Reviews.Title: “Beach cottages!”
Reviews.Author: Lori K
Reviews.Content: Being this was our first trip to Hawaii, we weren't sure what to expect regarding our accommodations. We were very pleased with the cottages, and as one reviewer commented even though they are on the older side, they were clean and airy and only steps from the beach. The staff were very friendly and always helpful. My group decided that when we go back we will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Barney9700
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned after reading a few of the negative reviews, but rest assured this hotel exceeded every single expectation. I do a lot of traveling and I will say that this staff was the friendliest that I have ever dealt with.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the cottages”
Reviews.Author: MaryKay0256
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from a wonderful stay at the Royal Lahaina. We weren't sure what to expect with the cottages but was pleasantly surprised to find them roomy, clean and inviting. They are a little on the older side but very comfortable. One of the four couples found their room to be "musty" smelling. They called the front desk and were immediately given a room in the tower. The rest of us agreed that when we come back to Maui we would definitely stay in the cottages again. We liked the fact that it felt like we were in a park like setting and along the golf course. However, I would request an end unit. We shared the patio area with the adjoining room which had their air conditioner running the whole time we were there. It was kind of hard to enjoy the patio area with the noise of the air conditioner. One couple did have an end unit and we spent our "outside" time with them on their patio. Can't wait to go back to Hawaii in a few years and spend the whole vacation on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: jockbrown
Reviews.Content: I took a shot at a popular name-your-own-price website, which I don't usualy do for the unpredictable nature. But I only needed one night prior to condo rental. I got a room for $135 (garden view) which I thought was relativley cheap for Maui. I looked at some of the negative reviews, after the fact, and thought I was at high risk for disappintment. I did not then notice that many of the negative reviews are 8 or 9 years old. We were greeted by about 6 bellmen and valets, went to reception where 4 receptionists were waiting, checked in immediately, and upgraded to double double with partial ocean view. This room was perfect. Thinking it was too good to be true, I investigated the room thoroughly, and could only find that the bathroom pocket door was slightly misaligned. That was it. Large Room; about 15x35, spotless, even under the beds. Nice Hawaiin decor, with rough hewn koa wood furnture including a desk and dresser combo. The rest of the resort was great, lots of service, great bvreakfast (we skipped the $21 buffet). Nice beach right in front, nice pool, not as elaborate as some of the $500 a night places. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for young singles”
Reviews.Author: stejacks
Reviews.Content: They have a tower of rooms and cottages of about 4 separate rentals. We stayed in a cottage with two cockroaches. The rooms in the tower are much nicer. I went with girls in the mid 20's. The average age was 60-75 years old and lots of couples. They have a hot tub and 3 pools. None of the pools were heated. They have towel service. There are 2 restaurants on the property. They have a "computer room", with one computer. Wireless in the room is an extra charge. Staff was very pleasant. The beds are average with a thin comforter. It was quiet at night which was good for sleeping. Location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: Troy M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here February 29, 2013 through March 5, 2013. This was our second time staying at the Royal Lahina. It was an outstanding stay, we were upgraded from a partial ocean view to an Ocean View. Room was great and the beds were extremely comfortable. the view from the 9th floor was amazing. We had the breakfast buffet included in our package.. I would reccomend doing this!! we also ate at the restaurant our first night and the food was good. While we were there we looked at several other hotels/resorts in the area and for the value,views, and location we couldn't find a better place to stay. We will definately be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!”
Reviews.Author: hapytrvlr_27
Reviews.Content: We had a wedding party stay at the Royal Lahaina so were able to see quite a few cottages and rooms in the tower. The cottages are spacious and comfortable. Some of them need to be updated and definately have a musty smell. Nothing a little airing out doesn't help. The tower has been updated and the rooms are spectacular. Everyone is very nice and helpful at the hotel. The hotel restaurant is OK, we only ate there for breakfast. The Barefoot Bar/Pool has good food and a great afternoon happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: The_Meeks
Reviews.Content: Our third visit to the Royal Lahaina and this time, we were upgraded to a garden cottage suite. Here we would disagree completely with the previous bad reviews, as we found the suite to be superb. Hotel location is ideal. The only negative comment would be concerning was the service in Royal Ocean Terrace in the afternoons/evenings (breakfast service was very good). We found that there was often too few staff to cope with the number of guests. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: need2shop
Reviews.Content: I cannot help noticing that many of the rave reviews are by people who were upgraded from the cottage or cheaper rooms. If you pay full price for their tower rooms, I think this hotel needs to improve. The location is perfect, on the beach. The hotel is renovated and our room was nice. The bathroom has some rust on the ceiling, but still was in pretty good shape. The service was one of the poorest I have seen. The from desk people are quite apathetic. All we got at check in was a photocopy (on a .5 page) of the map of the property. There was no acknowledgment of this being our honeymoon. It is important to realize that while the towers are nonsmoking, this is NOT a not smoking property. You would smell the cigarette smoke if you walk around, on the beach or around the cottages. When we checked in we only had a bath towel. Next day we got other towels but in general there seems to be no rule about what kind and how many. One day we came back to out room to find it OPEN. The housekeeping did not close it after cleaning. The next day, they cleaned the room next door from 9 pm till 10 pm. As mentioned by other reviewers, there is a Luau on site. That means that you will hear it, from 6 pm till about 8:30 pm. Every day, except Saturday. But even on the off day, the hotel had a movie on the lawn so basically you cannot hear your thoughts if you are in the room. They also seem to be stingy with the beach towels. They only give you 2 and they close early, so you'll have to carry them around till next day, because you have to recover your "tower card". I suggest bringing in your own towels. Summing up: would I stay here again? YES. Would I pay the full price for it? NO!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: reader12
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it is the classic tiki type resort. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The Luao was great (though it rained & we were told by one employee that that is more common in Lahaina than elsewhere on Maui). The rooms were small but clean, and we didn't spend much time in them anyway. It wasn't really a resort for kids in that there wasn't a kid's club or kid's pool or anything like that, and not a whole lot of kids were around, but that said, the staff was very good to our kids, especially the workers at the activities/equipment rental booth, and the kids had a great time. The food at the breakfast buffet was good and reasonably priced. Sometimes the kids even ate free at the buffet. The beach in front of the hotel was nice and the kids were able to splash around in it safely- not unreasonably wavy or with excessive undertow. The pools were both a bit on the small side. All in all it was really good, maybe not a 5 star resort, but exactly what we were looking for for that part of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Brenna B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 7 days and wish we had more time! We rented a car, which was a great way to see the island on our own. Maui truly is one of the most beautiful places in the world! The hotel was beautiful, you had the feel of old hawaii, which we loved. You can stay at a chain resort anywhere, we felt like this hotel was more authentic then any others that we saw. The hotel staff was amazing, so friendly and helpful, they truly want to make your stay a 5 star experience. We paid extra for valet parking, and my husband enjoyed the mai tais that came along with that! We ate at the hotel restaurant several times, as well as scoop for snacks and breakfast. The resort has 2 pools, and I thought the water was very refreshing. The beach is gorgeous, beautiful sunsets right from your balcony (we stayed in the tower). We were nervous after reading some of the reviews on trip advisor, but rest assured if you have booked this property you will have an amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “love maui”
Reviews.Author: ddjSaskatoon
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the royal lahaina for 2 weeks in jan/feb on the 12th floor overlooking the ocean and it was spectacular! the atmosphere is very hawaiian, from the pineapple ice water in the lobby, to the beautiful decor of the rooms, and the warm and friendly staff. it is one of the smaller hotels and we chose it for that very reason. it has a more intimate feel and lacks the impersonality of the bigger hotels and that is a good thing! we love the beach and spent alot of time on the beach at the hotel - it was never crowded, unlike what we saw on other parts of kaanapali beach where the resorts were much larger. you get a towel card on check in and use it for beach towels each day at the activity centre. also rented snorkel gear there at a weekly rate. we could sit on our lanai for breakfast in the morning and see the whales! the housekeeping staff were always visible and quick to service our room when they saw us leaving and kept our room very clean, with fresh towels and bottles of toiletries each day. we ate at basil tomatoes on our first night (after reading a great review on tripadvisor) and the food was amazing - delicious and fresh! loved it so much we ate there 5 times in our 2 week stay! (if you go between 5-6pm all food is half price - 18% gratuity is automatically added to the bill and you have to pay cash - but so worth it! doesn't hurt to make a reservation as they fill up quickly in that hour). we also really enjoyed restaurants in whalers village; leilani's on the beach, cane & taro, and the hula grill - ate at all three more than once - so delicious! my husband and i agree we would go back to maui just for the food! i'm not typically a fish eater, but in maui it is so fresh and delicious i was converted! try the baja fish taco at the hula grill, also the kona coffee cheesecake was my fave! for breakfast we often picked up muffins, bagels & coffees at the royal scoop outside the lobby of the hotel. also went to a nearby farmers market for fresh pineapple, fruit, nachos and fresh salsa that we kept in the fridge in our room. we chose not to rent a car for the whole time knowing that we would spend alot of our days on the beach, swimming, snorkeling, etc. we often walked into whalers village, or caught the free trolley, to eat, browse the shops or watch free evening shows. a special treat was dinner at the hula grill's barefoot bar one night when derek sebastian, a local professional ukulele player was performing! check his website for performances. also took the bus into lahaina a few times to eat and shop as well (fare is only $1). did rent a car for a couple days to drive to paia and hana (parking at the hotel is $10/day). we were treated very well at the royal lahaina and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxed & romantic vacation. it may not be the most high end resort, but has good value and a very special atmosphere. we loved our stay at the royal lahaina and look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Our time at the Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Kimbuehrle
Reviews.Content: Love it, we got there before our room was ready, so we went to the sea breeze restaurant We sat down looked up and a whale jumped out of the water, omg. Food was good room was awesome, everyne that worked there was kind. Beach was perfect, pool water was a little to cold for me, luau was good. But I have to say we went of a whale watching tour, I seen more from my balcony than on the tour. If you are going to want a chair at the beach, I say bring a small ne because they charge you 10.00 a day for the chair and bring all your snorkel stuff it can get expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: ImaWingBiker
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is beautiful with great rooms the customer service is poor, to say the least. We did not know that there was a Luau available until we saw the sign. We found the customer relations department and made reservations. They have two pools available for guests but they are cold. The beach is not that great right at the hotel. I would definately call this hotel over rated for what you get. Our room was right over the drive where people come into the hotel to register. So it is very noisey. We could see the ocean but we had to look over the roof line. Not the best choice of rooms. The hotel provides robes in the rooms and free towels at the pool. They have a nice restaurant and bar on the main floor which you have to walk through in order to get to the pool. You have to pay for parking and the spots are very small. Watch for door dings on your rental car! Poor customer service to its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha, welcome home!”
Reviews.Author: Kinderfamily
Reviews.Content: Each time we entered the resort property a lovely fellow at the gate would say to us: "Aloha, welcome home!" It was wonderful. The hotel was fabulous, friendly, well located and had a great luau as well. We could see the whales from our hotel room each morning and we did not even have an ocean view room. The resort was clean, the people were friendly, the restaurant was great (we had all but one breakfast there - great buffet with fresh, tasty food every day), the pools were great and the beachfront was clean and well taken care of, perfect for a family! The wait staff were super friendly, as were the bar staff and the towel/attraction booking people were super helpful, explaining the best sights, suggesting activities, sharing driving shortcuts! We loved it. I would highly recommend this resort if you are thinking of traveling to Maui. I would stay here in the future. This resort was suggested by our travel agent who had stayed here as well. It was a good suggestion!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: CatherineM1962
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at this hotel and enjoyed every moment. Our room was perfect. It overlooked the golf course and had views to the ocean and the decor was lovely. In my view the hotel offers the best location on Kaanapali Beach. It is an easy walk to the vibrant Whalers Village where we ate on three occasions. The resorts around the Whalers Village are much bigger than the Royal Lahaina so the area looks very overdeveloped. The Royal Lahaina is more secluded having the golf course on one side and several acres to the other before the next resort begins. The beach in front of the hotel is beautiful so we spent a lot of time there enjoying the water and watching the whales. The buffet breakfast was included in our room rate but was very ordinary. That is my only criticism of this fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the Aloha?”
Reviews.Author: Mike95128
Reviews.Content: The two stars are for the last time I visited . . . just over a year ago. We liked the place a lot. Nice decor, free upgrade. We loved the pool and the beach. And even though there's no spa, we could walk to the one in the strip mall nearby. I actually, we liked the local coffee shop there, too. So, based on last year's visit, this place earned four stars. But that was then, and this is now. This is a story of a screwed up reservation. Now, I won't blame that completely on the Royal Lahaina. In fact, my guess is they deserve only a fraction of the blame. Here's the deal. I used my accumulated points from my credit card to book three nights. I called the night before my flight and the morning of my flight. Both time the person at the hotel front desk said, "the agent hasn't sent the reservation yet. But if you have a piece of paper that says you have a room, we will find you one." Should I worry, "absolutely not. We'll find you a room." I did have the printed reservation receipt, and I had several assurances from the credit card travel advisor that the booking would be sent over. Well, it wasn't. Now, that's bad, but that's not what upset me. When I got to the hotel, the lady at the gate had called to someone from the front desk. She met me outside the lobby with a guard at her side. Really? Your message is, "Don't even step foot in the lobby?" She said se had been looked into the situation since I called in the morning. A third party (hotel beds.com) had booked me at a resort in Makena, nearly an hour away. There's nothing she would do. What about, "I'll find you a room?" Nope. Don't even come in. Where's the aloha. So maybe it was the fault of hotel beds.com. Frankly, I suspect the hotel bumped me because there was a HUGE conference in town. But, again, it's not about that. It's about how I was treated. I asked about the resort where I was rebooked. She said disparagingly, "The beach is nothing like this. It's way over by the Aquarium. I don't know anything about that area. I don't think it's nearly as nice as this." Well, Makena isn't by the aquarium. It's far from there. If she spent any time on the island, she would know that. So she was being dishonest. And, it turned out, the Makena Beach Resort was fantastic . . . great beach and pool . . . wonderful brunch daily, great views, super friendly staff a great fitness room, and a fantastic spa service. So why bad mouth it? Couldn't she have said, "I know you must be disappointed. But I called ahead to the Makena Resort. Here's what I found out. I think you'll really like it." Would that have been so hard? Or . . . "I know I promised you a room. I spoke out of turn. I sincerely apologize, Here's a coupon for a drink or coffee or a coconut (or something). Next time you come here, we'll give you a fantastic upgrade. We value your business. We feel really really badly." So this bad review is not for the messed up reservation, it's for the bad attitude and for trying to make the customer feel he did something wrong. The good news . . . The Makena Beach Resort is really wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, in a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: missalicia001
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice now. I went once with my mom, and a friend the second time. You can't beat the location, right on a secluded part of Kaanapali beach. When staying here I would highly recommend you book the Kai tower, its worth the upgrade amount. The cottages are in need of some renovations, but the Kai tower is amazing! I have stayed at the Westin in Maui as well and would pick the Royal Lahaina over the Westin any day. Royal Lahaina has the Hawaiian feel to it, it really portrays what Hawaii is supposed to be.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Honeymoon = SUCCESS!”
Reviews.Author: Kimba115
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did not book this hotel ourselves. Our Hawaii-based travel agent booked it for us as part of our Hawaiian honeymoon package. So honestly we didn't know what to expect beyond a beachfront resort on Maui. Royal Lahaina surpassed all of our expectations! From our partial oceanview room, to the coconut scented shampoo, conditioner, lotion and body wash to the LOCATION to the mai tais at the resort bar/restaurant. We spent our first night in Maui on a lounge chair watching the sunset over the ocean...it was truly magical! The ONLY negative I can say about this resort is that the pool is just a rectangle. Nothing pretty, nothing fun. Just a rectangle. But the view beyond the rectangle pool, the lush green grounds and the location far outweigh the un-imaginative pool. I would definitely recommend this resort to a friend/family member. Keep in mind that despite Lahaina being in the name of the resort, it is not in "downtown" Lahaina (where many of the tourist attractions/shops/restaurants are). So you will need a rental car (and pay to park in Lahaina, which can be expensive) or take the free resort shuttle bus to Whaler's Village and pay $1 for public transportation to downtown Lahaina. This didn't bother us in the least, but it is definitely something to keep in mind! PS - the pillows sucked, which is why I didn't rate the sleep quality very high

Reviews.Title: “Ignore negative reviews, this place is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Miss_SunShine89
Reviews.Content: Let me start this review by saying ignore any negative reviews of this resort. I have no idea what they are talking about, because the Royal Lahaina Resort is just amazing! Everyone I encountered at the hotel as well, enjoyed their stay. As soon as you drive into the resort you are greeted by extremely friendly staff and welcomed to the hotel warmly. Bell hops were readily available to help you with your luggage and watch over it as you checked in. The front desk staff were attentive, friendly and very helpful. The only issue we ran into was when we booked with the hotel, we had requested two double beds but received one king sized bed. They did quickly apologize and did the best they could to fix the issue. We would have had to wait a day to change rooms, so we decided to just stay with the room we had. When we arrived to our room, I was very happy with what we got. The room was stunning and had amazing Hawaiin detail put into it. One thing I must comment on is how comfortable the bed was!! I instantly fell asleep! We had an ocean front view room and was so happy we decided to go with it. View was incredible! We not only had a spectacular view of the ocean but got to see a lot of the cottages and pools. Bathroom is simple but very nice, and the rooms are very very clean! I will though warn some of you about the ocean front rooms in the main tower. If you like your peace in the evening, or like to sleep early, do request an ocean front room higher up. We were located on the third floor and every evening heard the music from the live singer in the restaurant. Personally, I loved it but some may not. The resort was spotless, you always saw staff cleaning daily and all day! Maid service was 10/10! Our maids were timely and even came to prepare our bed in the evening for us and gave us fresh clean towels for the night. One thing that amazed me as well, was how honest the maids were. My aunt wanted to tip our maids (not necessary, optional). By accident she pulled out a higher bill amount then she wanted and the maid was quick to say that it was too much and she couldn't take that amount of money. It really impressed me! Both pools were great, not huge but not tiny either. One pool is located infront of the restaurant in the main tower and the other just steps away infront of the beach. My aunt and myself prefered the pool by the beach because it had the best sunlight, as the other pool had sun blocked for a portion of the day by the main tower. The staff at the beach activity center are great and always friendly. You can either use the free lounge chairs or for $30 a day you can rent a cabana. We rented a cabana because they were higher (my aunt has a bad knee and can not sit too low) and it also provided great shade for when it got too hot. Beach. What can I say?! It was gorgeous! Kanapali beach is one of the top beaches and now I know why. I didn't get to swim too often because the waters were rough, but it was just stunning. Standing from the beach and even the pool area you could spot the whales as well. Whale watching was just amazing and is a must do if you are there during the time they migrate to the area. The restaurant in the main tower exceeded my expectations and I enjoyed it very much! Never got a bad meal there and the prices are very reasonable for the portion sizes. There is also a decent selection of food to choose from for breakfast and dinner. We didn't do it every day, but the breakfast buffet is very well worth the price! Lots of selection to chose from. For lunch/dinner my recommendation is either the Kahuna salad or steak sandwich. Both delicious!! We never ate the Basil Tomatoes restaurant as we never heard great things about it from others on the resort. We heard that either the food was luke warm or not worth the price. Personally I can't review it as we never ate there, so if you want to try it, they have half price on food between 5 and 6 pm! The Royal Scoop is great if you want just a small simple breakfast or a light sandwich for lunch, and of course sweet treats! Really enjoyed the ice cream from there and amazing bagels! As far as activities go, my aunt and I did the tour of Maui which included going up to Hana, the Luau and seeing a theatrical show in Lahaina called Ulalena. All were well worth the price!! We didn't book with the acitivity place in the front lobby. I found them to be very rude and not helpful. We booked with the Expedia Activity place located near the Royal Scoop just outside the lobby. They were so helpful and found great activities for your comfort level. Go see Julie, she's awesome! A must see is the Luau! Even if you have been to one before, this one was just spectacular! Food was great, drinks was open bar and show was entertaining! Maui trip was so fun and we went to see beauitful areas of the island! Ulalena, a must see! It shows you the history of the Hawaiin people in a beautiful mannor. But definitely check out the Expedia center for things to do and great prices. Over all, I loved the resort! From amazing staff, great vendors in the lobby and just the details in decor, you can not go wrong! I probably could keep writing but then this would be a very long review! No, it's not a hilton or sheraton, but it has the spirit of Hawaii and just a beautiful atmosphere! Will definitely return to the Royal Lahaina!

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a beautiful lobby. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Great location! Staff was very friendly and helpful. There is a coffee/ice cream shop and a nice gift shop/store that included grocery items and drug store type items.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: bmgonz
Reviews.Content: My aunt & I stayed at the Royal Lahaina for 8 nights and I have to say, it far surpassed all expectations. Based on the reviews, I was somewhat skeptical. Happy to say I was pleasantly surprised. Our requirements were fairly simple: clean, two beds, air conditioned, ocean outside our room. Royal Lahaina was a great fit. First, the room. We stayed in the Tower in an Ocean Front room. It was very clean. This was my fifth trip to Maui so I know that bugs are part of island life, but I didn't see any in our room, which was good. The beds were very comfy and also clean (no printed bed spreads here.) Storage space in the room was adequate. The mini-fridge was convenient. The bathrooms are small but I wasn't hosting a party in there, so that didn't bother me. The shower was fine. The water pressure wasn't as strong as I have at home, but I have experienced far worse at other hotels. All in all, I'd happily stay here again. Next, the hotel amenities. The lobby/restaurant/pool area is dated. Everything is well maintained but you don't get that "ahhhhh" feeling when you walk in. The staff was always friendly - from check in to valet to activities - everyone was pleasant. The restaurant is very convenient. We had breakfast there 4 times and dinner/drinks once. Breakfast buffet for two was $40 but we left full. Dinner (with drinks) was $65 - cheapest dinner we had on this vacation. Service is leisurely. If you're in a hurry, I wouldn't eat here but we weren't in a hurry so it was great. Dinner took forever but the live music and hula dancer filled the time nicely. It was a very relaxing meal. They do have a coffee shop, which is convenient if you're heading out. The pastry/food offerings were limited to banana nut bread, a couple of bagels and a couple of muffins. You may want to keep options in your room. There is also a small convenient store on the grounds, which is handy. There are two pools on the property. They are well maintained but COLD (if they update these, I'd love for them to add a heater.) Both pools have bars in near proximity with complimentary ice water and a variety of yummy beverages. Last but not least - parking. Dear Lord, the parking. I made one attempt to park in those itty bitty parking spots and quickly decided the extra $5/day to valet park is totally worth it. Finally - location. The hotel is on Kaanapali Beach, which is notoriously pretty. It's close to Whaler's Village and a quick drive over to Lahaina. The Kaanapali trolley service is convenient (but I wouldn't rely on it as my sole means of transportation.) The views from our room were stunning. All in all, the hotel was affordable, clean and conveniently located. We certainly got what we paid for and I'd be happy to stay here again. However, when planning your vacation, I think it's about really knowing what your expectations and priorities are. This is not the Westin or Sheraton. It is not grandiose or lavish. If you want marble floors and waterfalls, this is not the place for you and chances are, you'll end up being disappointed. Our top priority was clean with an amazing view. Royal Lahaina delivered for us!

Reviews.Title: “THE NOT SO ROYAL LAHAINA”
Reviews.Author: steve r
Reviews.Content: How sad, such a picture perfect location.Our one week vacation in Lahaina was spoiled by a combination of unfortunate events. first of all the reception staff were quite unhelpful almost to the point of being rude.Nice rooms, we had five of them, and a great view with a tiny tiny tiny fridge a coffe pot and not much else.the buffet breakfast was a real shocker. The hot food was mostly cold and we did not appreciate the variety of canned juices canned strawberries canned peaches canned pears etc. etc.The hotel beach looked beautiful, but alas as the warning sign displayed not safe for swimming due to severe tidal rips, and guess what ? no lifeguard patrol.Not a hotel for families.!!! Oh and $10.00 bucks a night to park your car. In my opinion the Royal Lahaina is a two star Hotel in a three star location.

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples”
Reviews.Author: cpo527
Reviews.Content: I love this place and have stayed in different resorts in Maui. THe most bang for your buck, not over run with kids, chairs around pool are always available, not over crowded when you are trying to catch the elevator or make your way through the lobby, at times you may be the only one out of the beach, beautiful breakfast every morning at pool side tables with a view of Molikai to greet you, the rooms were well appointed and clean, the beds were comfy cozy, and a large LCD tv in the room. Great view from ocean front and ocean view rooms, I have stayed in both. Can see Black Rock from only one side of hotel but there isnt a bad view at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Royal Lahaina Hotel”
Reviews.Author: john w
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before, but this time it was even better than before. The staff are great and the hotel is well located for all the Maui attractions. We had a very good room with a great view to the ocean and the island of Lanii. The hotel is near the township of Lahaina and Whalers Village where there are some very good restaurants. Try Captain Jacks and Honu in Lahaina and Leilanis at Whalers Village. Also there is a terrific place for breakfast at the Outrigger Napali Shores called the Gazebo, opens at 7.30 and get there early, best pancakes in the world. All in all Maui is fantastic and will go again to these places next year

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kathalina916
Reviews.Content: Room on the 12th floor so great views of the ocean and golf course and perfect for whale watching! Get an even numbererd room above 6th floor for ocean views. Hotel within walking distance of whaler village or free trolly runs fairly often. Dollar for the bus from there to lahaina for shopping or dining. Quiet beach but not kid friendly, try baby beach in lahaina for the little ones. Small pool, nothing fancy. Not a hotel with bells and whistles but affordable and good as a home base for the area.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Maui Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelers_55112
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina for 9 days in mid-January. The front desk fulfilled our request for a cottage (which had been noted during our reservation process) instead of one of the updated and very modern hotel rooms, which are great, but a little too "mainland" for us. Although the cottages on the property are "traditional Hawaii" style rooms and are showing their age, the additional space and the location on the quieter and spacious grounds near the golf course were perfect for us (recently retired couple from MN). The front desk staff was very helpful, the restaurant staff friendly, and the "grounds" staff available to transport luggage to/from the parking area and room (the only real inconvenience to staying in the cottages). The resort is perfectly located along Kaanapali Beach with just a short walk (less than a mile) to other resorts and the area's shopping "oasis," Whaler Village, which also has three very good ocean view restaurants, as well as "fast food" in the shops area. If we ever return to Hawaii, we'd revisit this resort again (which appears to have a long-range project to replace the single and two-level cottages with several two to 4-story buildings/cottages in the future, depending on the local economy). Royal Lahaina is a great stay if the feel of "traditional" Hawaii is your desire. By the way, the "Road to Hana" is a trip you have to take!

Reviews.Title: “Great oceanfront view”
Reviews.Author: otis94
Reviews.Content: Stayed the old part of the resort. The first room we were in had very strong smell of old pipe smoke even with the doors open had a hard time sleeping. There was also a loud niose all the time like fan running. Complained to the front desk and and they moved us the 3rd nite.Spent two nites in this room. Rooms are quite pricey for what you get. No wifi in this part of the resort. You can sign up for $10 day wifi with very poor reception. This is one amenity most hotels provide free of charge now a days. There was no offer of compansation for the 2 nites we spent in the terrible room. The view was Great straight out to the ocean. This part of the resort needs a total refurb. The resort is quite a ways from everthing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Milan T
Reviews.Content: This resort was amazing right from the front desk staff to the beautiful rooms and all situated on one of the nicest beaches in the world!! Very helpful staff with planning day excursions, a great luau right on their grounds, and very clean resort. We'll be definitely heading back sometime in the near future!!

Reviews.Title: “Oceanfront Kaanapali Ocean Inn”
Reviews.Author: GeneB4
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Inn is one of the older buildings on the site. It does not have an elevator and the decor is very outdated. However, the rooms are clean and quite and quite spacious. There is a reason why the price is lower than other sites on the resort. But, if you're thinking about only using the rooms for sleeping, you don't spend much time there and you have access to all the other amenities at the resort - and easy access to the condominium amenities next door.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Lahaina but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Ravensminded10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Maui a few weeks ago and spent 3 nights in the Royal Lahaina Resort. The resort itself is well taken care of, the rooms have been recently updated from what I could tell and the outlying scenery is what people dream of when traveling to Maui. The room itself was very clean with a classy choice of decorations. It had large wooden sun-blocking panels for the Lanai and the bathroom had a nice pocket door that separated the sink from the toilet and shower. Sleep quality is a big part of my experience as I am a light sleeper and honestly I couldn't hear anything outside our room. The grounds to the hotel are well taken care of and the fact the hotel is right down the road from Whalers Village Mall makes shopping a quick and memorable experience as you carry your new belongings down the beach side back to the hotel. The staff was friendly, did a good job of cleaning the rooms and the beach side bar makes sunsets a fun time for all. I'm sure some of the other hotels may include better accommodations but in all honesty I can't think of anything negative to write when reviewing the Royal Lahaina, and to me, that's all that matters. Have no regrets and no reservations when booking your travel so take it from me, the Royal Lahaina is worth the risk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Retreat”
Reviews.Author: sharri82
Reviews.Content: This resort is a great place to vacation. The staff is great and very helpful. The resturant was good. the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. All in all we had a great stay we would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaRon
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. There is a great uncrouded beach in front of the hotel. The resturant is good. Rooms are excellent. Just had a great stay. We were there from Jan 17 till Jan 27.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, especially the handicapped facilities”
Reviews.Author: mkamman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Lahaina for a week at the beginning of the 2012. We had two rooms, one for me, my wife and our infant daughter and the other room was ADA compliant suite for my in-laws. The service was outstanding throughout our stay and the location couldn't be better. Most importantly, the ADA room for my father-in-law made our week in paradise a lot less stressful than traveling (in a wheelchair) often is for him. We'd go back in a heartbeat. Finally, if you're taking the red eye home, ask about an extended check-out. We paid a couple of bucks to keep the suite until late in the evening. I'm thankful we didn't have to drive around the island killing time from noon-9pm with an infant, a wheelchair and all our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: GiniBMichigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort from January 3 - 16, 2012. We upgraded to an oceanfront room upon arrival and were very pleased with our 8th floor view. We could sit on the balcony and watch whales and porpoises as we had our morning coffee. This is a quiet resort; we experienced only one noisy evening when a large wedding party moved to the balcony next door. We were told by the front desk that the party had to end by 10:00 p.m., which it did, so it was a temporary issue. The staff was exceptional in their friendliness and service. One member of the housekeeping staff, Vilma, was especially kind and welcoming. The room was clean and bright and met our needs beautifully. We did not rent a car, but used the free shuttle service to Whaler's Village regularly. From there we often took a bus to Lahaina. There are also several other hotels within walking distance, each with its own restaurant.We plan to return to this same hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there - total rip off”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Krabs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this "hotel" for 1 night because the Sheraton at Black Rock was fully booked on Dec 27th. (Then I stayed at the Sherathon on the 28th and 29th, thank god!). I wanted something that was ok and thought that this "hotel" would make it for 1 night. I was so wrong. The stay was off a bad start as when I arrived at 5.00pm, they told me that the room was not ready. EXCUSE ME! NOT READY? I had to wait 30 minutes in the lobby, what a joke. Then, they showed us our room. It was a COTTAGE HOUSE. If you want to hear more about them, go into the "Terrible" reviews on trip advisor and you will understand my pain. So, I will reiterate : DO NOT STAY IN THE COTTAGE HOUSES!! They are old and out of shape. The one I was assigned was for disabled people. No offense, but I did not like the shower (I like bath tub). The entire night was just a nightmare. I could hardly get any sleep that night. There is a outdoor AC system that would run all day and night and just do so much noise, that it kept me awake until 1.30am when I finally collapsed. 4.30am - PPPPPPPPSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH! What is that f$$**$$ noise. Oh, yeah, the sprinklers - running for 30 minutes - because you thought that you could get some sleep at this "hotel"... NO WAY! I called the receptionist and she could not care less about it. So to sum up - Do not go there if you plan to sleep or stay away from the cottage rooms (and the left side of the building where the AC is). Other comments : The food is just ok (the pizzas are bad), the service is awful. It took 5 minutes standing right at the cashier before someone would ask me "Can I help you"... I could go on and on about all the bad about this hotel, but the other "terrible" reviews on tripadvisor also tell the story. Go to the Westin, the Sheraton, the Hilton which are much better

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Resort, Maui”
Reviews.Author: JeenyReeny
Reviews.Content: I would go back - but by all means, pay for the upgrade to the (renovated) towers. I had reserved a garden cottage room, which upon arrival, was dark, kind of depressing and didn't have the sleeping arrangements I requested. When I returned to the front desk, I was given an option to upgrade for a small $/night and it was MORE than worth it. The room was beautiful, clean, had a balcony and partial ocean view. The staff at the resort was helpful and friendly, but not overbearing. The beach is relatively small, but the atmosphere is quiet and conducive to romance and/or relaxation. Considering the cost of other resorts on Maui, this is a definite YES. Also - we LOVED having a rental car. Parking is $10/day if you self park and $15/day if you valet. Still, it was great to have the freedom to cruise the Road to Hana without paying a gazillion dollars for a tour - and we did everything on our own schedule. I was also impressed with how quiet and "mature" the hotel clientele were. Not a party atmosphere at all, but still fun.

Reviews.Title: “excellent honeymoon destination”
Reviews.Author: techBiztraveller
Reviews.Content: Our 12 day stay at Royal Lahaina was trouble-free, relaxing in a idealic environment with an ocean view large suite. The resort is well catered for, despite its age, still has qualities difficult to find in other resorts, staff are extremely helpful and would do the extra mile to accommodate your needs, we liked the swimming pool bar, beach is well maintained, and the restaurant by the pool side serves some of the best Mai Tais in Maui. We stayed at the kai tower, rather than the cottages that some people prefer; in fact, we don't regret it as our views from the 9th floor were unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: mrmackay
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the bad: The food in the restaurant was pretty average The lobby area was somewhat dated No free internet Despite the negatives, I still would recommend the hotel. The location is great and the staff friendly. The room was good enough. For the cost, it represented grat value. The pool area and dining area were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room with a view....”
Reviews.Author: Bpilot
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Maui without a hotel. First stop was the Royal Lahaina Resort. We were greeted by the gate attendant who was so nice and welcomed us. Then we drove up to the registration office and were greeted by more super friendly staff. (what's up with that?) Everyone was wonderful. Chris at the desk searched prices for rooms and gave us options of either staying at the new tower or going "budget" at the Ocean Inn. He gave us such a great price for a tower room, with a spectacular view of the ocean. So we booked that. We loved our room. The room was immaculately clean and had a refrigerator. It was stocked daily with additional soap,lotions, body wash and shampoos. The staff was amazing and everyone was genuinely nice!!! We will definitely come back again. We love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience! Perfect Setting!”
Reviews.Author: Erin F
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort in Aug of 2011. The hotel is a handy 5 minutes drive to Lahaina Town & a quick 10 minute walk along a paved walkway to Whalers Village in Kaanapali! The grounds are lovely & are sprinkled with Plumaria trees, green grass, plants and flowers! The hotel has an amazing sandy bottom beach, which makes it easy to get into the water! (A lot of the beaches have coral, so this sandy beach was a PLUS!) Black rock is just a short walk down the beach and many people snorkel there. The rooms are comfortable and there was a fridge and coffee maker, which made it handy to eat breakfast in. There's also a few restaurants on site. NEXT time we will try the terrace restaurant. We ate at Roy's in Kahana, which is amazing and the Aloha Mixed Plate behind the Lahaina Cannery Mall. Both very good. The staff were very helpful and kept our bags for us as our flight arrived early and our room wasn't ready. We changed and sat out at the bar by the pool and ocean. It's a small bar, but we enjoyed the drinks and views! We would stay here again!!! The only drawback was the $10 per day parking and the parking spaces are TINY! We just ended up parking in the back and walking as it was less crowded. They do have cheaper rooms in the cottages, but they looked older and the plants and trees blocked light, so we imagined they wouldn't have the light and views that our tower room boasted! (Also read other online reviews regarding the cottages and decided on the tower room.) All in all, we can hardly wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Honeymoon Spot”
Reviews.Author: ABChinn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our Honeymoon in August 2011. We were immediately upgraded to an ocean view room. The room was very large, very comfortable accommodations. The beach in front of the hotel is small which was fantastic for us as it was not crowded. The pool is very small which did not bother us as we knew this upon booking the hotel. This hotel is centrally located so if you rent a car you can easily travel the island. Other reviews have complained about the parking space sizes. Yes the spaces are small, however there was always a parking space available so not an issue at all. This hotel is within walking distance to Whalers Village which is nice for shopping and dinner out. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Tennis Ranch- great experience”
Reviews.Author: toastytravels
Reviews.Content: I took a lesson, a clinic, and played a match at the tennis ranch during a recent stay in Maui (I did not stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort, so am only reviewing the tennis ranch) and had a very good experience. Kaz, the head tennis pro, was professional, knowledgeable ( and fun!) and quickly addressed (and hopefully solved) some issues in my game. The clinic was equally good, with 3 of us participating. Afterward, the pro shop staff arranged matches for me with some locals, which was a really great touch. Apparently, they watch you during your lessons and clinics and get "a feel" for who you might pair well with in a match. I would definitely come back here for more matches and lessons.

Reviews.Title: “Dale D”
Reviews.Author: Dale788
Reviews.Content: My wife booked a cottage, thinking about some of the reveiws and we figured they couldn t be that bad. " Wrong" Told them we could not stay there and they told us there was nothing available. So they put us in there Inn which was worse than the cottage. It was a very long flight and our first trip to Maui, needless to say it was our anniversary also. No champane to make things feel better. We were then upgraded to the tower and loved it, other than four out of the eight days had to ask for wash cloths. Figured maybe there was a shortage or something. I suggest to save time since it is limited to book in the tower from the start. Althought some people seamed to enjoy the cottages it wasn t for us. As far as the staff some people were very nice others just a job.We had fun and enjoyed the tiki bar and the nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but staff at reception need a lesson on manners!”
Reviews.Author: Edward F
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in terms of location and surroundings. The rooms were great and so were the overall staff. The only staff we had a concern were the three women that were at the counter when we checked in on New Year's day in the morning and the young girl who seated us at breakfast on the second morning. The one who dealt with us was rude, did not give us a lot of time of day and when we asked if room was ready her response was "No...you are too early.....you have to wait until 3 pm". When I asked if I should check back throughout the day her response "do what you want". It may not appear negative written but it was the tone and body expression that completely turned us off. It is so unfortunate that such a beautiful resort get negatively tarnished by the front reception staff. On the second morning we decided to go to the breakfast at the restaurant when we were being seated we asked the girl if we could sit outside closer to the pool. She rolled her eyes and proceeded to walk towards that area without saying anything. She was utterly RUDE!!! I was disgusted!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, accommodations adequate”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location of the Royal Lahaina -- looking out to Lanai and Molikai, as well as the channel most frequented by visiting humpback whales who put on a show every morning (at least during Xmas week) around 9:30 am. Just up the beach to the north is a reef than begins almost at water's edge which offers nearly as good snorkeling for free as you will get on your $60 trip to Molokani. Also, there is good snorkeling just south of the Ryal Lahaina's beach, around the point, where you can also see an occasional giant sea turtle. We stayed in one of the cabins which was very convenient; you literally step out onto the lawn and then the beach; it avoids having to into the hotel and bother with elevators. The room was adequate for 2, a bit tight with two children, but manageable for a week; there is a small but useful deck on the seaward side. Staff was friendly and helpful; the Guest Services people were able to book us an inexpensive rental van that gave us great flexibility for a couple of days; the car rental office is a mile up the road with a free shuttle. NOTE: I wouldnt recommend renting a car for more than a couple of days -- one to go to Hana, one to go to to the top of Haleakala volcano; week rental are long and you don;t really need the car; you can always bus or cab in Lahaina for a fraction of the cost. One reason to visit Lahaina is for meals; we found the hotel restaurant barely passable. We avoided the overpriced buffet breakfast and bought bagels or pastries and fruit at the coffee shop. Basil Tomatoes -- a restaurant about 200 feet from the resort -- is very good; from 5-6pm, their prices are 50% off, an incredible bargain. There are some good restaurants in town that offer reasonable alternatives to the Royal Lahaina. The resport isn't luxurious and may not offer all the amenities sought by some who stay at a "resort," but its location (Kaanapali is the best beach on Maui, and there are those whales...) and affordability make it a very reasonable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not Royal but worth staying”
Reviews.Author: explore_enjoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the recently renovated main tower at the Royal Lahaina Resort in December 2011. Our check in story is pretty similar to a review that I had read about the resort prior to our vacation.They made us wait for 1 hour after we checked in saying they were overbooked and were waiting for check out from a room.Then the cleaning services took some time to get the room ready.The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful though and gave us free upgrade.Hence worth the 1 hour wait.We were upgraded to the partial ocean view but still had very nice view from the room on 7th floor. The room was very modern with some tropical Hawaiian artistic touches. The hotel is located right on Ka'anapali Beach . The beach walk is right outside the back of the hotel and can walk on either side.The watre is clear and the beach is well maintained.There is nice Italina hotyel Tomato Basil on the other side of hotel.The internet has poor connectivity and they charge 10$ a day.The guest services has usage of computer limited to 15min and also most of the times the server is down.Also one thing which annoyed me was they charge 10$ a day for parking even when you stay at the hotel.This does not make any sense to me.In the vening they have a seperate Luau parking but it still becomes difficult to find a parking spot if you come back late to the hotel. The whalers village is closeby and the hotel has free buses to and fro.The travellers help desk is ok ,depends on who is there.Sometimes they are friendly but a couple of them just ignored us and kept talking on the phone while we were ther for 15min and just ignored us. All in all with few good and few bad things I will give 3 stars for rating this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: mad666181
Reviews.Content: We went to Hawaii for our first time in November. We booked on-line and chose the Royal Lahaina as our hotel. We were very pleased. The staff was friendly and accomodating, the room was updated, large with plenty of room for everything. We liked the option of having a refridgerator in the room and a large counter to make up lunches etc. When we arrived we were able to upgrade to an ocean front room which was very nice. The restaurant was good with a nice variety. The nightly entertainment was relaxing and we enjoyed sitting on the balcony and listening to the music We didn't do a luau but heard the Royal Lahinia's was considered first rate. The resort is small but what we liked is it was quiet and peaceful and well kept. You have everything you will need right there. If we go back we will stay again at the Royal Lahaina Resort.

Reviews.Title: “ok, not royal”
Reviews.Author: sudsdrinker
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Ocean Inn. we were a little disappointed in the facility. we had the run of the resort but...... 5 star it is not. very friendly staff, very friendly. great location. but nothing to do at the "resort"

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Maui”
Reviews.Author: KymCalgary
Reviews.Content: Our two and a half week Maui vacation began with a 9 day stay just after Christmas at the Royal Lahina Resort on Kaanapali Beach. Our check in story is similar to a review that I read about the resort just prior to our vacation. Upon check in, we were told that the hotel had overbooked and our room in the tower would not be available to the following day. Instead, we would be given a room in one of the cottages. The attendant took us and our luggage to Cottage J, he was very informative about the resort along the way. Upon arriving at Cottage J, I completely understood the negative review written by another writer about the cottages. The cottage was clean, but very dated. I would say late 1970's paint, tiles, decor, etc. the bathrooms looked very old, with broken tiles, sink and toilet stains. In the main area, the two beds were very small, maybe a double or smaller. Being a family of 4, this wasn't going to work for us, plus it wasn't what we booked. Following a discussion with the resort manager, we were immediately moved to a room on the 7th floor of the tower. The renovations that they have done to all rooms in the tower are very nice. A drastic, but very much improved, difference from the cottages. In fact, we so liked them, we upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite on the 10th floor on day two. The suite was gorgeous with amazing ocean views, floor to ceiling, in each room. We absolutely loved it and we're very happy that we upgraded. The master bathroom was very, very large and beautifully appointed. The beds were extremely comfortable and the pillows too. My one suggestion would be to add a hook or two to the bathrooms to hang the robes that are provided. The living area was also quite large with foyer, a wet bar, lots of seating, a pull out couch and a second bathroom with a shower. Our experience at the resort was very good. One big plus about the resort is that it is located about half way on Kaanapali beach and the beach walk is accessible from the hotel in both directions. The beach in front of the Royal Lahina is beautiful. It is wide and very clean. We didn't use the two pools at the hotel, in fact we only saw people in them on two occasions during our stay. I believe that this was because the pools were quite small and cold. The Resort should consider redoing the pools to a more modern resort style pool area during a future renovation. However, with the beach, and other nearby hotel pools, we were able to have a great experience. We did have the opportunity to eat at both restaurants on the resorts grounds and attend the luau too. The lobby restaurant has good food and not too expensive, albeit the service is a little slow. We also had dinner at Basil Tomato Restaurant and absolutely loved it. Great and lively atmosphere, wonderful service and really good Italian food. We would go back there in a heartbeat. Unfortunately, we would not say the same about the luau. It was very crowded and unlike the good luau experiences that I have had in the past. It seemed to be more of a pack them in, sit everyone down immediately, then line everyone up for a mediocre buffet experience. Luckily, the luau performance and dancers were very good and made up for other part of the luau experience. Our only other concern at the hotel was the Internet connection. It was not very good at all. The wireless connection only worked sometimes in the rooms, lobby and guest relations areas. It was not strong and very spotty at best. If this had been a free internet service, I may be more tolerant, however it is $10/day/user. I expect a reliable and strong internet connection at those prices. Overall, our experience at the Royal Lahina was very good. I do think that they should continue to improve the other areas (cottages, pool area, internet) of the resort as they did recently with the tower renovations. This would then put them in the same league as the some of the finer resorts along Kaanapali Beach.

Reviews.Title: “breakfast and dinner review at royal lahaina resort”
Reviews.Author: connie g
Reviews.Content: the breakfast buffet was great, lots of choices -to order things off menu would of cost same amount if not more, go with buffet, we ate dinner there and the food was very good and you could watch the sunset from your table -beautiful, do not take savers room for hotel choice, ours was not that great, stay in the tower, much nicer, we had infestation of ants in our bathroom which they came immediately and sprayed but still who wants to deal with that on vacation

Reviews.Title: “Royal lahaina - Maui”
Reviews.Author: skvk
Reviews.Content: We visitied Maui for our 1st wedding anniversary and stayed in the Royal lahaina Tower. I don't remember exactly but I think we were on the 5th floor and an ocean view room which was the fourth room from the front of the tower facing the ocean side. We weren't offered an upgrade but the room we had was very beautiful. The view was really breath taking and we loved the local decor it had, especially the wooden lanai doors which would let us hear the lull of the ocean waves at night in peace while sleeping. This resort is located further away from all the big shot hotels and so you end up having a very calm, wide strech of beach with no kids. If you are travelling as a couple, this is definitely a plus. As others have stated, the pools are not fancy and it doesn't have much to do for the kids. They have free yoga classes and lei making but we didn't have a chance to try any of them. parking is narrow but we managed. Loved the bagels at the small coffee shop outside the tower. We went to the luau...food is sort of okay but the show was fun. Overall, I think staying at this resort was of great value and I would definitely stay in the same hotel if I were going back. Thanks Royal Lahaina, we had a wonderful time in Maui and yes, thanks for the complimentary champagne(remember it was our anniversary? :) )

Reviews.Title: “will not be back”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the key didnt work. Instead of bringing us a key up they made us come back down to get a new key. Then The bathroom was full of bugs it took them 2 days to come up and spray them. Then we had to smell bug spray.and the bugs are still there just not as bad. We went out and bought a can of spray,so we can spray every night before we shower. Then the wind blew the door shut and it took over an hour for some one to get it open. They charge for WIFI REALLY!!! who charges for WIFI anymore?? They dont offer shipping from the lobby. The gift shop is not that supplied. And they charge guest for beach chairs??

Reviews.Title: “Main Tower is Good”
Reviews.Author: sak116
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the main tower of the Royal Lahaina Resort in December 2011. The room was very nice and modern with nice tropical Hawaiian artistic touches. The hotel is set right on Ka'anapali Beach and offers a very nice pool. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We left our kids at home and did not spend a lot of time at the hotel during the day, but this hotel did not seem to have a whole lot to offer for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Cazz82
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina in a tower room for 5 nights in November as part of our trip to Hawaii. We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel, after doing lots of research and after reading mixed reviews we were not sure what to expect. We had a fabulous time at this hotel and in Maui. We stayed in room 1206 and it was perfect we had excellent views of the ocean south to black rock, we were on the highest floor so it was nice and quiet, the room was large with plenty of room to spreadout luggage, it was spotlessly clean, and had a super comfortable bed. Our check in was quick, the staff werent rude but werent overly friendly either. We werent offered an upgrade but we didnt expect one either. we booked a partial ocean view room and that is exactly what we got. We got to check in straight away which we appreciated after not having slept for 2 days. Kaanapali Beach is beautiful and at this hotel its nice and quite compared to the other hotels further south. The day we arrived it was Halloween so once we were all checked in we went to Front Street in Lahaina town centre to watch the parade and see all the costumes. We dont celebrate halloween in Australia like it so it was a novelty to see everyone dressed up and having a fun time. The hotel had a shuttle to Lahaina for $6 per person which was excellent. I can highly reccommend hiring a car. The activities desk organised this for us, as we didnt book prior to arriving, the hire car company came and picked us up from the hotel which was great. We got Valet parking which I would also get again because it saved us having to worry about parking. The activities desk staff were really helpful and answered any questions we had, they organised a couple of things for us like deep sea fishing charter etc but most other things we organised ourselves either before we left home from Australia or when we got there. We can also highly recommend the blue hawaiian helicopters we had a flight and it was absolutely breathtaking what you get to see that you wouldnt normally is unbelievable, worth the $500 australian dollars.we also did a day trip to Paia and had lunch at mamas fish house we can also reccommend here for lunch or dinner the food was fabulous and location was beautiful. We drove part of the hana highway but ran out of time to do it all. We went to Whalers village quite a bit for dinner it was an easy 10 minute walk or if you were feeling lazy you could get the free shuttle/trolley ($1 tip) We especially loved the hula grill at Whalers for afternoon cocktails and we had dinner here 2 nights out of our 5, we ate at the barefoot bar and also in the restaurant, the have amazing fish tacos and mai Tais good relaxing entertainment. The Royal Lahaina had a bare foot bar also and happy hour was great it was wonderful to sit and relax while the sunset and just chillout after a day exploring. We ate breakfast at the hotel once and that was enough it was ok nothing to rave about we just had bacon & eggs. We had dinner at the resort aswell and that was really good. Lahaina town centre (we drove) had heaps to do eat and drink and was only 5-10 minutes south, mmmm Ululanis shaved ice was delicious. The highlight for us from the hotel was the snokeling we hired equipment from bobs which is a bit further north at Napili and was heaps cheaper than the resort we were able to swim right off the beach and snokel at black rock which was amazing we saw sea turtles and a couple of manta rays and lots of different fish. we did a day trip to Molikini and the snokeling was better off the beach at the hotel than at the crater. Unfortunately we found Dukes restaurant on our very last day it is a short 10 minute walk north of the Royal Lahaina and had excellent breakfast, it would have been great to try for sunset drinks and dinner. The Royal Lahaina isnt 5 star but it is so relaxing and not one of the big chain hotels, it doesnt have a big resort pool but its on one of the most beautiful beachs and that to me beats a pool anyday (we didnt use the pool once). We fell in love with Maui and will definately be back and we will definately stay at the Royal Lahaina, I wish i was there now! :) ** Clean Comfortable ** Friendly ** Great Location ** Relaxed

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina - Maui”
Reviews.Author: Roly_in_Texas
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Clean rooms. Beautiful grounds. Narrow parking spaces. Very good breakfast buffet. Nice accees to walking/jogging trail along golf course. Beach access was easy. Wish pools were larger.

Reviews.Title: “The Cottages are the worst”
Reviews.Author: Fiji2010USA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at their cottages for two nights and when we first walked in we could not believe our eyes. The room was dirty and old. It was in dire need of an update. This was the worst place we have ever stayed in. I don't know what the hotel looks like, but do not stay in the cottages. The price we paid for this cottage was not worth it by a long shot. We wish we could have switched hotels all together, as we had a horrible stay there. Definately not worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: JOHN S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a value package through Costco.com Travel - including car rental, ocean view room, daily buffet breakfast, daily mai tais, sunset dinner sail, luau with dinner PLUS $250 food and beverage credit - what a deal! The staff was great and the location ideal - close enough to stroll down to Whalers' Village for shopping or dining but not as crowded as other places on Ka'anapali Beach. Our biggest complaint was that the cotton napkins in the restaurant have so much starch in them that they are totally useless - won't absord anything. If that's the only thing we could find to complain about - it must be a pretty good place. The hotel is not the newest or fanciest, but it's certainly comfortable anc conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Baker001
Reviews.Content: After doing a lot of research on where to stay, my wife and I decided to stay here. After reading a lot of the reviews, I came to the conclusion I only had a couple of items to worry about. If you want to spend your hours by a luxurious pool, then this is not the place for you. If you want to party all night long, I also would not recommend this place. If you want a nice relaxing place with a friendly staff and a great location, then this is the place for you. I did the package deal through Costco and couldn't be happier. I got the hotel, car rental, breakfast buffet, luau, and dinner cruise all included for about the same price as just the hotel room. The luau was pretty cool, the food was good, but the free drinks were pretty weak. Since I didn't go to get hammered, it wasn't that big of a deal. I recommend buying the souvenir cup for $15. They refill them for free and I actually had to ask the bartender to go a little easier on the rum in the pina coladas. The dinner cruise was alright. The food wasn't that great, but the crew, passengers, and scenary made the cruise worth going. The hotel does have a couple of computers you can use for a few minutes if you need to check something on-line for free. I go on vacation to get away from work, so this worked just fine for me. I also thought the breakfast buffet was pretty good. I don't think it is worth $20 a person, but since it was included in our package it was great. I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to get away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: MaiuOnMyMind
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week's stay at the Royal Lahaina, December 1-7 in a cottage room. I was a little worried after reading previous reviews of the cottages. I am pretty fussy but I was very happy with our cottage. It faced the golf course so it was very private, we had no room directly above us, and we enjoyed stepping right outside to the lanai to feed the birds. Unfortunately, the cottages will not likely be there much longer due to higher density development. Not fancy but roomy, very clean, and comfortable, and did I say good value. The staff at royal lahaina were lovely people who made us feel at home - majalo! On checking in late at night one of the receptionists gave me her lei which smelled so nice and made a great start to our holiday. Only negative was the hot tub/spa which was very tiny and located in a very dark remote location and i was surprised it would be allowed for guests to stumble about in the dark to reach it, but that was only a small issue and expect the resort has plans with it's new development. Thanks again for a lovely week in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Dream vacation”
Reviews.Author: anita k
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Lahina resort 12-2 thru 12-7 and I must say the resort itself is remarkable. We had a garden view room which also had a great view of the ocean. Jordan the bellhop was very nice. The only problem was there was no rollaway bed in our room, which I had requested about 2 week in advanced. When I called the front desk to find out why the bed wasn't in the room, all I got was that it wouldn't fit in the room. After checking with the Pleasant Holiday person on site to ask how to handle the problem,(she wasn't helpful either).I and my fellow travelers went to the front desk and spoke with the manager. All she wanted to do is to upgrade us at our expense to a room the a rollaway bed would fit in. Finally we all realized that we weren't getting anywhere so I asked them to put the bed in the room. To make a long story short. The rollaway bed does fit in the room without any difficulty!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, great location”
Reviews.Author: unojmh
Reviews.Content: Book a 7 day stay here through a Costco package and upgrade to deluxe oceanview rooom for extra $64.00 for the week. Room was on the top floor of the hotel with a beautiful view of Molakai. Went over Thanksgiving weekend and weather was a little mixed with some strong off shore winds and a few showers Shower afforded some beautiful rainbows from our balcony. Package included daily breakfast buffet which was very good, luau on property which was also very good, a dinner cruise on a catamaran, great fun, $250.00 food and beverage credit, daily free Mai Tai, Valet parking ($15.00 per day) Staff was very friendly and helpful. Grounds are very nice. Watched two weddings from our balcony. Location is near everything without being right in the middle of the congested part of Kaanapali. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hated to Leave”
Reviews.Author: txhawk29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina to celebrate a belated 10 year anniversary. We paid to upgrade to an Ocean Front room and it was worth it to us. Waking up every morning to the ocean view was awesome. The room was always clean and well kept. The grounds were beautiful and the staff was helpful. We walked to the whaler's village, but used our rental to go to Old Lahaina and Front St. which was too far to walk but more fun. The concierge hooked up with a great zip line company and we had a blast. We did snorkeling in the ocean right outside the hotel which wasn't the best but only about another 200 yds up the beach there is coral where we were able to see many more fish. We enjoyed the Luau. The food was pretty good. The drinks were pretty watered down but we expected that. The pool bar has a great view and reasonable happy hour so we spent some time there sipping Mai Tai's. We visited the week of Thanksgiving and I did not think it was busy at allâ€¦.lots of space around the pool and on the beach. Only three small complaints.....the restaurant is just below you if you have an ocean front room so if you keep your doors open to listen to the waves you'll probably also be woken up by the restaurant staff setting up the breakfast buffet and 5:30. Parking spaces are very tight at the hotel....barely enough room to get out of the car. Our rental got dinged in the lot overnight and we are waiting to see what that is going cost us. The weddings they have in the courtyard are beautiful, but the receptions can be loud. If you don't mind the chicken dance, YMCA, and some Lady Gaga while youâ€™re trying to watch the ocean it's great. They seemed to be over pretty early though. Overall we loved the hotel though and would definitely stay there again. We enjoyed Maui much better than Oahu and that is saying a lot. The hotel is a good value as well.

Reviews.Title: “40th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: SmplyYes
Reviews.Content: The resort, staff and room was perfect. My trip started out terrible no fault of the resort but the turn a terrible experience a wonderful vacation for me. Stephanie, Yvette, Marissa, Josh were just a few that went the extra mile. The room service was great, the daily made service was outstanding...the Luau was phenomenal! Maui is not a party city...relaxing. Take the road to Hana, go snorkeling & take a helicopter tour(amazing)! Leave your door open and let the ways put you to sleep nightly!

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lolahbelle
Reviews.Content: We got to Maui in the dark and the Royal Lahaina was about a half hour drive from the airport. They had given us a complimentary upgrade to an ocean view room because it was our honeymoon and when we woke up in the am and opened the shutters the view was to die for(only one of sooo many amazing views while visiting Hawaii). The Royal Lahaina was a very nice hotel and our room was lovely and very clean with a super comfortable bed. I also thought the location was great and really loved "downtown" Lahaina which we were very close to. If there was a negative it was only that our room was in the front of the hotel facing the entrance on a low floor and it wasn't very private on our balcony. It could also get noisy early in the am because of this but nonetheless I would stay there again and highly recommend it to travelers for a reasonably priced hotel on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great service.”
Reviews.Author: ammorello
Reviews.Content: I think some people were way too harsh in their reviews of the Royal Lahaina. No, it was not the greatest hotel we've ever stayed in, but if you are hanging out in your room on your vacation in paradise, then you have issues. When we first checked in, we were upgraded to partial ocean view tower room and were given a complimentary bottle of champagne since we were celebrating our honeymoon. The room was nicely decorated and mostly clean. The only complaint about the room we had was with the bathroom. After you shower and open the glass door, lots of water gets onto the floor. The location is pretty good, although there are a lot of tourists and the area is very busy. The beach in the front of the property was very nice too. The hotel is close to Front St. Where there are lots of cool shops and restaurants. It is also close to lots of other hotels where you can find some good places for dinner. The parking is a little tough because they often have luau's going on, so sometimes if you get back later, you could have some difficulty finding a spot. Also, be forewarned, the spots are very tight. It also kind if sucks that you have to pay for parking, but I think this is the case for most of the hotels on Maui. Overall though, we had a very nice stay and we feel that the Royal Lahaina was a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding stay”
Reviews.Author: idlehands26
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and i stayed here in nov. of 2011while we got married up at Kapalua Bay.We stayed in an ocean front cottage, which was rad if you care about your view.Other wise the tower and garden cottages are super nice as well.I mean who cares where you sleep, walk outside and your in paradise steps from the sand.The staff was really cool about calling and arranging four taxi's to take us all into LaHaina for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “fantantic resort”
Reviews.Author: HayleyMcGuinness
Reviews.Content: I was trying to book a resort for our honeymoon but i found that a lot of other resorts like the Sheraton where so expensive. So i decided to go with Royal Lahaina resort. I was unsure what it was going to be like as it was a lot cheaper compared to the other 'fancy' resorts. But i was so impressed when we got there. The drive to the resort is so pretty with all the landscaped golf courses. The resort was very well presented, the rooms were fantasic and modern with a Hawian feel.
