We had an ocean front room but it was to close to the bar. So we down graded to partial ocen veiw to move away from the pool area. But the view was even better! We had views of the mountains, the ocean and other islands. The bar staff were excellent, they really made our stay as they were so friendly. The beach was really nice and it wasnt a long walk to other beaches or resorts. the location was excellent. It was a short drive to other cafes or shops but you also were not surrounded by a lot of people unlike the Sheraton. It was just so relaxing and i would love to go back there one day.

Reviews.Title: “Destination wedding for a friend/Our Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: sharidunlap
Reviews.Content: Ok, we were invited to my husband's friend's wedding. He was asked to be his "best man." When told it would be in Maui, our first thought was, too expensive, two kids in college, we don't have the money. But, this is a very good friend of my husbands so we certainly didn't want to miss it. It was very close to our 25th anniversary so we thought we would celebrate that as well since I have always wanted to go to Hawaii. We were completely thrilled with everything about the Royal Lahaina Resort. We originally booked the Romance package for our anniversary which included an ocean view room. The room was more than adequate but I really wanted an ocean front room so we asked shortly after check-in if one was available. They said one would be available the next day so it did cost an additional $40 a day. We were more than happy to pay the difference and it was worth it!!! To wake up to the view and the ocean waves was incredible! We were definitely on a budget and I was a bit leery of some of the reviews but was so very happy with the whole resort. You need to be OK with a small pool, no spa treatments, and a very relaxing atmosphere. The nightly music was amazing! We could hear it from our room which was an awesome aphrodisiac! We were looking for something quiet and laid back and we got it!!! Would definitely go back! The daily breakfast buffet was consistent and great, the Luau , and the sunset cruise was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely vacation”
Reviews.Author: swissiam
Reviews.Content: I had the second half of my honeymoon at the Royal Lahaina after spending several days in Waikiki. We had a lovely experience here. The staff was gracious, our ocean view room was updated and had an amazing view, and the location was perfect. You can easily walk to all of the other resorts in the Kaanapali Beach area from here which is extremely convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina 10/15-10/22/11”
Reviews.Author: Geoff B
Reviews.Content: Resort was nice. We purchased the romance package. The food was average and when we went to check out, as well as one of our friends, the bills were incorrect. I loved the beach and the location however. The staff was friendly overall as well.

Reviews.Title: “Paraside for newlyweds.”
Reviews.Author: Kelley S
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at Royal Lahaina. We arrived very late to resort but were able to make us feel very welcomed by a very friendly front desk assistance, Lovely. I stayed for 10 nights in beautiful clean rooms, with an excellent semi-ocean view room. If there was ever an issue with housekeeping, Cora assured that the issue was addressed promptly. Our shower seemed to leak onto the floor, but they always made sure there were extra towels. My family were staying the cabins and it was nice to have a larger living space. My husband and I preferred staying at our own resort, on the beach eating a picnic underneath the shade a large tree or umbrella, or by the pool in a cabana, or renting snorkel gear and swimming with sea turtles just North of the resort by the coral reef. The activities guy, Casey, was extremely helpful, and made the trip that much better with surfing lessions and awesome sunglasses (Maui Jims), Paraside for newlyweds. My package also included the Luau (which was incredible!) and a sunset cruise (perfect!). The location was great: walking distance from Whaler's Village and Ka'anapali, easy driving distance to the rest of La'Haina. I loved the nightly entertainment at the restaurant and the private hottub. I cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: suzq595
Reviews.Content: We booked a package at this hotel for a week in September 2011 through Costco. This hotel was even better than we expected! I loved the Hawaiian feel of the hotel. We stayed in a tower room and the renovations were very impressive. The food at the breakfast buffet was awesome, we did that every morning as part of our package. The food at the hotel restaurant was great,too! Everything was perfect, I really don't have a bad thing to say! We would definitely stay here again. Have the hotel concierge make dinner reservations for you if you are dining off property, we got great seating when we did that. Housekeeping was super efficient and extremely friendly. Loved our stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: hls417
Reviews.Content: I was terrified to stay at the Royal Lahaina. I wanted to stay in a "hawaiian" hotel instead of a big chain and let my travel agent convince me to stay at the Royal Lahaina before I did all my research. I read review after review for a month, most of them terrible and finally made myself stop reading. I have good news - there was no reason to be terrified. But that doesn't mean I would stay there again. I am fairly low maintenance with hotels on vacation since I rarely stay in the room. If you get a good deal here, it's probably worth it but do not pay top dollar for this resort when there are so many good ones in the area. Pros: - The grounds are very pretty. Great location, great beach, great sunset views. - The valets and bell hops are very nice and helpful. - I enjoyed the pineapple flavored water and cooling down towels they keep in the lobby. - The tower rooms were very nice, I enjoyed the balcony and the minimalist look. - We didn't mind the parking and the price. There are bigger spots in the back of the lot that requires you to walk about 100 feet more, which I guess is why people were complaining. We're also from NYC where you have to walk alot. - The champagne for our anniversary was a very nice gesture. Cons: - The receptionists were nice enough, but sleazy. I don't know if they do it on their own or if they are trained that way. We had booked the anniversary special when we booked our room and I called the week before we left to confirm (spoke to their corporate office, which was great). Their office confirmed that I had a room on a top floor in the tower with a garden view. They told me if available, they would upgrade me upon arrival to a partial ocean view. When we checked in the receptionist told us that she had no more partial ocean views and for $100 a night she could upgrade me to an ocean view room. I declined. She then said that she would give me the great deal of $50 a night. I declined. And then, magically, a partial ocean view room happened to open up. How convenient is that? - Trying to charge you for a late check out and missing key and towel cards? Come on. - Maid service was AWFUL. I always tip the maid a lot in hotels but ours was super lazy. We had the same lipstick stained wine glasses in our room night after night, no matter how many times I left them in the sink to be replaced. She didn't clean anything or replace the cosmetic products. I found stained sheets on our 2nd night and had to get someone to change them. You're a resort, step it up. - It's impossible to shower without the water leaking everywhere. When they built the new fancy showers, they left 2 cracks in the door that water shoots from all over the floor and bathroom. - Last - I was very suprised to learn that there was no gym. I didn't even think to ask about it in this day and age. Every hotel has at least a couple of barbells and a treadmill for their guests. Nothing doing here. When I asked about it, they told us we could join the neighborhood gym for the low rate of $55 per week. Ha. I know some people don't like to work out in Hawaii but some of us do and this was the first place I've encountered without gym access. So all in all, the Royal Lahaina did not ruin our time :) We had a great time in Maui and the hotel was a non factor.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: lmparr
Reviews.Content: Overall a great hotel experience. I had hoped for a few more amenities to be included, such as beach chairs, snorkel equipment, etc, but that was all for an additional daily or weekly fee. Great location, close to wonderful snorkeling. Beautiful setting. Great live music nightly at the ocean view bar.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue V
Reviews.Content: We were told The Royal Lahaina Resort was remodeled a few years ago. Good job, people! Our room proved superior to our expectations. Decorated in a contemporary style with island touches - lots of deep rich wood contrasted with light colored walls, flat panel TV, brushed nickel fixtures and granite bathroom countertop, and best-night's-sleep-ever bed and fluffy, yummy pillows all covered with zillion thread count white sheets. We had mountain, golf course and ocean views from our 10th floor room. The location is more north and away from the always mobbed main area of Kaanapali. Walking on the beach in front of the hotel, we passed just a few people - not the crowds found around Whaler's Village. The restaurant is small but adequate. The food was very good and prices reasonable, for a resort hotel on Maui. The bartenders are skilled Mai Tai makers - 1/2 price during happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Marriage/Honeymoon Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: In June of 2010, my wife and I went to my favorite vacation spot in Hawaii. The Royal Lahaina Resort on Maui. We had come here to have our wedding ceremony and honeymoon here. We are high school sweethearts who re-connected after 38 years apart. This time, she didn't get away and we were married on a beach on June 19th. I'm partial to the main hotel "tower" since the entire facility was remodeled and upgraded. What a terrific job they did. The rooms are comfortable and spacious and the housekeeping staff are very cordial and helpful. We opted to have the buffet breakfast daily and enjoyed that. Only downside we had was the outdoor swimming pools. They are not heated and if you elect to try 'em out, you should be a card-carrying member of the polar bear club. They are cold! Luau nights get crowded and finding a place to park can be a pain in the "heiny!" Tennis is great here and so is the beach. This is where we'd like to return with our kids or just the two of us. Hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “All around great place!”
Reviews.Author: Skydivingchik
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 14 of us that went to this resort for a destination wedding. The bride and groom had stayed there before and had such a great time they decided to get married there. Most importantly, all the wedding plans went smoothly--everything was done perfectly by the staff there. Besides the wedding events, the rest of the week was great..Check in and check out were quick and easy, the pineapple water in the lobby is an extra nice touch, and all the staff was super friendly and accomodating. The bartenders, especially Richard, were GREAT (and we spent a LOT of time around them) as was the manager that ran the food/bar areas. We were able to book all our activities (sunset cruise, snorkeling, luau) easily from right there. The guy that ran the outdoor activities/towel spot was very knowledgeable and super friendly. We stayed in the main tower and all of our rooms were very nice and clean. The only problem (which we all seemed to have) is that when you took a shower, water would end up all over the bathroom floor. The rest of the facilities, food, and drink were all top notch. My only complaint was that the food menu was the same for lunch and dinner with no "specials", so after a few days we were looking for different meal options, but that just gave us a chance to explore. The hotel also has a complimentary trolley that takes you to some of the local shopping/eating areas so if you don't rent a car, you can still travel around. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beach, great view, and excellent property”
Reviews.Author: Capricornus
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 5 bight stay at the Royal Lahaina. Pluses: gorgeous beach, good location, excellent drink specials at the pool-side bar during happy hour. Breakfast buffet was pretty good but somewhat expensive. Good value for the price. One main downside: expensive beach chair rentals I definitely would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Like coming home!”
Reviews.Author: sanchevy51
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Royal Lahaina twice and stayed and in the cottages both times. It feels like you are in your own private bungalo. The staff is very friendly and the resort is beautiful. When we drove up to the entrance on the second trip, my husband's comment was, "It feels like we're coming home!" My favorite part is being able to go for long walks on the beach and on the walkways that connect the resorts. We will definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property”
Reviews.Author: KoziakProductions
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property in a gorgeous location with a welcoming staff. They bring in local tradesman with arts and hand crafted souvenirs that are extremely reasonably priced (sometimes almost half the price I found at other locations). Full restaurant but my favorite delight was the coffee shop that had delicious ice cream! One of the best Luau's in town.

Reviews.Title: “A nice return”
Reviews.Author: OzMum231
Reviews.Content: Having visited Maui six years ago, we decided to try a different hotel to the one we stayed at in 2005 - The Royal Lahaina Resort. However, after much web searching and comparing facilities, location and price we ended up back at the Royal Lahaina Resort. We had no regrets; there had been changes but none were detrimental to our enjoyment of the resort. Being beach lovers we spent little time at the pools, except to use the lounges there between swims in the ocean. The staff were as pleasant as in the past. The rooms were clean and very comfortable and even though we only had garden view rooms we still managed glimpses of the ocean from our balconies. I would recommend shopping at Whalers Village and a wander through old Lahaina. Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: King-vacationers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a cruise before coming back to Maui and staying at the Royal Lahaina Resort. Upon arrival friendly bell hops greeted us to unload our luggage and later brought them to our room. At check in we were offered an upgrade for a nightly fee and it was well worth it. Our room was on the 11th floor and my husband and I were pleasantly surprised. It was the most wonderful room we have ever stayed in. VERY clean, spacious and the full ocean view was breathtaking. We stayed two nights and wished we could have stayed longer. My husband and I were celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary and couldn't asked for a better place to stay. Everyone we spoke with at the resort was very nice and helpful from the housekeeping staff to the bell hops and from the front desk to the man giving out pool towels. We already started planning our next trip back to the Royal Lahaina Resort. Next time with the adult kids. Thanks again Royal Lahaina Resort and staff. Jim and Janet King, Creswell, Oregon

Reviews.Title: “40th anniversary”
Reviews.Author: adele50Oceanside_ca
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Maui. We booked a package through Costco travel. We had a great time. The staff was happy and seemed to enjoy their customers. We went 10/27-11/2. The pools were nice the beach was just a few steps away our oceanview room was wonderful.Would come back again. We went to the luau and spent the extra few dollars for premium seating which was fun. We are luau junkies,we also did the sunset dinner cruise on the cat through Teralani which was awesomely fun. If you have the chance stay at the Royal Lahaina

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, Skip the Luau”
Reviews.Author: MidNiteSunAK
Reviews.Content: Great location and beach access. We were here on the first part of our honeymoon Dec 23-Dec 27, 2010. The restaurant on site was pretty good, but there is a free trolly to more shops and restaurants (Whaler's Village) down the street. You can also take a nice stroll to the shops on the sidewalk, too. The rooms were really nice and the balcony with ocean front view was great. The luau isn't that great and is really a pack 'em in type of event. They had about 250-300 people with two buffet lines. When we got to Kona, we wished we had waited and did the luau at the Marriott (Waikoloa Beach Marriott Resort & Spa). They had a luau with <50 people and smaller, more intimate setting with the beach closer. Overall great experience, extremely expensive due to holiday time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location on a beautiful beach.”
Reviews.Author: shepherd35
Reviews.Content: We were at the Royal Lahaina for our son's wedding. The location was beautiful, and the beach was really nice. The staff at the hotel were very relaxed and accomodating with the group of us celebrating around the pools and common areas. The wedding venue was really nice - located on a grassy knoll in a private area reserved for weddings. The Luau after the wedding was very nice, with great food and entertainment. It wasn't too long, nor too short. We had a beautiful sunset while everyone was getting their food, so an opportune time to click some pictures. All day long we could smell the traditional Hawaiian pig-roast cooking while we swam at the beach - the aroma was tantalizing, so we were all ready for the feast. There was a number of different dishes that would suit the palate of everyone. You could enjoy boardwalk strolls that took you through some of the adjoining resorts. It was nice to do this early morning before the heat. You would meet lots of joggers and people walking most mornings. Downside of the hotel, I would say is that their "Terrace View" from the 4th floor was really a view of a flat roof from an adjoining building. As a result we had to upgrade and spend another $400. for a 9th floor suite. I would not recommend 4th floor rooms to anyone who wants to see something, other than a black tar roof. Also, while there is a parking spot for you, the spots are a bit of a walk, especially during the Luaus. Of course, Valet parking is available, obviously more pricey than self-parking fees.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: oneluvonehart
Reviews.Content: I would definutly recommend staying here. It's a good value, good location. You can walk right to the beach. There isn't a place to surf but you can drive 5 minutes to the Marriot and rent boards. The grounds are well kept and there are 2 pools. The rooms are clean and have a beautiful ocean view. We had no problems while staying here, it was relaxing and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there unless you like roaches and bad service.”
Reviews.Author: sd90311
Reviews.Content: We checked in and were told that we would have to wait for our room to be ready until 9pm. Once we checked in we founda cockroach in the bathroom. We decided to read reviews on here and seems we should have done this earlier as this is an ongoing problem since 2004 or 2007. Staff was not friendly, they did not even let us park by valet to just take out bags out of the car. Top it off you will pay $9 a day additional for a parking far from the hotel. They hold Laua's at this hotel so they want to save the closer parking for guests. There Lauau was so boring that people actually left after they ate and didnt really wait for the entire show. Definitely not a place you want to stay on your honeymoon or bring your kids to. Only good thing about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon nightmare”
Reviews.Author: jadesingsnow
Reviews.Content: i dont even know where to start our rooms werent ready when we checked in . we had to wait till 4pm we wanted to check in at 11am.,, we were offered a hotel room for a upgrade. which was fine the room was very small but nicely furnished ., the water pressure wasnt the best . we had a bathroom (toilet blockage it took hours for matinence to fix this we called 2 to get this done. we went to the main dinning area first day for lunch we got the menus thrown at us. basically . the food was ok the waiter was cold he didnt speak he just stood there and waited for us to make up our minds. we were there to spend money. ive worked in hospitality my whole life and whatever sham they are trying to sell you on the website dont buy it . unless u want your property damaged while onsite. we hired a car a nice one. it got keyed on their property they didnt want to deal with the problem told us to see the cop shop and took some notes no one got a manager. no one offered any compensation it wasnt about that it was the fact that NO ONE cared. also my new husband tried to arrange a spa day for me at a near by hotel the lady in the guest concierge services was supposed to arrange this , she did but misinformed my husband that they offered a service that they didnt. as well he ordered room service that day and it showed up with no bacon that was ordered. and no toast and no plate.for him it was supposed to be for both of us they keyed car was the end of it for me the resort is outdated for older people more or less they have a don club its never opened cept on saturday nights only till 8-11 these people are desperate for good staff obviously and good money., hiring people who dont care isnt good bussiness the manager we delt with was good as we were checking out they finally got the message we checked out before we were supposed to fed up with poor service and after the car being keyed the manager proceeded to say she wouldve done something for us offered us a upgrade great my point was if ur carpark isnt secured you have staff walking around there all night and they dont care about your property and there is no liability sign anywhere. well thats gonna happen again isnt it. she then added up our charges charged us full price only deduction was breakfast,for one day. then she added her Mangement. charge for listening to us tell her why we were leaving i work in this industry i will tell everyone about this it was disgusting. tom bell u should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MYH516
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean and pretty. The lobby is nice and all the staff is very friendly. The pool is nice and the beach front is very clean and there is a nice sandy bottom in the water where u can stand and not cut your feet on rocks and if you rent snorkel gear, you can swim a little ways in either direction and find some beautiful reefs full of fish. The hotel has a nice gift shoppe and there is a coffee and ice cream store as well that is convenient. The only thing that we didn't care for is that the parking. To be a guest and have a car, not only was it a small parkinglot and crowded, buy you had to pay $10 a day. To have it valet, it was $15 a day. We just didn't understand why we had to pay to park our car ourselves when we had a room there.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach location”
Reviews.Author: bruce14
Reviews.Content: Beachfront on one of the widest sections of beach in the area, 20 min walk or free trolley to Whalers Village - shopping, restaurants and bus to Lahaina Large, well appointed rooms Small pool with very limited number of poolside chairs for a hotel of this size, less attractive lawn area also available for sunbathing Breakfast seemed like quite a performance with long lines to obtain a ticket and then again to be seated â€“ our friends reported up to 20min wait; we declined breakfast option and went for coffee and croissant at on site coffee shop Lunch and dinner were both good, poolside setting with pleasant entertainment â€“ singer and hula dancer in the evenings On site Luau (69pp) was entertaining, buffet and drinks average, good show, wouldnâ€™t pay any more.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Letsg0somewhere
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Royal Lahaina and we had a great time. There are certain expenses to be aware of, but if it's not a surprise to you, it shouldn't put a damper on things. Parking is expensive; it's a few dollars more to go for the valet, and I think it's worth the cost to leave it up to them to squeeze into the tiny spaces. The breakfast buffet is also quite pricey, but the views from the restaurant are amazing if you get a seat outside. Go early or there will be a line. Or why not order room service; it is actually less expensive in most cases. Get a room in the tower and eat on your lanai; it is very nice. If you want to save money in the morning, the Royal Scoop cafe on site offers bagels and things, or their gift shop/store sells fruit, sandwiches, and beverages. We absolutely love the stretch of beach it's on, and it's less crowded than further down Ka'anapali. To me, it makes it worth every penny. Be sure to buy or bring your own towels while you're there, as the Beach Activities Center only let's you have two at a time and closes at five. Grab a seat at the bar there to watch the sunset and listen to some free entertainment from a guitarist and hula dancer. The bartenders that were there on our most recent visit were superb, and you get faster refills if your sitting at the bar rather than other parts of the restaurant (and beware, those Mai Tai's are strong!). The Whalers Village is five minutes away, and you can hop on a free trolley to get there, and Lahaina is just a bit further down, which is full of cool shops and great restaurants. We don't leave West Maui much while we're there but it's nice having a rental car to explore the other parts of the island and get to activities. There is also an Expedia Local Expert there to book activities, as well as two guest relations counters (one in the lobby and one just outside of it) so you won't be short of things to do while you there. They were offering yoga and pilates in the mornings during our stay (which I meant to check out, but never did...). Also you can print your boarding passes and get on the Internet for free in the guest relations office, so don't pay the hefty Internet fee while you're there each day because you're supposed to be getting away from it all! All in all, I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice secluded resort away from the crowd”
Reviews.Author: SuPeru07
Reviews.Content: This place was great. We stayed in a cottage which needs remodelling. The showers were OK and the bed was not great. But the resort and the cottage blended with the gardens and beach that made this the best place to stay. We also stayed in Westin, and this was more Hawaiian and more private. The sunset and sunrise from the beach was great. Their restaurant has hula dance every night which you can watch from the pool. I believe their Luau is great since it attracts good crowd. The housekeeping staff are very friendly. The front desk people are OK. They have a small convenience store and generally the people around are nice. I would definitely recommend this place. It has nothing fancy, just the way Maui resort should be.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Honeymoon- perfect secluded location”
Reviews.Author: Warfs
Reviews.Content: We really like the traditional feel of the hotel as soon as we walked in. The pineapple water when you walk in was quite refreshing. The Royal has their own beach that was never crowded. The room had an awesome view of the ocean and we heard the waves crashing all the time. No tub in room, but glass door shower. Yummy shampoo/lotion/soaps. Close but not too close to other main hotels. Walking distance to whalers (shopping, food etc) and quick drive to fun downtown Lahaina. Pros: Quiet, secluded beach. Traditional open bar luau. Decent restaurant with live music and hula. Cons: flat pillows, no bathtub, weak and distant hot tub. Reccommend book package deal with AATPA. All inclusive= awesome honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “check in?”
Reviews.Author: tripmay
Reviews.Content: i wasn't welcomed at all to this resort.the check in agent didn't even try to at least crack a fake smile.she demanded a credit card and i.d. and told me to read the back of the towel rental card or i would be charged a fee.felt like i was being "booked in", not checked in. we were early arriving so were told to go walk around and try back in 2 hours as our room was not ready.very surly.sat in the lobby and watched the bus load of people arrive about an hour later and all receive their rooms right away.hmm.i had booked this directly with the hotel 6 months previously. the site said to inquire about a free upgrade upon arrival.haha.i tried this when i went to see if my room was ready.of course they had no such room available but for fifty bucks more per night i could upgrade.no thanks, but nice try.valet dudes were alright,hostess at the bar/restaurant was nice.room cleaners were the most pleasant of them all.seems like staff morale is suffering at this resort???? resort as a whole was fine,beautiful setting and not terribly loud or busy.it is sad though when you arrive at a resort and are treated like you are inconveniencing them by staying there.unfortunate, but for that reason alone i will stay elsewhere when i return to beautiful maui.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: ctraveller7
Reviews.Content: I didn't look into a place to stay in Maui until the day of arrival. I booked through a third party site and the resort I was given was The Royal Lahaina. Upon arrival I was happy with the outlook of the property. When checking in I was given a complementary upgrade to an ocean view room. The staff was very very friendly and really helpful. The hotel is kept up very well and clean. I loved the room. The decor and set up of them were great and provided a nice beachy feel. The room had a mini fridge so if you were interested in heading to the local grocery store there is a place to keep your items cold. The room had a opened balcony with a beautiful view. The hotel is right on the beach and has a nice pool as well. Its a close drive to the downtown Lahaina area. Very happy with my stay here, would stay again on a visit to Maui, I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Kelly B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort in September 2011 for our honeymoon. Our vacation to Maui was a dream come true. Checking in was quick and the staff was always friendly and helpful. Because we were honeymooners we received an upgrade of an ocean view room (we booked a partial view) and a complimentary bottle of champagne (which was much needed after a long day of traveling). We were on the 11th floor facing the cottages and golf course. The views were incredible at all hours of day. Our room was spacious, very clean and we had plenty of towels and pillows. The bed and bedding were very luxurious and super comfortable. The fridge in the room was nice for drinks and snacks. The grounds and beach are fantastic with amazing views of the sunset. We added the breakfast buffet and are glad we did. We filled up on that each morning, ate a snack for lunch and went out for dinner. The luau at RLR was very nice. The food was delicious, the show was great and the mai tais and blue hawaiians kept on coming. We also ate at the hotel restaurant a few times. Our meals were excellent (I espeically liked the fish tacos and onion rings) and the service great. The ice cream at the Royal Scoop was almost as good as the ice cream we get in Wisconsin :) The pineapple water in the lobby was very refreshing after a day on the beach. We rented a car for two of our seven day stay. We booked a Dollar Rent A Car through RLR. A shuttle from the rental company took us to and from the resort when we picked up and dropped off the car. It worked great for us! An awesome thing about RLR is there is no resort fee (that is unless you rent a car in which it is $10/day to park). We talked with some people that stayed at the Sheraton who were suprised with over $400 in resort fees when checking out. No thanks. Royal Lahaina Resort is on the quiet side of Kaanapali Beach which made it very relaxing and enjoyable.We were so comfortable here that it truly felt like our home for the week. I do not have one bad thing to say about this place. It exceeded all our expectations and we can't wait to go back! We had the time of our lives and it was a great start to our married life!

Reviews.Title: “3rd time...not so lucky.”
Reviews.Author: pfed
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I have stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort. I was thrilled to be bringing friends that were new to Maui to share our experience and I did nothing but rave about how fantastic the Royal Lahaina Hotel had been for us year after year. In terms of culture, Cleanliness and location you can't beat it. It's a great bang for your buck for a hotel right on Kaanapali beach. The restaurant is great, the Royal scoop coffee shop was a life saver and serves amazing fresh brewed Kona Coffee, snacks and a light breakfast and the beach?....unbelievable. I am very saddened for the first time to be writing a negative review of this hotel because somewhere on Trip Advisor there is 2 more written by me for the same hotel for past visits. Here are the negatives that we experienced this time around which will definately change my selection of future accomodations on Maui. Booking- We got a fairly good rate and the reservations agent was happy to match any rate that was found on other travel sites which was a great thing. Please note when booking through the hotel that they take a minimum payment of three nights as a deposit. Check in- So disappointing! We unfortunately had late check in due to our flight, and let me tell you the night shift staff are probably curled up under the front desk until you ring the bell for service. We attempted to check into the room and gave the agent our credit card. Where she pre-authorized the entire 10 night stay. To our embarassment and shock, neither my or my husbands credit card was able to be processed. Being a little odd that both cards didn't work especially because we had cleared it for the trip, we were immediately panicked that our trip was about to begin with no credit cards working. The agent didn't seem to sympathize, she didn't even attempt to re-swipe or tell us what the machine was saying. For the sake of being exhausted, our friends lent us their card for the pre-authorization so we could finally just check into our rooms. When we contacted both of our banks the next day to see what the issue was. They immediately asked where we were because there had been a $3000 charge (not pre-authorization)attempted to be processed on both of our Visa's. (Our room total for 10 nights was $1400) 10 night experience: the first couple of days our room cleanliness was quite good, ample amount of towels, soaps etc. so we started to leave gratuity on our bed before heading to the beach....for some reason, this worked the opposite way, as soon as we started to leave cash tips the service plumeted substantially. We were less a towel every day, no shampoo was replaced and empty bottles were left and our bed looked thrown together. I complained the next day and they promptly came to our room with extra towels, shampoo etc. but I had never had this type of experience before. Check out: We checked out after our 10 night stay and the front desk agent asked if we would like to leave our charges on the card provided at check in. We immediately said "NO!" and for them to please use our credit card instead so our friend wouldn't be charged. The agent graciously smiled, took our card asked for our ID as we overlooked our invoice which seemed good (although our friends had extra charges on their's, so please double check if you stay here) all was well and we departed. After our return: our friend just called to tell us that our entire bill was charged to HIS credit card. So what the front desk did with our card and id is beyond me. So in addition to this review which again I am sad to be writing I am about to contact them directly and discuss our experience. I am very disappointed, and I'm not sure why this hotel has changed so dramatically in just over a year. I hope your experience is better than ours.

Reviews.Title: “Cottages need updating”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed stayed one night in late september. It was the last day of our vacation and she wanted to stay in a cottage on the water. The staff was very friendly and the tower looked very nice (didnt see the rooms). As noted in other reviews, the cottages need some serious updating. For $300+ a night I didnt expect a musty room, old carpet, peeling paint, mirror with chips etc. Very disappointing. I wouldnt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a tourist place”
Reviews.Author: LarsVomMars
Reviews.Content: In October 2011 my wife and I stayed at Royal Lahaina Resort for a couple of nights. The hotel offers good value for money and the rooms are very good. However, expect a tourist place where gifts are sold in the lobby and tipsy wedding guests sometimes jump into the pool at night. Also be aware that an additional resort fee of USD 10 has to be paid even if you park your car yourselve.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful wedding, great experience”
Reviews.Author: jvlady
Reviews.Content: We held our daughter's wedding ceremony here on the lawn. It was everything we asked for and everything turned out perfectly. We also spent about a week here - both before and after the wedding, and we loved it. The staff was always friendly, the rooms clean and the view & beach spectacular. Plus we loved NOT staying at a chain hotel. The pool area was nice although we never used it, and the beach was fabulous and not crowded at all. I would definitely stay there again, as would my daughter and her husband. We also thought the rates were great!

Reviews.Title: “It was a comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: E714
Reviews.Content: Most of the staff was really nice and polite. We enjoyed our stay and would gladly go back. The resort was really quite and mellow nice for couples that want to go relax and drink a couple mai tais thanks to Richard and Mark. Nice ocean view, good size pool but the hottub was hard to find and away from the pool and temp was warm not hot.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, friendly service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: nursemurray
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Maui - we celebrated our 30th anniversary there. This was a beautiful resort, with friendly service from the minute we walked in the door! They had one of the best luaus on the island (we heard it from a local!). Good food, great show. The resort was very centrally located - great restaurants, shopping, activities, and sight-seeing close by. I would definitely stay here again - paradise!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAY!”
Reviews.Author: Autumn T
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the Royal Lahaina. It was beautiful. The staff was very helpful giving us places to go see and things to do. We went to several beaches around Maui and I thought the Kaanapali Beach at our resort was the best. The water is so clear and blue, great for swimming and snorkeling (go over to the Sheraton on the other side of black rock. It is just a short walk from the hotel- the snorkeling is great there) It is cheap to rent snorkel gear at the Royal Lahaina too, it only cost us $30pp for the whole week. The beach was never crowded either which is a huge plus. When we got there, they upgraded our room to a Deluxe Ocean View which was beautiful. They have live music every night and usually they have a hula dancer too at the restaurant there. It is very relaxed in the restaurant, a lot of the time we sat there and had drinks in our swimsuits. We had a package that included the Royal Lahaina Luau and a Sunset dinner cruise. My husband and I weren't impressed with the Luau, I would try a different one. Food was NOT good at all. The Sunset dinner cruise is a MUST. You can book it right there at the resort and the crew is amazing. Very funny staff, made our drinks strong (its an open bar) and the dinner was really good too. I would rent a car so you can go exploring around the island. Big Beach and Fleming Beach are both worth going to. Fleming is just 5-10 min up the road. Big Beach is about 20-30 minutes the opposite way in Makenna. You can boogie board at either of those beaches. Honolua Bay was also a great place to snorkel and its only about 10 minutes away from the hotel too. If your looking for souvenirs go to the little store right down from Subway in a stripmall in Lahaina on the main road (I cant remember the name of it, I think something Liquidation??) Or there is a K-Mart by the airport that is a lot cheaper too. I would suggest stopping there for sunblock, bottled water, etc because the closer you get to the hotel areas the most $ it is. We DEF plan on going back to the Royal Lahaina! We couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: robertshuck
Reviews.Content: After visiting The Royal Lahaina Resort in March (during the Psunami scare)we thought the resort couldn't be better. Then we returned with 5 family members including three children this month and tom and his staff proved us wrong, it was better. From the lady at the pre-checfk in booth- stating "WELCOME HOME" to every employees great attitude. the room was perfect in every way --great food--stunning location. I seldom recommend any travel location, but this is the exemption. this resort deserves all the accolades, Tom and his staff are great. Keep up the good work. We will be back. ROB SHUCK

Reviews.Title: “It's just ok”
Reviews.Author: ready_n_waitin_to_go
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was very nice as were the bell men,,,, First let me start by saying the over all stay was just ok,, reasons,,,, The pool,,,well I have seen pools in 2 star hotels that were better and the service to get a drink around the pool was well, lets just say, we were there for 8 days and were only asked once if we wanted anything to drink,, said yes and she only brought back part of what I ordered, I only ordered 2 drinks,, The beanbag chairs in the pool were kinda fun. Theree are no chairs allowed on the sand and if you wanted shade, youhad to rent an unbrella... The maids,, haha,, twice, they didnt leave any coffe cups and when they did, they were chipped. Also, one day there wes a roll of tp on the back of the toilet,, nice,,but the next day, when the roll on the wall was gone and I went to replace it, it was gone!? Had to call room service to bring up a roll,,,,I also found a bag of popcorn behind the desk from a previous guest... The bed,,, OH my goodness,,,,it was so warn out and broke down at the head of the bed, I actually slept with my head on the foot of the bed,, it has a down feather cover over it to try and help,,, way too soft and very uncomfortable The veiw was nice as they gave me a partial up grade to ocean view at no charge.... Closed the kitchen early one day, 10 minutes early and told us we couldnt order off of the menu. That left us with the stale buffet breakfast that was $45.00 Once I sat at the bar that is by the pool, the bartender jumped my case because I was a tad wet....he was a jerk....Oh ya,, if you want internet in your room,,, it is $10.00 a day,,, you can check your email for 10min in the front of the hotel. I really dont think I will ever go back.....

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally relaxing”
Reviews.Author: occtravelerMI
Reviews.Content: We LOVED our stay at the Royal Lahaina. Our room was a deluxe ocean view in the towers (11th floor). The view from our room was breathtaking!! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and well appointed. Everything was very nice! Our package included daily breakfast buffet that was amazing. So many different offerings each day! We also had a sunset dinner cruise and luau as part of our package. Both were very enjoyable and 1st class. We ordered a "sack lunch" from Royal Scoop on property which was plentiful and perfect for our "road to Hana" trip. The onsite store has all you could want to pick up as far as snacks and is open from 7AM to 11 PM. Eating in the open air restaurant was a delight overlooking the pool and ocean. I'd recommend this resort to ANYONE!!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST VALUE in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: luvturquoisesea
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 day 25th Anniversary trip with my husband and stayed at the Royal Lahaina for 6 nights. We were in the new "Towers" where I think about 95% of the rooms have their own decks with ocean views! The friendly valets unloaded our jeep and took care of all our luggage. Check in was seamless and we were taken right to our beautifully decorated room with marble bath (separate shower and toilet which I love!) and gorgeous ocean view! Our king bed was the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in and we had plenty of fluffy soft pillows. A huge flat screen TV (not that we watched it much) kept us abreast of football (those Hawaiians are crazy about their college football teams--almost every other channel was a sports channel!). Enough of the room! The staff at this place are really the best. I travel frequently and the folks at this place really seem to genuinely care about making you keep a smile on your face! They are so friendly! There is a bar on the ground floor that is open to the outside and you can sit and sip a Pai Lai (an absolutely amazing type of pina colada they serve inside a real pineapple!) and gaze out to the ocean right in front of you! We ate lunch in the restaurant by the pool every day and honestly, we never had a bad dish. The roasted red pepper soup was to die for and so were the fish tacos! There is a luau nightly on property so you don't need to travel to be treated to that and the show was great! The special wild pig they serve was soooooo good! But the truly best thing about this place was the location. It is on the ABSOLUTE BEST stretch of beach you can find in all of Maui called the Kanapali beach (and we also stayed in Hana, Waikiki, and Wailea during this trip and visited other beaches around Maui via our jeep so we know what we're talking about here!). The ocean is so crystal clear you can see your toes even when you are up to your neck! The clarity and aqua blue color amazing! And there are no crowds like Wailea can get at times. We love to snorkel and only about a 100 foot walk north from this hotel is great snorkeling! We bought our own gear rather than rent it at the beach shack so we snorkeled in every day. I swam alongside a sea turtle daily at this spot and tons of beautiful fish including my new fav the Bird Wrasse! Lots of humuhumu fish too which are sweet! The sand is soft and everything is so clean and clear. We also walked the beach path to get to Black Rock, another great snorkeling site where, at high tide, we saw the largest sea turtle ever! That site is on the Sheraton side of the rock but is only a 5 minute walk. At night we drove a mile south to Whalers Village or 3 miles south to Lahaina to eat at numerous different restaurants, Lahaina Grill being the best memory for food and service! But you don't need a car because the hotel provides a trolley service for free that takes you to down to Whaler's Village where there is lots of shopping and two fun restaurants with nightly live music! The other great thing about this hotel is that there is a separate "family pool" where the kids were, so it was nice to lounge around the bigger pool without getting splashed, hearing yelling, etc. The poolside bar service was awesome too. The only reason I gave the lesser rating for cleanliness was the doors that front the hotel by the beach restaurant. The wood along the bottoms was corroded and they really should be replaced so it looks nicer. Otherwise I would highly recommend this hotel. We think it's the best deal going on Maui. Oh, and if you like golf, it is literally right next door. For $85 you get a cart and get to play on a beautifully maintained course with stunning ocean views. What a trip! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: TiminCA
Reviews.Content: My wife, my 13yr old daughter, and myself went to Maui for 7 days for the first time to celebrate my daughter's birthday. We purchased the Costco package and went over spring break. This vacation has been one of most memmorible trips. (Disney Cruise being the other). I can't say enough how nice this hotel was, everyone we came in contact with at the hotel was very nice to talk with. One of the valet workers even gave my daughter flowers to wear and put in her hair. We were on the 12th floor with ocean view. Everytime we went down to the beach we felt like we had our own private area. Room was remodeled, clean, and felt like we were the first to be in it. I know the rooms were remodled the year before but, still felt new. I tell everyone I know if they are going to Maui stay at the Royal Lahaina. Some of the other hotels seemed big and crowded. The Royal Lahaina had more of a smaller personal feel to it. I have read what people have said about the cottages never got a chance to see inside one so, I can't comment on them. I will go back their again next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Paradise”
Reviews.Author: doreen b
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina Resort is an idyllic get-away from it all hotel on the truly beautiful island of Maui. The staff are friendly, helpful and unobtrusive. The rooms (we stayed in the Tower) are well presented and very clean with plentiful towels and pillows. The bed and bedding were luxurious and very comfortable. The open feel of the terrace and lobby added to the peaceful ambience. The grounds and beach are terrific with amazing views of the sunset over the ocean. We are already planning our return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Lovely Beach”
Reviews.Author: MickieB45
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at this lovely hotel on Kaanapoli Beach, situated among a group of upscale hotels. Our room, which was a partial oceanfront was lovely, with many amenities. Separate bathroom and glass enclosed shower and large plentiful towels. Breakfast buffet at hotel was good, but not great - really could use an omelet making person. Activities desk was very helpful; glad we were able to walk to the nearby restaurant at another property for dinner and drinks. Took the trolley to Whalers Village and then the bus to Lahaina. Without a car, it is a bit cumbersome.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but did not outshine for the price.”
Reviews.Author: govenatorx
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Hawaii for our honeymoon and first stayed in Kauai. We then came to the Royal Lahaina in Maui for 6 nights. We were on a budget and chose the resort based on our financial restrictions. During our research, our travel agent told us about the "Maui Dream Package" offered by Costco. We aren't members of Costco so I don't know how we got the package but we did. It included free breakfast (brunch), 2 mai tai's a day (one for each of us), free valet parking, a free luau at their show, free sunset dinner cruise, and $250 foot and beverage credit (including booze......well liquor, but still how can you complain?). The room was nicely appointed and was in what I believed was a Hawaiian style. The furniture was dark, walls light, and linens were white in color. It was reasonable size and the bed was comfortable. The resort had a pool next to the ocean. It was an older pool and not as nice as others, but it's placement made up for it. There was a row of shrubs that lined the beach blocking the view from the pool when you were in the pool, but standing outside the pool you were graced with a view of Lanai and Molokai that were unparalleled. The beach was pretty good for Hawaii as beaches there aren't deep, but this beach was appreciably deep and offered plenty of room to lay out a towel. The main floor of the resort was very clean and offered a coffee shop, restaurant, and other resort offices. There are a ton of tennis courts and a tennis stadium. There is also a golf course adjacent to the course. Good restaurants and shopping is within walking distance to the Whaler's Village. Our FIRST room was on the 9th floor, opposite the elevator. This wouldn't be an issue if there was better sound proofing on the room door and in the hallways. The roar of other guests was so loud that we couldn't sleep past 5 AM. The cleaning staff started vacuuming the hallway before 8AM. We immediately had a bad taste in our mouths. We asked for a room change and in two days time they put us on the 7th floor, closer to the ocean. This was quieter and we did get better sleep. The buffet in the morning was the quality of a lesser hotel. The food choices never changed, were very limited, and there were no fresh made omelets. This got old real quick. The service was prompt and friendly to help in balancing off the less than average food. The resort was on a local trolley circuit which was free. It also was a 5 minute drive from Lahaina, a nice shopping area as well. In all, if I were traveling on a budget I would consider the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Mahalo Royal Lahaina!”
Reviews.Author: Abbie203
Reviews.Content: Me and my family of 5 stayed here for 10 days during April. We had a great room (partial ocean view i think?) anyway it was great, it had a interconnecting room which was handy.The rooms were cleaned daily and the complimentry body prpducts smelt delicious! We hired a car for the whole time so we mainly went out for meals in Lahaina. We did have breakfast and dinner once at the resort, it was nice but nothing too special. The pools were nice and simple and Kaanapali beach was awesome. A few times I walked around to 'Black Rock' and jumped off, heaps of fun! Overall my stay at the Royal Lahaina was amazing and i cannot wait to go back! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Attention: Kory Strona ( Resort Manager)”
Reviews.Author: Megan L
Reviews.Content: Hello Kory, I would like to bring to your attention that the cottage accommodations are absolutely atrocious. It has been brought up many times in previous customers emails. I feel it is your duty to bring the issues to the shareholders and owners attention. My stay was definately influenced by the condition of the cottages. The staff were absolutely fabulous ! The beach was amazing, and the local people are just so nice. Sadly we will have to wait until someone gets ill from the mold and mildew conditions or a lawsuit is filed against this property. My daughter has asthma and was very ill during our stay due to the air quality within the cottage. When we changed hotel she was feeling better within about 3 hours. I just got word yesterday that my brother in-law is booked into your resort in January 2012. He is not the sort to complain, although I eagerly await his opinion when he arrives home. Thank you kindly,

Reviews.Title: “Beware the "cottage"”
Reviews.Author: susierailroad
Reviews.Content: We needed one night's stay on the day of arrival and booked into RLR. Upon 11 p.m. arrival, clerk suggested she would "upgrade" us to a cottage. I agreed, since she said it was right on the beach. My mistake. The cottage was very musty smelling and I killed a roach on the wall (yes, I know it is the islands), and, although, I hate to write a negative review, I just wanted to advise you think twice about accepting a cottage (not exactly on the beach either.) Since it was so late, we did not request another room.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: PacificSandy
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Royal Lahaina in December, 2010. We arrived at the Hotel at 1:00 in the afternoon and we were told that we would have to wait 3 hours for a room. We found the Front Desk Staff very cold and unfriendly. We went to the Pool which was quite nice and had lunch. The Waiter told us that he couldn't believe they were making us wait because the Hotel was less than 1/2 full. Then we realized why. Since we had booked our Hotel on Priceline, the Front Desk was determined to give us the worst room in the Hotel. We went back to the desk several times and asked for different rooms and we were treated with snide remarks about having "booked on Priceline so what do you expect". We offered to pay more for an upgraded room and were told they were full. We settled for a room overlooking a parking lot. The rooms were very outdated. The bed was uncomfortable and there was a crack in the bathroom mirror. We have done very well booking on Priceline at other Hotels. I wouldn't hesitate to use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in paradise ....”
Reviews.Author: Christy31069
Reviews.Content: We had booked an ocean view room and on arrival they had problems finding us a room!!! We were told for an extra $50.00 a night they would upgrade us to ocean front. We said no as we had paid quite a lot per night as it was. A room was then found with a very minimal ocean view in the tower. I know you do not go on holidays to sit in your room to look at the view but the for the amount of money paid we expected a bit more. Apart from that the service of the hotel was excellent, a big thumbs up to the valet team who were very helpful with our luggage. Fantastic location and the grounds are magnificent. Would definately stay again but would better research the packages on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Just Don't Stay in Cottages”
Reviews.Author: lenalovestravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently got back from our 4th Anniversary trip in Hawaii. On the second half of our trip, we stayed at this resort in the Garden View Cottages which were awful. There was paint chipping off the walls. There were no windows, only shutters so you could basically hear everything that took place outside. The room was so old that they actually give you "keys" to access your room. My husband and I were so uncomfortable that we ended up going out and purchasing shower shoes. After one night, we transferred to the terrace room which was 100% better. The standard rooms are newer and definitely more clean. I think the resort is great but if you're not an outdoorsy person, I would stay away from the cottages. They even have some oceanfront rooms which are really old and dirty looking too. I would also stay away from those. My only recommendation is the standard terrace room if you want to stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: chyinadoll
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a 10 night stay in Maui and were so happy with our hotel choice!! The hotel is nicely renovated and the staff is very friendly. We purchased the Costco package which included a daily breakfast buffet, 1 dinner cruise, 1 luau, daily valet, and $250 food/beverage credit which came in handy. I'm not sure why people have complained about the breakfast because we didn't have a problem with the hostess nor the food. We did get there before 8AM so the food was fresh and hot. For lunch and dinner we ate in house often because of our food credit and the surprisingly the food is pretty tasty! The service is very "Hawaii" (laid back) and the food is simple. I couldn't get enough of the chicken panini! If you like rich ice cream slip away to the shop on the resort and treat yourself to a vanilla cone. The staff is very friendly and helpful with local food and adventure advice. Every time we used the valet service the guys made us feel so important and remembered our names and what we did the day before. The cleaning crew work very hard and always made the room spotless. They also provide a coconut lime shampoo, conditioner, body wash and soap that is so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Garden rooms well dated..”
Reviews.Author: adrianrelward
Reviews.Content: When we arrived first thing we were offered,,, room in main tower at $100 a night extra.Did not want to be in tower so stuck with what we booked. room 8191 Clean and ok but really an 80s road trip experience..Enough said..Maby we expected more than they had to offer or were willing to offer..Whalers village center 10 mins walk away is good for food and drink..Sort out the happy hours or dig deep in the pocket..make sure you are aware whats in the happy hour.. Was ok but not what we hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Costco package”
Reviews.Author: BigRaoul
Reviews.Content: Costco had a great package for the Resort. We got a rental car, luau, dinner cruise on a catarman, $250 for meals, valet parking, two mai tais daily, breakfast buffet. The package was for 6 nights, we added three more nights and extended to ten days. The resort was located at the end of all the other resorts. The beach was not overcrowded. The food was great. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a choice of fruit, cereals, pastries, juices, eggs, bacon, two sausages, omelets, excellent. The staff was friendly, except for upper management, who would walk by and not even say hello. The dinner cruise was with a buffet, sunset, and a great view of the beaches. Saw some divers on some rocks, even got mooned by one. Barefoot bar was convenient after being on the beach. Great snorkeling by the resort, saw turtles swim by. Luau had great entertainment. Would do it again. We had a delux oceanview room on the top floor with a view of the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, except for the garden rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: joan l
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Hawaii in April this year, with my mum and aunt. Overall, the hotel was very nice, the facilities available were all good, and it is within easy reach of other amenities, such as restaurants and shops. However, I would STRONGLY recommend that you book a room in the tower before you go, as we were in the garden rooms, which were very disappointing. Upon arrival, we went to the reception to see if we were able to move into a room in the tower, however, an upgrade was very pricey and the women on reception were not very helpful, so they weren't particularly bothered when we were querying this. A little later we decided to go back and politely asked for the upgrade, but the last room had been gone and another wouldn't have been available for four days, and we were leaving then, so just had to put up with it. Being British, we do not like to complain, but on reflection, we really should have, as this was meant to be a very good hotel. All the communication made with reception staff was conducted politely on our behalf, and yet they were still very unhelpful and blase. The problem with the garden rooms were that they were VERY outdated, and generally quite dull. The bathroom was very basic, and again, outdated, in dire need of a makeover! Also, I wouldn't feel very safe staying in these rooms if I were travelling alone, as they were completely separate from the main building and involved walking through gardens (as the room name suggests) in the night. Also, the safe in the room failed to work on a number of occassions, and we had to call someone out to keep fixing it (he was very nice though!). Finally, the hospitality room given to us to use on the day of departure was disgraceful. I know that hotels don't have to provide it, and especially not a top room, however, the towels had been used, and there were no fresh ones or toiletries. My mum politely asked for clean towels, to which the women at reception were completely blase about this, and didn't even apologise! Overall, the reception staff need a lesson in people skills, as they ae letting down the hotel! The room situation and reception staff were the only downfalls, however, this did put a dampener on our overall stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: N N
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4 day stay at the Royal Lahaina. The location is excellent, right on the beach. And the rooms are great - very modern in the tower. We booked a garden room and were upgraded to a partial ocean view for free. Easy beach access, close to great snorkeling and surfing, and a great tennis club. Be sure to get the $16/ day special for parking and 2 mai tais. Also request a room in the tower - it's been recently renovated. Many reviews talk about the pools. The pools here are small but fine for a dip. Why swim in a pool when one of the world's most beautiful beaches is steps away?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: EricaJerm
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very friendly and helpful in this hotel. We island hopped and this was by far our FAVORITE spot!! Exactly what we wanted when we thought of Hawaii!! GREAT place for our honeymoon!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Yearly Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Marina326
Reviews.Content: We just got back this morning from 2 weeks at the Royal Lahaina. I give top marks to Andrea (the server for the pool area), and to the front desk crew. I give low marks to the restaurant for the slow service and mediocre food. But there are tons of places close by to eat so it's no big deal to skip this place. Most of the valets are awesome - Wayne, not so much (I asked for somebody to come to our room when we were checking out to get our bags. It took him forever to get there, he showed up with a pretty poor attitude, and disappeared when we got to the lobby. We ended up loading our own bags into our car. Silver lining: the $20 tip went right back into my pocket!) Housekeeping does a great job and Tupopo (sp?),the "guard" at the entrance is so welcoming and warm. He always greeted us with a big "Welcome Home!" when we came back to the hotel. It's a little thing, but it made us smile. Guest Services is incredibly helpful and the employees (especially Conception!) at the Royal Scoop are awesome. The best spot to stay (in my opinion) is the Tower on the Molokai side. There are weddings in the courtyard of the resort almost every day. Royal Lahaina has a wedding center and they do a GREAT job. The beds are super comfortable and the blackout wooden slider blinds keep the room nice and dark until you're ready to wake up. I definitely recommend staying here. Oh - and don't be shy about asking if they are willing to upgrade your room. It's a rarity when they won't (for no charge). Especially for returning guests.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BaileyMonroe
Reviews.Content: The lobby is very quaint and welcoming, the rooms are beautiful and updated bathrooms are very nice as well. The restaurant was great, though we did pay more for breakfast than we did for dinner-seemed a bit strange. Staff was very welcoming and we enjoyed working with the Pleasant Holidays desk to coordinate activities. We liked the two pools and outdoor bar, but wish the pool bar stayed open later. The one pool is a little awkward since it's right by the main dining area, but you can either ignore it or just not swim during busy dining times. It would be nice if there was more than one computer available for guest use, or free wi-fi in the rooms. The beach is wonderful and sunsets are gorgeous from this resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great sence of Aloha spirit from check-in to check out.”
Reviews.Author: ccstamper
Reviews.Content: We booked the Aloha garden package consisting of a garden view room - car- buffet, and found when we arrived we had been upgraded to an ocean tower room after telling them it was our first trip together to Maui! The room was large and beautifully decorated, included basic toiletries, coffee maker with tea and coffee replenished every day, hair dryer, fridge, and in-room safe and iron/ironing board. Plenty of towels in room, and bedding was changed every day. The breakfast buffet was extravagant and plentiful, no matter what time we arrived to eat, with plenty of eggs, meats, fruits, pastries, pancakes, waffles, etc to choose from. Service was relaxed and friendly, and we were greeted by name by the end of the week! Hotel pools (three to choose from!) and grounds were kept immaculately clean, and everywhere we went we were greeted by friendly staff and a smile. We will definitely be staying at the Royal Lahaina on our next trip to Maui! One thing to mention in case you are like us and don't use a credit card - if you only have a debit card, they will charge the full weeks room charge up front, as well as $50.00 per day for incidentals. (any incidental amount not used is credited back to you upon checkout by your choice of cash or refund on your debit card). That was fine by us, as we had the full amount of our vacation in our bank account, but if you aren't expecting that, it can be a bit jarring to hear.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: SKDas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the resort between 1st - 7th Sep 2011 on Costco 6 nights package. It's indeed a wonderful resort and from the very first moment we were treated like royal guests. We had valet parking so never have to worry about searching & remembering a parking spot. The free Luau , Sunset ruise & 2 Mai Tais everyday which was included in our package really added the luxuary of stay. I have absolutely no complaints over the staff as other have commented , infact they were really friendly and very very supportive. Breakfast was good but same everyday , so at the end of the trip it was boaring. We had 250 Dollars food creadit which we utilized pimary for dinner. It was Ok & very reasonably priced. Regarding the room it was clean but had some problems with the housekeeping. Housekeeping is little lousy and doenot restore you room completely everyday instead just cleans the toilet. Need to improve in this area. Another issue was i had a baby & so asked for a microwave but they couldnot help me. It was a little rude from there part as they were offering to sell suites to me which has microwaves. If Hotel Management is reading this review then i want to make a statement here that " I did not ask it for my pleasue but i needed it for my 1 year old baby" My Tips - Always book tower rooms and try to get rooms on higher floors. Also never spend extra mony on Oceanfron Room as they become really Dark during night and you cannot see anything. Overall stay was good but will think twice before returning just because of the Microwave issue i had

Reviews.Title: “After Reading TA Reviews, Thought Royal Lahaina was right for us.”
Reviews.Author: tennis105
Reviews.Content: After reading about many of the Ka'anapali/Lahaina resorts, we decided that Royal Lahaina actually had the most activities and conveniences for a family with 2 teens. When we were checking in, we asked for a room with the least possibility of mold. My teen is allergic to mold (and a host of other things). We were given a 2 queen on the 11th floor of the tower, looking over the golf course toward the ocean. Really lovely. We were able to let the kids eat where they wanted (sign charges to the room) from the bar, restaurant, ice cream shop or convenience store. The prices and selection were good. Not Costco prices but considering the time and hassle it saved us, priced just right. Sandwiches were just under $6.00 and a small bottle of water, $1.00. Though the pools are small, they were not crowded. The beach was easy to walk onto and walk off of (foot and body showers located in all the convenient locations). The beach there is really good for snorkeling, swimming and jumping waves. Early morning and late afternoon strolls are pleasant. The sand is clean and fine. The jet ski rental is down at the Sheraton, a little walk away and the dinner cruises leave from this beach. Room was actually very well designed for space (for 4 people). We did not feel cramped and there was a place for everything. Loved the Hawaiian boat decorating theme and the quality of the sliding slat-shade doors and cabinetry. The only part of our stay that was a negative was that the shower glass doors did not seal completely, allowing water to accumulate on the floor. We used up a lot of our towels keeping the floor dry at the shower door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property, Great location”
Reviews.Author: ebeamish
Reviews.Content: We honeymooned on Maui and stayed at the Royal Lahaina. We really enjoyed our room as it was recently remodelled and quite nice. Had everything we needed as we were mostly eating out. We found the pool to be adequate for the odd cool off and tanning time as we were mostly out snokeling at beaches around the island and checking out the sites. The Restaurant is where they lose a notch as it was expensive, the food quality didn't match the prices in our opinion. There was a great breakfast/lunch place at Fairway shops that we wish we had found on our first day not our 2nd to last. We went to the luau at the resort along with over 300 others! it was definatley created for maximum crowds but they put on a good show and we felt satisfied walking out. All in all, we would probably stay here again as we like the hotel feel with the resort amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort (slighty marred by bad check-in experience)”
Reviews.Author: txgerman1
Reviews.Content: So let me start with this; after spending a few days at a very nice yet very sterile Marriott Resort in Wailea; I was looking forward to the Royal Lahaina for a more authentic Hawaian feel. The lenghty cab ride between properties was actually a great way to see the Shoreline..... and upon driving up to the Royal Lahaina; I definitely had a good feeling about the place. It had a very appealing RETRO look to it; a Resort right out of a Brat Pack movie; or Brady Bunch in Hawaii episode. (I really mean this in a positive way) The resort recently had an expensive remodel and the rooms as a result are quite nicely done. The lobby maintains more of a 1970's feel, but this isnt a bad thing....a simple but beautiful pool, surrounded by nicely manicured grounds boast the most spectacular view I saw anywhere on the island...... So heres the BAD.... check in; quite a hassle. I booked a Partial Ocean View Room, with the expectation of an upgrade to an ocean view. Little did I know when I arrived that the upgraded room to Ocean view, meant that I saw a gimpse of the ocean if I could just try to avoid looking directly at the roof that the room faced. Asked to be moved to a better view; I was actually put into a worse room. Apparently; there are 5 levels of Ocean view; a clever bit of marketing that gets you to have to drop quite a bit more cash in order to get the view you might expect. I travel a lot on business; and generally find that most hotels will do their best to accomondate you if youre polite and friendly..... The polite and friendly approach didnt work on either of the very surly front desk personell I encountered; and finally I had to resort to demanding to see the manager when suddenly a nicer room became unavailable. (they were sold out 5 minutes before that) Annoying; but after 90minutes, the check in fiasco was resolved; and I found myself appreciating this beautiful hotel for its simple yet authentic hawaiian feel. Clean rooms, friendly bar personell, a spectacular view, not far from the quaint (but tourist trappy) town of Lahaina. I would actually stay at this hotel again now that I know what to expect upon check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Hits and misses”
Reviews.Author: wonderland62
Reviews.Content: First of all, they messed up on our reservation, so we had to spend the 1st evening in a room that was not intended to be ours. The cottage rooms are hits or misses, we looked inside one and it had mold growing on the walls next to the AC. Thankfully we got placed into a bedroom tuie on the 2nd floor of the cottages, and it was HUGE!!! The sixe helped since we had a baby with us. The baby was able to sleep in a separate room than us so we're able to have somewhat of a life after she goes to bed. The kitchen was also useful - as Mayu food is very $$, we were able to prepare our own meals a couple of the nights. We ate at the hotel restaurant and I give that place 4 stars, it was good quality, excellent views, great singing and dancing entertainment, and reasonable Maui food price. I would have give this place 4 stars if it wasn't for our reservation mix-up and if it wasn't for the mold growing in one of the rooms we saw. If you have a loud toddler or baby, it is a good idea to spend the extra money on a cottage suite.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good room but lacks amenities”
Reviews.Author: kragca
Reviews.Content: Positives: Though the hotel looks old from the outside, the room itself was really nice (maybe upgraded recently?). They have a shuttle from the hotel to Whaler's Village which is rather convenient. Expedia has a local expert office right next to the hotel which makes activity planning easy. Its not as busy as Lahaina town but not very cut-off either. Negatives: My wife wanted to use the salon/spa, but they did not have any. Room service was rather limiting in terms of the hours that it was available at. The pools were rather small. You have to pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: SurferGirl91155
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are BEAUTIFUL! Located right on the ocean and every room has a lanai! The Luau was one of THE best I've seen in years. Everythig about this hotel exceeded our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Beach but Bad Service, Noisy...”
Reviews.Author: Magali T
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in this resort. When we arrived, we wait 30 minutes for our keyroom. Dom at the reception was the 1st unpleasant hawaiian we met. What a surprise when just landed in Maui! Our room was frontview but located in the oldest building and close to the restaurant with music and dancing every evening. And what about Briann, the most useless concierge: unable to understand that everybody doesn't know where and how to go to Lahaina centre! So the service should be improved and the conditioning system should be modernised! It is so noisy. The place is really nice but not enjoyable because of some employees and old infrastructures.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Don224
Reviews.Content: We were in Maui for a wedding and this is where we stayed. We loved it! The Resort is beautiful and the service was great. We loved the sunsets on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lpark0805
Reviews.Content: We had a 4th floor partial ocean view room. It had a very nice view for the price we paid for the room. The valet staff were wonderful! They were helpful and made us feel very welcome. The pool area is small but still very pretty and relaxing. The beach is the best part! The sunsets are gorgeous from this location. The hotel has lounge chairs that are very comfortable and they turn them all facing the beach at sunset so you can enjoy the beautiful sunset but not actually be down on the beach. Swimming at the beach was nice as well. The hotel and beach area did not have a lot of children around. It was mainly couples. We ate at the restaurant a few times. The food was reasonably priced.
