The service was good and they made you feel very welcome. We bought our tickets for the luau online at a discount ticket agency prior to the trip. It was a pleasant experience but a little more "commercial" than I was hoping for. It was great after the show being right there at the hotel and not having to deal with parking, etc. Overall this was a great hotel and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel room but stay somewhere else if you want nice pools or a good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: alp1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. We liked the tower room, although we learned the difference between "ocean view" and "ocean FRONT" when we arrived & didn't feel like paying $120 extra per night for what we thought we were getting in the first place. You can see the ocean from our room if you go out on the lanai and lean over the railing. I guess that counts as a view. The view we do have is of the cottages and golf course, which is still nice. At least we're not on the side that has a view of the parking lot. We enjoyed our stay here for the most part. The tower rooms are nice. I've heard the cottages are in need of updating. I was disappointed in the 2 tiny pools and lack of shade around pool areas. They also only have about 20 nice chairs. If you don't get down there early you are stuck with the old vinyl ones or none at all. The hotel is on Ka'anapali beach, which is very pretty. Sunsets are beautiful. The "torchlighting" ceremony at night is cute. The luau was fun. This hotel does feel like Hawaii, and we liked that part. We had a sunset cruise in our package and loved it. Breakfast is another thing entirely ~ If it had not been included in our package, there is no way I would pay $20 per person for it. It is the same exact thing every day, the eggs are disgusting & watery, pre-cooked heat-n-serve sausages, French toast and waffles that sit out all morning, corned beef hash from a can. There are flies everywhere- all over the food. You wait in a line to be seated and the hostess who seats you seems lost half the time. She wanders around while the line grows longer & we're all standing there looking at the empty tables we could be sitting at. It's just really not worth paying extra for. I've had free continental breakfasts that were better. Also- if you rented a car- pay the extra $5/ for valet parking. It's worth it. All in all I enjoyed the stay, the hotel staff was friendly & helpful, the room was nice & clean. I would recommend it, but if you want nice swimming pools or want to eat breakfast at your hotel, you should stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel, Service a little hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: Adrian C
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in the middle of the afternoon around 1400 and were told that the room wasnt ready, not a problem we went to the bar. The hotel demanded that a credit card be given although did not say how much they were holding - this was to become a problem later. The room was a cottage type and we were taken there by buggy from the bell desk, very helpful. The room was basic but from other reviews what we expected. Adjacent was a kitchen, lounge and further bathroom which was a suite part, we hadnt paid for this but checked and were told it was ok. We were woken up the following day by someone demanding it was to be locked, so clearly it wasnt ours. The hotel bar and setting are nice although certain staff could do with a lesson in customer service. The swimming pool and beach are not crowded and a Trolley Bus can take you to the other hotels and Whalers Village. If I were to visit Maui again I would probably go for a hotel rather than a cottage as this felt dated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: tripppingout
Reviews.Content: Make sure you book the Costco package for your trip to the Royal Lahaina (as long as it's still available) - it saves several hundred dollars off the other packages you can book and is well worth purchasing a $50 membership if you are not already a member. You get the breakfast buffet every day ($40 value per couple and a decent breakfast), luau ($120), sunset dinner cruise (at least $100), valet parking ($15 per day), 2 free mai tai's per day and $250 credit at the restaurant/outside bar/coffee shop per week. We actually didn't use our full $250 even though we ate lunch at the restaurant 3 times and took sandwiches from the coffee shop the rest of the time as we were out and about. The prices for the drinks/food are no more than in any of the restaurants, so it's not like you are paying more just because you have that credit. We loved the resort - the small pool space means that there are very few kids around - great for couples travelling on your own. The room was great - recently refurbished and with a great view of the ocean and surrounding area - being on the 11th floor certainly helped. The valet parking was fantastic - we never waited more than a few minutes for our car even at busy times of the day. The location also worked out well for us - we enjoy snorkelling and on our first day we saw 4 eagle rays at black rock, just a few minutes swim from the beach in front of the hotel. We took a snorkelling/sailing trip to Molokini with Paragon - the only company who actually sail - others tell you "some sailing" which means they put up a small sail whilst still using engine power. Paragon has a smaller catamaran and on the way back they actually put up both sails and turn off the power - which was a wonderful way to get back to the harbor. They had a great location at Molokini and it was much nicer to snorkel with only 30 people vs the big circus you see off the larger boats - and they don't make you wear a flotation device or stay near the boat - much better for experienced snorkellers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great beach...shame about the pool!”
Reviews.Author: NWLondonHoneymooners
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Lahaina in August. The hotel is set on a great stretch of beach and well located for Lahaina town and nearby resorts. Rooms were very nice, modern and you could see they were recently refurbished and the overall service at the hotel was very good. If you are a beach person then its great (as arguably their stretch of beach is one of the nicest in the area) however if you like to sit by the pool, you'll be very disappointed for the cost of the hotel what you get. The pool is small, no shade anywhere and limited chair space so we were very disappointed when we saw it. That said if you like to sit on the beach, want a nice room, decent location, good service and don't care about a pool then you'll be fine with the Royal Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort and nice cottages”
Reviews.Author: Parismyfav
Reviews.Content: Aloha! Located in West Maui, it is right on the Kaanaapali Beach with other amazing beaches (Flemming, Naapili, Kapalua) in close vicinity. The old HI capital of Lahaina is very close and offers an excellent small downtown by the sea. The resort grounds are beautiful with lots of different activities for the whole family. We stayed in the cottage area. While the rooms are neat and tidy, the cottages seem old (bathrooms, refrigerator, small AC, bed and matteresses can all use an upgrade) as compared to the tower rooms. No microwave in our single room cottage - a negative made up for by a large patio opening on the lush green lawn and flowering trees.... Overall, Maui was awesome, resort was very nice, the cottage room can use an uplift...Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Cant wait to return”
Reviews.Author: mhistmajor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for 2 weeks and from the beginning I saw I made the right choice. Now I saw some of the negitive reviews but I found most to be untrue but what I did find to be true was that the breakfast buffet was overpriced for what was offered. I would expect an omlette station and smoked fish to be offered. For Breakfast check out Lulu's at the cannary mall near safeway. Everything else was excellent.I was offered an upgrade for 125 a night when I checked in. I took it and what a deal it was. I had a top of the line oceanfront suite with wrap around terrace and still paid 375 less then the actual room rate. Now as to the review which addresses upgrades for free for some and not for others. This was solved by simply asking when offered the upgrade why its not a free offer as some are. The answer made perfect sense. The lower end rooms of the hotel are sold out whith just some suites remaining. So put a guest in there from the lower end room for a small fee because you wont sell it for the full price and now u have a lower end room to re sell. At slower times if available the hotel is happy to upgrade. The property was right on the beach and the hotel will work out a deal on a weekly chair rental but you have to ask can you do better then that. The staff was attentive and friendly. My hats off to the valet staff. These are the guys who know where to go and how to get there. They were unbiased and 10 times out of 10 every resturant recommended was great. The Italian resturant on property is actually quite good and we enjoyed the atmosphere as well. I cant wait to go back. Planning Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Got married at the Royal Lahaina and it was the best decision we ever made!”
Reviews.Author: Maribeth B
Reviews.Content: For all of you brides searching for the perfect hotel for a destination wedding, I would highly recommened the Royal Lahaina. Amy my wedding coordinator did a fantastic job from the begining to the end. She was very efficient and easy going. I was little worried planning a destination wedding expecially not seeing everything upfront but Amy and her crew did an incredible job from the center pieces, my bouquet, flowers, and cake. It was everything i envision but even better. It was a bummer though that our photographer couldnt step foot on the beach to take sunset photos because of the law that just passed and he just took shots from the lawn which all worked out well. Our wedding party was 25 people total and i love having the plated dinner. It was very intimate and were treated like kings. The dinner which consist of prim rib, lemon caper chicken, and mahi mahi. My husband and I had the prime rib and it was cooked to perfection. Everyone else absolutely loved their food too and just keep hearing how good the food was overall. We had such a great time here and besides the wedding service the hotel staff provided excellent service as well. The Royal Lahaina seems more hawaiian authenic then the other hotels and the price is reasonable. We wanted a hotel where our family could afford and nothing too extravagant. Our family had the choice to stay in either the tower or cottages. I would recommend the tower, the cottages are a little old and could use some updates but the nice thing about the cottages is your a shortwalk from the beach. Our experience here was definitely memorable and thanks to Amy and her crew our family shared the most memorable memories of our life here! One tip for the bride if you plan on having the ladies wear heels definitely buy heel stopper cause you will definitely sink in the grass! Saw them at Davids bridal for $10 a pair. Must have!

Reviews.Title: “Best time in the BEACH”
Reviews.Author: reyvan86
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth time in Maui. We always have a wonderful time eachtime we visit the island. First time in this hotel itself . It was good value considering the location. The QUALITY of the Beach I would say is its BEST Feature, better than at the Hyatt or the Marriot. The beach was sandy and gradual ,no coral reefs to worry about, WARM water and the waves strong enough to enjoy a relaxing swim even with small kids. BUT if you enjoy the pool this NOT for you....they have 2 TINY pools....but who cares you are in Maui afterall, we paid the money to swim in the ocean!!!! Stayed on the 9th floor in the tower which has been renovated recently. It is otherwise dated with regards to the size of the pool and the cottages. It has an old, native hawaiin feel. And Do not stay at the inn next door which is where they have their courtesy day room for late check outs....realy old and not a good LAST memory of the place. Restaurant is small but adequate. Overall very good for the money specially if you only spend half of your holidaytime around the hotel....While at the island explore Halaekala, Lahaina, Wailea, PAIA, Kaanapali get out of the resort and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great location very poor service and cold pool.”
Reviews.Author: Michael6714
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day stay on Maui. The hotel is in a great beach side location. The room was good value for money with a great see view. On the first night we decided to eat in the hotel. The experience was shocking. We were told to wait for a table to be cleared, there were plenty of tables all with old food and drinks left uncleared. We waited 15 minutes and decided to sit down at one of the tables until it was cleared. The waiter told us we should "not" have done that. The table was cleared 5 minutes later. We were not offered drinks so after another 5 minutes I went to the bar to order. I was told the waiter would bring them down. After another 5 mins The drinks arrived. We ordered starters and main course. The starters arrived 20 mins later. We had just started to eat the starter and the main courses arrived at the same time. The waiter was upset when we asked him to keep it warm in the kitchen. Breakfast was the same...lots of free uncleared tables but a 10 minute wait in the lobby to be sat down. (We ended going to the Sheraton for great breakfast and great service) the pool was cold and there were only a few sun loungers to sit on with no parasol for mid day sun cover. (so get down early or you have no chance of a sun lounger) All in all ok hotel but very poor service that spoilt the stay. Would stay at the Sheraton next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love with this hotel and will go back”
Reviews.Author: DianaB_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort for one week during our stay in Maui for our honeymoon. We were treated like royalties during our stay. Here is a review of all the aspects that made us fall in love with this hotel. Location and view: The resort is directly located on the Kaanapali beach.The beach is literally 10 feet away from the Ocean Terrace Restaurant and the pool. We had a beautiful view of the ocean from our room as well as a view of Lanai and Molokai islands. Size: The Royal Lahaina is the smallest of the resorts located on the Kanaapali strip. It is surrounded by names like the Hyatt and the Sheraton. We chose to stay at the Royal Lahaina because we wanted a local Hawaiian hotel and were not disappointed with our decision. Being smaller than the other resorts, guests do not have to walk 10-15 minutes in order to get to the restaurant, the pool or the beach. Everything is a few steps away. But one must not be fooled by its size, the Royal Lahaina still offered us the luxury and comfort guests expect to get from 4/5-star hotels in Maui but also gave us the feeling of a true hawaiian hotel. Rooms: Our room was very clean and comfortable. We had booked an Ocean View room and were upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean View upon arrival because we were honeymooners. We were on the 12th floor and had an amazing view. Each room has its own private balcony with a few chairs and a table. Food: The resort offers many options for food. Our favorite was the Ocean Terrace Restaurant which was located right off the beach. The service we got at the restaurant was outstanding and the food was delicious. We had purchased the Royal Experience Package which included daily buffet breakfast and a daily 18$ credit per person for dinner at the Ocean Terrace. I highly suggest this package since only a few meals on the menu are valued at more than 18$. There is nightly live music at the restaurant. During our stay, we looked forward to hearing Josh Sumibcay each night on his guitar. He made us fall in love with his music. The buffet breakfast offered a variety of choices to pick from included fresh fruit, eggs, bacon, pancakes, french toast, danishes, cereal and exotic juices. The manager was always there overlooking everything. Price: Having done a lot of hotel shopping in order to find the best place to spend our honeymoon, we found that the Royal Lahaina offered the best price-quality value. We paid much less than we would have if we had stayed at the neighboring resorts. I highly suggest the Royal Experience Package and the Paradise Value Package (which includes daily parking and free Mai Tai's). Service: Everyone working at this hotel was very friendly and helpful. - We had decided to go up the Haleakala volcano to watch the sunrise, and the lady at the reception warned us it will be very cold and lent us blankets which came in very handy! - Also, on our last morning, we had to leave very early to catch the plane. The restaurant manager prepared breakfast boxes to take with us and to eat on our way to the airport. - A stand with fresh and cold pineapple water is always set up at the main entrance of the hotel and is so greatly appreciated on those hot days! If you are looking to stay at a major American chain resort like the Hyatt or the Sheraton, you should avoid the Royal Lahaina. But if you want to get the most out of your stay in Hawaii by trying out a local smaller resort then I highly suggest this one. The Royal Lahaina made us fall in love with Maui and we are already planning our stay next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mutskie4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8 day family vacation in Maui. We picked the Royal Lahaina for its location and value. This is not a 4 or 5 star resort, however it is on the nicest and quietest stretch of Kaanapali beach. The Tower rooms are very well appointed and are big enough. The Kaanapali Trolley also stops here on its way to other resorts, golf course and Whalers Village. The pool area is in need of updating ( we came to Maui to enjoy the beach) We had read the negative reviews about the food and restaurant service. We only ate 1 meal at the hotel, and in was not very good and the wait staff was worse than the food. the valet guys very very friendly and entertaining. Overall I would rate this hotel as good and the location and value as very good!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the resort!”
Reviews.Author: Polly B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this resort thru Costco. We were exceptionally pleased with the package. The hotel is beautiful and our room was wonderful. The package included a dinner sail and a luau which were both extrodinary. The breakfast buffet was also included and was delicious. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant and helpful. We couldn't have been more pleased with the resort, rental car, etc. What a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, the view from our balcony looked like a postcard!!”
Reviews.Author: joedigrazia
Reviews.Content: We walked into our room and the first thing I noticed was that the sliding glass door to the balcony was so clean that I thought it was open. The view of the beach, the palm trees, and the distant island of Lanai on the horizon, looked like a postcard!!! The room had a South Seas flavor, with a nice 52" tv, huge beds, and plenty of room to unpack all our stuff. The beach area also has little cottages and a pool. The staff was great and friendly and there is a free trolly to "Whaler's Village", where you can shop or get a bite to eat. On another day we took the bus in front of "Whaler's Village" to the town of Lahaina which was once an old whaling town. The Royal Lahaina did not disappoint us. The location, staff, and service were top notch!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for snorkeling, excursions and more”
Reviews.Author: MBatz
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, not too big, not too small. We had to learn that "Ocean View" only means 50% ocean view. Then there is 70% Ocean View, full Ocean View and Garden View. The travel agent did NOT tell us all that. After some complaining at hotel check-in we got 70% Ocean View on the 11th floor and LOVED IT. Beautiful beach and ideal snorkeling conditions right outside. We not once used their pool but loved the ocean instead. Kaanapali Beach offers a board walk that goes along the various hotels for a couple of miles; great for long walks or jogging. Other option is to walk in the sand along the beach - really great. Easy to walk from this hotel to Whalers Village with shopping & restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel Depends What You Are Looking For”
Reviews.Author: JTTravels4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Royal Lahaina at the end of July 2011. This hotel is sufficient....it just depends on what you are looking for out of your vacation and your hotel. To us, this definitely wasn't a place we would want to stay at all day and relax. However, we didn't go to Maui to just sit by the beach so it was fine for us as a place to sleep at night. We did read the reviews prior to selecting this hotel. I would agree with some of the more recent reviews (that weren't posted when we booked) and if I had seen those reviews we would NOT have stayed here. Based on reviews, we called the day before we left to "secure" a room in the tower as we were arriving late in the evening and didn't want a problem. The room was ocean view on the 7th floor. Room was adequate and clean. The beds were comfortable (which is always a plus). We stayed 7 nights. It seemed that although bed linens were changed the room wasn't very clean by the end of our stay. The staff definitely does NOT clean the deck or the furniture out there so beware of putting any food you want to eat on the little table. I agree with another reviewer and would not list this hotel as a "resort". The two pools are very small and cold and as many other reviewers mentioned, there is not enough seating and what they have is broken and uncomfortable. There is not any poolside food service. There is a restaurant and small bar area not far away from the pool where you can go and get food and bring it back to your seat. Not that this is a problem but people should be aware in case they want that level of service. Wasn't an issue for us as we were out everyday at the beautiful beaches on the island but would be a problem for someone that wanted to hang out poolside. We had a $250.00 credit for food. We were so excited thinking we would have some great meals with seafood, but unfortunately for us, the food was just "O.K". True that we have great restaurants near our home so maybe our taste buds are spoiled?? Things like the burger, sliders, fries etc are a safe bet but anything outside of the "bar" food just wasn't very good. Same with drinks....not great quality. Out on the island there are much better choices (in Pa'ia- The Fish Market is great...so is the gelato place there). So, if you are out and about, don't rush back!! Finally, the staff. As a few others have mentioned be prepared for many rude people that will not go out of their way to help you or if they do, the look on their face says it all!! We had no idea the staff was like this and we were totally unprepared. After talking with a few other guests at the hotel and a server in the bar area, it seems many people are having the same experience. We primarily encountered this with the front desk staff. That being said, the valet guys were great! We would not visit this hotel again. This was our fist time on the island. It was fine for the vacation we had planned this time around however, if we had known, there are many other beautiful and amazing places to stay. The Kapalua area is beautiful and South Maui seemed to have several great resorts with great pools etc.

Reviews.Title: “So friendly!”
Reviews.Author: ion-horia
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great service, beautiful grounds. Clean and hospitable, a perfect location with great views.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Cammy044
Reviews.Content: We bought a package via Costco and we enjoyed our stay. We stayed in the renovated tower in a King size room with a partial ocean view. The room was tastefully decorated, comfortable and clean! The pools were small and crowded and we chose not to use them. However the gorgeous beach more than made up for that! We also noticed it was much more quiet and less populated than the other resorts on Kaanapali Beach and we enjoyed several romantic strolls along the shore. Our package included daily breakfast and a $250 food credit in the hotel restaurant. I was a little nervous about the food given other reviews, but we found the breakfast buffet to be quite adequate and we also enjoyed several dinners. The food was very good and the wait staff were quite attentive and polite. There are a few areas that could be improved upon. First of all, although the rooms were quite clean, the daily housekeeping was spotty. We had to call the front desk for washcloths and towels 3 times because they left us either none or only one or two. On one occasion, we had to wait well over an hour for some washcloths. I suspect they ran out and had to wash some! There were a few times when hotel staff did not seem as attentive or responsive as they could have been but they were quite busy and perhaps a bit frazzled. Finally, I have read other reviews which mention the fire alarm going off in the middle of the night. This happened to us on our first night and I have to say it scared the heck out of me! Especially when we were making our way down a hot, crowded staircase and stopped moving around the 7th floor. We were not given any type of apology or explanation and thankfully it didn't happen again but I admit it did make me nervous and I had difficulty sleeping for a few nights afterwards. Despite a few drawbacks we enjoyed our stay would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “My birthday present to me!”
Reviews.Author: marieglodt
Reviews.Content: Aloha from Maui, Being a resident of Maui it makes it easy for me to hop in my car and be to one of the hotels in less than an hour. For my birthday last month I decided to splure a little and do a "staycation" and spend the weekend at the Royal Lahaina. I had a lovely weekend enjoying the ocean front room at the Royal Lahaina, the luau, and breakfast buffet, plus walking the hiking trails in Kapalua. What I have found is when people have bad things to say on websites like this is because their expectations were not met. In many cases when they book their vacation they go solely on the price of a property. In the case of the Royal Lahaina it is NOT a 5 star hotel or even a 4 star hotel and it doesn't market itself as such. It is a moderate property with likewise services and qualities. To expect a moderate property to have a deluxe pool like the Hyatt or a luxury property like the Fairmont Kealani or Grand Wailea is not fair to yourself or the property. The pros of the Royal Lahaina would be the ocean front rooms! If you are looking for an ocean front room you can't get much closer to the water than this property. One of the reason for this is the zoning laws have changed here in Maui since this property was built. Nowadays the hotels have to be set back much further from the water. Okay, I know I probably lost a few of my readers by actually explaining why this is the way it is, but that is the reason why. The parking spots are small and there is no bathtub (shower only with the exception of the suites), but the price is good, the location is wonderful and the staff are friendly. For the money you can't beat the Royal Lahaina if you are looking for a moderate priced hotel in Maui. Marie Glodt Hawaii travel specialist

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Greg58551
Reviews.Content: All of the staff were very helpful and pleasant. The front desk person, Daphne was extremely nice and helpful, she is very professional and a great representative of your resort! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, location and service!”
Reviews.Author: AceTexas
Reviews.Content: What's not to like, these were very memorable moments the RLR is in the Kanapali area very good location. the staff is friendly and helpfull and the service was great, and let alone the view and the beach are first class.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, well located.”
Reviews.Author: Pheenan57
Reviews.Content: Recently went for my daughter's wedding. Stayed on the upper level of cottage C, which was oceanfront. Read a lot of mixed reviews about the cottages so I was a bit concerned. The room was nicer than I expected. We had four people (two adults and two teen age children) and it was very roomy, with two full baths, which was very convenient. This is not the Four Seasons, but it was comfortable and clean and had a full kitchen as well. I loved the ambiance of a casual beach cottage that is literally just steps from the lightly populated beach. The hotel is next to a golf course that is basically right on the ocean, so there seem to be fewer beach going guests per square foot than at other beachfront hotels in the area. This is a real plus in my view. Plus there is good snorkelling at the Black Rock just next to the hotel. The beach sand is nice and the surf was very calm the week we spent there. The hotel restaurant is kind of average. Had the Ahi Tuna sandwich for lunch a couple of times and it was perfectly done and flavorful. The restaurant really seemed more like a lunch place, not a dinner place. The wedding reception for my daughter was in the backyard of Cottage F (which has a small pool, hot tub and waterfall pool) and was very nicely done and the food was much better than the food at the Hotel restaurant in my opinion. The hotel wedding planner did an excellent job and everything ran smoothly. 36 people attended the reception. My daughter and her husband had a beautiful one bedroom oceanfront suite on the ninth floor of the hotel. The furnishings here were excellent top quality furnishings worthy of the Wynn in Las Vegas or a Four Seasons. My twenty something sons stayed in a room that was a garden view regular hotel home. Furnishings were very nice here as well and totally up to date. So my advice is, if you are looking for a modern well furnished hotel room, stay in the Tower. If you want a casual, beachfront ambaince, the oceanfront cottages are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: davinSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Royal Lahaina for 4 nights during our trip to Hawaii. Its a pleasant hotel but some area could be improved. If you are planning to hire a car and stay at this hotel, like many other reviews said, beware when there is an event going on. If the Luau is happening car park will be extremely full. First come first serve basis so even if you are hotel guest, bad luck if there is no car park. Never happened to us, although one night we ended up parking all the way down the end of the car park. The room we were in was quite small, big massive bed, although comfortable, dominates the room and the bathroom is quite tiny too. There is hardly a space to put your suitcases. But the room was clean and nice enough. The most frustrating place for us was the internet. The hotel said they have free wireless internet, but we couldnt connect for the whole 5 days we're in Maui. When we complained the staff either acted surprised or said that there is a problem with the connection, but no assistance was being provided. At one time we even took our laptop down to the reception to get them to connect but this wasnt successful either, then finally we gave up. The Barefoot Bar was a gem, ordering a drink and waiting for the sunset to happen was blissful. The place, although next to the adult pool, was quiet and tranquil. The restaurant Basil Tomato near the main gate entrance also wonderful. We met a fellow aussie, Steve, who is one of the waiter. Very attentive and friendly. The food was fabulous and if you come between 17.00-18.00 you get 50% off all food. Perfect. This hotel is also in walking distance with Whalers Village, although we didnt think its going to be that far (20 mins stroll). The walk is pleasant but the hot sun could be a killer! I think next time when we ever come back to Maui, we will try hotels in Wailea area or another hotel in Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: twingert
Reviews.Content: The room was nice. Wife and I were upgraded to a better view for free, due to our room not being ready. Staff was nice and friendly, But: THE POOL! We have seen bigger pools in peoples backyards. 2 small pools, they were so cold, we couldnt enjoy it . No one would get into the pool, everyone said it was way tooo cold. If you want a lounge chair, you better get up at 6am and reserve one.. We were running at the next available chair. They were old and most were broken anyway. Not enough towels. We were shorted washclothes. They said they had ran out! Had HD tv and Hd channels, but no reception! only a few channels. Rooms were nice and beds were comfy. We werent happy w/ the $70 bill for parking. We were charged $10 a day, they had failed to mention. We stayed in Aug of 2011 and would not ever return!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst place to stay in Maui. Over priced and bad service!”
Reviews.Author: BoxingChamp
Reviews.Content: They don't give you the room you paid for. More rude staff than any hotel I have ever encountered. The beach is okay, but the pool was very small and disappointing. With the kind of money they charge, I would expect better grass and landscaping. A big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been better”
Reviews.Author: alsworks
Reviews.Content: Sadly I believe our hotel experience tainted our vacation in Maui. We had booked our Hawaii vacation on a package tour. I am inclined to feel we were treated with less courtesy and hospitality because we were on a package vacation. Of course it did not help that we rejected our first and second room placement because of the overwhelming smell of mildew. Do not book a cottage room, no doubt they ALL suffer mildew. The front desk agreed to place us in a room (#3) in the tower for one night after which we had to move to room #4, still in the tower. We were adament that we would NOT pay extra from these rooms. Our room #4 was not ready as promised and we had to languish in the lobby waiting and waiting. Rooms #3 and #4 were nice, clean and adequately spacious. If we were to return to Maui, we would not return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: trvlknips
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed at this hotel for their honeymoon 20 years ago and my husband and I visited in July for our honeymoon. The hotel recently made some updates to the tower and the room was beautiful! Very modern and pretty. The only negative was the size of the bathroom - it was a tight squeeze between the toilet and the shower. Everything else was great - we also attended the luau there which was a decent price and lots of fun. I would love to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, horrible bungalow type rooms”
Reviews.Author: VioletaMartin
Reviews.Content: We spent there 3 nights. We were put in a bungalow type of room the fisrt night. We were in a very good mood as it was our honeymoon and were just after having a great time in Honolulu but after few monutes in the room I had to go back to reception and demand to be moved to another room (first time in my life I do something like that after been on holidays in more than 20 different countries...) The bungalow was more like a summer camp type accomodation (old, extremly basic, incredible cheap and ugly furniture) for teenagers than a $200 honeymoon accomodation. When in reception complaining they try to upsell us a higher category room. I denied and then they told us that we could move in into one of the rooms in the main hotel tower but only for the 2nd and 3rd nights. I find INSULTING that they made us pay 200 dollars for the first night in that summer camp crappy room, That was the kind of place I stayed when I was an student and backpacking with friends. The actual rooms in the main hotel tower are nice and completely renovated, still I wont be recommending the hotel to anybody, I just find unprofessional that they are actually charging people for some of the rooms which are not up to a minimun standard. The beach of the hotel is very nice and quite. Hotel is a drive from Lahaina. If back in the island I would stay in a hotel in the actual village of Lahain where the nice restaurants and shops are. If you are looking for more peacefull time once if this resorts may suit you better. The hotel restaurant looked cheap in decoration and service we only had lunch there the first day. Lahaina village has really excellent restaurants for the same price. Loved Lahain and the Maui (we rented a car and travel around the whole island) but the hotel was the lowlight of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best beaches in Kaanapali to play on.”
Reviews.Author: TerryDivyak
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in six months to the Royal Lahaina and though it is not one of the more expensive hotels with perfect amenities, this offers a wonderful spot to vacation. Being that it's close to Black Rock for excellent snorkeling and walking distance to Whalers Village, it's the perfect spot for a family or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: timberowl
Reviews.Content: I actually went here in June 2010, during my R&R in the middle of my deployment to Iraq. It's a beautiful resort, in a gated community where they verify your name on the way in so that random people don't come and use the private beach, amenities, etc. The back, where the cottages are, was beautifully manicured. My first morning here, I woke up to the sound of the ocean, and the wind going through the palm trees, and tropical birds singing outside my balcony. The private beach was awesome. It was so quiet and spacious, not like the public ones. When I told the person at the gear rental shack that I was active duty military, he gave me free snorkel gear for the whole week, and told me all the best places to go to see tropical fish. There's an Expedia office right downstairs--connected to the hotel, so you can just walk in and say "I'm bored, what is there to do today?" and they can hook you up with discounted zip-lining, para-sailing, skydiving, kayaking, dolphin watching, snorkeling, luaus, and tons of other things. The continental breakfast was a bit of a rip off. $20 per person. It's all you can eat, but since the area is integrated with the outdoors, there's nothing to keep the fruit flies from swarming over the buffet or birds from swooping down and eating your food the moment your back is turned. I had birds eat my food every time I got up for more juice. Also, $10/day for parking. Also, $10/day for wireless internet, which is run through a third party, and receives an extremely weak signal throughout most of the hotel. Calls to the front desk yielded nothing, because the service was not run through the hotel. For those of you asking "why would you go to Hawaii and worry about the internet anyway?" I was enrolled in online courses. There is no valet laundry service, at least not that I saw. There's a laundry room in the next building over, which required quite a bit of a hike. Whaler's Village is a great outdoor mall, and about a mile walk along sidewalks from the resort with a view of the ocean the entire way--I went there a few times. They have dozens of shops and a few nice restaurants, including the Hula Bar and Grill--a casual outdoor bar and grill with live music.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at the Royal Lahaina Resort”
Reviews.Author: Daveene
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to be able to go to the Royal Lahaina Resort for our Honeymoon for 1 week. It served us well as our "base" of adventures on the island of Maui. After reading and reading other reviews we were a bit unsure on this one. But we're happy to tell you that after the very pleasant check in upon arrival where we greeted by happy and energetic staff we feel we couldn't of stayed at a better place for our adventurous travels! After a very smooth flight we took the shuttle to the rental car offices where we picked up our car that was included in our "Royal Experience" package. With neither of us being in Maui before we took our time and took in a few sights before heading to the resort. We called the front desk to make sure that a later check in woud be okay. We were greeted with a friendy voice who reassured us that it would not be a problem. Finally arriving at the resort we were again greeted by very welcoming and friendly staff. (After reading several reviews we were a bit curious about this experience and were grateful for the nice woman who checked us in. Even offering us pineapple water). She then told us congratulations and offered us an upgrade without us prompting. We left to go take a look at our "upgrade" and was pleasantly surprised at the view the room offered. An ocean view that we knew we would be very happy with! Sunsets from here were amazing as well as a few sunrises that we watched from the balcony. It was a lot of fun that first night to take a stroll on the sandy beach that is just steps away! Before we left the room a "Welcome" bottle of champagne was there waiting and we took that down to the beach with us and consumed it while walking under the stars planning our vacation. We are somewhat adventurous in our travels not staying at the resorts/hotels for much of the day. Using them more as a base and a place to sleep. However on this trip we found ourselves more at ease and taking full advantage of the amenities offered at this resort. Our package also included breakfast every morning and we found ourselves enjoying this quite a bit as it served as a great base to last until dinner. Our package also included their luau and a sunset dinner cruise! Both were what we expected and feel that it was of good value. We met a lot of good people at both and it was nice to run into them at times the rest of the week. The pools were very nice looking however when we're this close to the beach we find ourselves not staying pool side. Snorkeling on this side of the island was very good to us! In fact probably the best snorkeling either of us has ever done! Just a short walk north on the beach is some of the best corral and fish! No need to waste time driving all over the island. It's right out the front door. Another thing that we were curious about was the parking. Again after reading several reviews we were expecting the worst and again it feels good to report that yes at times the parking is full but NEVER did we find a time where we couldn't park. And if there was any walking done it was welcomed after spending a few hours in the car driving particularily after "The Road to Hana". Our package also included a "drink" of the day at the bar and they make them right at this place. It was nice to walk up to the bar and have a nice, cold drink waiting. The bartenders are great and treat you like you are best friends. All in all we ended up being very comfortable and happy with picking the Royal Lahaina. There are several places one can choose from when traveling to Maui so reading the reviews here on Trip Advisor helps big time. They do help in providing good information that can assist in your decision. So if your looking for a great place where you can take your hat off and relax for a good value then you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but would probably stay elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: bol246
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina when we vacationed to Maui in April 2011. We stayed in the tower and had a room with a partial ocean view. Parts of the hotel were beginning to show it's age, although our room was super nice and looked newly renovated. The staff was very friendly. The pool is not impressive - small and plain. There is a pool bar which was not usually crowded. The beach was not crowded - and it was huge - and gorgeous. Would have been nice to have beach chairs or rentals. The grounds of the hotel were well-kept. The Luau at the hotel was well worth the $150 for 2 people. We drove to Wailea (45 minutes away) and the Road to Hana (few hours away) - both trips are well worth it! We also walked to the Sheraton hotel to snorkel at Black Rock - this hotel was amazing and we would definitely stay there next time if we stayed in Lahaina again. When I spend so much money on a flight to Hawaii (from where we live flights are $1,000) I want to stay in a nice hotel when I get there. Royal Lahaina was inexpensive - but very basic and plain. Location is good but that's pretty much it. All Hawaiin beaches are public so you can walk to ANY beach you want! Maui is beautiful and we are looking forward to visiting the island again - but staying at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “ALMOST PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: jstking
Reviews.Content: Attended a family wedding. After travel to many places, this might be one of the best hotels we ever stayed at. Right on a beautiful beach. Great for morning walks in the tide water or jogging. Two nice pools. Fairly priced drinks and food. Good service. Sunsets to die for. One negative: no jacuzzi spa. Maui is fun if you don't mind an extensive tourist infrastructure. While tacky, always enjoy stolling Old Lahina, which is about 5 mile away, but very accessible by car or city bus. Mai Tai any one?? JK

Reviews.Title: “Regardless of the negative reviews you read...I'm picky, travel a lot and loved this place so did the family and friends.”
Reviews.Author: Bperkins76
Reviews.Content: We did the costco package upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room prior to travel. Checked in noticed a beer and a bottle of wine in the fridge. Rated a 4 on cleaning as this should have been caught, but we enjoyed them nonetheless. The view was incredible, we were beach side opposed to golf course side. The room was well kept and furnished beautifully. The pool area was clean, and big enough, we are not huge pool people considering the beach was a stones throw away. Speaking of the beach, awesome. Quiet, not crowded, and calm enough to paddle board on in the am, or body surf/boogie board in the afternoon. There were 11 tennis courts, we don't play tennis but it made us want to. One was like a stadium! The restaurant was delicious, reasonably priced and good service. I should say we are not one to need a best friend in a server so all we care about is hot food hot, cold food cold. We had our friends with us for the friendship part. The luau, endless mai tais or basic bar drinks, if you cant enjoy a luau under those circumstances stay in your room. We valet parked and from what I read this is the easiest option. It also happened to be included in our package. All in all we are cruisers at heart, but after staying at the Royal Lahaina we may be going backto Hawaii sooner than our next cruise. Where will we stay you ask...The Royal Lahaina!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Calgariancouple
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina was the perfect hotel for us. We stayed in the main tower. Our room was facing the ocean. The grounds were well kept. There is a golf course on site. The beach was beautiful and very clean. While there we also took a peek in the little cottages on site and they would be great if you need a kitchen. They are very spacious and would be perfect for people with children or large families. Location for this hotel is great too! We enjoyed everything here and the restaurant on site was not too pricey! If you can - drive the road to Hana, it's about the drive not the destination. It's fantastic

Reviews.Title: “50th Anniversary Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Guitpicker
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Royal Lahaina since our first visit in 1988. We had a great ocean view on the golf course side of the 9th floor. This side of the hotel is protected better from the trade-winds that seem to blow constantly from the northeast. So, you can actually sit on the balcony and not get blown away. When we checked in I mentioned that it was our 50th anniversary and was hoping that they might upgrade us to an oceanfront room. No such luck. However, she did offer us a complimentary bottle of champaign. Since we don't care for champaign, I asked for a bottle of wine, and that was not available. So, she offered a bottle of mineral water which I said would be o.k. Later that day they brought us a bottle of champaign which we left in the room for the housekeeper. Hope she enjoyed it. Our only room complaints were with the bathroom which lacked of a tub/shower and also the dim lighting in the sink & dressing area. You could "almost" see what you were doing while shaving. The only meals we ate at the hotel was at the $20 breakfast buffet. The food selection was great. Their dinner selections are very limited and pricey, so lunch and dinner was in the town of Lahaina. The parking facilities at this hotel are ridiculous. The spaces are so small that it can be very difficult to get your car parked and then you may not be able to open the doors far enough to get in or out. The parking situation is made even worse in the evenings when people from other hotels show up for their luau and show. So, my advice is to get a small rental car that will have a better chance of fitting the parking stall. In spite of the above issues, it is still a great place to stay in Maui. The staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: happygallo
Reviews.Content: We absolutely were amazed with this place, especially considering the price. The beach the property is on is not crowded and is beautiful! Snorkeling at Black Rock was amazing, too. The staff were all really friendly and helpful, and we even got our room upgraded when checking in when they found out it was our anniversary! The atmosphere is relaxed and not uncomfortably hoity-toity! This is Maui! The room was clean and well maintained, as were all of the grounds. The lounge had live music and a hula dancer at night, and we loved sitting outside with a mai tai, and enjoying the ocean and the entertainment! I'm not sure why anyone would give this place less than 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Donmat64
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel right on the beach which is one of the best. Stayed in the tower, small room but nicely decorated, great 'walk in' shower. Staff very good but was a bit put off upon arrival, reception staff tried incestantly to flog us a more expensive room. If we had wanted that we would have booked it with our agent! We had the package which included breakfast, which was very good, a lot of queuing, surely they could come up with a better system!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not quite a resort”
Reviews.Author: JavaAlii
Reviews.Content: This is really should not be classified as a resort. Somewhat old and run down. Though the room was clean. No free internet. Upgraded to a partial ocean view. Great Beach. Poor pool for a resort rating. The resort security at the front of the property is rude and snobby. If I have an option to change hotel after my encounter with the security guard, I would have. But other than that, it was a nice hotel. No match to the Westin, Hyatt or the Sheraton on the west side of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people, nice service”
Reviews.Author: CaptFej
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawaii, so I can't compare it to other Hawaii resorts...but it was a great place to stay. The only complaint is that their website said they had cabanas to rent. When we approached them, they said they don't rent cabanas...and said we should should walk down the beach to one of the other resorts to rent one. Other than that, the staff was great, friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I will always stay here when I go to Maui!”
Reviews.Author: MBMTacoma
Reviews.Content: My family and I love the Royal Lahaina. It's in a fantastic location, the beach is beautiful, the snorkeling is amazing, the small touches are great (pineapple water in the lobby). When we got there, we were invited to upgrade to an oceanfront room in the Tower for only $35 more per night. They were able to put us on the 10th floor and we had a fabulous view! In fact, we saw a pod of spinner dolphins swim by our lanai. When we went snorkeling, we saw a few turtles. There was one turtle that was literally 10 feet off of shore! The staff was great, so not sure why the other reviewers felt they weren't. The only cons: you have to pay for parking (wish they'd change this), Internet is only free for the first hour (not a huge deal, because I have a data plan on my iPhone), pricey food at the on-site restaurant (but this was typical anywhere we ate in Maui), the pineapple water wasn't always available, there was an emergency alert to evacuate our rooms at 5am with no staff to really greet us in the lobby to tell us what was going on, and there were some loud people down by the pool in the middle of the night (we'd never had this issue before, however). Other tips: make sure you eat at Basil Tomatoes! Very good and just a few steps from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and beach but poor staff service; won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Woofin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina June 2011 for our 25th anniversary. There are so many couples there for honeymoons and anniversaries that we quickly realized there was no real special treatment; the complimentary champagne was cheap and required a $10 corkscrew from the gift shop (unless you knew to bring your own in advance), and the anniversary room upgrade turned into a sales pitch in which the check-in clerk repeatedly tried to offer us â€œdealsâ€� (for about $100/day) room upgrades which we declined. Our oceanview room was nice, although the lanai (porch) was small it offered a wonderful view which we thoroughly enjoyed. The hotel restaurant, pools, facilities and beach were all very nice and we do recommend them; the beach is not overly crowded which is wonderful. The only really big negative is in regard to the staff who were really uncaring and pretty much acted like we were just an annoyance being there. Examples: I asked for directions to a snorkel trip and they said they canâ€™t give me directions to it because they donâ€™t book that one. What customer service! I was flabbergasted. Another: I asked to borrow a valet cart for our luggage and they rudely said no, you have to use a valet (so you have to tip them). Another time I asked to borrow a pen and they said â€œbut itâ€™s my last one!â€� to which I responded â€œnevermind.â€� Summary: Decent rooms, some nice views, great beach, but very poor treatment by staff with constant attempts to make you spend more money than planned. Also, we do not recommend the Royal Lahainaâ€™s Luau â€“ it is not very authentic â€“ more like a Vegas imitation of a luau; if you want to enjoy a proper luau go to the Old Lahaina Luau instead.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, friendly staff and amazing location”
Reviews.Author: tonkatruck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for ten days as part of our honeymoon. From start to finish it was incredible. We upgraded to a partial ocean view room (located in the tower) and it was lovely. Beautiful sunrises, lovely, well-appointed rooms. We also opted for the daily valet parking which we felt was well worth the cost: the valet guys were so friendly, very knowledgeable and they anticipated your every need (for example, offering beach towels or boogie boards if you were heading to the beach). More importantly, two mai tais each evening was the great start to the evening. The bar was a great place to watch the most beautiful sunsets on the island. The bar guys were awesome at making mai tais. Food in the restaurant was also really good and we would recommend the salads any day. Each day when you got back to the resort, the concierge at the gate would say, 'welcome home'. I can't think of a better sentiment to sum up our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Mar7_2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina for 2 days and liked the resort location with ocean view. It was close to the Lahaina shopping center and I enjoyed the Luau that the resort has, worth the price entrance.They have a golf course for those who are interested and tennis courts as well. Valet parking was reasonable, $15 a day.. Very clean and comfortable rooms with ocean view. Will love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, not to be confused with the Royal Kona on the Big Island!”
Reviews.Author: DanielJG
Reviews.Content: First trip for my wife and I to Hawaii and Maui was the second leg of our trip (2 nights at the Hilton on Oahu, 3 nights at the Royal Lahaina on Maui and 2 nights on the Big Island). We really enjoyed the Royal Lahaina, nice contemporary room and eventhough our standard mountain view overlooked the parking lot, it was still enjoyable. Great location on Kaanapali Beach. Somehow the Royal Lahaina is associated with the Royal Kona on the Big Island (please do yourself a favor and stay FAR AWAY from the Royal Kona!).

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Cjflower
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a couple nights and loved it. The bed was extremely comfortable (especially when compared to the bed in the vacation rental we stayed in on Kauai) and the room was very clean. We got a free upgrade to an ocean view room upon arrival, which was a nice bonus. The Barefoot Bar was awesome for happy hour. I can't remember the woman bartender's name, but she was a doll. I will definitely go back next time I visit Ka'anapali.

Reviews.Title: “A flawless dream destination wedding”
Reviews.Author: GolferWC
Reviews.Content: We had our destination wedding here and their services was flawless!! Amy and her team are true professionals. At no point leading up to or during the wedding were we stressed. Amy and her teamed handled all aspects of the planning in a knowledgeable and efficient manner. All our guests commented on how effortless and smooth our wedding was. The Royal Lahaina has a phenomenal setting (which makes beautiful photos) and offers great food (the banana and caramel wrapped cheesecake definitely impressed the guests)!! i could not falter any part of their wedding planning service. The Royal Lahaina recommended a few photographers for us to choose from. We chose Peter Thompson to do our wedding photos and the pictures were quite simply stunning. Amy also assigned Trisha Joseph to do my hair and makeup. It turns out, not only does Trisha do bridal hair and make-up, she also does a lot of stars of movies, tv shows and music videos which are filmed in Maui. Trisha is quite frankly, a miracle worker. My point being, even their partners the Royal Lahaina work with are top quality. I would definitely recommend for a destination wedding.

Reviews.Title: “The Paradise Glow wears off Quickly !”
Reviews.Author: WhenPigsFlyShop
Reviews.Content: Nothing eventful the first day and that is how I like it. Check in was quick and we were offered to upgrade to suite for an additional $100 per day. Wow, not in the budget but loved the ocean front room. Staff was friendly enough, men more so than women (women house-keeping very friendly, women behind counters not so much, lady who checked us in was very nice though). Let's chat about the Pros: Great view, right on the ocean, small hotel, easy to get around, weather was amazing, love the ocean breeze, fun sunset dinner cruise, luau was fun Cons: Found out others were upgraded to suite for free and we had to pay, noisy!!!!!! Power washer going at 10:30 at night (we were trying to sleep) pools very small and dated (shut down to get ready for some activity) Nickle and dime you at every level. Beach chair-$10,. covered pool lounge $30, no lounges on beach at all!!!! Bad on that one. Yes, everything is expensive and we knew that before we came. Even ventured out to see if small, local places were cheaper and the are not. Cost of living is very high. Birds all over the buffet (inside). Grossed me out that birds were eating out of the buffet foods! Yes, poo poo!!! The food was not bad, but after seeing that I could not eat the food anymore. The buffet was always the same food types, no changes at all. There was diversity, but again, lost appetite after birds sat in granola..... Ate at Basil Tomatoes first night here (next to hotel within walking distance). Food was very good. Service was fun only problem was we went to go back when we saw big sign that said :50% off all food 5 to 6!!!! Made reservations, confirmed with hotel it included July 4th. Nope, did not. Got there and they started telling people it was not good for that day so most left. Bad form on that one. But we are going back tonight as it is not a holiday. Food was that good! Road to Hana was cut short as daughter got too sick. Great views if you have a strong tummy. Snorkeling is incredible and the water is so clear. Truly sapphire blue waters! Would love to come back, but hope to have a different hotel with the same room!!! The lobby is very dated, and I know they put the money into the rooms, which is fine with me as I do not hang out in the lobby. Internet is $9.95 per day and should be included for free, but there is free wifi at fairway shops if you want to drive there.

Reviews.Title: “A Place to be seen”
Reviews.Author: derekcrewe
Reviews.Content: We arrived 14th June via Las Vegas stayed 10 days, got upgraded as we are Seniors, booked through Virgin Holidays 12 Months in advance, what a great place, anybody not able to enjoy thois Hotel needs to be more forceful. The food was good enough although more variety is needed. we stayed in the Tower room and it was good very clean and serviced daily.we ate in the Hotel most of the time, but did go to Front Street to the Wharf, this is a good place to eat at night and watch all the action, the staff were fantastic. We used valet parking so had no problem parking. I would go again but it is not cheap from the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the cottages....”
Reviews.Author: wndyan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding trip and were pre-warned about the cottages. I decided to go ahead and try it out and was a little disappointed. The bathrooms desperately need a makeover. I was also bothered by 3-4 weddings while I stayed here because my cottage was right behind where the wedding ceremonies are performed (which could get very loud). I guess I didn't get too annoyed because I really only stayed in the room when I was sleeping.There was mold in the shower. My sister stayed in a tower room with a partial ocean view and it was amazing!! The staff was very nice and helpful. I would stay here again but only in the tower rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Royal Lahaina--would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: kjtraveler2008
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip to Maui last minute to meet with vendors for our upcoming wedding. We found the Royal Lahaina through priceline.com and really got a great deal. The hotel was wonderful, rooms were luxe and the beach in front of the hotel is one of the best on Maui. The restaurant in the hotel was delicious but nothing fancy...perfect for mid-day lunch and then back to the beach. The pool is not your typical big resort pool but when you're on vacation in Maui you should be at the beach anyway. There is also a really cute little ice cream shop that had an amazing selection (macadamia nut chocolate). Only negatives- One- since we booked on priceline.com the front desk reception kept telling my fiance that we got a very cheap room (said it more than 4 times) and they wouldn't take any of our preferences or even pretend to care. If you are on the lower floors facing the Sheraton you will have a view of a power plant of sorts. The next day they did move us to the other side and a couple floors up; we loved our room then. Other than that, parking was easy and we could walk to the Sheraton and the Whalers Village easily. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Keefe was AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: JackieRolls
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was pretty much what the people here described: The tower rooms look good; cottage rooms-not so much. We stayed in a cottage and were not disappointed, but we weren't impressed either. It served its purpose. You're on the beach in Maui-the room is for sleeping and showering. Speaking of showering-that coconut stuff-AMAZING. But not as amazing as Keefe. As soon as we checked in, he gave us the royal golf cart tour, carried our massively heavy bags and helped us out w. our bachelorette party planning. I checked in w. him when we were checking out and he remembered us a) and b) remembered where he suggested we go and ask how it all went. This is a no frills hotel with a few people who make the place stand out. But let's be honest-you're on Ka'anapali beach. You have nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach. Lousy Service.”
Reviews.Author: belcorn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Kaanapali Ocean Inn. Stay out of this building. Watch website. Offers newspaper delivery in a package deal but does not honor this building. Waited in line every morning for a self-serve breakfast. Very bad cleaning service. No satisfaction when brought concerns to manager.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Nice People”
Reviews.Author: tjnkriss
Reviews.Content: The room was very well decorated clean and the veiw was nice Had a golf/ ocean view . the bed was absoulutly wonderful cant say enough about it . the staff was ok didnt have and rude comments as previous stated. parking is tough tight spots even for small cars and if you come in when the show is going on tough to find one..overall would stay here again for the price and perks (free sunset cruise and luau breakfast included) quitness in room 1123 all A++ our stay was June 16-21 2011

Reviews.Title: “This was a very happy anniversary”
Reviews.Author: searst2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I reserved 10 days at the Royal Lahaina Resort in Kaanapali. Our room was located in the tower, 12th floor with ocean view facing west. The room was recently updated, very clean, with a king bed, bar fridge, coffee maker, very comfortable beds, bathroom with shower and balcony. The view of the ocean from our room allowed us to see most of the ocean and the island of Molokai with a bit of mountain view to the north. We met another couple at the resort who return regularly stay at this resort. They said they had tried the suites, oceanfront, ocean view rooms and cottages on the property over the years. They prefered the cottages the most. We were invited to look inside the cottage to compare. He said the cottage he was in had been updated, not all cottages have been updated yet. I must say, if we were to go back I would strongly consider one of the updated cottages. It has a small kitchen area with stove top, oven and fridge, an eating area, sitting area, bedroom plus a large outdoor lounge area. Hawaii is very expensive when it comes to eating at restaurants and if you like entertaining this is the route to take. The food and drinks were very good at this resort. Everyday you could hear Hawaiian music playing in the pool area. The beach is very clean with many beautiful snorkeling areas. As soon as you walk into the ocean and dunk your head in the water, you can see bright colored tropical fish. No need to book a snorkeling trip outside of the resort, everything is right here which is one of the reasons we liked it so much. We heard the snorkeling at Black Rock (located at the resort) was not to be missed, I can see why. While snorkeling we saw sea turtles, many fish of different colors and sizes and a nice size reef shark. Others said they saw a manta ray and an octopus. The waves change quickly in Maui so be careful, stay close to shore, if you can't see the beach then you have gone to far. The food at the Luau was delicious particulary the roasted pig. Everyone is given a seashell lai, flower lai's are available inside for $15.00-$20.00 each. Tip: You can make your own lai inside the resort for $5.00. It's a little piece of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “BABY GIRLS CHRISTMAS GIFT”
Reviews.Author: SILLYSISTA
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here in Jan 2011, we had an ocean view tower double everything at this mid priced hotel was fine/perfect. I will stay here again and save a few bucks vs going to the big named hotels $$$$ and use my money to eat,play,and go on tours. For the average person with average income stay here it is really not bad,we had no problems or complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: ldj327
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort for a week. What a great stay. It all started when we arrived to check in. Check in was very fast and all the staff was very very friendly!!! What a joy to step on the balcony to see and smell the ocean. We had a beautiful view from our balcony and enjoyed setting there each morning and evening. The breakfast buffet was very good and the freah fruit was amazing. We enjoyed eating breakfast each morning by the ocean. The time at the beach was great and not to crowded, just wonderful. We enjoyed the sunsets and walking on the beach at night. We were totally pleased with our experience with the Royal Lahaina Resort and it's staff. Thank you for a wonderful time!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsGoldberg
Reviews.Content: WE booked the royal package which gave us a full American breakfast buffet daily. Luau, and dinner cruise. If yo were to pay for all of those things separately it would be a lot of money. The luau was delicious (they had food for picky eaters) and the show as a lot of fun. The breakfast buffet was to die for! Ocean view with anything you could possibly want for breakfast. The cruise was nice the food was okay. I went for my honeymoon and can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by RLR”
Reviews.Author: COCO_CLASSIC
Reviews.Content: I had trouble when rating this hotel because there were parts that were just "average" but the hotel and the room itself were pretty nice so I'd give this a fair 3.5 stars. I'll start with the positives: Staff is friendly and very knowledgable: a young woman at the front desk gave us some really good tips for shopping and she was pretty funny too! The resort is big: I like being able to go around a property and not have to run into the same people over and over again. Lu'au on site: I think it's the Royal Lahaina Lu'au. We didnt go to this one but it seemed pretty popular. Recently renovated rooms: the room was lovely with a big bed, flat screen, sliding wood doors (gorgeous!) leading to the balcony; just lovely woodwork throughout the room. Lemonade/Flavored water in the lobby (gratis!): I found this to be welcoming considering how hot it can be on any given day in Hawai'i. Conveniently located: Right off of the main road, shops located on property, additional shops within walking distance and the Lahaina Cannery Mall within a short 5 min drive. Room was spacious: self explanatory - I like a lot of space in my room. Comfy Bed - Large and plush, just like I like it! Bath products - I absolutely LOVE coconut and its hard to find coconut scented products that arent mixed with other fragrances but Royal Lahaina has it! Negatives: Check-in: even with the front desk fully staffed it took about 15 mins. Maybe I'm overly spoiled by the Marriott but I thought this was a bit excessive. Parking: NIGHTMARE, especially if there's an event going on at the hotel and even worse if the Lu'au is happening too. Valet parking is right in the front and guest self parking is in the back (3 lots - one of which is FAR back). To me it makes more sense for employees to have to go further than guests. Bathroom: I thoroughly confused by how small the shower/toilet area is. I mean it's TINY. 2 people couldnt fit in the shower, there was no tub and maybe about 2-3 feet between the closed shower door and the toilet; VERY odd. Elevators: There were 2 or 3 elevator banks with about 4 elevators in each but they were pretty small so if you factor in people with their luggage, you might end up waiting quite a bit. Thankfully there was a staff member who showed us how close we were to the stairs and since we were only on the 3rd floor, we walked most of the time. I cannot speak to the restaurant, pool or beach since we were only there for one night. All in all, Royal Lahaina was pretty nice, great location and we paid a fair rate so no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Tojoru
Reviews.Content: We booked the Costco package and had an ocean view room. Our balcony had a nice view of the ocean and overlooked the grounds where the sunset weddings took place every evening. The rooms were kept clean and I really liked the coconut toiletries. The breakfast buffet was included in our package and it was very good. Enjoyed quite a few other meals at the restaurant since we had a $250 resort credit. we enjoyed the evening entertainment but it would have been nice to also having Hawaiian music playing throughout the day too. The beach was great and we enjoyed long walks on it. It was a nice walk to Whalers Village. Everyone wwas very friendly except for maybe a few who worked in the restaurant. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Lovely”
Reviews.Author: edhunter49
Reviews.Content: Wow we really found it to be very relaxing and lovely. We loved the grounds the pool the happy hour the friendly staff who did a great job of looking after us. It was our first time in Maui we had an Ocean view room in the hotel. The walk to the Whalers Village was good the walk along the beach was excellent spotting a turtle off the beach. Free pineapple and pineapple water was great the food was excellent better than the restaurants at the Whalers Village better value as well. Not far from Lahaina easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place ver helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: minimumphase
Reviews.Content: Wen there during Christmas so was very busy, but the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were nice and kept clean. My wife lost her id, the staff helped look for it even called to Police at the hotel to get the paper work done. They have two pools a bit on the small size but who need hem when you have the whole ocean 30 feet away. The beach was nice and clean. Not much "wave" activity on this part of the beach though. Will definitely come back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome grounds, great beach, room needed some TLC”
Reviews.Author: samsjake
Reviews.Content: We were in one of the garden villa rooms not the hotel. Good value for discount price. Would not have been happy for 200/nite. Grounds lovely, pool small but clean, towels never ran out, you could walk for miles on the beach which was by the pool (not far at all) the restaruant at the hotel was in or outdoor with ocean view and was great. Prices reasonable which surprised us and it was relaxing and the staff were awesome. very accommodating so we ate there most of the time. The room itself was SAD and dated. small fridge smelled like garlic, the sliding door was almost impossible to open or close. The front door had to be slammed to actually shut it. The locks were poor quality, airconditioner worked but was very noisy and old and yes, a cockroach greeted us on arrival. Only first day though and none further. FOR A GOOD PRICE, WOULD STAY AGAIN BUT WOULD CHECK OUT THE ROOM AND ASK FOR EXCHANGE IF IT HAD ISSUES. Dont do their luau...it was cheesy, expensive and 'free' drinks are a joke.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our trip - once we moved out of the cottages”
Reviews.Author: westleysfamily
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about our stay here except our first night - when we were booked in a cottage. It was outdated, dirty and needed much maintenance. We asked to be transferred to a tower room and they did so on the second day of our stay (they moved all our belongings for us). The tower rooms are clean, cozy and modern. We loved the breakfast, the pools and the location. The staff was outstanding and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We loved our trip and were sad to leave the island with all it's adventure and beauty. We walked through the Sheraton grounds on several occasions and thought the Royal Lahaina was more natural, tranquil and peaceful. I was a little concerned about the hotel after reading negative comments on this website but we were all thrilled with the accommodations, amenities and location.

Reviews.Title: “Left wishing for more”
Reviews.Author: mjrdnx
Reviews.Content: We had only one night in Maui .We checked into the Royal Lahaina Resort and and were given a lovely cottage that was clean and spacious. The a/c leaked and we were immediately moved to the 8th floor of the hotel tower ocean view. The staff was more than accommendating and our server in the restaurant (Caroline) made our one night more that pleasant. Great location, humus and room and we were sorry we had to leave. Plan to return next May and are planning to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Waiters/Poor Cottage Room”
Reviews.Author: gregmoats
Reviews.Content: The wait staff was incredibly rude at this resort. I HAVE NEVER BEEN AT A RESORT WHERE THE WAITERS/WAITRESSES START TO LEAN CHAIRS UP ON TABLES TO GIVE PEOPLE A HINT ON WHEN IT'S TIME TO LEAVE!!! One waiter asked me if I understood English! His name was Alejandro! Standing in line for a table for 20 minutes was ridiculous when there were about 15 tables open! They said they had to make us wait to be sure we were charged properly.. Needless to say we ate at other resorts. The cottage we stayed in was nice, but the closet doors kept falling off and it took a superhuman effort to get the slider open. It took hours to cool down the room to where it was comfortable. The hot water/cold water in the showere was touchy... you were a millimeter away from freezing or scalding! The grounds and beach were awesome! We were there for a destination wedding and it was done very well!

Reviews.Title: “Love ocean front cottage”
Reviews.Author: seechiken
Reviews.Content: Not sure why there are so many bad reviews of the cottage rooms, we loved ours. Clean, comfortable and just steps to put your toes in the sand. We were in building E and have no complaints. All the staff was helpfull, friendly and did there best to assist with anything needed. Also want to mention how helpful the lady (can't remember her name) was at the tour desk in the lobby. She assisted us with choosing a day trip to Lanai with Trilogy (also excellent), but also show us various free places to check out on the island. i would highly recommed this resort. Also - if you ask, you can add paradise value package at $16 per day (or $21 for valet which we did) this includes 2 mai tais a day, parking and use of safe. It was great - no hassle to find a parking place and be required to have 2 mai tais each day - we loved it :-)

Reviews.Title: “20th Anniversary - Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: datainmotion
Reviews.Content: We stayed in mid-May and the Royal Lahina was great! From the moment we first entered the lobby, everyone was very friendly. The room was very clean and well laid out.
