The view from our balcony on the 4th floor was a picturesque shot of Molokai. The grounds and pools are well kept and clean, the food was excellent (especially the breakfast buffett (dinner menu could use some work). The beach merits an entire review of its own, but suffice it to say that the hotel's proximity to it made our week that much more enjoyable. If you walk a 100 yards or so north, there is a large coral reef to explore while snorkeling. While not Molokini crater, the Kanapaali Reef is perfect if you just stay at the resort and relax - which you could easily do for a week. We'll be back and maybe with our three kids next time!

Reviews.Title: “Apathetic, Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiDuck
Reviews.Content: As long as you're already flying to Maui, you can do better. When I got in line to "check in," there were maybe 10 people in front of us. And yet my wife and I waited in line for close to an hour in a stuffy, crowded lobby with no AC. I began to sweat profusely while my wife sat in a chair with our bags. When it was our turn, the staff were incredibly rude, indifferent, and clearly hated their lives (which is too bad, but it's not my problem). I asked the woman helping me a couple questions and she ignored me both times; her body language was also apathetic. She eventually told us our room wasn't quite ready yet (even though it was almost check-in time) and she suggested we "stand to the side" so she can remember to give us our room keys(!). We did, and when I realized she'd never see us again, I asked another woman for our room keys and she acted very annoyed. After some time, i asked her again, and again she shut me down, so I asked another clerk walking by, and she immediately got the keys for me. Again: It's clear they hate their jobs/lives. Just not a welcoming atmosphere. Our room had a "balcony" that (literally) overlooked satellite dishes. Why they put a balcony on that room is beyond me. The room itself was ok--just a little small. Parking is $10/night in a first/come-first/serve parking lot that REALLY fills up at night. Again, why/how am I being charged to park HERE? Thankfully, we only stayed two nights (we stayed somewhere else earlier that week). When we checked out, the woman at the front desk printed off a sheet of paper and told me to sign on the bottom. No formal "x" with a line. I just awkwardly signed in a big empty white space. Now, do I need an "x" line to make my Hawaii trip memorable? No--but it's a little thing that speaks much to the cheapness of the place. A receipt from Walmart will have an "x" and a formal area for you to sign. So, really. As long as you've already been saving up money to fly to Hawaii, look around to see what else you can get if you splurge a bit. The one redeeming quality to this place is its close proximity to downtown Lahaina. I HIGHLY recommend Warren and Annabelle's magic show and/or dinner at Longhi's (they're just a few hundred feet from each other on Front St.). The magic show is hilarious and mind-blowing, and the food at Longhi's is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CarolynChesapeake
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome time at the Royal Lahaina. The resort is nice, not stuffy. Very few kids, uncrowded beach. Everything was great for us here. I would not recommend this place for a party crowd, since all the entertainment stops at 9pm, which was great for us since we had a 6 hour time difference we were tired early in the evening and got up early each am. The breathtaking views from the balacony were spectacular. Hotel staff was woonderful, drinks were great and the small coffee shope was great. Didn't like having to pay $10.00 a day to park, but the parking was good and we felt safe. Mattress were great slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “Cottages with a Million $ View...”
Reviews.Author: luv2cruiseCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in two "Ocean View Cottages" in building "D"....we have no complaints. We got exactly what we wanted....the Hawaiian atmosphere, spacious clean room, a private "Lanai" with a killer view of the Ocean, what else could we ask for? Upon arrival we were greeted by two lovely ladies who were very friendly, courteous, helpful. Every staff member that worked in the Resort was very much in the "Aloha Spirit", none of family members have any complaints with any one of the staff, if anything they all went out of their way to help us find our way around the resort. I also want to add, every night we would hear a knock at our room door and there stood the room maid with fresh towels wanting to know if we needed more. We were carted over, family, luggage, in one of the Golf carts to our Ocean Front Rooms in Building D. All of us got a kick out of riding the Golf carts to our rooms. We were a bit apprehensive about our rooms because of the some of the bad reviews, but what a pleasant surprise to see the cottages were quite nice. We found them to have the Hawaiian Charm we were looking for and of course have the Killer View of the Ocean. As far as the food, again we have no complaints in that department. We found the Cafe Shop had great morning sandwiches, muffins, cup cakes, coffee. The Restaurant had great food too, my favorite was their "Shrimp Appetizers", "Garlic Fries". We stayed last week of May 25 to Jun l. We all had a wonderful stay and we would definitely all go back with out a doubt. We love the Royal Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property on a great maui beach but did have its drawbacks.”
Reviews.Author: Breone1
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Lahaina seemed comfortable and modern at first glance but both me and my husband had back and neck pain from sleeping on the beds for 3 nights. The beach was really nice and we enjoyed some snorkeling nearby. The resort does not provide any chairs for you to have on the beach and in fact have planted a big plant barrier between the ocean and the property. I found this aggrivating to have to pay ten dollars a day to rent a chair for the beach or lay on their chairs by the pool but not be close enough to really enjoy the ocean waves. The parking was convenient and we felt our rental car was safe on property. The safe and refrigerator provided in the room were adequate and we really enjoyed the nice large showers. Overall pretty nice place. If you are ok sleeping on very soft matresss and pillow top you should be fine but it seems our backs prefer a firmer mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic beach!”
Reviews.Author: jomama7
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 week in celebration of my husband's 50th birthday. We had a ground floor cottage. Very musty smelling and old. Shower was great, bed was great. Really couldn't complain too much. The food in the main restaurant was horrible and horribly overpriced...do NOT order quesedillas! Staff was pleasant enough, however didn't like having housekeeping knocking at 8:30 a.m. May is certainly the time to visit Maui! Perfect weather, no crowds and the beautiful beach with non-threatening currents. First time in my life I was able to actually swim in the ocean! We really didn't need to go anywhere else.... staying in the cottages gave a nice sense of independence, however old they may be. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: IndyAnnieM
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our honeymooon. The prices were better than some of the larger resorts, but the rooms were very clean & modern and the luau next door was fun. The staff was very friendly and there was pineapple water in the lobby each day. The breakfast buffet was BY FAR the best I've ever had -- we had to pay for it, but I'd suggest figuring out how to get it included in the room rate somehow! The restaurant at night was relaxing with live music and good food. There were always chairs available at the pools and the beach was never over-crowded. I'm glad we stayed here as opposed to the busier Whalers Village, which was still very close for when were wanted to go shopping or be around more people. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel and we'll definitely be staying here when we go back to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: gejiv
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Hawaii and we were not disappointed. Going in May, the beaches were fantastic (not crowded). Employees were very hospitable and friendly. Over 50 upgrade to an ocean view was very nice. The room was clean. Breakfast was included in our package and it was delicious. Check In and Check Out was very quick. The Luau was very entertaining. The Sunset Cruise, on the Teralani, recommended by the Pool Attendant was totally heaven. Our only regret was not staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Liveforvacations59
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price. We stayed in the tower, not the cottages, and have no complaints about the room or service. Staff was always cheerful and helpful. Nice updated clean rooms. Beautiful landscaped property withing walking distance of Whaler's Village. The beach in front of the hotel is the most beautiful beach I have seen, Molokai to the right, Lanai to the left, just beautful! Only complaint is parking. The parking is so tight, is is hard to get out of the car, but parking in the back where the luau visitors park is less crowded, so we parked there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing. Great vacation spot.”
Reviews.Author: keithrodgers1972
Reviews.Content: May is the perfect time to go to this resort. It wasn't too busy and the atmosphere was very relaxing. The rooms were pretty plain but that doesn't matter because there is so much to do on the island that the only time you are in your room is to sleep or to get ready for the next activity. The staff was very attentive and helpful they even would remember you by name if you gave it to them. I would highly recommend this vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “YES! Definitely stay here!”
Reviews.Author: cornellsrnd
Reviews.Content: We just returned May 21 after 8 days on the Costco package. It was pretty much all we could've hoped for. We stayed on the 7th floor north facing room with a beautiful view of the ocean. Some complained about luau noise, but with our window closed it wasn't a problem at all. The only complaint we had was my wife thought the coffee in the hotel and the ice cream shoppe was pretty weak as Hawaiian coffee goes. Virtually all other aspects of the experience were fantastic. The maid service was great. The food was certainly good enough. The beach was the BEST! The employees all seemed to have good attitudes and were helpful and friendly. This isn't a hotel that gives you a grand sense of feeling like the Hyatt or the Westin might, but it did everything we needed a hotel to do for our stay on Maui. Maybe things have improved in the last year, but we're not sure what the basis was for all the negative feedback we read about before we left

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HooserWA
Reviews.Content: They took care of us. Good place to stay. Get the package with the sunset cruise and laua. Checked in early and they let us use a hospitality suite our last day to shower after snorkling.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Costco Package”
Reviews.Author: Conejojoe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I used COSTCO for the first time on this trip to Maui. This was our sixth trip to the island so we are no strangers. This was as close to all an inclusive package as one can get for Maui. We chose the deluxe ocean view room and were given a room on the 11th floor with a north west view toward Kahana. The dinner catamaran cruise was a highlight. You get to enjoy the sight of all the resorts from Kaanapali up to Kapalua with dinner in Napili Bay. Then cruise back south with the sails up for the sunset. The location is perfect with an uncrowded beach to swim or snorkel. Nice walking paths with only the occasional jogger to dodge. The helpful staff even printed my boarding passes when we left.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Hospitable Place I've been to.”
Reviews.Author: rocky51168
Reviews.Content: The employees here were the friendliest and the most helpful. I was just there last week and had a splendid time. We even had one day that we spent in the emergency room, but because of the quick response of a few employees ( raspsady and the manager of the food court) the rest of our stay was awesome. My girlfriend fainted and fell and cut her chin resulting in 12 stiches. The hotel was clean and had a good view from all sides. The beach was excellent and the water was clear. And they had everything you needed to where if you just wanted to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery or go snorkeling or do whatever you want, they had it. Great Place and I will be back there!

Reviews.Title: “Decent resort, beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: samit-neha
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui at the end of April, and let me tell you. We couldn't have asked for a better weather or ocean conditions. There was hardly any humidity, the sun felt nice and the ocean waves were quite calm, unlike the winter months. One amazing thing about the location of this resort during the month of April, is that the sun sets right in between the Moloka'i and Lana'i islands. This resort is located right at the center of these two islands in the distance. This combination makes up for beautiful Hawai'ian sunsets. The hotel beach itself is not very crowded, because its located on the right side of the black rock (which is more crowded because of its fame). So you have a very beautiful, secluded part of the famous Kaanapali beach to yourself. All the big brand hotels, namely Sheraton, Westin, Hyatt are on the left side of the black rock. The ocean walk there is very crowded, mainly because of these huge hotels and also because of the numerous restaurants and the whaler's village. But the Royal Lahaina side of the Kaanapali beach is much more secluded and less commercialized. So, full marks to the location. As for the hotel, It's definitely not a high end hotel, i.e. it doesnt have the extra frills like the luxury hotels do. I visited all the luxury hotels in Maui and this resort does not compare with the rest as far as the swimming pools, the resort ambiance and the amenities are concerned. But hey, a normal garden view room of those hotels would cost you the same as the ocean view room in Royal Lahaina, and the view from this resort is second to none. Royal lahaina has two small swimming pools, no waterfalls or bars in the pool like other hotels.....so families with small kids should definitely consider other hotels. The pool at Wailea resort is the best. Also, Sheraton, Westin, Mariott, Hyatt...all have huge pools with waterfalls and slides. I think kids would enjoy those more. But for people like me, who'd rather be in the ocean than the pool, who love to watch the Hawaiian sunsets, who love beautiful beaches with not much crowd...then this resort is just right for you. Also, the mai tais at the resort bar are only $4 during the happy hours (which last until 6 in the evening). As for the room, I stayed in the partial ocean view room in the tower. I'd rather stay in the ocean view, but it was a bit expensive for me. Maybe next time:) The rooms were clean and well maintained. A little small for liking, but you get what you pay for (and in Maui, you have to pay a lot to get luxury) . I stayed away from the cottage rooms, as I read a lot of negative reviews about them. The parking space was cramped. I rented an Impala and that really made it worse. Rent a small car if you can. It will save you on the gas and the parking hassles. P.S.: I did not like the $10 charge for parking, but I've heard that all Maui hotels do that. The shops in the hotel compound were nice. Do make a visit. So, all and all... a good experience at this hotel. No bad memories at all. Go visit Maui, its unbelievably beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - perfect for our Maui Honeymoon :)”
Reviews.Author: coquicola412
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! We booked a great Expedia package that included an Aloha Garden Saver Room. Ricardo checked us in upon arrival, and upgraded us to a partial ocean view! He was wonderful - ended up checking us out too, and was friendly and efficient. The room was great - decorated in Hawaiian decor. Very comfortable bed and I loved the bathroom! The balcony or lanai was wonderful - we enjoyed breakfast out there almost every morning while enjoying the bright sun and peaceful breeze, overlooking the ocean. We had a good view of the garden cottages too, and I'll definitely consider them for the next time. They looked very well kept, and were scattered about the tropical lawns. Much better than what I had pictured based on what I read on here. The hotel is located right on the beach. I'm so happy I picked this particular hotel because it is just slightly north of black rock, and seems to be on the "quieter" and less kiddy side of black rock. The other side of Kaanapali Beach is definitely the more family oriented side. So this was perfect for our honeymoon. The beach is beautiful. Sandy and clear waters. We enjoyed the Luau at the hotel one night, and it was a lot of fun! The drinks were plentiful, as was the food. The entertainment was great, and we got a good last minute rate through the Expedia Travel Office located on property. We ate at the restaurant twice - once for the breakfast buffet and once for dinner. Everything was very tasty, and not too badly priced (for Maui). It was wonderful being able to see whales playing off shore. The location was amazing - just a quick 5 minute drive to Whaler's Village (or take the free Kaanapali Trolley), and a 10 minute drive to Lahaina. It always felt so nice to come "home" to the Royal Lahaina and have the person at the guard shack wave and welcome us home. All of the staff was very friendly. They even went out of their way to retrieve my bikini top the day of checkout since it had blown off of the balcony overnight. The snorkeling off of Black Rock was great - we snorkeled one side one day and the other side the other day. Both times, we saw an abundance of fish and some sea turtles. The only slight negative I can find with this hotel is the parking. The spaces are pretty small. And it does get parked up due to the luau, so you sometimes have to park much further away. This hotel was perfect - a wonderful Hawaiian feel with the hospitality. It was beautiful too. Everything we hoped for for our honeymoon. I have to admit - I work in the hotel industry in Arizona, and so badly wanted to stay at the Royal Lahaina that I checked out the job openings one day, lol. Just dreaming I suppose. Stay here - you won't be disappointed. This will definitely be "our place" when we return to Maui in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Spot”
Reviews.Author: mehoust2
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week honeymoon on Maui at the Royal Lahaina. We were very happy with the hotel. He booked a garden view tower room, but were upgraded to ocean view at no charge at checkin. Our tower room was very clean, nicely decorated, and the bed was super comfortable. The beach in front of the hotel is very clean and calm. It's only a short drive from the Royal Lahaina to Front Street in Lahainatown, where we spent most of our evenings. We never ate at the hotel, but the food looked good. There is also a great reasonably-priced cafe at the Fairway Shops right down the street that is good for breakfast and box lunches (CJ's). We also went to the the luau at the Royal Lahaina. It was fun, and the food was good. A pretty good bargain we thought. The only downsides are parking is $10/day and wi-fi is also $10/day. And, were weren't expecting the $300 refundable "incidentals" deposit we had to make at checkin. It was refunded after checkout, but it would have been nice to be prepared for that beforehand. All in all, I would definitely recommend the Royal Lahaina to anyone looking for a well-appointed room with a great location at a great price! We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Decent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PurdueBetsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina through the Costco package. At check-in, I was asked if I wanted to upgrade to an oceanfront room for an additional $50/night. Donâ€™t bother â€“ our Costco â€œocean viewâ€� room in the tower was great, try to get on the northwest side, the other side has a loud a/c unit. The property is clean, small, but nice. Itâ€™s not nearly as fancy or luxurious as the Westin or Sheraton. Itâ€™s obviously one of the older hotels along the strip, it's very basic, no spa or fitness center, boring pool, go to the beach instead. The beach is great, soft golden sand, just steps from the hotel. Thereâ€™s a paved beachfront walk that winds around the hotels and stretches probably about 4-5 miles, very popular in the morning with walkers and runners. Itâ€™s about a 20 minute walk to the Whalerâ€™s Village, a decent-sized shopping mall, or thereâ€™s a free shuttle from the hotel. The food in the Royal Ocean lounge/restaurant is excellent. The breakfast buffet has your standard fare: eggs, bacon, pastries, fruit, cereal, oatmeal, etc. The buffet doesnâ€™t open until 7am, so if you have an early tour, you can either get something from the Royal Scoop or ask guest services the night before to notify the restaurant about a â€˜to-goâ€™ buffet (we did that once and they were a little disorganized, but it worked out in the end). The restaurant service at breakfast/lunch is a bit indifferent. Maritas, whom we had several times did not seem happy to be there and had to be asked repeatedly to fill up our waters. Bar service and dinner was better. Enjoy some drinks at the Barefoot Bar with Raffi, try his version of â€˜Put the Lime in Don Coconutâ€™ and enjoy the beautiful view. The Royal Scoop is an ice cream/coffee shop that opens at 6am, but donâ€™t get the shave ice. Itâ€™s not real shave ice, go to the town of Lahaina to Annieâ€™s or Ululaniâ€™s for the good stuff. Front desk and valet parking service was always friendly. There is a small fridge in your room, so you might want to stop at a store on your way from the airport and pick up some bottled water. Room was clean, bathroom area a bit small, but functional. The room could definitely use more places to hang wet stuff up, though. Included in the Costco package was the luau. If you read the awesome Maui Revealed guidebook (the blue one), it rates the luau as really bad. We thought it was ok, with the exception of half the seats face the setting sun, so itâ€™s pretty uncomfortable until the sun goes down. Bring a hat, just in case. The meats and purple sweet potatoes were good, the salads were just ok, desserts arenâ€™t great. The drinks are watery, but you can go up to the bar and ask for additional rum to pour in your mai tai. Frozen drinks are not included in the price though, I think those were $15 with free refills. The show is good, lots of energy and some humor. If youâ€™ve never been to a luau before and youâ€™re staying at the hotel, it might be worth the $70 for a ticket. One thing I was disappointed in was when I reserved the package, I noted that we were staying there for our 10th anniversary. There was no acknowledgement of that from the hotel, I was expecting/hoping for a little something, bottle of cheap champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, or at least a congratulatory card. One would think that Hawaiian hotels would be very used to people celebrating and would have a standard practice to acknowledge. This may validate other posters' comments about lack of aloha or poor front desk service. All in all, I was pleased with the Royal Lahaina and the Costco package deal.

Reviews.Title: “Maui has a lot of hotel, you can do much better.”
Reviews.Author: iggyinportland
Reviews.Content: I was doing research on Oahu for almost two weeks and knew I would need a break from my work. So, I booked a snorkel trip to Maui for a couple of days through Expedia. I researched hotels and the Royal Lahaina seemed like a good choice. I was wrong. I drove on to the property about 3pm and checked with the gate guard. He confirmed that I did have a reservation and then asked if I was traveling alone. I said that I was and he said â€œOh, thatâ€™s too bad.â€� I thought that was rather unprofessional. I pulled into the tiny and crowed parking lot and pulled out my backpack. Since I was only staying for one night and leaving in the morning for an early snorkel trip, I didnâ€™t want to haul in all of my luggage. I checked into the hotel about 3pm. The front desk was chaotic and several guests seemed to be having problems with their keys or reservations. When it was my turn the front desk clerk told me that they had two reservations in my name and in order to make sure I was checked into the correct one, I needed my confirmation number. My name isnâ€™t common so I asked if he could check the address and he said no that I needed the confirmation number. So I had to walk back to the car and find my Expedia print out and go back to the lobby and wait again. I told the front desk clerk that I was only visiting Maui for one day and would really like a nice room. I was then checked into cottage R, which is about as far away from the beach, pool and main building as possible and still be on the property. After a hike, I keyed into (using metal keys on the first floor, as a single woman traveling alone, I didnâ€™t like being on the ground floor and only a certain type of hotel still uses metal keys.) I walked into a dilapidated, stuffy room that smelled like mildew. It looked nothing like the photos on their website. I didnâ€™t even set my backpack down; I walked to the phone and called the front desk. The front desk clerk told me that for an upgrade fee, I could be put in a deluxe ocean view room. I couldnâ€™t stay in that horrible room, so I agree to pay the extortion fee and I hiked back to the front desk. I waited in line again, signed the upgrade agreement and was given keys to the new room. I went upstairs and tried to key in to my room. The key didnâ€™t work. So I went back to the front desk, waited in line again and was given new keys. I went upstairs, again and tried to key in to my room. The key didnâ€™t work, again. So I went back to the front desk, waited in line, again, and was given new keys made with a different key machine and this time a bellman escorted me up to my room (he didnâ€™t ask me if I needed help with my back pack, just walked up with me) and then condescendingly show me how to use the key. I travel a lot and believe in tipping for good service, he could have earned a tip if he had been just a little bit helpful. I was finally in my room and it took only an hour. This room was lovely, clean and comfortable. I love Asian themed decoration and the shuttered lanai. The bath amenities are generous with a fresh coconut scent. I didnâ€™t use the coffee maker because they left powdered â€œwhitenerâ€� rather than liquid dairy cream. Ick. I left the property for dinner, when I returned the guest parking lot was full because of the luau guests, so I had to park in the back parking lot and then once again, hike to the hotel. The parking spaces are very small. After sunset, I went to sleep because it had been a long day and I had to be up at 5am for my snorkel trip. I had been asleep for about 30 minutes when the front desk called to tell me that I had an envelope waiting for me. It was advertising from the Expedia concierge and really wasnâ€™t a reason to call after 9pm. Not once during this experience did I raise my voice or be rude to the staff, as I witnessed other guests doing. It would be nice if the hotel staff would reward well behaved and polite guests rather than treat them like crap. By rewarding the screamers you are teaching them that bad behavior is a good way to get results. You arenâ€™t doing your industry or the world a favor. I do plan to return to Maui but I wonâ€™t be staying at this hotel, the staff doesnâ€™t have even a small amount of the Aloha spirit that I have experienced elsewhere in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, friendly resort on the Beach in Maui”
Reviews.Author: MountainGirl000
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at this resort and we couldn't have been more pleased. We purchased a package through Costco with many special offers included. Hotel is ON the beach, with two separate swimming pools, restaurant, bars with excellent Mai Tai's! The employees couldn't have been nicer and helpful. Special thanks to April and Chicco in the Guest Relations office. We plan on returning. Free Trolley to Shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a very nice property”
Reviews.Author: Tagger87
Reviews.Content: Because of my line of work, I'm often upgraded at hotels and am given suites and treated extra special. So when I go on vacation and stay at a property where I'm not known by the hotel management or sales staff, it can sometimes be a let down. I have stayed at at least a dozen resorts on the Hawaiian Islands, including several of the top properties in the state. Having said that, I worried that the Royal Lahaina would not live up to my standards. I'm pleased to report that I was thrilled by the value and comfort of this property. I booked an excellent package through Costco Travel and would recommend it to anyone. No, the property is not the Four Seasons, but it is well maintained, the Tower rooms very clean and comfortable, and convenient. The beds were comfortable, the flat screen TV large, and the "partial ocean view" was terrific. The bathroom was roomy with a large walk-in shower. There was a small refrigerator and a decent sized safe (with no extra charge to use the safe). The hotel staff was friendly and kind. Our primary housekeeper, I believe her name was Ann, was sweet and friendly. When we would see her, she would ask how our day was, if we needed anything and when we asked for additional towels, was quick to offer more than we needed. (We actually missed her on her days off -- I've never missed a particular housekeeper before!). On our first full day there, I bought some sandwiches and chips at the ice cream/coffee shop for our lunch by the pool. Both times when we returned later in the week, the friendly young lady who worked there remembered me by name! I was impressed. The hotel valets were quick and efficient. I've seen many people complain about paying for parking here, but that is common at most hotels on the islands and in any big city. $10 a day is cheap and it is only $15 a day for the valet (our package came with valet parking). Reading the reviews on this site, I knew that self-parking was difficult, so $5 more per day is worth it for the valet. The main restaurant served a very respectable breakfast buffet (again, included in our package). It had a decent variety of items, but does not include an omlette or waffle station, or carvery, like many buffets. But even when there were lines to get in, the staff moved people in quickly and efficiently. I don't think we ever waited more than 5-10 minutes, even when there were dozens of parties in front of us. The restaurant could use a wider variety on its lunch/dinner menu (only one menu for both). But the portions were big and the food pretty good. The lounge chairs near both pools should be updated, as they were a little uncomfortable and look rather dated. My main suggestion to the hotel is to have servers to bring food and drink to those sitting at the pools. I'm sure they could make a lot of money by doing so. Even without, it is quick and easy to go to one of the bars to get served. Another great thing about the Royal Lahaina -- no resort fee. So many resorts try to charge you an extra $25-35 per day on top of your rate as a resort fee. They use lame excuses to justify it to cover the costs of things that should be included in your rate: room safes, local calls, towel service at the pool, lounge chairs, etc... You have to pay it even if you don't use those items. So no resort fee is a huge plus. All in all, it depends upon your expectations. Having experienced so many Hawaiian hotels/resorts, I was very impressed with the Royal Lahaina and recommend people try to get a good package like the one we got through Costco. It was an excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: micheallo
Reviews.Content: We had an okay time while at the Royal Lahaina. There were some hit and there were some misses. The hits: overall the staff was nice. A few people had a lot of genuine 'Aloha.' The grounds are full of lots of Hawai'ian plants. There were lots of flowers and birds. The hotel is on the beach. You can go from the pool to the ocean quite easily. The tennis courts are fantastic-- we played a lot of tennis when we were there. The free yoga classes overlooking the ocean were wonderful. The misses-- the cottage rooms are an unpleasant experience. We were on the ground floor and we could hear every step of the people above us. I even went to talk to pleople above us and they said they were walking normally. I think the building are poorly constructed. Parking and Wi-Fi are extra, which is a big turn off. There were loud, drunk guests at the pool who had little concern for other people enjoyment level. I guess thatâ€™s whatâ€™s to be expected at this place. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants. Due to the room and loud guests, I do not recommend this place and I don't think I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but doesn't deliver”
Reviews.Author: Barratt
Reviews.Content: Property is well located adjacent to other resort style hotels in Lahaina. Comparatively, the property looks tired and has little sparkle in the public areas. The service is poor in restaurants and at the front desk. Staff appear to lack any sense of goodwill and looked bored. Errors in room reservations were not acknowledged and very reluctantly corrected. We were told what rooms we could have and that was to be that. Rooms themselves were clean and comfortable. Queuing for breakfast after standing in line and having room numbers, names and ages taken by a totally disinterested front of house employee was not something we enjoyed nor were used to. We were left with the feeling of cattle there to be pushed down a shute. All of this for, what could only be described as, expensive room rates when service is taken into account. We were quite happy to spend our time and dollars at adjacent hotels and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely FANTASTIC !”
Reviews.Author: ThePlaces_11
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina is the best. We asked for adjoining rooms and were sent to the 9th floor,ocean view. We had aranged tor the ocean view,fantastic to say the least. Rooms were spaceous,clean,and quite comfortable. The waite staff were cordial but I have to give a special 5 star to the valet hostess.Always a warm aloha no matter in the am or pm. with a smile that was sincere. The restaurant staff, some were difficult for me to understand when ordering our neals. Food very good,the mai tais excelent. If you want to get the best parking service take the upgrade,plus there are some other amenities that go with it. Would we go there again you ask. in a NY minute.

Reviews.Title: “tower is nice bungalows are terrible”
Reviews.Author: firecapt102
Reviews.Content: I booked a 6 night stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort for my 26th aniversary with my wife. Most reviews were favorable and rated the hotel as a 4 star resort and great service. Some the negative reviews stated they were 1st given a bungalow which was terrible then allowed to up grade to an ocean view for an extra fee. When I booked my room it was stated I would get a tower room or a bugalow based on availability. The web site also said if I mentioned it was an aniversary I would get a room upgrade and a few small extras. well upon arrival we were given a bungalow that was actually hotter inside than it was on the outside (85 degrees inside with an old window type a/c unit running at full. The paint in the bath room was peeling off the ceiling and the carpet had strips of carpet missing. I spoke to the front desk and for an additional 300 dollars I could be upgraded to a tower room. As the bell hop took us to the new room he stated " wow most people dont last 30 minutes be fore requesting a new room". The tower room was much nicer but not to the level of a 4 star hotel. The beach location is excellent and the grounds are clean, but the pools are very dated. I was very dissappointed that they pull you into the hotel and basically hold the tower rooms until you pay the ransome. I sent the Royal Lahaina a couple of emails with no replys. I would not stay there again. with the extra money for parking and room up grade I could have stayed at a real 4 star hotel for less.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinBon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an amazing honeymoon! Absolutely LOVED our stay at the Royal Lahaina. Staff was great - except for the front desk, not really sure what's going on up there (and neither are they). Beautiful room, comfortable bed. Cory the manager was great, and helped us with some confusion at check in. Enjoyed the breakfast buffet, but we were tired of the food by the end of our stay. Beautiul grounds. One of the best beaches I saw in Maui! We swam with a turtle and saw whales from the beach and from our room! Paying for internet at a hotel in 2011 seems silly to me. Microwaves in rooms would be a HUGE plus! Other people said that Costco offers a great package at this hotel, so check that out if you are considering the Royal Lahaina! For the best view, request floors 10, 11 or 12, even numbered room ending in 26 or higher.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid cottage room”
Reviews.Author: Tommitraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in cottage room. The rooms are spacious but dated. Noisy air-conditioning unit which needs to be switched off overnight to allow sleep. Parking $10 per day. Internet is $9.95 per day. There is a free shuttle trolley to Whalers Village which is also walking distance of about 15 minutes. The tower rooms would appear to be the better choice.

Reviews.Title: “SECOND STAY IN SIX MONTHS. STILL FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: dlb0758
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in six months. We stayed at the resort in December of 2010 in order to tour the resort and meet with the resort's Romance Center staff who was planning our April 2011 wedding there. Our December stay was first rate and we were so excited to return in April to get married at the resort with 67 of our closest friends and family members, most of whom stayed at the resort. The wedding was fantastic. The Romance Center staff and all the contracted vendors made our special day one we will never forget. The hotel staff was as professional and friendly as they were when we visited in December. From the housekeepers and grounds keepers to front desk management and other members of upper management that our guests came into contact with, the Royal Lahaina Resort is a first class organization. When we retuned home we made a pledge that we will be returning to the resort every year for our anniversary. Thank you Royal Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: crazyforbreak
Reviews.Content: just came back from a relaxing vacation.The property is clean and well kept.Its close to the Lahaina village and Whalers village shopping.Luau was super fun.Missed having a spa on site though.Also I wish the pools were bigger and they had some beach activities like beach volleyball and frisbee and yes,some sun umbrella.Our costco deal included breakfast which was very good but the same everyday.Vary it a little please.Tennis courts are superb.

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing place to stay with great rooms and great views. Not for kids.”
Reviews.Author: UKBacons
Reviews.Content: We want to go back. Very nice people from start to finish. The rooms have recently been updated and were in very nice shape. The only problem was that the shower leaked onto the bathroom floor, but not a big deal. The location is great if you want a quiet vacation spot. Most of the major hotel chains are located close to each other making the beaches crowded. Not so here. The hotel had almost everything we wanted, the spa wasn't on site and they referred you to a spa at a nearby hotel. I think we liked the quiet relaxed atmosphere, hardly anythign we didn't like here. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Trip”
Reviews.Author: Danajroo
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed at the Royal Lahania for 7 days. Since I was traveling alone the graciously put me in the Tower. The room was fantastic and the customer service supberb. Thank you to the front desk gals, the housekeeping ladies, the activities gals & guys and all of you that made my stay memorable. I will return to Maui next year and will be staying once again at the Royal Lahania.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Wowie!”
Reviews.Author: minnietoTN
Reviews.Content: We few from Oahu to Maui for a few days of our 2 week Hawaiian adventure and I am SO GLAD we did!!! We stayed in one of the cottages at the Royal Lahaina and it felt like we had our own little cabin on the beach...we had a little yard and everything. We had beautiful views and it was close to a lot of the attractions that we did. The staff was amazing and the cottage was clean, and felt very "Hawaiian." The luau at our hotel was the best that I have been to! The food was delicious and the entertainment was spectacular. LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Really hard to leave and go home to snow!”
Reviews.Author: 2011wintersucks
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the tower for 10 days in April. Absolutely loved it! Enjoyed being welcomed home every night at the gate. Staff were very friendly, except for one waiter in the restaurant who seemed put out by having to serve us. The grounds are beautiful and clean. The beach is the the best part though. Gorgeous, nice clear water and not overcrowded at all. If you put your head underwater a few feet under, you could hear the whales singing. Pools were average and a little on the cool side, but never had a problem getting a lounge chair. Something else i liked was being able to get as many beach towels as you needed daily. We went through some of the other higher end resorts nearby and found them and their beaches to be too crowded. If I had to find something to complain about, it would be having to pay for parking and Internet. Parking spots are very small and sometimes the passengers had to get out before we could drive into the spot. Not a big deal though. Always found a spot. Would highly recommend the Royal Lahaina and cannot wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal LaCrapna”
Reviews.Author: pixieray
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina was absolutely one of the worst hotel experiences that I've ever had. At booking, a staff member confirmed that I'd "definitely, 100%" be in the tower room. When I called back later to request email confirmation, they went back on their word and said that they didn't guarantee tower rooms at my rate. However, three different people, including the Director of Reservations and the Front Desk Manager, said that getting a tower room would not be an issue, and it all looked good to go. But upon arrival, I was told by a snappy, unfriendly front desk staff that I had to pay $75 to upgrade into the tower. Like previous reviews have stated, the Garden Cottage was dumpy, equatable to a '60s/'70s motel room. There were NO windows, just open holes with bug screens and wooden window blinds. Given this, everything was insanely damp, and the small window AC was entirely inefficient at cooling the room and keeping it dry. The maintenance/cleaning staff also evidently pays zero attention to detail: missing light bulbs, very obviously broken hair dryer, and the shower drain did not work properly. When we asked the front desk staff to send maintenance, the employee there actually gave us a hard time for requesting maintenance twice ("I already had sent someone for your light bulb and now you're telling me you need a hair dryer?") and had to be called three times before someone came. The staff proved themselves unhelpful and unknowledgeable: they couldn't tell us where to snorkel and gave laughably bad advice about when to set out for the Road to Hana ("any time is fine, even 2 or 3PM"). They also provided us with a broken Road to Hana audio CD, which made us lose two hours of our day because we thought our CD player was broken and tried to swap out our rental car only to realize that it was just the un-useable disk that the Royal Lahaina gave us. The ONLY thing going for this hotel is their location on the beautiful Kaanapali Beach. The staff knows it, so there's no incentive to provide better (or any) service. Even if we had gotten a tower room, the staff's unapologetic and ungracious behavior about everything would still have resulted in a bad review. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere with more Aloha spirit.

Reviews.Title: “They should call this Resort: "Nickel and Dime You and Charge You Sleep on a Padded Board Resort"”
Reviews.Author: kowen07
Reviews.Content: In all fairness to the "Royal" Lahaina Resort, my kids and I had stayed at the most amazing place in Pa'ia the 4 days prior to staying here so our expectations were a bit skewed, but there was no excuse for how terrible the beds were here. At one point, my 16 year old asked if she could sleep on the patio lounger chair which she thought would be more comfortable than the beds. This place was so large and impersonal that we felt like just a customer and not a guest. The only nice staff member we met was the bell hop who helped us with our luggage upon check in. Everyone else seemed disinterested and not happy at all to be there. Parking was $10 a day and it was sometimes difficult to find parking! They charged $10 a day for internet. I didn't know people still did that! The room was typical and very outdated. We spent the same amount per night as we did at the place in Pa'ia and they had a fully stocked kitchen, free beach gear, free parking and free internet and the most amazing bed. I'm not sure how they justify the rates at the Royal Lahaina! The only updated thing in the room was the shower. It was very nice, but the bathroom had old faucets that you practically needed a wrench to turn on and off. The room had a window air conditioner that didn't really make the room cool and drowned out the sound of the ocean. The only thing this resort going for it was the beach. It was beautiful and you could swim out for miles and see some great fish for snorkeling (you could rent snorkel gear from the hotel for $15/day or rent it in town for $2.50/day). We even saw whales right from our beach at sunset! That is the best memory from this place, was the beach, so thank heavens for that. The best thing about The Royal Lahaina is that they made having to leave the island, not so hard!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: wrestlersmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from the Royal Lahaina. (4/4/11-4/8/11) It was the nicest hotel. Clean and comfortable rooms. Good food and drinks. Breakfast buffett so worth the money. The staff is so nice. We were there for our 25th wedding anniversary-vow renewal. We were upgraded to a side ocean view. It was perfect. The hotel sent us a bottle of champagne. We couldnt have been happier. I sent my husband to get the car the day of our vow renewal (he hadnt seen my dress) and when I came down to the lobby, 2 of the ladies(from the front desk) came over and hugged me, others were saying congratulations. That was so special. The staff there were the friendliest I have ever encountered at a hotel. We also saw a whale from our lanai and on the beach. It was about 200 yds from the beach. I also recommend going to historic Old Lahaina on Front St. Nice shops-resturants. Whalers village is nice to. Mahalo to Rev. Fay Hovey for doing our ceremony. I am already planning for a return trip next year. Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for Honeymooners! Romantic & Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: sugarangel808
Reviews.Content: We went there from Cali, for our honeymoon during the Thanksgiving week. They gave us an upgrade to Suite from Garden Cottage, which was incredible with ocean and mountain view. Incredible scenery, 180 degrees of ocean right by the restaurant downstairs. At the parking booth, they gave us a coupon for Basil Tomato restaurant and they had the yummiest food there, along with romantic, moody atmosphere. The suite was gorgeous, with modern wood taste and little bit of hawaiian twist. Loved it, coming back for sure! The most bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: ROBNLORI
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a vacation with our son and daughter in law, they could not have picked a more perfect location or Resort. Staff ,Room, Location, all perfect. We went through the PsunamI scare, The staff could not have been better or more attentive . No panic at all. When the staff found my wife has M.S.and can not walk a great distance they provided transportation to the safe area. We are so looking forward to many more trips to the resort. -Hopefully, in the very near future . My sincere thanks to Tom and the entire staff for a terrific vacation (although way to short) Rob and Lori

Reviews.Title: “How to make a trip to Paradise even better”
Reviews.Author: cwpostlethwaite
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned two weeks ago from a wonderful vacation at the Royal Lahaina Resort in Maui, HI. This is our sixth vacation in Maui, but the first time Iâ€™ve felt an obligation to write a formal review. The tone of our stay was set from the outset when the gentleman at the entrance gate stepped out not to check the purpose of our visit, but to greet us with a warm and sincere â€œWelcome Homeâ€�. We had stayed at the Royal Lahaina before and we were delighted to find the downstairs facilities and ambiance unchanged â€“ true examples of the Aloha Spirit. Warm woods and island dÃ©cor with a most competent staff dedicated to making your stay memorable. We knew the Tower had undergone a major renovation and were most impressed with the new rooms. Much larger, the bath facilities well separated from the sleeping area, granite countertops and dark woods, an extremely comfortable bed, native art, and a balcony ocean view that was spectacular. As impressive as the new accommodations are, itâ€™s the people that make the Royal Lahaina experience so enjoyable. Ford Ushijima, the food and beverage manager, has assembled a top notch staff to make sure each guest receives the ultimate in service and attention. From Ernie in the dining room who always brought a smile along with our morning coffee, to Eric and Raffi at the bar who helped us enjoy our afternoons and evenings, Ford has made sure each of his staff brings the same joy and enthusiasm to the workplace that he brings himself. Although there is no â€œformalâ€� dining in the evening, food is served until 9 p.m. and the selection is excellent and unique. If you want a great burger, they have it, but my advice is to mix and match. One evening we ordered one of the flat bread pizzas, a bowl of the roasted pepper soup, and a bowl of the â€œbust da mouthâ€� lobster macaroni and cheese â€“ more than enough for two people andeasily the most enjoyable meal we had on our trip. There is entertainment poolside each evening, singer/guitarists George and Josh take turns at the mike on alternate evenings and are accompanied by the most lovely and talented hula dancers you likely to see anywhere on the island. The entertainment ends around 9 p.m and the bar closes at 10. While we were there they had a great special going on â€“ Monday, Wednesday, and Friday wines and champagne were 50% off, so if the bar happened to close before you surrendered the evening, you could pick a nice bottle from their excellent wine list to take to your room and enjoy on your balcony. Any honest review has to include at least one con, so hereâ€™s mine. On our previous visit the breakfast buffet included made to order omelets and they were outstanding. The buffet is still good, especially if included in your package, but the omelet chef is definitely missed. Thatâ€™s it, complaint department closed. So there you have it â€“ one glowing, unqualified, double thumbs up review. I have recommended the Royal Lahaina to everyone Iâ€™ve talked to since returning, will continue to do so with great enthusiasm, and canâ€™t wait to drive up to that same entry the next time and hear â€œWelcome Homeâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: AngWilliams
Reviews.Content: My husband and I researched a lot of hotels in Maui before choosing the Royal Lahaina Resort. Upon our arrival, I was immediately relieved because the hotel location, staff, and accomodations were fabulous! The hotel location is amazing as it's located right on the Ka'anapali Beach where the ocean water is clear enough to snorkel. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. My husband and I stayed in the tower where our room was clean and the "partial ocean view" was still beautiful! We had a little scare as we were in Maui during the latest tsunami warning, but nevertheless, the hotel staff provided a safe place for all hotel guests including lighting, chairs, tables, towels to keep us warm, food, water and a bathroom. I am very excited tostart planning my next trip to Maui and staying only at the Royal Lahaina Resort. The hotel itself has a restaurant with daily happy hour specials. Mai tai anyone? In addition, the hotel has a daily breakfast buffet for the eaters in your group. As a bonus, the hotel has a small shop that sells ice cream, sandwiches, salads, coffee, and breakfast pastries. This shop was perfect because I was able to enjoy a bagel and orange juice a couple of mornings at a reasonable price. You will not be disappointed with this resort. Go to Maui, stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort and enjoy your trip to paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: KristyMaui
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 3031 (ocean front) had a great view of the ocean. Everything was perfect. We ate at Ruths Chris and our server Suzanne was awesome so was our driver Michael. Maui is magical. Tower rooms are the best. Castaway Cafe was nice. We loved Maui but at the same time its good to be home too! btw we used AT&Ts 3G network for the IPAD and it worked best. Loved Maui. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - oceanfront cottage on Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: javgrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina for about nine days and chose this location because my boyfriend's niece was getting married there. We stayed in a 1 bedroom ocean-front cottage (2nd floor of the cottage buildings). It worked well for us as we had two teenage boys with us and there were folding doors between the rooms so we could have privacy. It's a spacious suite that needs some TLC. Our bed was super comfortable, but on the boys side, the pull-out sofa-bed was in such bad shape it couldn't be slept on, so the boys shared the day bed which they said was okay. Our suite had a kitchenette so we went to Safeway in Lahaina and stocked up on essentials (water, and beer and wine of course!) and breakfast items. The best part of our suite was the location. On arrival, I was a bit disappointed that our two lanais faced the garden area and not the ocean, but it was fine. Many nights we ended up making the very short walk to the beach, to sit on the sand and listen to the waves and look up at the stars. I'm very surprised more people didn't do this as the resort (even the tower) is so close to the beach. It was one of the highlights of the trip for me. We had two rainy days, so we spent part of the afternoon sitting on our covered lanai, reading and drinking wine. Heaven! We deliberately chose not to stay in the tower even though the rooms there have been renovated because we wanted the ability to walk outside or door and just be outside. It was perfect. They aren't fancy accommodations, but they are spacious and the location couldn't be better. Many mornings we saw whales from the beach (I loved Kaanapali Beach, it was never crowded, and just felt relaxed and you could spread out as much as you needed to.) The restaurant is good, service is generally slow, and it seemed like there was quality entertainment most nights (the entertainers we saw were very good). We didn't enjoy the coffee in our suite, so went to the Royal Scoop (on site) for Americano's which were very good (and had excellent sandwiches to take along on road trips around the island). We had two excellent meals at Basil Tomato's. Whaler's Village (excellent shops and restaurants) is a short walk away, and Lahaina is a very short drive away. I wouldn't recommend the luau. The one in Lahaina is apparently better. If you are traveling with teenagers be aware that there likely won't be many other teenagers there. At the time we were there, our two boys were the only teenagers we saw. They said they had a good time (I mean, sun and surf, as opposed to snow and cold where we're from!), but they would've enjoyed meeting other kids their age. I would definitely stay at the Royal Lahaina again. It's a nice, comfortable, laid-back resort in a fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation full of Awesome Memories”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina from 3/13 - 3/18 and it was fantastic! The staff were wonderful! At check in, we opted for the full valet service. Do this! For alittle more, you get full valet service and do not have to worry about finding a parking spot those time when the luau is going on AND try to park a vehicle in such small spots. It was all taken care of for us, PLUS we got two free Mai-Ties (spelling) a day! One day we were heading out to the Road to Hana and one of the hotel staff noticed we had a leak in our collapsable cooler we brought along in the suitcase. He told us to wait a second, got us a styrome cooler with ice and threw in some small bottles of wine for all of us to enjoy our lunch with. Totally classy! The beach is awesome and one day were treated to a Monk Seal that beached itself to rest. They had it roped off and the volunteers around told us all about this particular seal. It was amazing! The rooms were clean and the showers were fantastic with the cocoanut spelling shampoos, conditioners and lotions! At check in, we originally had a partical view ocean room, but immediately upgraded us and our children to ocean view for our 25th wedding anniversary celebration. In the room fridge, there was a bottle of champaign with a nice card for us. The luaus they have are fabulous. My husband was able to watch the worker put the pig into the hot ground very early one morning and learned about the ways they prepare the meal. No question was a dumb one... they are there to make you feel relaxed and comfortable. I absolutely LOVED it when you drove down the dead end road to the Royal Lahaina where a staff would be there and would say.... "Welcome Home" each time we left the hotel and then came home again. It was fabulous! Relaxing on the beach we would watch MANY whales playing out in the ocean and breaching up so you could see them. It was around 200 feet out and was absolutely awesome! Hats off to the Royal Lahaina Resort as it was beautiful, relaxing and the best hotel in a very long time that we have felt so comfortable and spoiled!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Yolanda50
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui so didn't know what to expect and we were there for 10 days. I reviewed several hotels through Trip Advisor and had narrowed it down to two, but I wanted a hotel on the beach so we choose the Royal Lahaina. It is a lovely hotel with a beautiful beach. We had an ocean view room on the 6th floor which has a terrific view. The room was nice and we had no problems checking in. We arrived late (midnight) as our flight was late and our room was ready for us. The breakfast buffet is your best bet moneywise, but $20.00 is expensive when you don't eat a lot for breakfast (but we know Maui is not cheap). The location of the hotel was great, close to everything so we usually went out to eat.. It was a short drive to Lahaina or Napili and a short walk to the Whaler's Village. Just up the road (a five-minute walk) from the resort at the Fairway Shops is a Chinese restaurant called the China Bowl which had the best Chinese food I have ever had at good prices. We ate there a couple of times. We did opt for the valet parking as it was so convenient and well worth the extra $5.00 per day. The pools are kind of sad, no extra frills, but the beach was amazing. The water was warm, although the waves were a bit rough on a few days after the Tsunami. Got caught in a riptide and was possibly the scariest moment in my life, but survived it and the Tsunami and it is now a great story. I would definitely stay at the Royal Lahaina again.

Reviews.Title: “Would certainly stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: kwallin
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawaii-spent 9 days in Honolulu/Waikiki to visit with friends-then went to Maui for 5 days. We stayed in a garden cottage-really liked our room-especially the lanai for our morning coffee. The room was comfortable and clean, the Luau was great-really enjoyed the entertainment and food. The evening entertainment on the outdoor dining room was excellant-especially the hula dancer!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Stuffs, Fantastic View, Wonderful Time!!”
Reviews.Author: New_Travelver
Reviews.Content: We went to Royal Lahaina Resort on March, 2011 for our 5th Anniversary. We booked through Expedia.com. Unfortunately, we forgot to mention the special request. After we realized, it was too late to fix anything. When we arrived at the hotel, we mentioned to the front dest guy. He was so nice to upgrade our room to the entirely different than what we paid for. We got the side of an ocean view instead of the garden view. The view was amazing, and just sitting at the balcony was so relaxing. The only thing that we were kinda surprised was there were no FREE parking at the resort. Self-parking is $10/night, Valley parking is $15/night with tips when you pick up your car (tips is an optional though between $2-$5/each time, we did tip everytime we pick up our car anyway.) So, we went all out with the Valley Parking service (believe me, you wouldn't want to park it yourself), it was well worth it. The room was so clean, the stuffs was so friendly, the atmosphere was relaxing, the view was fantastic, everything was just perfect. The food was amazing, the dinner with self-seating was so convenient.The guy who played guitar with the lady who danced just another additional for another romantic night. One thing though, the breakfast serve at 7-11 a.m.---if you're late, they will be a big line. So, try to be there around 7 or 8 a.m. You can charge everything to your room, and pay when you check out. The breakfast buffet is the best price at $19.50/person. We recommended trying Papaya, it was so juicy. We're also recommended trying to see the Expedia Local Expert, which located just right outside the door. They'll be able to give you some coupon which you'll be able to use it at the hotel & somewhere else. The Expedia Local Expert Concierge was fantastic, especially Derrick. The ice-cream was rejuvenating. The beach was so close enough to just be able to pop-in & pop-out. With two swimming pools & a lot of seating giving us a lot of choices. We've a blast on this trip. Like we all know "Non of Hawaii trip is cheap", but we believe Royal Lahaina Resort was well worth it. It was a fantastic vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the cottage rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ak_gb
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about the cottage rooms after reading some negative reviews. Within our party we had 6 cottage rooms. They were wonderful and relaxing! We are making planes to return next year. Best vacation ever. Don't listen to the negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “incredible ocean view and free luau viewing, but had to hassle for it”
Reviews.Author: skirtandsupersuit
Reviews.Content: we booked our hotel on priceline for under $100/night and expected to be offered an upgrade to the tower for $40 more per night per the reviews here. when checking in, we were the upgrade would be over $100 more! so we asked for an ocean view in the garden cottages and we were told there were no ocean view rooms available. then the woman waiting on us took a phone call and kept us waiting ... we expressed our irritation and she said she would see what she could do. knowing that the view was the most important thing to us, she put us in an oceanview room at the inn. the rooms at the inn are fairly run down and basic (definitely not luxury), but she came through. the ocean view was absolutely breathtaking - nothing between us and the beach/water - and made the stay here worthwhile. we also got a free view of the luau from our hallway because of how the luau is situated. i wouldn't want to deal with the hassle again and the inn is really run down. if i was searching for value, i would probably look for something on another part of the island like kihei rather than searching on kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst hotel stay I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: quattro29
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler, typically staying in hotels 150 +/- days a year for the last 15 years. I have never complained about a hotel stay before. I booked the room through Priceline. When we arrived, they advised us they could not honor our reservation. We had to either accept a room at their older, non-resort hotel or pay significantly more for a suite. Not having a back-up option and having already paid for the room, we accepted the room at the older hotel. It was a huge mistake. The room smelled so badly (mainly of mold) that we would not stay in it for more than sleeping and quick showers. There were RODENT DROPPINGS on the floor in the bathroom, visible mold throughout the room and the promised 'view' was of a tall fence hiding the dumpy hotel from their luau area. It was gross, unclean and completely unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Royal Lahaina Resort!”
Reviews.Author: momandherson
Reviews.Content: My son and I just returned from an eight day vacation in Maui. We were so glad we stayed at the Royal Lahaina because of the location, service and surroundings. Everything we requested at time of booking was honoured, from being on a higher floor, to a room close to the ocean, to the golf course side of the hotel. The service was always friendly and helpful. I read many TA reviews before we left, and am happy to say that we did not encounter any of the problems that were mentioned. We loved the tours we booked from the hotel, even though they were a bit pricey, well worth the money for convenience of not having to drive. We did not rent a car; we just relied on the complimentary trolley and county bus. Strolling along Front Street in Lahaina was lots of fun. All in all, a fantastic vacation and we would love to return!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: noble220
Reviews.Content: I love the easy beach access--the best beach too. My wife swam with a sea turtle 50 feet out from the beach. Love the pineapple flavored water in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for a Maui vacation!”
Reviews.Author: augusthoneymoon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 6 day/5 night stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort in Maui. We've been to Maui before and stayed at The Hyatt at our last visit, this time around we didn't want to spend a lot of money on the hotel as we don't spend all that much time at the hotel itself. So, we booked the Royal Experience package on Hawaiian Airlines which included an Ocean View room for 5 nights, a welcome bottle of champagne, a sunset dinner cruise, a luau, and free breakfast buffet each morning. Prior to booking the hotel, I did a lot of research online and read the reviews regarding the Royal Lahaina and their rooms and cottages. I knew that we definitely wanted to be in the remodeled tower and not the cottage. I also read a lot about people who showed up and their rooms were not available and so they were offered alternatives for their first night. During our check in, we were advised that our Ocean View room was not available, they were overbooked. The hotel clerk offered to put us in the Kaanapali Inn for the first night and upgrade us to the Deluxe Ocean View for the remaining four nights. So, we would be downgraded the first night and then upgraded the remaining four nights. He also threw in free self-parking for the trip, a $50 value. I didn't put up a fight as I don't think it's the clerks fault for overbooking. So, I was prepared for the downgraded room...this room was VERY much in need of remodeling. The room smelt of mildew and the room was very dingy, luckily it was only for a night. We ran into another couple who checked in earlier that day and recieved the same sad news, they were overbooked and their Ocean View room was not available and they were offered the downgraded room as well. However, they refused and asked that the hotel figure it out. They ended up getting placed in the Deluxe Oceavn View room on their first night and were allowed to stay in the room throughout their entire stay. A part of me wishes I would have put up a fight to get the same deal. But it was vacation and I wasn't in the mood to argue. They made the move easy, we just packed our things and they moved our belongings the next morning by 11 AM. We were already out and about on the town. The new room was fabulous, we were placed on the 11th of 12 floors and the Deluxe Ocean View was very much like an Ocean Front view. The difference between Deleuxe Ocean and Ocean View is that the Deluxe Ocean views are the rooms closer to the ocean, whereas the Ocean View rooms are towards the back of the building. The room itself was very clean, modern, and fresh. When we stayed at The Hyatt in the past, the room was very dated and somewhat dark. These rooms were bright and open. The buffet breakfast was good. I love papaya and had that just about every morning. The selection was quite large. You could pick from fresh fruits, pastries, breads, bagels, granola, cereals, oatmeals, pancakes, waffles, french toast, eggs, sausage, potatoes, etc. I think this was a great value as everyone who's been to Hawaii knows...food is expensive here! The luau was not bad. I read all these horrific reviews and was prepared for the worst, It wasn't bad. We went to the Old Lahaina Luau at our last visit and had low expectations for this luau. In fact, the experience was good and the food was as good as any luau buffet food...decent. The pools at the hotel were basic and small. The pool at The Hyatt was a lot nicer. You're not going to want to hang out at the pool at this hotel, there just aren't any amenitites (swim up bar, water slides, ambiance, etc.). This hotel doesn't have a spa or a fitness facility either. However, for a great room in a good location, I would recommend this hotel hands down. The location is very good and the rooms and views and grounds are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the tower”
Reviews.Author: Iowa_mon
Reviews.Content: We booked the ocean front cottage room category and opted out after seeing the room. We were not happy with the cottages and were told that we could upgrade to an ocean view room in the tower. We negotiated the price for an ocean front room and were very happy. The staff and grounds were excellent. All of the staff were wonderful. They all greeted us with an â€œalohaâ€� and a smile. The beach is one of the best in Maui. It was not crowded like the other resorts and was very clean. We snorkeled at black rock and drove to Honolua bay to snorkel there. We saw more whales from our room than we did on the whale boat tour. We were very happy that we took our binoculars. My wife would sit on our balcony and watch the whales for hours. This is a very nice resort for the money. The food at the resort was ok and we found that the Maui food, in general, was not that outstanding for the price. Get the $16 a day package that pays for self parking, use of the safe, free phone calls, and two myties a day. Itâ€™s worth the money just in the cost of the myties.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for "OCEAN VIEW" rooms”
Reviews.Author: bbbananas
Reviews.Content: We specifically picked an "ocean view" room when booking this hotel. Their website claims an ocean view room is one where you can see the ocean from inside the room. In reality they have 4 classifications of rooms because most are sideways to the ocean. To see the ocean we had to go onto the balcony and look past all the other balconies to the far fight. If you really want an ocean view you MUST specify a deluxe ocean view or ocean front. After complaining to the manager we were finally moved to the other side of the building Beware! they are truly a bait and switch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, an absolute bargain for the location”
Reviews.Author: JulzieJ1
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to a partial ocean view room upon arrival, it was just beautiful, and the room was clean, modern and big. This hotel is a short walk (about 10 mins along the beach) from the other resorts and restaurants, shops etc, but so much cheaper to stay here. The pools and beach were never too crowded, and the bar area is nice. We went to the luau one night which was also good. We learnt to not try and park around the times the luau was starting or ending because the car park gets crazy and you can't get a park anyway! Other than that, had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Lahaina.”
Reviews.Author: enchantment2
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawaii and we were thrilled with the Royal Lahaini Resort! We stayed for a week in an ocean front cottage and loved it. The room has a patio, large dressing area, King bed, tub, fridge and lots of drawer space. We had a lovely room adjacent to the lawn and a wonderful Ocean view from our ground level cottage. We left our slider open each night to listen to the crashing waves. We played the Kaanapali Royal golf course just steps from our door, excellent golf. The beach was the best on the Island in our opinion, less people, wonderful sand and you can see Molakai and Lanai from the resort. The staff was very friendly, especially Jared and Eddie. We had the package with the free Mai Tai and they were the best I have ever had. We feel we had a true Hawain experience. I read reviews prior to leaving and many people said they did not like the cottages, we loved ours. On our last day, 3 whales swam within 100 yards of the beach, closer than on our whale watching trip! We will be booking for 10 days next year at the Royal Lahaina. Ask for an end cottage as they have no room above them. On a scale of 1 to 10 this resort gets a 9!

Reviews.Title: “A great resort on an awesome beach!”
Reviews.Author: KatjaMaria
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival, we were told that they had upgraded us (for free) from the cottage to a tower room with oceanview. In my opinion, oceanview needs further defining, however! Nonetheless, our room was fantastic, comfortable, and clean with a view on part of the ocean (& Lanai'i), the gardens, and the mountains... The side we were on was a bit noisy -- a huge A/C machine a couple of floors below us, road noise... but overall well worth what we paid for!!! The claim that there are refrigerators in the room is false advertising, however. We purchased some breakfast & lunch foods (to keep the overall cost of eating on Hawaii down) that needed to be refrigerated. Well, the so-called refrigerators are no colder than room-temperature, and when maintenance was sent to our room to take a look, we were told that we had not a fridge but a mini bar cooler set around 50 degrees or so. WTF? Who drinks their beverages this warm? Anyway, this was quite a disappointment, since our trip depended somewhat on the availability of a fridge in the room. It also would have been nice to have a fitness center available--since they call themselves a "resort." Last, the beach the resort is located on is simply beautiful & lovely-- only sand & no corals close to the beach, on which one can get hurt kind of like around the area of the Hyatt... All in all, this place was well worth the $$$, and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms in the tower”
Reviews.Author: Bucket_list25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort as a part of our 25th anniversary. It was a nice location on the beach and still close to the action in Lahaina. The only real downfalls are no free internet and self parking. Go to CJ's Deli just a walk up the road. AWESOME food and free net. $10 a day for self parking is average cost and OK if you can find a spot. But when you circle through the lot for 3 times waiting to get a opening that might fit a scooter...that stinks. I made a rule the first night after the third time it was back to the valet and they could do it. Now that I'm home...I'll give you a trick I learned. There is a tree in the lot with cones to block off spots because the roots pushed up taking out 6-8 spots. That's is now your reserved parking. I had the bride move the cones and I'd park the car. When we left, she put them back. Shhh...don't tell anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, great service!”
Reviews.Author: MollyandDoug
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Royal Lahaina and enjoyed every minute! The hotel is beachfront and not crowded. It's a very short walk to Whalers Village. Ocean View Terrace Restaurant is good but a little pricey. Another restaurant on site (Italian) but we did not try. All of the staff members were awesome. The Luau was great as well. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “rooms to accomadate all types- large family vacation and it was amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: mrscampell
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Maui the first week of February and I never wanted to leave. Our hotel, Royal Lahaina was great. I stayed there about 10 years ago and it is much nicer than our last trip. It was my wedding this time! We had 23 in our group- and the Royal Lahaina had a room to fit everyones needs. We had a couple families/groups stay in the 1 bedroom cottages and then several couples including myself and my husband stayed in the ocean view or partial ocean view tour rooms. cottages are less luxurious than the tour but great for function. weather you are a group of 4 singles or a family with several kiddos the cottages were the way to go for those guests. For the couples- the ocean view rooms couldnt' have been more perfect. The dark wood work and beautiful lanai made for an excellent value. I booked through costco travel and we had originally went with the partial ocean view but for the difference in price the ocean view is the way to go. 3rd floor looks at the roof... 7th floor (our floor) was a PERFECT view of the beach and even the gardens. We were able to see the luau at night from our room. we wanted to sleep with our slider open but the noisy old women that didn't leave their lanai all week were cackling until the wee hours of the night... hey but at least they were enjoying their vacation too!
