I think people who visit maui are laid back people and if you want an authentic hawaiian vacation the Royal Lahaina makes you feel the essence of Maui. I wish the restaurant by the pool had a little better service and quality in food. drinks are amazing! entertainment by the pool/restaurant was awesome! our last day we found this great breakfast place at the entrance of the hotels (the comfort zone) awesome breakfast/lunch for half the price of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it agan and again”
Reviews.Author: fbstar73
Reviews.Content: What can I say this was our third time here in 3 years. It seemed that some of the staff remembered us. The cabana was great way to get a break from the sun. The pool was refreshing to cool of from the sun. Their beach is amazing with spectacular views. The view from our ocean view room was fantastic with this being whale season. The room was very clean with no problems. The restaurant on site is fabulous we didn't have any bad food. We had a late flight and they let us use the pool and they stored our luggage. Our original check out time was 10 am they pushed it back to 1 pm for us plus let us use a cottage suite right before we had to leave for the airpot to freshen up. We were married here in 2007 and none of our guest had any problems. Any request that we had were met with no problems. The resort also has live entertainment by the pool at night. They also have a little convience store whiched carried sandwiches and drinks made it easy to plan for the next day. And if your kids can't find something to do at the beach and pool than your kids don't know how to mother nature.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Hyatt, but a great place for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Jodywoj
Reviews.Content: Our room was a partial ocean view, partial mountain view. The rooms were all recently updated and very comfortable. The lobby needed some updating as did the restaurant . It appears they have plans to update the public areas when the new villas are constructed. The staff were all very polite and kind. I attended a seminar at the hotel, so the price for our rooms was discounted, but even at full price, the hotel was a bargain. You do get what you pay for. The hotel didn't offer the ammenities of the higher priced resorts, but what it did offer, it did very well. I would consider returning without hesitation and look forward to planned updates.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great views, Very Nice!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: texasshark688
Reviews.Content: Very NICE surprise! The value is great, and the location between Kapula and Lahaina was perfect. The tower rooms were nice with very comfortable beds and fanatic views of the beaqch and whales jumping. Two nice pools and great access to the wonderful beach. "no wonder the Royal Hawaiians lived here" Hotel and staff are very friendly, food and entertanment was very good. For this price you will not find a better hotel. Is it a $500.00 per night ? No, But it is a very nice place with a good atmosphere, great location to golf, beaches , Whalers mall and everything else!! I have lived in the Islands when I was station at Pearl Harbor and have been to Maui over 10 times and I would not hesitate to stay at the Royal Lahaina again! Get an ocean view room from the 8th floor up on north side and you will love have coffee out there everymorning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, if not overly impressive”
Reviews.Author: bikergirlNYC
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was fine. It's slightly apart from the string of resorts just south making it a bit quieter and the beach there much less crowded. My stay on Maui was broken up with 2 nights before and 2 nights after a few days on the smaller island of Lana'i so I ended up trying out both the Royal Lahaina's highrise main hotel and one of their cottages on the grounds. The highrise rooms are updated with nice woods and marble, but the shower leaked and the mini-fridge was just barely cool and non-adjustable. I also was unable to get the pay-per-view movie channel to work or to order dinner from room service about 10 minutes before the stated closing time. As for my second stay, in the cottage, the interior was not updated (and needs to be) and the in-wall air conditioner was an eyesore, kind of noisy, and didn't do a great job of cooling. On the other hand, it felt kind of homey and it was lovely having a lanai where you could step right onto the grounds and walk right out to the beach. Great for sunsets! The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, there is a convenience store for sundries, snacks and souvenirs on the grounds, and a free shuttle trolley to the other hotels and a shopping plaza nearby. Black Rock, next door at the Sheraton and in easy walking distance, is a public beach with good snorkeling. I swam with giant sea turtles, stingray, and tons of colorful fish.

Reviews.Title: “Price is what you pay...value is what you get!”
Reviews.Author: richjoy403
Reviews.Content: Glad we bought Costco ground package...briefly: First, you'll be disappointed if you normally book mega hotels and ships. The Royal Lahaina is no mega hotel (for us that's a good thing). Admittedly, the food is very good, but not gormet. We saw several couples with small children at the hotel, and also a couple and guests being married there. Second, we had a wonderful time, and would definitely return if Costco offers a similar package. Third, suggestions for those going...if book an ocean-view, for maximum use of balcany ask for north side of hotel (offers both shade and view of the most ocean, whales, and beach); even with a rental car, use the convenient free trolley to visit Whaler's Village to avoid costly parking; staff is more friendly than larger hotels; nightly beachside entertainment and torch lighting are nice touch; rooms are fully adequate and clean; small refrigerator is nice; there is a very tasty deli (CJ's) with free 'hot spot' in the fairway shops only 2 blocks walk from the hotel; finally location (free Internet at the hotel is limited to 15 minutes per session), location, location! Kaanapali Beach is the finest. We upgraded to a delux oceanview. We were on the (top) 12th floor, and stayed 2 weeks. This was the only time my wife has EVER not wanted to return home at the end of a vacation! Hawaii is very expensive (e.g.; buffet breakfast is $20, mai-tai is $9). We highly recommend the Costco package for its many inclusive features...check it out. (We read some unfavorable reviews of the cotteges--as we stayed in the tower, we can't comment on the cotteges.)

Reviews.Title: “ok but no 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Travelicious55
Reviews.Content: First off, Maui is fantastic, a beautiful romantic island. Really magical. But this is about the hotel, not the island. The 'shtick' they use with booking this place is that you can get a decent rate on line (ie: Priceline for example), but the only room type shown is 'hotel room', so when you get there, they tell you you are getting a garden cottage.. and after reading others comments the cottages are dirty/etc....so.then tell you if you want a tower (more newly renovated room) that you can get it for an upcharge of lets say $50 per night. We did that just to save ourselves the grief. My main regret is that I didn't quote lower on priceline. It was ok but noisy. Luau every night gets on ones nerves after the third time, also the soundproofing to hallway is non existent and all doors tend to slam. In our opinion, condo rentals are just a far better value than most hotels. There are nice hotels but in Maui and in high season, you get what you pay for. Also best food we had on the island was Whole Foods in Kahalui - even counting the restaurants we ate at. Do NOT recommend the Lahaina Fish Co. , service was lousy, food below average at $30+ per plate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place & Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Uniballer
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights - 2 in a cottage and 1 night in the tower. If you don't enjoy the camping vibe, I would pay the extra $45 at the front desk and upgrade to the tower if you're not already in it. It's fantastic. They say it's a promo, but other posters mentioned it so I knew the offer was coming when i got to the desk. One the first morning staying in the cottage, I found a small insect in the bathroom. No biggie. The second morning though, the insect was beyond my expectations. HUGE! It's the tropics, so I get it, but called the front desk to let them know and they were nice enough to offer the tower room as an apology. Beautiful room, great view of the mountains / ocean etc. from the tower. In summary: Really nice beach, incredibly tight parking, and good value for money, - cottage bug with hairy legs aside.

Reviews.Title: “Slept like the dead”
Reviews.Author: travelmama79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights after getting married. It was a gift so I'm not sure how the booking and all that went. I was told the place was very well priced. Upon our arrival the staff was very friendly. Our room was suppose to be a garden view on the 4th floor but we had a clear view of the ocean. The room was recently updated with lovely decor; white and a deep wood. The bathroom was modern, large shower and a nice sink area with great little complimentary soaps and stuff. The flat screen tv was great and the HUGE bed was so comfortable...we slept like the dead. We liked our bed so much we wound up buying a very similar one. The view was perfect, great to wake up to and sit on the balcony while drinking a cup of Kona Coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Garden Cottage”
Reviews.Author: shippa241
Reviews.Content: Was a bit apprenhensive after reading an earlier criticism of the Garden Cottage. However, the location was great, facing the fairways. It was nice and quiet during the night. The room initially smelt musty, but this quickly dissipated. The aircon struggled. The bedroom/living room was a good size, although their was water stains on the ceiling. The bathroom was appalling. It was clean, but it was so dated and in drastic need of modernisation. For the amount of money we paid we were extremely disappointed. Even at half of what we paid it would have been borderline. It was not unpleasant, just not value for money in a "resort". The overall area and the restaraunt were great value. We saw whales off the beach everyday. It was an easy 20 min walk to Whalers Village where shops and other restaraunts can be found. If it wasn't for the quality of the cottage rooms I would have no hesitation in recommending the resort. We still had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jp4190
Reviews.Content: Me and my girl hade a wonderful time everone that worked there was very very nice. the guy that worked in the customer center set me up some tee times. Food was good . the view of the wales jumping was nice. All the employees were the best. we are going to stay there again next year. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great view.”
Reviews.Author: PortlandMorgan
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to one of the more expensive rooms and it was wonderful. The room was clean, comfortable, and pretty. The staff were all friendly and I loved the complimentary pineapple water in the lobby. The breakfast buffet was really expensive and not very good but all the other food we ate there was great. The beach in front of the hotel was also one of the better ones. The best part of the hotel though was the view. We stayed during whale watching season and were able to spot a whale from our balcony every 3 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “New Rooms, soft beds, Great Views!”
Reviews.Author: lasvegaskarie
Reviews.Content: Due to mother nature, we were upgraded to this very nice room on the 12th floor ( from the Bungalows, which we also enjoyed... ) here are some photos of our views! Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: mjmarco3
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week for a conference. Rooms in Kai Tower newly and nicely remodeled. Rooms far from ocean front have some highway noise. Oceanfront rooms have excellent views of beach,pools and ocean. Lots of staff around; very helpful and friendly. Poolside chairs and amenities just fair. No facilities or services on beach, but the beach is right there on the other side of a hedge, and is great. Great swimming beach. Best to rent a poolside ocean view cabana for the day and you get the best use of beach and pools.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: HolidayBonny154937
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a four star and the staff were great , I loved the room and view from the fourth floor. It is just what I expected and the grounds beautiful. Looked at the cottages they were a three star and quaint , but had private deck to sit in the sun . But I liked tower was best. IF you need night life try the luau , it was really fun and the food good too. Or go into town and have a meal at Bubba Gumps or Mala. If it rains try the Aquarium or shop the cannery mall and take in the local talent free show hula. Really cute. Golf was world class courses but not cheep. Basil tomatoe resturant was very lacking and I would pass on it. Service was really poor and prices really high and quantitys small. I would definalty go back to this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: HolidayBonny
Reviews.Content: Dont listen to those awful comments. We arrived to a great and very pretty 4 star hotel. The gardens are beautiful and well maintained. The hotel staff were friendly helpful and reliable. The cleaning staff worked extra hard and were very prompted. I would definatly come again. But if you want night life pop into town. things are quiet here in the evening. The cottages are a 3 star and quaint. But you get a deck and can sit outside and enjoy the sun, But I loved the tower and ocean view room even from the fourth floor. The food was good and well priced and the Drinks and coffee mmm good. The beach walk is great and Whalers village a good walk in the sunshine. Visited the Marine Aquarium on the rainy day and shopped the Cannery Mall. Loved the local talent free show. The Luau was wonderful and good food. Just what I was expecting. The Basil Tomatoe Resturant was lacking volume for the price. Service was not good either , I would pass on that one. Try Bubba Gumps and Malas on the beach.. Both fantastic. Dukes was a good walk away but worth it, great food. Enjoy your vacation.. we sure did.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful views, quality of hotel lacking”
Reviews.Author: deliciousVancouver
Reviews.Content: the staff is not knowledgeable, we were looking for a laundromat and they sent us to this complex called timesquare and there wasn't one, upon our return I pointed that out and she didn't even apologize. The cleanliness is a big thing for us, our bathroom toilet the only thing that was cleaned was the bowl not the seat you sit on nor the lid, the shower had mold. The bed was extremely comfortable so thats a plus.We had the royal lahaina experience package which gives you a buffet breakfast, sunset sail, and luau. The breakfast was disgusting, bugs and flies were everywhere, when I pointed that out to the restaurant manager he said thats to be expected because they are under a plantation and due to the rain they've had..bla bla bla...I pointed out that its no the case at the other hotels just yours...he then shrugged his shoulders. I then pointed out how a long piece of hair was in the corn beef hash, he again shrugged his shoulders...he asked me what I wanted..I said remove the breakfast out of the package its disgusting he obliged but said it wasn't up to him...It just baffles me with this hotel why are you trying to appease me when you don't even have the final say? We dined at the sheraton after the first day..and the breaky, and lunch there was excellent! I will say the Royal Lahaina luau was great! So book that its entertaining and fun! Also, the sunset sail with Teralani 2 company was awesome, the dinner, drinks and seeing the amazing whales was well worth it and in part made up for the poor hotel. There isn't much to do for kids at this hotel, so if you have kids its going to be boring. Its not bad for couples if you can put up with the above things we went through. We usually stay at Westin, Sheraton and Fairmont properties maybe thats why it was a shell shock for us.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: otis222
Reviews.Content: Having spent a few days at the Sheraton next door, we moved to this hotel for an 11 day stay. The Oceanfront Cottage Room promised " full ocean/sunset views". Please see the photographs posted. The Cottage we were allocated stank of urine, and looked as if it had been last upgraded in the 70s. How anybody can write a positive report about this place is beyond me! Eventually, we were moved to a room in the main block, (with a lovely view of the carpark, see the photograph posted). The room was so small you could not swing a cat. However, to add insult to injury, the Resort had decided to embark on building work in peak season, ( without prior warning). Just imagine travelling 1000's of miles to be on a construction site! The response from the charming front desk staff was, "if you check out early we will fine you 3 nights stay". More photographs are available of the peace and tranquility you could enjoy at this wonderful Resort. If you are looking to stay at any resort in Lahaina the Sheraton would be my recommendation. Moreover, do not book with Hotels.com. They are totally uninterested in valid customer complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, will come back to stay soon!”
Reviews.Author: anngel0107
Reviews.Content: Our stay during the Christmas holiday was wonderful. It took us about 45 minutes to get the resort from the OGG airport, and there was a wonderful cheery lady at the gate to welcome us. We self parked our rental car for $10/night, and after a speedy check-in, we we headed up to our room in the high rise tower. Our 11th floor ocean view room was extremely gorgeous, newly updated, and had breathtaking views of upper Kaanapali beach and island of Molokai. We spent a lot our days out on the beach and exploring the towns nearby. But there was also a balcony with 2 chairs and a small table where we enjoyed early morning and late night views. The hotel staff is very friendly, as is every local in Maui. I can't wait to go back to Maui and stay at this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for extended family vacation”
Reviews.Author: lah0718
Reviews.Content: My Dad wanted to take us all on a vacation over Christmas so we chose the Royal Lahaina. There were 13 of us in all, ranging in age from 11 to 81 and everyone had a great time. We booked through Costco and got a great package deal with breakfast every day, the luau, and the dinner cruise included. We stayed in the Ocean Tower and upgraded my Dad to an Ocean Front room. This resort was perfect for our extended family, it was close enough to the beach that my Dad could relax on his lanai and still see us. It was a lot quieter than the mega resorts on Kannapali but still had everything we could want. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We had a nice time in a tower room”
Reviews.Author: miumiu4me
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Maui for the second half of our Hawaii vacation. The Royal has a nice location, it's near Whaler's Village and it's on a beautiful beach. There are a few places to eat on the property; we only tried the main place in the building, it was passable. The service was kind of spotty. We stayed in a tower room that we booked through beachdestinations.com. The resort is a little old fashioned, but the room was modern and nice. I heard bad things about the cottages, but I never went into one. There are two hotel pools. There is also a jaccuzzi, but it's far away from the pools, and some tennis courts we never checked out. The grounds are very pretty and nicely maintained. Overall, we enjoyed the property and we'd return. It's not the nicest place I've ever stayed, but it met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hija_del_sol
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for three nights on a short hop to Maui, and decided to splurge. Although it was much more expensive than I would normally pay, I believe it was cheaper than most of the other places in the same area, so in that sense it was a great value. NOTE: Fly into KAPALUA airport if you can! We mistakenly went to Kahalui, and it cost us $100 R/T for a shuttle! Here are the plusses: - Location on the far side of Black Rock (from Lahaina) is much more peaceful than the Whaler's Village side, and though we were told that the resorts were all sold out for the holidays, the beach and pool were never crowded. - Black Rock snorkeling reef is only a short walk away! Also, trolley/bus system to Lahaina was pretty easy and cheap if you don't have a car. - The terrace bar/restaurant has good food, happy hour, and a fantastic view of Moloka'i and Lana'i, and one day we even saw whales frolicking close enough to photograph! - View from the balcony (lanai) was great, but only after we asked to be moved to the other side of the hotel (see below). - Hotel guests get a discount at the luau, but I would check the Expedia reservations office (just outside the front door), in case they have better deals. Minor complaints: - Nowhere to wash feet when entering hotel from beach. - Room was beautiful, but layout was a little weird - and on one side, the "partial ocean view" rooms are right over the restaurant roof and ventilation machinery - very noisy. - Woman working "Dining Reservations" was distinctly unpleasant - unlike everyone at the front desk and valet!

Reviews.Title: “Tower rooms are great cottage rooms are the pits”
Reviews.Author: cam030
Reviews.Content: We booked the trip through a travel agent and when we arrived we were taken on a golf cart to one of the cottages. It was dim, dirty and depressing. There was a comment card in the cottage that was filled out one month earlier and never collected. There was an empty water bottle under the bed, the tv screen was filthy and the refrigerator froze our food. The closet door was off the track. We asked to move into the tower and the hotel was full that night but we did move into a better room for $100 extra per night. On checkout, we received the bill and it was $960 when it should have been $346. they charged us $200 per night and charged us that amount for the night we stayed in the filthy cottage and then charged us double the agreed upon amount for the other three nights. It took 30 minutes to get the bill straightened out. We witnessed other people having trouble with their accommodations. One man was adamant he had booked an ocean front room, the hotel said he booked ocean view. Another family had 3 adults and they were in a room with one bed. One woman and her son insisted on moving to another hotel. I don't know if the people who work here are incompetent or dishonest or both but I would suggest staying somewhere else in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE READ B-E-F-O-R-E you book!!!”
Reviews.Author: Olif_10
Reviews.Content: Alright, here is something you MUST read before thinking of making a reservation at this hotel: This hotel consists of TWO DIFFERENT room styles, which are inherently DIFFERENT from one another. First, there are the "TOWER rooms." They are the ones you will see in all their advertising on various websites: they are very nice, modern, clean etc- NO QUESTION a 4 star category (somewhat made me think of a Crowne Plaza with a nice Hawaiian touch). THEN, there are also the so-called COTTAGES. Here is my most honest assessment of the Royal Lahaina Cottages: If you have ever taken a long road trip and got to the point where you were so tired that ANY hotel/motel will do, because it is better than falling asleep at the wheel and causing injuries/death to yourself and others, and you see a "Bates Motel: rooms rented by the hour" and you think, "what the heck- it's only for a night... BELIEVE ME, ANY SHADY HOTEL OFF AN AMERICAN INTERSTATE IS N-I-C-E-R THAN THE ROYAL LAHAINA COTTAGES!!! They are old, foul-smelling and downright disgusting!!!!!!!!! Of course their only availability for OUR stay was a cottage room. After I basically told the reception guy that I'd rather get a rectal exam from an unskilled West Texan oil rig worker than stay 7 nights at the cottages, he offered me an "upgrade" to a Tower room for about $280 for the 7 nights (there was a fee because we had booked a "garden view room which, according to them, could be either a Tower room OR a cottage room. The 'upgraded" room would be a partial ocean view...). Well, I was left with no choice than paying an unplanned $280 which made me less-than-happy. The reason we initially booked the Royal Lahaina was because it seemed like a better value than its neighboring properties (Sheraton, Westin, Marriott, Hyatt etc). Now, with the "upgrade costs we could have stayed at one of the other properties for more-or-less the same price... The reason why I am upset (even though ultimately the Tower Room was "great") is because of the hotel's dishonesty. YOU CANNOT ADVERTISE YOURSELF AS A 4 STAR PROPERTY WHEN A GOOD PERCENTAGE OF YOUR ROOMS ARE ABOUT 1/2 STAR QUALITY!!! If I go to a Mercedes dealership and order a luxury sedan, no sane car dealer would expect me to accept a small economy car for the same price and then expect me to pay an "upgrade charge" to get the luxury model I was under the impression of getting in the first place!!! So, again, to sum up: Tower rooms: very nice, 4 star quality etc... COTTAGES: AWFUL, would make any Econolodge seem like a 5 star hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's a strong 3 star, a little funky”
Reviews.Author: julias
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with extended family over Christmas. Royal Lahaina is a reasonably priced option on North Kaanapali beach. Because we decided pretty late in the game to go to Maui for Christmas, all of the other hotels were in the high-season-extortion mode. Normally, we like to stay at the Sheraton for its great beach and convenient location, but we just planned too late to get a decent rate there. Royal Lahaina was by far the most reasonably priced hotel on Kaanapali for this trip, although it is north of black rock and just slightly off the beaten track. We had 3 rooms in the tower, and all had a nice modern yet Hawaiian decor. I think another review mentioned this, but one thing odd was that in the ocean front rooms, the vanity area is open and looks like it should be a wet bar. I think it was left open so that you can see the view from that part of the room, but it's a little strange. My relatives were in partial ocean view rooms, and the vanities in their rooms were enclosed, which seemed a little more normal. One other oddity is the mini-fridge. We were informed that it is actually a "chiller" not a fridge. The difference is that it does not get very cold. Not a big deal, but don't try to keep perishables in the chiller. After reading all of the TA reviews, I still wasn't sure what to expect. The tower rooms have been renovated, but I'd guess that the rest of the hotel has not been. It is a bit funky, in a retro kind of way. The hotel does grow on you. On advice of the TA reviews, we got the "value package" that included 2 mai tais per day, valet parking, and the newspaper. After being w/family every day, the mai tais, were great. There is a nice casual bar area near the pool where there are Hawaiian singers in the evening. (As a side note, the lower floor ocean front rooms can be a little loud during the entertainment b/c they are directly above the restaurant/bar area.) The pool was better than expected, but it is not on the scale of a mega-resort. It is a good size, and pretty relaxing. The lounge chairs were comfy, although they could use more of them. The room service menu was extremely limited, so we did not try it. We had high hopes for the Don the Beachcomer bar, as it looked kitchy and retro from the outside. But, it seemed more like a holding pen for the luau crowd, so we bailed. It could have just been bad timing on our part. The little store on property is convenient and well-stocked. We also found a good little breakfast spot called the Castaway Cafe, which is located on the property just north of Royal Lahaina (I think it's condos). All and all, this was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with it”
Reviews.Author: EricDurham
Reviews.Content: My Priceline bid was accepted by Royal Lahaina for a decent price and after reading all the reviews about cottages I was worried I might get them. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a partial ocean view room on the 9th floor. We are very happy with the room and the resort overall. I canâ€™t comment on the cottages because I havenâ€™t experienced them. The only complain about it is the parking lots are too narrow only a Mini Cooper can fit in it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: tiffany4567
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five night stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort, and would happily have stayed longer! The resort is beautiful, our 9th floor, partial ocean view room was nice and modern, and the view from our lanai was absolutely INCREDIBLE.. I wish I was still waking up to it everyday! The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the cleaning staff did a great job on the room. The hotel is in a rather quiet area, so if you like hustle and bustle then this is not the hotel for you. We enjoyed just relaxing and not doing much at all! The beach is fantastic, and not too crowded (nothing like Waikiki beach, where you are almost sitting in someone's pocket!). We booked a package that included buffet breakfast, which we enjoyed every day. The morning staff were lovely, though we did go for dinner one night and watied 20 minutes to get a menu, and another 20 to get drinks and our food order taken, so decided to go somewhere else! I think I can narrow this bad experience down to one staff member, who fortunately wasn't on at breakfast time. The rest of the staff were great, and although breakfast was always very busy, you never had to wait too long for a table. Our package also included the Luau at the resort, which was good fun, and a sunset cruise with Teralani, which we highly recommend. It was a beautiful way to end our trip. Overall, we had a fantastic stay at the Royal Lahaina, and would happily return!!

Reviews.Title: “customer service needs some work”
Reviews.Author: gbritfl
Reviews.Content: Our trip started off with us checking into the room we booked 3 months in advance with information that there were no rooms available so we would have to stay in the inn next door. This was basically like a motel 8 when we were expecting a luxury resort. The room was horrible. The next night they checked us into our originally booked room at the royal lahaina. The rooms in the tower are nice, very comfortable and clean, the view was ok too considering it was only supposed to be partial ocean, we enjoyed it. The part that was absolutely ridiculous though was upon check out, we reviewed the bill and they had charged us the full rate for the room the 1st night in the crappy motel next door, when we complained they said they had given us 1 free breakfast (a whopping $20 value). When we complained further they said that we had "chosen" to stay there instead of staying at the royal lahaina in exchange for free breakfast. Now they were just lying! Why on earth would we have chosen to stay at a crappy hotel in exchange for a free breakfast. After finally talking to management they gave us free parking which amounted to around $50. Still I beleive we should not have payed for the first night since it was not what we booked and obviously the hotels fault for overbooking. I heard from other guests that the same thing had been done to them. This is obviously a very hotel poor policy and terrible customer service. Another One of the problems we encountered was that everything closes very early including their room service and shop. When we called front desk to ask for suggestions they actually suggested we go to pizza hut "um get a concierge that has a clue". The pool is nice but very small and frequently the lounge chairs would fill up very early. I would not return after the run around we got on the first night!

Reviews.Title: “"AWSOME RESORT"”
Reviews.Author: tulips0611jg
Reviews.Content: Awsome resort! Casual setting and not stuffy at all. 2nd time staying at the Royal Lahaina, at their new renov. tower this year. Absolutely awsome! Beautiful ocean front room views. Beach waters are always great & next to black rock which is great for snorkeling. Their restaurant food was included in our pkg and let me tell you, it was always delicious. No need to go anywhere else. Look up "Mr.Ford" food/mgr., you will sure get the best service ever. "He is "AWSOME" no words can describe his genuine cust./svc. Their cust.svc. & staff are truly their highlight at this resort. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Gear view from refurbished room”
Reviews.Author: Sel15
Reviews.Content: We were here on our honeymoon, we initially paid for a garden view cottage however on arrival we were offered the "managers special" which was an extra $50 p/night in an ocean view room in their newly renovated tower. The view was spectacular. The room was clean and spacious, however the bathroom did not have a vanity in it, only shower and toilet, therefore you have to do hair etc in the kitchen. The room we had did not have hotel information, which we found annoying when we first arrived to orientate ourselves. The guest service office has one computer which you can access internet for free (15 min time limit). There are two food venues on site, if you want other options you need to walk (20 minutes) or catch shuttle into Whalers Village. We enoyed the food at the bar and also enjoyed basil tomato (however more pricey). We enjoyed a relaxing time here, very close to a lovely beach and the pool amenities are good.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay there”
Reviews.Author: eugene_o
Reviews.Content: I have bid on priceline and got a pretty good rate for this hotel. The hotel is located on the north Kaanapali beach, about 15 minute walk from the main resort area. There is a trail along the beach, although it was not well illuminated at night and sometimes goes through the parking lots at the back of the hotels. The beach next to the hotel was very nice, with only a few people; the water was very calm and clear. The ocean floor was sandy - to snorkle you would need to walk a little to the north or to the south. Food options on Kaanapali were a bit limited and expensive. Few resturants and bars are open after 9PM. To have a real choice you should drive to Lahaina (5-10 min), but that means having a designated driver for the drive back. Parking was additional $10/day. When checking in, I asked for a room with internet access (another $10/day). Initially I was given a room in one of the cottages, but the WiFi signal did not reach there. After I complained (nicely), I was upgraded into a tower room for the same rate. From what I saw, the cottages were quite nice, compared to what I read in the reviews. The tower rooms, however, were much more stylish. They had mini-refridgerator, coffee maker, safe, flat-screen tv, clock radio with iPod dock and you could see the ocean from the balcony of almost every room. That said, I think the main hotel and the cottages should be marketed separately, since the customers may expect the rooms shown on the website, but get a bit more basic accomodations. The lobby of the hotel was very lively, with vendors selling souvenirs and consierge helping book activities (I cannot comment on the prices, since I did not buy anything). The restaurant had a nice open-air terrace. I've only been there for breakfast and it was very good. Just be sure not to miss the breakfast special of eggs, bacon/sausage and potatoes/rice for $7 istead of the $20 breakfast buffet. $3 for a cup of tea, though, felt like a rip-off. The swimming pools were kind of pointless, since there was the ocean a few steps away - I only seen people in them a couple of times. There was a booth renting snorkles, fins, etc. and lending beach towels for free. In summary, I really enjoyed stying there, although if I were to go again, I would probably stay in Lahaina, exchanging the gorgeous beach for being closer to civilization.

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIABLE!”
Reviews.Author: glendoraflorist
Reviews.Content: We were there celebrating our anniversary, which we will never forget. It truly was unbeliable! Everything about this resort is beyond wonderful. Especially, the attention all employees give you. There restaurant food & ocean views is exceptional, with their nightly singer & hula girl always embracing a romantic evening. The food/beverage manager "Ford" is beyond unbeliable. His attention & kindness is truly one of a kind. Mr. "Ford" your kindness is unexplainable & unbeliable, you make this resort a five star hotel. You are truly a diamond in the waters of Maui. We want to thank all employees for an unforgetable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome beach. Not to modern but it was a Hawaiian treat.”
Reviews.Author: Hoteluhowitis
Reviews.Content: Great resort with an amazing beach. Snorkling was terrific just off the shore. Didn't use the pool but a good place to have a drink or 7. Bar and resturaunt wasn't open late enough but food and service was good. Get the paradise package including 2 mai tais, parking, news paper and something else for 20 bucks a day. Internet was pay but suck it up buttercup. We were there for our honeymoon and couldn't have been happier. Stayed in the tower and was perfect. I wouldn't recomend the luau. Show was good but the food was awful. This hotel is good and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Price.”
Reviews.Author: zinse24
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not the most luxiorious hotel on the strip but it is one of the best. We stayed there twice already. One of the reason is the beach. The best beach in the area, not crowded and easy to get to from anywhere in the hotel. The pools are ok. The Breakfast Buffet is great if it is included otherwise is EXPENSIVE. Recomendation drive about a mile down the road and hit Front St and eat there. Recomendations there are the Aloha mixed plate, David Pauls Lahaina Grill and Ruth Chris Steak House. The rooms at the cottages are dated but with a local feel to them. The second time we went we got one of the new rooms at the Lahaina Tower. Those were great. They are roomy, super nice and the Ocean view like no other. I would highly recomend this hotel to anyone. Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the cottages”
Reviews.Author: CKB05
Reviews.Content: The cottage room we stayed in was filthy and smelly. Another couple staying in a cottage room also complained to us that their room smelled awful every time they walked into it. I had to open the sliding glass door just to let the odor dissipate enough to breathe. I had to clean the bathroom mirror with a hand towel in order to see in it and my husband walked across the tiled area in his dry, bare feet and actually left footprints on the floor....it was that dirty after the maid had "cleaned" it that morning. His feet were absolutely black after walking across the carpet a couple of times. Apparently washcloths are optional and very hard to come by. There were none in the room and after calling the desk for some, the maid removed the used one the next day and did not replace it. I told her I needed one, she told me to call housekeeping, and it took 2 days for washcloths to appear in our room. The faucet dripped constantly in both the shower and the bathroom sink and no one seemed to care. Trying to adjust the water temperature in the shower was a full time job.......there seemed to be two options: scalding hot or freezing cold, nothing in between. I would never stay there again! Even the dining room was dirty and I watched fruit flies swarming the uncovered, cut fruit for cocktails at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Resort...”
Reviews.Author: BettySue83
Reviews.Content: My husband and i chose the Royal Lahaina Resort for our first trip to Hawaii beause we loved itslocation in Maui and because the fact that it was recently remodeled. Unfortunately the "cottages" have not been remodeled... and thats what we got.... and though i was very dissapointed that we would be spending our three year wedding anniversary in the outdated cottages i was determined to make the best of it.... Long story short... there was a MAJOR problem with the A/C unit in our room. We spoke to the front desk and then the manager... and we were moved to a different room. And i must say it was gorgeous. The room, the view, everything from that point forward was perfect in our stay. I would say make sure you stay in the main hotel... its not just the decor that has not been remodeled in the "cottages" .... but it is a beautiful resort.. with wonderful staff and a management team that takes care of problems As soon as possible...

Reviews.Title: “Best Hawaiian Vacation to date”
Reviews.Author: uk2la
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Maui. We had originally booked a package through Expedia to the Kanaapali Ocean Inn (the "budget" building at the Royal Lahaina) but upgraded to a partial ocean view at the resort. We spent one night in the tower (beautiful rooms/views) & then transferred the next day to an ocean front cottage which worked much better for us & our children (12 & 9) w/ access to the pool, beach & grass area. The rooms did not have the modern furnishings that the tower did but were comfortable and clean. All of the staff was helpful, pleasant & courteous. Be careful if you leave things out on the lanai as our daughter's boogie board was stolen however, the activities desk kindly allowed free use of one during our stay. We had the breakfast buffet once @ the hotel - which was very good but a little expensive. Other restaurants within walking distance - Castaways - next door (good, reasonable breakfast - has shuffleboard court to keep the kids occupied) & CJ's Cafe @ the Fairway Shops as you drive into the resort (great inexpensive food w/ free internet & they allow you to bring in your own beer/wine). Whaler's Village was also within walking distance which had various restaurant - but a little on the expensive side. The Expedia office onsite at the resort was helpful w/ excursions. We did the Atlantis Submarine which was good (kids 1/2 price w/ adult) & the Pacific Whale Found. snorkeling trip to Lanai (kids free w/ paying adult) which was fabulous (w/ breakfast/lunch, snorkeling & a pleasant nice & informative crew). The rest of the trip we spent on the beach, boogie boarding, snorkeling & touring the island (be careful if you decide to drive north & go around to the east side of the island - very scary one lane road!!) We've visited The Islands numerous times and this was our best all-around visit so far. We'll definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Cottages vs. Tower? Cottages are awesome!”
Reviews.Author: johnlee666
Reviews.Content: We toured both the cottages on the grounds and the tower. I have to admit, if you enjoy typical hotels you will like the newly renovated towers. They are very nice as everything is new. However it's no different for me than any other Mexican or Caribbean hotels. Walking out to the balcony I can hear the other patrons, and I realized I had to wait for the elevator. We took the cottages. They were the first in Maui, from the 60's, and it shows. Some renovations were made but the cabinets were old with the paint peeling. The AC is a wall unit that's crudely cut out with boards holding it up. Bed was on par with Motel 8, and the shower is inconsistent to the point that you can the scalded and cold in the same 5 minute time you try to clean yourself. All that goes away when you realize you are at the ground floor of a resort in Maui. Open the back door and the garden is your back yard. There are no elevators to wait for, nor people asking your for anything. Wake up, open the doors, and take a minute walk to the beach. We never heard our neighbors (we did see them) and it felt like we owned our little apartment right near the beach. You can't see the ocean from the cottage. But it's a 30 second walk. It's quiet. It's better than all the high rise hotels I've stayed in Acapulco, Cancun, Thailand, Singapore, Carribreans... For the two of us, it was cozy and awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Nickle & Dime Place”
Reviews.Author: SSDNY
Reviews.Content: Hotel location and the beach is great. every little service is money including the additional 1 hour after 12 PM check out time, the front desk wanted $100 for the hour.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort lacking good customer service.”
Reviews.Author: TakeMeAway07
Reviews.Content: My husband, 7 year old, and I just returned from Royal Lahaina Resort. We arrived in the evening around 7. Customer service definitely leaves something to be desired. Another review mentioned they didn't get an Aloha welcome, don't feel bad, because we didn't either! Although on other days we noticed people getting the full treatment (flower, warm cloths, water ect). The staff at the front desk offers no information about the resort or its facilities and when we inquired, they were less than forthcoming. It was pretty much "here's your key, there's the elevator." Not such a great start. Housekeeping staff was very courteous and always made sure we had everything we needed or wanted. The room itself is beautiful! Very clean, nice understated island decor. Gorgeous view of the ocean and the islands in the distance. The location is fabulous. The beach is perfect with calm water, perfect for swimming. It was never too crowded, lots of space. Several people snorkeled right off the beach. The two pools are just average. The chairs are good, although there's no good view of the ocean from the pool area. We didn't mind though since we spent our time on the beach. Snorkel gear, body boards, beach chairs and umbrellas are available to rent but very expensive. You're much better off renting from Snorkel Bob's for a fraction of the price (which we did). Beware that parking is very limited and you'll pay $10/day. We didn't realize this until we checked in. There's a luau at the nearby hotel every night, so parking in the evening if you return from dinner is very annoying. The luau guests never seem to park in their section of the lot, so it can be a hike back to your room. The spots are also VERY SMALL, like smartcar small. So take heed if you're driving something bigger than a compact. Overall, the best part of the resort is the beach/location, and the cleanliness of the room. We would probably stay here again if the price was right, despite the lack of customer service. I would only recommend this place to a friend after warning them about the lack of service.

Reviews.Title: “If I could, I'd move in permanently”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRoyHobbs
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Royal Lahaina, and it didn't disappoint. It just feels like I'm coming home when I arrive. This isn't the biggest or fanciest resort on the island. The pools are slightly larger than what you might see in someone's backyard. That said, you cannot beat the combination of location (the beach is never crowded and you feel like you have it to yourself), service (everybody goes out of their way to make you feel welcome, and many remembered me from my previous trip), and overall Hawaiian ambiance. My room was in the tower facing north, with a great view of Molokai from just about every angle. The dark wood and super-comfortable bed were wonderful to come back to every day. Great snorkeling within a couple of hundred yards either way, either at Black Rock or Kahekili Beach park. If you need to be around people or shopping, Whaler's Village is a 15 minute walk, and Lahaina is a 10 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “You can keep the Ritz, the Hyatt, the Fairmont & the Marrriott,we have found the best!!”
Reviews.Author: srednalf
Reviews.Content: Al that we can say is WOW,stayed all over the world and soooo enjoyed this vacation. The staff was wonderful, beautiful rooms ,double upgraded us and for a small fee had a option of a BEAUTIFUL ocean deluxe room!! Going back and always staying here. My sister stayed at the RItz went there, no thank you, and beat friend at the Grand Wailia, nothing over the friendly service, pull down service we had here. A great value and the food was great also. The Luau here was fun and food was enjoyable.Do not waist your time we checked them all out. Stay here and enjoy it all!!

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel with convenient location in paradise”
Reviews.Author: mdotlee
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via priceline for 7 night stay, Royal Lahaina resort is clustered within a handful of resorts in the Kaanapali area. We were granted a partial view ocean room upgrade after being told we were going to be given a cottage room. I would definitely not suggest that a free upgrade should be expected. It all depends on the timing and person at the front desk. We were given a north facing balcony, partial ocean view room with a king bed that was spacious and clean. The view from the room was magnificent but if you are on a lower floor, your view will be blocked by the group of buildings that house the luau and other hotel facilities, something to keep in mind when booking the location of your room. Throughout our stay, the cleaning staff was very diligent in refilling toiletries, restocking towels, and arranging the room in a neat manner. They do clean during the mornings but I only had to tell them to come back again once during the week around 8AM. The location of the hotel is very close to downtown Lahaina so nighttime activites can be filled with trips to downtown for dining/shopping/ or a leisurely stroll. Coming from New York, the distances to various towns in Maui seemed to be a little farther than what I would have preferred. Driving to Wailea, Paia, Maalea Harbor, Kihei, and Kahului would be around 45minutes - 1 hour. Not a big deal but it can be a drag if you plan on visiting each of these places during your trip and wish to see and enjoy the endless sights/experiences found throughout the island. We did not eat at the restaurant except for the breakfast buffet one morning. I would highly suggest other restaurants around the island that are excellent. The breakfast buffet is average, nothing to definitely experience. The beach is steps away from the hotel and stretches north. Snorkeling was very good at the Blackrock, saw multiple turtles up close. Whalers Village is next door with a shuttle bus from the resort providing some variety from the limited selection of shops and restaurants at the hotel. The worst aspect of the hotel was the parking. They charge you $10 a day and the spots are legitimately small. During the day the number of available sports are adequate but once nightfall arrives you can expect to park 100 yards away from the entrance of the hotel. I guess I have qualms about paying for something that is neither convenient or plentiful. The concierge was very friendly with a greeting at the gate and entrance. The front desk personnel were helpful and they did show effort to listen to your inquiries. Did not have a problem with anyone at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “probably no second time at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelcowcow
Reviews.Content: Nothing was drastically wrong, but I thought the facility itself was pretty old. The first day when we arrived, my sister and her bf were offered a room that was facing a generator. It was loud and that was the one and only view of the room's balcony. However, after complaining to the front desk, we were offered another room on the next day when other rooms became available. We also had to wait a long time for our room to be ready on the first day. This might have happened anywhere, but the wait plus the generator-facing room was not what we anticipated. I do want to give some credit to the nice beach that's just right in front of the hotel. It was clean and beautiful. Snorkeling is probably not possible because of the waves, although I didn't try. The pool area by the beach front is relaxing. We took some pictures there and the pictures turned out very nice. Next time I will pay more to stay at a nicer hotel. I would probably pick something that's closer to the center of Kaanapali beach, because of more choices for restaurants, activities, etc.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: krawner
Reviews.Content: Pros: The friendly bellmen recognized us by name every day. Concierge lent out CD guide on Road to Hana for free . Pool staff let us try out a free snorkel set because conditions were windy. The room was spacious and facilities were immaculate. Good location as it is on the beach between 2 snorkel sites (Black Rock and Old Airport Beach), which are both within walking distance. Cons: Parking was a little far and $10. No free wifi. 2 pools were nice, but not spectacular. No hot tub/ jacuzzi. Overall I was pleased with my stay and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach but overrated.”
Reviews.Author: CNY-Tripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a cottage room, and unfortunately none of the millions they spent on renovations found its way to the cottages. This would have been cheap roadside hotel anywhere else. Although the carpets and bedding were newer, the rest of the place was right out of the 1970s. All the fixtures were dated and the converted window air conditioner sounded like a Mack truck idling outside the door. The place has potential; there was plenty of space and a nice patio outside the glass slider, but it wasn't the resort accommodations I was expecting. We booked a room and car deal. It wasn't expensive, so I should have been suspicious. Not only were there taxes and fees for the car, but parking too. The location was great. Kaanapali Beach is awesome. Some of the best snorkeling on the island is off the black rocks near the Sheraton. Unfortunately, The Royal Lahaina property is separated form the rest of Kaanapali by the break wall. I think we would have been happier a little further south. The proximity to Lahaina was also good. We enjoyed Old Town, the Old Lahaina Luau and snorkeling with Ocean Riders. There are lots of restaurants, shops and activities in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: grescity
Reviews.Content: We can't recommend this place highly enough- it was just beyond fabulous. Couldn't have asked for a more romantic place for our honeymoon stay. When we checked-in, we were upgraded to an ocean-view; and wow, it was like a post-card. The view was to die-for, and we couldn't get over how goreous. Meals in the hotel are very good. We visited the Hyatt during our stay (for dinner), and while beautiful...it seemed as if we were back on the mainland at some fancy hotel similar to what we'd expect back home. When you're on your honeymoon- don't you want to experience more of a local vibe? We sure did- and were so glad to have received that type of atmosphere at Royal Lahaina. We'd absolutely return. Good Luau, lucious room, friendly staff, and a unique charm to the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort. Highly recommend this place.”
Reviews.Author: NewYork404
Reviews.Content: Service was great-people were friendly, approachable, and ready to help with your questions. The beach area right next to the resort was clean, with soft sand, and not rocky and overcrowded when we were there (it's a long beach strip shared between several resorts). The two pool areas were clean and well-maintained. We stayed in a room with two double beds. We were in a partial ocean view in the tower and still had a nice open view of the ocean. The beds were very plush and comfortable. The rooms are not tiny but not overly spacious-you are not crawling over each other's stuff but if you tend to bring a LOT with you, it might get a little crowded. The bathroom area was clean, the shower/toilet were separated from the sink area which was open to the room. The decor of our room was very nice with a dark brown/wood theme. If you want to experience a luau-there is a show within walking distance. Cons: not much that I can think of. Good place to stay if you want to stay in the Lahaina area. One tip for booking excursions--If you choose to book activities when you get there, there is definitely more than one company offering tours and activities on the resort. This was a year ago, but at the time, there was one booth right when you walked in the lobby but we discovered later that the others are around the corner. The packages are similar between companies, but I would recommend sort of shopping around and comparing rates and packages before you book to make sure you get the best deal for what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings!”
Reviews.Author: holidayfan55
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week here and have some good and bad things to stay. Firstly some of the rooms sold as a garden view are in fact a car park/hotel entrance view. Our first room offered was the latter. We complained to the manager and got a complimentry upgrade to a partial ocean view which was nice. The check in staff are extremely hostile, unfriendly with no interaction or 'aloha' spirit. This frosty attitude extends to the lady in the adjacent activities desk. You are much better off going to the Expedia office attached to the hotel next to the guest relations. Also we had no royal aloha welcome at the gate as the website claims. The 1st pool area is the traditional sun beds spaced around the pool whereas the second area is set on a lawn where you can spread out more. The 3rd pool is a very small pool with a jacuzzi next to the Tennis courts. It's very hard to find and usually means there is no one there! The only problem is there are NO umbrellas anywhere.(Except for the on hire cabana's) There is some shade on offer under the palm trees but not enough for the amount of beds. Basil Tomatoes restaurant was quite expensive for pasta. The restaurant next to the pool is a better bet or the 3 restaurants in Whalers Village. (Depending on the time you go you may need to book a table at these though) The main bar seems to shut at 10pm and Don The Beachcomber bar hardly ever seemed to open at all except when there was a Luai on. The advertised fitness centre is not on site but at the local Fairway shops on the golf course. Onto the plus points, all the bar staff were very friendly especially Bill in the Tiki Bar. We especially enjoyed the 2pm to 6pm Happy Hour. Our room was kept clean by a couple of (We think) Phillipino ladies who we had a good laugh with every morning, not sure if they really understood us or not but a good game! The free internet in the Guest Relations office was a nice touch (You get great complimentary cookies in there as well) but only had 1 station so you invariably have to wait. A trip into Lahaina town is a must. It's like it's been stuck in a time warp or something. A $1 bus ride from Whalers Village into Lahaina is money well spent. I would recommend this hotel as there are good points and there are a lot of activities you can indulge in if you desire or you can just chill out around the pool but a course in customer relations for the check in staff would be a great idea.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation - perfect beach location”
Reviews.Author: JHS19
Reviews.Content: Pefect beach location, gardens with pool ideal for families, we loved every minute of it not stuffy very easy going, Royal Scoop great for snacks staff accomodating

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Beautiful Sunsets”
Reviews.Author: Travelguru24
Reviews.Content: The Renevated part of hotel was Very nice. Beach was gret too. No coral to get hurt on. Loved watching the Sunset every night and going for long walks along the beach walk.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: catlady888
Reviews.Content: They knew how to spoil our honeymoon from the moment we arrived in the evening. we were tired and they made our day worst. We booked garden view cottage and were told that we would receive complimentary room upgrade based upon availability and complimentary bottle of champagne because we were on our honeymoon. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a rude staff and told that we rooms are not available for upgrade but for $35/night rooms are available for an upgrade. We weren't expecting an upgrade until we were told that we will be getting upgrade based on availability. So why is it that the rooms are not available for complimentary upgrade that they told we would get but is available when you pay $35/night? We kept on telling them that we were told that we will offered upgrade and they kept on telling us rudely that rooms are not available for upgrade and they are fully booked but we can get upgrade for $35 by one staff and when we talked to another, it was $50 by another rude staff. We didn't want to ruin our honeymoon by arguing with the staff so we decided to check out the cottage room. When the the staff opened the door to our cottage room, the room smelled really bad.... I agree with a previous review using sewer to describe the smell. smelled really bad. Room was dirty, old, falling apart, dingy.... just disgusting. Insects crawling around. I couldn't bare the smell for 1 minute never mind the whole vacation. We decided to pay for an upgrade for $35 a night. We feel cheated as we were told that we would get an upgrade based on availability but they keep on telling us the rooms are not available for upgrade but for $35 they were plenty of rooms available for upgrade. We mentioned that we were on our honeymoon to marriott in oahu just a week before heading to maui and they gave us complimentary upgrade without asking and we were really happy because we weren't expecting one because they never told us that they would give us one but with Royal Lahaina, they told us we would get complimentary upgrade so that is why we expected one. However, they did honor the complimentary bottle of champagne. The room they gave us in the tower had a big black stain on the bed so we called front desk and they told us to call housekeeping. We tried calling housekeeping for a long time but there was no reply. We finally gave up because we were really tired and had to sleep on a dirty bed that night. Didn't want to deal with the rude people at front desk anymore so we just went to bed on a dirty bed that night. The next morning, we got up early and decided try the breakfast at the hotel. We were greeted by another rude staff. she took us to a table, my husband and I spotted a big, bright pink lipstick stain on the coffee mug where she seated us. I don't know how anyone could have missed that lipstick stain. we saw from a far distance and we told her there was a stain on the mug and she rolled her eyes and made a sound and walked off with the mug and returned with another mug which she threw on the table and walked off. We were very unhappy with this kind of attitude and decided not to eat there anymore. So from day 2, we had to drive out every morning for breakfast and did not eat at the restaurant so can't comment on the food. After a long day out on day 2, we noticed there wasn't any kleenex and they didn't refill our shampoo and shower gel so we had to call housekeeping to get them but we kept calling for over 15 minutes and no one replied. An answering machine went on and we left a message but a long time no one brought the items. we tried callling again and still no reply. So we used the almost empty bottles of shampoo and shower gel from the previous day and we didn't have enough shampoo and shower gel for our showers. After a long day 3, we noticed they forgot to give us bath towels so we had to order them and same thing happened... no reply and we left a messages and still no one replied and no one brought towels so we both had to use a small towel as a bath towel. The next morning we tried calling for a towel and miraculously, someone answered the phone so we asked for 2 towels but we waited for a long time and no one brought towels so we tried calling again and no one answers again and when we left about 1 and half hour after calling and still no one brought the towel yet. my husband had to shower in the morning with the small towels again. but when we came back in the evening, there were 2 extra towels on the bed. I don't know when they brought up the towels but it must have been after the maid service since the towels were on top of already made bed. so that day we had 4 towels. After 3 days bad experience with this hotel and housekeeping, we gave up calling housekeeping and decided that we would wait around in the morning to see if we could find any cleaning lady and ask for anything we needed or anything they forget to give us. What a waste of time for us. Day 4, we wanted to go to the beach so my husband goes down to get some beach towels early in the morning. Guess what, the staff tells my husband they ran out and towels will be there in 5 minutes. My husband comes up to get me and we go down together. It must be at least 15 minutes after he initially asked for towels and we go together. There were still no beach towels yet. the staff tells us to come back in 10 minutes so we decide to grab breakfast at the hotel. We went to the store across the street and couldn't find anything so we bought a pastry and fruit salad at the ice cream place. Worst pastry I ever had and not freshly baked. Fruist salad wasn't fresh neither. we took a bite and couldn't eat it anymore and had to throw it out. We walk around a bit looking for something to eat but couldn't find anything at the resort so we went back to get beach towels and it was at least 1 hour after we initally went and still no beach towel. There was a group of people standing near the pool waiting for towels. They told us to come back in 10 minutes again. We didn't know how long it was going to take and decided not to swim at the beach anymore and had to think of something else to do. There beach towels when we came back in the afternoon so we grabbed 4 just in case they run out again and we went swimming next day. Oh and the activities lady was rude and unhelpful too. Just one bad experience after another at this hotel. But near the end of this trip. We went to guest services to ask them for recommendations for a special occasion dinner and we met a very helpful and kind staff by the name of Gilbert who helped us call restaurants and he also helped us make a reservation. We also met a very nice lady at guest services by the name of Chiba who also gave us directions and recommended a few restaurants to us. Overall experience was very bad besides the 2 very kind people we met at guest services. Room at the cottage was disgusting but room in the tower looked ok but were not very clean. dust everywhere and stain on bed the first day. never been to a hotel where housekeeping doesn't answer calls. items are always there within 15 minutes to 30 minutes after requesting them. also forgot to mention that it was noisy also. WOuld never return to Royal Lahaina resort. I would have went to Sheraton instead if I known I would have to pay $35 more a night for half decent room. The pools and facilities are much nicer at the Sheraton. Didn't know that cottage would be that bad and feel cheated that they wouldn't give us upgrade when they told us we would get one. Didn't make our honeymoon special at all. Regret booking this hotel and would never come back. Should have booked Sheraton instead.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting presentation of room”
Reviews.Author: Kiwifos
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in hotels all over the world and this would rate as the worst accommodation we have encountered. To assign an overseas guest to a room in this condition for any price is just not acceptable. We run a five star hotel in New Zealand and would never allow a room of any type to become as poorly conditioned as this one was, let alone expect anyone to enjoy a comfortable stay. we wasted good money for four nights here. We had an air conditioning unit which was like trying to sleep in a 747 jet liner, extremely noisy. We had a faulty telephone which when the serviceman arrived to fix it he said the connections were rusty but he didn't have time to fix it as it was 5pm, time for him to knock off he would come back tomorrow. Great!. We had a bedside lamp with faulty switch. We had to wait an age to get hot water in the basin and shower. The basin tap was dripping constantly. There was dust and dirt around skirting boards. The carpet had seperated from the tiles leaving an exposed jagged metal edging which was dangerous to walk on. The ranchslider to the garden patio was stiff and hard to move. All this and more to make our stay as uncomfortable as possible. We will be telling our travel agent to avoid this hotel for the sake of other travellers. Simply not good enough!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: southerneyes
Reviews.Content: Hawaii has always been our dream vacation spot and after 26 years of marriage our dream finally came true. Our family visited Maui recently and chose to stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort after sorting over several places with our travel agent. We were extremely pleased with every aspect of the resort. I have to say that this place is top notch. I have no complaints and I can't even find a tiny reason to rate it less than excellent. The staff at the resort was extremely friendly and always met us with a smile and an Aloha. We became fast friends with several employees there and even the shop oweners at the resort became like family, speaking as we walked past daily. The maids, when they would hear us walk past a room they were cleaning, would shout "Aloha", even if they couldn't see us. I have never experienced a place like this. Everyone went out of their way to make sure we had the most memorable vacation possible. One evening I had walked down to take some sunset photos and as I walked back up the steps into the resort a fire dancer and a friend of his commented on my camera. After learning I was passionate about photography, he pointed to a spot and said, "If you go stand over there, we are about to do our torch lighting ceremony and you'll be able to get some really great pictures". It was that way with everyone at Royal Lahaina. The resort was immaculate. We stayed in the tower and the rooms were awesome. Their grounds were perfectly pedicured and the cleanest I have ever seen. I have to say, don't change a thing, you are the best!! Our week went by too fast but I am so happy to say that we will be returning to Maui in February 2011 to see the whales and we will be staying at the Royal Lahiana again. There was no other alternative for us, we love it there. Thanks to Royal Lahaina Resort and everyone in Maui and Lahaina for their amazing hospitality and top notch service and for making our dream vacation perfect. See you all soon.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at a wonderful price!”
Reviews.Author: justified42
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about the Royal Lahaina after reading some of these negative reviews,but I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived,this is a beautiful resort,I felt like I was in a true hawaiian resort,and not a nice chain resort.We booked this thru our travel agent for our anniversary and my 50th birthday,so I really had some high expectations,and they met them,everyone was so friendly,and the decor had a true hawaiian feel,the only thing I din't care for was the beds were to soft,We just happen to like a firmer mattress,and the lighting over the sink needed to be brighter,was a little diffucult seeing to put on my makeup,for the money this is the place to stay,my definition of paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: shaqquitta
Reviews.Content: New renovated rooms. Close to the beach, cheaper then the sherraton, but close to black rock. Black Rock is a little overrated to snorkel. I would recondmend going to Wailea to snorkel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: SCbaby15
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel... I attended their Luau for the second time I wish i would have checked another one this one is too packed. The rooms were nice ocean view but small. Beach was great we checked the sunset/sunrise no problem. The road to Hana was fabulous i really like that we also did the hiking tour another day in Hana that was great also. The hotel restaurant was just OK. If you have a rental car i would recommend checking out the local restaurants in area the fresh fish is amazing. I had a fish burger that was out of this world. The one thing that disappointed me about this hotel was that I may have been bit by bed bugs. I emailed the hotel but they never responded. I thought it was maybe mosquito's or some type of bugs from snorkeling but the bites kept itching and new ones appearing all over my legs way after my return. gross! I would just recommend checking out the bed/mattress and that down comforter they use real good.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: gourmetcarrie
Reviews.Content: CLEANEST Resort I've ever stayed at but contrary to the name, this resort IS NOT in Lahaina but not to worry, it's still a great location! We initially booked a Terrace View room and at check-in upgraded for a few extra bucks to an OCEANVIEW room and it was soooo worth it! READ ALL MY EXTRA TIPS BELOW: 1) Go purchase the book MAUI REVEALED by Andrew Doughty. If you get nothing else from this review take this piece of advice. Write it down now and go purchase it ASAP! You'll thank me later....it will be your bible while on vacation and you will be soooo happy you have it. 2) There are a lot of amenities on the resort however, you HAVE TO HAVE A CAR to go and do anything - public transportation on Maui is bad and slow and expensive. We found the restaurants on the resort to be ok and way overpriced (as well as the shops). So jump in the car and drive to LULU's each morning for breakfast...FANTASTIC and CHEAP for Maui (it's right by the Safeway at the Cannery Mall on Highway 30 - less than a 10 minute drive from the resort. You can find great shopping all over the island (WAL-Mart on Dairy Road by far has the cheapest prices for great souvenirs). 3) The Whaler's Village is within walking distance however, it's better to drive so you don't have to carry all your purchases back to you room. Also, the parking is $5 at the W.V. however, if you spend over $20 at any place (including the restaurants) they will validate your parking (remember to take your ticket with you...don't leave it in the car). Every restaurant there is awesome but pricey. Again, LuLu's has fantastic dishes for each meal and big portions - consider splitting meals and you can be eating for under $20 a meal (for two). 4) The snorkeling is amazing! We rented snorkeling equipment from the activities desk at the pool for $30 each for the entire week (you can rent it by the day too). We went to about 12 locations to snorkel and the 2 best beaches we found are right by the resort - on the Sheraton side of Black Rock (10 minute walk south of the resort) and a 5 minute walk north is Kahekili Beach was hands down THE BEST SNORKELING we did the entire trip. So many kinds of fish, stingrays, octopus and sea turtles galore! We paid a couple hundred dollars and did a boat trip through TRILOGY and didn't see near the kinds of fish we did right there at the beach. TRILOGY was fun and great in a lot of ways but I wouldn't do it again. 5) The Luau - so not worth it. We did the Feast at LeLe which on all the internet searches said it was the "best". Setting got an A+, first impressions got an A+, first Mai Tai got an A+, first round of food got a B+, all drinks after that got a C, all the food following that got a D+, the entertainment....C at best. The highlight was the fire guy at the end and his 3 minute show. It cost us $250 and 12 cocktails later we walked out SOBER! The first Mai Tai's were strong but all other drinks after that we not strong at all, maybe they forgot the alcohol. I'll never do a Luau again. I would have rather spent that $$ on a helicopter ride. 6) The Road to Hana - definitely put it on your agenda but keep in mind you need to leave the hotel by 5:30 a.m. because this is an ALL DAY event. By the time you get to the 7 Sacred Pools you'll be tired and cranky and hopefully you took some motion sickness medication as soon as you left the hotel. There is a ton to see and a lot of twists and turns on that road but it is GORGEOUS! A must do! We did take the Kaupo Trail around the rest of the island but I don't recommend this way for the faint of heart. It's really bad for about 10 miles and not near as pretty. On the way to Hana, there are plenty of little food stands all along the way that we didn't pack any food. Stopping at these little stands was half the fun. We had fresh coconut, banana bread, ice cream (awesome) and BBQ at all different stands. It was ALL GOOD but these places only take cash. 7) Do you like art? You'll LOVE Front Street in Lahaina! 8) Do you like Sushi? My recommendations are Sansei (in Kapalua 15-20 minutes from the resort) and Kobe (right off front street). 9) If you have time and want one high end meal definitely make MaMa's Fish House a must stop. About 10 miles from the airport and the setting can't be beat! We did a cocktail each, split the Mama's House Special, coffee and dessert and our bill was $130...and worth every penny! 10) FREE INTERNET ACCESS - if you go to LuLu's they are right next to StarBucks and you can pick up their free WiFi signal. I had to check-in with work each morning so I took my lap top to breakfast. So I never logged onto the resort WiFi, saving there $10/day fee. The Safeway grocery store is right there as well if you want to get water and alcohol. We saved a lot by mixing cocktails in our room before heading to the pool. Hopefully all my tips help you with your vacation in paradise! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “This resort took my breath away - from views over the water to the views across the property!”
Reviews.Author: st_al_rod
Reviews.Content: I plan to go back. I've never had such a wonderful vacation. Everyone from the resturant staff to the maids were ever anything less than angels in disguise. The resort manager was always walking around to make sure you were having nothing less than fun. What made it nice was that it's not surrounded by so many other resorts or hotels. It's as if it was a cluster of privacy in the comfort of a resort with every comfort imaginable. Words cannot express what I took with me as my memory from Maui thanks to the family at Royal Lahaina Resort.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ilike2trvl
Reviews.Content: I was quite aprehensive after reading a lot of the reviews about the property, however I am glad we stayed anyway. We were in the newly renovated tower, and had a great experience from start to finish. The reivews about parking are true, we decided to valet the whole trip, and it was a plesant experience. The valet's and bell were very plesant and a big help. Gave us fantastic service and also had great tips on places to go, and things to do. The room was very nice, and we had no problem with noise.
