In the morning we did hear the staff around 6:45 for a few minutes, but we went right back to sleep. The whole staff was fantastic, and we for sure would stay again. The buffett is a bit expensive for what is offered, but thats Hawaii. The luau is expensive for what is offered. But I guess its a one time thing...so....at least we can say we did it. All in all... I for sure would go and stay with them again!!! Aloha!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rude front desk staffer and blocked shower drain on day 1 set the tone for our stay at this resort”
Reviews.Author: prwoo
Reviews.Content: Our flight arrived in Maui at 7.30am and after wiling away the morning and early afternoon in the Lahaina township- stretching this out as long as possible in the humidity- we arrived at Royal Lahaina at around 1.30 with the hope that we would be permitted an early check in- this has been accorded graciously in other hotels we have stayed in elsewhere in the US. Unfortunately we were served by a particular female staffer at the front desk who received us with indifference and then annoyance after we made our request. Following 10 or more minutes of fiddling on the computer without either acknowledging or explaining what she was doing and talking in undertones with her colleague in another language, she advised us she would organise for our room to be readied as early as possible and told us to check in with her a bit later (hello, where's the service?). We did, about 45mins later, and were told to wait. So we waited, and waited, and at 3pm- official check in time- again went up to the front desk. The room wasnt ready. Another 15mins passed with this staffer again ignoring me, consulting and giggling with hotel colleagues, presumably in filipino, and talking on the phone without a word of explanation. Then I was asked to step aside while someone arranged a key. This took more than 5mins and was expedited by another staffer. My experiences of customer service in Hawaii up to that point had been positive and this encounter tarnished my view of the hotel and my willingness to spend any more hours there than were utterly necessary. Such were my feelings about the rudeness of the staffer that the problem of a blocked shower drain in an old and unscrubbed bathtub- the shower I had looked forward to after a pretty long stressful day ended with my wallowing in ankle deep filthy water- was secondary. Our 'garden view' room located in the furthest corner of the resort, reeked of a badly maintained public restroom- 'smelled musty' is a polite description. There was no hotel service directory- how is one to navigate oneself?- and I only found out by observing other patrons that a map of the grounds was available- another oversight of the front desk. Had our experience of the hotel been better I might forgive it its poor location- on a beachfront, yes, but for those without a car, this equates to 1 bus and 1 trolley trip to/from Lahaina, plus a further 2 bus trips if travelling to the airport or approx $60 one way cab fare, which is more than we were charged in New York. Maui itself- away from the tourist shops and enclosed resorts- is lovely and I'll be coming back some day- but giving the Royal Lahaina a really wide berth.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: bayres
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice located 4 miles from Lahaina. The hotel grounds and beach are excellent. We upgraded to a full ocean view room and it was worth the extra fee although being on the fourth floor was a little noisy. One thing to avoid is the hotel restaurant for dinner (horrible service). I think it is a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT 10th anniversary vacation!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel0805
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect vacation - 9 days in paradise at a great hotel that didn't break our budget! My husband had called from our layover in CA, and we were told that we had been booked in a cottage and no tower garden rooms were available, but for $40 more a night we could upgrade to an ocean view tower room. When we got to the hotel, we were told the same thing about the upgrade. We had booked on Priceline ($100/night), so I expected they would put us in the cottages. My husband asked if we could see the cottage and then decide what we wanted to do. Then the front desk girl told us, that well, we could see the cottage they would put us in the 1st night, which was a suite, b/c all garden cottages were booked and we'd have to move the next day to a garden view cottage (she said the rooms were all practically the same though). My husband then asked about the upgrade, and we were told that well (oops), that wouldn't be available until the next night, so we had to stay in the cottage suite that 1st night. My husband was being very nice and patient, as was the front desk girl. He told her, he hated to move around, so then she said - how about we stay in the cottage suite night 1 and then the next day, we'd be moved to a tower ocean view room, no extra charge! I was thrilled with the ocean view tower room, and my husband was thrilled with the $40 savings per night! The cottage was not as bad as I expected. It was clean and updated in the bedroom and living areas - the suite had a sitting area with a TV, a kitchen area, and a 2nd bed, and then another area with a king bed and TV - it also had 2 bathrooms (I'm pretty sure it was 2 rooms they tore down 1/2 wall and made into a suite). The bathrooms in the cottages are not updated, but they are still clean. It is most noticeable in the shower/tub because the tile shows it's age. It was a bit musty at first, but my husband cranked the a/c and turned on the ceiling fan and the smell went away. They have several cottages right on the lawn - ocean front - steps to the ocean, that I would have stayed in for the whole time (if it was 1st floor). Strange, but only the 1st floor of the cottages seem to have lanais with chairs and a table. The next morning we were upgraded to our ocean view - and what a view! It was about 75-80% ocean view, then trees and gardens and a roof from another RL building (floor 5 for us - there are 12 floors) - so beautiful to look out each morning and see the ocean and palm trees and boats already out. The room was updated and very clean and nice. They even had a flat screen HD TV. The room was a little small, but we were mostly out and about, so it was fine for showering and sleeping (nice comfy bed!). You do get a mini-fridge, nice for soda and water. Everything they say about the parking spots being small is so true!! But, after a day, my husband became quite adept at pulling into small spots. The small spots are all over Maui - not just at the RL. The pools are not spectacular, but are clean. They even come around with fruit on a stick -- we hit that a couple of days before lunch time. They have a huge bin of towels, so you can take as many as you want - which was very nice. The beach is beautiful and very uncrowded. Even on the day we hit it "crowded" it wasn't really crowded. There is some awesome snorkeling around Black Rock - we walked down a bit from the hotel, and jumped in at the far end of the RL beach and went around Black Rock to the Sheraton side (saw 2 turtles and a manta ray! and TONS of fish). Whaler's Village is a short walk away (or you can take the free trolley) - they have shops and restaurants, lots of high end places. The pizza place (food court) was very qood, and we loved YogurtLand! Lahaina is about 10 minutes away, and we got lucky and found parking in the free lots every time (try Cool Cat Cafe - the hula chicken - hands down the BEST chicken ever!). Everyone we dealt with at the hotel was very nice. We had a few small requests (another suitcase stand, and extra towels) and each time, someone came up to our room very quickly. The housekeeping staff doesn't seem to always restock all the towels, or the shampoo/soap (they even have body wash!), so a few times we had to get extra supplies - there was always a cart on the floor, so it wasn't hard. All in all, this was a great deal for a hotel (the Sheraton and Hyatt I read were going for $175 on Priceline, vs $100 for the RL). We walked thru the Sheraton on the way to Whaler's Village, and it was HUGE. The pool looked really nice, it was huge and they seemed to have a lazy river (but it was dark, so I never saw if they had tubes to ride). The RL has a great, uncrowded beach and the 2 pools are clean, just small and regular (the most I ever saw in the pool at once were 3 people!). They have a nice grass area that you can move the lounge chairs to, and find some shade in the afternoon (while we always found chairs, there usually weren't more than a few unoccupied ones). There wasn't a lot of shade on the beach - a little from the trees in the morning, but none in the afternoon. The pool had a little shade in the morning, none by 11am or so. The lawn did offer some shade in the afternoon. All in all, this is a very nice hotel, and we didn't have to pinch pennies to stay here! Maui is beautiful, and the ocean is so perfectly clear it is amazing! We had a late 11pm flight out, so we asked about a late checkout and you can get a 1pm checkout no charge (normal checkout is 12pm) or you can pay $100 and get a checkout at 6:30pm. Also, you could checkout and sign up to use their hospitality suite. We opted to check out at 1pm and toured south Maui before heading to the airport. The hotel did seem pretty booked, probably because they are the most affordable hotel in the area. I think this hotel received 3 and 1/2 and not 4 stars because of the following - the cottages (they are 2.5 stars I would say), the pools (the other 4 star hotels show elaborate pools) and no fitness center on-site (there is a fitness center you can use within walking distance - for I think $10 a day). If you want to exercise, there are great sidewalks that wind around all the hotels, great for walking or jogging. Also, Maui has some good hiking trails.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Maui”
Reviews.Author: JandN1234
Reviews.Content: We split our vacation between Kihei and Lahaina - couldn't decide which one as first timers. They have different qualities as towns, and we enjoyed both for different reasons. Lahaina is much more touristy and busy - with Kihei being "laid back" - having a hippy vibe to its local restaurants and beaches. Royal Lahaina is not within walking distance to Lahaina, you should rent a car. Smaller the better - the parking lot stalls are extremely compact. You have to pay for parking, might as well get valet service. They market the hotel as a resort, but it's more of a hotel with a few resort qualities. When we arrived - we were told that they had overbooked the cottages and would receive an upgrade to one of the tower rooms. Fine with us - we had read the reviews about the cottages and were going to ask for an upgrade anyways. Our room was very clean, renovated, very comfy bed. Lanai overlooked the golf course. Pool was fine, nothing special. The hotel is on a nice swimming beach, fun snorkeling at the far end towards the Sheraton. If you put on your snorkel gear on the Royal Lahaina beach, hop in, you can snorkel all the way around Black Rock, the Sheraton is on the other side. Lots of fish , a few massive resident turtles and a few pieces of coral that are not dead. As soon as you get to the Sheraton side - you will appreciate Royal Lahaina more - it was very busy with all sorts of touristy types. You can either swim back, or take a quick walk through the Sheraton parking lot to hop back on the beach walk path to RL. The restaurant was okay - nothing special - happy hour is worth it. Whalers Village has a few restaurants that are within walking distance that are quite nice and decently priced. We would not recommend the luau at the hotel. Okay food, okay entertainment, drinks left us thirsty. MIght as well sit in the hotel restaurant/bar and watch the torch lighting at sunset for free with a nice fresh beer or glass of wine. Overall - great value when you are staying on the same stretch of gorgeous beach and amazing ocean as people paying ridiculous amounts of money on big name resorts. I would enjoy staying here again. I would not recommend for families - not enough for kids to do and the shore drops off pretty deep. You also have to rent a car to get the Maui experience, more great beaches further up the highway. We walked through some of the resorts on the beach walk - most looked great, fancy pools, lots of restaurants and bars - but for the price you pay - you have to decide what you are going to Maui for. We spent most of our days beach bumming and snorkeling all along the coast, so the pool and resort activities did not matter to us. We were able to spend extra $ on nice dinners and a little bit of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “on the beach...the uncrowded beautiful beach...seemed private”
Reviews.Author: AlohafromKapolei
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina Resort was truly a wonderful surprise. The rooms were spacious enough and clean!! It's located about 5-10 minutes to Old Lahaina Town. There is a shopping center close by with places to eat and grocery stores. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant and at check in got us a room with a view of the ocean although online there wasn't one available. The room rate was a steal for the Lahaina/Kaanapali area. A nice touch...we said we were there to celebrate our anniversary and a bottle of champagne was delivered to our room. Not at all a ritzy, stuffy hotel. It felt very warm...comfortable. Self-parking was convenient too. I REALLY like this hotel...would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy0718
Reviews.Content: From the front desk, to the restaurant to the housekeeping staff - everyone was helpful, cheerful and ready to assist. The layout of the resort was relaxed and inviting. Snorkeling outside the resort was amazing - even saw a sea turtle there!!! Friday night art walk in Lahaina is something you do not want to miss!!! Very fun!!! We celebrated 33 years of marriage during this trip and I would recommend this resort to anyone and everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Mushy187
Reviews.Content: We booked 5 nights in a Deluxe Ocean View Room, and for a VERY reasonable price we were upgraded to a Lanai Suite after mentioning that we were there on our Honeymoon. I can't speak for every other room in the tower, nor for the condition of the cabins, but this Suite was a small sample of what it must be like to live in the true High Life (pictures attached hardly do the place justice). The views from the room, or from the balconies were like something out of a postcard. The sound of the waves on the beach were heavenly to fall asleep to, and surreal to wake up to. The resort has a small convenience store right on site that was perfect for any little purchases (including everything from ice cream to liquor). The staff was outstanding, with the exception of one bartender named Richard (but everyone has a bad day sometimes), and they even went way out of their way to accommodate us during an emergency trip to the hospital (completely unrelated to anything associated with the resort). The breakfast buffet offered plenty of variety...and while I wouldn't say it was the best food on the island it was still better than anything I could have whipped up myself. The hotel sits on what is arguably the nicest stretch of beach on the entire island, and while the pools can't compete with some of the bigger resorts for style...a couple of Mai Tai's at the Tiki Bar and you won't know the difference! The Royal Lahaina Luau was a pretty good show too, and it was the highlight of the entire trip for my wife. A couple of notes worth pointing out: 1) If you booked events/activities as part of a package with your stay make sure you make arrangements to take care of them as soon as possible. We didn't run in to any problems ourselves, but I know quite a few people simply couldn't fit in the Luau or Dinner Cruise on the days they wanted to do them because they were already booked up. 2) There is a daily parking fee, and the while we never had a problem parking at the resort, we did have to park a pretty good distance away at times. I even ended up using the valet at one point simply to avoid the long walk to the hotel from the available parking spots (but this was only because we had a lot of stuff we were bringing up to the room after spending a day shopping in Lahaina).

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to stay forever!”
Reviews.Author: Ltdkr
Reviews.Content: The west coast of Maui has many different options for hotels, condos and lodgings. We have been a number of times and have never found anywhere better. As with any hotel you can find fault. If the car park is near is loud if it's far away you have to walk. If you want perfection you have to stay at the four seasons. The price for this hotel is very reasonable in comparison. The staff are so helpful and friendly it is crazy. You will not find a more friendly staff anywhere on the planet. The basic price of the room does not include coffee and safe or parking but you can add this on, which I prefer rather than having a resort fee. The rooms are newly decorated and are way beyond the price you pay. The grounds are old but kept clean and tidy. I would recommend this hotel to any one who is able to use sense with their expectations. I would however advise not eating any room service or bar food it's bad.

Reviews.Title: “I am glad I did my research”
Reviews.Author: imsuprmn
Reviews.Content: So i read reviews and looks at accommodations on Maui and honestly i passed this one a few times but when it became evident that on maui it is either too expensive or cheap. i took a harder look at this place. The room was great. the balcony was great the bed was amazing (that was a big point for me because i love good sleep) the buffet in the morning was really good as well as the outside seating. it was within walking distance to one of the best snorkeling sites on the island and the beautiful beach was just amazing to walk on. i have to say i was so impressed and i will be going back for another weekend get away

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful..”
Reviews.Author: mspeggyb
Reviews.Content: This resort was beauiful.. The rooms were spacious and the beds were welcoming after 14hr of traveling!! The food was great, the service was on and off. Many guest complained about the service.. Yoga on the Beach was challenging. Loved every min. of it. We also saw a few weddings, real beautiful. The attraction desk was very helpful. They have so many coupons..even some for the hotels dinning room.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean View means parking lot view”
Reviews.Author: EastSpringsOwner
Reviews.Content: We reserved an ocean view room through a travel agent for our anniversary trip. We were not offered an upgrade upon arrival, probably because the room had already been paid for. The view from the balcony was mostly the parking lot, and the pointed roof of another building (think of the old Howard Johnson's motels). The bell hop called down to the front desk for us. The cordless room phone kept cutting off (low charge) while we tried to talk to the clerk and they did nothing to get us an ocean view room. The bell hop said that they had 'ocean view' and 'deluxe ocean view' rooms. The next morning we called the travel agent who talked to the hotel. We then got our room changed from the 5th floor to the 10th floor on the opposite side of the building, overlooking the golf course and the cottages. Much better. Great things about this hotel: The beach is wonderful, in fact the best we'd been to in Hawaii. The water is blue and calm and you can snorkle right there. I ran two mornings. There is a 'beach walk' that is paved and goes through the cottages and around the gof course. From there, you can safely run on the road that goes up to the hotels on Black Rock. The bell hops and valet drivers were friendly and a great help. The room was modern and attractive and the bedding was comfortable. Whalers Village is within walking distance. Great for shopping and dining. We ate at the Hula Grill the first night we were there. Basil Tomatoes Italian Grill is on the property. Good food, and it overlooks the grounds. Not so great things: Housekeeping seemed overly anxious to get into the room, especially on the morning we were checking out. The restaurant on site is 'seat yourself', We waited around watching for a table to free up and finally left. How hard is it to employ a hostess? Instead we drove up to Aloha Mixed Plate for authentic Hawaiian food. Delicious. The ice cream shop on the property closes at 6 pm. It would have been nice to get a treat there in the evenings, but it wasn't open. Overall, the stay was pleasant, and I would probably look into staying at the Royal Lahaina again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeremiah4strings
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our honeymoon in Maui! The people at the Royal Lahaina were incredibly hospitable and friendly. We were upgraded upon check-in to a deluxe ocean-view room on the 11th floor (of 12). The first night there we ate at the restaurant in the hotel, and the food was excellent, and very reasonably priced especially for Maui! I think the total including appetizer, a drink each, dinner, dessert, and tax and tip was around $70. Not bad given the beautiful beachfront atmosphere, and the romantic live music and dancer. The breakfast buffet (included in some packages) was quite sufficient, and the restaurant service was great! Did I mention you have the terrific option of adding 2 Mai Thais ($18 value) to your parking package everyday for only $6?! VERY worth it! =) We noticed the Royal Lahaina seemed to have far fewer children than other hotels, providing an even more romantic environment. The pool isn't as nice as some of the other hotels, and we never actually climbed in, but another couple told us it was a very comfortable temperature. The ocean water for us was as good as it gets. The snorkeling is awesome from this hotel ---10 minutes walk in either direction gave us better snorkeling rewards than our excursion snorkeling trip to Molokini and Lanai. We only had a couple complaints which were eventually taken care of by the hotel staff. --- We had booked a package that included a sunset-dinner cruise. Two days into our trip, we went to guest relations to pick the evening we would take the cruise, and we were told that the more desirable boat with the better dinner/drink option was completely booked. After complaining for a few minutes, the lady at guest relations called a manager (Corey) over. Corey listened attentively to my complaint, and he explained that when we booked the package it never specified which boat we would be on or what the menu would be (which is all true) but he promised to call the company we wanted to cruise with, and see if they could do anything. Eventually he told us if the cruise was completely booked, there was nothing he could do about that. Our options were that we could cruise on a different boat with a less desirable menu, or he could credit us some money back. Neither option sounded good to me, so I told him I would think about it. The next day he called and told us we could do a Cocktail cruise on the original boat of choice, and he would credit us with dinner. We agreed to this option, and were satisfied that he continued to show concern. A few hours later, Corey called me again, and said someone had canceled their sunset dinner cruise on the boat we had originally wanted, and if we wanted it, the open spots were ours, (which we happily accepted)! When we went to the desk to pick up our confirmation number for the sunset cruise, Corey handed us 2 of the most gorgeous leis (that we KEPT getting complimented on) that were hand made by the lady we had originally complained to in guest relations!!! What a great show of concern for their guests! =) The only other complaint, which really isn't their fault, was that the air conditioning went out, and could not be fixed for about 3 days because the part had to be ordered from the main land. This really only affected us at night because we were gone for most of the day anyway. And if you have enough drinks... you never notice the temperature anyway! =) What an amazing place! We are already planning our return trip for our first anniversary!!!

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: oregontraveler85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time staying here. The resort is large and has at least 3 different lodging options. They have the main building tower which is the newest, garden bungalows which generally each have 6 individual units within a single bungalow, and the oldest is the Kaanapali Ocean Inn which is where we stayed. We originally had a garden (non-ocean view) bungalow booked but when we checked in they offered us a ocean view in the Kaanapali Ocean Inn so we took it! The view was simply stunning. It was fantastic to wake up to each morning and be able to relax and watch the ocean and the sunset from our lanai. The room was nothing special (old, as I said) but the view made up for it. If we did not have an ocean view I might not have as good of an opinion but we did so my opinion is very good:-) The resort in general is also in a great location, walking distance to the Black Rock by the Sheraton, Whaler's Village, and also further up the beach towards the Westin where there's great snorkeling :-)

Reviews.Title: “Hope to go back someday”
Reviews.Author: parkton
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort was fantastic. We had booked a garden cottage room and were upgraded to an ocean view tower room. It was beautiful but we decided we wanted to see the cottages anyways because we had read so many bad reviews. Well when we got to the cottages we couldn't believe how beautiful it was. I think the people who say bad things are just a bit too picky. We stayed in an oceanfront cottage and it was the best decision we ever made. We would walk out on the deck and we were litteraly 20 steps to the beach. The rooms were very cosy and the beds very comfortable. The cottage was very roomy. Every night we sat outside to watch the sunsets just beautiful. The thing that we really enjoyed was not having to go up and down the elevaters every time we wanted to go to the beach ar anywhere. There is a little fridge in the cottages so we would buy stuff at the store or supermarket and have breakfast on our patio . We had rented a car which we really enjoyed the freedom of going where we wanted. The driving is not bad at all. The beach is very beautiful and long . We loved being able to go for long walks whenever we wanted. The Whaler's Village is only about 10 or 15 minutes away by foot. There are lots of shops and resaurants . One thing that I found really great was that every time we would arrive at the hotel there was a man greeting us and welcoming us back home. We truely enjoyed our stay at this hotel and we hope to someday come back and we will definitely stay in the ocean view cottage E.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value-Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: kdc11101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina for 8 nights and loved every minute of it. It is not as posh as the Sheraton, but it cost about half as much! Unlike other reviewers, I found the staff very friendly. We were upgraded (for free) to an ocean view because there were no more garden view king rooms when we checked in. This was a plus! We woke up every morning to the sound of the ocean. The rooms are beautiful and the mattresses extremely comfortable. We did not eat at the Basil Tomatoes restaurant, but the food in the downstairs lounge was very good (we had lunch there) and the mai tais were out of this world! The parking was a little difficult between 5 and 9, but we always managed to find a space. I do wish the hotel had was a fitness center and spa on site. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hawaii Done Right.”
Reviews.Author: B_the_Stickman
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in one of the ocean front cottages. True, they're not remodeled to look like the Marriott. They are very comfortable, clean, and the benefit of walking out the door onto the beach without tromping through a lobby or down an elevator was well worth the slightly "older" vibe. We would choose the same spot over the remodeled tower every time, but that's more our vibe anyway. At least in September this year, we didn't need the A/C on. We were in one of the end units and had windows on the front and side, so it was easy to get a little breeze blowing through the unit. And the little in-wall units were pretty loud as hotel A/C often is. I wished that our immediate neighbors would've left theirs off too, as it almost blocked out the sound of the waves and wind in the trees. We did run a little the first day, and then realized that it wasn't needed at all. We just kept anything of value in the safe and left the slider open all day, whether we were there or not and it was always nice when we got back. The beach right in front of our door ended up being one of our favorite on the island, and we visited a lot while we were there. The short walk to snorkeling (south, by Black Rock or north, in front of the Westin), the beach path for a run in the mornings, the great coffee and baked goods in the Royal Scoop, and the location near Whaler's Village and other restaurants we could walk to were just a few of the high points for us. It's a short drive up to Kapalua, and even closer to Lahaina's funky old town. One thing I'd recommend: while you can rent snorkel gear (and other beach stuff) by the day or hour at the hotel, it's MUCH cheaper to run to Lahaina and get a set at Snorkel Bob's (on your right before you get to Lahaina on Front St.). We also rented a set of fold up beach chairs, umbrella and cooler, but probably won't bother with those next time. But, the snorkel gear was great (we upgraded the masks to the middle level) and we used it everyday we were there. We didn't have a lot of interaction with the staff, but everyone we did talk with was very friendly and helpful. Check-in and out was fast and easy. Oh, a word on the parking... yes the luau happens most nights, but there was always room further back in the lot if the "front" lot was full. At least in the cottages, you're never parked outside your door anyway, so the extra 100 yards is not a big deal. You can always valet if it really matters that much to you. Also, the spots are very narrow, so the econo car we had was a plus. Even still there were always spots that were wasted because a few people can't seem to park inside the lines. Again, not a biggie, but slightly annoying. Also, we got the "Parking package" that included use of the safe, a newspaper, 2 mai-tais each day and parking for $16. We probably won't bother with that next time as we didn't get the drinks everyday or read the newspaper. We did use the safe all the time, and parking is $10 a day, so all in all, we probably still came out ahead with the drinks we did end up having on the days we were around the grounds. We saw signs that look like they're trying to get rid of the cottages for a more upscale set of condos or something. From our perspective, that would be a shame. We loved our cottage room, and are hoping it's still there for another trip next year. We loved the old-school Hawaii vibe without the big resort Disneyland trappings. Exactly what we want when we go to get away from the daily grind of normal life. Thanks Royal Lahaina! See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Smaller, intimate resort feel with most of the perks of a larger resort”
Reviews.Author: LBJB31110
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon and originally chose it based on price and the good reviews we saw here on Trip Advisor. It did not dissapoint. We stayed in the tower with a partial beach view....the tower was recommended and I would agree that it seems like one of the better if not the best areas of the resort to stay. Usually "paritial beach view" is a tiny slice of water or sand that you have to lean off the balcony to see, but our view was incredible and you could actually see whales spouting in the distance from on our balcony. There was also a great view of the lush green mountians. Our room seemed newly rennovated with a Polynesian theme and a great bed. The cottages looked interesting and nice and close to the water. The only one we saw into though was the room they let us use to shower on our last day when we had to check out at noon, but didn't have a flight until 9pm. So it was nice that they give you the option to use a shower, but the cottage itself was run down and a little grody. Not sure if this is the standard, if so, I would not recommend the cottages. The resort had nice features and was very comfortable with a smaller intimate vibe. I preffered it much more to the mega-resorts that have hundreds of chairs on the pool deck, excessive activities and thousands of tourists. My only other advice that I wish I would have known earlier in our stay....if you're looking for a cheaper meal or just a sandwhich or snack during the day, the Royal Scoop downstairs in the resort is very convenient and affordable. I thought it was just an ice cream shop, but they have light breakfast items and sandwhiches that are much much cheaper than the resort restuarant, and easy if you just want something for the beach. We will be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good cottage style accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ClowAR
Reviews.Content: Saw some bad reviews, so we were a little nervous, but were happy with our stay (after the first 2 days). The first 2 nights we were in a cottage right by the main building (tower) and the driveway. Housekeeping woke us up at 8:30am, then some lawn guy with a leaf blower started a few minutes after thatand the beeping of delivery trucks shortly after that. Our cottage had a door that connected to the room next door, which was loud when housekeeping started vacuuming, or people talked loud. It was like they were in the room. We also had been expecting a full kitchen and were surprised to only have a minifridge. I think the website was not exactly clear on this point, at least when we booked. We talked to a lady at the front desk (she seemed to be in her own little world), and we able to change rooms the next day. Our experience after that was much better. This room was on the corner and had a lot more windows with plantation shutter blinds (unlike curtains in the other room). It looked out on the golf course and felt more private, no people walking past our patio. Quieter location. Much closer to the beach and pool. The beach is great, not too crowded like at black rock, and very close. No connecting door to another room. We put the do not disturb sign out every night just to be sure we were not woken up at 8:30 again. The cottages have been updated some, but the bathrooms are a little odd, clean, but odd. The glass part of the windows are plantation shutter style, so they don't keep out the heat really well. The first ac worked well, but the second one had trouble during the heat of the afternoon. Keep the ac on during the day while you're gone, and it'll be better. Parking was $10/day. We would stay there again, but we would make sure in advance our room is not in the 1st building we were in. We called and they came and picked us and our luggage up in a cart and took us to our car at check out. Great service because the parking lot was pretty far from our cottage, and it was a hot day. Only one computer for all the hotel, so if you need to print boarding passes, go EARLY in the morning when they open. Otherwise you could have to wait 45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but not without Flaws”
Reviews.Author: RalphVentura
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend booked this hotel. We were upgraded to the 3rd floor full ocean view in the tower for an additional $60 per night. After checking out a variety of options, we just went with this. We were told this was a special and that typically a full ocean upgrade to the full ocean view is $120 per night. View was spectacular. However.and this really pissed me of,. I specifically asked what time the pool and restaurant open b/c I was concerned that over looking them we'd get an over abundance of noise. I was told 7 a.m., which is a bit early to rise when vacationing, but ok. However, preparations began closer to 6 a.m. and the screeching made by the set up was intolerable and woke us way too early sometimes closer to 5:30 a.m. Also, no bath tubs and no table on the balcony to accompany the two chairs. I also thought it a bit petty to charge for $10 a night for internet access, but I guess it's common to do so and no gym facilities for those who desire such things. The staff was friendly and helpful. Close to Lahaina. Unpretentious. The $5 happy hour mai tai was tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Ramona51
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Royal Lahaina are all very friendly and approachable. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The newspaper is right outside your door every morning except Sundays. Their breakfast buffet was delicious. We enjoyed the convience of having the ocean at walking distance. It was also nice having the luau close by. The first parking lot might get full but you can always park at the upper parking lot. My family and I enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay at the Royal Lahaina on our next visit to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: EL_GQ
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at Royal Lahaina because I was told my the bride to be that this location was the best. Even though there were other hotels in the same area I choose Royal Lahaina because of the price. This Resort is far from a resort. I would consider this a hotel. I state this because this location has a tower and cottages you can choose from staying in. I choose the cottages because it was more affordable. Bad choice. The cottages are outdated and remind me of some motel from the 1970's. I felt semi betrayed because they only show rooms from the tower on their website. I had a friend who stood in the towers and she said they were really nice. I assume the towers were remolded but the cottages are the ones that need to be molded. The staff is nice and ready to help but the service of the hotel is NOT VERY GOOD. Like everything on the island food stops serving at 9 (including room service). In the morning it was a journey just to order coffee and OJ from the breakfast lounge and we were told it would be a while not sure why since the lounge was empty but yet had a long line to go in. Needless to say I wish I would of booked another hotel because I felt I over paid due to the cottages and the service we received. The business center only had 1 PC and was limited to 15 min and had no privacy since it was in a open office with many people going in and out. You have the option to self park for $10 or valet for $15 since there's never self parking you are forced to pay $15 valet and defects the whole purpose if you are staying the cottages because you still have to walk (outside) around the hotel just to get to your room. This hotel had nothing but couples and since my friend and I are single we choose the wrong hotel. I must say though the valet guys are the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Beautiful Beach, Wonderful Memories”
Reviews.Author: nurseking99
Reviews.Content: We spent our 20 year anniversary here and were treated like royalty! We stayed for 5 days in this beautiful hotel in an ocean view room and had a wonderful experience. The beach was not crowded at all and really nice. The room was clean, the hotel had plenty of things to do. The luau was wonderful, I definitely recommend paying the extra $15 for VIP service (open bar and not having to wait in line). Also, use the valet instead of self-parking. It is only $5 more and they are very fast, friendly, and helpful. Everyone went out of their way to make this a special vacation. Also, in the evenings, get a table outside by the pool area for drinks or dessert. There is a talented musician who plays romantic (not hokey) Hawaiin music and has a single dancer who tells the story through hula.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay - a dream come true”
Reviews.Author: McCullah
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, they made us a deal to upgrade our garden cottage to a ocean view cottage. It was worth every penny. Every morning, I was able to take my cup of coffee and sit on the beach. I liked that the resort was close enough to Whalers Village but just outside of all the hotel crowds. The beach was never crowded. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Would Go again in a second”
Reviews.Author: blmcwatson
Reviews.Content: We had an ocean view room. At night we listen to the ocean waves while we slept. The room was rather new and very clean. It had all of the amenaties that we needed. The service at the restraunt that is attached to the hotel was wonderful. The buffet breafast was 20.00 but we did NOT eat lunch.The pools were very clean and the beach is within steps of the back doors. We enjoyed the free trolly to the other hotels and shopping. The snorkeling at the beach is great. Many people told us that we did NOT need to pay for snorkeling tour as the same fish are right down the beach. We tried it out and they were RIGHT. GREAT SNORKELING on our attached beach! What a great place to stay I would reccomend it to everyone! We can not wait to go back. Yhe 11 hr plane ride is the difficult part!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for the Price”
Reviews.Author: basegolf12
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Royal Lahaina and I have to say that it was more than I expected. We had a tower room with a partial ocean view, so I cannot complain. Members of my family stayed in the cottages and they weren't as bas as expected. They are older and the studio ones are small, but they each have a patio area and offer a great value for the money. As with all restaurants in Maui, the resort restaurant was way too expensive. $13 for Nachos? Really? The only other drawback is that parking is horrible from 4:30-9:30 because of the Luau at the resort. If you plan to be out, do not return till after 9:30 or have your car valet. Another drawback is that they charge for everything, parking, $10 per day, Internet, $10 per day. It would be nice to not have to worry about these things at checkout. If you are looking for a nice hotel, for a good price and a great location, next to the Kaanapali golf course, then this a good choice. If you require more attention from staff or high end accomodations, try someplace else. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “layed back,”
Reviews.Author: cdrflorist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very layed back and relaxing. We went after the renovation was complete. We stayed here because of the tennis courts, 3 pools, ice-cream parlor and beach access. Even the beach was low-keyed . We enjoyed our time there. The bar tenders are pretty good. Hospitality could have been a bit better. The office/clerks/ desk girls could have been a bit more friendly. We came with a group of 12. Hoping to be on the same floor. We were all seperated all over the place. The ice-cream shop on the grounds has terrible hours: 6am-6pm. Who eats ice cream at 6am? By the time we had dinner and was looking forward to a snack. They were closed. The pools are not kid friendly and very small. This seemed to be more of an adult retreat. "Don the Beachcomber bar" was disgusting. We walked through it because of the luau. *(which was not so good). I am not 100% sure if I would stay here again. If you are an adult and do not want the hustle and bustle of a busy hotel. This is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: BG54
Reviews.Content: When I checked this resort out on Tripadvisor, I read some of the negitive comments, and felt somewhat worried to book the dates. But after considering the realization that you can't please everyone, I did book the dates. From the moment we arrived,,,, It was service with a smile! every employee we came across was very helpful and willing to do what ever to see to our needs. The room was clean and the housekeeping staff was there for any needs. Guest Services was great assisting with checking out a day flights to Pearl harbor, setting up the dinner -sailing cruise and offering advice to places of interest for us to see. The restaurant was also top notch,the prices were reasonable the Manager Ford was simple a joy he was so friendly and cheerful he made us feel welcome from the first day we went to the resturant. The breakfast buffet was also excellent, with many choices and hot eggs and omelets, pancake, french toast and assortment of fresh fruit not to mention all the pastry. the Luau was tastefully done and we had a great time, a little short in time it was only about an hour and the buffet served!!! I could go on , I would say to anyone staying in Maui that for us this resort was perfect, clean, great pools and beach. We would stay there again without hesitation, it was fantastic. But remember that was our experience, I can speak to what others will encounter. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Juliana891
Reviews.Content: Obviously not one of those BIG hotels but very nice for the size and the value. The beach was gorgeous and the rooms were very nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: PhiDelt496
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and well taken care of. We went to beaches all over the island an the beachfront of the Royal Lahaina is the best on Maui. The water was clear and there was plenty of room to spread out. Also it is a short walk to Black Rock where some of the best snorkeling is. We had a group of 18 people and we stayed for 10 days. We had our wedding at the Royal Lahaina, and it was absolutely amazing. Their Romance Center deserves every penny that they charge and made our wedding truly special. Everything was taken care of before we got there and we felt like royalty during our stay. The rest of the staff were equally amazing. From the parking attendant telling us "Welcome Home" every time we drove in, to the on site activities planners, to the bellhops never failing to say "Aloha" and greeting us with a genuine smile. Even when there was a small discrepancy with the bill (The Deposit was applied under our names instead of hers when the reservation was made...as much our fault as theirs) the manager was more than friendly helping straighten it out. The true hidden gem of this resort is the Basil Tomato, which is the Italian restaurant that is located at the gate of the property. We had our reception dinner there and the staff was incredible. Jack, the manager allowed us to choose a fixed menu of items that we chose and had them printed and on the plates for every guest. They also served and plated our wedding cake for no charge! Also the food was absolutely delicious and they had a great wine selection. I cannot say enough about how much we loved this hotel and will definitely stay here on our next trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful experience-didn't want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: harleechik70
Reviews.Content: We booked our room on Priceline and on another blog we read to make sure we were put in tower rather than the cottages, as that is the quality of room we had paid for. The bloggers said they'd try and stick us in a cottage since we had gotten the room at such a great price. When we were checking in I inquired as to whether our room was facing the ocean and the clerk told me know, but that he had a "cottage" that was oceanfront if we'd prefer. I requested to see the cottage before deciding and man am I glad I did! One of the bellboys gave us a ride to the cottage in the golf cart, even though it wasn't that far. The cottage's decor wasn't completely up to date but it room was clean, roomy, in good repair, and as close to the water as we could possibly get! Needless to say, we were ecstatic to be able to open the sliding doors and walk right out onto the grass--and another 20 feet and we were at the water! There were very classy wooden chaise lounges that were always available to us, wonderful shade trees if we wanted to relax and read/nap a little, a terrific outdoor bar poolside, also just steps away... We didn't dine at the resort while we were there, but there was always fresh pineapple water in the lobby that we took advantage of when we passed by. We did have drinks outside in the outdoor seating are of the restaurant and the drinks were wonderful, accompanied by a local guitarist and hula dancer. :) There's a very well-stocked store on site and a magnificent running path that starts at the Royal Lahaina and goes right along the beach past the other local resorts, bars, and some very nice homes. This was the mid-point of our two week stay in Hawaii and was without a doubt our favorite resort. They offer free internet access for a designated time period (an hour maybe?) once every 3 days or so. We used it twice during our stay. The only thing I can think to list as an area they could work on is letting the guests know what activities are available. I asked too late in our stay, but there were several activities we could have taken advantage of-yoga, etc. on site....but we missed out. I had to ask at the front desk and even then, there was no handout available.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KittyCatsCan
Reviews.Content: We came to Maui recently to stay 4 days and this is the hotel our travel agent booked for us. All I can say is, I'm glad she did! We had a shuttle from the airport take us straight there, they had no trouble checking us in even though we were early and gave us a free upgrade from a garden view room to an ocean view room in the tower. The room was beautiful, could see the ocean from the bed and there was a small balcony too. Nicely decorated and appointed. Just beautiful, couldn't have asked for a better start to our holiday. The staff were all extremely helpful and friendly, the concierge made hiring our car very easy. The only problem was parking the car ($10 per night) in the small carpark. We hired a SS Camaro and the parking spots were a bit tight, when we came down on the second morning someone from the luau had dented the side of the drivers door with their door. We had dinner out on the balconey at the restaurant twice and breakfast once, it's a really nice place to sit and relax and the food was good. The singer and hula dancer were really nice to warch too. Totally recommend staying here, a smaller resort that definately ticked all our boxes. Will stay again here if we come back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and inviting”
Reviews.Author: LAtoMaui
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Royal Lahaina. Having seen it myself, I can't believe the negative reviews I've read on here because our experience was completely the opposite. I read up a lot on here before our trip, so I want to return the favor to anyone considering the hotel. First: The location is awesome. Beautiful sandy beach, virtually empty every day, with clear blue water and some decent snorkling. Also within walking distance of Whaler's Village with restaurants/shops/other hotels. 15 minutes up or down the coast and we were at wonderful beaches or cute Lahaina for dinners/wandering around. If you don't have a car there are also trolleys that can take you some places, although I don't know why you wouldn't rent a car; Maui is great to explore. Second: Our room in the tower was beautiful. Comfy bed, beautfiully decorated. Partial ocean view was amazing from the 8th floor. We were on the south side of the building, which I think gave us a better view than the north side. We had breakfast on the balcony every morning and it was beautiful. I had mentioned it was a special anniversary and we were also treated to a suprise bottle of champagne. The cottages looked cute, but not nearly as nice. Third: The staff was incredible. Every single one of them that we dealt with was friendly, welcoming and excellent. The few requests we had (our bar fridge wasn't as cold as it should have been, we requested more mugs brought up, etc) were fullfilled within minutes. Fourth: The pools. I've read complaints here. I don't get it. You're in Maui. With a beach literally 10 feet away. With warm water. You don't need a pool. We couldn't have cared less that they weren't as fancy as the Sheraton next door as we didn't spend any time there. Poolside they have a giant bin of towels and you can grab all you need for the day and take them with you. We trekked all over Maui and tried out every beach we could. There was a cute bar/restaurant with live music every night and dancers. The music was always great and the bartenders really did make the best Mai Tais we had. The lobby had lots of character and pretty wood scrollwork and murals. Yes, you have to pay for parking. That's not uncommon at hotels and $10 isn't outrageous. I've seen up to $40 a night. Get the upgrade PV pkg and you get Mai Tais, a paper every day and use of the safe for $16 a day. It was worth it for us. The hotel was one of the less expensive options when we purchased our pkg; having seen the other hotels in the area, I have no idea why there would be such a difference as I preferred the Royal Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Marb89
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second time staying at the Royal Lahaina. My husband & I were married there 10 years before and we came back with our children this time. We stayed here for 12 nights. I love the Royal Lahaina! The newly renovated rooms in the tower were spectacular. We had a gorgeous Ocean Front room with a view to die for. The staff was wonderful and friendly. Be sure to stop in at guest relations to pick up a schedule of weekly events at the beginning of your stay. The young man that works in Guest Relation (sorry I forget his name) was fantastic! He was so kind & patient to my children as he helped to teach them how to make flower leis. I love the location of this resort. It is north of Black Rock on Kaanapali beach which is more secluded and private section of thebeach than the heavily populated area where the Westin & Hilton are located. The luau is a must see event at this resort. The food was really good and even had a children's menu. Opt for the Paradise package and it will include parking, newspaper and 2 (awesome) Mai Tai's daily. The best place to eat here is at Basil Tomatoes! Wow, their food is amazing!!!! The staff at Basil Tomatoes is the best! I would definitly recommend having a rental car. It will give you the freedom to go explore the beautiful surrounding area. Lahaina is a great place to just park and go walking around Front Street. Be sure to stop at Ululani's Shave Ice for the best shave ice ever!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Arnoudvh
Reviews.Content: I noticed some less than complimentary feedback on this hotel. I wish to advise that I went to "trip advisor" to look if the Royal Lahiana is available for this coming January as we intend to return to this hotel. We feel that we received excellent value at a gorgeous location. Arnie from Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous service”
Reviews.Author: Bruingirl6
Reviews.Content: We had booked a one night stay at the Royal Lahaina before we planned to travel further north and stay in Kapalua. Upon arriving at the front desk we were told "unfortunately, the hotel has been oversold and you cannot be accomadated here as you were only going to be staying one night anyway." I requested to speak to a manager. He was exceedingly rude and told me that we had been "re-accomadated." We were sent to a hotel down the road with no room service and no valet parking. The manager at the Royal Lahaina had the nerve to state that we were "getting an upgrade." During our negotiations with management our luggage was left unattended on the sidewalk. They stated that no one could reach us on our phones; this is interesting as neither or our phone numbers have changed in over half a decade. Clearly this hotel "overbooks" and places people in sub-par accomadations for the same price. I am not sure if the hotel and it's subpar "sister hotel" are under the same management. When planning a Hawaiian vacation, one wants to be sure of where they are staying...not forced to get back into the car after a long flight and drive to a hotel that was never booked. I recommend staying far, far away from the Royal Lahaina!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible. Stay away. You WILL be dissapointed.”
Reviews.Author: agoodlifeoftravel
Reviews.Content: First off, I would like to say that I own a vacation rental stateside and know hospitality when I see it. WOW. I am world traveled and this is the worst "resort" I have ever stayed in. The Royal Lahaina Resort completely ruined our trip. I would like to point out that we were in the TOWER that was suppposed to be fabulous. Our first room had a broken A/C and they knew it so we were forced to upgrade. Our second room was just over the bar and if you like to hear loud drunk men all night it would be great for you. Oh, and the night cap is the servers in the restaurant scraping the metal chairs against the slate to organize and close the bar. Our third room (which we were assured we'd love) had a beatiful view. HOWEVER, the room was not cooling off and we discovered there was no air flow coming through the vents. We picked up the phone to call maintenance and the phone didn't work! We used our cell phones to call the hotel and at midnight we had a man in our room changing the filthy air filter so we could actually get the room air conditioned. He was rude and left dirt all over the floor so we had to were our shoes in the room. Thinking all was well, we settled in to watch a little TV and guess what didn't work? The remote! It was so annoying. In addition you have to pay for parking every night and most nights there are very few spots if any because they have a cheesy luau for all people, not just guests. Which by the way you get to listen to every night. The beds were comfy, but were full size and the frames were for queens. Hence you would often bang your feet or knees on them. WHY on earth would they buy queen frames and use full size mattresses? Budget? Strange. The restaurant was horrible, so we either left the hotel or got sandwiches at the little store there. The ladies at the front desk were rude an not accomodating. Guest services was a man at a desk who handed you a form. REALLY!! The gentlemens desk crew was much better. Check your bill before you leave, we were double charged for parking and the couple next to us was also overcharged. They were clearly agitated as we were. So to sum this all up. This place is a scam. Do not listed to the manager and his pre-typed form replies to the negative comments. He has everything to gain by lying to you. WE DO NOT have anything to gain by being honest. While in the hotel, we tried to get ahold of him and he ignores you. All you will get from him is voicemail and you are lucky you will reach his secretary. They put you in a filthy room and force you into upgrading if you want to sleep or have A/C. Nothing is maintained which leads me to believe that perhaps they are going under and are resorting to unscrupulous practices to limp through their last days. Why else would they do a multi-million dollar renovation and skip the lobby ect? I would NEVER stay at this "resort" ever again. We were treated like we were "American" tourists in deep South America. I kept reminding myself, we were in a UNITED STATE. These people are SLUM LORDS with a fancy website. I feel sorry for the people that work there, I can't imagine having to polish a turd everyday. At least the managers don't require them to smile while they are doing it.

Reviews.Title: “the best deal on ka'anapali beach"”
Reviews.Author: tbates50
Reviews.Content: this is without question the best deal on ka'anapali beach. don't let that 3 and a half star rating fool you. the renovated towers rival five star resorts in las vegas. the views from the molokai suites are simply amazing. the staff is top notch and the price can't be beat. the grounds need some work and the restaurant choices are lacking but overall i would recommend this place to anyone. this was truly a wonderful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel-Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: OmahaNETraveller
Reviews.Content: It's surprising that this hotel is a 3.5 star. It's perfectly located on a quiet stretch of beach. The beds are very comfortable, rooms are updated and well kept, the service is great. I recommend snorkeling at Black Rock---I saw huge sea turtles right off the rocks! This hotel is a wonderful value and you are not giving up anything for the value. Great choice!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that has it all in Maui”
Reviews.Author: lucky_charm2300
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the staff were great! We arrived late at night after a drive from the Kahalui airport, only to find that the room type we had booked was not available. We needed a room with two beds, but only a king was available. Disappointing, but we agreed to take it, with a roll away bed. We were told the roll away would be brought up right away - it was, and that the view from our room would be spectactular in the morning - it was! The manager said that a room would be ready in the morning (after the occupying party checked out) and that room was in fact an upgrade. We were excited as it was! The view overlooked the mountains and the villas and had a great view of the ocean - really something to wake up to every morning. Both rooms had a fridge and coffee maker, which was really helpful. The beds were comfy and it also included a radio/stereo that had those soothing sounds plus you could plug in your ipod. Also, nice HD TV. The staff overall was helpful, the bellmen, the conceirge, the maids, etc. Everyone greeted you when you passed by, and requested were tended too very promptly. The resort itself is large with lots of beach space. The beach never really gets crowded - and crowded on this beach is maybe 20 people!! (Much better than Waikiki!!) Water is crystal clear and the beach is litter free. There are a few pools around as well as rentals for water toys (rafts, etc.) Didn't use either, but they looked good. The luau is on premises - we didn't do it this trip, but have in the past and it's a good one to attend. We didn't try the restaurant this time, but walking through (you can walk through to access the pool/beach) the meals looked good and the customers happy. Also handy was the convenience store, the gift shop, the laundry facility, florist, conceirge, coffee/ice cream shop and jewellery store. The business centre lacked - just one computer to share for the whole resort. It was free, but there was a 15 minute limit when there were others waiting...the upside to this, the woman who maintains the shop gives you warm chocolate chip cookies while you surf the net!! The only downside was the parking. Given the size of the resort and the fact that people not staying at the resort can drive/park to attend the luau, sometimes parking was a good 5-10 min. walk away. No biggie given it's a nice walk through the little commerce area. Other things at the resort included tennis courts, italian restaurant, golf course and banquet hall. While we were playing on the beach, we saw a wedding taking place on the grounds just beside the luau area. It seemed like it would be private enough for the couple, but we got some glimpses of the ceremony. It looked beautiful and well organized. Definitely nice place to get married. The location is great - Kaanapali beaches are some of the best in Maui, so you can't go wrong here. I would suggest renting a car to get around - head to Whaler's Village in Lahaina. This is where most of the shopping is plus restaurants. The package we got actually included the car rental; however, we had to pay the taxes and upgraded insurance upon arrival. Parking was also $10 per day, but when you do the math, the package worked out better than renting the car separately. It was all pre-arranged and there was no trouble with the transaction. Overall, I highly recommend the Royal Lahaina Resort. Last time I was in Maui, we stayed in Kihei and did not have nearly as good an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly atmosphere with relaxing oceanfront views for the perfect price.”
Reviews.Author: apgalia
Reviews.Content: We just got back yesterday and the hotel was clean and the staff was warm, friendly and the rooms are very comfortable and clean with a modern Hawaii flare. We stayed on the 12th floor with the oceanview and the view was breath taking !!=) Having kids 5 and 10y/o, it was convenient to walk to the beach anytime of the day. The Luao wasn't what I had expected, too many people and the food wasn't all that great and the show ended in 2hrs and for the price- I don't think so!!!=( Parking is 10. a day which should be free if your a guest at the hotel. Overall we enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KaylaGeske
Reviews.Content: I traveled to the Royal Lahaina Resort with my Family. It was my parents and one of my brothers. I was the youngest at age of 21. I had a GREAT time there. The rooms are amazing. The decor is beautiful. The room had a nice balcony with an amazing view. Of course, the higher the balcony the better the view, but there was no bad view there. The beds are very comfortable, some of the best nights of sleep I ever got. The staff there is super friendly and very good at their job. My parents had been there at the same resort two years ago, and during our stay, one of the workers (appeared to be a manager of some sort) in the bar/restaurant came up to my father, shook his hand and called him by name...He remember who my father was from two years ago! The restaurant/bar is a great place, it is all open and looks out to the ocean. It also has a pool right there. Also, there is a little pathway to another pool with a smaller Tiki Bar next to it. Everynight they had a hula dancer and singer in the restaurant to entertain the guests. The first night we arrived at the hotel, we took our stuff to our rooms and then went down for a quick bit to eat and a few drinks. It was busy when we got down there. We were looking for a place to sit down, and a manager came up to us to see if he could help us. He quickly cleaned off a table for us and got our drink orders in. Every worker at the hotel is very helpful. Right by the front desk there is also a booth set up where you can go and book different events all over the island (parasailing, luau, snorkeling, diving, sunset cruise, etc.) The hotel also has a luau right on site. It is a great luau. In the summer months they have one every night as well. What I really love about this hotel is the location. It is not very hard to get to, and close to a couple good shopping places. But it isn't crowded. The beach isn't full of people. It is nice and quiet and relaxing! Also, it is just one building of rooms. It just has one tower so if a big group goes, they won't get spread way out all over, everyone will be in the same building. Also, there are little cottages you can rent as well. I know the hotel gets some bad rap for it being a little expensive. But everything down there is expensive. They are consistant to everything else around them. Going to Hawaii you have to expect to pay a little more. But it's really not that bad. I can't even begin to say how much I loved this place. It was my first time to Hawaii and I will not stay anywhere esle! I won't even give any other place a try. The only thing I would do is take a day or two to go to Honolulu and do the whole Pearl Harbor thing. But in my opinion. the Royal Lahaina resort is amazing! It would be very very VERY hard to top it.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic location on a quiet beach”
Reviews.Author: debbiepughjones
Reviews.Content: We had an ocean view room at the side of the tower block and it was amazing. It was a good sized room (we had an extra put up bed for one of my sons). Restaurant was very ordinary - not worth buying breakfast there - much better to go to the takeaway cafe which sold delicious pastries, cakes and salads for lunch. Beach was brilliant - white sand and an easy walk into the blue sea. Two swimming pools ensured that they did not get too busy. Nearby Whalers Village had three good restaurants and a good selection of shops - there is a free shuttle there but it is not far to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: mlovett88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located with beautiful ocean and island views. Every service aspect; however, was disappointing. The restaurant, hotel management, and housekeeping were all disappointing. From a wake up call that never came to internet service that was spotty at best. The internet cost an additional $10 a day, but rarely worked. When we called mgmt about the issue, they said they contract with an outside provider and couldn't do anything. We also contacted mgmt about housekeeping and wake up call issues. We got an apology. The service was a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in a great location on...”
Reviews.Author: bewarethedawg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location on Maui. It seems to be a great midpoint for everything worth seeing on the island. The hotel staff routinely offers discounted upgrades at the time of check-in, if available. The beach and pools are clean and clear. The hotel is near a great area for jogging on the beach and around a golf course, which is nice since the hotel does not have an on-site workout facility. The food is average. The restaurants, both in service and in quality, are the only disappointments on this property. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A short walk to the best snorkelling in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: trav-lersmore
Reviews.Content: Room spacious and clean. Very comfortable and no noise from other guests, fantastic views from balcony. Fridge in our room meant we could buy in some fruit and cheeses etc and have a romantic dinner with champagne on our balcony - just lovely!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Make sure your room is facing North!”
Reviews.Author: cakeprincess57
Reviews.Content: We just got back from my brother's wedding at the Royal Lahaina, Maui. The wedding was beautiful and the hotel wedding staff did a nice job with the details - location, flowers, music, cake, etc. The hotel is in a nice location for beach access and the beach walk. The beach is about 15 steps from the hotel pool. The view from the outside tables at the restaurant is exceptional. The bar/restaurant staff was quick and attentive and everything we ordered was pretty good - if expensive. Our room was decent and had the normal amenities. The hotel is located in a string of resorts on the beach. Warning - everything looks closer than it really is! We would make a decision to walk to another resort or Whalers Village for dinner and it was a lot farther away than most people in our group were prepared for (we were traveling with extended family including our older parents). Take advantage of the free Trolley that makes the rounds every 30 mins. Our complaints about the hotel are few. Everything was way more expensive than we are used to, but we read about it before we left so that we did not have sticker shock when we saw the bill. Our check in process was not helpful. We think the receptionist was new because she didn't do anything but look up our name and hand us a key - didn't tell us where to park, or give us a permit, or a hotel map, or explain the parking cost, or really let us know any helpful information. We learned more from other guests on our ride up to our room in the elevator than we did from the hotel staff. We tried to ask the front desk staff simple questions a few times about when the trolleys come or how far away something was and they always just said they didn't know. Our room location was horrible - we were on the 4th floor south side. Our view was a large AC unit. It obstructed any decent view and was noisy all the time. This would have been fine if we had paid less than the others in our group. However, all families in our party paid the same price (and it wasn't discounted) and we were the only ones with such a horrible location. Everyone else was on higher floors or on the North side of the hotel. The hotel was booked solid so we couldn't change rooms. My husband did not mind this but I wouldn't stay at this hotel again for this reason alone. We kept our blinds closed and didn't use the balcony except to dry clothes. Housekeeping came really early every morning - btw 8-8:30am. Each room gets 3 towels. We made the mistake one day of taking 2 of our room towels to the beach and so when our room got made up housekeeping only changed out 1 towel. Be sure to go grab beach towels out by the pool early so that you don't need to use your room towels. We highly recommend renting a car. There are several great snorkeling beaches w/i 20 miles. My husband saw tons of sea turtles and 1 shark! We had so many people in our group that at least 1 person tried every activity available on the island. We did not personally use the activities planner at the hotel but other people in our group gave her good reviews. We would recommend this hotel to travelers who maybe have been here before and don't need a lot of assistance or directions. We would probably not recommend this hotel to first time Maui visitors. Hope someone finds this helpful!

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: amymad
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the end of June in a deluxe ocean view room. RLR was exactly what I was hoping it would be -- a beautiful, comfortable room with a breathtaking view of the beach and ocean. I had stayed here 16 years ago, and the public areas were pretty much what I remember: it looks like old-school Hawaii with staff in aloha shirts, an outrigger canoe in the lobby, lots of plumeria perfuming the grounds. But the rooms in the tower! The teak furnishings and the graphic photos and the little touches of floral fabric give a real sense of place without being over the top. The platform bed was comfortable -- it had a down mattress pad -- and there was a feather pillow in the closet for people like me who HATE foam pillows. The room felt spacious. I loved the sliding louvered doors instead of curtains at the lanai, along with the louvered panel in the sink/vanity area of the bathroom -- I could enjoy my view as I brushed my teeth! The room had a big closet and plenty of storage space so all the luggage, clothes and toiletries could be tucked away with no clutter to mar the beauty of the room. My one criticism is that the safe was locked and when I called security to come open it they never showed up. Oh, and they charge $10 a day to park. That being said, the front desk staff, the bellmen, the housekeeping staff, the pool attendant and the bartender were all pleasant, efficient, and professional. Every night when we came back to the hotel from dinner (it's just a few minutes to the restaurants in Lahaina or Kapalua), the parking lot attendant said (with a big smile), "Welcome back to your home!" It was completely charming. We looked around at other hotels on Kaanapali and the RLR has the best beach location -- we walked to Black Rock to snorkel every morning and swam in the uncrowded, gentle water right in front of the hotel the rest of the time. It was an excellent value; I would go back to the Royal Lahaina Resort in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous in Maui”
Reviews.Author: ggruns
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a lovely tower room with an ocean view for 5 nights on a family vacation and had a wonderful experience. The room was comfortable and clean with fantastic ocean views with great access to the lovely pool area, great bar, and an awesome beach. I liked the little touches, like the fresh pineapple scented ice water in the lobby and the courteous and friendly staff. Also, the evening entertainment (singer and hula dancer) at the restaurant lounge was really top notch. The restaurant is on "island time" in terms of efficiency, but then again, so are most of the restaurants in the area. Our only complaint was the wireless internet service did not work well, but after a couple of days at the Royal Lahaina, I had no desire to check my e-mails anyway. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back - Loved it - Stay in the cottage rooms!”
Reviews.Author: lengineer
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect about this resort to me and my boyfriend. Location was beautiful and perfect for snorkeling. Grounds were well-kept. Accomodations were great. Onsite restaurant was well-priced and the food was great (I had the ahi-club), and the live entertainment was enjoyable and made it a memorable experience. The Luau here was great and very entertaining! The ony drawback to our graden cottage room was all the service trucks in the background [ulling up to the loading dock of the hotel tower, especially early in the morning, but it wasn't enough to make us want to move to another room. I would reccomend the cottage rooms over the tower. They are older but so much roomier and more intimate. The patios are huge compared with the balconies in the tower. We saw both. Staff was friendly. Concierge was great. The only other thing I would hope for if I went back is that the lightswitches and hair dryers were wiped down as regularly as the rooms are cleaned; I'm picky when it comes to touching grime from others. Unfortunately way too many hotels are guilty of this offense. Try this hotel, the location is perfect and the beach is amazing! The rooms are great and I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great service, beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jasonlaura
Reviews.Content: Great resort. Rooms were fantastic beautiful and newly furnished. The hotel was good. The menu at the hotel needs updating they should have a lunch menu and separate dinner menu. The food was yummy. The Pool areas were ok - could look better (needs modernising). Some palm trees, swim up bar, umbrellas. Staff were fantastic and friendly. Its about 15min walk to Whalers village (shops, bars, restaurant) and the hotel supplies a free shuttle. Golf course right there at your door step. Best sleep ever great beds.

Reviews.Title: “Can hardly wait to return”
Reviews.Author: mauisun1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in upper cottage D at the Royal Lahaina Resort. Upper 2 bedroom oceanfront cottage with kitchenette and 2 bathrooms with unobstructed views of rainbows, whales and sunsets everyday. We were a lttle hesitant after looking at some of the reviews of the cottages and let me tell you, I really researched this place and even called them several times about the cottages. But, WE LOVED IT! Just right for a family with girls (ages 12 1/2 & 16) who can go sit by the pool, the beach or the grass and go back up to the cottage for a snack or to use the bathroom without an adult.
