We just had to walk down a few stairs and the lounge chairs on the grass or pool were ours for the taking. We didn't want to wait for an elevator and then walk thru a lobby to get to the beach/pool. If you are looking for five star accomodations with granite countertops, luxury beds, modern baths, etc. then the cottages are NOT for you, but they are nice and clean with an island feel. The staff, ammentities and location were perfect for us. We could walk around Black Rock for shopping amidst the high rise hotels and very crowded beaches then walk right back to our almost own private beach with hardly anyone there. Can hardly wait to go back before they tear down the cottages for some type of mid-high rise condos. L-O-V-E-D I-T!!!! Don't hesitate to go stay in oceanfront upper cottage D at the Royal Lahaina Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - AWESOME Beach!”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiLover23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina in the newly renovated towers for six nights. We both really enjoyed our stay. All of the staff was extremely friendly. My husband and I tried to tip the valet every time and because of this their manager comped our last couple of days and we got to valet park for free. Make sure to tip them, people! They work hard. They have a really good breakfast buffet, although it was $25 per person. They do have deals they offer every day though. You can get a light and tasty breakfast at the Royal Scoop shop they have on the hotel grounds. The beach is soooo beautiful and it's never packed. There is great snorkeling right off the beach just ask the woman that works at the Beach Activities Center where the best snorkeling is. She's really cool too. My husband and I happened to see her out one night at dinner and she remembered our names and asked how the snorkeling went. Also, make sure and take a snorkeling cruise with Terilani. It's worth the price. The luau was also really fun and entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Ocean Front Hotel with Excellent Beach!!!”
Reviews.Author: deonrenae
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days on the Maui. For starters, the Kahului airport is busy. Plan on 1.5 hrs to get through security and ticketing, unlike the usual 1 hr at most US airports. We stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort. It was a very nice hotel that is located right beside the beach. We rented a 12 passenger van (6 adults and 2 children) from Dollar. They treated us very well and so we have no complaints. Our traveling group consisted of 4 Senior Citizens, 2 Forty Year Olds, 1 Eight Year Old and 1 Five Year Old. Here is a listing of the top things that we did, listed from best to not the best: 1.)Kupanaha Magic Show-Good and clean humor, awesome magic and great food. 2.)Hula Girl Sunset Dinner Cruise-Smooth Cruise, Great Staff, Awesome Boat and wonderful food. 3.)North Shore Drive-Beautiful sights but a bit tight with a 12 passenger van. 4.)Alexander Baldwin Museum-Pretty lame unless you are into history or sugar or board. 5.)Sugar Cane Train-Very Lame

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay... I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ladyaloha
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Lahainia Resort in June. I thought it had a great beach. Our room was in the tower which was very nice.We booked a ocean view room & were updated to a deluxe ocean view room without even asking.We had dinner there a few times and the food was good. The breakfast buffet was pricey and not worth it. There are 3 pools , two of which were oceanside, they were never too crowded . You could go to the beach easily for amazing clear water . We located a good snorkeling spot just down the beach for those early morning snorkel outtings.I would recommend a car, since it is a bit of a distance to Lahaina. I recommend eating at Cafe Mambo in town of Paia, very good!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel on an Economy Budget”
Reviews.Author: RosieKC
Reviews.Content: We loved our six night stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort. We booked our hotel/air package through Apple Vacations for the best deal. Based on all the reviews, we emailed the Royal Lahaina and asked for an upgrade from a standard room to their recently-renovated Tower. They gave us an upgrade to a partial-view room for free, which overlooked the cottages and golf course -- and you only had to look to your right to see the ocean! Our room was large and lovely -- one whole side was three wooden louvered doors on tracks which you could open completely to see the ocean and enjoy the balcony. They have a wonderful "early bird" (from 7-8) special of 2 eggs, hash browns or rice, and ham, bacon or sausage for $7 -- a real value in Maui. We also had salads in their restaurant for lunch which was very reasonable. Nice happy hour with the very talented musican and hula dancer. Nice pools (the water was very cool -- a welcome respite compared to a warm pool) and the beach was very accessible, just steps from the hotel. The walk to black rock and the Westin only took 8-10 minutes, so you could stroll over to see the cliff diving ceremony any night. Also, there is a free hourly shuttle that goes to each hotel, and you can transfer to a city bus at Whaler's Village for $1 to ride into Lahaian (where parking is very scarce). I wish I'd known ahead of time about the on-site concierge service, as they seemed very helpful to the other guests. It was nice to have access to the free internet at their guest services. I'm not sure why there are complaints about the $10 parking -- that seemed to be the norm for all the hotels in Maui. Be aware that parking spots are very narrow, however, if you drive anything larger than a medium-sized car. Beautiful and spacious grounds, quiet hotel, lovely views -- everything to make our trip a trip of a lifetime. We would DEFINITELY return!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel that reflects Maui's style-no hurries, no worries”
Reviews.Author: mrfritz-bklyn
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my first trip to Maui at this hotel. I would definitely stay here again. I stayed in one of the cottages. It was a bit outdated, but it had a nice homely feel to it which I enjoyed. The rooms in the tower are more modern. But letâ€™s face it, you don't go to Hawaii to enjoy the hotel, so the condition of the room wasn't a priority, but at the same time it was also a good place to stay. The service was great! I had minor problems with the plumbing, TV and iron. Someone came to look at the problem within 20 mins and they were all repaired within an hour or less than a day. The grounds and beaches were beautiful.Every evening by the pool at sundown they have little fire dance ritual to close the day which was enjoyable. In the evening there is also a musician singing and playing the guitar with a hula dancer by the bar/pool. This was very relaxing. This is a resort, so you'll have to pay for internet, and parking. Get the mai-tai package, it is worth it. This is Maui, so try to relax and don't spend too much time running around and avoid time share presentations like the plague (unless you want to buy one). There was much more but I can't write it all down because you might get bored reading. But itâ€™s safe to say this was a great hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfh_kac
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty nice hotel. We stayed on the 5th floor in the newly renovated rooms. We had booked our trip off travelocity and had a "partial ocean view" room reserved. When we arrived at the Royal Lahaina, we inquired about upgrading our rooms. We were offered excellent discounted rates and shown the available cottages and beach front rooms. As it was, our partial ocean view was excellent and we stayed with our original reservation. The room was comfortable, a nice view and I really liked the way the room was designed and remodeled. Services: The hotel's services were very good. The housekeeping staff was always very friendly and prompt on requests for extra pillows, blankets and any other items requested. The Bell hops and valet parking attendants were always courteous and friendly. The front desk attendants were friendly as well. I reviewed the restaurant separately, as most of its service was appalling. The restaurant's service was not a reflection of the rest of the hotel's staff who were friendly, courteous and a pleasure to be around. Complaints about the hotel: The few complaints I have about my stay here revolve around no free internet, it was $10 a day. The Hotel does give a guest services down stairs next to the coffee shop which provides free internet (15 minutes) and printing services for boarding passes etc. This was more than adequate for our internet usage, since we were on vacation, but it would have been nice to be able to check email from our room. The other complaint, which wasn't a big deal either, was that we were on the south side of the hotel. We had a spectacular view of Black Rock, however, the air conditioning unit was kind of loud when the door was open. The sliding door for the balcony filters out all of the noise when closed, but when open, the noise was evident. Other than these two minor complaints, I loved my room. I would recommend this hotel. Both the room and the staff were as expected and I very much enjoyed my stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mellicav
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina in Kaanapali is 5 stars in my book. The hotel staff is by far the friendliest people ever and are always willing to accommodate you. The views are spectacular and it is very close to shopping, great food, and activities. We stayed in the hotel, not the cottages, and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. Aloha Mixed Plate is a great place to eat in Lahaina and offers traditional Hawaiian dishes at a cheap price. I strongly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: labewo
Reviews.Content: my mom and i would definitely stay here again. firstly, the hotel is in kaanapali, four miles north of lahaina, which is why location isn't a five. but it's also on a beach, along with all the other kaanapali resorts. great snorkeling spot! it's right next to black rock! and the westin, right next door, has a coral reef in their waters, and all the beaches are public. just great! the staff at the hotel was great, as were the amenities and our room. (we stayed in the tower, free upgrade for some reason, not the cottages where we booked. so that was great!) the grounds were large and included most everything you'd need, like a business center, two pools, a gift and snack shop open from 7am-11pm, two different and competing tour booking groups, and so on. i got to make a lei, and the worker didn't even charge me the $5 they're supposed to. it would have easily cost $15 in a store, and was so pretty! and the staff was just helpful with anything we needed, and everyone was extremely friendly. also, a great deal that if you have a car and park there ($10/night) you could tack on $6 extra per day for two mai tais, which would have been $18 full price. and these were by far the best mai tais we ever had. (they didn't skimp on anything just because they were cheaper.) oh and the musician (singer/guitarist) and dancer they got to perform each night at the hotel restaurant/bar were great! i normally find that stuff cheesy but it was just soooo good. the singer had the most beautiful voice i've heard. since then we've been to many places with singers but none can compare. you can even just sit there by the pool and listen without buying anything. also, they had a snorkel shack and even though we brought our own gear (so much cheaper than renting) the guy there taught us how to use it and also sprayed them to de-fog the masks. and when my mom's flipper got messed up he tried to help fix it! all just to be nice, which was great. he told us about the tours he sold but definitely didn't push us to go on them (which we didn't since the free snorkeling was so great!) definitely stay in the royal lahaina next time you're in maui!

Reviews.Title: “Greate location, loved our stay.”
Reviews.Author: famtrav4_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and loved every minute. The cottage suite we stayed in had two bathrooms and was roomy for our family of four. The kitchen and bathrooms are a bit older and do not appear to have been updated recently but everything worked. All of the staff was very friendly which was nice after staying in Oahu for 5 nights where they were not so friendly. Located right by the beach, paths to walk, food on site and drinks were good. If you leave at night between 5-9 be prepared to park far because of the Luau. Go to the Luau and use travel/adventure assistance on site.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: OrganizedTourist
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband on a quick short trip to Maui for a friend's wedding. I was recommended by a co-worker to stay at this hotel. He told me it was recently renovated and that it was a nice place to visit. So I decided to take the leap. From the looks of the outside of the hotel, it looks old. But once you get inside and especially into your hotel room, it's completely renovated. The rooms were extremely comfortable and nice. I was completely surprised! The bathroom and decor is modern so it felt new and clean. It was definitely worth the cost that we paid to stay here. The hotel is also close to the Black Rock which is about a 5-10 minute walk but has great snorkeling. We also ate at the restaurant downstairs which had amazing food. I would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting to find a nice value priced hotel because this is definitely it!

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: rwm013
Reviews.Content: I went here on my honeymoon, and decided I really wanted to splurge on a super nice hotel so we could live in luxury for 6 nights. I was constantly disappointed- the room wasn't as big or as nice as I had thought, we had to pay every night for parking, and you had to pay an arm and part of a leg just to use the tennis courts. We thought a resort would include more- really it just allowed them to charge us more. We were told we would get a free bottle of champagne brought to our room the first night since it was our honeymoon, but we had to call down twice and received it on day three, finally. The bed frame was at just a height that I cut my shins to the point of blood at least twice. The website assured there was "free internet" but that was only for one hour a day. The room service and hotel restaurant were very average. There were just so many things that made me wish I would have saved our money and stayed at a simpler hotel with the same accommodations for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thumper1223
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Lahaina with my husband and parents. My parents had an ocean room in the tower on the 12th floor and my husband and I had an ocean view on the 5th floor. The views were great and the hotel was peaceful and beautifully landscaped. The beach was really great, with great snorkeling and was never really very crowded. It was great for a long morning walk and a beautiful spot to sit and watch sunsets. I had heard that tower was recently renovated, and that was why we chose to stay there. The rooms were clean with nice big balconies. And there is nothing more relaxing than falling asleep to the sound of ocean waves breaking on the shore. We had a few meals in the restaurant there, and the food was actually pretty good. Whalers village is a short walk away and nice for shopping. Parking was a little challenging at night, as the hotel hosts a luau which people attend from all over, but we never had an occasion where there was no parking - it was just far away.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel and wedding was great, but get your own photographer-not Martin Wyand from the hotel or you will get screwed.”
Reviews.Author: cat43323
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful, a great location and right on the beach. Yes a great place for a wedding. Just don't go through the hotel for a photographer. We did and yes it was a big mistake. The hotel does have wedding planners and yes use them , but don't go with Martin Wyand for a photograher. We waited 9 weeks for our photo album to arrive and it wasn't what we had ordered and they didn't want to make it right by sending us the correct one we ordered. We spent about $3300.00 just for our pictures to be taken (that didn't include getting those pictures), one photo DVD and one photo album that didn't even have the engraving on it.

Reviews.Title: “See Whales from the Balcony!”
Reviews.Author: TGordL
Reviews.Content: Our trip in late February and early March was wonderful. The tsunami never materialized and we were able to watch whales breeching in the water from our balcony while we were temporarily confined to our room! The rooms (stayed in Tower) are reasonable in size, very clean and modern and the maid service is terrific. The rooms appear to be recently renovated with newer furniture, flat screen tv, clock radio with iPod adapter. We had a safe in the room that we used at no extra cost. The pools at the hotel were clean and refreshing and the beach is right next to the hotel. The bartender was friendly and the happy hour drinks did not skimp on alcohol. The areas for improvement would be: shower seemed to drain very slowly, consistent quality of food at the restaurant (breakfast buffet has good selection, quality could be better) and more food selection (e.g. coffee, sandwiches, etc.) and availability from on sight shops.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok but liked the Kaanapali Beach Hotel better in this range”
Reviews.Author: lbearpal
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the KBH our last trip we decided to try the Royal Lahaina just for a change. We were placed in a 4th floor room just above a large very loud fan/compressor unit on the roof below. Why they would site this noisy thing outside and below all of the rooms in this wing I do not know. After a noisy night where we could not sleep with the window open we were transferred to an identical room on the 7th floor and further to the side from the fan and that was better. The staff seems rather disinterested and sometimes unpleasant. When I dropped my wife late one night near the entrance (knowing the car was pointed the wrong way but not blocking anything or even remotely creating any hazard whatsoever) my wife was yelled at by one of the attendants at the entrance. Customer friendly, NO! There also is inadequate close in parking for those with a car and not paying extra for valet parking. The facilities ate somewhat dated, but adequate and clean, although worn in places. The same can be said for the lounge chairs around the pool area. And they charge $10/hour for a covered chaise! All in all we won't be back. We will return to the far friendlier and more pleasant Kaanapali Beach Hotel on our next trip to Maui. It is more conveniently located as well.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: KristinT2
Reviews.Content: We had purchased a package thru American Airlines vacations. We bought the entry level room hoping to upgrade at the hotel, and it worked! For 60/night we got an oceanfront room with a stunning view. By Hawaii standards, the room was absolutely beautiful, bed comfortable, large lanai, no tub but the shower was fine. Newly remodeled and even had a nice refrigerator (which we used a ton) and bar area with stools. Some have complained about the valet parking charge, etc, but guess what people, Maui is EXPENSIVE so just get ready for that and you will have a great time. We did not eat in the restaurants but the musician played every night from about 7-9 pm and we greatly enjoyed sitting on our balcony having drinks and listening to him play while watching the sunset. This might be a problem if you are an early sleeper, because it was a little loud. It didn't affect us because we stayed up. We also made use of the laundromat on site. I will say that the pool areas are not as fancy as some of the neighboring hotels, but the caliber of the room and the beautiful views made up for that totally. We preferred to swim in the ocean anyway. Beautiful snorkeling site within easy walking distance (Black Rock) and the trolley made it handy to get to Whaler's Village. On the whole, this is an economical choice for a great vacation in pricey Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Rest and Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: over50traveler59
Reviews.Content: After researching our trip for a couple of weeks, we selected the Royal Lahaina Resort for our Maui vacation. The resort is older, but as recommended we requested our room to be in the tower a partial ocean view. We utilized the hospitiality suite on our day of departure to shower before our flight and as suggested the cabins are not worth the price. We had booked our stay with AARP/Expedia as we found this to be the biggest savings for the room/car rental package. When we arrived for a late check-in we were given the option to upgrade for a upgraded fee, but select to stay with the room we had selected. We were on the 7th floor with a partial ocean view, the room was small, the beds are comfortable, carpet was stained, air conditioning is on some type of programmed timer and the nights became warm when trying to sleep. The lighting in the sink area made it almost impossible to make-up or to shave, very dim. This is a non-smoking resort as it appears that most properties in Maui are. If you are a smoker, there is a small area outside the lobby with ashtrays and we actually met some really nice people here, smoking is also allowed on the beach. The pool area is older, but comfortable never had to wait for a lounge chair poolside. Very nice beach, no chairs on the beach. The resort dining is over priced for the quality of food and appeared to be understaffed. We only ate one dinner and one breakfast there. Our favorite dining was at Whaler's Village at Leilani's their wait staff was excellant. My recommendations for the resort are the following, park in the valet parking for the extra fee - self parking problems are the spaces are very small and it is a distance from the hotel - also, our rental car was hit by someone and when we spoke to hotel security their response was if you would have parked in valet we would take responsibility, but not in self park. If you are a coffee drinker, in room coffee is terrible and the coffee shop/ice cream shop does not open until 6 AM if you are an early riser and on a different time zone you will wish you had purchase your own coffee maker. The resort should provide coffee in the lobby and I bet hotel guests would not mind paying for a good cup of coffee in the mornings. I felt that since we had pre-paid for our room with expedia, that the hotel staff felt it wasn't necessary to try and make our stay above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgustinucci
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. I did a lot of research while looking into where to stay in Maui and couldn't be happier. Based on previews reviews I stayed in the tower instead of the cottages and was quite pleased. The rooms were clean and spacious. The beach was great. The area in front of the hotel was pretty quiet and the water seemed much calmer than other parts of the island. Great for swimming. I didn't eat in the hotel restaurant, seemed pricey but plenty of other options within walking distance or even a short drive to Lahaina. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome to the island”
Reviews.Author: aperfectasian
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, I was immediately upgraded to an oceanview room, although I had booked at a negotiated rate. When I walked through the door of my room, it took my breath away! But I'm sure most Maui hotels do that. I didn't take advantage of many of the resort's amenities, but this was a great value for me as a solo traveler. The location is ideal. Parking is a slight problem, though. I didn't pay for valet, so the trip to my car was quite a hike. The evening luau added to the frustration as parking becomes even more limited. The pool left something to be desired; one of them was quite small and uninviting. Fortunately, the beach is expansive and accessible. The staff at this hotel was attentive, helpful and warm. You're greeted as you come and go. I'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - but only because we stayed in the towers”
Reviews.Author: DRL11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina for our honeymoon. Initially, they put is in the older cottages. It was awful. Old, dingy, stinky, and the bathroom was loaded with ants. After the wedding and our long trip from New York, we were devastated. So we complained. After 3 calls, we spoke with a manager (our savior) who moved us to a much nicer cottage that night and then to a room in the new tower for the remainder of the honeymoon. They also sent a bottle of champagne. It was like a completely different place. The tower room was super clean, modern, well-decorated and comfortable. It felt like everything was new. We had a balcony. It was lovely. All of the staff members, except for the women who worked the front desk, were very friendly and helpful - the men who worked the front desk were pleasant. The valet guys were awesome - extremely helpful and filled with good advice/tips. The grouds are beautiful - the hotel beach is beautiful, quiet, and steps from your room. The pool, while nothing special and on the smaller side, was still great. Skip the hotel restaurant - not worth it. Walking distance to Whalers Village - though walking through the golf course at night was scary (pitch black!!). But it didn't stop us. We went to the hotel's luau - it was a good show, though it was very crowded, the food wasn't great and it was pricey. Still it was nice to fill up on food and drink and only have to meander back to the room. Long story short - stay in the tower!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: newlywedsfromoregon
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I went to Maui on our honeymoon. We stayed The Royal Lahaina in the tower building. The room was great! It was obvious the room was recently renovated. The decor had an understated Hawaiian feel to it. We booked a room with the least expensive rate so we couldn't complain about the view...which was pretty bad. We were on the 3rd floor and our view was the roof with a big generator humming constantly. I tried to pretend the sound was the ocean! The location was what I loved best about staying at this hotel. It is right on the beach..and what a beautiful part of the beach it was! We were surprised that it wasn't very populated either. We loved how we were able to go straight from the beach to the pool. The pools weren't huge and fancy but the water temperature was perfect and it was really clean. We liked how it was so relaxing and low-key. The grounds were well kept and beautiful. We ate many of our meals at the restaurant where we could sit outside and look at the pool and ocean. The food was good and the prices weren't bad. Shopping at Whaler Village was just a 10 minute walk away. We went snorkeling at Black Rock which was only a five minute walk from the hotel..how convenient! If you are looking for a fun, relaxing, kick-back hotel..this would be a good match. It is definitely not glamorous but has wonderful charm!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view, but terrible bed”
Reviews.Author: Brf123
Reviews.Content: The beachview from my room was fantastic, but the bed was awful. It was a Queen-size mattress on a Full-size boxspring, so you would roll off if you got too close to the side.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Cottages inside. Disgusting bathroom. Will never return.”
Reviews.Author: a_true_reviewer
Reviews.Content: Driving into the resort, we thought that the cottages looked amazing. But alas! as soon as we entered, we realized that must have been years since they renewed it if at all. Everything was falling apart. Bathroom was disgusting with poop marks in the toilet bowl. Shower was not a shower, it was a big hose hanging on top pouring straight flow of water. There was insects walking into the tub from the drainage opening. I swear that I was wearing my slippers all the time even while showering. Bed was old and hard and pillows were thin and small. And then I saw a LIZARD on the wall so kept all the bags chained up all the time to make sure that I don't bring back home the reptile and other insects. Then came time for checking out. We asked if we can do a late checkout by just 1.5 hours and they refused saying that they are all booked. So I asked if I can book the room for one more day.. funny ha!! but guess what, they said yes, $100 plus taxes. After much arguing, they offered a hospitality room to shower in if we needed to for 30mins. and this is what gets them the 1 star above. Never going back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “you have to stay in the beachfront cottages”
Reviews.Author: fusionink
Reviews.Content: My husband Adam and I spent 6 nights at the royal lahaina resort and could have stayed in the newer tower but opted for the beachfront cottage. Ours was in cottage E. It was amazing. Our room was really nice and our own lanai that was only about 10 steps to the sand. We would definitely stay again. It was like our own peice of paradise. The only downside of staying there is the parking. It is a long walk but in the end all of us can use the exercise. The beach is amazing. Great snorkeling right off of the beach. We choose the paradise parking package and got 2 free mai tais each day along with use of the in room safe and parking. Afu our waitress was awesome and a really nice person. The 2 pools are nice but we never even swam in them since we had the Pacific as our front yard. The water on Kaanapali beach is beautiful and clear. All of the employees there make you feel like you are home. We had read the reviews on the cottages and after seeing them for ourselves fell in love with them. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Will Be Returning...a PERFECT escape”
Reviews.Author: 5princesses
Reviews.Content: 1st trip to Maui...Surprised my husband for his 30th. We stayed in a tower room I was nervous due to other comments but let me tell you. The staff was awesome. The room was everything you need and more the bed soo comfortable. The Luau was so fun. We went all over Maui and this was the BEST location to come back to. We will be booking many future vacations at the Royal Lahaina Resort.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: CLS0975
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 nights here for our honeymoon. Apr19-25. I can't believe anyone has any complaints about this resort. It was wonderful. We stayed in a tower room with an ocean view. The staff was very friendly. The beach is clean and huge. The food is fine. We missed a snorkelling trip trip because of poor directions and a staff member at the hotel pointed out a reef 5 min down the beach. We spent alot of time snorkeling there and it was free. I was lucky enough to see turtles and whales pass by while sitting on the beach having my morning coffee. The garden is beautiful and the breakfast buffet has anything you might ever want.(as far as breakfast food) Didn't spend any time in the pools but they looked clean. The bars close early but who cares. This is not Mexico and I don't think people come to this resort exclusively to party. The Luau is entertaining and again the food is fine. Sure, they charge you for parking but if you can afford a trip to Maui this shouldn't even be a concern. We will definately return here and I would recommend this resort to anyone who is happy to be on vacation and wants a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “No risk at all staying in the cottages”
Reviews.Author: CMarsino
Reviews.Content: I was getting really nervous after reading the reviews of the cottages but I decided to book anyway cause I just couldn't pass up my husband and I being this close to Kaanapali Beach. We stayed in the F cottages and we did not regret one single minute of it. We had an awesome little backyard that was no more than 20 yards from the beach. Perfect!!! Yes the bathrooms are in desperate need of being updated but I don't know about you but I was not planning on staying much of my time there in the bathroom. It was fabulous to be able to come back from sightseeing and get to hang out on our back porch enjoing some "beverages" , sunning then be able to go run into the water without having to go through the main building. All the staff were so friendly. It was great to come back and be greeted with "Welcome Home". It was also nice that they cleaned our rooms twice a day which was convenient when going to the beach and coming back to shower and have them replaced by the time you are back from dinner. We also splurged on room service one night and for the price, which at first was frightening, you get really good portions. Another deal was the paradise parking package. For the $16 you get a daily paper,use of the safe and 2 mai tais daily(and they are not watered down if you were wondering, was tipsy after one. ) The mai tais alone cost $15.50 for 2. A sacrifice of being in the cottage is that the parking lot is a good walk away but it was totally worth it. The spots in the lot are also extrmely tight so beware of dings. Dont forget to let them know at booking that you are on your honeymoon or anniversary because we had a bottle of champagne waiting for us when we arrived. I would without a doubt stay at The Royal Lahaina Resort again and definitely request Cottage F!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: jset1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Royal Lahaina, we stayed 4/17 - 24. We had a wonderful time at this resort. We booked an Terrace View room and were very happy with it, we were on the fourth floor looking out towards the cottages, we had a clear view of the ocean and mountains. We found the room to be spacious enough for us, bathrooms were very clean, nice fixtures. Bed was very comfortable and nice pillows as well. We ate several times at the Ocean Terrace Restaurant and spent most evenings at the bar. It is right by the pool with an outstanding view of the ocean and sunset, could even see whales. There was entertainment at night, two different local guitar/singers, and a hula dancer. Both guys who played were very good, and the dancer was so friendly. She even made my wife a lei and hair flower. We found the food to be fine and the bartenders were friendly and attentive (Eric and Marc were the best). The waitstaff was a little slow at times but with the music and view we were in no hurry. The beach was very nice, sandy, very few if any rocks. The pool was small but not crowded and we could always find lounges poolside. There is a free trolly that runs from the hotel to the Whalers Village every half hour or so. From there you can take a bus to Lahaina for $1 each way if you don't want to drive. We also enjoyed the Luau Overall we were very happy with our stay. Evey staff member we encountered was friendly and willing to help with whatever we needed. The only drawback that we had was that it was quite windy during the week, but that can hardly be controlled.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not very private”
Reviews.Author: ckrogerguy
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. A few drawbacks. the Bar Closes at 10pm!!!! Nearest bar is a 20 minute walk. Small Pool. No Beach Furniture. The balconies are not private at all. You can see everyone around you. The staff is Good. Just a little let down due to the fact that we were island hopping and had just left the big island where the beaches were so much nicer, and our hotel was so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Whale Watching & Sunsets”
Reviews.Author: livinonsunshine
Reviews.Content: My husband & I took our first trip to maui after many years of going to waikiki. We fell in love with this place!! Not overly crowded and no small children, which was what we were looking for. We had a beautiful room which we could watch the whales breeching from our lani...will be back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: SouthDakotaGirl
Reviews.Content: The three of us stayed in one of the cottages near the beach and believe me when i say we had a great time. What a beautifull resort. We spent time at the beach snorkling and we went to the resorts lounge. We will never forget Ford, Eric, Mark, Richard. They were sooo COOL!!!!! Full of conversation and suggestions, not to mention they can mix a mean drink WOW!!!!! anyways this place is fantastic. We will be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Right quality for its price”
Reviews.Author: mrsjdm
Reviews.Content: When I first stayed at this hotel, I was comped. I was not very impressed with the lobby... Kinda old looking and so was the elevator. Room is not bad. Bathroom was kinda small. But location is pretty good and beach in front of the hotel is excellent! Surprisingly quiet! Restaurant was not good so don't eat at the restaurant! Second time I went back to this hotel, we went to the Luau and it was very nice. For this quality, the price is just right. If you are looking for something decent and good location, I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: andreamartin31
Reviews.Content: We were first put in the cottages and was not happy with the condition of the room. The cottages are run down and badly in need of fresh paint and modern furniture. They immediately moved us to the tower and the room there was very nice. It was very clean, modern, flat screen tv and had everything we expected! The staff was quite friendly and their service was excellent. Rooms were kept very clean every day and they had clean linens and towels daily. The beach was at the back of the hotel and they have 2 swimming pools with loungers. They also provided beach towels. Nice atmosphere in the hotel and they made us feel very welcome. There is a trolley that comes every 20 mins and takes you to the Whalers Village shopping area. Self parking is $10 and valet is $15. They also charge for internet which is a downside. But overall it is a nice hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, nice rooms, nice grounds.”
Reviews.Author: shutter808
Reviews.Content: We stayed here not expecting much as we were looking for something that suited our budget. We ended up on the 12th floor on the north side, excellent view. We whale watched from our balcony with binocs. The staff were excellent from the greeters, check in staff, maid service, restaurant staff, porters. All good. Everyone freindly and helpful. Good live music every night at the restaurant and Hula Dancers that made a Lei for our kids on several occasions while we dined. The beach in the front of the hotel is nice, a bit of undertow so no small kids unattended! Snorkelling in front of the hotel is poor as there is no reef but a short walk to black rock or north provides nice snorkel spots. Pools were clean and warm, parking was good. We had a king size bed, very very comfy. The rooms have been renovated, nice shower. Avoid the cottages as they are slated to be torn down and are quite old. I have to say the only complaint I could possibly have is that there are not a ton of selections on the dinner menu but certainly enough to get you through. The food was very good. The in hotel activity staff were not super motivated. There is an expedia activity staff in the hotel as well that bent over backwards to help us out. There is also an ice cream parlour and a general store as well. This opinion comes from a blue collar guy that doesnt have a stuck up bone in his body. I have read a lot of reviews on here and I think in a lot of cases hotel staff is not treated very well and responds accordingly. You get what you give.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: WinsomeWahine
Reviews.Content: I was attending a wedding at the resort and was expecting your typical resort, but was pleasantly surprised. At check in I asked if I could be closer to the ocean and was upgraded no charge to a tower room with an ocean view. The bed was like a big white cloud, the pool was warm, and the ocean was right outside your door. Didn't encounter one snotty employee. I had room service twice and loved it, the restaurant was yummy, if the service at the restaurant was a bit slow - but who cares? Relax and watch the whales! There's no smoking on the grounds - a BIG plus. Cool trolley comes every 15 minutes to take you to Whaler's Village.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, relaxing, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Saratogacouple
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Royal Lahaina. If you stay in the tower, all the rooms are Ocean view on either side of the hotel. We were on the golf course side, which also had a nice view of the mountain. The rooms were spacious, and looked to be renovated recently as the fixtures, furniture and carpets all looked new. I was told that the cottages were not that nice, but I didnâ€™t see them personally. We especially liked the bar which was have indoors half out, overlooked the pool and nice view of the ocean. The bartending staff was very friendly. They had two pools there, one by the main bar, and another near the cottages, which had itâ€™s own tiki bar. Also easy access right on the beach. There is a walking path that leads to a shopping and restaurant area at Leilaniâ€™s, about a 10 min walk. I was told they were 90% full, but with two pools and the beach, I never saw a crowd. There was music and a hula dancer every night, very nice. About the only negative I could think of is that they didnâ€™t have free internet in the room. We went off the property for dinner every night, so I canâ€™t speak for the restaurant, except we had the breakfast buffet one day and it was very good. The staff was very friendly and helpful across the board. The cleaning staff made a point when they saw you in the hall to ask if there was anything they could do for you. I asked for more coffee once, and everyday after they made sure we had extra coffee in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice - Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: DSruns
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Royal Lahaina for 4 nights after stays in Honolulu and Kuai. My wife and i loved this place. The staff was treendous. We valet parked our car and our bags were taken to our room as we checked in. The bell hop gave us tour of our room showing us the safe, refrigerator, closets, robes, how to work the air, balcony doors tv etc.. No other hotel did this. The staff was friendly not just to us but to each other. Several guests we spoke to commented on the same thing. We only ate breakfast here and like any resort the 19.99 for a breakfast may be a little steep but the food was good and all your coffee, juices etc... were included. Happy hour at the bar looking out at the ocean at sunset was perfect with Mai-Tais the best we had had anywhere on our 14 day vacation. Bartenders were very friendly and the guitarist/singer was mellow and very good. We were looking for relaxation and comfort on Maui and this is what we got. Our valet parkers treated us like gold and gave us great directions and good restaurant ideas. Desk personnel were also extremely happy. Our room was Deluxe Ocean view on the Ninth floor. the view was great and the room was immaculate. Everything was brand new. I mentioned we were there for our anniversary and that night when we returned to our room a bottle of champagne and a card awaited us. A very unexpected but nice touch. All we expected was a nice room, a nice beach, and friendly people. We got it all. I would highly recommend this resort, it's location is second to none and my wife and i looking to return.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: TwinkleViolet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon, and would not recommend it to anyone. We were advised to stay in the tower (and not the cottages) as the tower has undergone renovation recently. However the rooms are nothing flash, and the lobby and restaurant areas obviously weren't upgraded in the renovation, as they were dreary, old and dated. Within five minutes of being in our room we noticed the toilet leaking water everywhere. Maintenance had a quick look and thought it was fine, and the handle was merely stuck. The hallways stunk of god knows what, and the food & service at the restaurant were appalling. We ate lunch and breakfast during our 4 day stay, different waiters each day (we even had to get our own menus) and the food was really bad. The buffet breakfast that others raved about was greasy and covered in flies! You could get a better food at the take away coffee shop. The staff throughout the resort just didnt want to be there, let alone be friendly to guests. The only good service we got there was from the Expedia Expert onsite that sold tours. Another person mentioned the gale force winds in the Kaanapali area, and this is true here too. But if you go down to Lahaina, there was no wind at all. Stay in a hotel down there instead, as the wind was so loud we could barely sleep. And certainly didn't want to swim there only to be whipped by sand. Definitely wouldn't advise this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but terrible restaurant”
Reviews.Author: aztoHI
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in the recently remodeled tower; it's a solid 3-4 stars. Very pleased with the accomodations, and the excellent customer service. Their web sites makes it sound as if there are 4 or 5 restaurants on the property, but there is really only one attached to the hotel, and then another one just outside the gatehouse. The main restaurant is just plain awful, and the service is very poor. The daily buffet is lousy, and even when there are many open tables, they make a big production of gathering your personal information, filling out a small form, then waiting for a hostess to find her way to the front stand to show you to a table. Ridiculous and unnecessary. Then the food, both buffet and off the menu, is less than 'Denny's' quality. On Easter Sunday, the restaurant manager was loudly berating staff, complaining about servers not showing up, etc. He's a complete amateur. The wait staff was just rolling their eyes at him. On a more positive note-- the front desk and bell/valet have obviously been well trained in customer service. Well done! We toured the much maligned cottages and can see why there are so many complaints, They need to be torn down and this premium ocean-front site should be redeveloped. We would probably stay here again, but there are so many other choices, and this hotel seems like its having a hard time competing.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Beach”
Reviews.Author: ADJS
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and were quite happy with out stay. The beach in front of the hotel is awesome - hardly any people at all - no crowds and very relaxing. The luau on site was great and the propoerty overall was beautiful. IT is just a short walk/drive to Whalers Village - and several golf courses. The rooms were nice but the only downside was we had a room in the tower on the 3rd floor and it did not have any view at all - just of the roof - which was somewhat disappointing after we came from another resort with ocean view. There was the chance to upgrade for $40 more a night but we hardly spent anytime in the room so just dealt with the room we got. We called down to ask for another room but nothing was available. Self parking is $10 a night - sp be prepared to pay for that.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back again and again”
Reviews.Author: spyderpig
Reviews.Content: Not sure what Butchcat is looking for in a hotel. If you come to Maui to "hang out" in the lobby, then go to Topeka and save some money! Hotel is wonderful, and says they just put $35 million into remodel. I think it shows in the rooms. Luxurious bathrooms, every room in tower has a patio and ocean view. I can't speak for the cottages, but I wouldn't have changed anything about the tower building itself. Restaurant was just fine, not dated, and was true to the hotel's overall relaxed & casual environment. Pool areas are not huge, but they're good, too. Both are right by bars, so that's convenient, and both are less than 100 yards to the beach. Grounds are immaculate! Level of service was exemplary... what you'd expect at a Disney resort. Everyone there was so friendly. We were met on the walk up to registration by a nice, professional looking man offering to help with our luggage. We found out later thru the local hotel channel that he is VP of Operations for this particular hotel group... leading by example guarantees a great attitude from everyone, so props to him. Special kudos to the ladies in the ice cream/ coffee shop, who had a smile no matter how miserable the easterners (that's you, NY & NJ!) were in the morning. And they remembered my order after only two days... not bad in a sold out hotel. Parking is a bit tight, especially on Luau nights, but griping about the $10 parking charge is a bit misleading since you get two complementary MaiTais each day as a make-even. And even with that $10, you're still paying $50 less here than you would in a hole like Ocean City MD at peak season for oceanfront. My only tiny complaint was something they had no control over - the wind. It was 20 -25 mph with gusts up to 60 mph the entire week we were there. So you may want to check the weather first. Other than that, it was an A+ experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: AliTinTX
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend (now fiancÃ©) and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort last year from May 9-16. It was a fantastic trip. Since we wanted to spend our money on activities rather than upgrading our hotel room, we got a garden view room on the fourth floor, and the view was actually amazingâ€”mountains to the left, garden below, and beach to the right (yes, we could still see the ocean). Some reviewers have complained that from the garden view rooms all they had a view of were the A/C vents on the roof below. Well, I have to say that if youâ€™re looking straight down at the A/C vents and complaining instead of looking at the gorgeous scenery everywhere beyond, then I wouldnâ€™t want to take a trip to Maui with you! The room was clean, modern, and comfortable. I slept better than I do at home! The bath products were yummy (coconut lime) and towels, etc., were replaced diligently. We bought some fruit and drinks and kept them in the small refrigerator in the roomâ€”very handy! I loved the Old Hawaiian feel of the lobby, friendly staff, and personal touches, like the pineapple water and chilled washcloths in the lobby. We enjoyed delicious mai tais and Maui-brewed beer at the Beachcomber Bar and the Royal Ocean Terrace Lounge. In fact, we ate dinner a few times at the lounge while watching at the sunset and listening to live Hawaiian music. At times I couldnâ€™t believe I was so lucky to be experiencing it! The on-site convenience store was great for snacks or sodas, and although the prices were a bit higher than Iâ€™m used to paying in Texas, it was worth it for the convenience of being just a few steps away from our room. The stretch of beach next to the hotel is the best one we went to for our whole trip, and we went to many beaches up and down the west/south coast of Maui. The water is crystal clear, and itâ€™s great that you can walk over to Black Rock if you feel like snorkeling. We didnâ€™t care about the pools being small and non-fancy. Why would you want to swim in a pool when the most beautiful turquoise ocean is literally feet away? If you are someone who complains/nitpicks about everything in life, youâ€™ll probably always find something that isnâ€™t up to your standards, regardless of where you stay. But if you are looking for a great value, beautiful location, and friendly atmosphere, this is the place for you. Oh, and we're going back to the Royal Lahaina this September, when we get Maui'd!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: BCSunSeakers
Reviews.Content: Not sure why the latest review was so negative. If you like a 5 star, don't stay at a 4 star. We stayed at this resort for a week and thoroughly enjoyed it. The beach was magnificiant and not very busy for being so beautiful. My tips are: book extra ativities with the Local Expedia Expert as it saves average $10 per activity, visit Guest services to use free internet for 15min period and get fresh cookies in the am,.No, the restaurant doesn't give you a good value (check out Marco's Grill 5 mins from airport!!). If I were to do a Luau again, I would go to the "Old Lahaina Luau" not the one at this resort. We watched whales and spinner dolphins from the beach in front of the resort - this was amazing. Use the trolly and bus system vs. a cab when travelling to/from any dinner cruise locations (unless you don't consume alcohol and can drive yourself).

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful vacation - we enjoyed every minute/fantastic beach/superb staff”
Reviews.Author: Rangvald
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed every minute of our wonderful vacation at the Royal Lahaina. We especially enjoyed the resortâ€™s long sandy beach, tropical gardens, and the very large lawn for sunbathing. We started each day with a delicious buffet breakfast at the oceanfront Terrace restaurant. This was followed by a long walk on the oceanfront â€œbeach walkâ€� - which brought us to all of the activities of the Kaanapali beach area (including the Whalers Village museum, shops and restaurants). The spectacular sunsets, the Royal Lahaina luau, the live Hawaiian music at the Terrace restaurant, the beautiful birds, and the moonlight shimmering over the ocean at night were all very special. During our visit, we saw many whales breaching, dolphins jumping and turtles swimming in front of the resort. The tennis and golf facilities were extraordinary, and all of the sightseeing activities of Maui we easily accessible. The very friendly, and professional, staff and employees of the Royal Lahaina made our vacation very memorable. We are looking forward to returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “This place is the best!”
Reviews.Author: MaryGor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina for a week and I just had to write a review. It was above and beyond what we expected. We had an ocean view room on the 12th floor and our view was awesome. We arrived at night so didn't know exactly how great it was until the next morning...were we ever surprised to see it. Absolutely all we could have wished for. We had a package deal and breakfast was included each day. The buffet was delicious, especially the omlets and the fresh fruit. One of the things we really liked was the fact we were so close to the ocean. Just walk out the door and you're nearly on the beach. We could see whales from our beach and room too. As we walked down the beach in both directions we noticed there were many nice resorts, but none were as close to the water as we were. I must say this is the first time we've gone to a resort and not seen others nearby that we would like to try next time. We'll definitely return to the Royal Lahaina on our next visit to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nanni2010
Reviews.Content: The staff was warm, friendly and helpful. I would recommend this resort to anyone. My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and we are looking forward to going back with family!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Resort - Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: dastagg
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in the Royal Lahaina Resort and really enjoyed it. I first had a supprise package delivered to the hotel and called ahead and warned them that it was our anniversary and wanted this package available upon arrival. They pulled it off fantastic and upgraded my room because of my anniversary and they had rooms available. This is a beautiful resort and upon driving in, the gate person welcomed us as to "home" and each time we left and came back in, the same man would tell us, "welcome back home". He made you feel special. The hotel was super nicely laid out with lost of nice things in it. It has a laundry mat nearby in the resort grounds to do laundry and machines were nice. The resteraunt was nice and mildly expensive but not as bad as many and they have a nightly hula lady and hawaiian singer with guitar and was very good. The beach is so-so since it has no cabanas or lounge chairs on it to sit by the beach but still nice beach and view. You can see the whales when in season from hotel room or on beach and while swimming in beach, you can even hear the whales calling each other. The rooms were nicely laid out and not huge, but had plenty of room. Bathrooms were small with shower stall but no tub. Had only small sink in area just outside bathroom and has a nice balcony to overlook ocean and watch whales. Rooms were pretty modern and was told they just had major renovations and everything was nice. This place was recommended from a friend and I will also recommend it to others. The Luau at the hotel is a little cheesey and put on and believe the others would be better from what I am told, but with hotel discount, it was decently priced. The staff was super nice here and has a coffee shop and ice cream shop on the grounds also. Needs better parking as it competes with the Luau and gets crowded but always found a place but not as close as without competing with Luau. This is definately a keeper and nicely located close to Lahaina to see or do activities. Shopping is expensive near Lahaina compared to prices by airport but it is too far away for short trips there for better prices. Still, this is the west end of the island and the whales are abundant on this end of island. We found a very secluded dark sand beach a few miles away and we were by ourselves for a great getaway. The sunsets are not as good as on Oahu due to the other islands get in the way of the sunset going down over the ocean. Still nice views and we saw rainbows every day in the area and we stayed 7 days here. Well worth it and we will return again to this hotel. It is a keeper and thanks again to the staff and handling my special requests. I was warned to stay away from the cabins and stay in the main tower that has recently remodeled and the cabins were not. Didn't look at them myself, but talked to a couple that said they would have rather got the main tower rooms instead of cabins. The swimming pool was located right next to the restaraunt and to me is poorly located and saw very few visit it. Had numerous tennis courts and nice looking ones also. Parking is $10 per day and had wireless internet and although it is is supposed to charge after a period, I never got charged but may have not used it long enough. House keeping was good, but had to ask for wash cloths twice and also soap and shampoo once. Room has nice sized safe in it and small refridgerator but didn't get very cold and could not find adjustment. Overall, a super nice hotel/resort and will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if you are in the tower”
Reviews.Author: love_beach_holiday
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort through Expedia. The pictures looked great - they had just done a multi-million dollar renovation. I chose a cottage. When i got there, the room was nothing like the photos. it was DISGUSTING. it actually made me cry. the cushions had mold spores on them, nothing was very clean. it was all very old and, as someone else said, should be not be sold to the public. (they are being torn down and new units for sale will be build - shame that they are still letting us rent these - should be illegal). Anyways, in tears i went to the manager. he was very nice, put me in the renovated tower in a partial ocean view room. MUCH BETTER. finally i received what the pictures showed i'd be getting. the room was nice, clean, and what you'd expect from a resort hotel. be bed could have been better. it was hard and the feather topper kept poking me and my DH with feathers. other than that, perfect. the restaurant could have been better (not so...tired) but the food was decent. they had sweet potato fries, so i was happy. great private beach, and nice pools. nice location. if they could update the restaurant and get better staff (a few of them are not very good), i'd recommend this place to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Charm with the most Beautiful Beach.”
Reviews.Author: jaelyte
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the Royal Lahaina Resort. Definitely skip the cottage room for the tower room. The tower rooms are beautiful. Even our "garden view" had a partial ocean view. Cottage rooms are tired and old. The beach in front of the hotel is the best beach in Kaanapali. Say hi to Jose at the restaurant bar for us, he was great! We will stay here again. There are two pools and they are both great, but it's not the "resort pool" of the other Kaanapali resorts. We loved it and enjoyed it anyways. What the Royal Lahaina does offer is Hawaiian charm, and it goes a long way to make your vacation special.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Resort is a good hotel choice in Maui”
Reviews.Author: SEAchange
Reviews.Content: Overall, the RLR is an accommodating resort with good facilities and service. The staff is wonderful and extremely courteous and friendly and the room (tower, partial ocean view) was fine and quite well appointed. If I return, I will request a higher floor but even from our third floor room, the view was not bad - but the lanai was always in shade and I would have preferred some sun. The grounds are lovely. Having a late flight out and a noon checkout time, I particularly appreciated the free hospitality suite to shower and change in the evening before heading to dinner and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chriskoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room outside the towers and had not a single complaint. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We Picked A "GOOD ONE", No Disapointments!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BASKETBALLGRAMPA
Reviews.Content: There is NOT one Bad thing I could say about this Lovely Resort. Very Courteous, and friendly. The rooms were spotless, very comfortable beds and a breathtaking view from our "Partial Ocean View" room. The breakfast Buffet was Excellent!!! Beautiful walking paths through the garden,and golf course. Nice long beach area. Close to Black Rock for snorkelers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, would recommend to everyone.”
Reviews.Author: LCYLOU
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights for our Honeymoon. We had booked a Room + Car package for quite a good price, so we thought! The car hire ended up costing us an extra $300 in taxes/insurance, however we were made aware of this before we landed in Maui. On arrival into the beautiful lawns you are greated by a lovely Man welcoming to your new home, which was a great thing to hear after a long day out exploring. We decided on the valet option at $16 per day, the sbell staff were fantastic and never once hinted for a tip. Our room on the 10th floor looked over the ocean and golf course, an amazing view. Since also being our honeymoon were received a bottle of champagne, which was delicious. The rooms were very spacious and well looked after. The bathroom was a little small, but the lovely shower made up for this. Housekeeping was amazing, and even thanked us for saving them extra work on one day when my husband wasn't feeling well and spent most of the day in bed. Even referring to us by name. The restaurant within the resort was pretty good. We only ate their once, but decent food and wonderful cocktails. I recommend the cocktail in the pineapple. Amazing!! We purchased our own breakfast materials, as we weren't all that keen on paying $20 each for breakfast every morning. The pool, although the area not so inviting, the view of the beach was just amazing, with happy hour at the Pool Side bar well worth it! $5 Mai Tais, which were the best I had while on vacation. With the beach on our door step, we rarely used the pool and swam in the ocean, which was usually warmer than the pool anyway. Which was never crowded and felt as though you had most of it to yourself. The Luau within the resort is also a must! Although being from Australia, we didn't think too highly of the buffet (mainly the side dishes) although the Pig was to die for. We also ate at the Italian restaurant at the entrance of the resort, which for the price, wasn't really worth the prices they charge. Although the Banana dessert certainly made up for that. One restaurant we were recommended by the wonderful lady at the Activities Centre (nearest to the lobby) in Whaler's Village. Leilani's on the beach was amazing. We sat upstairs in the main dining, although it was a little pricey, the meals and wine were amazing. Definetely worth the trip. I would stay here again for sure! I wish I was back there now!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Cottages at all Costs”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed777
Reviews.Content: I was very excited when I saw the cottages from the highway with my family. They looked so cool. But when you get inside, wow, are they ever run down. The couches had several tears in the upholstery. The bathrooms were from the 1960s and had old motel fixtures. Some of the cabinets had hunks of wood tearing-off. I couldn't believe I had spent so much money for this. It seems the emphasis is on the hotel and the villas they are going to sell (they remind you of the villas everywhere), and are lettting the cottages sink back into the sea? The staff was nice, and the retuarant nice, too. Too bad those cottages are so bad -- I really felt lied to. If I had known I would never have stayed there. Really, be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic honeymoon, cottages were much better than these reviews let on!”
Reviews.Author: HelloKittyUK
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Royal Lahaina on a Friday night having flown in from Vegas; we found it a very straightforward drive from the airport to the hotel, didn't need a SatNav, there's not a lot of main roads in Maui so you can't really go wrong! We were booked into a cottage which I was absolutely dreading having read some horrific reviews on TripAdvisor about cockroaches and all sorts! However, I found the cottage more than adequate. It was clean, comfortable and really peaceful. We actually enjoyed the feeling of being detached from the hotel. Being on our honeymoon we liked the peace and quiet by our cottage and ate breakfast on our own personal patio table and chairs in the sunshine almost every morning. We had a large fridge which we found really useful for storing drinks and food, there was also a large cupboard which we kept crisps and breakfast cereal in; there is a safeway a 2minute driveaway so you can really save some money on food and drink if you make a quick trip. We also tried some more local foods at the Safeway such as Poke which I think was raw spicy squid, it was good! The Safeway is attached to a small shopping mall where we bought flippers and snorkel masks which we put in the boot of our car and explored the beaches of Maui. Our favourite was 'Turtle Beach' in Molokai, lots of turtles everytime we visited even in the shallows! We ordered room service the first night as we were too tired to go out exploring, it was average food for an OK price. We didn't even bother eating at the hotel as the prices were quite high. Hotel staff were OK but to be honest we had absolutely minimal contact with them. We had a complimentary bottle of champagne when we arrived along with complimentary local newspapers delivered to our door each day which were nice extras. The beachfront was absolutely lovely and never too busy; great for sunbathing and evening walks. We also found the bath in the cottage although wasn't the most attractive was very large and big enough for two easily. The car park was often busy and sometimes had to park quite far away; not too much of a problem just was a little bit annoying after long days out. We spent a lot of time out of the hotel exploring the Hana Highway, Oheo Gulch, Iao Needle, Molokai and Lahaina all of which I would recommend. My number one tip would be hire a car and explore.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: BandA678
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved every second of our stay there for the week. The room, the view, the beach, the restaurant and the service was great! They greet you every time you leave or arrive at the hotel. They are very friendly and even remembered our names. We also visited Front street which was a close drive, and we had a great evening walking through the shops, eating, and looking at the art studios. It was the perfect mix of relaxation, beauty, and excitement. We plan to make a yearly trip to the Royal Lahaina ...once we are able to. I HIGHLY recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Experience was very Pleasing”
Reviews.Author: maitai12
Reviews.Content: Folks, comb through the reviews carefully. We did from home starting 2 weeks before our arrival to Royal Lahaina Resort. We chose the tower over the cottages based on many of the reviews we read. We were on the lookout for any of the other poor experiences other travelers may have had. We have visited the islands (especially Maui) many times now. We are aware of the prices and what is expected in the travel/tourism trade. At home, I have part time jobs as both a bartender and working for several caterers. I am in a unique positions to see both sides. I can certainly appreciate good/outstanding service, and show my appreciation generously. We were treated very well by everyone. Our room was both clean and comfortable - everything worked. We were not shorted on any towels, coffee packets, shower supplies etc. No staff walked in unannounced or otherwise. Valet service was exceptional, no valet member (or any staff member for that matter) had their hand out looking or even hinting for a tip. Room attention was swift and thorough. Pools were never used by us -so can't say too much. We stayed during the Tsunami challenge. Staff was alert and helpful. Food was what we expected. Our package thru Pleasant Holidays included breakfast buffet and $18/per person/per day evening meal credit and ocean view room with King bed. If this package is still being offered, I highly recommend it. Drinks were not bad (hey, I bartend, I'm kinda picky about that), but overall service was excellent. I would recommend (and it doesn't matter where you stay - I do it at the Grand Wailea as well) to go thru your final bill carefully, that would be my only comment - they did not deduct our $36/day meal voucher until I reminded them of it, they took care of it on the spot without malice. We enjoyed out stay very much and would stay there again. Read through the reviews carefully please.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Resort - Nice place, it worked well for us.”
Reviews.Author: Chris F
Reviews.Content: Royal Lahaina â€“ We checked into the Royal Lahaina Resort in February 2010 for 5 nights. This was the second time we stayed at the property, the first since their major renovation that was finished in 09. We found the resort to be very accommodating with everyone on site very pleasant and courteous. We stayed in an ocean front room that had magnificent views of Lanai, Molokai and the ocean. The rooms were very nice with rolling shutter style doors that swept back into pockets when opened revealing the fantastic views. The beds were very comfortable, but did have an awkward low positioned foot board that I bumped my knee on several timesâ€¦.ouch. The Royal Lahaina also hosts a Luau several nights a week. This was our second time to the Luau and found it to be very entertaining and lots of fun. There was plenty of good food and lots of complementary drinks. We would go back and stay here again. Aside from the pools being on the cool (cold) side, everything was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: KathyS6
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina is the original , traditional Hawaiian Hotel. The rooms are nice, locale was marvelous, staff was great, food was great, but the MAI TAI's were out of this world!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: joisey77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the cottages for a week and it was fabulous! We were only a few hundred yards from the beach and the cottages feel like your own little spot in paradise. They are surrounded by lush gardens and are fairly private. Never had any problems hearing neighbors. The grounds have lots of amenities including a couple great restaurants (the Basil Tomato Italian grill, while pricy at about $100 for the two of us, was by far the best meal I had on the island) and a shop to get all your essentials. The beach is, according to a local we met, one of the best on the island. It was never overpopulated and has a gorgeous sand beach with no rocks. You can even rent snorkel equipment and boogie boards at the hotel. We just got back a few days ago and are already talking about going again and will probably stay here again. It is one of the oldest resorts on the island with multiple generations of employees working there. I definitely recommend it to anyone...couples or families alike!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngieD2
Reviews.Content: This was a very reasonably priced hotel. The rooms were clean and spacious. My parents who have never been to Hawaii were upgraded to a corner room with spectacular views of the ocean. Staff was very friendly and helpful with our questions. Food was mediocre but reasonably priced when compared to other hotels such as the Westin or the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on earth”
Reviews.Author: moseleygal1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and we had a simply wonderful time. We'd stayed in a much more expensive hotel in Honolulu for the first part of our trip and it wasn't a patch on the Royal Lahaina. Although the building looks a little dated from the outside, our room was ridiculously comfortable with a fantastic view of the resort and beach. The bathroom was great and everything was clean and well maintained. The beach is out of this world and incredibly quiet. We had lunch on the terrace most days and it was lovely. I would avoid the restaurant 'Basil Tomatoes' in the grounds, however - we had a very rude waiter on our one and only visit.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the cottages!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cannongc
Reviews.Content: The cottages should be condemned! I read all the reviews on tripadvisor before I chose to stay at the Royal Lahaina. I read to not stay at the cottages, but that the tower was really nice. So, when I booked, I thought I was specifically NOT booking the cottages. Well, when we arrived, we were told that in fact we had booked the cottages. I felt somewhat deceived since I had specifically booked thinking I was going to stay in the tower. Anyway, we asked to be moved to the tower a few times, but they kept saying to check back as there was nothing available. The room in the cottage was HORRIBLE! You will need flip flops for the shower and don't even think about soaking in the tub! There is no outlet in the bathroom. So, I had to blow dry my hair with the outlet in the bedroom. The sprinklers went off every night at 1am. They were loud and woke us up every time. They give you an actual key to open your room (no plastic card to swipe) and you have to make the door is securely shut or you will come back from being gone and the door to your room is wide open. We learned that the hard way! Beware as well, they charge you $8 a day to park your rental car. They are actually going to tear down the cottages and build condos fairly soon. Really, they shouldn't rent these out to customers any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Maui accomodations”
Reviews.Author: KYLamplady
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Royal Lahaina resort immensely. The location is perfect, the beach is not crowded at all. The grounds are maintained beautifully as well as the rest of the resort. Our daughter lives in Maui and had recommended this place. We were not disappointed. Had a problem with our TV coming on each a.m. @ 6:30. We told the front desk staff and they said they would take care of it. It came on EACH morning. Talked to the manager on duty who sent maintenance up to "take care of it" - no one knew how to disable the TV alarm. They did offer to move us to another room, but we chose to stay in our original room.& unplug the TV at night. The staff @ Royal Lahaina make you feel at home. They seem genuinely interested in pleasing the guests. Our housekeeping ladies did a great job and were super friendly. We had a partial ocean view room and enjoyed spending time on our lanai each evening and morning. If we ever get the chance to return to Maui, we will stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort again and recommend it highly to anyone vacationing on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY GORGEOUS”
Reviews.Author: Msalisa
Reviews.Content: This was a very exceptional resort everyone was so nice, great food, entertainment, and the rooms were lovely a little small but I was with my husband so I didn't mind being cozy! My only regret We left too soon! The staff greets you every time you leave and when you return. We are planning to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: BeauH
Reviews.Content: The definition of paradise. I could write a lengthy review and go on forever about this resort but here is the bottom line. They have anything and everything you need on site, private grounds, villas ,golf, coffee , one of the worlds best beaches if not the best , a desk to choose from dozens of island activities, a beach side bar, a ocean side restaraunt, a jewelry store,. Yep this place has got me i have been to a lot o places and this one is the best . STAY HERE YOU WILL LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: “Second time around and good but...”
Reviews.Author: milehighclub-1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Royal Lahaina Resort for the second time in a year. This is a great place to stay if you want to be close to Lahaina harbour and the whales from December to April. The cottages (we stayed in Feb 2009) need updating however, the tower rooms (stayed in Feb 2010) are nice. If I have to fault them... I need to tell you that the fridge is not a real fridge. It will only keep cold things cold so.... We took a freezer bag, filled it with ice and put it on a "royal chinet" plate and kept the fridge and contents cold. My biggest problem with this resort is I felt nickelled and dimmed to death. You pay for parking, room service, Internet and several other things. On that note..... Ask for the $15/day parking deal = you park your car, you get a news paper every day and two of the best Mia Tia's (made by Marc or Ricco) on the Island. I should add that the beds are super comfortable and the A/C works great! Regular price for parking is $10/day no inclusions however the Mia Tia's cost $8 a piece so it is a good deal to go with the $15 deal. Also, the Ahi salad is excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “maui honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: JonathanS4
Reviews.Content: This resort is awesome. The people are extremely nice and eager to please. I can honestly say it was the best and most relaxing time I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot!!”
Reviews.Author: MissingHawaii2010
