Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Lahaina over Christmas. Was worried about staying in the Garden Cottages after reading some of the reviews --- but we thought they were fantastic. We were close to the beach. Loved the privacy and the nice patio. It was totally quiet and beautiful. Yes the bathrooms are older, but the amount of sand teenage girls bring in --- please!!! The staff were great. Girls played tennis at the ranch a few times. Very nice courts. The beach at the Royal Lahaina is the best. We walked a lot and the Sheraton and the other nice hotels had crowded. narrow beaches that were a lot steeper. Loved going to the town of Lahaina in the evenings. Will go back and stay at the cottages again. With teenagers it was just so nice to walk out to the beach -- no elevators and just beautiful views and flowers!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: noelani32
Reviews.Content: This place will charge you for everything and be rude to you while they do it! On top of paying thousands of dollars to stay here they charge for parking, internet, If you smoke on your own balcony they charge 250 dollars, all of which they do not inform you of. Theres is absolutley NO SERVICE HERE! Oh and the room service doesn't knock they barged right in TWICE and once saw my boyfriend naked. They don't do their wake up calls either. The help is very rude too. If you do decide to stay at the resort anyway don't stay in the cabins, only the hotel part is nice the cabins are the "original" resort. The cabins have disgusting showers not only does brown water come out when you first turn it on they look like no one ever cleans them too. I have been to Maui before and have never had such a horrible experience, you should be able to relax and have a good time. Please thouroughly research resorts before you pick one. I didn't and look what happened

Reviews.Title: “Wow, this truly is the best value and truly breathtaking location”
Reviews.Author: littlemisstraveller0
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Lahaina for my wedding/honeymoon. Upon check in we were upgraded to an ocean view room and what a view it was!!! Everything was perfect and I remember feeling like we truly had arrived in paradise on the first day as we sat for lunch at the hotel and took in all the beauty that surrounded us...there are birds and even some little lizards around the hotel and the first meal we ate with the birds hanging out with us...lunch was a few steps away from the pool and a few steps away from the pool is the beach/ocean. We were married at the resort a little ways down the beach under a tree in front of the ocean...we got our pics back from the photographer after the wedding and the pics are so gorgeous you would think that we were standing in front of a blue screen. maui is truly a breathtaking place and it is no wonder so many ppl get married there!! We will definitely be back for a wedding anniversary...i recommend to anyone travelling to maui to rent some snorkel gear...there are perscription snorkel goggles available and you can snorkel on the beach directly in front of the hotel! also rent a car it is easier to get around...

Reviews.Title: “BE CAREFUL WHAT YOU WISH FOR”
Reviews.Author: chitownrick
Reviews.Content: This is an "add on" to the 5 star resorts that line the Kaanaapali coast..an average overpriced place at best. Not worth the money at all..and they are always out for a buck..i.e. parking fees, ridiculous food/beverage prices..one business center pc, and luggage carts you can't even use..so they can make more in tips...And as for our room....the WORST one in the hotel..no exaggeration..room # 3019..a garden terrace view..that looked right out at the rootop AC units..sound and all..with satellite receivers right next door. This was the worst decision of our trip and I would tell people to stay in Kihei and do the drives to this and other areas. A big and costly mistake on our part...wouldn't stay even with a better room etc...except for the nice beach....I would pass on this place. setting was OK..but just not a good experience. Avoid it if you can..the only plus was a concierge named Steve who went above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - best place in its price range!”
Reviews.Author: Yo-Go-Girl
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawaii and Maui was every bit it was hyped up to be. We loved the place and we stayed at Royal Lahaina for all the 6 days. The location was great, had lot of privacy on the beach compared to other hotels at the Whalers village. Our room was perfect with a beautiful view. The staff was friendly, the pool was great! The Luau was famous in the area although we did not attend it. The hotel is a short walk from the whalers village where you can find shopping and water activities. All in all, we loved the place and would totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Beach in A private area”
Reviews.Author: needingavacation360
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the cottages during our stay essentially it was a little house with four Hotel rooms. The rooms were spacious and well kept for being so close to the beach. The bathroom could use a face lift but really who's there for the bathroom? We had our own balcony opening up to the garden. the hotel sits on a private beach where only a couple hotels are located...unlike the crowded beach next to the Whalers village. If you're looking to just bask in the sun this is a great place to do it. If you're looking for a little more the shopping mall and great snorkeling is located a short 10min walk away...or take the free shuttle (we always walked). We ate at the restaurant the first night there it was nothing special also overpriced and small. A better option is to just go down to the shopping mall and grab something from the Hula grill. It is very good and great Hawaiian feel with live entertainment. We had a flight out in the evening giving us the whole day to relax on the beach and catch the last bit of sun. Unfortunately check out time is at noon. Luckily this hotel has thought of it all. There is a hospitality suite that they let you sign up for and use for a half hour to shower and go on your way without sand in places you don't want it on a 8hr flight. We appreciated this so much! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Vic45
Reviews.Content: If you are not planning to spend whole day in the hotel, this place is good (location, sunsets etc). Otherwise it's nothing special and mostly on an average level. Food in 2 restaurants is very good except breakfast. Don't spend your money on nightly show - it's amature turist trap with really horrible buffet and cheap watered drinks. Overall not very romantic place to stay, but decent, clean and convinient.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Ocean View Room”
Reviews.Author: TravellingOzzy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Honeymoon and had a wonderful time in Hawaii. Basing our choice of accommodation largely on the feedback on this site, we chose the Royal Lahaina. After the doing on 3d tour on thier website, we chose the Ocean view room to ensure we had the ocean through our window each night. Unfortunately, when we shown our room, the Ocean view room was the Golf course view room, with a side view of the water. We complained and managed to upgrade to a proper Ocean View room for an additional $25 per night. Apart from this, we had a great stay and the location is out of the hustle and bustle of the big 4 hotels down the road. The Barman is a great guy and kept us entertained each night after dinner. Maholo ot the beautiful islands of Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Was all one could ask for!”
Reviews.Author: York092609
Reviews.Content: There is not going to be any complaints in this review. We left NC for Maui to celebrate our honeymoon in September and found the Royal Lahania as a cheaper alternative for our stay in HI. When we first purchased this trip off travelocity.com, I was a little concerned. BUT, when we made it to the resort and walked into the newly renovated room in the towers, it was amazing! We were welcomed with champaign and a note from the front desk. The room was like brand new with all one could ask for. The balacony/beach view was fantastic with a clear & private beach. The resort is very close to lahania and all the shops on front street. Use the valet parking on front street in Lahaina to save yourself from walking so far. The buffet breakfast in the lobby is very high and probably not worth the money. The sites of Maui are great and the beach at the resort is seriously like having a private beach. You have a perfect view of the Black Rock and within walking distance for snorkeling. The resort is about 25-30 minutes from the airport & very easy to find. The front staff was always kind and helped us place reservations for local restaurants in town. My wife also enjoyed the pineapple water each time we came back through the lobby. For a mid-week trip, we took a plane over to Oahu. Let me tell you that this place is a complete disaster compared to Maui. Maui is so relaxing, where as Oahu is so busy and fast paced. We were so relieved that we did not spend our 8 days in Oahu. This was a fantastic stay and will definitely return! Would def. recommend over the higher priced resorts! Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Very nice beach, to ritzy for my taste, paying for parking as a guest is insulting...just trying to get more money”
Reviews.Author: trinity_tori
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in a partial oceanview room, overlooked the entrance mostly with small view of water...could see luau so didn't feel like missed by not going. Breakfast more was $30 per person and was mediocre, prefered to go to IHOP or Denny's for about the same meal. Menu in restaurant in resort had very few options, especially if have allergy to shellfish. Felt like they wanted all the money they could get from you. We paying $50 for five nights of parking, insulting to have to pay as guest to use the resorts parking. Then the people not staying there parked in the same lot as guests did and you have to fight for a space if return during luau. No free wifi to guests, $10 per day with 60 CONSECUTIVE mintutes free. One PC for all guests to share. Best Western in Honolulu even gave free wifi, how cheap of this expensive place. Two of the nights the housekeeping did not leave us any washcloths, we had to call down but they did bring them to the room. Fridge was not very cold and shower door would not remain shut and caused flooding daily. Housekeeping was very loud and vocal in surrounding rooms, could not sleep until 8:15am on any morning. The older man who greeted us as we checked in insisted to an uncomfortable degree that he would get our bags to the room for us. We had just noticed that one wheel on suitcase was breaking, so we tried to take it ourselves but to no avail. He grunted and said 3 times how heavy the luggage was and said we needed a to replace that wheel another 3 times, very rude of him.....it had just broke 30 minutes prior, there was nothing that could be done but made us feel like we were to poor to fix it. I cut open my heel very badly and my husband dropped me at entrance a few times to save me a walk, several times the same man kept waiting to open my door for me to the car and it just made me feel weird because of how quick he was and how long he remained even though I said "I can manage, thank you anyways" . Nice place if I had a grand to drop in a week, not my style.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: CFLFANS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and clean. The food and service from all staff was fabulous.Located right on the beach. Pools and beach were fantastic. It would have been nice to have a hot tub close by but that is our only critiscism. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again. Great value. the Basil and Tomato restaurant on the resort was fanatastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: Likestotravel1223
Reviews.Content: I have been to Maui twice before ('01 and '04). We stayed at the Hana Ocean Front Cottages in Hana (private home with separate quarters downstairs and a cottage on the property). This was so quiet and beautiful...directly across from Homoa Beach. When we went for 2 weeks late Aug to early Sept 2009, we stayed at the Royal Lahaina. The grounds are beautiful and the Tower looks really nice. We rented a Garden view room in the oldest part of the hotel and when we arrived they upgraded us to an Ocean front room b/c I am over 50. I believe the room was under $100/night. Although the room was nothing special, you had to be Hercules to open the stuck sliding glass door, and were privy to there tacky luau almost every night (we knew most of the act & songs by the time we left) we did witness the sun setting almost every night between the islands of Lanai and Molokai. If you're going to Maui and plan on staying in your room, first of all stay home for that, then spend more money for a better room. If you are going to do what we did and roam the island every day, swim, snorkel, shop, hike and eat, then don't spend much money on the hotel room (we did not have any bugs) and enjoy all the other things Maui has to offer. I also could not understand why the hotel charged its guests for parking...I thought this to be extremely tacky considering your renting a room from them.

Reviews.Title: “Not more than you ask for by far”
Reviews.Author: watermeter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in Dec, 2009. Although the location is great, the beach is on the quieter side of black rock by far, and the rest of Maui is paradise, we were quite disappointed with our stay at this hotel. We have travelled extensively for years and are not ones to complain but I do want to let people know that although you may be getting a better deal at this hotel, it is for good reason. We unfortunately were put in a room overlooking the golf course and had a partial oceanview right above the exhaust from the restaurant below which kept us up all night and the fumes never subsided. There was absolutely no room for either of us to unpack our things as there was one tiny closet with only three hangers, no drawers or chest of any kind to put our things. We did not have a table on our deck, only two chairs which turned out okay since we couldn't relax with the nonstop fumes and noise from the exhaust. The bathroom was very poorly lit and housekeeping would not come in everyday. The area around the hotel is gorgeous but if you take a short walk and see the other accomodations in the area you will be sad that you are returning to this hotel. The two pools are merely three sizes larger than your bathtub and were kept very cool. The expensive breakfast is very average food but nice to have there if you don't want to venture out too far. They don't allow you take any chairs or loungers down to the beach and the "bar" is a tiny shack by one of these tubs. They are no shady spots on this beach and you will have to fight over the few palm trees on the grassy area. I don't agree with being charged parking while you are their "guest". Add that to your rate and call it a day, why nickle and dime? The staff at the hotel were cold and we found them to be unapproachable. The housekeeping started vaccuuming the outside halls as early as 8 or 9 am. The poor ones that would check in very late from a long flight and wake up to that. The newspaper at your door in the morning was a hit and miss. Nice touch but I would rather buy my own newspaper if many of these other aspects of the stay could be improved upon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, views of the ocean, and private ocean swims”
Reviews.Author: marlisaiahmama
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline for a very good price, and could not have had a better experience. The staff all contain the aloha spirit, and welcome guests with a glass of pineapple water. Our room had an indescribable view of the ocean, and swimming was available immediately outside the resort. Although the hotel was busy, our family swam by ourselves for most of the afternoon. The food at the hotel is not exciting, but the free fire ceremony, singing, and hula, makes it a great place to eat after a long day in the ocean. The swimming pool is tiny, but hey, who cares about the pool when the ocean is steps away? Overall we were very happy with this hotel. Go before everyone finds out how great the Royal Lahaina is and they raise their prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Lovely Hotel, Beautiful Beach”
Reviews.Author: LonelyPlanetFaithful
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on priceline - pool was great (and drinks were too) Loved the room - LOVED LOVED LOVED the lime coconut products in the bathroom!!!!! Generally in HI I try to do more B&Bs and such - but to swtich it up a little we thought we'd kick it up with a nice hotel - and we were really happy we did - nothing bad to say about t!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic beachside fun with cute little birdies”
Reviews.Author: TheJillahs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for couples and families. It is a very peaceful location. right by Kaanapali beach. Our room was in a little beachside hut, with it's own outside area where we could chill out with the little birdies under the flower trees. You got a free Hawaii newspaper every morning. The breakfast was a bit expensive for what it was. The pool was the best bit, with its own cocktail bar and super friendly bartender. Beware, it may be very windy though. The pool is right next to the beach, if you feel like a romantic stroll. There is a free trolley bus to Whaleside Village - the posh shopping centre. And from there it was $1 on another bus to Lahaina town. Lots of things to do there, shops, restaurants, bars. We recommend Kimis for good food and drink, and go at sunset - so beautiful. And you must try the Kimis Hula Pie - it's huge! Back to the hotel - there is a laundrette, its own little shops to buy essentials, free internet (but only 1 PC so you might have to queue). I was more blown away by the location than the hotel itself. If you are going for your honeymoon, you won't be the only ones on honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay, will return”
Reviews.Author: MAMATANNER
Reviews.Content: After leaving, O"ahu, we flew to Maui. Having done some reading of what to see and do, on our way to Lahaina we stopped at the look out suggested for spotting whales. Twenty minutes on the Island and we saw 1 whale breach and one do about 20 tail flaps. I am in HEAVEN. We stopped here many times and were never disappointed, but you do need patience and bonoculars.So on the motel. After being disappointed with the motel in Waikiki, I was a little scared. May I say, thank you to our travel agent for this motel. It is great. I am more used to 4-5 star hotels but with Hawaiian prices we had to compromise, but I was not disappointed. Staff, all of them are friendly and helpfull. Rooms are very clean! Bed is comfortable. Balcony was great. No staff member hassled us for anything, no upgrade, no changing rooms, we arrived early and room was ready. Pools were clean but not used by us and were never full.. Breakfast was included with our package and it was extremely great. Anything you could possibly want. I would have paid the $19.50US for this breakfast ( not for the last hotel breakfast) Beach was geat. This hotel is quite, so for us this is great (we are retired 60yr olds.) I do not need hot tubs and bars in pools, etc. The decor was dark plantation and the sheets were white and crisp adding a contrast to the wooded shutters. The large sliding glass doors opened to our own little patio with 2 chairs and a table. We saw whales from the balcony, as well as a double rainbow. Air conditioner worked well as did eveything, I phoned about our phine and it was fixed as I asked. The shampoos, conditioner, lotions and soap were high quality and after useage we were delighted to smell like coconut and lime. Always plentiful as the maids made sure you did not run out. Maid service was prompt and efficient and room service great. We had stopped at the local safeway grocery store and filled our mini-fridge with water and snack foods The beach is white and the ocean is torquoise blue, beckoning you to enter. It is very swimmable and almost vacant or tourists. We spent every day taking a dip in the ocean...and if you walk up north by a few hotels you can find one of Lahaina's public beach which offers a great snorkelling reef - eels, humuhumus, angelfish, etc. are abundant. We snorkeled Black Rock twice and were lucky to see another sea turtle. We also snorkled in front of the Sherton Hotel ( most people were in their pools, which are beautiful but could have been in any large city) but the wind was blowing and we found it very rocky and no fish of any amount. We had a rental car, but used the free shuttle that goes from hotel to hotel when we were staying close to home due to the high cost of parking in the parkades. Whaled watched with the Pacific Whale group and it was good not too many whales as it was early Dec and I hear Jan and Feb are better. We ate in the restaurant twice and really enjoyed the food and the prices were reasonable. Did the road to Hana and lots of other tourist things but it was always nice to have this beautiful room to return to at night. Loved Maui. Some say there is no shopping but I found lots to see and buy, but really I did not come to Heaven to shop, but to relax in the beauty and peace which is all around you, it is so good for your soul. PS elevators (3) all worked and worked fast, used the laundry facilities which are clean and worked great ( $1.00 dry) but the building here could use some care but then who stays in a laundry room. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay so great. See you again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in tower, not cottages, just to be sure”
Reviews.Author: jarhung
Reviews.Content: I have to concur with a previous poster - why do they try to juke you into the cottage rooms, which are clearly not 3 1/2 stars when a true 3.5 star room is available in the tower at 8pm of check-in time? Do we look like we enjoy staying in Motel 6 rooms? Honestly, I would've preferred sleeping in the car. Fortunately they upgraded us to the tower, 9th floor, facing the Garden. View was nice, but I can see how if you have a lower floor room, it's not a very nice view since it's above the satellite dishes and roof below. Rooms in the tower were indeed nice, I'm sure comprable with the nicer 4 star resorts. Please make SURE you stay in the towers if you want guaranteed 3.5 star rooms! Do not gamble on the cottages. We walked by and into a few of the rooms (during housekeeping), some are well-updated, some just so so. Our cottage initially, cottage I believe "U", was atrocious: Management - this is a 2-star cottage, please do not charge 3.5 star prices and try to pull the wool over our eyes into a 2-star room. You make us feel more "RELIEVED" than "ELATED" when you give us this free "UPGRADE". Pools are fine, nothing special or elaborate. If you want a more all-inclusive resort, you're better off at the Sheraton or Westin, where you can swim and lounge all day around the different connected pools and mini-waterfalls, up to the bars, etc. We walked around, and those have more of a 'vibe'. We were busy exploring the island, so we'd take a morning swim few laps, so not a big deal for us. Luau - very average. The kahlua pig is dry. Bud lite is delicious tho :) One final comment: If you work at the front desk, you should be friendly, not surly. The lady who checked us in intially was just not very nice. Apparently she is that way with everyone. But still, you make us want to avoid interaction with you or asking you for anything, which makes your job easier, but our vacation less relaxed. Work in the back-office then if you don't like human beings.

Reviews.Title: “they try to get your money”
Reviews.Author: hubertCa
Reviews.Content: They tell you the room you booked is not available and in order to get the room you need they make you upgrade and charge an large amount of money extra. Room was not cleaned /serviced.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: captainandcoke
Reviews.Content: We loved the Royal Lahaina!!! We enjoyed everything about the hotel, from the outstanding treatment we received to the luxury and comfort of our hotel room. Based on the reviews we read, we booked an ocean view room in the newly renovated tower. But because we were on our honeymoon, the hotel upgraded us to the top floor. We got a gorgeous, full ocean view off the balcony and a lovely bottle of champagne in the fridge waiting for us. This warm welcome is the perfect example of how well we were treated during our stay. The room looked just like the pictures. Brand new, tastefully furnished, with luxury linens and high end bath soaps/lotions/etc. I believe the room itself was on par with any of the Sheratons or Hiltons I've stayed at. Coupling that with a balcony and a breathtaking view of the ocean, well, we couldn't have been happier. Even though we didn't have a microwave, we were sort of prepared for that. We wanted to stay in a resort hotel, as opposed to a condo with a fully equipped kitchen. We planned on enjoying the great food on the island instead of cooking for ourselves. The Royal Lahaina had everything we wanted. We were right on the beach. There were two beautiful running paths, one by the beach and the other through the golf courses. BTW, those same running paths bring you to the Sheraton and Kaanapali Beach Hotel, so we got to see the other side of Black Rock and have drinks at their hotel bars. We also liked the free shuttle to Whaler's Village and the Lahaina Shuttle stop. We were glad we took the advice of other reviewers and valet parked our rental car. It was quick and easy, and we got to know the hotel staff a little better. And I just can't say enough about how good the customer service was. Everyone was really pleasant and friendly. There were so many other things the hotel offers - a nice pool, a bar & restaurant, a luau, even tennis and golf. But we had so much to do elsewhere on the island, we just ran out of time! One thing I'd warn others about is Kaanapali Beach itself (and this is all of it, not just in front of Royal Lahaina). This is no reflection on the hotel - this is just in case someone reading this isn't a strong swimmer. The water was rough while we were there. We heard about two horrible beach accidents happening within days of each other. We visited other beaches within driving distance, and many seemed safer (one had no waves at all). I don't swim too well, and was glad we had a car to find calmer beaches. That being said, the bottom line is this. If you want to stay in a Kaanapali resort hotel with an ocean view, Royal Lahaina is a great place. Besides being more affordable, I think you're getting about the same amenities as the larger chains (whose rooms may be older and worse for wear). I'd even be willing to bet very few of them have the same views (unless you're willing to pay triple the price). To me, that's just throwing away your money. Save the extra cash and spend it on the many other amazing things to do in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MauiMoon09Michigan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently went there for our honeymoon and I was truly impressed. They upgraded us to a partial ocean view, which worked out because the other view was of the mountains. The room was beautiful, the restaurant had great food, the pools were nice and clean, and the walk to the beach was very easy. Honestly, I'm a tough critic, and I would recommend any of my family and friends to stay here. Because it was our honeymoon, we contemplated staying at a bigger name hotel, but we got our money's worth right here! I definitely want to go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Old School Lahaina with Fantastic Beach”
Reviews.Author: loopysis
Reviews.Content: Last December I was planning my June wedding on priceline.com and, like a slot machine, decided to gamble on 4 rooms in Wailea. Since I had already been rejected for Wailea alone, I added Lahaina and decided to "pull the handle" on a 3.5 star hotel for $130 a night (hoping and praying that it would be Wailea and NOT Lahaina). Well, my gamble was a bust...OR SO I THOUGHT!!! When I saw that it was the Royal Lahaina I started getting sick to my stomach. How in the world could I have gambled $7000 on a hotel I had never stayed at in a location I didn't even know? All I could recollect of Lahaina was the long shopping promenade filled with exorbitant art galleries and that Forest Gump restaurant. Made me want to "Run, Forest, Run!" just at the thought of it. I even unsuccessfully begged a haggard priceline.com employee to let me out of this obligation (since not 24 hours later a tree had fallen on our car, also ripping out the power, cable and phone to our home). Evenutally my fiance had patted my head long enough to calm me down and suggested I just 'play it where it lies'...which is a better golf analogy than a gambling analogy. We took the kids (5 between us) and the parents (4 between us) and headed out to Maui on June 22, 2009. Aside from a layover in the city we left from (yes, we flew an hour and half only to have to turn around back to Seattle for a medical emergency (P.S. - hearing a flight attendant as he walks briskly down the aisle ask, "is there a doctor on the plane" is NOT something one who hates flying should ever hear?) So, 10 hours later (of a 6 hour flight) we had made our destination to our favorite island of Maui. We were "welcomed home" in the aloha fashion by the guards at the resort. As we checked in we were charmed by the chilled wet lavender-infused wash clothes and the ice cold water with large slices of fresh pineapple. The staff were welcoming and professional and when they found out we were getting "maui'ed" they upgraded 2 of our rooms to water views. Our parents received the garden rooms and they were able to watch the golfers try to avoid the walkers pushing their baby carriages along the beach path and the hotel's beautiful garden areas. The decor was dark plantation and the sheets were white and crisp adding a succulent contrast to the wooded shutters. The large sliding glass doors opened to our own little patio with 2 chairs and a table: a perfect setting to sit back with a cup of complimentary coffee while watching the surf hit the shore. The shampoos, conditioner, lotions and soap were high quality and after useage we were delighted to smell like coconut and lime. My mother-in-law swore by a good coconut lotion dousing after a day spent too long in the sun. Maid service was prompt and efficient and room service was a bit pricey but necessary after our long trip. We stopped at the local grocery store and filled our mini-fridge with yogurts, and snack foods and our cupboards with cereal and papayas (the PERFECT Maui breakfast - 1/2 papaya, yogurt and granola - and the papaya acts as it's own bowl) and purchased a brita water filter to avoid having to buy bottle after bottle of water. The pool was always a perfect temperature and the lounge chairs were always available. The wind, so strong in June, took a heavy wood chaise lounge and drug it right into the pool...so beware of what you let free when you're laying there. The beach is white and the ocean is torquoise blue, beckoning you to enter. It is very swimmable and almost vacant or tourists. We spent every day taking a dip in the ocean...and if you walk up north by a few hotels you can find one of Lahaina's public beach which offers a great snorkelling reef - eels, humuhumus, angelfish, etc. are abundant. When we got hungry we took the whole family to the buffet, which was a bit pricey for what was offered but everybody walked away satiated. At night the restaurant offers live music and hula dancing and we were among the lucky to go up and dance with the beautiful hula lady. And, God forbid, pictures were taken. Needless to say, we were very satisfied with our experience. One drawback is the elevators - which you'll see mentioned in other reviews. There is usually one that is broken (of the three) and it does take a while to get down to the lobby. There were many times that we decided to grab a little exercise and just take the stairs. It was both fun and good for us. In December of 2009 we came back to the Royal Lahaina - this time getting the room for $110/night through priceline.com. We were offered an upgrade if we didn't like the cottage room but once we went inside and got the feel of it, we were hooked. This is, without question, "Old School". The cottages have not been updated, the showers are a bit square and large and strange and the pillows were a bit lumpy but we loved this room even more than the tower rooms. Being in a cottage room allowed us the privacy that we craved while having the comforts of room service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise,Great place!”
Reviews.Author: JWLChicago
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually like to stay at 5 star Hotels on any vacation trip but we were traveling with my sister and her husband and they wanted to watch the budget so we selected the Royal Lahaina based on the reviews. I usually am pretty critical but this place was a great find.Ignore the slightly dated front desk,it is not reflective of the rest of the hotel. Our deluxe oceanview room was spectacular.We were on the top floor with a great view of Molekai and the beach.The furnishings were as good as any Hilton,Westin etc. Housekeeping was great and very freiendy,the room was always immaculate. The staff were all very friendly and I believe were genuinely glad to help you. A special thanks to Ike,our Bellman at check in, and eventual "Concierge",great guy with right on restaurants and tips.We came as guests and left as friends with the staff at the Royal Lahaina.Will definitely stay again.Oh,never ate at the restaurants but who does anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: travellover145
Reviews.Content: I originally had a "garden view" room, but when I checked in I asked about an upgrade. They hecked and were able to give me an upgrade to a partial ocean view for free. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance of "The Whaler's Village" for nearby shopping. I was very happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Elenza
Reviews.Content: Royal Lahaina resort is really nice hotel! Actually it's kind of surprizing that prices there are so decent. Location of the hotel is great - 15 minutes walk to Whalers Village and really close to Lahaina. We were leaving in the Tower, which was reconstrusted recently, so everything was brand new, pretty and clean. Really nice two pools, beach is in 3 minutes, and believe me, it's one of the best beaches on Maui. Staff is polite and helpful. And pineapple water in the hall, hula-dancer and a singer every night at the restaurant, lei-making lessons, movies under the stars were kind of cool detail. They offer one of the best Luau on Maui. I would definitely stay there again and strongly recommend everybody else!

Reviews.Title: “Waste of potential”
Reviews.Author: KarenLen
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location on the beachfront in Maui. It is totally let down by the poor facilities and lack of" in-resort ambience". We booked a beachfront cottage room for 9 nights at about $350 a night. When we got to our room we were very disappointed. The room was incredibly small, had terrible privacy from the nighbours (5 other units in the "cottage",the air con had no remote, the TV was old school on its last legs, the room had not been refurbished for at least 15 years. Worst of all the "beachfront" outside our room had the resorts swimming pool in between us and the beach - so instead of a romantic little place where we could sit outside our room and watch the waves break we could sit outside our room and share the experience with dozens of people lounging around the pool. We had to keep all our curtains closed otherwise people walking past could see us lying in bed. You could not even see the beach unless you stood up and peered over the bushes! One day we recieved a note saying that there would be no water or air-con in the resort from 9-5pm next day - what a joke - we had to leave the resort to go to the toilet. Twice in the middle of the night there were false fire alarms forcing the evacuation of our rooms. The in house entertainemt was terrible with the same singer singing the same mournul songs every night for 9 nights. The swimming pools and bars were not much better than what you would see in a decent back yard. We eventually paid to upgrade to an ocean view unit where but at a cost pushing the room to $600 a night. Great room but would have rather spent the money at a better resort with better facilities. Staff were friendly and the place clean. In need of a full on makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: PoldiStar
Reviews.Content: we had one of the great cottages close to the beach

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: cheapguy23
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels I ever stayed at. Anniversary time, greeted at the time you step in the lobby. Refreshing pineapple water, bellhops wisk your bags away, and take them to a beautiful room. Room wasnt the biggest, but great for two people. Nice partial view of the ocean and mountains. Even had a bottle of champagne in the fridge. Wood decor was wonderful, bathroom clean and nicely furnished. Best sleep I had in a lonnnnng time! Basically a great time! Wouldnt hesitate to stay again. Tip for drivers...if you have a car, self park is $10/day, valet is 15/day. Valet lot is next to self park, so unless you are handicapped, save yourself $5/day and take the 1min walk to the car!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: JulieOzo
Reviews.Content: We had a great time and were pampered by the staff at this beautiful, tranquil hotel. Loved the decor, too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort but don't stay in the "cottages"...”
Reviews.Author: TraceyPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We spend several weeks in Maui every spring and fall. Early this November we were married there. Although we always stay at a private residence, per our recommendation, a few of our wedding guests stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort. I have always loved the Royal Lahaina. The property is beautifully landscaped and the beach cannot be beat. Itâ€™s located in a quite stretch of Kaanapalli beach but still close to shopping and great restaurants. Itâ€™s a great value â€“ way less expensive than the neighboring resorts and hotels. We booked rooms specifically in the newly renovated Kai Tower for our friends because we know the â€œcottagesâ€� are scheduled for demolition to make room for new condoâ€™s and therefore have not been updated or renovated like the main tower rooms â€“ which were beautifully redone about two to three years ago. The check in staff will tell you the cottages have had a â€œsoft renovationâ€� and try to sell you on them. Please... they are dumps. We have seen them. Do not be fooled or taken advantage of. Like so many other peoples reviewâ€™s here on trip advisor, upon check-in the staff tried to force our friends into a cottage instead of the Kai Tower rooms we reserved for them. Our friends stood their ground and ended up in beautiful Kai Tower rooms as we reserved. Again, the Royal Lahaina is a lovely resort and a great value. Just be sure you know what room you are getting before you agree to it. Ask them to show you the cottage before you make a decision to stay in one. Attention Royal Lahain staff: Why do you do try to force your guests from a great room to a substandard room?? I don't get it... Huge bummer for our guests and because of it we will most likely never recommend you again to our friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous......Noelle, Ireland”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissSmiles
Reviews.Content: Its only taken us over a year to review this hotel!!!! But sitting in cold wet Ireland I wish I was there. We spent our honymoon in Maui and I could safely say we could not find any fault with this hotel and we have stayed in some bad places as we have travelled. Warm, friendly people who were unobtrusive is how I would describe staff, who when asked couldnt do enough for you. We spent ten days as guests of the RL and I have recommended this hotel to others. Our complimentary upgrade and those sunsets will live with me forever.... We hope to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding of our dreams”
Reviews.Author: sendmebacktohawaii
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was FABULOUS!! We got married there and it was like a dream come true. We had one of the biggest weddings the resort had ever had! Half of our guests stayed at the hotel and we all had an amazing time and loved the hotel. The staff were VERY friendly, the rooms were beautiful. They were not too small, not at all dirty, and the housekeeping were fantastic. We had the same woman every day so we got to know her and she even left us a note on our wedding day saying congrats. The hotel is so open, there is pineapple water to drink and lavender towels to wipe your hands in the lobby everyday. The restaurant is not overpriced, unless you consider $10 pizza or $12 ribs expensive. Some of our friends still crave the ribs!! And a few nights a week they sell their wine at half price - amazing deal! As for our wedding. It was the time of our life. We did get off to a bad start with an incompetent wedding planner, but once we realized that we were not being looked after, we called and got a new wedding planner who absolutely made us feel like we were important and she definitely went above and beyond to make our day a dream come true. So, if you get married there, ask for Amy to be your wedding planner!! She is so sweet, there are not enough words to describe how wonderful she is. Both swimming pools were great, and the beach is gorgeous. We also had guests stay in the cottages...and there were NO problems. They are not as fancy as the tower, but there was absolutely nothing wrong with them. In fact, we ended up spending a lot of time at one of the cottages because they had a huge patio right beside the golf course, it was great for hanging out after a day at the beach. I LOVED it here, wish we could do it all over again and we can't WAIT to go back for our one year anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: ribbin
Reviews.Content: I was given this trip as a 50th Birthday present from my husband. When I started checking everything he had planned I became nervous after reading some of the reviews. But, it was a wonderful gift, so I said nothing. When we arrived to the Royal Lahaina Resort the first thing that happened was a complimentary room upgrade. We did not ask, they just did it. The valet and front desk people were extremely helpful and friendly. This is our third trip to Maui, first time staying on the Lahaina side. Our room was very nice, everything clean and comfortable. Again, maintenance came to our room to fix a broken sink stopper that we were unaware of. Housekeeping had told them. The resort has a much more laid back atmosphere than some of the other resorts. This suited us just fine, there was nothing missing from the larger resorts except the noise and crowded feeling. The pools were clean and inviting. I think some new deck furniture would enhance the second pool. The grounds were clean and well maintained. The restaurant was really good. Everything is expensive in Maui, so I thought it was in line with other places. Food was good. The bar and bartenders were very friendly and fast. We met fun people and had a couple of nights that were spent at the bar the hanging out, making new friends and laughing while enjoying well made Mai Tai's! The Luau is average. The food was good, the show was the average part. The dancers were just okay. Parking - paid the extra $5.00 for valet. The valets were fast and friendly. Elevators - never a very long wait, even at checkout time. I have enjoyed all my stays on Maui. Both sides, Lahaina and Waliea were awesome. If I were in Lahaina again I would stay at the Royal Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fantastic rooms, great views”
Reviews.Author: kngeducate
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Maui. The rooms are fantastic and new, the views from the balconies are incredible and it's in the heart of the resort area or Lahaina. A free trolley runs throughout the resorts and to the mall, but it is also a fairly short walk. The beach is beautiful, but a little rocky. My wife and I even made friends with some of the locals on the beach (sand crabs!!). As the hotel is on the west side of the Island, I highly recommend to spend at least one evening on the beach to get a picture of the sunset over the ocean, incredible. The only issue is the distance to the town of Lahaina. to get to town, take one of the many busses from the mall to downtown. It is only a short bus ride and it's cheap. i would advise against taking a taxi as it costs about $20 each way. Fantastic hotel....loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Please Read”
Reviews.Author: tessyts1968
Reviews.Content: November 2009 This resort is way over priced and deserves less than the 3 stars it gets. We were led to believe that they had just rennovated the hotel to the tune of 35 million. So that made us look past some of the reviews we read before leaving. We were told that we had a garden View Room but would be upgraded to an Ocean View if possible. In fact there is another View that they do NOT tell you about. It is called the Satellite View Room. That is in fact what they tried to put us in. Most all of the partial ocean view rooms look out over the ugly brown roof with bird crap all over it and duct work. The balcony of our room had dried bird poop on the rails and dried coffee stains all over the little cheap table. I honestly never saw one staff person smile. They were down right rude at best. The restaurant was way over priced and the waitress ridiculed us for only ordering 1 breakfast to share. I have had gastric surgery and only eat a few bites and her behavior embarrassed me. The rooms are VERY small. The shower took a long time to finally heat up and was luke warm at best and then the glass shower door wouldnt stay shut and leaked all over the bathroom floor causing a small flood. The small fridge was never cold. The carpet was dirty and had potato chips left on it the minute we walked into the room and the staff person just looked at it and shook his head and we never heard anymore about it. The sheets were changed 1 time because I insisted and was present while they were changed. The parking was $10 a day and believe me when I say we had trouble getting out of the car w/o dinging the car next to ours and we are both small people. The pools were dirty and the luau is very expensive.The people never asked how things were, even at check out because they know that people staying there are not pleased. Many of the guest were not happy. Honestly people Super 8 is nicer than this place. This is an old run down resort that has some new paint on the walls and small flat screen t.v.s still it stinks like an old resort. The halls have NO airconditioning and this is a problem when you are waiting on the elevator to get there. Some of the elevators are out of service. Oh YES this takes the cake. The rooms are VERY dark. You can not see to put on makeup or fix your hair and the staff was aware of this and brought up one of those old lady light up makeup mirrors after we called and asked what to do. We had planned to get married there and were so upset we postponed our wedding and will go to the Carribean. PLEASE BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with a choice of pools or prestine beaches for swimming or snorkeling.”
Reviews.Author: TasmaniaHawaii
Reviews.Content: After a long day travelling my wife and i finally arrived at about midday to a very welcoming reception.We checked in and were escorted to our room on the 5th floor which was imaculately presented.Kingsize bed in moderate size room with most mod cons provided.The view from our laini was far beyond our expectations,absolutely beautiful looking out over Kaanapali beach and surrounding grounds.We spent 7 wonderful days enjoying our accommodation complex and exploring other locations around Maui.Snorkeling at black rock was a highlight of our stay.Hoping to return someday and would not hesitate in recommending THE ROYAL LAHAINA.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: -tourist865-
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the tower for 6 nights. The hotel amenities were very good, the staff were always courteous and helpful, and we felt that it was very good value for money. Along with the free room upgrade to a partial ocean view room, our stay here was very comfortable. The location is also quite good, about 15minute walk to Whaler's Village and Kaanapali Beach. The beach front at the hotel is also nice and quiet. The beach near Whaler's Village is more lively and crowded. We tried the food at the restaurant one night and found it to be not very tasteful, but this seem to be a common occurrence on Maui. You might be able to get by here without a car but we found it almost a necessity to have the flexibility to tour around. There is a trolley bus that comes every 30-40min to take you to Whaler's Village and a bus that goes into Lahaina. You would need to rely on hotel pick up service when booking tours though. The only minor glitch was a toilet that was loose on its foundations which caused it to rock when in use. Overall would be happy to recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for 1 week of our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: tracymiami
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year for the first week of our honeymoon. The hotel was nice. The rooms were lovely and large with a a good size balcony and a very comfy bed and very modern. Staff were really friendly and helpful There were not many places to eat on site but we did have breakfast in the resturant. There was a small mall about 10 minutes walk away but again only had about 4 resturants so choices were limited unless you went into other hotels in the area. The bar in the hotel shut really early as we arrived about 10pm and it was closed so nowhere close by to have a drink. You could get a cab into the local town Lahaina which had a good selection of bars and resturants. My biggest gripe was there were no sun loungers on that part of the beach so we had to use the pool which was very basic which was rather disapointing as we had travelled from the UK to sit on a beach in Hawaii. We hired a private cabana which overlooked some of the beach but it was like $30 which i thought was very expensive for what it was. Was a nice hotel but is not on the top of my list

Reviews.Title: “A great deal - W like feel to the renovated tower rooms”
Reviews.Author: EdwardTylicki
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina is a great bargain for the price. The renovated Tower rooms feel like a W. The views from the balcony of the mountains and ocean are amazing. Loved watching the sunset each night. The lobby is still shabby. There also is a great beach that is not too crowded. I just loved the feel of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Fantastic Beach”
Reviews.Author: julia_1962
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina at the end of a long overseas adventure. It was fantastic from start to finish. We had booked a partial ocean room, but upgraded to a full ocean view room and it was the best thing we did. the room was big and beautifully furnished with a lovely view of the pool and beach. A few floors higher would have been even better. The hotel grounds are small compared to places like the Sheraton, but this is a plus in my books - we went to the Sheraton one morning for breakfast and it was double the price and the building was so huge and the resort so big it was awful. Too many people! Anyway, the beach at the royal Lahaina is beautiful - crystal clear water with good snorkelling just off the shore. Hotel and bar staff were very friendly and helpful. The only down side was the food choices were a bit limited and the little cafe is not that flash. ANd I think they should offer free wi-fi, it's very expensive otherwise. But everything else about this hotel is great. I loved the 1960's Hawaii feel of the lobby, but don't expect that in the rooms -they are thoroughly modern and very high spec. Upgrade to full ocean view if you can. it's certainly worth it. We'd definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: davebernie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at better places but have also payed extra for them as well. This place has a great location on a very quiet beach and is just a short walk to Whalers Village. The renovated rooms are clean and comfortable. If you go purchase the package that includes the Valet parking, daily newspaper and free Mai Tai....a lot better value than the self parking option. Remember also the happy hour that works on Hawaiian time...seems to go forever...2 till 6 if I remember....a bit hard after all the Mai Tais.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Wedding trip!”
Reviews.Author: LH80
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 night here as part of our wedding celebrations. We actually got married on the lawn of the hotel on our 5th day. When we arrived it was already dark and we were told that we had been upgraded. We were taken to the 12th (top) floor to our room. It did have an oceanview, but not oceanfront, so I called down to the desk and asked if there was anything oceanfront available. After waiting a few minutes I was advised that we could further upgraded to the one bedroom suite for a small extra nightly fee. Iâ€™d seen this room on the website and was delighted and agreed to the extra fee, it was our wedding week after all! The room was on the 11th floor and was gorgeous. 2 lanai with table and chairs and one on the other side too. It had spectacular views out the mountains and the oceanfront. There were 2 bathrooms, the main one being huge with a beautiful free standing bath and 2 sinks, with a dressing area too. I did wonder why there were no bathrobes, and it took 2 days for me to discover that there should have been, it then took 2 calls to get them brought to the room. That's probably the only downside though! We took the valet parking deal and the valet guys were great, very helpful with local suggestions too. We splurged on valet, but I don't think its really necessary, its not that far to walk to the self parking lot at all. Also, donâ€™t bother with the mai tai deal with parking unless you plan on being around the pool al lot and drinking during the day. We found the bar in the hotel was closed by 9.30 most nights and we couldn't get our free drinks. They wouldn't roll them over to the next day either. The two pools are on the small side but have plenty of beds around them for laying out. And you are step away from the beautiful beach and pacific ocean too. I didnâ€™t have time to snorkel, but my friends say they saw lots of fish right off the beach. The hotel provides beach towels which was handy. We had the buffet breakfast one morning which was nice, but not sure if it was worth $20 per person. We walked to Whaler's Village a few times for dinner which was great, and went to the Luau the night before our wedding which was also very good. We hired a car for the duration of our stay, and I'd say that if you are going to be there for more than 2 or 3 days this is a must. We did some really fun things during our stay in addition to getting married, I'd recommend the zipline tour at Kanaapali - the guides there are amazing fun, we also biked down the volcano but unfortunately got a cloudy day, and we had a private surf lesson, so much fun! The lobby was lovely, seemed really Hawaiian. Having read some reviews I was expecting the hotel to be a bit shabby, but it wasn't at all. I did have friends who stayed in a cottage room. And while there were not as nice as the tower rooms, they weren't too bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “You can not call this a RESORT”
Reviews.Author: chanelcpr
Reviews.Content: Purchased this hotel and air through a charity auction. Website made the property look very nice and inviting. Wrong...I first must say that the newly renovated rooms were very nice, with comfortable beds. Other than that, there were absolutely no amenities : a few pool chairs around the pool area, no pool beverage or food service, no umbrella (so you could only stay out for a very limited time). No rooms service. We did check out the cottages, OMG I didn't know rooms like that still existed. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone. We checked out and went to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, you should stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGirlAZ
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here for our anniversary. I scoured the internet for months looking for the best hotel/condo to stay in on Maui. I have NO regrets staying at Royal Lahaina. The hotel itself is as magical as Maui itself. When I walked into our room Sunday evening after a LONG flight, I was immediately at ease. There was an absolutely breathtaking view of the ocean and sunset. I just melted. Not to mention the rooms are nicely decorated. I loved all the wood decor. The tile shower was great and relaxing. Also their toiletries were really nice. It was a lime coconut scent that was really good. The next morning we ate breakfast at the hotel. It was REALLY good buffet. I thought it was pricey ($20 per person), but actually after eating at other restaurants, this is actually a good deal. If you want something quick and light, they have a little cafe on the premises that sell bagels, donuts, fruit, juice etc. We ate there a couple times. The pool area is cozy and is right in front of the ocean. If I could go back I would do a few less activities and spend more time just enjoying the hotel. I just smiled the whole time I walked around the hotel. There is light hawaiian music playing everywhere. It just oozes Aloha. It wasn't a crowded hotel either which was great. Lots of people we met on various activities bragged they were staying at more expensive Sheraton or Westin, but we walked around those places, and it wasn't really worth the money from what we saw. The location of this hotel is also perfect. It is right near Black rock which has AWESOME snorkeling just a few feet from the beach. It was like swimming in a fish aquarium. I didn't see any sea turtles though =( RL is also close to Whalers Village which is REALLY nice! I wish we had've check it out sooner than our last night. Plus the hotel is right off the 30 highway which easily gets you anywhere on the island quick. ABout 10 minutes from Lahaina and 30 minutes to airport. I PRAY that we can go back soon. I truly left my heart in Maui. I plan on staying at Royal Lahaina. It is the best deal with an amazingly cozy hotel. (PS-I read reviews about slow elevators, but we were staying on the top 12th floor and had no waiting at all. They were pretty fast to me) (PSS- Check out CJ's deli. The food is GOOOOOD and fairly reasonable. It is right near the hotel at the Kaanapali Fairway Shops) (PSSS- Check out Hula Grill in Whaler's Village. DELICIOUS food, and absolutely PERFECT hawaiian vibe. Including live music)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: squashirt1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I would most defnitely return to the Royal Lahaina. We spent 9 days theere for our second anniversary in June 2009. We had a non-ocean view room in the tower, but we could still see the ocean off of our balcony. Since the hotel is on the opposite side of black rock as most of the Kaanapali hotels, we basically had a private beach during our stay. There was pretty good snorkeling near the Sheraton on the other side of black rock. It is just a short walk through the Sheraton to that part of the public beach. It is also a quick walk to Whalers village from the Royal Lahaina. We used the expedia travel services on site at the hotel to book our excursions. It was very convenient and the prices were about average. It is defnitely important to book your excursions either before you go or on your first day, because tours fill up fast. The pools are average and it can be hard to find beach chairs at times, but we don't like to sit around a whole lot on vacation so that was fine. I can sit around at home, so there is no need to do it on vacation. Some people complained that there were no parking spaces, but what they really meant was that there were no close parking spaces. We NEVER had trouble finding parking, but did have to walk from the end of the farthest lot a few times. It certainly was not something I would say was negative about the resort. The one thing I would rate negatively was the elevator. It sometimes took 10 minutes or more for an elevator to come. This is even more of a problem, because there are really no stairs that you can use. They really need to do something about their elevators. Overall, we loved the Royal Lahaina and hope that we might someday return. Thank you for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Avoid the Cottages”
Reviews.Author: JiminAttleboro
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, it looks like the complaining of the cottages is pretty common. May be complaining about the cottages is getting tiring, but I have to put in my two cents here. We booked our honeymoon as a package, and were told the cottages were nice and less expensive, so we gave them a shot ( as a package, I honestly don't know the price we paid ). When we arrived at the hotel, it was friendly enough and after check in we were given a small tour of the facility on our way to our cottage on a golf cart ( nice touch I thought but may be common place nowadays ). The cottage appeared nice initally until a closer inspection. The whole place seemed way outdated, and the sliding doors on the closets couldn't even stay on the rails. The AC worked, but struggled. The bathroom, in all honesty, was an embarrassment. The bathtub was stained, there was chipped paint all over the place, and the shower was extremely hard to regulate ( we never once had a shower with a setting we were comfortable with ). And the toilet....I can't even begin to describe. It was so bad at flushing that I once had to flush it FIVE times to clear everything. And two times we found small lizards crawling around ( a small cockroach too ). I guess being in the tropics this might be somewhat common, but in what is supposed to be a luxury resort, I found it unacceptable. We thought about complaining and going to the tower ( and trust me, we NEVER complain, it just isn't our nature ) but we decided to stick with it and it ended up being ok. The maid service could have been better, as we got some dirt on our sheets and they were never changed. One time the maid didn't come until almost 4 oclock. The privacy was nice though, even though the locks are very cheap. One thing too that I didn't care for is the room keys themselves. They are about the size of a padlock key. Even though we never lost them, they easily could be. The biggest problem I had though, is that we got locked out of our cottage TWICE. Once is a mistake, twice is a habit. The first time the maid was still in the area, and we were able to get in. The second time, however, we had to walk to the front desk and tell the girl we were locked out and it wasn't our fault. She said ok but never apologized. They sent maintenance, he couldn't get in ( and seemed annoyed at us ) and he called housekeeping who finally got in. NOBODY apologized ( though the housekeeper was pleasant). This was annoying this time because we had a long day of driving and we were looking forward to relaxing in our room. I still can't understand why the maid locked the door from the inside. The fact that nobody apologized ddin't help any. The rest of the resort is pretty good I guess. The restaurant at the beach was very pricey I thought, and the beach was nice and quiet. Most of the workers were pleasant, and the ladies at the activities desk were very helpful. But pretty good for a luxury resort isn't good enough. The whole place just seems outdated and in need of an overhaul. The parking is very crowded, and the spots themselves are very narrow, barely allowing room to open the car door. The luau I thought was real good, but I thought it was going to be on the beach and a bit longer. Looking back I wish we had asked to be upgraded to the tower, but I am the type ( my wife too ) that understand that people make mistakes and not everything is perfect. However, there have to be better options in Maui than this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: PortMoodyCouple
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Maui, we read lots of reviews and priced out many hotels, we finally decided to stay at Royal Lahaina. We were not disappointed with our choice. Great location, fantastic clean and comfortable rooms, and helpful and curteous staff. Great strip of beach in front of hotel, good for swimming and snorkelling, also very close proximity to Lahaina. Easy to find, and lots of parking. Well kept grounds, rooms, and building.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing beach, great breakfast, quaint room”
Reviews.Author: skoester
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home after 14 nights in Maui. We spent the first part in Wailea at the Marriot Resort and Spa, the middle a condo at the Papakea and our last night in the Royal Lahaina. We loved it. The lobby was pretty, the valet was quick and attentive, the rooms were clean, and perfect. We had a room on the ground level that was a four room bungalow?! I don't know what it was called! We were upgraded to this as we just pricelined the room. Our family (an infant, a three year old and a nine year old) all were in the room. The bathrooms were large. The tub was quite deep. There was a mini fridge in between the double sinks, very large closets. The room was average sized and had two double beds. There was a tv, a chair and two small tables. The back was was entirely glass doors and sliding shutters. The patio area was concrete, had a full sized table and chairs, over looked a grassy area then a pool, then the ocean. This is an ocean property and like all Maui property it isn't new. However, it was clean and sweet. It isn't shiny. It isn't the Ritz, but the room size is the same :) We did the breakfast buffet in the morning, it was wonderful. The prices weren't bad for Maui. The made on demand omelets were fantastic, there was tons of stuff for everyone. We sat outside and overlooked the ocean and pool. It was heavenly. We did a bit of time in the ocean before our flight and it was our favorite beach. It was so clear that you could read a book through the water. The waves and sand on this stretch of the beach were the best were saw on our 14 day trek. It was beyond amazing. Check out was super easy. We found the valet to make sense for us and for only $5 more. I can answer any questions if you want to email me. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel at a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: BeachLover4702
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was a little nervous about what to expect at the Royal Lahaina based on the negative reviews I read on this site. Iâ€™m thrilled to say our stay was totally positive. Iâ€™m seriously wondering if those who had negative comments stayed in a Royal Lahaina resort in a strange, parallel universe! From the moment we arrived (after 12 hours of flying from the US East Coast), we experienced truly genuine friendly hospitality from everyone at the resort. We never had to wait long for the elevators. If you want to really experience that, just go to any midtown NYC hotel. Youâ€™ll see what a real wait is AND youâ€™ll be stuffed like a sardine in the elevator with a ton of people that you really donâ€™t want to be close to. Do yourself a favor and once you step foot off the plane, take a breath and â€œchill-laxâ€�. Isnâ€™t that what a vacation is all about? The pools seemed perfectly fine to us but we came to Maui for the beaches. Iâ€™m sure there are more lavishly landscaped pools on the island but youâ€™ll pay a lot more for them. We thought the towels (available poolside or at the front desk) to take to the beach or out & about was a super perk (that much less to pack in your suitcase). Just bring them back and the next day there was a huge bin with fresh ones to grab! On the subject of the beach, the stretch outside the Royal Lahaina was beautiful, clean, and free of sharp rocks. Our room was spacious, comfortable, and clean. We had plenty of drawer/shelf/closet space; we actually brought too many clothes as we lived in our bathing suits most of the time. The lobby and main restaurant areas were also very nicely decorated and not at all â€œoutdatedâ€� as some other travelers commented. The lobby & room decorations suited the hotelâ€™s location; did these people that had negative comments on the decor think they were going to Paris/LA/etc? We did notice a little water dripping down the door casing divider from the shower/toilet area to the sink area. However we went down to the front desk & reported it, went to breakfast and upon our return to the room, it was all fixed and didn't occur again. We were very pleased at the speed & efficiency of the repair! The valet parking was well worth the $5 extra a day and we gave the guys a few extra dollars each time they ran to retrieve our car (and they really hustledâ€¦never had to wait more than a minute or 2 for our car). We enjoyed talking to the valets and they gave us great suggestions on places to go (including a great non-tourist sushi place where we ate wonderful sushi for next to nothingâ€¦Genkiâ€™s just down the street from the hotel). They even asked us how our day was & what we did when we returned to handover the keys for them to park our car upon our return. On the subject of tips, people need to keep in mind that all the locals working in the hotels, restaurants, etc., usually work multiple jobs to keep up with the cost of living and they appreciate an extra bit here & there. We are by no means wealthy but this was our 25th anniversary trip and something we've been saving up for (even though we've had our share of expenses with 3 kids). I guess we identify with the locals. There are so many things to do both on-property and around the island. We took advantage of the free yoga classes and there were also sign-ups for other activities in the lobby. We also spent time talking to the locals (at restaurants, shops, and just out & about all over the island). They were all so nice and we enjoyed our conversations with them. Give them some respect; Maui is their home and they graciously allow us tourists to experience their beautiful island! We are so looking forward to making a return trip back to Maui and when we do, weâ€™re heading to the Royal Lahaina!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Soccer10_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights. The staff was great and the place/location were awesome. We couldnt have really asked for anything better for the price we paid. Rooms were very clean and bed very comfortable. We stayed in one of the garden cottages. I'm sure the rooms in the tower were nicer but thats ok :) If you go to the bar ask for Richard. He makes by far the best Mai Tai on the island from Lahaina to Walea. He is also so much fun to talk to!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Gorgeous, Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Royal Lahaina Resort as part of our honeymoon and we absolutely loved it!!! The room, view and service was excellent. The Hotel itself is a little further away from the other hotels along Kaanapali Beach but this is one of the things we liked. We went for a walk along the front of the other hotels and it was much busier there. There is a free shuttle (the Kaanapali Trolley) that runs from the hotel to Whalers Village, however it is only a 10 minute walk anyway (all downhill going!) Once at Whalers Village you can hop on a bus to lahaina itself for only a dollar. There are lots more shops and restaurants here too. The Royal Ocean Terrace Restaurant in the hotel served a lovely all you can eat breakfast buffet, however there is the Royal Scoop ice cream shop on site that also sells coffee and bagels if you fancy something lighter. I cannot fault Maui or The Royal Lahaina we loved every minute of being there. We used the Pleasant activities desk to book our helicopter ride and would like to thank Elena for all her help as she was so lovely to us! When arriving at the airport its best to use a shuttle to get to the hotel, we got a taxi as we didn't know any better and this cost alot of money around $90, executive shuttle cost $50 for myself and my husband so obviously we used them on the way back to the airport. Would love to visit Maui again and The Royal Lahaina is where we would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “By far the worst resort/hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: IslandGirl2026
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon visit to the Royal Lahaina in Maui. It was by far the worst resort/hotel experience ever. We booked one of the cottages for three nights. When we checked in we were impressed with what we thought was a guard stand at the entrance of the resort. Having heard several stories about tourists having their belongings stolen in Maui, we wanted to be sure we were staying in a place that had some functional security measures. We approached a jovial gentleman manning the station; he greeted us and sent us onward to register at the front desk after verifying our reservation. Upon entering the lobby there is ice cold pineapple water and fresh damp towels to cool off with. Having just left a different resort on Oahu that offered fresh pineapple juice upon your arrival, it wasnâ€™t quite as refreshing but it was appreciated none the less. As I checked in my husband waited with the Jeep in front of the hotel. Even though the lobby was empty, the front desk staff was noticeably distracted and seemed somewhat â€œput outâ€� by my presence but I was eventually greeted. I made it a point to let them know that it was our honeymoon. They proceeded to prepare our room keys and were educated on the $10 per night parking fee. Having noticed that the parking lot was near-full on the way in I was a bit concerned with having to compete for parking so I asked what happens if someone steals your paper parking tag from your convertible vehicle. The answer I received was â€œweâ€™ll give you a new one.â€� At this point, I began to wonder what the point of the parking tag was anyway! Room keys in hand, I approached the Jeep and found my husband parked further down the hill than I had left him. He informed me that the bellman had told him that he needed to move the car while he was waiting for me. The problem was that the hill was really steep and we were then going to have a problem removing our heavy bags on that downward slope. After driving around in a circle back to the original level spot, the bellman then offered to help unloading our bags into a golf cart. My husbandâ€™s backpack carried all of our electronics in it (laptop, nav unit etc..), and he let the bellman know that we would like to take that bag. The bellman then grabbed it anyway and tossed it in the back of the cart. Ugh. We proceeded to the cottage room and entered only to find a small, dark, damp, 1970â€™s style studio apartment minus a kitchen and eating area with an atrocious bathroom and two full (not queen) size beds. We immediately announced to the bellman that it was our honeymoon. The bellman returned to the lobby to get a cottage with one large bed for us and returned in five minutes or so. While he was gone we observed the room a little better; it was not comfortable feeling (old, stinky damp). The air conditioning unit was struggling, the temperature inside was only slightly cooler than outside and it was very loud. The windows were old louver style windows that did not completely shut, hence why the temperature wasnâ€™t comfortable and why we could hear the girl next door talking on her cell phone so clearly. Additionally, the window did not offer any view of the beach, nor did the sliding glass door as it was facing the same boring lawn. I am unsure what anyone would find pleasing about staying there. We were escorted to the new cottage (same style and nasty feel) and within five minutes of discussion let the front desk know we needed a room in the hotel. Weâ€™ve seen pictures of cottages and were really impressed with the seclusion, updated style and the amazing views. This was not the case with the cottages at the Royal Lahaina. They offered us an ocean view room on the 11th floor of the hotel for an extra $100 per night and after reminding them again that it was our honeymoon, settled for the offer at $50 extra per night. We had already incurred $180 in unexpected charges and we hadnâ€™t been there an hour. The bellman seemed annoyed that we asked for him to bring our jeep windows up with our bags (?), very strange. We proceeded to the hotel, completed the paperwork and proceeded to our room to await the arrival of our bags. The hotel room was much better. The bathroom was clean and so was the shower, the room was generally clean and put together. However, there were at least 4 large towels, two hand towels and only one washcloth. Who gives an odd number of matching towels? How frustrating to have to call for something so basic. It was definitely only a partial ocean view as it required you to be on the balcony and facing to the far right to see the ocean. The toilet was slow to flush and we thought that was just the way the toilet worked. Wrong. We found out later the first night that the toilet was actually clogged when we arrived when we had to call for maintenance after a flush that nearly caused on overflow. When the maintenance guy showed up he looked especially upset with the job that was ahead of him as if we had done something to make the toilet clog. Ugh. Our room key hardly ever worked and took at least 3-4 tries to read the key. We had to trade it in twice to have it reprogrammed, up and down from the 11th floor with all our stuff. We were sure to keep it away from cell phones and credit cards too. There was a safe that we called to verify we didnâ€™t have to pay to use. As it turns out, in the tower the safe is free, but if you were in the cottage you would have to pay by credit card to use it (?). Gougers. We didnâ€™t allow housekeeping in our room at all, keeping the â€œdo not disturbâ€� sign up for our entire stay. We are glad we did, we have since read several reviews indicating that folks had their bags torn apart while they were not in their rooms and some have reported personal items missing. Housekeeping called our room every day we had our â€œdo not disturb sign upâ€� and left a message with something like â€œIt is already 2:30 and we cannot clean your room because your sign is up. If you need towels call us.â€� This was annoying because we obviously knew our sign was up. We put it there. The final day at 8:45 AM (check out is at noon) housekeeping stuck their card in the door to open it.
