I had just gotten out of the shower and freaked out, they verified that we were checking out today and said they would clean later. Give me a break; it was over three hours until we had to check out! The final night we were there we received a call at 12:15 AM (4:15 AM Colorado Time) from security waking us up to tell us to come down and move our Jeep as it was â€œblocking traffic.â€� We were not parked in a no parking zone, but were parked on the curb in their parking lot, just the same as several other vehicles parked there. There was plenty of room for cars to get by or we would have known better than to park there. My husband had to get dressed, go down with the keys, and was instructed by the front desk to go out and find another spot to park in. After getting the manager that had no idea what was going on, he told them that security told us to come down and move our car instead of at least offering to move it for us. That manager then offered to valet our vehicle free of charge and wave the nightly parking fee for our entire stay, (thank you for that one nice manager). The next morning I spoke with the Manager on Duty (MOD) and went over our entire experience with him. He was surprised that we had experienced such bad service by explaining that they get such great reviews but offered nothing to make up for it. Not even an hour later the same MOD approached my husband and I and asked us if we were â€œthat couple that had to go to the hospital last night.â€� We were dumbfounded and replied â€œno,â€� he said â€œhuhâ€� and walked away. Hello?! We just talked to him about how terrible our experience was and apparently he cared so deeply that he already forgot? This interaction pretty much sums up the entire experience. At this point all we could do was laugh about what might happen next. Our final interaction was with the staff when checking out. The guy who assisted me with check out says â€œWhere are you going home to?â€� I say â€œDenver,â€� he says â€œMaybe thatâ€™s why youâ€™re not happy.â€� Thatâ€™s a pretty lame thing to say to someone who just paid a portion of your salary and is here on their HONEYMOON. That is how they ended our wonderful stay at the Royal Lahaina. The service is terrible and they do not care about you as a person. Spend the extra money and stay at the Sheraton. We spent a lot of our time there eating and enjoying their hospitality and intend to stay there if we return to Maui in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and great value!”
Reviews.Author: LDurben
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several days for our 10th wedding anniversary. Our room was fantastic - very spacious, up-to-date and clean. The grounds were very nice - two pools and the most fantastic beach. We had lunch at the restaurant once (good) and the bar was small but friendly. In fact, everyone at the resort was extremely friendly and helpful. We could walk about 5 minutes down the beach and snorkel at a coral reef. We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, the second time around”
Reviews.Author: mychinita
Reviews.Content: We are back for our second stay at this charming low key, laid-back Hawaiian style hotel. We have had excellent service from the moment we arrived. The tower rooms are the best - comfy beds, flat screen TV, great ocean view, beautiful beach right in front (though not great for snorkeling). The best snorkel sites are Black Rock and Honoloa Bay and this hotel is just a few minutes from both places. We enjoy going to CJ's Deli around the corner - they have GREAT Mango Ribs. For the best Pineapple Upside down cake, try the coffee shop in the Napili Plaza shopping center...yum. So the location cannot be beat. And the relaxed, laid back island style is perfect for us. There are bigger, glitzier resorts with lots of restaurants and waterfalls but those places tend to be too crowded and frenzied for us. Here - we have the beach, the small pools..almost all to ourselves, simply heaven! We plan to come back here for a 3rd time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Minn_Traveler_45
Reviews.Content: I booked our entire families at the Royal Lahaina for our wedding, wanting a reasonably priced hotel. I honestly was nervous. I knew this was not a Marriott or Westin, it was an older resort and the price reflected it. We walked in after a late flight and I was SO relieved! The lobby was updated, yet charming, reflecting the era it was built. The rooms had all recently been updated and ours were fantastic, comfortable with an amazing view. The staff pleasantly accommodated every request we had and answered every question with a smile. The restaurant was good for lunches and breakfasts - we ate out at night - but returned to the bar after dinner each night. We attended the resort's luau for our wedding dinner and it was really fun- a little cheesy, but come on, it was a luau. My father and his wife had been to other luaus on the island and this was by far their favorite. The hostess/MC really involved the crowd and the dancers were fun to watch. The food was fine, but really we were there for the atmosphere. I can't say how impressed we were with the Royal Lahaina and would return there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Tower Rooms are Great”
Reviews.Author: sgm24
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this hotel, separated at little from the other hotels on Kaanapali beach, which means you can't walk to as much, but at lot time you have a beautiful beach almost to yourself. Read a lot of reviews about skiping the hotel food, but we had some drinks at the bar and they were stout. The tower rooms are upgraded and fantastic, hard to find a better deal based on the room. The only problem with the hotel is they always seemed to be a little short staffed. Especially on at the front desk and valet. Anyway hard to complain about such a nice hotel that we got such a great deal at.

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome Adventure”
Reviews.Author: cbanker17
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Nice and quiet. Beach was awesome. View from the balcony was spectacular. Stayed in the partial ocean view room. Everything brand new and nice. Staff was very nice and helpful. Were in town for the Maui Marathon and Half Marathon. 10 minute walk to Whaler's Village (or free shuttle). Easy walk or shuttle ride to other resorts and other parts of beach. No complaints whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: beautt101
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked through united and it was wonderful. The room was spacious and they upgraded us to a partial ocean view for free. It was really perfect.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RATE, SPECTACULAR VIEWS”
Reviews.Author: jesschan81
Reviews.Content: We got married in Maui this past April and my fiance and I, as well as the majority of our extended family all stayed at the Royal Lahaina Hotel. For the price, it was such a good deal compared to many of the other older hotels near that location. The renovated rooms are very nice, clean and modern. Overall, the hotel is dated, but the rooms in the tower are amazing. I will stay there again in the future (not the cottages though because they are older and not yet renovated.) The views were really nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but stay away from the cottages”
Reviews.Author: DaRose46
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate but had specifically requested a Tower room as a friend had warned us the cottages had not been renovated - nevertheless they stuck us in a cottage. The view and beach access were great but the AC unit was so old and so noisy that we had to turn it off and swelter - you couldn't talk over it, let alone sleep, and it was mounted so low you had to kneel on the floor to see the controls. I kicked up a fuss and they moved us to the Tower the next evening; much better! Good value for the price I thought, though it was disappointing that Don the Beachcomber bar seems to be permanently closed.

Reviews.Title: “What More Can I Say?!?!”
Reviews.Author: Maui-Bride-2009
Reviews.Content: WE LOVED THIS RESORT & WILL RETURN!!! We stayed here for our wedding/honeymoon and are STILL talking about the wonderful time that we had. We received a room upgrade/w champagne and the view was FABULOUS...... the Pacific Ocean, to the right and the islands of Lana'i and Moloka'i dead ahead. Our check-in started out a little shaky but it got better as we went along. The BEST person on staff is Ike, he really goes above and beyond. On my wedding day, he knew that I was nervous and took it upon himself to escourt me to my limo; made sure that the elevator did not get too crowded on the way down and got me into the car before the Chauffer could even get out of his seat :) The Luau was a lot of fun, don't waste your money on VIP seats and the Kaula Pork was tasty!! I actually cried on the afternoon that we left. The departure at the airport was a DISASTER!! Only Maui residents would understand why they have a separate line for each city on the mainland.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the cottages”
Reviews.Author: Bethgauthier
Reviews.Content: We were here for 7 nights in cottage "G". The beds are hard as rocks! Gouges in the bathroom sinks. Ant's in the room! Musty smell that could only be gone with the air conditioner turned and left on at 66 degree's! Was told these were going to be condemmed and I could see why. I will never stay here again and I come to Maui every other year, there are so many other choice's.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location! Nice Room with fantastic Lanai!”
Reviews.Author: ek_sweden
Reviews.Content: 30/8 - 4/9 2009. We had a tower ocean front room on the 10th floor. The room was great, big lanai with a fantastic view of the ocean, the beach and the islands MolokaÊ»i and LÄ�naÊ»i. Room: When we first arrived, we were given a corner Ocean Front room on the fourth floor. When we got to the room, it was very nice, but located right above the Ocean Front Bar, and felt more like the 2nd floor than the 4th. We felt a bit disappointed and went down to the lobby to ask if any other rooms were available. The guy in the lobby was very nice and instead offered us an Ocean front room on the 10th floor. And when we walked in our new room, it was perfect. The view was wonderful and the room was quiet. The room was very nice, with a comfortable bed and a great balcony. The bathroom only had a sliding door and the sink is outside of the bathroom, which we felt was a bit weird. Since this was our honeymoon, we were given a bottle of champagne and flowers on the bed. Nice touch, even though we are not too fond of alcohol and did not drink it. (We hope the cleaning staff enjoyed it though!) Location: We did not have a car during our stay, we used an airport shuttle as well as tours to get around the island. Would have wanted a car if we had stayed longer though. The Royal Lahaina is about 5 minutes walk from Kaanapali Beach and Black Rock where most of the big Resorts in Lahaina are situated. This is NOT a downside. The beach right outside the hotel is beautiful, quiet and there is a lot of space. You can easily find your own little sunbathing spot. If you want to be close to restaurants during your "day on the beach" just take the beach walk or the free hotel shuttle bus and stay on Kaanapali Beach. Lahaina is a cute town (quite exploited though) close by. Take the shuttle bus (or walk 15min) to Whalers Village and then take the Maui bus (cost 1$) to Lahaina. Piece of cake. Try taking a 8 minute walk to CJ's Deli and Diner for breakfast/lunch or a "Hana/Haleakala picnic basket". Yummie! Black Rock is the BEST SNORKELING spot ever! We saw our first sea-turtle after 3 minutes in the water and then went on to spot pretty much the entire cast of "Finding Nemo", including three Spotted Eagle Rays, swimming in formation. Awesome! We rented really good snorkeling gear from the hotel (unlike what some other hotels offer, from what we heard), and walking to Black Rock and back is easy as pie. Luau: One night we went to the Royal Lahaina Luau, that was right next to the hotel. The food was so-so and the show was ok. However, the grand finale fire show made it all worth it. Spectacular! To wrap it up, the Royal Lahaina is great value for money. Everything 'extra' is pricey of course, such as internet, parking, breakfast, room service etc. But that seems to be true for most anything on Hawaii. The (tower) rooms are really nice, the view is great, but the location and the beach is the best of all. Probably the best in the Lahaina resort area. We LOVED Maui and our Balcony. We wish we could have stayed longer! Tip! Go up to Haleakala for the sunrise! WOW! Expedia has an office in the hotel and gives the best price for the tour. Ekani Tours - best ever. If you are lucky you'll get Joe as your driver! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort - good value”
Reviews.Author: freqtraveleratl
Reviews.Content: Royal Lahaina is a very good resort for the money. Rooms in the oceanfront tower are spacious, comfortable, and attractively decorated. The staff are friendly. Parking was a bit crowded, especially during the nightly luau, but we always managed to find a spot. Parking is $10 a day. The beach in front of the hotel is pleasant and the water is calm enough for swimming. Sunset views are beautiful. The resort has two smallish pools. They could use more lounge chairs. Ka'anapali is a bit far from many of the popular destinations on Maui. Lahaina is nearby but be prepared to drive an extra 20 minutes if you are heading to Hana, the Haleakala crater, or the marina for snorkeling/diving trips. The resort has a tower and several scattered 4-unit buildings. Be sure to stay in the tower. The "cottages" looked pretty run down and it does not appear that they will be renovated. Real estate signs on the property indicated that new ownership properties were going to be constructed on the land where the cottages sit. Overall, a good resort and worth the money if you can find special rates.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but definitely not luxury, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: PickyButSensible
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 days on my honeymoon. Most of the comments, negative and positive, I read prior to going were true. The hotel lobby just seemed like a traditional Hawaiian style lobby, may need some paint here or there, but really wasn't bad at all. The pineapple water they provide everyday in the lobby was great, especially after coming from a long walk, it was quite refreshing. 1 elevator wasn't running, but we never waited long. We were offered an upgrade from a partial ocean view room to an ocean view, I looked at the ocean view room before deciding and declined the upgrade. The ocean view room was on the exact same side of the building as the partial ocean view, just a higher floor but still a side view of the ocean, so why pay for that. The partial was perfectly fine for us. So, if you are offered the upgrade for a low price, my suggestion is to ask to see it before you pay. If I'm paying for an ocean view room I don't want to have to walk out on the patio to see the ocean, it should be apparent from the room. Now to the room. King size bed slept great, the room was clean when we arrived and there was a flat screen TV and a small fridge. The bathroom is small because it only includes the shower and toilet, the sink is on the outside of the bathroom, but separated from the room by wooden shutters, it was different, but not bad. My biggest problem at this hotel was housekeeping. They sucked!!!! When we arrived at the hotel, the bathroom had 3 bath towels and 1 washcloth, I thought that was strange. The another day they did the same thing, how do you have more bath towels and not an equal amount of wash cloths? Housekeeping took or threw away my travel can of Lysol air freshener, it was on the floor, but it was a full can, so if picked up you knew it wasn't trash. I complained about it and no one ever got back to me. Now, the reason this bothered me sooooooooo bad was, 1 day I took all the plastic cups (about 5) from having pineapple water and threw them on the floor with the dirty towels. When housekeeping cleaned the room, I swear, those same used plastic cups with leftover pineapple water drops, were stacked up on the dresser sitting in the tray with the glasses. NOw, how in the world, can you throw away a can of air freshener, and yet pick up some dirty cups stacked with dirty towels and place them to be used on a tray. Like I said, Housekeeping SUCKED!!! Oh, and the bed is never made as neat as the day you checked in, its like they don't care, they just straighten it up and that's it. Because the bed looked like a kid made it 1 day, I knew they didnt change the sheets, so we had to call and request fresh ones. The only meal we ate at the hotel was the breakfast buffet. For us, not worth the money, it was average and not very satisfying. We had a cheaper more fulfilling breakfast at the Gazebo in Napili, a must try, they have the best pineapple pancakes. When we ate breakfast at the hotel, my husband just picked up bagels for us from the store. The best part of the hotel is the location, the beach is great, not too crowded because it is north of black rock. On the south side of black rock is the westin and sheraton, so more crowded. We enjoyed being able to walk the beach without having tons of beach chairs in the way. You can walk about 15 mins from the hotel to Whaler's Village to go shop or get a quick bite to eat. There's also an Italian restaurant on the property it was good. Also, about a 5 min drive is the town of Lahaina where there's restaurants and shopping, you can park and walk for blocks. So, like I said the location of the hotel was great. We will not return here, because we like more options and better service, but if you are the type of people, who are only in a room to sleep, then it isn't a bad place to stay. We loved Maui and had a great time overall, just some things about the hotel we could have done without.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pflagdad
Reviews.Content: We loved the room - large, well-appointed - with a lovely ocean view in the tower. Breakfast buffet was excellent, again outside with an ocean view. Steps to the public beach, beach walk (3 miles, perfect for a morning run).

Reviews.Title: “So wonderful, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: jojoanddash
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina was so beautiful & amazing. The staff was so nice & helpful...we did not meet one employee that wasn't, they all truely had the aloha spirit! We upgraded to the oceanfront room and so glad that we did. We watched whales from our balcony!! The room was so clean and the wood work was awesome. If I had to come up with something bad about this place it would be that the elevator is slow sometimes & it is hard to find a parking spot sometimes. We fixed the parking thing by paying a couple dollars more for vallet parking which was very nice & the elevator wasn't that big a deal, we was never in a hurry there. They had some pineapple water in the lobby which was very tasty. The views are amazing & the service is top notch. We are going back again in April of 2010 & meeting my Mom & aunt ---- can't wait to get back to my home in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Perfect Location, But You Might Have to Settle a Little”
Reviews.Author: danandchenae
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed here for our honeymoon, and overall it was a great value resort. The location to the beach was absolutely PERFECT!! It was steps from the sand, and there was more than enough to do in the water. Plus, it is on the north side of Black Rock which is the less populated side, and the water is much better and clearer for snorkeling and swimming. The staff was friendly, and willing to help. We upgraded from a partial ocean view to Ocean Front, and it was well worth it!!! Plus we were only charged a very small fee extra, after a bit of bartering with the front desk. The $10.00 per day to self park is absurd, but hey, its paradise right? My complaints.....The restaurants are not the best, but the breakfast buffet was very good, the rest of the food I could do without. It is very close to other resorts though, and they have every food imaginable. There were small amounts of mold in the shower, but both our rooms had it, and by the end of the 9 days, me and my wife were feeling some effects of the mold (cold like symptoms that cleared up right away upon returning home), but the staff did not seemed to concern. Overall I would recommend this hotel, but be prepared for less of a "Vegas Resort" and more of a "Hawaiian Hotel and Resort." If you want real Hawaii, stay here, but avoid the cottages at all cost!! They were nasty!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the cottages”
Reviews.Author: COhonymooner09
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at Royal Lahaina in the cottages for our honeymoon. Upon arriving (late and exhausted) we fell into bed. The next morning upon closer inspection noticed all the things wrong with the cottage - rust, tiles falling off, air conditioner that is loud, and the worst thing: MOLD on the walls. We immediately notified front desk who moved us to a room in the hotel. The hotel is nice, but not what we were looking for. We wanted ocean, sand right at our fingertips - exactly what the cottages offered. Moving to the hotel, we had to go through the lobby, elevator, restaurant and pool before arriving at the beach. Dissapointing. When checking out we were told by the front desk "oh yeah, we were going to tear the cottages down a year ago" Well, you should have, and not allowed guests to stay in the hotel. I would recommend Royal Lahaina for the hotel portion if that's what you're looking for. The rooms are nice, beds are comfortable, and everything is very modern.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort.”
Reviews.Author: TexasCat0718
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Royal Lahaina and we have yet to encounter a problem. The staff is always friendly and eager to please. The awesome beach in front of the hotel is a big bonus.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: A1maui
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I arrived to the Royal Lahaina we were greeted and our bags taken from the car. Our room was just what we asked for...Oceanview. The room was beautiful, very well cleaned. We had a king size bed, The room contained plenty of storage space, a safe, fridge, iron & board and a large flat screen TV. We stayed for 7 days and we will continue to make The Royal Lahania are place to stay again when we vist Maui. The resort is right on the Kaanapali Beach. The beach is so beautiful. The resort did have a restaraunt on site but closed early. My husband and I found out that 2 min away is Whalers village. Which has many good alternative restaurants which were cheaper and stayed open later. Whalers Village also has many shops that are great. The Royal Lahaina staff were always really friendly, helpful and always said aloha to us! We really enjoyed our stay at the resort and would recommend it to anyone and we would definitely go back there in a hearbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for a Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyBowers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Royal Lahaina for seven nights as part of our honeymoon in August 2009. We had originally booked a partial ocean view but decided to upgrade to a full ocean view when we checked in for a small fee, we were not disappointed! The view from our 11th floor tower room was stunning with lovely views of the Pacific, the island of Molokai and Kaanapali Beach. The room was large with a king sized bed. The bathroom had views of the ocean through the bedroom and it was spotless with a lovely walk-in shower. The room contained plenty of storage space, a safe, fridge, iron & board and a large flat screen TV. We had breakfast included in our package which was great value as it would have worked out $46 dollars for the both of us per day. It was a buffet style with plenty of cooked items, cereals, fruits, Danish pastryâ€™s, omelettes which are cooked to your liking and a good selection of drinks - I recommend the 'pog' juice! The table service was first-rate. We had our evening meal a few time in the hotel which was above average, however the menu was not very extensive and they finished serving at 9pm. Whalers village had many good alternative restaurants which were cheaper and stayed open later. However, we found Maui was more about your days than nights. The hotel is located directly on Kaanapali beach which is beautiful and not overcrowded (the beach on the other side of the black rock can get quite packed). Whalerâ€™s Village is within easy walking distance (from here you can catch a bus to Lahaina town or Napili). There is also a regular bus trolley service which takes you to the village, other hotels and the golf course. Despite what others have said on previous reports, the Royal Lahaina staff were always really friendly, helpful and always said aloha to us! We really enjoyed our stay at the resort and would recommend it to anyone and we would definitely go back there ourselves, we really miss sitting on our balcony or the beach watching the sun set!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, very bad service and rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: Belinda93
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina for 4 nights. This was our first time in Maui. Kaanapali beach is absolutely breathtaking, we loved it completely! The beach and hotel area is very windy but you get used to it and the scenery definitely makes up for everything! The hotel is old, it needs a renovation I reckon. The front desk staff is not really organised, we arrived at 12pm, they said our room was going to be ready in an hour, after one and a half hours our room was still not ready and they did not even bother, sent us away for another half an hour. But we got a very nice room right on the top floor, level 12, ocean view. The room is not that big but for two of us it was fine. The chambermaid came into our room without knocking to bring in the clean robes and she didn't even apologised...that was very weird. The bellboy Ike was extremely weird as he took our bags up to our room and showed us where the switches are for each light and what the coffee maker was....come on!!! And then as we had no cash on us...he was staring at our hands for tips....so we had to tell him we will take care of his tip later once we get money withdrawn. By the way, all the staff is just "hanging" for tips, and they expecting it as it was a must, however the local staff are so rude especially at breakfast. They don't listen to you when they ask you if you want more coffee in your cup, I said no thanks, they still poured me some, or talking to us rudely. And they still bring out the bill for sign and "tips" after each breakfast however we had it included in our package....it was really annoying! I was not used to this at all! I mean, if there is a really good service, nice staff, great food etc, I don't mind giving them tips, but just because they are so underpayed and plus rude, don't expect 15-20% of tips every single time they serve us anything!!! And they never said hello or good bye or good night after breakfasts or dinners! How rude! The staff from the US they are nice, but the locals are really bad, made me feel very uncomfortable at this hotel. But as I mentioned the location of the hotel, the beautiful beach, the sunsets every night...that we were watching from our balcony or from the beach make up for any little inconvenience! The hotel has got two pools, one pool has a new bar called Tiki bar, it was great. The ocean is beautiful, warm water you can even snorkel around the Black rock. We were bitten by sealice when we went snorkelling to Monokini island, and I think I got bitten while swimming at Kaanapali beach as well. We went to the Royal Lahaina's Luau night just right next door the hotel, which was great! It was raining so hard but they gave us little ponchos so we didn't care, the dancers were absolutely great and the food was amazing, featuring the pork roast! Not sure if we would stay at the Royal Lahaina again, I think staying closer to the Wailer's village would be better in terms of more vibe and maybe a bigger hotel with much better service and nice staff!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nicer Beach”
Reviews.Author: BRIAN-IN-SD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last August (booked through Pleasant Holidays). No real complaints. The room was nice, not too expensive and the beach was awesome (not crowded, clean and sandy). I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very good...............but lacked that little something!”
Reviews.Author: RFKNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights at the end of our honeymoon in Canada / Hawaii. We had such a fantastic experience in Canada and were so looking forward to Hawaii. We werent disppointed.....but.....there was just something missing from what could be a fabulous hotel. Our room was fine on the 11th floor with an ocean view. Perhaps a little cramped (bathroom in particular) but nothing to complain about. Location was excellent right on Kaanapali beach. Quiet part of the beach. Pools were also clean and spacious. Staff were generally ok but one or two could do with learning a few manners and could benefit from putting guests first! Food was generally very good but the thing that got us was the fact that the place shut down so early! It was almost impossible to get a drink after 10pm and the staff were quick to shut the bar even if there were guests who obviously wanted a drink! There is a decent shop and small cafe (where we had breakfast most mornings) as well as a few other services at the resort. We attended the Luau which was very good. Overall a most enjoyable experience. We would definitely go back but would expect a higher standard of service from certain staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but don't expect a luxurious experience”
Reviews.Author: ktothet
Reviews.Content: Loved the room (8th floor, ocean view) even though it was relatively small. We were at the Fairmont Kea Lani for a week before staying at the Royal Lahaina for nine nights, so it was a bit of a shock to go from amazing to just average. It costs $10/day to park, which seemed a bit ridiculous. The breakfast buffet was decent as far as those things go, and the cheapest one we saw on Maui. Fantastic location close to Front Street, and very beautiful beach though you have to lie in the sand without chairs. Avoid the luau at all costs! It's absolutely horrid even taking the guest discount into account.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: svassmer
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Maui for Spring Break at the last minute. We looked over several properties and chose the Royal Lahaina because it seemed to have decent rates and the reviews were favorable. We got in the first evening and were offered a very cheap upgrade to an ocean view room. We accepted, and I'm glad we did--the view was beautiful and it was nice to sleep to the sound of the ocean each night. I never slept better! The updated tower rooms were nice--not huge but a good size for two people. The rest of the decor--lobby/hallways/elevator area was a bit worn, but it wasn't detrimental to our stay. The pool area was no frills, but who wants to hang out at a pool, anyway? The beach was not crowded and I'm glad we stayed north of Black Rock because of this. The hotel restaurant was typically overpriced but breakfast was adequate and the coffee was good. Orange-guava? juice was yummy, too. Overall it was a good stay, and I wouldn't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid”
Reviews.Author: SPYLon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a definitely not 4* hotel, more like a 2*. There is no point flying all the way to Hawaii to stay in such an unpleasant hotel. The hotel was so run down I spent as little time as possible there. My recommendation is to avoid it completely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Best Beach, Super Personel”
Reviews.Author: lindatc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 nights - Had oceanfront room on 8th floor - super view - loved the room, very very clean - Food pretty good - breakfast buffet a littlle pricey - walked next door to hotel, ate for half price - beach was great although no chairs allowed - can walk to black rock to snorkel - all staff went out of their way to accommodate- craft lessons in lobby- Would most definitely go back there -hotel out of the major grouping of other hotels - made it nice at the beach - all 3 pools were clean also - there is also a free trolley to the whaler's village - loved the lalani restaurant -

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: L8BarLVR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel with our three children. There is quite an age spread between all of them. Along with our family, we vacationed with my husband's sister and her family, and they have two kids as well. The oldest kid in the group is 12, youngest is 15 months (both being mine!). We knew when we booked the hotel that it was a decent value, and that we weren't going to be getting the amazing pools, but for the price we felt we were doing the right thing for our trip. We arrived very late (it was after midnight I believe), since we had taken a 6pm flight out of Los Angeles. The front desk was extremely courteous, even at that late hour. They got a service person (not a bellman - I think they had all gone home for the night!) to help us with our luggage, which I sincerely appreciated, and I tipped him well. Our room was in the tower, and it was gorgeous. It wasn't a huge room, and the next time we decide to go (and there will definitely be a next time!) we'll have to get two rooms since our two older kids are getting to the age where they definitely need their own space. That said, it was still fantastic. I loved having the balcony so that when the kids finally went to sleep at night, my husband and I could sit out there and enjoy the peace. I thoroughly appreciated having the refrigerator in the room as well, although for some reason it didn't seem to get very cold - even so, it really helped with keeping food on hand for the baby. After such a long flight, and long days every day, I can honestly say it was a joy to climb into bed - the sheets were soft, and the mattress was heavenly. We ate at the restaurant for breakfast one time and had the buffet. We thought it was fine, pricey for what they had, but honestly - that's the way it is when you are at a hotel, and that's why we didn't eat there more often. The service was fine though, and we would have eaten there again if our daily schedule had permitted it - we were just very busy and on the go every day! We also did the luau at this hotel. We had a great time! No, the food wasn't gourmet, but perhaps it's all about the expectations, because we knew we were going to a luau, not a fancy restaurant. We also knew we were going to get shell leis, and you know - we didn't really care. The only small issue I had was that we had to wait in a ridiculously long line, and mainly it was due to their photographers taking pictures, but even that, I can't complain too much because we bought the photo in the end. The kids also knew this, and we all expected the food to be FAR worse than it was...which it wasn't bad at all! I loved the kalua pig, and to be honest, I'm glad we didn't spend more to attend a different luau. It was perfect for what we wanted, and we all had a great time being there. Parking is kind of a pain in that no, you're probably not going to get a place near the door of the hotel unless you valet - but whatever. We're on vacation, and if we have to walk a bit, we have to walk. We always found a spot without a problem, and yes, the spots are tight. The pools were fine while we were there - my kids played in the pool two of the days, and I enjoyed that the area by the pool was grassy. It provided a nice place to escape from the sand of the beach (when you have a baby, sand is not a friend - so we split our time up and that was really nice). We really wanted to try out the activities that the hotel had to offer. (lei making, hula...etc....but we were never at the hotel long enough to try anything. Next time!) I absolutely ADORED the iced pineapple water that the hotel always had available inside the lobby. I filled up a cup every time I went in, and I also filled our water bottles with it when I had them available. Now that we're back home, I crave it so much that I'm going to go and buy my own glass jug to keep in the refrigerator with pineapple water in it - my kids loved it so much they drank more water than I've ever seen them drink that week. It was just a really nice touch. As for the elevators - I don't know what people are complaining about. No, there isn't a bank of 10 elevators available. Big deal. We were there for a week, and we never, EVER waited longer than 2 or 3 minutes for the elevator - and there were only 3 working while we were there as well. I think people are being a little bit ridiculous about this complaint, to be honest. Our room faced the garden, but we also had a partial oceanview. In looking at my paperwork when we flew home, I noticed I had reserved a full oceanview room - honestly it's the only real complaint I have about the hotel, and obviously it didn't bother me that much otherwise I would have noticed it sooner and said something. The next time we go, I'm going to request an oceanfront room - my sister-in-law's family had one, and it was fabulous. We loved our trip, and we loved how quaint and Hawaiian this hotel was. It was beautiful, and well-worth every penny. I'd go back in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Cottages are tired and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TheatreGuru
Reviews.Content: We chose one of the garden cottages because they were described as very nice and private. Private they were, but nice they were not. They are probably 30 years old or more, with few if any upgrades beyond a coat of paint. Beds were uncomfortable, linens had holes in them, A/C was a window unit that did not do the job well, plumbing was very old and worn, door lock was standard in-knob keyset right out of the 70's or earlier. No deadbolt, no electronic lock. In room safe, but they change $3.75 per day for its use. Outrageous for a room costing over $200 per night! Wireless internet is a joke -- it is pay as you go, but the signal is too low and unreliable to be useful (I am a computer pro and know what I'm doing). The setting is extremely nice, as you would expect in Lahaina area, and maybe the newer tower is OK, but the cottages are just not worth $200 per night. Oh, and there is no complimentary breakfast either. The breakfast buffet was substandard. Average menu, most food lukewarm or worse, cost $20 per person. For other meals, menu service is expensive for the quality and the wait service is VERY slow. If you have a car and don't want to use the valet parking then you are charged $10 per day, but you share the lot with their evening Luau which means you probably can't park between 6PM and 9:30PM if you aren't already parked. Valet costs more, of course, but then it is their problem to find a spot - the best spots reserved for the valets, naturally. Overall, the resort is very overpriced for the quality. I cannot recommend this resort to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Unroyal Lahaina - needs updating”
Reviews.Author: AZpsych
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read the reviews to know that the hotel is old and needs some renovations. Also, do not let them put you in a cottage - ask to stay in the tower! While the privacy is nice, the rooms in the cottages are old. Our shower still looked dirty, even after it was cleaned, the fixtures were old, and the moldings appeared to have been painted over several times. One day we even needed housekeeping to come spray because ants had invaded our room through a crack in the floor. While the hotel is nice, it has absolutely no nightlife, which could be good or bad. Both pools on property were small and not very creative, unlike the pools at the other hotels (waterslides, lazy rivers, waterfalls, etc.) With all this being said, the hotel is right on the beach and right next to Black Rock, which is where all the best snorkeling is. However, on the Sheraton side of Black Rock, we swam with two big sea turtles. If you do not want to spend a fortune and can handle the accommodations I've described, this is an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Our dream wedding”
Reviews.Author: Hannah_Allen
Reviews.Content: My partner and I chose to travel from the UK to Maui to get married. The wedding co-ordinator suggested holding the ceremony at this hotel. Ourselves and 17 other guest stayed at the resort for a week and in various types of rooms. All of us were delighted with the resort. The rooms in the tower block are outstanding. The views are stunning and our ocean front room had the added bonus of the constant sound of lapping waves!! Some of our party stayed in the cottages and really enjoyed them. They are clean, cosy and very authentic. It is a shame that they plan to tear them down and replace them with private condos in the future (however that depends on very slow moving sales) The lobby of the hotel is a little dated but we all agreed that this added charm. The pools are small but nice and the beach access is excellent. The staff were excellent. We needed help with a few matters and guest relations couldn't have been better. They booked taxis, provided DVD players, and generally just made sure that we were ok. The ceremony took place on the hotel lawn and was lovely. My husband and I plan to return to the Royal Lahaina in the near future

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the anniversary we expected”
Reviews.Author: AussieGal56
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to go to Maui. So we went there for our 35th Wedding Anniversary. We arrived at the Royal Lahaina Resort at 10.30am and were guaranteed our room at 3pm. We were still waiting at 3.45pm for our room. " Housekeeping were busy". The staff at reception were quite rude.This is not good enough when it is very warm and you have been awake since 4.30am. We were offered a drink to pass the time away whilst we waited for our room. We finally got our room which was an ocean view room. It was average and in need of an upgrade. Do not belive the photo's! Then on our anniversay night we would have liked to have stayed in the hotel restaurant and sit back and relax but the food was just average. I mean average,more like a caf'e. I would recommend that they look at upgrading there rooms. restaraunt and service. We didn't find the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Updated”
Reviews.Author: Braddock54
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Lahaina for eight nights, and had a great stay. If you read other reviews, you will find the typical "oh my god the lobby is so tacky...or the elavators sucked, etc", which are true, but don't take away from this place, unless you like to spend copious amounts of time in the hotels lobby or elavator. When I was here, they had two new elavators installed, and only one less than stellar one. There are only three which makes for a long wait but no big deal. Everyone is very friendly here to the guests. Once you get to your floor, the updating really shows. It is nicely decorated and very new. The rooms are decorated with a polynesian feel, and are very comfortable. The bedding is nice, and is always clean, as was the bed. The shower was a tiled in type deal and was quite decent. I would definately go back....once they finish the lobby and elavators, this place will be perfect. The restaurant is not great, and is very expensive....just go to Lahaina! Also, the beach is great....far better than the other side of Black Rock, where the Sheraton is located....absolute gong show over that way. Our beach was always quiet and subdued....awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: MHutton1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying here. Great value for the price we paid. Partial ocean view room meant that we could see the ocean from the balcony. Cozy atmosphere but still large enough to have 2 pools and plenty of beachfront area. Nice, newly remodeled hotel rooms but not much storage space for your luggage (no dresser drawers). Also liked the location of this hotel--close to drive in to Lahaina. Convenience store on-site for buying small groceries to keep in the room. Expensive but helpful.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel with magnificent views”
Reviews.Author: wholelottaworld
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at this hotel, having stayed in the towers, the Ocean Inn andthis time in a garden sver cottage. All Maui hotels are very expensive but we did get this cottage at a good rate for our 6 night stay there. The cottages are lovely and airy and very quiet, ours had a view of the golf course. Our first cottage was small withan extremely noisy air con. On reporting this to the front desk we were immediately offered a different room which was much larger, unfortunately, the air con was still noisy but as it was further away from the bed, did not cause too much inconvenience. This hotel is a beautiful hotel, friendly staff and has the most magnificent views of Molokai and Lanai sea facing and the beaufiul mountain range to the back of the hotel. We love it here and would recommend to any one traveling to Maui to stay here. A fre trolley services operates into whalers village which is only a 15 minute walk from hotel and from Whalers you can catch the bus to Lahaina for a more varied night life. (visit Moose McGullygoodies for the best onion rings in the world and the cheapest Mai Tai in Maui)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting, great service”
Reviews.Author: uxsah
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the cottage rooms, which provided a quiet, private setting and a peaceful lanai which was a great place to relax in the breeze and enjoy a bottle of wine. The room itself was furnished with a plantation style motif, and could have used a little updating, but everything was comfortable and clean and the housekeeping services were great. Plenty of fresh, fluffy towels and soap, shampoo, lotion, etc. were all generously replinished daily. The hotel is located on the beach, with great snorkeling just a short walk down the sand. The property is vast, and we never did find the spa which was reportedly near some tennis courts. There are two pools, which are just your basic, rectangular design - nothing special. Parking is a bit of a nuisance if you self-park ($10/night) as it is a large lot and a bit of a walk to your car. They do have golf carts and will shuttle you from the reception area to your car or room if you ask, but we did not find this necessary. You will need a car if you plan to do anything off-property. There is live music and a hula dancer in the restaurant/bar area nightly, which was a lovely way to spend an evening as you have a cocktail or meal and watch the sun set over the ocean. Staff were friendly and welcoming, and the clientele at the hotel were all respectful and polite. We spent four nights here and it was our favorite property out of a three-island trip.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get!”
Reviews.Author: davidjhernandez
Reviews.Content: It was a good hotel and stay. Deb in the restraunt and Debbie at the onsite pleasant holidays were amazing!!! The front desk staff where okay. Stay away from Vicki. She is not nice at all!!! Elevators where a nightmare...almost as bad as the parking. 3 out of 4 working. Spent alot of my time at the elevator door on my floor then at the beach! With the horrid parking, they should have free valet. Parking is 10 per day, and valet is 15!! INSANE! (Parking is worse when there is a Luau. Bellhops where always helpful. Rooms - they are great. Nice beds...great tv. Not alot of premium channell options though. Phone in room didnt work! Beach- was really nice!!! One of the best. Pools - small. Actually someone drowned the day we where there. they closed the pool for a few hours and it was back running. Seemed so common place that it happened-that was odd. Resturant closes at 9/bar closes at 10. Insane - especially for those travelers who want to enjoy the night air with a tropical drink! Attention prospective travelers. You cannot purchase alcohol on the island after 11 pm!! Get your booze early! Also-No hot tub!!! If you want these things, go to the hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent”
Reviews.Author: LynnNPhotos
Reviews.Content: We first arrived on the property and our first trip to Maui. At first sight it was pretty. It is situated on a golf course and the ocean. We reserved the cottages thinking it was right on the beach and we could step out to the water. NOT! They were like little one level squised condo, old and musty smelling., with cracked walls and horrid tub and shower. If they get updated then it would be a different story. I was disappointed and asked for an upgrade to the towers. The front desk people were very pleasent & very helpful. They offered for us to see a few rooms before deciding what floor to stay on and what type of view. The upgrade for a partial Ocean view and 8 nights to a remodeled room was around 470.00 worth every penny. I will attach photos of the cottage and of the new room as well as our view. The lobby, dinning area, room and pool were all very clean and kept nice. For a three star resort, rating that they have, I felt very comfortable and happy with our choice. Had we not been upgraded that would have been a different story. The buffet breakfat was good, offered allot. We also opted for a danish and coffee a few times during our stay, with a coffee shop on the grounds. They also had a few shops on the grounds too. This was in a fantastic location on Ka'anapali beach which I recomend. They offer free shuttles to the Whalers village and the Canery Mall. And to shop in down town Old Lahaina ( a must) you would pick up another shuttle at the whalers village and pay just a $1.00 in "07" that is. Not sure about prices now. My only disappointment with this facility was the Luau. We got a discount ( 65.00 per person) because we stayed on the property but ,so what. Food wasn't good, too packed in with people, on picnic style tables , it was raining and they did not cancel or postpone. Just too pricey for not much. As for the tower rooms, view, location of the resort and budget, I'd go back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Bricari
Reviews.Content: A great location right on the Beach (private) with our balcony having a great ocean view. Good base to get around the Island. Went to Hani but thought that the road and view beyony Kannapali was better. Hotel menu became a bit so-so as it is was the same lunch and dinner. Plenty of other places short walk or courtesy bus away. Entertainment at night was great by the pool. The sun sets in the west right over the beach, can't get better than that.

Reviews.Title: “good room, friendly people, great beach”
Reviews.Author: oiler3535
Reviews.Content: The people here were always very friendly and helpful. The rooms were nice. We were upgraded from a partial ocean view to a full ocean view(went from a lower floor to the eleventh). We were on the side of the hotel, which we preferred to an ocean front room because we could see both the ocean to our right and the mountains to our left. Housekeeping is great; if you have your privacy tag out, they will even call in the afternoon to see if you would still like a cleaning. The restaurant at the hotel was good(especially the Mahi Mahi sandwich), but there are better ones around for similar prices. The pools are nice, but the beachfront is some of the best in Maui so take advantage of it! Black rock is amazing for snorkeling(go in the morning to see turtles and eagle rays). They have cultural activities in the hotel lobby most mornings. Their Luau was also very good(heard from regulars that it is one of the best). Weâ€™ll leave you with just the few nitpicky things that in no way lowered our overall enjoyment: elevators slow(currently being replaced), nowhere to hang wet bathing suits, no free wireless internet(1st time, 1st hour is free), and the fridge is in a cupboard and does not stay cold unless you leave the door open. If you happen to be stuck in the room some of the channels have no signal and the feeds are all east coast so after midafternoon everything is infomercials. These are all minor things and if we ever go back to Maui we WILL stay at the Royal Lahaina again! Trips to Hana (back way and do the 1.5 hour hike up to the waterfall at Oheo Gulch), sunset up Haleakala, and snorkeling Molokini are all great DOs.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the garden cottages!”
Reviews.Author: katryanahk
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in the garden cottages at the Royal Lahaina! We booked on Priceline and paid just $100.00 a night, but I would still highly recommend NOT staying here! Because we booked on Priceline, we assumed we would be in a hotel, not a cottage. The Royal Lahaina did not seem to care about this when we brought it up. â€¢ There were bugs in our room (many ants and silverfish) â€¢ Coffee was not replaced â€¢ Conditioner was not replaced â€¢ Not all of the towels were replaced and the ones that were not hung up â€¢ Shower kept alternating between hot and cold â€¢ Room was small â€¢ Bed was not very comfortable â€¢ Part of the roof on the patio was falling down â€¢ Found toenail clippings on the patio â€¢ Parking was far away â€¢ No hot tub (at least not one that we could find) When we voiced our concerns, the staff did not seem to care. They did not apologize for the bugs or the poor service. Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to the rave.”
Reviews.Author: photogandwife
Reviews.Content: I actually switched our reservation from another hotel because I heard such great reviews about this resort. However, we were quite disappointed overall. We have been to a number of "resorts" and expected the Royal Lahaina to compare (as was portrayed on their website); however they did not- by a long shot. First, friendliness is not overabundant! Frankly, with the exception of 2 individuals- employees seemed miserable to be there. We were really surprised by this! Secondly, for the price it fell short overall. The tower rooms are basic (nice, but basic). The "terrace view" was actually a view of the roof. We were put in the room at the end of the hall by the stairs exit. Needless to say, the door slammed shut all night long. The two pools are quite small and there are not enough lounge chairs for all of the guests. We got out early to avoid the problem on most days, but we definitely witnessed some arguments over chairs, "We left our towels there....". Although advertised, there is NOT free internet available. This was a frustration for us as we left our infant home with my parents and planned to talk to him with the webcam each day. On a good note, the luau was a great experience. Book the luau online and you get a discount. We won't return to this "resort" on future trips. Book wisely.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: AFields620
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Royal Lahaina from June 21 -26. We loved every minute and would love to plan a trip back someday. Upon arrival we were upgraded to an Oceanview suite and had a bottle of champagne in the fridge. The room was large, and the bed was comfy. The staff was helpful and always smiling. Our room was cleaned everyday and was always spotless. The beach was beautiful and we were at least 40 feet away from the people next to us. I cannot say enough wonderful things about this hotel. It's perfect for everyone (families, honeymooners, etc.) and you will not be disappointed if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Money Spent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NurseJewels
Reviews.Content: We visited Maui the week of 7-6/2009-7/13. We were actually there to get Married. I was worried at first when reading some of the bad reviews here on trip advisor, but our stay at the Royal Lahaina was amazing. However, make sure you stay in the "tower" these rooms are newly renovated. The cottages from what I hear are outdated and need lots of work. Our room was very clean and the bed was very comfy. Ya the lobby may not be as fancy as a Sheraton or Hilton and the elevators were a tad slow at times....But I didn't go to Maui for my hotel lobby. The staff was very friendly and were always helpful on giving advice ont things to do. The always had fresh pineapple water in the lobby. FYI Go to Safeway and by an ice chest. You can fill your ice chest with whatever you like and take it down to the pool or beach as long as its not glass. The lady who came and did my hair in my room for my big day said it best "This hotel has the real Aloha spirit"

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place”
Reviews.Author: AdrianP33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a few hotels while I was in Lahaina, including The Westin, but The Royal Lahaina was my favorite experience. I stayed in the tower rooms and we had a great view of the ocean! The staff was very welcoming and friendly. There were some shops at the hotels, and the Luau every night on site is very convenient. Their bar and restaurant had a great feel and was right near the beach. Speaking of the beach, they have the best beach! It's perfect to swim in with no rocky bottom, and nice to sit on with a Mai Tai at night. They have 2 pools and a pool bar as well. We will absolutely be returning. The only thing about the place was their elevators ( they only had one available so it took forever), which are supposed to be re-done. Either way we just took the fire stairs mostly, it was good to get the exercise!

Reviews.Title: “Returning next summer...”
Reviews.Author: kansas1977
Reviews.Content: We just completed our honeymoon trip to the Royal Lahaina Resort on Kaanapali Beach. The hotel was nice, they cleaned it everyday, inside and out. It was our honeymoon so they upgraded us to an oceanfront, but we took the partial and was totally fine with the view. We did'nt stay in our room much at all, why would you?? (ROOM) But lets say you get tired from all the activities. Theres a flat screen, probably 32 inches with HD. Keep bottled water in your room, the tap is a little salty. The lighting in the bathroom was to dim for my wife, so I took a bedside table lamp and put it in there. Toilet and shower are in same room. Sink is behind wall in bedroom. There is a safe and fridge. Downstairs is a resturant, lil pricey, foods ok. Two pools, really great beach. Want to snorkel or anything, hotel rents that stuff. Snorkel set $15, down the street its $1.50. We went snorkeling right outside the hotel, so I paid the higher price. Just walk outside to the beach, look left and see the big black rock. Its like the movie Finding Nemo. Sea turtles and thousands of fish, a five to ten minute walk away. The beach is clean, nothing but great sand and waves that crash right into eachother on the shore. Get about ten feet out and its smooth swimming. (CAR) Location is great, but we rented a car. If we did'nt have that, we would be stuck near a bunch of resorts on one of the most gorgouse beaches. The car allowed us to go three miles or so to Front Street in Lahaina. I went with Budget, four days was $160. Gas is 3.48 a gallon, fill it up before you return it. Budget will charge $5 a gallon and for the whole tank, no matter if its half full or not! (FOOD) If you are an early riser like me and want some breakfast, dont go to Starbucks or McDonalds. I drove around for two hours, trying to find eggs and bacon. Where do the locals eat?? I had to settle for a coffee shop breakfast, bagel and coffee... But if you go to Front Street in Lahaina, the street near the ocean. If your coming from the hotel, stay to your right, exit at Canoes resturant, onto Front St. There is shops, then a neighborhood, then all the other shops. Look for the ice cream shop on your right, pull in and a little nook called the Sunrise Cafe is there. For under six dollars you can get the best eggs benedict, potatoes and fruit. I had coffee, her juice, $20. The hotel breakfast buffett is $20 per person alone and I don't stuff myself early with a buffett. Lunch, backup down the street to the Mixed Plate, sit next to the ocean and eat great food for the same price. Dinner is up to you, we tried several places, non that really rocked my world. She liked Cheeseburger in Paradise and no its not a Jimmy Buffet place. (ACTIVITIES) Hit the shops on Front st. buy some Hawaii stuff, museums, the weirdest tree, Banyon tree is on that street. Kids will love that tree, like a piece of playground equipment. We took surfing lessons, hurt my foot and limped around for awhile. Paid $100, it was...starts with an O, Olehu...look it up. Good guys, Hoto was our instructor..."1, 2, 3 Baseball" Old japanese gym teacher, very nice and good instructor. We surfed. Did the hotel Luau. She really had a good time. The open bar means, cheap mixed Mai Tais and Budweiser. But the hula girls and their hips were worth it to me and there are hula guys for her. I think it was 130 total for the good seats. All you can eat and drink, lasts about two hours. if your on the way back to the airport, and are early...kill time at the aquarium in Malaeah bay, spellings off. 23 per person, its worth it if you have never been to one. So to sum it up, it was a blast. We are going to take the kid next year. DONT FLY DELTA, so much bs. Coming from KC or east, United flys to Denver then to Maui. Delta, Minn, Wa, Maui. Lost our bags too.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Tranquil”
Reviews.Author: lightpan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 night stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort. We had such a relaxing stay. The rooms in the tower looked new, and the best part is that they were very quiet. What a great view from the rooms and the restaurant/lounge. Several evenings we sat in the outdoor lounge sipping our MaiTai's and watching the beautiful Hawaiian sunsets. And the Luau at the resort was a highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: burrfish
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the towers section of the property and were very impressed. The rooms were recently renovated and well done. What made to hotel excellent was the staff. They were extremely friendly and helpful and always willing to give local tips. Food in the restaurants was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Can't ask for more from the Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: pattonsyanks
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina Resort is located on what I consider to be the most beautiful beach, Kaanapali, in Maui. More importantly was the service we received at this resort. It was nothing short of first class. The resort offers many activities from early morning yoga to lei making classes throughout the course of the day. The valet service is top notch. Every time we need our car we were never kept waiting. Upon returning to the resort after a day of touring or exploring you were always greeted by a man or women at the gate welcoming you "home." Once you pulled up to the valet or self parked and walked into the lobby you would be greeted with ice cold pineapple water and cool face cloths to refresh yourself. There are other reviews that make mention to the problems with the elevators in the reosrt but I can honestly say we did not have the same experience even with one of the three elevators down for maintanance. Another plus about this resort is the fact that they have a Pleasure Adventures and Expedia kiosk right in the resort. Both are great for securing reservations for such things as tours, to luas, to dinner reservations for restaurants around the Island. The Terrace room restaurant is great for breakfast and dinner. The Price is right and the food is excellent. The view from the Terrace restaurant is breathtaking, especially around sunset when the nightly torch lighting ceremony takes place. We stayed on the 11th floor of the Tower. The room was fantastic. We had two lanais: One off our bedroom and one off the sitting area/living area. Both faced the ocean and the views were just spectacular! The decor was modern with an island feel that kept it true to its roots. The room was so nice it was hard to leave it. With that being said, you are not in Hawaii especially Maui for the room. The reort sits on arguably the best stretch of beach in Maui. It is also adjacent to a golf coursethat stretches all the way to black rock so in a sense it is basically a private beach. Black rock separates this stretch of beach from the other stretch of the beach that is much more crowded due to the number of hotels on that particular stretch. If you are into snorkeling, Black Rock is great and you do not need to head out on a tour. The coral reefs is beautiful with lots of fish and coral life. There were also plenty of sea turtles that would be swimming around this part of the beach. I have nothing negative to say about this resort. Of course if you are into those resorts that have a great pool scene wher there are bridges and hottubs then this is not the reort for you. The resort does have two pools but are just simple pools with a tiki bar where you can get drinks. These pools are more than adequate and in my opinion you are there for the beach anyway. The staff at the Royal Lahaina were great in every way and would go above and beyond in any way they could to make your stay a pleasurable and memorable one. I do not hesitate to recommend this resort to anyone. I can't wait to go back!! One more thing. There are cottages located on the premises that you can stay in. I agree with some of the other reviewers that they are not in the best of shape. However, they are not nearly as bad as some have suggested. We actually became friendly with a couple that was staying in one of the cottages and found the cottages to be quite intimateand nice. The cottages are going to be torn down and villas are being built in there stead. So thisattributes to the fact that more is not being down to perfect those cottages.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Bixbyjeans
Reviews.Content: 1. Amazing location - beatuiful beach and views! 2. Fantastic service - staff was friendly, helpful, patient, knowledgeable - particularly Casey who can often be found in the onsite restaraunt - he was great! 3. Wonderful, comfortable, super clean rooms, super comfortable beds My only regret? Not staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “Lasting memories”
Reviews.Author: tambr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in what they advertised as their "Garden Cottage" in July 2009 and these are some of our lasting memories of this hotel: - Smashing large cockroaches which crawled in from the outside, thru the large gap under the front door. (We were given a ground-level cottage.) - Mold in the air conditioning unit. - Three minute waits in the shower to get warm water, which then suddenly flucturates between scorching hot and freezing cold. - Toilet which needs to be giggled everytime it's used to prevent it from leaking. - Have to decide between a dimly-lit room or opening the shutters which allows everyone on the grounds to look into the room. - Paying for a parking lot (a very long walk from most of the cottages) with no available spaces. (And then being told by the staff to just keep looking for a space.) - Front desk staff which had absolutely no reaction (not to mention apology) when informed of these major maintenance issues. Avoid the ground-level cottages. Better yet, avoid this outdated, poorly maintained hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed overall opinion of the resort, but LOVED our room and the beach!”
Reviews.Author: bendw8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on 6/29-7/4/09 and had mixed feelings about our experience. When we arrived, the lobby was impressive and grand, but then the front desk area was completely outdated with peeling Hawaiian wall paper and worn out carpeting. Our impression of our room was very different, however. We had an ocean-view room in the newly renovated tower. It was BEAUTIFUL! We absolutely loved the calming, pale blue color on the walls with the contrasting dark wood furniture. The room had a contemporary feel with granite countertops, neutral carpeting and ceramic tile and a large flat-screen LCD TV. Everything in our room was luxurious. But then we were catapulted in to the 1970's again when we went to the Terrace restaurant. The cushions on the dining furniture were falling apart and there was bird poop on many of the chairs. The decor was very outdated. The food was delicious, though, and very inexpensive for the island. We ventured on the pools. The first pool was definitely newer and really nice with cobalt blue tile. The second pool was in serious need of repair, however. There were many missing tiles and it needed a good cleaning. There is a serious shortage of lounge chairs around the pools. We noticed that hotel guests would claim their chairs early in the morning by putting a towel on them. It was quite amusing and annoying at the same time. Why wouldn't a beach resort have more lounge chairs?? The tiki bar near the second pool also appeared to need some major work. The beach was great! We love swimming in the ocean, so we opted for not staking out a lounge chair and just went straight to the beach. The current and undertoe were strong, but the waves were great and it was absolutely beautiful. I prefer the Kaanapali beaches over the Wailea beaches. We loved the tennis ranch at the Royal Lahaina. There were at least 9 courts that I counted and it was very easy to schedule court time. The courts were in great condition and I felt like I was back at a high-end resort. My husband asked where the fitness facility was and he was told they didn't have one. I found that very disappointing that this "resort" had a tennis ranch, but no fitness facility. Overall, the condition of this resort is very inconsisent and lacks that "aloha spirit" we were really seeking. You can tell the economic conditions have hit the island and this resort, but again...we LOVED our room and the beach!! I would probably recommend this place, however, to the budget-minded traveler who is looking for a decent price on an ocean-view room on Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “We found paradise”
Reviews.Author: krmckinno
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an eight night stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort. Because we were celebrating our anniversary, we received a complimentary room upgrade. To say that we were happy with our room and view, is not nearly enough. It truly was paradise. We stayed in the tower, on the top floor (12) and the room and view were amazing. We enjoyed the "Old Hawaii" lobby and also the cool, fruit flavored water dispenser. The ocean front restaurant was fabulous for sunset viewing and the pool was clean and refreshing. We can't wait to return. For those who previously complained about the elevators, we had absolutely no trouble at all. One has been replaced, but most of the time we were in the older model, which has terrific, Hawaiian character. Enjoyed every minute. We also enjoyed the island crafters who were able to set up shop each morning, just off the lobby. Very convenient. Royal Lahaina is our new, favorite place.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: fettuchi
Reviews.Content: Incredible value!!! The rooms have been recently renovated and it shows. The design is very well done. I love that the sink and counter area are separated from the toilet/shower area. In general, the design and organization was really well thought out. Our room had a beautiful view looking out to the ocean. The hotel has great location on Kaanapali Beach. We were able to walk straight from our room to beach. The grounds of the hotel were lovelier than expected. The hotel had free craft making classes which were nice. The outdoor ambiance of the hotel was beautiful; the food was just ok though. We had a great time at the Royal Lahaina. I already miss our beautiful room and our great time there.

Reviews.Title: “We love Royal Lahaina & Maui”
Reviews.Author: jackiea192000
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at The Royal Lahaina Reosrt for our Honeymoon. I heard so many good reviews about it I had to see it for myself. Well we got to the Resort and it was beautiful!! They had pineapple water in the longe area (which I drank everyday). The first night we stayed in the Tower but decided we should go to the cottages because we are smokers and they would charge if we smoked on the balconies. No worries because the cottage room was fantastic. We were on the first row and could see the water, pool, and tiki bar from our room. It was so nice to be so close to everything. They staff was great and so helpful. They have a ice cream shop in the resort and I went there for coffee, ice cream, and even breakfast. The Luau was a little crowded but the show and food were great. We never tried Basil Tomatoes. We love it and will go again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the Price!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Raidamundo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent for the Price..Great Location ..path to walk to Whalers village and the hotel sits on the beach....Ask for a room on a high floor preferably the 12th floor (highest level), partial ocen few and tower is a must.... The crispy chicken wings at the hotel restuarant were tasty!!!!!. Any questions feel free to send me an e-mail..but I would and have recommened this hotel for the price to family and friends.... Ray

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mauitwins
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an updated cottage. It was much improved from our stay in 2007. The beds were very comfortable with lovely linens, and it was very clean. We stayed only for one night, as we own a timeshare, but it was just fine. Great location, very reasonable for Maui, nice restaurant, lovely, quiet entertainment, and a teriffic Luau. The staff was very nice and helpful. I would definitely recommend it. Maui hotels are very expensive, and this was more reasonable, but makes for a very comfortable home base.

Reviews.Title: “A warm comfy room during a rainy cool week in Maui”
Reviews.Author: freeamac
Reviews.Content: We loved the Polynesian feel to our room. It was comfy, functional and romantic. The view was acceptable but if I return I will ask for a room higher up than the third floor. The restaurant in the hotel was better than a Dennys but certainly not gourmet. Luckily there is a lots of choice a short drive from the hotel. The changing floor mat in the elevator was a cute addition and very charming when it matched up with our plans for the day. The front desk could get very backed up and busy which was annoying. It was too cool and rainy during our stay to sample either the pool or beach although both appeared very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quiet Part of Maui”
Reviews.Author: k_andrew_33
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to stay in a cottage on the beach and we got that here. There are only a handful of the cottages with an ocean view out of the back patio so make sure you get one or I don't think it is worth it. The cottages are as they explained them...not up to date. We thought that being 10 steps from sand or pool was worth sacrificing amenities though. 2 nice sized swimming pools so they don't get too crowded. Staff was great. Food was a bit pricey. We ended up eating at the strip mall just before you turn into the resort for quick meals. This resort is minutes from the marina for most activites and minutes from a good sized shopping center. We thought it was a great place to relax, but close enough to get to everything.

Reviews.Title: “A very good value”
Reviews.Author: 2sharinginfo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently enjoyed a 6-day stay at the Royal Lahaina Hotel on Kaanapali Beach. After 10 hours of traveling, we were overjoyed to step into our (automatic upgrade) ocean view room and experience the beautiful sunset from our room/balcony. We expect quality wherever we go and were not disappointed at this hotel. Friendly, accomodating staff, great Mai Tai's, good food, clean room, tropical grounds on the beach...all make this hotel a great value! One tip...skip the onsite luau and make advance reservations at the Old Lahaina.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Poland / Ukraine / Hungary :) - I move around a lot.
Reviews.Title: “First time in Hawaii - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_PL
Reviews.Content: hello everyone. after the swineflu breakout we had to change our vacation plans and decided to go to Hawaii. We are from Poland so flying there literally ment flying across the world. but it was definitely worth it. Maui is the most beautiful place I have ever seen in my life. And since we were on a tight budget after loosing money on rebooking the tickets and canceling hotels in mexico - we chose Royal Lahaina. And we liked it a lot - rooms: we arived around midnight, dead tired. they guy on the reception was very nice and upgraded us 2 levels to a partial view ocean view room. unfortunately they didnt have king size bed so we ended up with a twin bed, but they were so big we had zero problems usinig only one of them! it was still comfy! the view was good, the rooms were big and comfortable. What I loved about the place is the balcony + the big fridge. that means you can stuck up in a closeby safeway and premake sandwitches for you trips, and keep them cold! + if you want you can even get a bottle of wine, cool it down and drink it on the balcony while watching a Maui sunset. priceless! - hotel amenities - pretty week. the pool was pretty much non existent for me. but on the other hand I was comming straight out of Vegas where I was hanging out by the greates pool in town. so anyway. its there, its small - but no fun. the beach is great though! restaurant is ok. unfortunately there is not much going on... - hotel park: nice, condos, lots of flowers but nothing special. just average I think, but really nice. - location: SPECTACULAR. if you dont mind the walk - Kanaapali is right there. whalers village is right there, 3 minute drive to safeway and lahaina. 2 great snorkling places in walking distance. just spectacular! it is priceless to walk out of the hotel, straight to the beach and right there - you are swimming with sea turtles... - other: the elevators. they are really old and prettyy much scary. during the 5 days of my vacation there I think I have spent at least an hour on vaiting for the elevator. but thats a minor flaw Overall I would recommend royal lahaina to anybody. I would certainly go back. Yes - if you dont mind the money you can spend a couple hundred more and stay at the sheraton which is hard to beat (amenities, views etc.) but on the other hand - why not save the couple hundreds and use them for shopping or a couple of nice nights out in a good restaurant? anyway - if you have answers - will be glad to answer. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: athenapex
Reviews.Content: Pros: The Royal Lahaina Resort was a great accommodation and we were satisfied very much with our stay. We stayed in the tower with a partial ocean view. The photographs on their website are accurate and do reflect how the rooms look like. Our room included a king size bed with a down mattress pad on top of the normal mattress and a light down comforter and down pillows. The room also included a shower (no tub), mini frig, in-room safe, blow dryer, iron, daily coffee and tea replenished and daily hawaiian local paper.
