The soap, shampoo, conditioner, and lotion were a lovely coconut-lime scent which I made sure to take home with me. The room had plush towels and included spa robes. For the most part, my husband and I were out and about seeing Maui but the time we did spend at our hotel included a nice size pool with free beach towel service when you tell them your room number. They had some vendors in the lobby in the morning selling hawaiian goods. There is a kiosk in the building where you can set up your tours, activities if you so choose. The hotel also offers a luaa although we opted to do the Old Lahaina because our friends recommended it. When we first checked in our king wasn't available and we were in a double bed room on the third floor. We packed our stuff ready the next morning and the hotel staff moved our stuff for us while we were out sight-seeing to a king bed the following day. One day the hotel staff must have gotten interrupted while cleaning our room as we had a shammy left on the counter and our bath supplies were not replenished but the hotel staff downstairs accommodated us very easily. It has probably the best location for the beach at Kaanapali as you can easily walk to Black Rock to snorkel from the beach and the snorkeling is excellent at Black Rock with turtles and schools of fish. It is cheaper than actually staying at the Sheraton at Black Rock and still easily accessible. Cons: We did not use the internet during our trip but the rooms are not wireless unless you subscribe to a service that the hotel does not run so if you have problems you have to call the company direct. Also the hotel does offer ethernet but the bellhop was not very knowledgeable as to the details. Apparently there are lots of activities but there is no way of knowing the hotel activity schedule because it is not included in any documentation in the room or on a board in the lobby. I think the hotel should look into posting it...it is on their website but if you don't have internet access on your trip it's a moot point. We were out and about and didn't want to bother with paying for the internet and didn't do that many activities at the hotel so in the end it wasn't a big deal. You can rent snorkel stuff but it's cheaper to rent in Lahaina as the hotel charges much more. We didn't try any of the restaurants or shops at the resort. Initially when you check in the reception desk person hands your hotel keys to the bellhop thus forcing you to allow the bellhop to take your bags as you can't get a hold of your hotel keys without using him. Your then obligated to tip him for taking your bags from the lobby 15 feet to the elevator and then to your room. That was a bit annoying as I had little luggage that I couldn't handle myself. I chalked it up to assisting tourism during the recession.

Reviews.Title: “So happy we booked here!!”
Reviews.Author: travelgrl00
Reviews.Content: pardon my spelling, in a bit of a hurry! My husband and I booked through expedia.com and booked a terrace view since it was significantly cheaper. But when we arrived we upgraded for 25$/night for a partial ocean view and are glad we did, what a view!! Check in was a breeze, and check out was even breezyer! We payed the 16$/day for parking and the 2 mai tais a day deal. You could get your mai tais at either the bar in the restaruant or the poolside bar but had to get them before 9pm, so remember that if you are leaving and won't come back till late. also, parking spots are tight! and everytime i opened my door, i hit the other car accidently, so might want to get renters insurance.... We stayed on the 7th floor and had a lovely view of Molokai, the ocean and the west maui hills. The lanai was nice with 2 chairs and table, perfect for morning coffee, or letting your swimsuits dry off. The rooms are upgraded, flat screen TV, comfy bed, only downfall is the lighting in the vanity, but there is another mirror in the hall with more lighting. oh, and you could hear into the hall easliy, which means people can hear you while your in your room... Shower was nice and so were the soaps and shampoos (cococut scented!) the lobby is kind of old school, with murals and rock walls, but i though that was cool. and the pinapple water in the lobby is very refreshing! good to refill your waterbottle with! Staff friendly, bartenders pretty friendly too. We ate at the restaurant a few times, and i really enjoyed it. It is open to the outdoors and has a lovely view of the beach, ocean and pool area. Food was ok, nothing spectacular. we had nachos(huge!), fish tacos-sm. portion, and the garlic fries were great. The breakfast buffet is 20$, and quite a variety of things to choose from. The bisquits were cold and hard, but then they put out new ones that were fresha and d-lish. We ended up going to whalers village, or out to sushi for our other meals. We rented a car, which is a must if you want to explore. there is a shuttle to take you to the whalers village (shopping, restaurants), and from there you can take teh maui bus, every hour for a dollar to get to the cannery mall in lahiana. The hula grill-bar in whalers village is excellent for dinner, and live music playing and your feet are in the sand, looking out to the sunset.. but make reservations and be prepared to wait 45 minutes (you could 0just shop around though). We mostly walked to the whalers village on the nice path they have (about 15 minute walk). the beach is great, not too crowded on the end near black rock, and the snorkeling at black rock is awesome! We saw 2 sea turtles one day, but the other days, the current was too strong to snorkel there. Snorkeling is also good on the other end of the hotel (about a 5 minute walk to the right) lots of coral and pretty fish! Overall, great place to stay for the price, and we will definately stay here again! Mahalo Royal Lahaina!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it !”
Reviews.Author: Horseintown
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our trip to Maui. We loved it. I work in the hospitality business and because I don't like hidden surplices I always do my research before I book a place. I read all kind of reviews on many different websites, I did my study and I know what to expect. And I was pleasantly surprised when my expectations where exceeded. The landscape around the Resort is beautiful, pools are clean and the rooms are very nice, we did a little upgrade for a room with ocean view and getting up in the morning and opening the shades and seen a "postcard view" in front of you was really the cherry on top of the cake. The location of the hotel is great, for snorkeling a great spot is right at the hotel south part of the beach (Black Rock) were we swam with turtles ! Dining we ate fish every night in Lahaina, everything was a energizing experience ! So If you are planning to go, do your research, yes maybe stay away from the cottages, yes the lobby might need a little touch up, but the rooms are elegant and comfortable, the beach is immaculate and for the money is the best you can get in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the cottages”
Reviews.Author: Rhedd21
Reviews.Content: I read all of these reviews, and couldnâ€™t believe what I saw when I got there. This hotel, clearly under renovations still, needs help. I was booked into a cottage room, the room, once I got in it, had visible mold, not to mention the smell, and tile falling from the walls in the bathroom. I sat on the bed and had to look again just to make sure I wasnâ€™t sitting on a rock. The room was so small I could barely maneuver around the bed. This hotel should be ashamed of itself for even booking people into these rooms. When I called and asked to have someone help me out with the bags as I was leaving to go to another place, they sent someone right out. Then I received a call from the management staff at the front desk asking if I would prefer to be in a â€œtower roomâ€�. When I was assured these rooms were mold free, I agreed. The tower room they placed me into was much cleaner and recently renovated. The balcony faced out onto the buildings rooftop mechanical and electrical equipment, which was VERY loud. Really, this place is far from paradise, go at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice - good location, clean and value for money”
Reviews.Author: hereandthere98
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina was a great place to stay. It was conveniently located and the staff were just lovely.....very helpful. Food was good too. The bed was very comfortable and views from the ocean room were great. It's close to Black Rock, so ideal for snorkellers. The beach in front of the hotel is almost a private beach. Overall, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Bibliotekarien
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week at the Royal Lahaina. My impressions of the place are both good and bad. We were greeted by friendly and helpful staff and were upgraded to a better accomodation than we had paid for (cottage with ocean view instead of garden view) free of charge because it was our honeymoon, which was nice. However, if you go, do not, I repeat do NOT, stay in one of the cottages! The ocean view was lovely but the cottage was a damp, smelly and not very clean place. After the first night I wanted to pay for a hotel room instead (haven't actually been in one but from pictures and from what I heard from other guests, the rooms seem lovely) but since this was the last week of our trip and we didn't have that much money left, we decided to "tough it out"... As mentioned before, we were well met by all staff with a few exceptions (such as the hula teacher not-too-interested in having classes...) For excursions I would recommend turning to Expedia instead of Pleasant Holidays (both have offices at the resort); nicer, cheaper AND with better tickets! And I'm afraid I can't recommend the wedding/vow renewal planning service either. Other than that, everyone treated us well. All in all, we had a good stay, partly because we didn't spend much time in our cottage. Location is very good, with the snorkeling spot Black Rock within walking distance and a free trolley passing by other hotels and restaurants on Ka'anapali Beach. Next time, however, I will stay at the Hyatt or at the Sheraton. For nightlife and/or shopping, go to Lahaina town. But remember that Lahaina is Hawaiian for "cruel sun" - it gets r e a l l y hot at daytime!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Becomes Reality”
Reviews.Author: Nacholovers
Reviews.Content: Forgive me for any misspellings or run on sentences. I am writing this after just returning today from the island. It has truly been the longest travel day/night of my life. Being that this was a trip to Hawaii, I have to start out by saying Aloha and what a wonderful experience. Since this is only a review of the hotel, I will leave out the details of our 7 day tour and focus on the highlights of the hotel. After experiencing Maui first hand, I highly recommend it to any couple who would like to just truly get away from the hustle and bustle of the mainland USA. Now, for the resort. For those that just want a quick yes or no (to book or not to book) my gut instinct is a yes. (for married folks, couples, singles, and the romantically involved.) If you are a surfer, hiker, or you are adventure/nightlife seeking, there are probably better options. Skip down to the end if you just want the quick summary. This hotel is situated up the west coast of the island of Maui. It is just about as secluded as you can get for the price. The drive is roughly 30-40 minutes from the Kahului airport in central Maui. If you are coming in during the day and this is your first time, take a moment as you drive to truly take in the drive on Hwy 30 heading toward Lahaina. If the sun is shining bright, it is truly a treat for those that appreciate nature and the elements. After you pass through Lahaina, look for Kaanapali Parkway and make a left. Take the winding road (Keeka, I think) up to the Royal Lahaina Resort (another fantastic view of the water, greens and beach). After you pass the guard shack (more on that later) go all the way through the stop sign and come back around up to the main entrance. (I made the mistake of driving up the wrong way....great laugh.) The valets are ready and waiting to check you in and get you on your way. At this point, your hotel experience begins; If you would like to have the valet take your car, it is $15 daily. (first of few negatives for me) Some may say that's cheap (compared to Chicago/New York..etc.) so if you are up for it, I recommend doing so. Although we did not take advantage of this, it will truly come in handy later. We found out the parking lot is small and does not accommodate anything larger than a Chevy Areo without being on top of the next car...and even that's a stretch. By the grace of God we didn't get a scratch on our rental...So let this be my first official negative about the resort. *Beware of the parking lot* The spaces are very small and if you self-park, you do so at your own risk. Additionally, because they have their own luau on sight, parking is extremely difficult between 5pm and 8:30pm. So my advice is to pay the $15 and let the valet handle it; from what I saw, they were very timely and it seemed hassle free. To self park is $10. Check-in was flawless. In fact, call ahead to confirm your reservation and ask for a room upgrade to save a few $$$ when you book. Our package deal was flight/hotel for $1598 6 days and 5 nights. This included a terrace view. If you are vacationing in Maui, then you have to go the extra mile and get the ocean view...I cannot tell you how relaxing it was to have the patio door open listening to the ocean all night long. Upgrading the room cost us an additional $50 per night compared to $235 on the booking site. They told me for that week, the normal price for the room we got was $400. Okay; to address the complaints about the elevator. It is totally true what folks have been saying; although, I have to be a bit more grown up about it. True, the elevator is outdated and slow as molasses; and yes, that can be frustrating for those up on floors 6 and above. My advice would be, simple ask them to change your room to a lower floor and don't take the elevators. My wife and I heard a couple complaining they had waited 10 minutes for it and were all pissed off. My thought is, after 2 or 3 minutes, look for the stairs. And that's exactly what we did. Unless were carrying something heavy or needed to go through the main lobby, we took the stairs. Inconvenient? Of course; but there are worse things than slow elevators. So I will let this be my second negative because it is true. *Avoid the elevators, the are slow at times* Our room was on the 5th floor and the view was just spectacular. I couldn't ask for anything more. (as you can see from the pics). The room itself was simple; the decor was nice and the bed was very comfortable. But it was truly all about the view. Another plus was being on the west side of the building, we got to see every sunset. If you are looking for that romantic setting, this is truly it. The Royal Ocean Terrace is the hotel's in-house restaurant. I have a mixed review about it. Breakfast was not the greatest. Good concept, overpriced, and not the greatest quality. We did the buffet our first morning (I think it was $20 or $30 per person...I can't remember.) There was a good spread, but most of the food was cold. I cannot stand cold food, so this is a little personal for me. I asked the waiter to warm it up, and he did; however, that doesn't fare well when you have to do that multiple times during a meal. Plus, the plates were cold, which probably contributed to the food issue. My wife didn't like the buffet at all, so I can't really give good marks for breakfast. Also, my third negative. *Beware of the birds*. I have never seen birds that are so bold....and not just the big ones...small ones too...(see pic) I'm not one to want to contend with fowl when I'm eating. It was cute the first time; but annoying after awhile. Dinner at the Terrace was better for me; the menu was deep for a hotel...and the prices were reasonable for the portions..($15-$30 per plate) My wife again wasn't too impressed; but a lot of this had to do with her just not feeling well either..so it wouldn't be fair to totally include her misfortune. The highlight was the dinner music. Each night, they have a local musician play soft dinner music (a few covers mixed with some Hawaiian music). I thought it added a nice touch with the ocean backdrop. A plus for us was that after we ate, we could go upstairs and still hear him perform. It was great! To wrap up, the hotel staff was VERY friendly. And I truly mean this....I did not see one person that mistreated us or gave us an unfriendly response. It was always, yes sir/ma'am...right away...or what can we do for you? I was totally blown away. We don't see that too much back here in the Midwest. The shops in front of the resort were also very convenient...a nice way to kill an hour if you just want to get out a bit. Also, they have two activity centers (for tours and adventure stuff). One is inside the hotel, and one is just to the right before you walk in. I recommend price matching before you make a commitment. We got sucked into one and could've saved about $75 on a show. We also added 2 additional days and an extended checkout. Ask about their policy before you commit. They will allow extended until 1pm; however, they have an extension for an additional $100 for whatever time you wish..(convenient for us because our flight left at 9pm) Personally, I would ask if they could hold your bags for a few hours because $100 is kinda steep for a few hours; but I felt it was worth it not to have to worry about running around too much before leaving. Summary: Pros: Not as expensive as other resorts in the area Secluded Friendly staff Romantic Food on premises Beach is about 75 yards away No real crowds to speak of..even on Memorial Day weekend Housekeeping was Great! Cons: Parking Slow Elevator Birds in the restaurant Breakfast was not very great 20 minutes from the great restaurants As I stated earlier; the guard shack experience was one of the most humbling moments I've had in my life. There is a man that works their (usually nights) named Tupou (sp). He greeted us our first day and our last. It started with a simple line: "Welcome, this is your home." Not very moving to the average person; but when I saw him day after day, I was convinced he was truly sincere. He greeted everyone with a smile both coming and going. It was so moving to see such spirit in a human being these days. My wife and I could not wait to get back to the resort from our daily activities just to be greeted by him. We were very sad when we left and wanted so badly to take him with us. How great would it be to have someone truly welcome you home each and everyday no matter what the circumstance? He was truly a blessing to us; and if he or the staff have an opportunity to read this, I would like to personally say, mahalo for your service and a hui hou...you are truly ohana to us. God Bless You.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not Great”
Reviews.Author: jemmini6
Reviews.Content: The room looked pretty nice, the beds were comfortable and the location on the beach and near Black Rock is great. Our AC didn't work when we first got into the room, but they sent someone up and had it fixed within 15 min. The lighting in the bathroom is terrible for getting ready and the shower door didn't seal so there was a huge puddle of water when you got out of the shower. Also, our view kind of sucked. Our "garden view" room was on the 3rd floor and looked directly over the flat roof, you could've hopped over the balcony and walked around on it. The worst part was the elevators...SO SLOW!!! It took almost 10 min just for an elevator to arrive. Overall, it wasn't too bad for the price, but I probably would chose to stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: pjhopkins
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for a more. This resort was the last night of our 6 night vacation, having a split stay on both Maui and Oahu. The first person to greet us was the gate attendant who checked our names from his list with a genuine warm smile and "welcomed us home and invited us to relax" as he directed us up the drive to the lobby/check-in. Talk about first impressions! Upon check-in the staff was quite friendly and accomodating and although we recognize it's out of the ordinary, we were pleasantly suprised and honored to have been upgraded to a 1 bedroom ocean-view suite. The room was beyond our expectations. We stayed in a 1 bedroom lanai suite on the 12th floor. The suite had 2 bathrooms, a separate living room area, 3 lanais, and view that pictures can't do justice. *I've stayed in many hotels/resorts and this is one of the few times that I didn't want to leave the room (a large statement given the ocean/beach that awaited outside). We felt like royalty and the staff ensured we were treated as such. Each encounter with the hotel staff was similar; from the staff at the restaurant to the bellmen, to cleaning staff, each was friendly and went out of thier way to ensure all needs were being met and each guest was being attended to. I understand they recently underwent a renovation and have had some mixed reviews in the past but rest assured, our stay was marvelous and we would return in an instant. Great service, great value, highly satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: sjmann
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at Royal Lahaina and it was lovely. We stayed in the towers and it was lovely. We had view facing north and had a nice view at sunset as well. The room was clean and they also gave a bottle of champagne on our first day. We swam at the beach and at the pool everyday. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Mauiman147
Reviews.Content: You MUST come to this wonderful place and experience what service and friendly people are all about while on Maui. I took my adult son on a golfing vacation and we played both the North and South courses....what fun!. Our room faced the course and had a great views of the sunrise and beautiful sunsets. Topo at the gate and all the staff greeted us each day with smiles and new info to make our days memorable. The food at the Terrace was outstanding,the dancers were amazing, uncrowded beaches... This is my place...make it yours!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations, loved it”
Reviews.Author: kpmurph1
Reviews.Content: My goodness, reviews on Tripadvisor are certainly subjective. Glad we ignored the negative ones or we would have missed out on the greatest stay. We stayed in the tower and had a view of the cottages & neighboring golf course. The beach is beautiful. The Mai Tai's are delicious . No complaints. Others might complain about: 1) the interior of the elevators (worn, less than pristine condition) 2) they advertise 3 pools, but the 3rd pool is near the tennis courts, its tiny and in the shade 3) the cottages are dated and worn, but really cute from the outside. Wait, I have one small complaint but got over it very quickl. I dieted for 2 mos. before the trip, no bread, no starches. I celebrated our first day w/ a hamburger in the poolside restaurant. It was inedible. I should have had the salad.

Reviews.Title: “Stop Reading the negative reviews, and book now!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaGaPeach
Reviews.Content: If you're anything like me, you immediately read the negative reviews first. (Especially since the only ones of us writing do it clearly out of a great, or terrible experience) And you'll keep reading the reviews probably like I did till your trip when you can write about it yourself. So, I've written a long one so you have an idea of all the great things in store for you when you book at the Royal Lahaina. Check In- SUPER FAST! After a 14 hour flight from Atlanta, the last thing you want is a rude front desk person and especially one that takes forever to hand over the keys. We came in at 4pm with fresh pineapple water and lavender chilled towels to wipe our faces with. Nice touch! Some reviews say the hotel lobby is dated, I say it has more of the old Hawaiian feel, more personal. Plus, they unloaded our luggage for us, let us park, and personally showed us to our room instead of handing over the keys and trying to figure it out ourselves. Rooms- We got a partial ocean view room, Very clean, has 2 trash bins, hair dryer (thank god cos I forgot mine), ironing board and iron, and the beds! OMG! The beds are AMAZING!!!! They are so plush and confortable, and this is from someone who sleeps with a memory foam pillow, semi hard bed with memory foam topping, and 800 tc sheets and down comforter- Trust me- you'll get a good's night sleep here! Bathrooms- Beautiful stone tile, and let me say- the coconut lime soaps smell very tropical and delicious. I wish I could buy a huge bottle of the body wash! Grounds/ Parking- The flowers are great on the grounds, kept so clean and the golf course is beautiful. The parking is a little tight, so be sure to get a compact car, but also be sure to get the package which includes parking and the Mai Tais, Parking is $10 per day, and the Mai Tai's on their menu are $9, but for $15 a day you get 2 free Mai Tai's, access to the safe in your room, and parking- it's worth it! And they do not get cheap on the alchohol in those drinks, lemme tell you! The pool to some may seem dated, but there's two and I thought they were both great- and besides, the beach at the RL is so nice you won't want to be in the pool but to lay in the sun. Restaurants- Basil Tomatoes is "okay" it reminded me of Olive Garden, which if you like Olive Garden, you will love Basil Tomatoes. We went for lunch on the fly and I had the pesto ravioli's (which were actually very good) and my husband had the burger. The burger was hugeeee, My husband the human garbage disposal couldn't finish it. The burger is $7 (great deal) but to have topay $2+ for fries. Ocean Terrace Rest. was our favorite. Great food. We've had the nachos, ribs, Kalua pork quesadillas, and we were never disappointed! AND, they give you LOTS of food! the nachos are worth $14. AND, they had nightly entertainment while you ate. (the restaurant is also infront of the pool and ocean so there's never a bad view and great sunsets) Over all, our stay at RL was wonderful. The staff was great, the cleaning crew were great (There were always 2 maids per room), the front desk was great to suggest restaurants to us, and over all really helpful. And know that when I left, the new elevators were already installed and someone was working on them. I will definetly come back to the Royal Lahaina when visiting Maui again, I just hope they don't wise up to what a great value they offer and charge more for the excellent service and rooms. Better book now!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss out on this experience!”
Reviews.Author: l0ve-the-sun-22
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui and we will be going back, possibly to the same resort. Six of us travelled altogether, three couples, all in our 20's. There were some other younger couples on this resort, but mostly people come in families with children, or for weddings as well as anniversaries. We saw other beaches during our trip, but I must say, our resort was on a beautiful clean beach, the best beach we saw. The location was excellent, not a far drive to front street and local dine-ins and parking was about $10/day. There are also small shops directly outside the hotel. The staff were exceptional during our stay, so polite, friendly, happy. They were open to upgrading the room from a terrace view to a partial ocean view for us, what a nice way to start our vacation. The rooms are modern, spacious and comfortable. They are just as they look in the pics. I was surpised to read the handful of bad reviews. This resort is quiet, comfortable and affordable. It's no 5-star, but it's a great 4-star. My advice: Stay in the tower, not in the cottages. The rooms are not renovated there, we heard from others, and saw for ourselves. Ew. The beds are the best part, oh so comfortable. The resort is quiet by 10, most people are asleep.. so take a nice walk around the resort, the bar, the pool, the beach and enjoy the quiet enviroment. Make sure you go to the Luau that is offered right on the resort! It was a great experience. And order the pina colada in a pineapple from the bar on the resort :) Hope this helps. My heart is in Maui <3

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Kaanapali Choice”
Reviews.Author: aniehaus
Reviews.Content: After looking at tons of reviews and driving myself crazy, we finally settled here for a couple nights. It was completely worth upgrading ($45) to an ocean view room, and the renovations were fabulous--a bed I didn't want to get out of, despite the gorgeous beach and view, and a perfect location on the most gorgeous stretch of Kaanapali beach (far superior to the Hyatt end). I adored the lovely Hawaiian kitsch feeling of the lobby, and the pineapple water really made my vacation! The pool isn't as astounding as the others on the resort stretch, but get a little creative and just go there anyway for some drinks and swimming. There's a great and easy path in between all the Kaanapali resorts (it gets a little hedgy through the parking lot at the Sheraton, but it's there!). If I were to go to Kaanapali again, I'd stay at the Royal Lahaina for sure. (It's also really easy to get into Lahaina on the Maui Transit Bus.) If I had tons and tons of money and could afford Wailea, I'd stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani--but as-is, I enjoyed their fancy pool bar quite a bit and didn't have to shell out the extra $300 for it. Go Royal Lahaina!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad Choice”
Reviews.Author: RJAYR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back last Friday and i'm starting to have my Hawaiian/Vacation Withdrawals. We stayed for 6days 5nights at the Royal Lahaina Resort. I had my doubts with this place before booking, but that went away when we got there. i'll break up my review for those of you who want to skip to what you want to read: Parking: The parking cost $10 a day for self park or $15 for valet. I can understand Oahu/Waikiki area charging for parking because real estate is scarce, but on Maui? The Parking stalls are small...If you do get a rental just buy the bumper to bumper coverage..you will get dents if you park at this hotel..that's a guarantee. Also there is a nightly luau so you have to ether get in early before 5pm or get there right after they leave 915pm. Check in: Check in was painless and they upgraded my room to a Partial ocean view or a ocean front cottage. i opted for the upgraded partial ocean view because i wanted to see the Newly renovated rooms. The staff at the front desk were helpful and not rude at all ( i remember seeing a posting that the staff was rude...maybe those people got fired) Room: we stayed on the 3rd floor which was not bad but i wish i had a few more floors up. The rooms were great! they were standard size but they really spent some money on the renovation. i must say the bed was super super soft...I really miss that bed. All the wood in the room is some type of dark wood( sorry i dont know what type of wood) that smelled great. all the bath room fixtures were from kholer. all the metal fixtures were bamboo design. The Interior design of the room was very pleasant with framed pictures of waves and Hawaiians in canoes. There was a paddle mounted to the recessed wall as you enter the room. the TV was a Flat screen LCD (32') which sat on the Office desk / Dresser. The lanai was some what small..only good for 2 people at a time. There are no blinds, but there were these wooden dividers which tied into the Wood theme of the room. 1 thing i did not like was the lack of Closet/ dresser space and the small...really small fridge. THEY CHARGE FOR INTERNET ACCESS! you get 60 min's free every 48 hours. so after you use up your 60 min's it's $9.95 . All in all its a good room for 2 people..more than that and that would be pushing it. Restaurant: We had breakfast in the restaurant downstairs on our last day there and we should have spent more time at the restaurant...but where's the fun in that. The food was really good. My wife had the Mac nut pancakes and i had the buffet. All the food was great, the spread had a lot of variety and all the food was fresh. Of course all the fruits were sweet and delicious. The staff at the restaurant was very attentive and you didnt have to go looking for help because there was someone always close by waiting. Watch out if you eat outside...these birds are not afraid to eat off your plate WHILE YOUR STILL EATING! it was cool to watch though. Hotel Grounds: The hotel is Located off hwy 30 at Kekaa Dr. If you play golf then you picked the right hotel. There is a golf course adjacent to the property which is convenient. there are also 9 full size tennis courts . There are two pool, but who would use the pool when the pacific ocean is located 5 feet from the pool!?! The beach is calm and often empty. No problem finding a spot to tan or just fall asleep..that's what i did. There are some independently owned shops on the property which are not worth mentioning. The Hotel lobby is furnished with a Hawaiian/ Canoe theme which was pleasant to the eyes...since i'm the subject of pleasant , there is a Pleasant Holiday information desk in the lobby....there is also a competing Expedia information office right outside the front lobby. Luau: I read the Reviews and the Luau go some bad reviews. I personally have been to too many Luau's , I've been to Luau's on the big Island which looked like they were put on by a Circ de sole to i can't even count how many on Oahu. The luau at the Royal Lahaina was pretty good. They had the all the plots to the luau..the unearthing of the Pig from the emu, the luau demonstration , the Joke telling...which was pretty good... the food and the show. i actually liked this Luau. It got to the Point...The show was great! the music was good, the Food was Actually good, the mistress of ceremonies was the Best! and the Performers were not bad to looks at...not at all. It was an open bar ...nuff said and if you order a specialty drink it's $15 free refills....just buy one and share it with your friends...thats what the girl next to me did. Hey it's free! Good Luau if your staying at this hotel...you dont have to find parking and you can just stumble back to your room! Staff: The entire staff at the Royal Lahaina Resort was fantastic! I do want to give a shot out to the guy working the shack when you first drive in...made you feel like you live there...as you drive out he would make sure he gave you a Aloha and a Shaka as you drove by and as you drove back in he Greeted you with " ALOHA and welcome home" ....very nice touch...i know how boring working the guard shack must be on the swing/night shift and dealing with tourist everyday and to have that smile and pleasant and welcoming attitude is just ...well the ALOHA spirit. i would definitely recommend this hotel in the future. I will also be staying here in my future visits to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and if you are traveling with Kids......”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSimpleton
Reviews.Content: I think someone said it right in one of the other reviews don't let the bad reviews scare you. This resort was beautiful, the rooms were amazing. They had a playpen set up in the room for my one year old. A refridgerator in the room, again helpful for a one year old. A balcony view of the garden in the main tower amazing (Garden view room). The water is clear on the beach line. Two well sized pools not crowded in May,we swam with the baby it was great. Breakfast was delicious at the hotel can be pricy but its Hawaii ($15 each/$19 buffet) its good for one-three days if you are tired. DONT EAT AT THE ITALIAN RESTARUANT ON THE PREMISES PRICY $80-100 WORST FOOD WE HAD WE ONLY PICKED AT OUR FOOD AND STILL HAD TO PAY. We booked all of our tours through the Expedia on the hotel premises they were great. The Luau ($69 front row seating b/c expedia booked it) was wonderful the buffet great (must try the pig). Hostess hilarious. The Four Winds II ($78/each) for snorkeling with a one year old amazing lunch (chicken breast delicious) good breakfast staff amazing, FREE fishing, glass bottom boat area for kids/adults, fun water slide into the ocean, you view turtle town in the middle of the ocean and see sea turtles swimming. Maui Escape helicopter tour awesome, great staff, good price ($220/each) same helicopter that filmed Jurasic Park. Experienced pilot. Maui princess for dinner cruise awful. We were polluted by diesel fuel while we were eating, it's old no high chairs for babies. Road to Hana wonderful an ALL day trip. FREE just pay the gas on your rental and you are good. You see and can swim in hidden waterfalls (please bring watershoes, slippery rocks), the famous black beach, 7 pools, explore caves, etc. WARNING the road is windy during the 2 hour drive to Hana those that suffer from severe nausea ( Scobalamine patches goes behing your ears MD must prescribe or Dramaine over the counter; These drugs good for cruise/boat rides too). I suffered from nausea but the frequent stops to view sites on your way to Hana was good enough for me. FREE visit Old Lahaina Shopping area on Front street with rental or free shuttle from this resort. P.S. rent a Car it's Maui don't feel restricted $140/week you can go to local Walmart for things you forgot or don't want to pack (soap, diapers, souviners, etc). McDonalds, BK everywhere if you want to budget breakfast, lunch meals. On Front street in Old Lahaina you will find great reasonable breakfast prices at Sunset Cafe (looks dingy at first but food great 5.99 complete breakfast meal) and another restaurant $6-8 great food sorry forgot the name looks like a sailboat curtains. DO NOT eat at CoolKats for lunch nasty, dingy pricy.

Reviews.Title: “nice resort”
Reviews.Author: sjetexas
Reviews.Content: Stayed Apr 26 - 30 Positives : -found it clean, tower rooms were nice, great views even with a partial ocean room -Service was friendly overall, valet was very responsive. -I thought the restaurant food was fine, even though we only ate there once. -very nice TVs in the room...HD support and a lot of available channels for being a hotel. -Didn't see many kids, but probably just the time period we were traveling. Negatives -rooms seem a little noisy...we had a room by the elevator initially and the noise was *terrible*. We had to upgrade our room to get away from it. We could also hear people in adjacent rooms at times...seems like noise was coming through the vents or maybe the walls are just thin...bit annoying late at night. The fire alarm went off a 3 times one night over a half-hour span at 1am. Think it was caused by a power failure, but aside from freaking us out initially (12th floor), it kept us awake for awhile. -annoyed that there are no beach chairs on the beach. I think that's why everyone is at the pool and the beach is typically deserted even though it's beautiful. Cabana rental fees were pretty outlandish and looked pretty unused because of it...shame to see them all sitting there empty going to waste. -Elevators are odd...noisy, sorta slow (only 2 of them), and seem to have a mind of their own. We were on the top floor, and more often than not there would be people from a lower floor (trying to go down but obviously going up) in the elevator when we stepped in...

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were fantastic, view was perfect too... great location”
Reviews.Author: slackerlova
Reviews.Content: What a nice place for the price versus the other chains on this beach. You won't find a fancy lobby at this place but the tower rooms are beauitiful. I little cramped in the bathroom area but beds are comfy. We upgraded for $25/per night for a full view, and what a view it was. Our only complaint was the elevators were awful... had to hit up to go down, etc. Never ate in the restuarant except for one wing order, they were awful and there were 6 for $15. Pool bar was fine, bartender was friendly. Didn't enjoy the pool since there were lots of kids, and we were there to GET AWAY from our kids so we stayed by the beach and larger pool. Kind of a drag to pay $40 a day to utilize chairs on the beach, but they are covered and it's the going rate at other hotels too. We went to safeway, bought a cooler & our own beer and wella! Saved tons of money. They were cool about our own cooler and never said a word., We did ask if it was ok before we bought it and they said yes. Good snorkeling right next door at black rock. Make the long trip to Mammas fish house, expensive but what a view! There is a bus by Whalers village that will take you into Lahaina for $1. Worth it if you want to avoid driving. Parking at this hotel is tricky late at night, but we always found a spot. Staff was all around pretty helpful. Laua here is cheesy, try the one in old Lahaina instead we heard it was better. No computers in the lobby to check email or anything, that was annoying. An attached shoip had it but they weren't always open. Also note, we heard the cottages were old and musty, get a room in the tower!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Lahaina and the staff :)”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelIl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Royal Lahaina Resort from April 20th to April 28th... We had a wonderful time at this resort. I have traveled a bit for my vacations, I've even been to Maui before, but I have to say, there is no place like Maui.... It's God's gift to us, people on this earth.... About Royal Lahaina... I was a bit confused when one day I would read positive review, the next day, negative review... I did not know what to make out of it, that is why I wanted to take a few minutes and write about my experience at Royal Lahaina Resort. I traveled with my sister and my 18 y/o and 10 y/o nieces, we arrived late at night about 1030pm on Monday night, the minute we pulled the car in front of the resort, this young man came to open the door for us and lead me to the front desk, while I was checking in with the most friendly lady there, my car was being unloaded and the lugage was being taken care of, I upgraded to an ocean front room, I figured I don't come to Maui everyday, therefore I want the best there is for me and my nieces. I was on the 4th floor, right in the middle with full ocean view, breath taking.... the bell boy brought my stuff upstairs and I had asked him for a vending machine to get some cold water, instead he showed up a few minutes later with 4 botles of water, complimentary from the hotel staff, since everything else was closed, I guess... That little gesture meant so much to me, when I was so tired, travelling since 6 am and being on 2 planes for more than 9 hours and also loosing one plane, than having to drive from the airport to the hotel in the dark on a rainy night.... I was exhosted, all I wanted was cold water to drink, a good shower and a bed... I got them all... the shower had so much water pressure, was just great, the room was outstanding, the decor, the cleanliness, and NO SMELL !!!! The bed sheets, were white as snow and so crisp, than the bed....oh my Lord... the best matresses ever..I spend $3,000.00 on my mattresses at home and they are not as good as the ones from Royal Lahaina Resort.... I, actually all 4 of us slept like babies that night and all nights :) In the morning we got to actually see where we were at, WOW, the view, the landscaping, all kinds of flowers and plants... so well maintained and manicured, the beach.... my it was beautiful, just gorgeous... and to top all that, the staff was unbelievable, they were so friendly and always with a smile on their face at anytime of the day... There were some classes on Hula Dancing, LEI making, and Puka shell necklace making, which my 10 y/o old had to attend them all, she had such a great time... she got to bring home the Lei and of course her Puka necklace and she constantly does the Hula for us... The people teaching the classes made us feel so special by being so friendly and telling us places to go eat with the locals and places to visit.... They were the best !!!!!!!! I don't know what to say but that I miss Maui and the people from the resort, on the day we left the staff stopped us to say good bye and to ask us to return soon, which of course I will, I would not want to dissapoint my new friends.... I loved, loved Royal Lahaina, can't wait to go back, same room, same place..... Mahalo to everyone at the resort, until we meet again !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It is a wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: soozandr
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Wednesday April 15, and left Friday April 24th. The hotel is clean, the beach is terrific, and the rooms was very nice. The hotel staff were always courteous, and friendly and always willing to help you out and offer advice. Our room was large with a "partial" ocean view (however we were on the 8th floor and could clearly see the ocean so I would say it was full ocean view). The only complaint is not with the hotel - we should have rented a car, everything is spread out and Taxi's are expensive, so lesson learned - get the car.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and grounds...will not be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: CharAnn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely. The staff was so kind and helpful. They look our luggage to our room while my husband and I checked in. They showed us around the room to make sure we had everything we needed. Whenever we wanted to "explore" we never waited more than a minute for the staff to get our vehicle for us. The ice cream shop at the hotel was really tasty and the breakfast items offered were just as good. The beach outside the hotel was very clean and at night the music from the hotel made it such a romantic atmosphere. The restaurant was okay, but not nearly as good as the ice cream shop! The location allowed us to take in what we wanted to in the area and then have a place to retreat to at the end of the day. The room was inviting and so clean.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T LET THE BAD REVIEWS SCARE YOU AWAY! ITS A GREAT PLACE!!”
Reviews.Author: marleymeandmarcy
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui and my wife and i picked the Royal Lahaina resort simply for the beautiful beach pictures that we saw!! After reading so many bad reviews we were scared that we weren't going to like the hotel so we tried to cancel our reservations and move to a different hotel. Our travel agent told us it was to late to cancel without a cancelation fee so we decided to go there after all. First of all i really dont know why so many people have bad things to say about this Hotel, my guess is that these people are cheap and picky as hell!! I mean they pick this hotel for the low price and expect the four seasons!! I wish "tripadvisor.com" would delete all the bad reviews on this place!! Okay now for the good stuff!! This hotel is wonderful, the people that work there are really friendly and helpful. We had an ocean front room, the room was super clean and comfy! very modern. The grounds were very clean and the beach "BEAUTIFUL". If fancy swimming pools is your thing dont go to the Royal Lahaina Resort they have two good size pools but really who cares about pools when you have such a nice beach only steps away from the hotel!! This place is a wonderful to visit!! Dont let cheap and picky people make you think twice about this resort!! For the money they charge its great compared to other resorts located just down the beach!! I loved the Royal Lahaina Resort and will go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “4-star hotel, 5-star value”
Reviews.Author: masterr8r
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina for 7 nights in March 2009, and were very impressed with the resort. The grounds are beautifully kept, and the location is excellent. Infamous "Black Rock" is a 2 minute walk down the beach. On the other side of Black Rock hotel prices seem to be double the price of the Royal Lahaina. In my opinion, the beach is just as nice at the Royal Lahaina, but Black Rock certainly is great for snorkeling. There is a complimentary shuttle bus that takes you to the other side of Kaanapali if you don't feel like walking, but the pathway along the beach is hardly a chore to stroll along. The lobby of the hotel is dated, but the architectural details are beautiful. We had a partial ocean view tower room, and it was excellent. The rooms have been completely updated, but the Interior Designers did a great job of making it a modern Hawaiian style. The room features beautiful wood built-in furniture and details. The bathroom is well appointed, and each room has a nice deck with floor to ceiling windows. When in Maui, one generally has to accept dated styling in hotels / condos, but this is not so at the Royal Lahaina. I would go as far as to say the rooms are finished better than the majority of the high-end hotels on the strip (Hyatt, Sheraton, Marriott etc.). The restaurant / bar in the hotel is good, and there is nightly live music. The pool area is nice, and it's only steps to the beach. There is a cafe and ice cream shop if you don't want to sit down and have a meal, and if you walk 5 minutes up the road there are a few restaurants. We walked through most of the Kaanapali, Walea, and Kiheh resorts, and our conclusion was that the Royal Lahaina was hands down the best value per dollar. Stay there soon though, because I'd bet that in the near future the rate-discrepancy between the Royal Lahaina and the other high-end Kaanapali resorts will be no longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel, clean, new!!”
Reviews.Author: Ilse_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days at the royal lahaina and we loved it. The hotel is modern, our room was spacious (6014), great view, good shower, good bed and very clean. Yes you have to pay 10 dollars a day to park your car. The safe is for free. You have 60 minutes of wireless internet in your room per 48 hours, if you need more time you can also use the computer close to the lobby. The pool isn't big, but a great beach is just 10 steps from the hotel. The best snorkeling spot (black rock) is on walking distance. We also went to the molokini, we found it a little bit disapoining, the water is very clear but there a way more fish and turtles at black rock. We would definitely recommend the royal lahaina (tower), we loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Choose the tower over the bungalows...”
Reviews.Author: julieOO
Reviews.Content: In a bungalow, the beds & pillows were so uncomfortable that we asked to move to a tower room after the first night of our 5- night stay. The bungalows are definitely dated, so if you equate clean with 'new', you'd better confirm a room in the tower. We were accomodated with a 4th floor tower room with a view of the roof of some lower-level structure complete with satellite dishes. I did enjoy the ease of getting into Lahania by using the trolley & bus system and the view of the ocean while dining in the restaurant is fantastic. Great coconut-scented toiletries! There is a fee for internet service and the connection is sketchy at best. There is a pc and printer in the Guest relations office that can be used to check in for flights but check the hours it is open.

Reviews.Title: “Will definately go back! I LOVE Royal Lahaina!”
Reviews.Author: telsea
Reviews.Content: Was there for a week and I want to go back already! I loved Maui and the resort! beautiful place, helpful and very accomodating staff, loved all the little extras like the fresh pineapple water in the lobby and the cool washcloths ! I don't know how anybody can complain about this place, the beach is amazing, the pools are not that big but who cares when you have the ocean a few feet away?!! the grounds are beautifully kept! On the first day me and my daughter went to a Lei making class in the morning and it was sooo much fun, they always have activities going on like Hula lessons or bracelet weaving. We stayed in the tower in one of the rooms with a partial ocean view which was breathtaking. I still can't get over the beautiful blue/turquoise ocean water! Maybe a few things might need updating but I wouldn't change a thing, I love the old Hawaiian feel of the hotel, it made me think of Elvis! But if you like those big all inclusive resorts with huge pools that you have to walk 2 miles to get to and no personalized service and NO beach don't come here! Oh.. and their Luau was spectacular ! it was so much fun my kids loved it! I can't wait to go back ! Mahalo Royal Lahaina ! for making our holiday so special!

Reviews.Title: “i wouldn't even think of staying anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: cerlman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the tower. This was the one of the nicest, most elegant rooms we have ever stayed in. The view from our Oceanview (1219) was a perfect mix of ocean and the amazing mountain scene on the other side. We spent 5 days at the Westin just the other side of Black Rock and then moved to the RL. Best move ever. We have stayed in the Ritz, Westins, Beach Club and Wyndhams and more modest chains. I think the RL has put investment where it counts.The Royal Lahaina does not have massive river rides, impressive fountains or water slides, but really, is that why you go to Maui? Not us. The staff is superb, and the beach amazing. The entertainment in the dining room was a very unexpected surprise and a highlight of our stay. The singer (Kapulenui) and hula dancer (Wainani Kealoha) offer an elegant and graceful performance that the busy venue does little justice to. Hula is so much more than most people know. Wainani spoke with us about some of the history of the area and the significance of hula in the islands. Our flight home was late evening and with an 11 o'clock check-out, but the hotel offers luggage lock up and a courtesy suite you can use for shower and change prior to your heading out. Just a great touch. The hotel does demean themselves with an unfair portrayal of available internet. They offer a free hour of internet connection every 48 hours. What they provide is 'the first hour' of a 48 hour period at no charge. That is a subtle, but very important difference. If you think you can keep up with email and do a little web research at your leisure. Think again. I hope the commissions the hotel gains from the internet provider will very soon cause them to reconsider this arrangement. They are better than this shell game.

Reviews.Title: “Old and in need of repair but not horrible..”
Reviews.Author: maross396
Reviews.Content: First the positives: the beach is very nice and not overcrowded, the grounds are very nice and maintained..the negatives: this place is in need of some repairs as the rooms(we stayed in a cottage) are old and not greatly maintained, while having a drink at Don the Beachcomber lounge waiting for the leau I noticed a large hole in the ceiling that was black with mold. The restaurant was slightly understaffed and had a weak menu which would explain it being half empty all the time. the location wasnt to bad as it was a nice walk to the good restaurants down the beach, if you like to golf it has a nice looking course out by the cottages. the service was ok at best as i didnt really see anyone around and while waiting for the leau to start they only had one bartender on making it very slow to get drinks. This place could be so much more with some effort, again i am used to staying in nice hotels in cancun, playa del carmen etc and this place is not close to their quality.

Reviews.Title: “Probably a nice hotel at one time”
Reviews.Author: caposotto
Reviews.Content: This was probably a nice hotel at one time, unfortunately, the owners don't seem to have any interest in keeping this property up. The staff was probably the best part of our trip. Nearly everything in our room was broke or non-operational. Even the Bell Hop was apologetic about our patio door and closet doors not working. But none of them were fixed. They did fix the TV and the two broken lamps. Overall the room was clean, but old and in poor repair. It was nice to stay in a cottage vice a hotel. The luau at the hotel was pretty good. The drinks were horrible, they use cheap liquor and too much overly sweet mix to cover it up. The beach was nice. The two pools were a joke. Both were too small for the number of people at the resort. I also didnâ€™t appreciate the nickel and diming, everything was extra (internet, parking, phone calls and safe). For the condition of the property and the price they charge, they should through all of these in for free. We will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach, Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonMeli
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the tower of the Royal Lahaina are beautiful, newly renovated and very comfortable. It is located on a beautiful, private and calm beach with soft sand and our room had a nice ocean view. The pools were very basic and you had to walk across the parking lot to the small hot tub which was very hot. The lobby and elevators could use some renovating as it appears dated but the hallways and rooms are beautiful. The parking lot has the smallest stalls I've ever encountered. We got the parking package for $16/day that included free local calls, 2 free mai tais or non-alcoholic drinks/day and in room safe (without the package it is $4/day). However, it was a headache to get our drinks. At check out they wanted to charge us for our pineapple juice, which we had to argue was non-alcoholic and we had always verified with the bartender that we had the package before ordering. They ended up taking it off our bill but we thought that was unnecessary as they were non-alcoholic and we had only ordered drinks 2 of our 5 days there. Check in was ok - i would avoid the towels at the front desk as the towels smelled bad. They tried to get us in early but ended up giving us a room that had no safe even though we had just arranged to have the package. It was a bit of a hassle to change rooms - when I first called to tell them about the mistake, they told me there would not be any rooms with a safe available all day, even though it was only 12 pm and check out had just started and we were willing to wait. So we went to the front desk and they were able to find us a new room right away. I don't know if they were being unaccommodating or just confused on the phone. Besides the front desk, it was a pleasant experience at the Royal Lahaina. All in all, the hotel was great and we would definitely recommend it! Warren & Annabelle's is a must-see! We laughed all night and when it was over we were left wanting more. Good, clean humor with amazing magic. Warren was very engaging, extremely witty and connects with the whole audience. If you don't want to eat there, you can just show up before the show starts. They validate your parking for 4 hours but it was a bit longer so we were charged $2. Book early as they say it books up a week or two in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Royal Lahaina Wedding & 1st trip to Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: pickyandchoosy
Reviews.Content: I am the mother of the bride & just want eveyone to know what a wonderful job this hotel did for us. We had a wonderful wedding experience & 1st time trip to Hawaii. The hotel's wedding coordinator "Rainya" handled every detail to perfection & made the wedding perfect & effortless for us. We did everything by email correspondence with her, with only 2 months notice. We had a traditional Hawiian ceremony, followed by a buffet reception dinner for 18 people on the ocean lawn. The was food @ the reception dinner was FANTASTIC. The service was awesome. Everything was just done effortlessly, without us even noticing. We felt like we were guests @ our own wedding. The wedding cake was "melt in you mouth"...the best I've ever had & absolutely beautiful too. Most of the wedding guests stayed in the cottages, which were nice, I wouldn't classify them as luxurious, but they were nice (kind of middle class, I would say) & a very good value @ $165/night. For us a hotel room just needs to be a nice, clean & comfortable place to groom & sleep. The lawns surrounding the cottages were beautiful, private & perfect if you enjoy a very short & beautiful walk to the main hotel, pool & beach. The beach seemed very private, (Blackrock Inn just down the beach, had a very crowded beach area & was very HOT, probably since they are in a cove & don't get the nice breeze like the Royal Lahaina) The hotel breakfast was very good too (we ordered from the breakfast menu, we didn't try the breakfast butffet) I would highly recommend a Royal Lahaina wedding. See the attached photos.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a low price”
Reviews.Author: LitaDoll
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our second trip to Maui and the Royal Lahaina. My husband and I stayed for our honeymoon a year and a half ago and just spent another week there with extended family. We upgraded to ocean front and spent every morning watching the whales and every evening watching the most amazing sunsets....DEFINITELY worth teh price! Overall, the hotel is pretty good. The refurbished rooms are beautiful. The hotel is older (the elevators need some work) but has a very polynesian feel. The pools aren't spectatuclar but they get the job done...besides, you're so close to the beach it doesn't matter! The food at the hotel isn't great but the drive to Lahaina is a quick one. For the price, the Royal Lahaina can't be beat. There are definitely ways to go on the cheap (rent snorkel gear from Lahaina, eat on the cheap, buy snacks from safeway etc). We had a great time and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful rooms and comfortable stay! Will be back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 10horses
Reviews.Content: Before my husband and I left on our honeymoon, I checked the reviews for this resort and worried about what we were going to find. Because of those reviews I wanted to make sure people knew how nice this place really was! The first night we got there the front desk people were great, vallet was so quick that all of our luggage was out and ready to be taken to our room by the time we got the keys. We ate at the resturant in the hotel; the food was perfect and the live music was relaxing. When we returned to our room, room service was waiting at our door with a bottle of champagne with compliments of Royal Lahaina (our honeymoon). We had a wonderful partial ocean view room, I loved it as I got to see the mountains and the ocean! The pillows on the bed are huge and are feather, which I'm allergic, however in the closet was a non-feather. The following morning I left a not for house keeping to not remove the one pillow that was mine. When we returned they have completely taken all the pillows and replaced them with for hypo-allergenic ones!! This place was beautiful inside and out! We ate breakfast every morning at the hotel resturant, you can have buffet or order by menu. We did one day buffet but prefered menu. The waffle with coconut syrup, fresh strawberries and pinneapple is to die for!! Also we ate at Tomato Basil 3 nights in a row! Fabulous fish! 110% recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Tower Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dredrian
Reviews.Content: We traveled with 2 families w/younger children & a teenager...upon check-in the lobby was nice, open-aired, prompt valet/bellmen were available for the entire 10 days. Fresh, fruited water & moist towels greeted you, desk staff was very pleasant & courteous. Our check-in guy recommended a close pizza shop to feed the kids after our LONG plane trip to get there. It was tasty & quick! We had partial ocean view on the 10th floor, our room was right in the middle & had a spectacular view of the mountains to the left & the ocean, Black Rock & Molokai to the right. You could hear the waves & see the very visible stars. I slept with our patio door open most nights. We saw whales breaching the 1st morning & every morning we were there. I had asked for a (2) bed room but a king was only available that night, my sister had a 2-full room...I agreed to keep it for the night with a roll away (my 8yr old slept in it fine)...after seeing the difference in floor space even with a roll-away, I kept the King room for the entire time, if fact it was the hang-out room. It was beautiful, spa like & also had a canoe-theme...simple but elegant.. the king bed was so cushy & comfy, I slept very well & I usually don't away from home. The mini-fridge held alot more than 1st glance (gallon of milk, 1/2 g of juice, yogurts, fruit, lunchmeat, mayo & then some). We packed beach picknics daily (it saved on costs & with little ones who want to eat NOW, it really saved the day) In fact we turned my that section of the closet system into a cupboard/food area & charging station next to the coffee. The closet was Large & had iron/board, wooden hangers & 2 spa robes to go along with the spa-like bathroom. It has 3 pools & a hot=tub... none seem to be heated but the pool in front of the cabins felt the warmest also had the most kids (but seemed more a "Senior" facility) Ours enjoyed the pool by the tennis court where the hot tub is..not busy & they jumped back & forth. Didn't eat dinner at the restaurant but did get breakfast to go, it was tasty but a little pricey for the area. 1 hotel over (Castaway Cafe) had a reasonably priced menu & fabulous priced kids. We ate breakfast & lunch there..saw whales breaching from the patio.. Walking distance to Whaler's Village via the beach walk...also Black Rock was there for awesome snorkeling (saw huge sea turtles an arm length away every time there) If I went again as a couple only without kids, would definetely stay here again. Not so much w/kids would get a condo instead for better meal prep...average time to get food on a table in Maui was about 45mins to an hour (kids always wait till last minute to say "I'm starving" but that would be the only reason.

Reviews.Title: “Reception staff not that friendly”
Reviews.Author: Superjabba
Reviews.Content: I stayed in early Feb 09 at the Royal Lahaina, the hotel itself(reception,rooms etc) is OK, bit tatty but clean and comfortable all the same. The hotel is located on a great stretch of beach, no coral like some of the beaches where other 5* hotels are located further down. The dissapointing thing was the greeting by the reception staff, not what I was expecting after 15+ hours travelling. No friendly Hawaiian greeting that we expected but a rather frosty hurried one with nobody around to assist with luggage. We were given a room above reception with a lovely view of the grocery store(??!), the fumes from arriving vehicles was very apparent so I complained and was told if I wanted to move it would cost more money. I asked if I could just move higher or along to avoid the CO2 and was eventually given another room which I asked to look at before I accepted. The new room was facing the other side to reception in front of the biggest, noisiest airconditioning unit I'd ever seen - this was presumably to make me think I was lucky to have what I'd been given. When I went back the receptionist (Imilda I think) laughed so I gave up and accepted the original room I would recommend the hotel for it's location but I recommend anyone going to make sure they ask for a seaview room and don't expect a warm welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at poor quality---would say this is maybe a two start resort!”
Reviews.Author: e_o_mfam
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 10 day stay at this resort yesterday. I had read most of the reviews prior to going, but expected that most of the negative reviews were people who were just being "picky". Unfortunately, that was not the case, and both my sister and I wished we had heeded what we had read here and made reservations to stay somewhere else. Due to using American Express plan, we were locked in to staying here. Upon arrival, the staff was friendly. Our first room was located on the ninth floor. When we walked in, the strong musty odor hit us very hard. We wanted to be able to be satisfied, so decided maybe it just needed to be aired out. We were unable to open one of the sliding doors to a balcony and had to call for help. Even after the door was fixed, airing out the room did no help. By then, my throat burned. We then went down and asked for a different room. The second room was as musty and bad as the first room. It too was on the ninth floor. We did request a third room, which was not nearly as musty and it did work for us. However, every once in a while we got strong odors of raw sewage. We also smelled the raw sewage smell in the lobby on two different occassions. Our room was NOT refurbished--it was very old and very worn. There were cracks in the ceilings and walls. The windows were filthy, looked like they are never washed. The doornob on the master bathroom kept falling off and had to be put back on in order to leave that room. The floor was not clean and we wondererd if it was ever mopped. The fridge did not work properly---we ended up getting ice from the machine, put it in plastic bags, and kept food cool that way. The air conditioning was blowing constantly and we froze. Finally we did find out from the front desk how to turn it down, and then it was much more comfortable. We were very dismayed that we had been told that we were in a refurbished room---FALSE ADVERTISING. Part of the place has apparently been renovated, but certainly not where we were!!!!! Housekeeping---Oh My! When we first arrived, the hide-a-bed was not made up. We called for linen so that we could make it up---we waited for 45 minutes, then called again. Fresh linen did arrive finally and we made up the bed ourselves. For the first few days of our stay, the housekeeping was adequate. Then, by day 6, the service dropped off almost completely. The housekeeping did not empty our garbage even though it was heeping. We ended up taking it down to the garbage can in the ladies bathroom in the lobby and emptying it ourself after it remained there for two days in a row after the housekeeping had supposedly been there, as the smell of garbage can get quite strong in the tropical weather. Housekeeping also did not leave clean drinking glasses or clean coffee mugs by around day 6 either. We opted not to have housekeeping even bother on two days at the end of our just because we felt with such extremely poor service we did not want to leave a gratuity that was not earned. We think the only thing they did was pull up the bed linens to make the bed, leave clean towels, and nothing else. The two things that were excellent there---The Valet service was the best we have ever had anywhere. They were prompt and courteous at all times. The second thing that was wonderful was the view. We had full ocean front view that made the atrocious rooms livable. Had it not been for the view of the ocean, I do feel our entire trip to Maui would have been ruined. We will NEVER stay here again, and do hope that if you are not certain that you want to stay here then seriously give it second thought. I have never experienced such a negative resort experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, could be better.”
Reviews.Author: Zzee
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first trip to Maui and we stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort. My first impressions of this hotel was not bad, the lobby was simple however a little dark and it appeared like an old hotel that had been refurbished. Our experience checking in was prompt and friendly with no issues, did I mention the friendly staff...good. Upon arriving to our room which was a partial ocean view on the 4th floor we found it to be very nice, clean and welcoming. There was the sound of waves hitting the shore line playing on the radio in the room which was a nice touch to set the mood. The room was definately refurbished and seemed to have a canoe theme going on which was nice. My only issue with the room was the washroom area which was a little dark, sorry to nit pick but it is hard to put on makeup when there isn't enough light, other than that we where very happy with the room. The daily maid service was nothing short of great and the king size bed was extremely comfortable. Now to describe the restaurant in this hotel it you could call it that, what an utter disappointment. The Royal Ocean Terrace is dated and dirty and has a very shabby menu. We didn't mind having the breakfast buffet there however the decor and cleaniness of the place had me on edge. From visible stains on most of the seat cushions to mounds of ants having there own meal beside you on the ledges, well you get the point. The dinner seating side seemed to be much cleaner however still very dated decor. Ocean views are the highlight here however is ruined by the dinner menu which seems to limited to appetizer style entrees if that makes any sense, or get a burger. I didn't come all the way to Maui to have a burger I tell you that. And lastly the service at the dinner seating is atrocious, it appears that they have 2 servers working the entire restaurant and than 2 bartenders and one greeter, which this is a seat yourself restaurant. This was not a one of because we came twice to see if it would improve and both nights where exactly the same. Everyone was very friendly however it just didn't make up for the lack of quality in food. The beach area is fantastic and less busy than on the other side of Black Rock which we enjoyed. Complimentary towels are offered to you and you are not limited to how many as long as you return them. There is also a boardwalk/path that you can take all the way to Whalers village from the hotel which cuts through the Sheraton hotel and takes approximately 15 minutes. From Whalers village you can catch the public transit for $1 into Lahaina Town. We didn't rent a vehicle so we took the bus everywhere and saw most of the sights. The bus system is very simple and inexpensive. Keep in mind if you want to see Hana or Haleakala you need a vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad..Not the best”
Reviews.Author: kayjayMontreal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Lahaina in Feb 2009 for 3 nights and 4 days. When we first arrived at the hotel the front desk gave us three choices of rooms to stay in. Before taking a decision I asked her if we could see the rooms, she allowed us to take a look at the oceanfront room she was offering. The rooms were on the right side of the building right where the Luau was held everynight. When we walked in the room, it was really really spacious but really really old. Not dirty, just very old looking, and nothing matched in the room. The room was ocenfront but they had made the balconies in a way where no sun could be reflected in your face during the day if sitting out on that balcony. What was the point? Also being next to a Luau for 3-4 nights would get to be too much after awhile. I didn't need to see the other cottages that she was offering because I knew they had not been renovated and must look the same as the oceanfront room. I decided to go with the tower rooms since they had been renovated with 44 million dollars of refurbishment. The room was georgous. Not a five star room but a big improvement from the other rooms. It seemed as if I was staying in a completely different hotel. We didn't see any cockroaches and the cleaning ladies came in everyday to clean, change the towels and make the bed. I'm glad I was in a brand new room because my partner and I were getting over severe bronchitis and were happy to know we would be in excellent comfort with great tv choice and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Key things when you're sick in bed with a fever. We did have a partial oceanview which is a little under-estimated because we had a clear view of the ocean and Molokai. The staff were wonderful. Some of the downfalls of this hotel are that the hotel is far from the city and buses are not reliable. They come once every hour and if you want to explore the city, you spend half your time waiting around for a bus to come. The restuarant at the hotel is very weak. The food is at best mediocre and extremely overpriced. Also the menu in the room for room service is outdated and doesn't even match the menu in the restaurant. I would only reccommend this hotel to elderly people. Not many young people there and feel this is a hotel for people over the age of 40. The beach is not very wide and most people spend their time by the pool for this reason. You can't lie your towel down without it getting wet at the beach. The last thing I would say is becareful about using the phone in the room..there is a 1$ us charge even for local calls. Overall, if it wasn't for the newly renovated room we had, I would never come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Lahaina was very nice”
Reviews.Author: NoKidsCanTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at the Royal Lahaina in February 2009. It is situated on a beautiful swimming beach. We were very pleased with the accommodations. We stayed in the tower and our room was beautiful as was the view. We got the upgraded resort fee which included mai tais everyday and they were excellent; I was afraid they would be watered down. The bartender by the pool was very nice also. The tower was recently remodeled. The pool is old style (not like some of the new mega resorts), but who cares when you are on such a beautiful beach!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, excellent staff, great location... we will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: PerthSheep
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I had a lovely time at the Royal Lahaina Resort in Maui, We loved it so much that we cut our trip short in The Big Island to return to this fabulous hotel in Maui.The rooms were recently refurbished and were fresh and luxuirous but still in harmony with the Hawaiian theme. Our room which was the Deluxe Ocean View Room was overlooking the beach and we could see whales having fun ever sunset. It wa spectacular. All the staff were really friendly and helpful and the resort had daily activities on to keep us occupied. The famous Luau was in the hotel as well so we did not need to travel far. It was such an amazing place and I would highly recommend it to anyone. It was far enough from the rest of the other hotels on the beach but close enough to walk from one hotel to another to Whalers Beach where the shopping centre is. Grace, March 2009, Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Towers not the COTTAGES”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed036
Reviews.Content: Please take my advice and stay in the Towers they are wonderful and recently renovated. They cottages are in dire need of repairs and maintaince. I found ants each and everyday everywhere....................... on the carpets, in the closet , on the night table.in the bathroom etc. It as disgusting. Our neighboors were so loud as each cottage has a door in between each other and you can hear your neighbor as clear as day. I think perhaps for the price they should spend some cash and renovate the COTTAGES. I was so happy when we moved to the Towers and wished we had orginally booked these instead.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star quality and service for 3 star price”
Reviews.Author: LadyKMoreno
Reviews.Content: The locations is the best! The rooms very clean, and quite. This hotel was recently renovated and is fantastic. The Royal Lahaina is right on the best beach in Maui. Will return again & again.
