Reviews.Title: “A bit far from the beach walk, but just as far off their prices.”
Reviews.Author: ak2outside
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina as a "wild card" draw from Priceline. We were looking for a 3 1/2 star hotel and Priceline bait-and-switched us to the 3 star Royal Lahaina. At first I was immensely ticked, but after staying there for a night, I was more accepting. You have to walk out the Royal Lahaina's property, then by the clubhouse of the Maui Eldorado Resort, then through the walkway of the North Course golf, then through the property of the Sheraton Maui to get to the Kaanapali beach walk. A bit of a walk, but I enjoyed saving money and need the exercise anyway. Hotel room was acceptable. The room only had a 3/4 bath: toilet, sink, and standing shower; no tub. Decorated in traditional Hawaiian fare and kept clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaMan2006
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just north of the Kaanapali beach walk. Hotel grounds are nice, the pool area a little crowded, rooms were clean/new, staff some of the friendliest in Hawaii. Overall this hotel is a good choice if you get a good price. The best location in the Kaanapali area is along the beach walk in the Whaler vicinity. If you can save money and don't mind the extra 5-10 min walk then this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Hawaii....(signed) the Cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: macraw4d13
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around midnight totally exhausted especially after having difficulty finding the location. Check-in was quick but we were reminded that we had booked thru a vendor (which I didn't remember). The bellboy drove us via the golf cart to our cottage which was Cottage R way in the back. He had barely left, the door wasn't even shut and the first big 2 inch cockroach greeted us! Welcome to Hawaii! I stepped on it and left it there for proof. I needed to use the bathroom and found another cockroach. The room was very musty smelling. I called the front desk requesting to be moved to another room. No apology at all but were told all rooms were filled. Now do you really believe that? I don't and were quite surprised they didn't offer us an upgrade to the towers or somewhere else! We were exhausted so stayed (without choice) but the AC kept disturbing our sleep going on and off all night. Early the next morning the waterpipes in the upstairs unit began to howl. This happened all the time when they were used and were so loud, especially at 11 p.m. and 4:00 a.m. We had no idea what the layout was and wandered onto an adjoining property the next morning....only to run into friends from our hometown who were staying at Royal Lahaina. They advised us to really make a big deal about the bugs. We went back to our cottage and the maid was just arriving. I showed her the bugs and she said it was very common due to the gardens. She offered to spray - we didn't want spray at this point. The gardens are minimal - it is a golf course and a few plants. I told her about calling the front desk the night before and she, too, said they were full. I still don't believe it at all! She was very nice but I asked her if this was just the way it was going to be? She assured me "Yes, it would be and did apologize.". Hmmmm. We found another cockroach in the shower that morning as well. The musty smell never left. The linens were very clean and the maid good but the bed was hard. We did like the location, however, as we only used this place to sleep and left for the day. The room is dark unless you have the drapes open to the lanai. Unfortunately, no one told us about the restaurants at the resort, etc. or we would have tried eating there instead of waiting forever at the nearby Basil Tomato place. In fact, we did not use any of their facilities which is unfortunate. We saw a trolley once, but again, no information was given to us in regards to times, etc. so we skipped that as well. After reading other reviews, I don't think the cottages are at the top of their list at all. It is too bad as they are unique and private and easy location to the rental car. We didn't care about the view so much but do think for the price it should be in working order with the doors fully able to open as well as the drawers not falling apart and hopefully no bugs. We do not like to deal with a lot of people and they are rather private (except for the noise from upstairs) and therefore bypass the hotel hassle, elevators, etc. We did not complain again since the only other bug was one on the bathroom light and then it disappeared. Upon checkout, the gal asked about our stay. I told her about the musty smell and the cockroaches. She shook her head yes and looked down, but no apology. I thought she must not care either! To my surprise, she waived the $10 per night parking fee due to the condition of the room which was appreciated, but the hotel rate should have been amended as well. Maybe I should have asked? Anyways, we will not stay there again. Instead of spending millions on the tower, they need to apply some $$ for maintenance of the cottages. Like I said, they are unique and private. Just watch out for the bugs!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: chansey83
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had an amazing time staying at the Royal Lahaina Resort. We couldn't have stayed anywhere better. The beach is only at the back of the resort and there is absolutely no crowd and the water was crystal clear. Our room was spacious and looked almost brand new. The bed was soooo comfortable. The decor is perfect. We had a problem with our check-out charge but the friendly and understanding manager fixed the issue in no time. The customer service was superb! The only regret we have is not spending enough time by the pool and at the beach. We can't wait to stay at Royal Lahaina again.

Reviews.Title: “More Than We Hoped For!!”
Reviews.Author: MOrtimer8
Reviews.Content: Royal Lahaina was everything we hoped for. I would highly recommend it to anyone going to Maui. Karen at Pleasant Holidays in the lobby was territic at booking the trips we wanted. Pearl Harbor and the U.S.S.Missouri were definitely must-Sees as was the whale watch and the road to Hana trip. The Luau was memorable and a great evening. The town of Lahaina is great also with places like Bubba Gump for lunch. We did not rent a car but the free trolley along with the $1.00 bus got us where we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Royal Lahaina! Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: BigWaveGoldenAle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a great week at the Royal Lahaina, and enjoyed every minute of it for a few reasons. First, the beach location is absolutely perfect. Lots of soft sand, great water with sandy bottom, room to spread out, no crowds. Secondly, the rooms are really nicely appointed, very clean and very comfortable. Finally, the location in relation to other services and points of interest is also great, with Whaler's Village and some convenience stores not too far away. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to spend some time on Maui, looking for nice accomodations (we stayed in a partial ocean view room), not necessarily stuck on value added services within the hotel (no spa, no business center, minimal dining and bar options, no kids club). Most importantly, it is a very solid value. Now - in regards to some comments I read about a dated lobby & elevators, and chipped concrete around the pool... simply put, if that's what you feel will make or break your vacation, my only recommendation is to book a room at the Westin or some other 5-star hotel - but bring your Visa because it will easily cost you twice as much.

Reviews.Title: “Love Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: ajr18f
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina for 3 nights during our honeymoon & wish we should have stayed here longer (we split our time between Maui & Oahu). We got the Royal Lahaina thru priceline.com and at first we were nervous about reading all of the reviews (esp about the cottages) but were very pleased. The rooms are very modern, very comfy beds & great location. At most there was 10-20 people on the beach and between the 2 pools we never felt it was crowded. The breakfast buffet was also good. We got upgraded to a partial ocean view room upon checkin and also rec'd a bottle of champagne since we were on our honeymoon. The staff is very helpful, they have a great little shop on site for little things. It's about a 10-15 min drive to downtown Lahina. I would surely recommend the Royal Lahina again & if we ever make our way back to hawaii, we will for sure stay there.

Reviews.Title: “If you do not want to spend a fortune this is the place!”
Reviews.Author: kbhPella_IA
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to Maui, the first time we stayed at Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotel. The Royal Lahaina is a much nicer hotel but the service is not as good. The Royal Lahaina has been recently renovated, make sure you request a renovated room; they are pretty nice, nothing too special but comfortable and clean. We usually travel to the Caribbean instead of Hawaii because of the price of everything. I had almost forgotten how expensive it is in Maui! We were happy to see there was a refrigerator in our room because we like to go to the Safeway in Lahaina and get cereal and milk so we do not have to pay $20 each for the hotel breakfast buffet. After we did our shopping we realized it is a mini-bar and does not keep everything very cool, we ended up having to get a cooler but it was not a big deal. The only real complaint I have about the room was that there is not enough light in the bathroom to put make up on. We had considered staying at the Westin or Sheraton, we did visit those locations, they were nice but I am not sure it would have been worth more money to be there. I would NOT recommend eating at the restaurants on the hotel property, very expensive for what you get. If you are going to go out go to the Plantation for breakfast AWESOME (worth the price!). If you want a nice supper find a place in Lahaina, we like KOBE. We attended the Luau as we had our three year old daughter with us and knew she would want to see it. The show is okay, no better than any other luau I have ever seen, the food is AWEFUL! Also, they say drinks are included, that is only four options, not any drink you want, all of the other drinks are $12 each. If you decide to go make sure you book it with the Expedia office, we booked ours through the hotel and it was $74 each, from the Expedia desk you can get $64 each. We also went to the Kaâ€™anapali Beach Hotelâ€™s magic show, we went the first time we were in Maui. I remembered it being better than it was this time but maybe I had had more to drink that time ï�Š. The beach was very nice! We love Kaâ€™anapali beach! It is nice being at a hotel that is right on the beach. Overall the location was not perfect, quite a walk to the Whalers Village. Overall if we are going to Maui again I would stay at the Royal Lahaina, it was not the nicest place I have ever stayed but the coffee shop has awesome guava sherbet!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, would stay again. Mediocre food however”
Reviews.Author: calicocatcallie
Reviews.Content: Overall I was very happy with this hotel. The accomodations were great. We had a room with two double beds, the partial ocean view. It was right on Kaanapali beach which is a great beach. It has two pools as well, although one might be for the people staying at the condos. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were disappointed in the hotel restaurant though. The menu is not vegetarian friendly and what I did get was so-so. Not bad but not worth the price. I would say the Mai Tai's are so-so too. We went to the Royal Lahaina luau which was a lot of fun. The guy at the Expedia center at the hotel (who was also very friendly and helpful) got us a discount. Again the food at the luau was mediocre and not vegetarian friendly (although I get the idea that most luaus do not accomodate vegetarians that well). But the show at the luau was fun to watch

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: karenodie1
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 got flooded out our trip to Hana and so had to find quick accomodations during the Christmas holidays. Not fun. We finally got a room via a Hawaiian hotel internet service at the Royal Lahaina complex. Since we had just made a reservation though another company and drove immediately to the hotel, it took the folks at Royal Lahaina awhile to find the reservation and get us our room. No problem, we realized there would be a delay, and we were just grateful that we had a bed for the night. Besides they had a lovely water cooler with fresh pineapple inside. When our room was tracked down, we rode over with the valet Josh to our cottege room and when Josh unlocked the door it was obviously occupied and full of luggage. Josh was mortified and got on the radio immediately to let the front desk know. We went back to the front desk, and they quickly arranged a room at the towers. Before we had turned around to go to that room, they staff realized that that room was occupied too. Morgan, the ? evening manager, stepped in and gave us an oceanfront one-bedroom suite that he whispered in my ear went for $900 a night. We rode the elevator to it and it was gorgeous. The kids really enjoyed a room to themselves and listening to the surf all night was great. The staff, including Morgan and Nika went out of their way to make things right and it was a great reflection on their hotel and the aloha spirit.

Reviews.Title: “Best value at a great location!!”
Reviews.Author: elmiller291l
Reviews.Content: I won a trip for two to Hawaii at a Detriot Pistons game last season, and I picked this resort for my stay based on the reviews on this site. My wife and I got there on New Year's Eve and left 10 days later, we had the best vacation that we have ever had in our entire lives. When we got to there the staff at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. Our room was great, big flat screen TV's, the bed's were like sleeping on clouds, and the furniture in the rooms gave you a home-made feel. The royal ocean terrace restaurant/bar had great seafood/sushi. I recommend the ahi poke! We spent a lot of time at the barefoot bar watching whales breach and spout all day, enjoying some local beverages. The bartenders were awesome, Richard & Bill - thanks guys! They told us everything we needed to know about the area and what was fun to do and where to go. We spent a lot of time by the pools and on the beach. They have 3 pools, 2 by the resort and one up by the tennis court. Who needs a hot tub when it is 80 degrees outside? The pools aren't the greatest, but they serve their purpose. Brian from the activites center told us about the two great snorkle spots that were a 5 min walk up or down the beach. We rented gear from him and saw all kinds of sea turtles, tropical fish, and great coral. Renting a cabana for a day is a great idea, facing the ocean, and working on that tan. The Ka'anapali trolley is a great free way to get to whaler's village, and from there you can take the maui bus for $1 to get to Lahaina. We didn't rent a car and this was the best thing because the trolley runs all day and night and you can get to an from some fun spots with out having to worry about paying $10 a day for parking at the resort. Harold is the day driver and a real nice guy. We were there at the end of the holiday rush so we got to see the place empty out after the first weekend of the year. The whole first week of January we practically had the whole place to ourselves. The beach is great and the water was warmer than the pools. We went to the luau on a Wednesday, they perform this luau everyday of the week, so the dancers really knew the routine. They roasted a pig in the old Hawaiian fashion which was neat. The buffet and open bar were good, plenty of tasty dishes to try, and the bartenders have perfected the Mai Tai. A good suggestion is to pay the extra $15 per person to go to Don the Beachcomber at 4pm, you get VIP seating right up front and an extra 90 min of open bar. This bar is only open for the couple of hours before the luau. It is like a time warp because you can tell that place was built in the late 60's and hasn't been updated since. It has real character, and i wish that they would keep it open all the time, or do some updating to it. I loved that place, even though i only got to hang out there once. Our overall opinion about the place was great, going to Hawaii in general is really expensive, so why not save a bit of $$ and stay at a place that has a great location, even though it might not be as new as the other places. It is right on the beach, and there is never a bad day in paradise. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience and cannot wait to return”
Reviews.Author: susy10
Reviews.Content: I read some of these negative reviews and just shake my head..the Royal Lahaina is a beautiful resort and I guess some people just have lofty expectations that I hope they succeed in finding it in la la perfecto land:) The staff at the Lahaina are very pleasant and accomodating, the restaurant has a lovely view of the ocean and an open airy atmosphere that is really nice..the food is very good and I loved the ease at getting around the Lahaina area..driving is very simplified getting around as everything you need is close by. A 10 minute drive takes you to Front street which is a great shopping area with restaurants and the marina that you can select excursions from..we went on a 2 hour whale watching tour and saw 7 whales..it was an incredible experience! Ladies you must check out the beautiful shopping experience to be had at Serendipty Maui on Front Street, extremely beautiful unique clothing and accessories! On the grounds of the Royal Lahaina there is an italian restaurant that has excellent food and service, it overlooks the golf course. There is also the Kai Nani Gallery steps away from the lobby of the hotel that has the most amazing jewellery at great prices..I was in that store every day and cant wait to go back for more! I wish other areas had such respect for their surroundings like I witnessed in Maui..it is the cleanest area..not a strewn peice of garbage to be seen..the beaches were so clean and beautiful and the ocean water was divine and so hard to stay out of! We stayed at an ocean front cottage and I would highly recommend them..immaculate groomed grounds, excellent room service and literally steps away from the beach. Each cottage has an outside table and chair set/loungers and it was so relaxing and nice..I enjoyed it much better than staying in a hotel room. The ocean front cottages are A through F..others are set back on the grounds..so if you want to be close to the beach be sure to request and ocean front cottage..they were cosy and quiet and the beds were very comfy..I so miss the warm breeze that filled the room through the open shutters..the smell of the beautiful warm air and flowers was intoxicating..beautiful flowers and plants that are so plush..I love this area of the beach as it was never cluttered with people..I would also suggest getting a car as it is so easy to get around Lahaina etc and there is much to see and do..Whalers village is a 5 min drive away from the hotel and has great restaurants, upscale stores and many other shops that sell really interesting things..I loved my time there and would definitely stay at the Royal Lahaina again..it is a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Verry nice hotel, note they now charge $9.95 a day for internet”
Reviews.Author: Gloabtrotter
Reviews.Content: The rooms and service at the Royal Lahaina are immaculate. We arrived at the Royal Lahaina after travelling about 16 hours, and the guy at the guardhouse gate greeted us with a very welcoming 'you are home now, Aloha' greeting which was a very nice touch. This guy in fact always welcomed you 'home' when returning to the hotel. All of the other staff was very welcoming and hospitable as well! We spent 6 nights here, but only a day or 2 at the resort itself, as we spent a day driving to Hana, a day up Haleakala, one day surfing etc. The resort is sooo lovely that I would almost like to return and just stay there for a few days without leaving the grounds. Great beach with wonderful snorkling about 5 minutes walk north from the hotel's beachfront. Brian, the super friendly guy at the pool activities kiosk told me that more fish and turtles can be seen at Black Rock (about 15 minutes walk from the Royal Lahaina - somewhat of a circuitous walk as you have to go through the grounds of the Sheraton Maui to get to that side of Kaanapali beach), but I'd say there's just about as many fish on the north side of the beach if you dont want to meander over to Black Rock. Which brings me to my only small tiny misgiving about the hotel. At the time I booked, I called the hotel to ask if internet access was included in the room rate, to which I was told 'Yes, it was'. When I arrived, I learnt that just a couple days prior to my arrival, the hotel started using a service provided by Skywave, which gives you something like free 60 mins every 48 hours, after which there is a 9.95 per day charge. The hotel manager on duty very kindly and expediently resolved this issue for me by giving me promo codes to use during my stay, so that I didnt have to charge my credit card. He explained they were doing this for guests who were told there was no charge for internet access when they booked, since they had only just started charging. It was very good indeed that the hotel manager did this for me, but it is one small thing that would make me think twice about booking there again now knowing I'd be charged for internet access in the future. (Admittedly this may not affect a lot of people, but only tech geeks like me who travel with VoiP phones and need internet access for just about any and everything they do - it is handy to consult websites whilst youre on holiday on where the nearest drugstore is or to get directions from mapquest etc:) All in all though, this is a stupendous hotel, and I'd stay there again if they waive the internet charges for me, or compensate my internet charges through a reduction in room rates:)

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed week on Maui at a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathrin_73
Reviews.Content: After 5 nights Waikiki Beach we arrived for a relaxing week on Maui, December 7-14. In general terms it was nice and I do recommend the hotel. It was a great location and we liked the beach, which was less crowded than on the other side of Black Rock. Less than 5 miles driving distance you are in Lahaina. Kaanapali Resort has a free shuttle from all hotels to Whalers Village, a shopping area with restaurants, where I highly recommend Hula Grill - good lunch and dinner ocean front. The room was nice and clean. We have been on the 10th floor and have had a good view to the ocean and the island of Lanai. We have had every day breakfast a la carte at the restaurant and I highly recommend waffle with strawberry, whipped cream, macadamia nut and delicious coconut syrup - THE BEST you can imagine. Staff was okay, but nothing outstanding. The "Irish" waitress at the restaurant and our bellman were the best we have got in touch with. At the front desk I felt always like disturbing their talk. I always have got the answers to my question, but no much more - I definitely missed the Aloha spirit here. When we arrived we checked in with two rooms, which were assigned right next to each other, what was nice. I asked the lady to put my name with the king bed and my parents room with the double bed, but she just said: you just choose as you wish when you get to the rooms. And so it was exactly the opposite way and I always had to sign my bill with the room number of my parents... I do not know if it would have been so difficult to make it right from the beginning... They also did not make a note of my mothers name and when she got a message on her birthday, they did not know if we have somebody with her name in our party. Since the reservation of our rooms they have had all 3 names... Well, she received her message at the end. They definitely do not tell you anything about the package you can purchase for $16 a day, which includes 2 Mai Tai's, parking and local calls. Thanks to the reviews of Tripadvisor I knew about it and asked directly for. We have had dinner several times at the restaurant and it is good food they serve. Also here a small negative touch: at 8:30 pm latest they start taking table clothes away at the tables next to you, which are not occupied and to equip them for breakfast. You start to feel a little bit pushed, but well... The bar is open until 10 pm, not longer... For breakfast we have had often the same and had to realize even if you order the same, you do not always get the same. A pastry basket came one day with butter and jelly, another day without... Our waffle came twice with coconut syrup, one day without... You get everything after you ask for, but some thinks could just be a little bit less complicate. I am not a picky person, but at a 4 star hotel I expect a certain level of service, but they still have a lot of opportunity here and after being Assistant Manager at a hotel with 810 rooms in the Caribbean I know what I am talking about. Staff could be much more friendly and rather make you feel home than being disturbing sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: juniormyrick
Reviews.Content: Remodeled in great taste. Rooms are cozy, Staff was, "overly friendly" Kind of annoying really, But if thats all there is to complain about....I would return for sure!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: CCDToronto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay, needs so renovations specially in the lobby and pool area. Overall the rooms are nice and the staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Tower review”
Reviews.Author: aziza5
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline by offering a price, and received this hotel for one night. Had never been on this side of Black Rock before, but the beach was pretty, sandy, and fairly empty. We were in the Tower, recently remodeled per the staff, and were impressed with the quality of the furnishings and bathroom. No bathtub, but the glass and tile enclosed shower was cool looking. Nice TV, refrigerator, and wireless internet. The view was the greatest, as we saw a low roof with satellite dishes on it. 2 of my kids and I had breakfast in the restaurant, but it was not outstanding. Staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I am in Love”
Reviews.Author: MauiDan2009
Reviews.Content: I had read a few bad reviews before going, none of which, I found true upon arrivial. There was some construction at the time, but It didnt bother me at all. The staff were excellant, the food at their resturant was tasty. I enjoyed not even having to leave the grounds, if I didnt need to... everything was there. I did the Laua, which was average, but the girls were stunning. THe beach is right there... along with black rock, which is about a 10 minute walk, if you like to snorkel. The bar service was excellant and the staff friendly. My Dad and I got a free Snuba leason right there in the pool. I plan to get back with my wife in March 2009. I will always stay at the Royal Lahaina, when I am in Maui

Reviews.Title: “Old and Run-down”
Reviews.Author: Bluesky29
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina was not so royal...we arrived to an old and run-down property (don't even go near the bathrooms around the property). The rennovated rooms were slightly better than the rest of the property, but the black mold in the shower of our first room quickly runined that. The "Royal Ocean Terrace" restaurant soon became know to "ROT" to us, after stale food and slow service marred our stay. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone, no matter what the price. The only bright spot of the stay was the luau, which despite the good entertainment, had horrid food.

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: gil83
Reviews.Content: we slept at the room with the ocean view, fully renovated with a king size bed, flat screen tv. in front of the hotel a great, beautiful beach (1 minute walk). there is also a pool but with this kind of beach you wouldn't even look at it. the hotel had this relaxed atmosphere and the staff was very nice and welcoming. the only thing is that the price doesn't include breakfast but it was a lot lower than all the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort”
Reviews.Author: OatmealCeiling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort for a total of 6 nights and we loved it. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly throughout our stay. We had a deluxe oceanview room for half of our stay and a suite for the other half. Both rooms were spacious, tastefully decorated, and had beautiful views. The building is somewhat old but with the renovations, location, and great service, this was a fantastic experience and value, especially considering the rates at hotels nearby. We would definitely stay at the Royal Lahaina again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous! Totally renovated Tower Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MauiKitty
Reviews.Content: Our only experience with this resort was in 2000 when we attended the luau here. We wanted the Kaanapali resort experience without the high cost. We paid 219/night. After having spent 10 days in Kihei at a condo, 2 nights in Hana in a cottage, we wanted to end our vacation resort style. When we arrived, we were greeted by an attendant to check us in, a bellman to lug ALL our stuff to our room and were given cool wet towels. The attendant told us he was upgrading us to a partial ocean view from the terrace view we had booked, we didn't even have to ask. The lobby area, to the lounge, to the hallways to the rooms are all renovated. The only area left under construction to be renovated were the lobby restrooms. We got to our room, 4010 and just gasped. SO pretty, beautiful wood, HUGE king size bed, the headboard took up the entire wall, HUGE wood desk, flat screen HDTV, nice bathroom and vanity, safe, mini fridge and the view! Very nice!!! Well worth the $$. They have a trolley that comes by about once an hour to take you to Whaler's Village, or wherever you want. We had just missed it, so the bellman took us in the golfcart on the golf path to the Sheraton and we walked to Whaler's Village from there to have dinner at Hula Grill. The next day after beach time and pool time, we cleaned up and went down to the lounge and chatted with Ricky who became our favorite bartender. He's a lot of fun and we tipped him well. The manager we spoke to quite a few times and he is very nice, the service at this resort is outstanding! We stayed in that night and had appetizers and dinner there. Very good food! The last day our flight out wasn't until 10:20PM. We called the front desk and they let us have the room until 6PM for 100.00. Worth it! That gave us almost another full day. We went to Napili Bay to do some snorkeling (awesome) and then back to the resort pool area. We chatted with the man at the activities desk and he let us have one of the cabanas for no charge since it was our last day. I can't say enough about this place. It doesn't have the big fancy pool scene like some of the other resorts, but that is not a selling point to us. We WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Maui is so beautiful - you really don't spend much time in the room.”
Reviews.Author: Decompress
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small, but updated and well decorated. We stayed in an partial ocean view room. The balconies can be awkward when your neighbors go outside to enjoy the view at the same time. The beach in this section of Maui is great for beginner snorkeling. The waters are exceptionally calm in the morning. The hotel restaurant leaves quite a deal to be desired - as does the on-site luau. I would stay at this hotel again simply for the quiet, beautiful beach. Further north the waters become too rough and remote. Then further south there are too many people. I travel for business weekly - I travel for pleasure at least twice a year. I was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great value, beautiful rooms in tower”
Reviews.Author: supernova87a
Reviews.Content: We had booked this room via Priceline for a great deal of $100/night in the October season, and were nicely surprised. The resort is very pleasant and comfortable, and the main thing is that the room we received in the tower was excellently furnished, with modern renovated decor, bathroom, and beds. I had been a little apprehensive about receiving this hotel via Priceline because of prior reviews about the cottages being a little outdated and in mediocre condition, but it certainly does not apply to the tower rooms -- they are beautiful. And I verified beforehand by calling the hotel that our Priceline room would be in the tower. There was free wireless internet access, a pretty good deal on early dinner ($25/person, which we unfortunately didn't get to try), and a very nice beach area. The only flaws were -- 1) that we smacked a cockroach in the bathroom one of the nights, but quickly disposed and forgot about it. 2) Parking is $10/day, I believe, which is basically mandatory (kind of like a resort fee) because there is no other convenient parking around there. 3) parts of the hotel could use, or are actively being renovated, such as the lobby (being fixed up) or elevators (which look a little outdated). Other than that, we enjoyed our stay very much, and were pleased with the deal we got!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: djsroufe
Reviews.Content: Very nice. Booked through Priceline and got a great deal. Right on the beach and the room was clean, comfy and tastefully decorated. Snorkeling at Black Rock down the beach was incredible with several big turtles, eagle rays and lots of colorful fish. I didn't like paying $10 a day to self-park, but that's getting to be the norm in a lot of places.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon while staying at the RL!!!”
Reviews.Author: zegers719
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the RL for our honeymoon from Sept 2nd-Sept 10th. I can't say enough about this hotel! It is very authentic in the Hawaiian culture. Everyone was very friendly upon our arrival at the RL. We stayed 2 nights in the Garden Cottage where we were then upgraded to an Ocean View (Rm 4012). Our room was AMAZING!!! The decor had a nice Hawaiian touch! The best part of the room was having the opportunity of sleeping with your patio door open at nice listening to the ocean. The pools are on the smaller side, but who needs the pool when your just steps away from the ocean!? Don the BeachCombers was a great litle hangout on the property of the RL. Richard the bartender was a RIOT!!!! We found our way down there every night for our Free Mi Tais that we had included with our package. Everyone at the RL was very helpful and informational. We had a hard time leaving the RL, but we will definitely be back!!!:-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Lahaina Resort”
Reviews.Author: jbc090
Reviews.Content: We stayed at an ocean front cottage in the Royal Lahaina Resort just steps to Kaanapali Beach one of the most beautiful beaches in Maui. The staff and manager (Kory) were wonderful and accommodating would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. The resort is set away from other hotels and is very private but still within walking distance of main shopping centers (Whaler Village) and great restaurants (Basil Tomatoe). We rented a car but there is a shuttle bus from the resort to Front Street down town Lahanina and also to Whalers Village. We arranged to go to Pearl Harbor through Pleasant Holidays located in the front Lobby of the hotel and would recommend this tour the kids loved it and was well worth going to. This was one of the best holidays and if you are lucky enough to be able to go to Maui try out this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms - very comfortable beds. Close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: boomernation
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights. Our room was recently renovated. Had a wonderful patio with garden, mountain, and ocean views. #4029. Loved it. Close to all other resorts - could walk miles touring other resorts. Fabulous beaches. Snorkleing couldn't be easier - just find a spot on the beach and walk into the ocean to snorkle. 2 pools. Hotel restaurant was ok. However, there were restaurants a plenty within walking distance - Basil Tomatoes Italian was good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: megamoo1979
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights here for our 5th anniversary. We stayed in one of the tower rooms. We originally booked an ocean view room and was told we'd get a room upgrade to deluxe ocean view and a bottle of champagne since it was our anniversary. When we arrived at the hotel they didn't have any deluxe ocean view rooms available. That was okay though, because the room we had was fine and the view was still beautiful! We did find a bottle of champagne in our room that night too. The hotel has a perfect location right on Kaanapali beach and close to Lahaina and Whaler's Village. There's also a great indoor/outdoor bar area where it's great to grab a drink. Bartenders very friendly. Also, eat breakfast outside at one of the tables looking towards the beach. Talk about a perfect view! The hotel grounds were very well kept and all the staff was friendly. The only complaint we had was that housekeeping was hit and miss. We didn't have any washcloths the first day. Then they would take away our water glasses and not leave clean ones, or they'd just leave the dirty ones. They never did take the dirty champagne glasses from the first night. Still, this wasn't really a big deal. Overall we're very happy we chose this place and we'll stay here again when we come back someday. Excellent price/value when compared to others in the area too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: clay1976
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina was perfect! Most of my family stayed there for my brother's wedding, which occured on the grounds of the Royal Lahaina. It's absolutely beautiful there and the staff is so friendly. The pools were fun and Kaanapali beach is within steps from the hotel. The food was excellent as well. Great breakfast buffet. The renovated rooms were awesome, the best room I've stayed in. Our "partial ocean view" had an excellent view of the ocean and beach. I don't have anything but good to say about this hotel. I only wish I could have stayed longer! Paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place”
Reviews.Author: epreston
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a garden Cottage room. It was nothing fantasy but it was so relaxing and plenty of things to do. The laua is right on the resort and that was very convent. I love this place and we would def stay there again. the staff was wonderful. Its a great family vacation and the beach is perfect for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “God must stay here”
Reviews.Author: sth1250
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort from Sept .5 - Sept.12th. Everything about this hotel was impressive from the "God's view" room ( Room 1112), to the hotel staff & the friendly wait staff, everything was well done. We met a lot of wonderful people there, and everyone was very friendly. My conversations with other guests was positive too, it was truely paradise. The pool was nice, the ocean view even better and the sunsets were right out of the movies.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: coldethyl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after being in the fabulous Las Vegas and I thought nothing would be as good, I was wrong! We had a beautiful room in the new tower section. The room was fantastic. The bed was huge! we had a great view. The staff were very helpful and we could roll out of bed on to the most perfect beach ever! The food was delicious in the restaurant and the resort was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “never want to leave maui”
Reviews.Author: LloydminsterMaui2008
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned home after spending a week @ the Royal Lahaina Resort celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. We had a deluxe room on the 10th floor that had an outstanding view of the ocean.All the staff were more than helpful courteous. One of our favorite things to do was spend the sunset hour @ the poolside lounge and listen to the guitarist/singer ( I'm sorry but I forgot his name ) and watch the hula dancer ( I believe her name is Wainani ). These 2 folks were so interested in the guests and always took time to ask people where their are from. Upon finding out the purpose of our vacation, Wainani presented my wife with a beautiful lei to bring home. The bartenders and waiters/waitresses provide excellant/ speedy service that is 2nd to none anywhere that we have travelled. We will recommend this hotel to all our friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Exceeded All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: iluvhawaii08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the last week in Maui and Oahu for our anniversary, and we couldn't have asked for a better experience at the Royal Lahaina. We were upgraded to a partial oceanview upon arrival and had a bottle of champagne waiting for us in our room. The view from our balcony was amazing! The room was very clean, the king size bed was very comfy and the staff was extremely helpful. We got a package that included breakfast and a rental car from Dollar, and with all of that the rate was still better than most of the major resorts in Kaanapali. The resort has 2 pools...we only went to the one in front of the restaurant. It always had open seats and had a very calm atmosphere. The beach was just a few feet away from the pool. It was never crowded and the water was unbeleivable. We had booked several excursions before we got to Maui, but once we arrived at the Royal Lahaina all I wanted to do was hang out there (my husband said no to that idea). While staying in Maui, we did the Ekahi Sunrise Tour of Haleakala Crater, a luau at the Feast at Lele, and a snorkel cruise to Lani'i with Safari Adventure Tours. We loved all of these and would do them again if we went back Maui. After 4 days in Maui, we headed to Honolulu to do the Pearl Harbor thing before we flew back home. We spent 2 days in Honolulu, and if I could do it over again, I would never have left Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Loved are Stay at Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: RobSand817
Reviews.Content: Our Honeymoon at RLR we LOVED IT! The rooms are clean. Our room was Ocean View and we were able to see the mountains on our left side in front was the golf course and on our right it was the BEAUTIFIL Ocean we couldn't as for more! Everyone was so friendly gave us ideas of things to do and were to eat. If you stay at the Royal Lahaina or in the Lahaina area you have to visit GAZEDO'S it's a good place to have breakfast, you have to get here early if not you will have to wait in lane for a while... My husband loved it, we went two times. We really enjoyed our time at the RLR... We are thinking of going back! R&S - Southern California

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach and View”
Reviews.Author: tatown
Reviews.Content: First of all, The drive to kanapalli is wonderful. The resort is located on a great part of the beach. The room was small but made up for it in luxury and view. The view was incredible. Very clean room and big comfortable king bed. As with most resorts there is a lot to do immediately around the hotel. Plenty of shops, dining, bars and pool areas (average priced). We found it to be less crowded than we thought. We took a lot of excursions so we found the extra $15 a day for valet was well worth it. ALWAYS rent a car in Hawaii!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed all the Details”
Reviews.Author: JimandLaurra
Reviews.Content: Not only was our room in the Tower wonderful (newly decorated and very calming), but the attention to detail was beyond our expectations. We were greeted on our first night here by a mellow singer/guitar player with a beautiful and graceful hula dancer (we later learned her name was Wainani which means beautiful fresh water.) It was so much better than the loud luau's we've been to - it was peaceful, beautiful and personal. Kirk, at the activity center took very good care of us and the restaurant manager, Ford, treated us like we were VIP's. The hotel is a peaceful spot in an area of Maui that is becoming more and more busy over the years. We highly recommend the Royal Lahaina! Jim and Laurra

Reviews.Title: “Loved Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina04
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Royal Lahaina The hotel was great I had been reading reviews for the last 4 months and I have to say some were right and some were wrong I feel its what you make of it. We were married in Maui and spent our honeymoon at the RLR and they upgraded us to an oceanview 11th floor this was the place to be I have no complaints. All I can say is I did not want to come home really had a beautiful time at the resort. B& J Detroit

Reviews.Title: “hula and yoga lessons”
Reviews.Author: alohadog
Reviews.Content: The guest relations center is excellent. Some of the activities we especially enjoyed were the yoga classes and hula lessons. Both the yoga instructor, Carmen, and the hula instructor, Wainani, were pleasant and seemed to really enjoy their classes. Wainani is an accomplished hula dancer and quite knowledgeable about the history of the hula, language, and culture. The spirit of Aloha was so nice around the pool in the evening as Wainani danced to live guitar music. We also appreciated the aloha spirit of Ford, the food and beverage manager. We highly recommend the Royal Lahaina for a true spirit of the islands.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star, but good overall”
Reviews.Author: caliwrestlingmom
Reviews.Content: The photos on the Royal Lahaina site are pretty accurate. Except they don't show the lobby because it is HORRIBLE! Not 4 star lobby. The rooms in the tower are exactly what they look like in the internet photos (I will attach photos). Be careful when booking "ocean front" and "ocean view" because "ocean view" means you can see the ocean (even if you have to lean WAY out your balcony to see it). We booked ocean view and they took us to a room that was mostly parking lot below or mostly golf course. So we asked for a better view, they said something like there was a "manager special" to upgrade for another $40 a night....we said okay and were taken to a spectacular room on the 12th floor (the top floor). After my husband tipped the bell hop $20 he came back and said "Oh there is no charge for the upgrade." I think that is a gimmick they do as I have read that on other reviews of this resort. They tell you they are "upgrading" you when in fact this is the room we asked for to begin with. So, I am not sure it is worth it to book ocean view or just get here and then wait for then to offer you and upgrade. Kind of odd. Now for the location....awesome. When you look at the photos online you see nobody on the beach and at first I thought that meant it was a lousy beach. Actually the beach is so close to my balcony I could throw a baseball into the ocean. The beach is deserted because it is a private beach pretty much. The sand is great, the water warm...really nice location. No waves if you are looking for surfing, though. Parking: we got a rental car at the airport because I don't think there is any other way to get to the hotel (it is about 20 mins drive to the resort from Kahaului (sp?) so you kinda need a car). Self park is $10 and valet is $15 so we went with valet since it would only be another $25 and we didn't want to hassle with it. Food: there is only one restaurant and it is expensive (everything is expensive on Maui...$20 per person per meal, expect). The breakfast buffet is $20 pp and so so. Just a regular breakfast buffet. My husband said the hamburger at lunch was one of the best burgers he has ever eaten and he is a hamburger expert. Whalers Village....not really a "10 minute" walk....more like 20 or 30 (I guess we walk slow) so we did that only one time and drove there the rest of the time. There is a trolley that is free that comes every 30 mins to take you from Royal Lahaina to Whalers and that is great if you don't have a car. They rarely follow the schedule though, as we saw our driver stop and pick up pedestrians and take all sorts of detours, so don't count on the trolley being on time. We ate at the Rusty Harpoon because they would put on the Dodgers for us and that was great! We also ate at the Hula Grill and that was good too. Now, after spending a ton of money on food, I asked the valet if there was somewhere good to eat that was cheap and he told us to go to Front Street. GO TO FRONT STREET!!!!!! There is a Burger King there and other cheap places to eat. It is about a 10 minute drive. Oh yeah, Whalers Village has a food court that we didn't realize, and they have fast food there...pizza hut and mcdonalds I think. So that is a cheap alternative too. Look for ABC stores. They are the best (cheapest) way to stock up on snacks and they are everywhere. They are like a mini mart so not that great of a selection. Make sure to stop at KMart or Costco when you arrive and buy cheap snorkel stuff and sodas or whatever you want for your room. The snorkel stuff and boogie boards are like $25 for the day at the activity center so it is better just to buy one. We got one at the ABC store for $5.99. It was cheap, but it worked. We drove to Hana the first day we got here. It was exactly as we expected. Make sure to get a book so you know where the secret waterfalls are. It took us 6 hours total to go there and back. Stop at "Halfway to Hana" and get a shaved ice. Big and yummy! Also they have really good banana bread and my husband said we should have bought more to bring back. We came for our 20th anniversary and got what we expected...total relaxation....no hurries....we could walk out of the elevator and be in the ocean in 2 mins and that is what we wanted. No bells and whistle at the Royal Lahaina, but we couldn't afford the other hotels for what we could get. We have stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels and this is probably about a 3.5. The room is definitely 4 star, but the lobby and the lack of amenities (2 small pools, no pool side bars for snacks or chairs for the beach). We stayed 5 days and 6 nights and that was enough. We got the best deal on Hawaiian Airlines after searching Pleasant Holidays and Expedia. So you might want to try there.

Reviews.Title: “a true destination resort”
Reviews.Author: Lynn003
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful holiday at the Royal Lahaina. Our 11th floor oceanview room gave us a great view of the ocean and gardens. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The beach was beautiful, and great for swimming and snorkeling. We ate most of our meals at the hotel, and enjoyed the nightly entertainment. Free lessons were offered in hula dancing, pilates, yoga, lei-making, etc. They were great. Wainani, the hula dance teacher and entertainer at night, made us feel very welcome and a part of Hawaii. We'll never forgtet her enthusiasm for Hawaiian history (which she included in the lessons), hula dancing and people .

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back to the Royal Lahaina!”
Reviews.Author: clw03n
Reviews.Content: This hotel emulates what Hawaii is all about! My boyfriend and I just got back, and really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The pictures I looked at before we left did not do this hotel justice! We stayed in an oceanfront room in the tower(be careful ocean front is NOT the same as ocean view-which we paid extra for), and our view was incredible!! Beautifully decorated room, comfortable bed, and quiet! Hotel restaurant was nice, and the staff was very helpful (be aware of all the "hidden" charges-i.e. internet cable, local phone calls, safe,etc). We booked a snorkel trip right from the activities desk, and it was great! We did not do the luau at this hotel, although it looked to be very crowded. Overall, a wonderful experience! We would go back in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michie2783
Reviews.Content: Hotel tower was great! Rooms were very nice and clean. REstaurant was good and reasonably priced. Lobby was a little out dated. Cottages were kind of dumpy, not renovated like rest of hotel. THey are tearing them down soon, but are still renting them out. Get a room in the tower if you can. Luau was no longer free, they told us 71 bucks a person. Beaches were beautiful, and the pools were small but adequate. Staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodations, fun atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Travelingduo777
Reviews.Content: We were in Maui to Get Mauied and our travel agent helped us pick out a hotel. The hotel had undergone major rennovations just prior to our stay, and most of the reviews pre-rennovation were not good so we were nervous about staying at the Royal Lahaina. The hotel ended up being beautiful. We were upgraded to an ocean view room, although it seemed like we would probably be able to see the ocean from any room they could have given us. The room overlooked the luau grounds so we could see and hear the festivities from our balcony. The staff was always friendly. The property has 2 pools, but we never did use them because we were too busy exploring the island. The beach is OK...but a little narrow. I was disappointed that there was no boardwalk to walk along the length of the beach, there was also zero lighting on the beach so it felt unsafe at night. There is great snorkeling to the west of the property-about a 5 minute walk. The breakfast buffet is good, but pretty expensive. The biggest complaint of the whole experience was the parking. You had a pay $10 a day to park and they squeeze as many parking spots as they can into the lot. Bigger people probably wouldn't even be able to get out of the vehicle the spots were so tight. Everyone got door dings. If you came back to the hotel late at night you would have to park a long ways away because of all the luau guests. Overall this hotel gets a big thumbs up! Don't forget to bring cash for the bellmen that INSIST on bringing your luggage up to your room.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Lahaina Our Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: KenandNormaJean
Reviews.Content: It's hard to put into words the Aloha spirit that the Royal Lahaina has, from your first greeting of welcome home to we look forward to your return. We decided to give R L a try last year we were a little apprehensive until we saw our room, from the custom made furniture to the beautiful ocean view everything was simply Hawaii. We fell in love with the R L , it is a laid back Hotel not over crowded, the beach is the best ,you can actually relax and enjoy your surroundings. The staff has a excellent Aloha spirt and very accomadating. We had one of the guard shack personell check us in with a big smile and with the greeting of welcome home. Hawaii is our favorite place to vacation this was our 7th trip and have already booked our trip for next year, but it's the hospitality of Hotels like this one that make you want to come back to home year after year. God Bless and Aloha until we meet again

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty at the Royal Lahaina Resort”
Reviews.Author: strovalta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RL on june 8 -15. We arrived very late from a long flight from texas (and after encountering a very rude rental car clerk). The Bellman, Steve greeted us and the smiling checkin clerk made us feel better immediately! We had a oceanview room and found it to be excellent. The beds were comfty and the room was spotless. The remodeling was well designed with beautiful wood beds , shutters, large LCD tv, frig, safe and large shower. I thought the size of the room was large for the money and each day it was cleaned very well. My daughter enjoyed the shampoos and soaps (coconut )that were left each day! The view of the ocean was priceless! The beach is not crowded and the snorkeling was great . The walk to whalers village is so relaxing and there is a small mall. "the fairway" with great shave ice and CJ's deli. the grounds were beautiful also with lots of beautiful flowers, trees, birds and pools. We enjoyed the hotel luau on the grounds , good drinks and food. It was a perfect week at the RL, the entire staff was always friendly and helpful. Each time we returned to the parking lot, the clerk always said "welcome Home" which really was a nice touch and he really meant it! They made us feel like royalty because they treated us GREAT! The week ended with a outside viewing of the movie "Enchanted" . (they even supplied the popcorn) under the stars listening to the ocean and movie. It truely was an enchanted week at the RL. We hope to return again one day!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LMicheleS
Reviews.Content: Me and two others had reserved a garden cottage and was disappointed when we arrived. The hotel had done a typical 'hotel thing' and overbooked the cottages. They offered us 'upgraded tower rooms with an ocean view'. We decided to take this. Other than the room being merely a PARTIAL ocean view, it was wonderful! The room and grounds were immaculate and the staff was very helpful. I also liked the fact that the hotel had their own beach - not too crowded at all. My only criticism I have...constructive really - not a complaint...is that there is a design flaw in their sink mirror area. It's the lighting and the fact that most of the mirrors are sunk too deep away from you and the light to look closely at your face. (which may be a good thing after a night of Maitai's!) Males had trouble seeing close enough for a good shave, and I couldn't see well enough to apply makeup very well. One of those magnified mirrors would help that without ruining the decor much. Just a suggestion!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, location, room, service”
Reviews.Author: deacondog
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina was outstanding in every respect. The desk manager greeted us by name when we pulled up. They took us directly to our room overlooking the beach (note: the higher floors are by far the best views). The room was immaculate. It had been remodeled with beautiful dark woods, louvered balcony doors and bathroom/room divider, matching furniture, great linens, etc. The balcony overlooked the beach looking north and west with a wonderful view. Even with a nightly luau nearby, the room itself was remarkably quiet and could be kept very dark for late sleepers. We found a gift of champagne in the refrigerator to welcome us for our honeymoon. The restaurant overlooks the pool and beach, thus the location was great. The breakfast buffet was always very tasty (beware lest birds--inside and out--eat from your plate if you step away from the table). Dinner was also very good. Good snorkeling just a few hundred yards down the beach (either direction). We loved our stay at the Royal Lahaina and would recommend it highly. A WORD OF ADVICE: avoid buying ANYTHING from the poolside activities desk as they charge $15/day for one set of snorkel equipment--when you can get it for $1.50 nearby--and their people will try their best to sell you ridiculously expensive sunglasses, snorkel trips, sunscreen, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: DaisyMontana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina from June 11 to June 18th. We had a wonderful time celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. We were upgraded to an ocean view room, which was beautiful! The atmosphere at this resort is very quite and calming. We enjoyed eating at the restaurant at the resort. The pancakes with macadamia nuts and coconut syrup was wonderful. The Royal Lahaina is on a beautiful beach and is close to the Whalers Village and the town of Lahaina. We used the free trolley a number of times to get to the Whalers Village. The Whalers Village has great shopping and restaurants. We booked our tours from Pleasant Holidays which is right at the Royal Lahaina. Everything about the Royal Lahaina was fantastic. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. We would return to this beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: haoleboy777
Reviews.Content: We were really happy with this hotel. The lobby isn't much, and overall things look a little old, but the room was really nice. LCD TV, teak wood furnishings, Hawaiian touches. The rooms had been redone recently for sure. We were on the top floor, in the back of the hotel, and we still could see the ocean from the bed. This was a much better "partial ocean view" than I have experienced in other hotels. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. Also, if you can get your hands on an Entertainment book for Hawaii, the hotel resturant as well as other shops have coupons in there. We got our hotel on Priceline for about 160 per night, double occupancy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: steph1322
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel! Very friendly staff at check in and helping us with our bags. The bellhop even told us some great restaurants in the area. I made sure that they knew it was our honeymoon and we received the King bed, as requested, a free bottle of champagne, and an awesome oceanview (which we were a little worried about because they have so many different levels for ocean view, we chose the ocean view with the free breakfast and it was one of the best views I've ever had). We did have an issue with the balcony door not locking but we were on the 11th floor so we weren't too concerned. The breakfast buffet was one of the best that I've seen. There are so many options to choose from! The luau was good, but I have heard the the "Old Lahiana Luau" is the best one. Our only complaint is that the lady checking us in did not tell us that we had to pay $16 a day instead of $10 to get the 2 free Mai Tai's included so we got charged for 3 days worth, so just make sure you ask about it when checking in.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Ocean Front Hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Akalliecat
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 year old son, and I along with two of our friends stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort during our 4 day stay in Maui. When we arrived, we had some really friendly staff greet us and helped with all of our luggage. The people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful and our friends who had booked a room with a Garden View and were upgraded at no extra cost to a room with a partial ocean view, pretty close to our room. They have recently refurbished the guestrooms and suites in the 12 story tower and our rooms were very nice with pretty comfortable beds. They have some shops on grounds and some places to eat (as well as other shops and restaurants nearby) and they also have an Expedia.com on property and the employees there were very helpful in finding us good deals on some of the area attractions. We had never been to a Luau before and they had one right there at the Royal Lahaina, so we bought tickets and had a great time watching the show and enjoying the buffet and drinks. They have nice swimming pools and it was great to be able to just walk right out to the beach and watch the sun set. The next time we are in Maui, we will not hesitate to stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: sheluvsblu
Reviews.Content: Home Away From Home We loved the Royal Lahaina. After a long flight from the east coast and a dark, 45 minute drive from the airport we arrived at the hotel around 10pm jet-lagged. We were greeted and offered the ocean view room we booked but I mentioned that we were honeymooners and promised an upgrade. Thankfully, we were given a deluxe ocean view and what a view it was â€“ fantastic! We heard waves all day and through the night. The room is beautifully decorated and well appointed. Loved the comfortable bed! The fridge came in handy for water and snacks. We got the special with the safe and valet parking, which was very convenient. The valet guys are friendly and helpful. In fact, all of the staff was very pleasant. And we received a complimentary bottle of champagne for our honeymoon. We enjoyed the hotel grounds, including all of the beautiful vegetation. And the elevators were fine (yes, they are old but very fast). The RL felt distinct from the other hotels we visited, some of which were very elaborate and reminded me of Disney World. We actually preferred the lobbyâ€™s more natural Hawaiian ambiance. We took advantage of the trolley to Whalers Village daily and only ate at the hotel once (mistake â€“ terribly slow service and too many preying birds and gnats to enjoy). There are so many other delicious choices in Maui. Aside from the dining, however, everything else we loved including the walks along the uncrowded beachfront. The luau was also great fun and as hotel guests, we received a discount. We cannot wait to return the Royal Lahaina and we hope that it will retain its charming, quiet and relaxing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on the beach”
Reviews.Author: madamechair
Reviews.Content: This was a great deal. And we were really happy with our choice! The pros: hotel is on the beach, and a little north of the tourist center of Lahaina. We had to drive to Lahaina (which is a good thing). The rooms (in the main building -- not the cottages) were renovated in the past year or so, and the hotel is totally non-smoking. The room renovations were decent, with a modern feel, and the rooms were fresh and new. Most, if not all room shave a balcony, but be careful which side of the hotel you are on, since one view (the north view) is the top of the a restaurant and luau venue (which can be loud), plus we could hear the ac units. And the cranes in the distance at the Ritz (which was under renovation, totally obstructing the view). We changed our room for a better view which was partial ocean and partial hills which was perfect. The hotel staff was very friendly. We also had a fridge. The cons: Not many, but the bathroom was small with only a shower, and the beds were not very good -- mushy and nonsupporting. Also, I wouldn't bother with any of the food options, except for maybe a drink at sunset. The food is overpriced and not great. Unlike the rooms, the rest of the hotel is really NOT renovated and rather stuck in a time warp. With the exception of the rooms, the rest of the facility is a little on the dingy side. But really the rooms and the beach were great!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: CharlesClark
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nights at Royal Lahina and we had a great stay. The beach was perfect for my 5 year old and we enjoyed the pools as well. We also really enjoyed the Lua held on property. We were planning a return stay the second day there. Having on onsite combination coffee house/ice cream parlor worked out for all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: omigks
Reviews.Content: I think the greeting at reception should have given us a clue. After stating to the clerk that we had a reservation...one of the first comments was "what time will you be checking out?" We were given one of the cottage rooms which had not been updated since the early 1980's. The bathrooms were in poor condition Mold in the tiles and cabinet doors in very poor condition) and the room smelled because of the old and stained carpet. The positive about the resort was the location and the ability to walk the beach and to the shopping areas through a picturesque path that runs along the outer edge of the golf course. This was the only negative experience we had during our stay in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it All!”
Reviews.Author: Jdub31807
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend just got back from our first stay in Maui. To put it simply, we were not disappointed! Royal Lahaina Resort was great. The hotel itself and the grounds were perfectly maintained. True, the cottages are a little older, but they do not take away from the overall authentic hawaiian look and feel. Not to mention, they are all to be replaced soon. the rooms in the tower are very nice. clean, modern, and comfortable. big bed and flat panel tv! woo hoo! I had a partial ocean view room from the 12th floor, and the view from the balcony was superb. We had mountains on our left. We had the tropical gardens and golf course straight ahead. And we had the beautiful beach to our right (not to mention more mountains in the background). check out some of my pictures, and im going to try to include a video tour from my room. the staff was so helpful! i was very impressed by their willingness to provide. the activities center in the lobby also exceeded expectations. very very helpful and knowledgeable. true, the pools arent great. but i didnt go to maui for water slides. their beachfront is awesome. the resort has pretty good food as well. the breakfast buffet is great. a very good selection of food. a little pricey at $20 per person. the royal ocean terrace is the resturant at RLR, and it was good as well. not too expensive either. and for dessert they have the royal scoop; an ice cream parlor. all good stuff. when its all said and done, i would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. and if i ever get a chance to go back to maui, this is where i will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha Spirit”
Reviews.Author: ValleyGirl08
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina in February 2008, during whale season. We had an awesome time. I had stayed here in 2002 and returned again. We were greated with warm cookies and smiles. The check-in was swift although the staff wasn't ready, but it allowed us time to walk the grounds, see the beautiful main pool, and have lunch. When we got our room it was just beautiful. This hotel doesn't have all of the perks as some of the large chain hotels, but that is what we liked about our hotel. We got to know the staff and were taken care of. The conceirge desk was always helpful in providing information about the island and letting us borrow a cd for our personal tour of Hana. Being in a smaller hotel, we were not overwhelmed but were truely relaxed and the staff made us really appreciate the aloha spirit and forgot about the big city hustle and bustle where we came from. I recommend staying in the tower! The hotel staff were very accommodating in making sure that happened. The grounds are well maintained, even around the cottages. If you have the chance have dinner at the Tomatoe Basil restaurants which is a short walk near the hotel grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Tower rooms are nice”
Reviews.Author: caribjay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in late April / early May (no kids and we travel frequently). The location is convenent to Whalers Village and downtown Lahaina. The tower rooms are newly rehabbed with upscale fixtures. The beds are amazingly comfortable. The pools are dated and not resort like at all... but the beach is one of the nicest on the island and just steps from your room. The staff was also very friendly / helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Loved the Royal Lahaina!!”
Reviews.Author: jaims1026
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed 5 nights at the Royal Lahaina Resort. We were very surprised how beautiful it was! We are Marriott members, so we were a little nervous about staying at an "unknown" place. We were so wrong!! This place is gorgeous. Yes, the lobby is a little dated and the grounds are dated, but who cares - who spends all their time in the lobby anyway?!? The rooms in the tower are spectacular, clean and well decorated. We had an ocean front room and our view was fantastic. The 2 pools are nice, never really busy and can always find a spot to sit. The beach is beautiful! The resort staffers are very friendly and accomidating. From the Royal Lahanina, you can walk to Whalers Village and it is a short drive/cab ride/shuttle ride to Lahaina. Excellent resort for the price! We are already talking about our return vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Louise2008
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a wonderful 5 day stay at the Royal Lahaina. The room was well appointed with beautiful decor and the bed was very comfortable. The beach is magnificant. We had the buffet breakfast and car as part of our package. We enjoyed a lovely and good breakfast buffet while overlooking the ocean. The staff were very friendly. We felt that the restaurant could have opened earlier to accommodate people who were attending early excursions. We took the opportunity to book excursions on site at the Expedia desk and found staff to be very helpful when booking activities. Parking was a somewhat tricky as the parking spaces are extremely small. Overall we were pleased with our accomodations, the location and the cleanliness of the resort. Mahalo, Louise & Norm, Canada

Reviews.Title: “This was a very unexpected find!”
Reviews.Author: 911boss
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Royal Lahaina before we had read the TripAdvisor reviews here, and then we were very concerned about getting stuck in a cottage or being forced to pay more than we could afford to upgrade. None of that happened! We stayed here 6 nights (April into May) and had a lovely room, a great view from our little lanai and experienced excellent service. This is not a "hot spot" for night life nor a superior snorkeling beach. It is, however, a lovely nostalgic visit to what the 60's architecture brought to Hawaiian resorts, with today's amenities and comforts. The beach is great for casual swimming and sunbathing. There is a bar at one of the pools if that's your thing. The restaurant and bar are open and airy and the ambience is quiet and restful with lovely ocean views. We had an evening bar meal once and ate the breakfast buffet twice and all 3 meals were quite good, worth the price, and we experienced good service. Be advised - the resort is among several clustered on Kaanapali Beach, and is not in Lahaina proper; but this is a superior beach, walkable and worth your attention.

Reviews.Title: “Wnderful Resort and staff”
Reviews.Author: LawandOrderCA
Reviews.Content: We have been vacationing at the Royal Lahaina Resort for the past 14 years and probably logged in over 150 days. The newly remodeled rooms are wonderful. The resort staff has always made an effort to make sure we were satisfied with our accomodations. This year (2007) the manager found out we had a personal tragedy and suprised us with an upgraded suite. We stayed 10 days and felt like royalty. The kindness we were shown was heartfelt and will always be remembered. The morning breakfast buffet is always a treat. We have seen the resort go through various changes in the last 14 years and it just keeps getting better. All we can say is if you want to spend a wonderful vacation on the island of Maui, kick back, and leave your troubles at home, then the Royal Lahaina Resort is the place to be. This year we were going to miss our trip but couldn't bear to. It wouldn't be summer without our pilgramige to the Royal Lahaina. So we made the necessary changes and are going back on May 30, 2008, for 7 nights, we can not wait. The best review one can give is to return. We have done so for 15 years. Kevin & Elizabeth

Reviews.Title: “What a life”
Reviews.Author: OkanaganLori
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the towers 1st 4 nights OCEAN front and the next 10 days on the 9th floor towers with ocean view we were all over the Island and I would go back to the Towers everytime we just loved it there and the staff was absolutely great. What a fun time for our 1st visit, thank you Royal Lahaina, Roger & Lori

Reviews.Title: “awsome place”
Reviews.Author: love2travelIndy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two days before an emergency back home called us back. Started in the cottages and they were horrible. Moved quickly to the tower oh my what a difference of one half star to a 4 plus. Beach was beautiful and location was perfect. Bad was the pool was small rectangle. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Ka'anapali”
Reviews.Author: Azia76
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location if you stay in the Kai Tower. Beautiful rooms, great views from the balconies, great breakfasts in the restaurant downstairs. Overall a great experience. 2 pools, great location on the beach. You can walk a few minutes up the beach to a great snorkel spot. Would definitely recommend this hotel as long as you stay in the Kai Tower. I can not speak to the other rooms as I did not see them. I simply followed the advice of others and was well rewarded.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: fbstar73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were married on the beach there in July of 2007. The rooms were fantastic with awesome views very romantic. We are planning on going back next winter.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: MelAlberta
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 days at the Royal Lahaina. Enjoyed every minute of our stay. The staff were outstanding. They all went out of their way to keep their guests happy. We stayed in the Tower and the rooms are beautiful. True, the cottages look tired, but they were in the process of painting and reroofing many of them while we were there, despite the fact that they are to be torn down soon to build villas. The pools are unremarkable compared to other area hotels, but the beach is gorgeous. We recommend this hotel to all. Our teenage kids loved it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Maui's Gem”
Reviews.Author: travelfamilykkbj
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort. It was the most fabulous stay! we were at the hotel for 8 days. Our room had the most beautiful view of the ocean! The staff at the hotel is amazing, each time we returned from being away we were greeted with a welcome home. we truly felt that this was home for 8 days. The beach is amazing, the snorkling within 3-5 minute walk of the hotel is amazing and the quiet pool and grounds are just wonderful. we really love every aspect of this hotel and highly recommend it! we will be planning another trip very soon and can't wait for another fabulous week in Maui! Thank you Royal Lahaina for making our Spring Break so wonderful! we always tell people about your incredible hotel!

Reviews.Title: “You gotta stay in the tower!”
Reviews.Author: aaron-j
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the last two reviewers-the tower rooms at the Royal Lahaina are REALLY nice. My wife and I stayed there the first week of March this year. Try to get an even-numbered room on a higher floor (we had 1108) and you'll have a great view of the whales in the channel between Maui and Molokai. We spent a couple hours just watching them from the room balcony. The Royal Lahaina grounds are looking pretty dated, but the staff was helpful. Parking can be a pain, and the actual parking stalls are very narrow (though that seems to be the norm all over Maui). I had to crawl across from the passenger side to get in our car a couple of times. Rent a compact! We only had drinks at the hotel lounge. The food looked ok, but our drinks were tasty.
