The Pele Mai Tai is a good one! Service was slow unless you were sitting at the bar itself. The resort location is pretty good. It is about a 10 minute walk along the beach walk to the Whaler shopping center, which has (of course!) an ABC store where you can get any food you might want to have in your room or anything you forgot to bring from home. The cottages appear to be quite worn and tired. There is a sales office on site for some new timeshare condos which will replace them. If you are looking for a resort where you will spend much of your time, you might look elsewhere. We were looking for a nice room and not many other on site amenities, so the Royal Lahaina worked well for us. Almost forgot one thing-there is a somewhat cheesy looking Italian restaurant right at the edge of the grounds as you drive in called Basil Tomatoes. We decided to try it one night just because we were too tired to drive elsewhere. As it turned out the place is VERY good! Traditional italian food and some nice wines. We were pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: VancouverTakemeaway
Reviews.Content: After reading the bad reviews wasn't quite sure what to expect, but it was a lovely resort! We stayed in the tower, nice room, comfortable beds, upgraded to a partial ocean view when we arrived. Very clean, very comfortable and lovely! The beach is spectacular and never was crowed and within walking distance of a fabulous snorkeling spot ( Black Rock) and shopping etc. The only things i think could be improved, are # 1 , the parking. For $10 a day you can self park and for $15 they valet park. We self parked and it was usually a trying experience finding a spot to park in. I am not sure what they do in peak season as there are not enough spots for everyone! When we finally found the hot tub, the temperature was boiling. Way too hot to even put your foot in. The two swimming pools are not heated and too cold for evening swims. The restaurant is not worth eating at. Its grossly over priced and not all that good. Toast with breakfast was $3.60! We only ate there once, found lots of other places that were reasonable and much better. The hotel is for the budget concious but the restaurant definitely is not. The little coffee shop was quite nice, and served very good coffee. Other than that, it was a very pretty location, friendly staff, cleaning staff were very sweet. I would definitely go back to this resort

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: edojapan
Reviews.Content: Funny enough I stayed for business, this was recomended to my by someone in the office. The staff were great my entire stay, the room was very clean. The private beach was nice lots of room, I felt comfortable any time of the day or night walking around the resort very safe. I had breakfast and the food was very good, this is my first choice for all trips to Maui I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucks27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon. We stayed in the tower and the rooms are very nice and my husband loved the sheets, nice and soft. The location is good, close to Lahaina. My husband is extremely picky when it comes to hotels and he was very happy with the room. There is not much of a pool scene here. The pools sort of remind me of something someone would have in their backyard, just a rectangular pool. So if you want a pool scene this isnt the place. The beach is nice... short but nice but it seems to be like that everywhere. Beautiful sunsets and we happened to see a whale off the coast from the shore. Only thing bad about the rooms is horrible lighting in the bathroom area. Very hard to see your face to stick makeup on. We visited the Ritz Carlton for the day... obviously we didnt see the rooms. It has more of a pool scene and the lobby was gorgeous but the beach was the same. And for the price I would prefer to stay at the Royal Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Honeymooners !”
Reviews.Author: Curious_Canucks
Reviews.Content: This was our first week of our honeymoon. Our first impression is quite good â€“ the staff are very nice and have the best smile !!! We had a room with Ocean View and what a view !!! We were on the 9th floor; our room was quite spacious and very clean. Bed is extremely comfortable; bathroom is functional and spacious. We had no issue whatsoever with this hotel. Our package includes the buffet breakfast and itâ€™s worth it; the buffet include the usual suspects: eggs, sausages, potatoes, but also French pastry and a very good omelet station. The restaurant also offer Ã  la carte itemsâ€¦ For lunch and light dinner, the same restaurant offer a wide variety of items on their menu and the food is again, good, but do not expect fine dinning at this restaurant. A few steps from the reception, you will find a convenience store selling wine & beer; (fridge in the room !!!) Also, a ice cream parlour and other various shops can be found in the same complex. The pool is nice, but sometimes got noisy with kids â€“ There is a hut â€œBeach Activities Centerâ€� that will rent all gear for beach activities and also organize scuba/snorkel tours; staff are very friendly and give great advice for local restaurants !!! The concierge is extremely nice, professional and very knowledgeable. Donâ€™t be shy to ask him for advicesâ€¦ He always have cookies for the kids !!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and clean”
Reviews.Author: 24jeffanascar
Reviews.Content: Nice room, clean and met our expectations, the lobby was fine (contrary to some reviews) but expect a "local" flavor. We did not do the breakfast buffet- to save money and because we wouldn't have enjoyed it. If we return to Maui will probaly look to go back to Kaanapali Beach Hotel with the suites- so we have another room to relax in while partner is sleeping- or not..

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beach”
Reviews.Author: genieSouthAustralia
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 children and 2 grandparents stayed at the Royal Lahaina in May 07. We had booked ocean view rooms in the newly refurbished main building well ahead of our trip through our travel agent. We also requested adjoining rooms at this time. When we arrived at the resort we were not given adjoining rooms and the ocean view was quite good for one room but not so good for the other room. The room itself was really lovely and we really loved the room. It was very clean and the beds were lovely and comfortable. The beach out the front of the hotel was absolutely magnificent. It was everything that you would dream of when you think of Maui. We took our children snorkelling right out the front of the hotel and saw all sorts of beautiful fish and even a sea urchin right there in about 12ft of water. It was a great experience. We enjoyed a lovely buffet breakfast each morning at the restaurant in the hotel. It was really nice. A bit of a wait in line each morning but not too bad and definately worth the wait. Allow a bit of extra time if you want to go somewhere early. Overall we had a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SMOWMAN89
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Hawaii and for part of our stay we stayed at the Royal Lahaina resort. When when arrived and were being checked into our room I asked about the location of our room and if we could see the ocean being we had booked a "ocean view" room when we booked our travel plans the girl checking us in said that we would have to stretch our head out around the balcony to see the ocean I said to her that isn't what we booked when we made our room reservation with our travel agent she said just wait one minute and she came back and said that she could upgrade us to ocean view delux but we would have to paid the difference we took the room the room was very nice. We had breakfast included in the cost of our room and the food was very good all of the food was very good at the hotel also the drinks were very good too and prices weren't that bad for being in Hawaii. This resort could use more help I felt sorry for some of the workers but the workers were very helpful and nice. I did ask for a late check out but they gave me a 1:00 pm check out and didn't charge us for the late check out and then offered there hospitality room for half hour so that we could freshen up for our flight back home and that was one of the cottages that was awful they need to be torned down dirty just don't even think about staying there or using the hospitality room we just changed our clothes and left. The staff never cleaned the hospitality room between guest!!! If you plan to stay book a room in the main tower and you will be much happier. If I was to go back to Maui I would book a room again at the Royal Lahaina Resort .

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Honeymoon - Must stay in the Kai Tower!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tarheel4Life78
Reviews.Content: Maui is the best place ever to go for your honeymoon and any other vacation. I did 6-months of research on where to go and especially where to stay. The Royal Lahaina was the perfect place on the Island. The grounds are beautiful. We stayed 10 nights in the newly remodeled Kai Towers. Everything was "brand new." I hear that the cottages are not that nice though, so stay away from them until they are remodeled. The price was great since we used an agent. Search "Unforgettable Honeymoons" and ask for Laurie. Our flight was cancelled leaving the island and had to stay an additional 2 nights. Bummer right. The airline put us up in a bigger and more expensive resort which was horrible. The next morning I called our agent and she got us in another room within 15 minutes and got us the same rate we had paid before. The food was decent and a little pricey but you are a walk from Whalers Village and a 5 minute drive or bus ride to Lahaina where everything on the island is. Trust me, the location will be hard to beat. The pools were a little small but you have the ocean so who needs a pool. The resort has a luau everynight but it's not bad. You can barely hear the drums and parking is taking care of in its own area. The staff here is wonderful. If something was wrong, they fixed it. I'm sure some people might have different opinions on this hotel but as for myself and my wife, being as picky and clean as we both are, I wouldn't have changed anything. You get the mountains with rainbows on one side and the most gorgeous sunsets on the other every single day! I hope that this review helps someone make one of the best decisions by choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: wazzucoug05
Reviews.Content: Despite all of the negative reviews, we loved staying at the Royal Lahaina. The service was excellent, the rooms were great and the beach was great. We stayed in the tower of the hotel, which has been recently renovated. The rooms were very modern and clean. The bed was very comfortable and we had a great TV and mini fridge. We had the buffet at the hotel once and it was very good and not too expensive, $19.50 for adults. Lots to pick from and good food. We had ice cream almost every night from the Royal Scoop, an ice cream shop on the grounds, and would go to the pool to eat it. The restaurant overlooks on of the pools and they have live music every night, so it was always enjoyable to listen to. All in all, I love the Royal Lahaina. Especially for the price! I think it's in such a great location. We didn't even have a total ocean view, but we were still able to see the ocean and the beautiful grounds that surround the hotel. I'm at the Hyatt for the remainder of the trip. I can honestly say that I like the Royal Lahaina much more, especially for the price. They charge at $15 usage fee per day on top of everything else! The Royal Lahaina has a much better beach, too. Hope this helps! We loved Maui and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Be Tricked - Cottage Rooms are Dumps!”
Reviews.Author: lrbh
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and expected the cottages all 10 of our party were booked in to be not so nice. But we were all just happy to be in Hawaii and since there were so many of us and we booked this trip only a few weeks ago, we didn't have much of a choice. But we were all shocked out how really bad the cottage rooms were. The concept of the cottages is great and they must have been nice 30 years ago, but they have not been kept up at all. We called the front desk to get our room changed but they said the hotel was all sold out, but they could move us to the inn, which was worse. A few hours later a friend of ours went to inquire again, ad they magically had 5 rooms for us, but not until tomorrow. When the rest of our friends showed up hours later - surprise! - there were now two rooms available right away, leaving the rest of us to suffer a night in the dump. These rooms are really what you would expect on the side of a highway in the middle of the desert for $49 a night. They are tearing down the cottages soon, to put up new condos but until that time they should be giving these room away for free or not renting them at all. They should be ashamed of themselves, they are ruining people's very expensive vacations. I felt sick to my stomach when I saw people being taken to their cottage rooms by the bellmen. There were many many people complaining about the rooms, who upsetting when you just want to get to Hawaii and relax. This is not a resort as you would expect today. There are three very tiny pools and the shops on the property are gross and very overpriced. If you want to stay at a nice hotel in the area look at the Sheraton n the other side of Black Rock. Oh..we peaked over the fence to look at the Luau and it looked like a really bad backyard party with white plastic tables and blue plastic tableclothes and a stage, not even on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Was a decent place”
Reviews.Author: Down4travel
Reviews.Content: Our friends got married and we all stayed at this hotel Was not bad for the price since there were so many people flying out to the wedding and budget was a main thing. The room we had was okay but you could tell it needed remodeling. The food onsite was pretty good though. The neat thing is that whoever gets married on their grounds gets a personal engraved stone with the newlyweds names on it. It's right along the beach so you can get married right on the beach and that saves tons of money as well. I would probably stay there again, especially during the times when the prices are really low.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: fabioolli
Reviews.Content: Believe Bad reviews this hotel is simply terrible. We booked a ocean front cottage but as soon as we got in we asked to change room, immediately. It was filthy and dirty. horribly old stains on carpet ants and rats escrements. They moved us to the tower - and while moving our luggage they robbed several things from my purse. We set in the ocean front tower room which was nice , but then were asked for 200 dollars surplus. We packed 2 days later.we were supposed to stay there 8 days. Service is just bad- no one helped me to find my things. no one helped me with anything. Do not book the trip on the boat. It's a robbery. for 98 dollars they promised us we'd see turtles and dolphins- we dind't see anything. the same trip was at 35 dollars in the hotel next to ours. While having dinner next to the pool we got a shower of uber hot water from the ceiling. We will never ever again go back to this filthy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful area, ugly experience, dont eat there.”
Reviews.Author: E_Dub_89
Reviews.Content: This hotel appears to be made for retirees on vacation with their grandkids. We were the only guests I saw between the ages of 13 and 60. The hotel lobby and room looked great, but there were some problems. We booked on hotels.com for 3 people (my neice, my wife, and i). Room had 2 double beds, which was not a problem since my wife and I like to sleep close anyway, but the bed was slanted to one side. My wife woke up with her back hurting. Our phone was not working (mouthpiece was broken) so I went downstairs to the front desk, and they proceeded to argue with me about the bed being slanted: "The beds are new", "no one else has complained", "those are the only beds we have so there is nothing to be done", etc. I was not willing to have my wife further strain her back, and I would not let them get rid of me, so after a while they agreed to send someone up to look at it. A maintenance man arrived later that evening, and i pointed out the visible slanting of the bed. He saw what i was talking about right away, and said he would be back to try to fix it. Later, 3 staff came up to mess with the mattress. Interestingly, they rotated the mattress, but the bed was still slanted the same way, which they acknowledged. Finally a manager came up and made a big deal of changing us to an upgraded room. I thanked him a bunch, and we all packed up our bags and went to the new room. It was EXACTLY identical to the previous room, down to the slanted bed. We couldn't believe it! I even picked up the phone and found it had a lot of distortion (but this one did work). I slept on the floor that night, to give my wife's back a break. On the way out, I was asked to sign for various "services" (like parking, and shade by the pool). Then they asked me to sign one for all the charges cumulatively. I pointed out that i had already signed slips for the individual charges, they again argued with me. I was making no progress, so I signed it, but I warned the desk-person that if I were double billed I would cause trouble for them, and I will see what happens with all that. The food was terrible too. Considering how expensive this hotel is and how negative my experience was, I feel Royally Ripped-Off by the Royal Lahaina. There is NO WAY that I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a our family of four!”
Reviews.Author: blammo
Reviews.Content: After spending hours on Trip Advisor I booked our 3 night/4 day stay at Royal Lahaina Resorts. I originally booked a garden view room in the Tower but received an upgrade to a partial ocean view. The room had been recently updated. It was very roomy and worked great for our family of four. It had a nice bathroom with a seperate area for the shower/toilet. I liked the fact that it had a small 'frig. Everyone was very friendly and very gracious towards our two young boys. We ate at the Italian restaurant our first night and I enjoyed the food and ambiance. We ate breakfast each morning at the buffet and it had a pretty decent selection. The beach was just a few steps from the pool area and very nice. The pool was a little cool to swim in so the ocean was our primary hang out. We could see whales every morning while we were eating breakfast...very cool!! All in all, I was very pleased with our selection and would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Royal Lahaina...best deal in Maui!!”
Reviews.Author: stevensbride
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a one-week stay at the Royal Lahaina for my wedding/honeymoon. Wedding services from outside vendor, not the royal lahaina. we booked ocean view rooms (view OK from room 1217, GREAT from 6026...our honeymoon room!). We stayed in the tower with wonderfully updated rooms. Front desk staff very helpful with any questions...trouble with wireless connection in room, but front desk gave me a cable which worked great! Hotel was beautiful with the most beautiful beach area around! Definately stay in the tower (as recommended by other trip advisor reviews!)...the cottages seem to be falling apart (roofs covered with plastic tarps?). Apparently, they are going to be torn down to build the villas/condos. Also, a couple that came to our wedding was upgraded from terrace view to ocean view because the room was available & it was their first trip to hawaii! Restaurant food was OK, but many great places to dine nearby! Hotel is close to whalers village & front street with soooo much to do! We will defianately stay at the royal lahaina towers on our anniversary trips to Maui! This is a great resort for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service for a weary guest!”
Reviews.Author: Kahunacpa
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through Priceline, for only 1 night. We needed a night before our condo stay started. When we got there, it was about 9pm, which was 2 am from where we left from. We were TIRED! The front desk was extra helpful, and even upgraded us to an INCREDIBLE room for the night, since it was open and we were only there for the one night. He didn't have to do that, and all we asked for was a "renovated" room, in keeping with what we had read on TripAdvisor. The desk gave us an oceanfront room with THREE balconies, and the bed was one of the best I have EVER slept on, and that includes Westin, Ritz-Carlton, etc. The decor was beautiful. It was an easy check-in and and easy check-out the next day. Overall, I think the grounds and amenities may need some upgrades to make this a top-tier resort, but I can say that our room needed NOTHING to be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem in Maui”
Reviews.Author: travellingsforme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and are planning to come stay here next year. After reading some of the negative reviews, we were unsure what to expect. I'm so glad we didn't listen and got to experience this amazing place - the newly designed and upgraded rooms were beautiful - stayed on the 7th floor. The pool is overlooking the beach - the best beach on Maui, Kaanapali beach. This place was very romantic - can't wait to come back and stay here!! The Royal Lahaina went far beyond our greatest expectations of a fabulous Hawaiian resort! The luau on the resort was also spectacular - right off the beach and wonderful food and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “A Motel on a Beach”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Fan38
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina Resort is comprised of a single tower of newly renovated hotel rooms, surrounded by dozens of dilapidated free-standing two story shacks (the hotel advertises these as "cottages"). The grounds are very basic, comprised of a large lawn area, with several concrete pathways that are filled with cracks, potholes and finger/stick engravings in areas that were patched. There are two small rectangular pools on the ocean side of the grounds. The main drives and parking lots are unkempt, filled with pot holes and crumbling curbing. When we checked in, we were unknowingly checked into one of the "cottages." When walking up to our cottage, we noticed the roof was covered in black plastic tarps. Upon entering the room, we realized immediately that the room was not in rentable condition. The mirrored closet door was off its tracks, there were holes in the walls, a broken towel bar, a wall air-conditioner unit that had an extension cord with electrical tape, and the bed had a lumpy mattress. Also, we discovered mold spores growing in the bathroom (see pictures we've uploaded from this cottage room.) Finally, the room was extremely dated (circa 1970s), dirty and smelly. Needless to say, we returned to the front desk to explain the condition of the room and get a new one. It became obvious that the hotel staff were quite accustomed to guests complaining about these cottages. Instead of expressing shock or concern when we described the abominable conditions, the front desk clerk simply said "Uh huh, OK, ... let me see if I can find you another room in the tower instead." After waiting about an hour for another room to open up, we were given a room in the "Tower". However, the only room available was an ocean view, so we were told it would be an additional $200 a night (to stay in a clean room). We were so exasperated at this point that we took the upgrade after negotiating them down to $100 extra. What's completely interesting about this hotel is that the Tower rooms have been completely renovated. We were surprised that the rooms in the Tower are new, clean, modern and very pleasant to stay in. While the rooms are Tower are new, the rest of the entire complex is extremely dated and run down. In fact, the only renovations are the rooms themselves and hallways. The elevators are ancient, and the hotel lobby is dark, dreary, and outdated. Overall, this hotel and grounds looks and feels more like a giant apartment complex instead of a resort. In fact, after reading the prior reviews on here, it is absolutely bewildering how many guests have rated this hotel above average or excellent. Perhaps these guests are comparing this "resort" to motel chains. Thankfully we only stayed at this hotel for two nights. If you do end up staying at this hotel, considering visting the more upscale area of Kaanapali beach and resort. This area is on the south side of black rock. You can take a short boardwalk path from the hotel. Follow the path across to black rock. From there, you'll arrive at the back side of the Sheraton resort. Walk towards the tennis courts. Just past them you'll find a guest walkway that takes you to the hotel grounds, pool and public beach areas. Just down from the Sheraton is the Westin, Marriott and Hyatt hotels. Explore these hotels' grounds and pool areas and you'll immediately learn what a TRUE 3 and 4 star resort is. This resort does not even deserve a single star.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Room 3 Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: jmeb77
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great beach at a moderate price than this one is for you. The Royal Lahaina is the best value in Kaanapali. The renovated rooms are just as nice as the rooms at other 4 star resorts in the area. The hotel itself is average. Nothing beautiful about it. Great beach. Just as nice as the beach south of black rock. Stay away from the cotteges. They are not renovated and I believe they will be eventually torn down and replaced with timeshares in the future. Parking is bad after dinner due to the nightly luau. I recommend valet.

Reviews.Title: “Headed for construction”
Reviews.Author: SSH-5
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 booked a 2-bedroom cottage on the grounds. The rooms were very spacious and pretty clean. We were thrilled to have three bathrooms, a nice sitting area, a small kitchnette and an entire patio not far from the beach with a view of the golf course. It became obvious that the renovations they mention on their website did not include the cottages. They are quite old and in need of updating. We found out later that they are scheduled to be torn down in March of '08 to make room for 3 story condos. There is some obvious termite damage and tarps cover most of the cottage roofs. The staff that we dealt with directly were very nice and helpful. We were advised to visit Costco at the airport before heading to Lahaina, so we didn't visit the restaurants on the premises. The two pools seemed nice, but we spent most of our time in the ocean. Our only complaint would be in trying to secure bedding for the hide-a-bed. When we pulled it out it was covered with ants and obviously hadn't been changed in quite some time. It took an hour for the sheets to arrive. We had asked for new bedding, which included blankets for padding. The young man who delivered the sheets said he would return with the rest of the bedding, but after another hour we gave up and went to bed. The beach is much less crowded, but the snorkeling isn't as good as other areas on Ka'anapali. Self parking is also difficult (the spaces are very narrow and the lot fills up fast at night).

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: jeremyaudino
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself spent one night of our honeymoon here on December 23rd, 2007. The Rooms: Decent size rooms, unable to set the temperature below 68, we like our room cold! The Staff: Our first experice was with checkin. The lady at the front desk was down right rude. We were questioning weather a previous phone request for an upgrade would be honored, we were interrupted with a snippy "If you'd let me finish" by the staff member. Not a good start The Food: Breakfast was included with our package. When we visited the buffet the next morning there were small flying insects (fruit flies) over most of the food. Particulary bad were the fruit and patsty. There was one plate of pastries that had, and I'm not kidding, probably 200 little bugs crawling over it. We brought the waitress over to tell her about it. She said she said something to the manager earlier in the morning an was scolded for even being over by the buffet. She suggested we talk to the manager directly. The manager came over and his explanation was "we get sprayed monthly, but there is nothing we can do about it". He then pointed at the birds and said that we can't image what they get into. Disgusting. Well we lost our appetite and went back to our room. We both looked at each other and said we have to get out of here. Luckily we found a room at the Westin down the road (It only ended up costing $40 more a night). The pleasant part was our treatment by the Hotel Manager. She was by far leaps and bounds more professional than her staff. (Hint, overqualified....). We explained the situation and that we would be leaving. She appologized and refunded the rest of our stay (5 nights) in which we had pre-paid for. She also worked with us on the rental car that was also part of the package. The rest of our trip was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad & The Ugly of our Experience”
Reviews.Author: Amacski
Reviews.Content: Stayed in May 07 for 3 nights as Honeymooners. No special treats for that. But this was an awesome hotel for the price we paid. Me and my wife were overall impressed (9/10). It was Renovated and very modern, the room was quite small, the bed was comfortable and furniture was fresh. we had a partial ocean view room, but it was a pretty decent view of the ocean from the 11th floor. Ate at the restaurant down stairs, nice food and good service. The guys at the Beach Hire Place were really helpful and gave us a free Cabana on quiet days. Snorkling outside the hotel was fantastic, good to do for an hour a day. Saw dolphins jumping close to the shore, that was great. The Good > Good value for $ > Quiet Location > Excellent Beach > Friendly Staff > Modern Room & Modern Furniture > Clean > Free access to the Ice Machine on every floor > Snorkling very close by (2-3 minute walk up the beach) The Bad > Getting to the Whalers village in Kaanapali was a bit painful. There is a free trolley that we felt runs when it wants (never really stuck to the time table it felt like). Best off getting a taxi and finding another couple. Although i think the taxi ride is about $5US one way. Alternatively if you plan to rent a car for part of the holiday, this is the place to rent it. Also getting to Lahaina Town from this hotel is difficult again (because you have to get to Kaanapali whalers village by the trolley, then get the $1 Bus). Planning your trips here is important. > Lifts were as old as the building and it showed. > Pools were not that exciting, but there are two medium - small pools available (they are still nice however, but a lagoon pool would make this even better). The beach was fantastic though and a bit more private (quiet) than when we were in Kaanapali (the other side of black rock). The Ugly The building is old, but renovated. Pipes are a bit noisy, we had a toilet that kept getting stuck and wouldn't flush properly. So i had to learn all about plumbing, because i wasn't going to call maintenance when I had the previous nights dinner on show. Friends we know who stayed there on our recommendation had the same problem with the toilet too. Also too embarrassed to make the call, and became a plumber. Overall 9/10 and if we go back to Maui we will spend our entire time at Royal Lahaina Resort. Good value for money in our opinion and we've been recommending it to family & friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, Recommended”
Reviews.Author: QQ1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina over New Years, Dec 07 â€“ Jan 08. I would say that the hotel is not as grand as the Westin or Four Seasons, it is certainly not as large as these hotels, but the staff is very friendly and helpful, the location is excellent, and the fully renovated â€˜towerâ€™ was very comfortable indeed. It is right on the ocean with a great beach. The restaurants are not grand, but the food is first rate and also reasonably priced. The 10$ parking fee is a clear minus, but the free Internet makes up for it. The view of Molokai is magnificent. We stayed in the tower.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: mmcauley
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resort Dec 19-26/07. I had no clue what to expect of Maui at all - I am happy to say it was a wonderful place to go to relax. I found the resort excellent in almost all regards. We got there before xmas so it was a little quieter.. towards the 24th lots of people started coming in but it still felt like it was a relaxing place to be. My family and I (mother and sister, 60ish and 30ish) spent almost every day lazing by the pool and then at the beach. The pool was wonderful - comfy chairs, a great place to read a book and listen to the Ipod, although the restaurant had outdoor speakers playing Hawaiian music which was really nice too... totally puts you in the tropical mood. The beach was excellent also - as someone who has been to Cuba and experienced the beaches there I can honestly say that this beach is a very close 2nd. Warm water, soft beach, clean, not busy at all. Only bad thing - no beach chairs - but it is a public beach after all, next time I'll bring my own. Our hotel room was a gardenview - meaning view of the golf course and cabins and ocean to the right. It was a great view from the 9th floor but unfortunately the highway was there and a little noisy. Oh well, the morning sun was excellent and we drank our coffee and read the paper every morning on our patio. Recent renos had been done and it was very modernized. Love the big HDTV! Only complaint was no microwave, and housekeeping was not always diligent about cleaning the coffee maker or giving us enough towels. We heard that in the future the resort is ripping down all the cabins and building low rise condos units - too bad - I think the ambiance of the garden view will be ruined that way. My only problem with this resort was the restaurant. Slow slow slow. And that's for the breakfast. We did supper there a couple of times and weren't impressed. First meal my mom sent her burger back twice because it wasn't cooked, and second meal was for xmas dinner, the MANAGER spilled a glass of water on our table soaking my mom, and the best he would do is move us to another table??? I think that at least warranted removing her meal from our bill. Also, the only other major problem at this resort (including bars and stores) is that they totally gouge you. Meals and drinks are very expensive... no big deal if you are out at a nice restaurant but these were at the pool bar and hotel restaurants. Up the road is a place called Basil Tomatos, I don't know if they're part of the resort but it was an excellent restaurant. The hotel offered many many different tours and things like that but we didn't do any of that stuff because they were whole day tours and we prefer to spend the day in the sun. I heard from another guest that the whale watching tours were really good though. The hotel has a free shuttle to Whaler's Village. So in summary - would I go back? Definitely. Very relaxing, but for those of you into nightlife.... this place is not your scene.... but bus and cab rides are easily available to take you to Front Street in Lahaina Town where there's tons of bars, restaurants, stores, art galleries to keep you entertained in the evenings... except for the 10 pm last call everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent trip all round...”
Reviews.Author: WahineSurfer
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort last week for 6 days. I can't say enough good things! The room was great, the service was friendly, the pool and beach were excellent. They have a Pleasant Holidays desk in the Lobby and the staff there were so incredibly helpful that we booked two excursions. The price was incredibly reasonable and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Awesome Beach”
Reviews.Author: BoiseStateBronco
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 25th at the Royal Lahaina Resort. The resort offered upgrades and great packages which resulted an excellent value. The room was great. The remodel of the rooms is tasteful and very upscale. The room was very quiet and our view from the 11th floor was amazing (20.00 deluxe ocean view ugrade from ocean view at check in; definitely take it if you are offered it.). (see photo) The bed and sheets were like sleeping on clouds. Maid service was very good and by 10:00am each morning. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. No pretentious snobery here. The food was excellent. We got the buffet breakfast package and the selections were amazing. We also had a coupe of evening snacks off of the menu and found that food excellent as well. The beach was awesome. Not crowded as all. I recommend this resort without reservation. It is very relaxing and a great place to just kick back and hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mmels
Reviews.Content: This resort is gorgeous! The rooms were recently remodeled. The bed was really comfortable. My only complaint is that the housekeepers need to clean the balcony better. There was bird poop on it all the time. The restaurant in the hotel was delicious. They had a breakfast buffet to die for. They had everything you could possibly think of on it. I would definitly stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoveMauiAndWaikiki
Reviews.Content: Folks, this is one of the best kept secrets in Maui. I booked a Garden-to-Ocean special, which was not a bad room that looked to the ocean on the left but the parking area on the right. My husband wanted a REAL ocean view, so I asked what they could do. For an extra $75 per night, we got OCEAN FRONT on the 5th floor with a killer view. Definitely worth the extra money. The restaurant was below our room, but you could not hear anything except the Slack guitar player in the evening which only added to the ambience of the killer views. We slept with the door open to hear the ocean. The rooms are beautiful, the beds and bedding are top notch in my book. Because it is slightly off the beaten path of Whaler's Village, it is more quiet and only a few families with children, most everyone was older. Very few people used the pools, which although they are not huge they are adequate since the beach is steps away. Did you really go to Hawaii wanting to swim in a pool? Some tips, most of the restaurants in town have early bird specials for breakfast and dinner, so check around. Maui is expensive, so the specials come in handy. Fuel was $3.82 per gallon the last week of November. For reference, the we got more TV channels at this resort versus the Sheraton Waikiki, plus the Sheraton charges $13.99 for a movie versus $9.99 here. All the hotels charge for parking, so get used to it. $10 isn't much when you are already spending hundreds on the room for a week. Costco is a good stop to stock up on staples, including alcohol. We stayed the week after Thanksgiving, which we were told is the slow time of year. Yes, it was probably more rainy than usual, but the sun was usually out for a few hours each day, enough to get a tan in a week. I would definitely recommend and stay this resort again. After our first stay here, my husband wants to make this a yearly event, to which I agree!

Reviews.Title: “Service! Service! Service! Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: GaryMinnesota
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding November 1st. The now and forever wedding planner, Theresa did a perfect job.. We had stayed here in 2001 and said if we ever get married it will be here because of the location. The rooms have been upgraded but the old cottages are going to be torn down for 3 story condo's. First time in my life that I did valet parking but it was awsum!! All the employees were great. We were upgraded to the 12th floor on the S.W. corner, so we could see the ocean and golf course. The color in the morning is WOW!! The breakfast in morning was GREAT, but we were full with ordering the regular breakfast menu. Supper OK, but Castaways, (a short walk to the north) was excellant for supper. Bartender Jose was fun and GREAT! Seems like a lot of the employees have been here for years. Room cleaning was good and on time..We went to the luau after the sunset wedding and they were great and we got to go 1st in line. Location is perfect for walking on the beach. Also some small shops right next door. However, Maui is much more crowed and expensive compared to when we were here in March 2001.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: emmonsNorwich
Reviews.Content: Like many who have writen reviews on here I was slightly apprehensive due to some negative comments. However when we arrived there our fears were resolved, upon checking in with received a upgrade to the ocean view room, granted it wasn't looking directly at the ocean, but it wasn't exactly a hardship to turn my head to the right. The staff throughout the hotel were pleasant and helpfull. The building its self was slightly dated but was very clean and well maintained. Our tower room was fantastic and the bed was so comfy, we couldn't of asked for any more from the room. We were given a bottle of champagne as it was our honeymoon which was a nice touch. Only three negatives, the first being that you have to pay for the car parking, secondly the food was slightly overpriced, thirdly we hired a car through avis which is just down the road from the hotel, so we asked the bell desk to order a taxi for us which they did, only to be told when we arrived at Avis that they run a free shuttle bus service which the hotel should have told us about. Overall we had a fantastic time, just one piece of advise though the restaruants we went to around Lahaina weren't all that good, so we bought alot of our food from the nearby supermarket and had many picnics on the beach which was just amazing. I would definatelt recommend doing that

Reviews.Title: “nothing to rave about!”
Reviews.Author: cal_trip_2007
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on trip advisor before I made reservations so I knew not to expect anything but the lovely beach:-) Here are the pros: Located on a beautiful beach Good food and drinks at the restaurant downstairs Nice rooms on the tower building(NOT garden Cottage). I got a room in the tower, so the room was pretty good. I liked the beds, very comfy sheets too! Decent pool You can snorkel on the beach! Fantastic views from the beach. Icecream shop at the resort has great flavors! yummy! Great water sport rental shop. Those guys are great! Now come the much awaited cons: Reception are clueless about local sites. Asked about hana road pointing it on the map! and the lady has a look of confusion on her face. Also, not the friendliest bunch that I have met:-). maybe they are underpaid.....who knows...... paid full price for ocean view, got to view the ocean by leaning precariously over the balcony :-). oh well...... 5 min walk to the parking lot, else you can pay $5 per day for valet....PLUS $10 for self parking hmmmm internet is pathetic. the wireless access points are few and they DO NOT work! if you talk to the our expert receptionist, u will again encounter the blank look coz they are thinking 'access what'????finally managed to get an ethernet cable by walking all the way to the front desk(might I add, it requires a deposit of $10 which will be not be refunded if you do not physically bring it back to the front desk ). Plugged the cable and still no internet. Arrrgggh.....At that point I gave up, took it as 'sign' and did not boot up my laptop for the rest of my stay. There goes the $ 20 per day resort fee :-(( Please do not spoil your morning by tasting the yucky complimentary coffee.The coffee shop downstairs has decent coffee. The resort is in a prime location, so really they are not very concerned about anybody's opinion. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: MrMash
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I liked the hotel and would probably stay here again, but you should know what you're getting into before you book. If you are looking for a hotel to relax with family then this is a solid choice. If you're looking for something more exciting then you might want to consider a different hotel As you can probably tell from the other reviews the hotel recently was renovated. It is essentially completely done now (late Nov 2007). The decor they chose is not very beachy. The hallways are tan and dark brown with light fixtures that look like straw. Likewise the rooms are filled with dark wood and tan walls and carpeting. The decor is more 'mountain retreat' than beach resort. Currently, the rooms are immaculate, but I wonder how well they will hold up with people dragging sand and sea water in. We had friends staying at the Marriott which was down the beach, our rooms were much, much nicer than theirs. The pool is non-existent, especially when you compare it to the hotels down the beach. The beach is great, so it didn't matter to me, it's just that if a great pool scene is important to you then you might want to consider a different place. There also isn't much of a bar scene. The bartenders were great, but there are only about 20 or so chairs at the bar. On a rainy evening they were completely filled. The only thing that really irked me was the restaurant. We went for breakfast and were told that we must eat the buffet, the waitress literally refused to take our order. We never went back. Ask the staff how to get to CJ's for breakfast. It's not very far.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST View!!”
Reviews.Author: jodi1114
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were just married in Maui. We stayed at the Royal Lahaina for the 1st part of our trip. It was fabulous! They had just completed tons of renovations, and did a great job. the room was lovely. Everyone who we met who worked at the resort was super nice. I can not think of anything that was not great. If you go there eat at Basil Tomatoes. Wonderful food and the staff there too was great.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel staff on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Theatre-boy
Reviews.Content: I read almost every single review for this hotel when deciding where to stay. After a long flight that lost our luggage, we were warmly greeted by the staff. And all of the people who work there are helpful and friendly. They even remember your name! The grounds are very clean and kept. The pools are a bit small, but with the ocean right there, who cares? Our room was upgraded to a partial view, we faced North which looks over the nightly Luau and I would preffered the other side. The noise is slightly irritating. But we could see the ocean just fine, and we had a lovely view from our balconey. Good shower and soap in the bathroom. Friendly maid service. Loved the bartenders, they were great! Knew your name, knew your drink and very personable. Believe what you read about the restaurant however, we had a rude hostess and very slow service. The food was OK, but not worth the asking price. They are much better places to eat than there. For the price I was very satisfied with service and accomadations. Even though we were a gay couple, we were treated like everyone else amongst the " newly-weds- and the nearly deads ". A very nice hotel and YES I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: RKW1
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not a four star resort. We booked an ocean view room and the only way to see the ocean was by leaning over the balcony. Our room was recently renovated and nicely done. The rest of the hotel needs some major renovations in all other areas. The front desk staff act like they are doing you a favor by allowing you to stay at the hotel. However, the employees who do the valet parking and take your luggage to your room are exceptionally friendly, helpful and professional. The hot tub is across the parking lot, up the stairs and near the tennis courts. Ask one of the employees who park the cars for assistance in finding the hot tub. The beach is wonderful and the location is great. Hopefully, the hotel will continue to renovate and maybe do a additional training for the employees working the front desk. For the price we paid, we are sure there are much nicer hotels/resort in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: smnornes
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the day, after 8pm. Maui was the last of 3 islands on our 2 week trip to Hawaii. We certainly saved the best for last! When we pulled into the valet area, my door was opened for me and I was directed to check-in. By the time I checked in, the bellhop had our car unloaded and my family (hubby and 2 kids, ages 6 and 8) waiting for me at the elevators. We were escorted to our room. When the door opened, I caught my first glimpse of the huge wall of windows looking directly out to the ocean. We had an oceanfront room, top floor. I loved the sound of ocean waves coming from the clock radio on the night stand. Nice touch. We were given a tour of the room and were told to call if we needed anything. Wow, the room was incredible! It was classy and comfortable. The beds were comfy. I liked the little sink/bar area, although the hinged mirror on the wall was a little awkward. It had a huge lanai with a table and chairs that faced the ocean. We had two double beds, a plasma TV, desk area, a nice bar area with two stools, a fridge, safe, and robes. The two pools are small, but never were crowded. Besides, you have the entire ocean right in front of the hotel to indulge in. There were always plenty of lounge chairs and towels for the taking at the activities desk. The activity desk guys will try to sell you everything from sunglasses to sunscreen to boat tours. They mean will, and were quite helpful when we were teaching our kids to snorkel. One day I asked for a good place to snorkel with kids. I was given a map with special instructions written on it, directing us on where to park and enter the beach area, etc. I think the activities desk guy (Kirk???) went out of his way to help us. Snorkel gear rental is pretty steep here. I think we paid $120 for 4 full sets of gear for 4 days. But, I guess it is all about convenience. We ate at the breakfast buffet once, and it was good enough. Adults were about $18 each, kids ate free. We would have never eaten here if the kids had to pay, too. Watch out for the pesky birds if you dine out on the patio. They'll steal scraps of food from your plate if left unattended for even 20 seconds. The kids had fun watching the mischief. We had breakfast at Cheeseburger In Paradise on another morning. That bill came to $60. Ouch. We had reservations for the Royal Lahaina Luau and paid extra for the premium seats. I'd definitely recommend paying the additional $15 for the premium seats. We didn't wait in line for food or drinks and had front row seats for the show. We found the show to be entertaining. It was our first and only luau, so I don't have much to compare it to, but I'd do it again. Being at the hotel was very convenient. Bring cash for the sunset family photos, though. I missed out because I didn't have cash and couldn't charge the photo to our room. I was sad to leave the Royal Lahaina. It was a great property for us. The rooms were fabulous and the lanai, oh, the lanai was to die for. I'd love to return.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly relaxing resort!”
Reviews.Author: sd2maui
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on this website and others, I was quite hesitant to book this hotel. But, with it being a much better value than all the big-name chain hotels, we decided to give it a try. We had booked a "deluxe ocean view" room. I was disappointed when we got to the room - it was on the side of the building and we could see the ocean, but it wasn't oceanfront view like I had thought it would be. So, we upgraded to an oceanfront room (i attached a picture of the view from our balcony) - for only $50 more a night. Definitely worth it. The staff was very friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived. Our room was serviced twice a day - cleaning in the morning and a turn down service at night. My one complaint would have to be with the room cleaning. We left the hotel to snorkel one morning at 6:30 and didn't return until 2:00 that afternoon and they still hadn't cleaned our room. This happened a couple of times and was kind of annoying, but we just went with the flow and stayed out by the pool and beach a bit longer. The hotel was lovely. The rooms were a good size, clean, and well decorated. The pools were nice and clean. Didn't have a problem finding a lounge chair at either pool. The beach was only a few steps away and just beautiful. I agree with the other reviewer, this hotel was very quiet. We had the sliding door on our balcony open whenever we were in the room, so we could hear the ocean. And that's about all we heard. It was a wonderful and relaxing vacation. We would highly recommend the Royal Lahaina Resort to friends and will absolutely visit there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: kyemae
Reviews.Content: I've seen a lot of bad reviews for the Royal Lahaina, but most of them seem to be from those who stayed in the cottages (which are being torn down eventually). We stayed in the tower for 5 nights and were very pleased with everything. The room was newly renovated with modern yet authentic decor. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean with a large shower. If youre looking for a quieter hotel, Royal Lahaina is the place to go. You can eat at the poolside restaurant and bar with hardly any background noise. The hotel was full and we were surprised by how empty the pools were and the small number of people walking down the beach (which was beautiful). We snuck over to the Sheraton to snorkel at Black Rock (HIGHLY RECOMMEND DOING THIS) and were apalled by how many screaming kids were splashing in the pool and crying on the beach. The only thing we were unhappy with was the valet service, which at times seemed non-existent. A couple unanswered phone calls to the valet desk were enough to file a complaint, but we were compensated. I will definitely stay here again. The location, beautiful rooms, and peaceful atmosophere are well worth the price, which is about $100 lower than the Sheraton and Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: alund
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Royal Lahaina from Oct 22-27, 2007 and had a great experience. The rooms are beautiful and very comfortable. We commented to each other that we looked forward to coming back to our room each day because of how comfortable we felt there. Our room was on the 9th floor with a Partial Ocean View. It's always hard to know what kind of view you're going to have when the description of the room is "Partial Ocean View", but when we opened the door to our room we found that we had an amazing view of the ocean and beach! The Royal Lahaina is not a huge resort/hotel, so there are not a lot of activities available at the hotel and the pool area is pretty basic. But you have easy access to a great beach, which is what we wanted anyway. I would recommend going to the Luau they have. The food was great and the show is fun. Plus, you get about $20 bucks off the regular price if you stay at the Royal Lahaina. Also, if you are a guest of the hotel and call ahead, you don't have to wait in line! Hotel guests are let in first and have seats reserved. I would definitely consider staying at the Royal Lahaina if we visit Maui again. It was just the kind of hotel we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon couple upgraded to ocean front room”
Reviews.Author: adimax83
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Royal Lahaina on Sunday, Oct 21st. From what we've read on here, normally honeymooners are upgraded one level in their type of room; in our case we had booked an ocean view room and were expecting to be upgraded to the deluxe ocean view. However they had no king beds available in deluxe ocean view but offered to upgrade us to ocean front at just $20/night, but would only get 2 double beds. The upgrade was well worth it as the view was just stunning, and the double bed was not all that different from the queen we normally sleep on. The food at the hotel's restaurant was very good although it was pricey which is to be expected for hotel food. The beach was excellent and not very crowded at all. The location was great as well. Just a few minutes away from Lahaina and all the activities there. The hotel itself is nested in with several other nice hotels and a golf course as well as the Whalers Village shops and several restaurants. A couple of issues: 1) Housekeeping. They did a good job don't get me wrong it just seemed they came around at odd times. There were several days where we'd go out in the morning and come back to the room mid-afternoon only to find our room still not cleaned. We'd put up the do not disturb sign while we were in the room for the rest of the afternoon and usually around 3 or 4 we'd get a call from housekeeping asking when it would be okay to come clean the room. It would've been nice if they came and cleaned in the morning since it gets rather warm in the afternoon and many people may want to retreat to their room before going out for the evening. 2) Thermostat. Now we're both pretty good with electronics but we could not get the thermostats there to work like we wanted to at all. Some nights we'd think we had the thermostat off or even switched over to heat and still the A/C would run all night making the room freezing cold. Finally we got the heat to run for a whole day then we couldn't get the A/C turned back on to cool it off even though the thermostat was set to cool. Since the weather was so nice, we opened the balcony doors during the times we were there most of the time, so it wasn't a huge deal. Just at night when we were sleeping it became annoying. 3) Water pressure. I assume the water pressure is probably low all over the island but it seemed very low in our shower. It would've been nice to have a little pressure to help wash the sand off of you after a day at the beach. Final Thoughts: Royal Lahaina was a great hotel in a great location. The view from the balcony was simply amazing so if you have a chance to get an ocean front room don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: TexanGirl78
Reviews.Content: While it is not the fanciest hotel it is a great value. The rooms in the Tower are newly renovated with down pillows and comforter, plasma TV, and are nicely decorated. If you are staying on the 5th floor you will have a not so good view of the lobby roof (unless you have a full ocean view room). I highly recommend getting a room on the 12th floor. We did and had an awesome partial view of the ocean, view of the golf course, and the mountains! I never eat at hotel restaurants so I can't say how the food is, but we did have drinks by the pool and had a very generous bartender. The pools were not impressive, but why waste time in the pool when a beautiful beach is a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Team07
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel at the far end of the hotel zone in Kaanapali. The Sheraton is next door (quite a walk) which starts the path of hotels along the beach and to Whalers Village. It is certainly no Hyatt or Westin but you do get what you pay for. If you want an oceanfront room definitely pay for it because even though I was a promised an upgrade based upon availability it was not given. We were promised an upgrade when we booked the hotel because of celebrating a special occasion but when we got there they said they did not have an oceanfront available but when others checked in behind us and got an oceanfront room I questioned it and they responded with you can get the upgrade if you pay the difference ($100 more per night). Deceiving.......don't like that and the staff was VERY rude and did not try to accommodate any requests including the dirty stained carpet (had to wear shoes in the hotel room all the time) YECK!! The white comforter on the bed was stained with black spots all over it and the A/C did not work (although after several requests they did finally fix the a/c). Also, the ceiling was pealing and white stuff kept falling on clothes beneath it. Parking was always a problem and even if you found a spot it was so tiny you could barely get your car in it then you could not get out of the car. They have two pools that are very plain and one was very dirty. They rented lounge chairs for $10.00/HOUR!! RIDICULOUS. The only good thing I have to say about this place is is was cheaper for obvious reasons and we were not there much because we did a lot of touring and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: jasper0101
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect spot for my wife and I for our anniversary. We did not want to spend the $ to stay at the Westin or Hyatt. We read the reviews, crossed our fingers and booked the Royal Lahaina. We arrived to find a hotel that ended up being just what we were looking for. It didn't feel crowded like hotels on the other side of Black Rock, There was never problem getting a lounge chair. It would have been nice if they allowed lounge chairs on the beach. My suggestion (if you are going to stay more than a few days) would be to go buy a chair (or bring one)so you can sit on the beautiful beach in front of the hotel. The pools are basic. There were a few kids around but mainly couples and quite a few honeymooners. All the staff were courteous and friendly. The rooms in the tower were more than adequate. The better ocean view is on the North side of the tower. if you can spend the extra bucks for an ocean front, do it. That's what we'll be doing when we come back next time. Nothing bad to say about this property. It's not the Westin or the Hyatt and that suited us just fine..

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay & Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: 1961wine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived on Oct.13,2007 we had reservations to stay in a Water Front Bungalow. When we were escorted to the room we were unhappy with the very out dated decor and the old bathroom with very old grout and tile. I called the front desk regarding how disapointed we were the nice front desk lady understood our concerns and offered us a room in the new Towers with an additional fee for this upgrade? of course we went first to see the room and inspect the room before we would consider a change. When we walked in the new room we were very happy with the decor and how very clean the bathroom and the partial view was enough for us to enjoy the beach. The restrarunt thier was a very nice place to have breakfast and a wonderful Sunset Dinner. This Sunset Dinner also included entertainment along with a delicious choice of dinner menu. We would recommed this beautiful breezy resort. We will be back next year and we will stay at the Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: KoolKev
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical on staying in this hotel based on other reviews, but I am glad that I did! The renovation work that was done to the rooms is amazing! The furniture and room amenities are better than some 5-star hotels I have stayed in. The bed is very comfortable and the flat screen TV's and free Wi-Fi are a great bonus! For those of you planning your first trip to Maui, I recommend bringing a laptop with you to simplify making reservations and evaluating the numerous amounts of excursions. There are only 2 parts of the hotel that need some major work: (1) It is obvious that the elevators were not updated during the renovation and they could really use some work. (2) The cottages are in terrible condition. I believe that the hotel is planning on knocking them down soon to make way for some condos. So if you are going to stay in this hotel, make sure you stay in the tower!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: hiluc22
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time on our vacation. True, it's not a magnificantly huge resort compared to all the chains but it definitely has the feel of old Hawaii. My significant other and I had a beautifully renovated room and stayed for 3 nights- there's no tub in the bathroom but we weren't there to take a bath! The view was perfect, we weren't directly out facing the beach but you could see another island in the far off distance and look down the beach, it was very calming and we were happy. The staff was very accomodating with pointing things out to us. We had the breakfast buffet as part of our package and we were both pleased with it. The beach access is nice however my other half is rather a "city boy" and prefers the option of lying on the beach with a chair and an umbrella. This option wasn't available at this resort so he stuck near the pool, a little bit of a downer. There's a lot of snorkel excersions available in many of the pamphlets and books around the island however we walked 5 minutes up the beach and went in the water! We saw a lot including turtles, needle fish, and eels. It's a 10 minute walk to whaler's village and a 10 minute drive into Lahaina. Nice resturants at both places so you know you don't always have to drive. Overall we had a great time and were satisfied and would definitely recommend this hotel to others...just make sure you do your planning a head of time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cialti
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews here, I booked 3 nights at the Royal Lahaina as part of our honeymoon. (The following 4 nights were spent in Hana... review to come shortly.) When we checked in, we were sent up to our room with a bellhop to help with luggage. When we got to the room, it was right next to the elevator so we told the bellhop we'd need to go back and get a different room. He had us hang out in the rejected room, went downstairs and got 2 new room keys for us to check out. On his recommendation, we checked the one on floor 3 first, as it had better ocean views, and it was fine. (As other reviewers have noted, only the most expensive rooms face the ocean -- the others are on the side of the hotel and vary in how much ocean view you get. Our first room was on the parking lot side of the hotel, so there wasn't much view. The new room was closer to the front of the hotel, so we had a much nicer view. So, we appreciated the help of the bellhop, but were unimpressed that the front desk gave us the worst room on the floor initially. The rooms are quite nice with the renovation. The bed was far too soft for us (there's a featherbed on top of the mattress), but otherwise nice. There was only a shower (no tub). Nice amenities -- the soap is the scratchy oatmeal kind which we like. The small refrigerator in the room didn't feel very cold when we first opened it but did an ok job at chilling the water we'd bought at Target when we arrived. Some of the towels were obviously brand new and super fluffy, while others were more used and more typical. Apart from the rooms, the hotel doesn't feel very special. The pool is small and you have to walk through the restaurant to get to it (which is weird for both restaurant-goers and pool-goers). Luckily, we were spending time in Lahaina on this part of the trip, so we weren't planning to hang out at the hotel very much. Note that the hotel is not actually in Lahaina -- it's just north in Ka'anapali. Takes about 5-10 minutes to drive into Lahaina depending on the time of day. We never ate at the hotel as there are such good restaurant options elsewhere in West Maui. We opted to self-park instead of valet park to avoid the wait for the car to be brought around. The parking spots are tiny, and with all the American rental cars, it can be challenging to fit your car into a spot or get out of the car in the spot you've found. And as many people have mentioned, the luau does fill up the parking lot. (We found that if we returned from dinner after 8:30, it usually wasn't a problem.) The grounds of the hotel are quite limited. As I mentioned, there is the small pool (actually two small pools), and there are paths wandering around all of the cottages. You can take the path to the Sheraton (next door) and after crossing a parking lot, you can get to the sidewalk t hat leads to Whaler's Village for shopping and restaurants. While I really like staying near Lahaina for the busy part of my vacation (this was my second time in Maui), in hindsight I should have booked us a garden room at the Four Seasons for a nicer honeymoon experience. I would not stay at the Royal Lahaina again.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaHappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I went to Maui to celebrate our anniversary, and booked the hotel based on the fact that the rooms had been recently renovated. I have allergies that flare up to mold, dust, and smoke, so we thought that we could prevent any problems by staying at the RL. (I even called to make sure they had a strong no smoking policy, and it was even a law in Hawaii that people couldn't smoke within 20 feet of hotels or establishments!) WE WERE WRONG! When we arrived the front desk was pleasent, and upgraded us for free to the 12th floor, I was estactic to have a view of the beach from the balcony. Sadly, the next morning I woke up coughing, and went outside for fresh air only to find the person next door to us smoking on his balconey!!!! After using my inhaler, I called the front desk and complained. They apologized, but did nothing. This continued to happen for the rest of our stay, and despite many confrontations between the 'hotel security' who came to confront my rude neighbors, nothing was done! (The rude smokers lied and said they weren't smoking! I hope they get lung cancer, for lying and for their stupidity.) If you want to prevent an asthma attack, lung cancer, or a nagging cough do not stay here! I

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful rooms and great view wonderful beach!”
Reviews.Author: Enon
Reviews.Content: We arrived with a very pleasent welcome from the valet and the front desk agent was great. He even upgraded us to the 12th floor with a view of the south side overlooking the golf course and a nice view of the beach and sunrise. This hotel has had their rooms newly renovated very crisp well appointed rooms great space and a balcony of which we enjoyed day and night. If we were not in Hawaii we would have enjoyed the room alone but had to get out and see the great views. The restaurant was not good food was more of a lower mid level range with high prices $25-$40 for an entree I expect a tasty meal. I suggest you get drinks only they have a great view and the sunset Hawaiian dance and music is a nice touch, really enjoyed our first night of arrival. The Concierge was so nice, every day she had a new cookie for us hot from the kitchen when we approached her for the surf report, ever seeking the perfect body surfing beach. The Bell Staff really knew of good beaches and made a suggestion for a great hike just south of Lahina on the coastal drive it was an old foot and horse trail used over a hundred years ago. The hike would take about 4 hours if completed one way but we started late the last day we were there so only got about 2 miles up. Oveall I would say this was an excellent stay and a great location, away but close enough to walk to Whalers Village and other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon Experience”
Reviews.Author: shell_shells
Reviews.Content: The first night/check in: My husband and I both made separate phone calls to the Royal Lahaina prior to our stay to confirm that we'd be getting a king bed. Both times we were assured that we'd get a king size bed and champagne (which turned out to be half the size of a regular champagne bottle) since it is our honeymoon. Well, upon checking in at around 9 p.m. after a long flight, we were told that we got a room with two queen beds instead. I was slightly upset but figured it was no big deal since we were used to sleeping in a queen size bed. However, when we actually got to our room, we discovered that they were two *double* beds. I was *very* upset at this point. Even my husband was upset. He called down to the front desk to ask for a room with a king size bed, even if it would be a downgrade (we were staying in an oceanfront room). They told him they had no extra king beds at all and that they were accommodating us by giving us a king bed the next day. Okay, yeah, well what about *tonight*? I thought I'd give them a call next. I got a hold of a manager and she explained how she was sorry and that they were worried about us the most since we had called a couple times before. She then went on about how they run out of king beds in the fall due to honeymooners and run out of double beds in the summer due to families. If this has happened before, why in the world could they not buy any extra king and double beds?! I told her that it was our first night of our *honeymoon* and now we have to spend it in a *double* bed. For a while she said there wasn't anything she could do, and I told her she better give us *something* for this huge mistake on their part. She finally agreed to pay for our parking. At least we got something out of it, but I still would have rather had a king bed our first night and pay the extra 10 bucks a day for parking. This incident really irked us. They should have a better policy in place to where priority of king beds go to honeymooners (and anniversary couples), especially if they are paying for one of the most expensive rooms (ocean front). I also must add that all of the workers we dealt with were very nice and remained calm, so I better give them props for that. I just wish they were more accommodating. Just a side note: the TV was NOT working and they shut off the water for the rest of the night while we were taking a shower. What a lovely first night, ha! The room: The room itself was amazing! The decor was modern and had a Hawaiian feel. Since the rooms were recently remodeled, the room was very clean. The king bed we got the next day was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Pillows were great too. The alarm clock was neat since it had the radio, the ipod thing and nature and spa sounds. You also have a phone but it costs a dollar to make a local call, which is ridiculous. Just use your cellphone if you have one. The mini fridge was nice to put the expensive drinks and snacks in. The in-room coffee maker was convenient to have in the morning while getting ready for breakfast. The bathroom stuff that you get includes hand soap, bath soap, body wash, shampoo, conditioner, and lotion in a coconut lime scent. I wish the bathroom was a little bigger and had a tub in it, but we were fine with how it was. The view: The oceanfront view was gorgeous, but it would've been better if we weren't on the floor right above the lobby/restaurant (3rd). We were right there above the blue tarp thing and were able to hear loud people at night. Whenever I went on our balcony I felt as if though everyone could see me since we were so close to the ground. The housekeeping: They were all very nice and courteous. They checked on our room twice a day, which we thought was cool since people like to take showers after swimming in the salty ocean in the afternoon. The room service: We ordered room service dinner one night. They need more choices on the room service menu. The prices for the food is much too high for the quality you get. However, they were very quick. The maintenance guy was pretty quick too (about 10 minutes) when we reported a clogged toilet. The breakfast buffet: We were impressed. The food wasn't the best quality, but it was still pretty good! There were lots of choices, including pastries, sausage, fruit, french toast, made-to-order omelettes, etc. We actually met Flavor Flav our first morning here (celebrity; most known by his "Flavor of Love" show on Vh1). The parking: Yes, parking was a little tight but we were always able to find a spot so we never had to use the valet service. The worst times to find parking seemed to be at night (of course). The beach: Great access to the beach, and it never once felt crowded. Lots of great snorkeling opportunities just minutes up or down the beach. We saw an octupus one morning (but no turtles). We rented the gear at the resort even though we knew it'd be much cheaper elsewhere. They were very nice and helpful. I wish they didn't charge for the cabanas and that they would allow people to take the chairs to the sandy beach. The pools: Very simple, but nice for a freshwater dip. I didn't really care for the pools since we came to Maui for the ocean. Maybe in a few years they will upgrade them. The check out: Went pretty smoothly. As promised, we weren't charged for parking. We were sad to have to go back to the "real world". Other stuff: The elevators need to be updated. They were actually the freakiest elevators I've ever been in (not as bad as it sounds--but they were kinda shakey). I couldn't even figure out where the stairs were (if they have any). Plus sometimes in the late morning it took a long time to wait for an elevator. So, would we stay here again? If it wasn't for the first night, then yes. But it bothered us so much that we will only return after we've tried out different resorts and if those resorts weren't to our liking. I hope they realize they need to buy more beds to accommodate everyone, especially honeymooners. As long as our first night experience doesn't worry you, then the Royal Lahaina is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome uncrowded beach!!!!”
Reviews.Author: anywherewithwater
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at 9 p.m.. The valet, front desk, and bellman were all great. Went downstairs for dinner and a drink as we had been traveling all day. The only negative we found at the hotel. Had to wait 30 minutes for a glass of water and another 20 minutes to have our order taken. Food was good, but expensive for the quality and the service. Did not eat at the hotel again. The room was incredibly comforatable. Yes, the balcony did overlook the roof of the lobby, but all one had to do was turn their head slightly to the right for a fantastic view of the beach and ocean. The only staff that we had regular contact with was the valets, who each morning gave us great tips on where to go exploring. (Thank you, Wayne!!!) Didn't use the pool, the beach was too perfect. It was a 4 minute walk from our room on the 3rd floor to in the water on the beach. Definitely going again. Make sure you pay the extra $5/day for the valet service. (Although, was not told about the free drinks. Just read about that on this site.)

Reviews.Title: “Great access to the beach!”
Reviews.Author: Auburnmb
