Reviews.Content: My Mom, sister and myself stayed at the Royal Lahaina the first week in September for 3 days. We had just come from Oahu where we were spoiled in our condo there. Upon check-in--we had a horrible experience w/ a very slow employee. She had trouble finding two rooms together on the same floor. We had paid and booked for ocean views with 2 rooms together. She had to get someone else to help her..ppl around us were checking in left and right w/ ease. Once we got to our rooms on the 11th floor we found out that one of the rooms had 'partial ocean view' meaning you could see the ocean if you craned outside on the balcony. I called down to request the ocean view we paid for but they said since I could see the ocean it was ocean view. They had nothing else available. Be sure to request the even numbered rooms to get a better ocean view. The odd numbers were off the golf course area. I also had trouble with my AC unit. It would not cool my room for the life of me. I even put in a maintenance ticket and no one ever came. The beds are set up so that in order to sleep comfortably without falling out of them you had to sleep in the middle of them. Yes I did fall out and stumble out of them one sleepless night. The rooms also do not have curtains they have giant wooden doors that close over the sliding glass doors. I would have preferred to have light curtains or something so that you can have a little light in if you want. The hotel is pretty quiet and peaceful. They have 2 pools that we saw and used that were never crowded. The access to the beach is very nice. We ate in the hotel restaurant for one of their sunset dinners. It was nice enough. The food and drinks were adequate but not for the price. We also attended their luau. We were told by the front desk and on our tickets that the luau started at 6:30 and we were to be there by then. We could see the luau from our room and saw that ppl were already down there..come to find out it started at 5:30. So be sure to double and triple check the start time of any of your activities. If you haven't been to a luau yet it's worth checking out but it's a little trashy and might be too sexy for youngsters. The hotel is close to the Whaler's Village and Lahaina for shopping/food. That is a bonus. All together I would stay there again if I was with a significant other. Not an ideal place for singles or someone who needs a lot of entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Gdog_hoosier
Reviews.Content: This was a once in a life time vacation for me. We booked our vacation with a online Hawaiin travel agent. She did a wonderful job! The Royal Lahaina was beautiful inside and out! We were upgraded to the top floor at no extra cost I believe because she knew I had ALS and was on a trip my work sent me on before I was unable to travel, Anyway the staff were awesome everywhere, the rooms clean and cozy, very relaxing! Don't pass this one up!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: cbrawlins777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort for our wedding in July. We had 12 guest rooms booked almost 10 months in advance with a guaratnee that the bride and groom would have the best suite in the tower, as well all our guest would have ocean view upgraded rooms. In addition to spending 8 nights at the Resort, we held our wedding and reception as well as attended their Luau (40+ guests). Upon check-in not only was our room "not" what was expected two of our guest that evening had to change rooms three times before we found one that was even suitable. The front desk was absolutely rude and unwilling to work with us. I immediately worked with the sales office who guarnateed the remainder of my guest checking into the resort would have the pre-assigned rooms as agreed. Of course, the front desk again, refused to honor the pre-assigned rooms and I spent the week of my wedding ensuring my guests had the rooms the were guaranteed and paid two nights deposit months in advance. The resturant bartender was very insulting and disorganized... they have a wonderful drink served in a pineapple that we encouraged and purchased for our guests as they checked-in. Unfortunately, one evening I purchased six of these drinks, four out of the six had ants crawling all over them... while I understand that given the juices of tropical fruit, when bringing it to the attention of the bartender, he refused to remake the drinks, nor compensate us for the cost. After my mother had an ant in her mouth, I insisted on speaking with the resturant manager and requesting that all drinks be compensated, which he kindly did for us (Thank You). It was insulting that I had to escalate this to management to begin with. I will admit that the upgraded Tower rooms are beautiful and the beach access is amazing. However, it is in your best interest to ensure you have a pre-assigned room with "full ocean view" and not believe that your confirmation with ocean view is correct, unless of course you are okay with a sliver view of the ocean while you overlook the roof of the carport and restuarnts. While the end result of our trip and stay was to be married to a wonderful man, I will never recommend this resort to anyone again, nor will we ever stay there. Our party spent over $35k at their resort in one week, one would have thought they would have taken better care of us and treated their guests to as if they'd like them to return and provide future recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: KGeurts
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went on our honeymoon here, and we were very pleased to say the least! We stayed in the tower rooms, on floor 11, and we had an ocean view room... The views we had were spectacular. I was not expecting such oceanfront views, for only the "ocean view" room we booked. On one side it was green beautiful lush mountains and golf course, and the other side was the breathtaking views of kaanapali beach! The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Pillow top, king size, feather pillows. Flat panel big screen TV's, private balcony (or lanai). We were very impressed, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay here for our honeymoon. We would highly recommend it. The hotel restaurant was good. We recommend the "sunset special" 24.99, for a prime rib dinner, that comes with 2 mai tai's and dessert. It was fantastic... not to mention the spectacular sunset views, and the live music, and hula dancer. It was picture perfect, and paradise for us. We recommend also the Snuba diving the hotel offers -- amazing!! I know it seems a little expensive, but it is worth every penny. Snorkeling was great just a little walk down to Airport beach at the hotel next to us. Amazing fish, and coral. I really can't say enough good about the hotel... it was fantastic. Only thing I wish they had was a tub... they have nice tile showers, but I would have enjoyed a long soak in a tub, but other than that, it was simply amazing. ** tip: definately go for the hotel valet-- its only 5 extra bucks a day... and totally worth it! We will go back!!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel in Maui!!!!”
Reviews.Author: itsmever
Reviews.Content: I have never been to Maui so i had done some tough searching for a nice hotel to stay in. We were so exited when we arrived,it seems we had picked a great one! The front desk upgraded to ocean view which was in the tower. the room was beautiful!I only wish it had a bath(i did miss that very much) only oceanfront and cottages do. we loved sitting on the balcony watching all the people arrive to our right and the beautiful ocean to our left. room 4020. We went to the royal lahaina luau that night which i personally thought was pretty cheesy. i went to the old lahaina luau a couple days later and that blew it away except the royals kalua pig was better. spend the extra on the old lahaina but you need reservations before you go(traditional seating if you can) The staff was very nice to us got us everything we needed.BUT the beach directly in front is breathtaking!they have the best beach! the pool was nothing to write home about which is weird to me why they wouldn't have a fancy pool at such a nice hotel. Beds are comfortable. we slept with our sliding door open.If i go back(which i have to its that beauiful of a place) i will definitly stay again. We were there for 7 nights

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, lack of service”
Reviews.Author: amycb4
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay at this "True Polynesian" hotel. They had just renovated the main hotel (not the bungalows) and the rooms were a work of art. The Hawaiian people had been so kind to us in Oahu, I was a little shocked in the lack of service or personality I should say, here at the Royal Lahaina. The front desk seemed angry (and put me on hold for 32 mins when I called down from the room for a question- yes I waited!), the valet/bellmen wouldn't make eye contact after we wanted to park ourselves (parking was 100 yards away and 5 more dollars to valet- not including tip). The restaurant ruined the experience for me all together (I am a stickler about food service- dining is the best part aside from the beach!) The first time, we had little service, they didn't allow refills for sodas, and we waited 20 mins for our check after we had finished and crunched our ice completely out of our drinks. We tried the restaurant a second time and it was the same, and the food was worse. The concierge is pointless, I asked for help and without saying a word or looking at me she pointed straight to the Expedia Booth. The best part of the hotel, besides the great rooms, was the super friendly towel/beach hut guy. He was welcoming, helpful, showed us where to snorkel, what to do, and always was happy to see us! The Luau is ok, WAY too many people (600 I believe). Great Snorkeling! ***I promise I am not a negative traveler, I just expect more when paying that kind of price!

Reviews.Title: “Updates are tremendous - LOVE the tower rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Seattleite
Reviews.Content: We were at the Sheraton Maui for a week and decide halfway through our stay to extend an extra weekend. The Sheraton could not put us up the last night (a Saturday) so my husband called all over West Maui trying to find a room. We finally found one at the Royal Lahaina. We had a little trouble finding it (poor signage - drive through the golf course), but the gentleman at the gate was delightful and parking was easy in the early afternoon when we arrived. The hotel is comprised of a 12 story tower and numerous free standing buildings. The free-standing buildings look like they have not yet been updated, and the lobby of the tower is looking a little tired, but the rest of the tower has been very recently updated and is very nice. Our check-in was painless though we were told we could not yet go to our room (only 12:30pm). When they found out we were only there for the one night, they told us we would get an upgrade if one was available. We left our luggage and went into Lahaina for the day/evening. We came back at 10pm and had a little trouble finding parking because the luau was still going on, but not a big deal. We got our key and went up to a gorgeous full-ocean-view suite (for which we'd paid the going rate for a partial ocean view regular room) with huge den, bath with huge walk-in shower, and a lovely bedroom with an extremely comfortable bed. The furniture and design were Polynesian flavored and very tasteful (though the bath is what I'd call "very upscale US with EU influence"), each of the main rooms had their own lanai - one with a spectacular full ocean view and one witha very lovely partial ocean/mountain. They even have the louvered doors like you see frequently in the Carribean so you can leave the doors open to catch the breezes and the morning sunshine, but stil have privacy (I prefer the breeze to air conditioning). The next morning we enquired and found out the rack rate for that room is $800/night. We had a very tasty (and potent) Mai-tai at the bar and walked out onto the beach for an hour in the late evening. It's very nice and dark (unlikethe other side of Black Rock), so you can actually enjoy the stars and a kiss or three if you desire. :-) The living room has a huge plasma TV, coffee maker, refrigerator, and lots of storage, art and books, though we didn't really have an opportunity to utilize it (the bedroom also has its own huge plasma TV). We slept very well in the bed and awoke to morning sun streaming in lazily through the louvered doors of our lanai. Breakfast, though not terribly speedy and yes, our waitress had a bit of attitude as is reported in others' reviews, was very tasty, and eating outside was lovely. My husband had the buffet, which had a huge range of foods, and I ordered from the menu (I recommend the blueberry pancakes - get the short stack). On the downside, the pool is rather small and the beach is not as good for swimming and such because the current is a little stronger on that side of Black Rock. It's not bad, it just isn't as good as the beach on the other side where the Sheraton is located. The Sheraton is only a 2 minute walk away though, with a very lovely beach perfect for a family day outing and kids playing in the surf for hours on end. The Royal Lahaina's beach would probably be best for adults who want to get in the water, paddle around a bit, perhaps do a little snorkeling (there are nearly always sea turles on this side of Black Rock near the rock itself), then head to other pursuits. There's a shuttle that takes you around to all the hotels in this area and to Whaler's Village for more restaurants and some shopping, you are right on a lovely golf course, the views are tremendous, and we felt the service (except for the waitress at breakfast) ranged from very good to excellent. This will be a particularly lovely place to stay once all their upgrades are completed, but even now, if the pool is not a particular downside for you, and you don't mind walking a couple of minutes if you have to park a bit further away from the tower (ie, during the luau), it's a bargain for what you're getting. A spectacular way to spend a night or three - especially for a couple - I'd strongly recommend it to anyone who has the means to get one of the nicer rooms - especially if you play golf.

Reviews.Title: “best honeymoon ever!”
Reviews.Author: rachaelmac
Reviews.Content: Better late then never I always say.... We stayed at the Royal Lahaina for a week at the end of March, 2007 in the new tower. We had a long day of travel and got to the hotel in the late evening. The bell staff was right there to check us in and we didn't even have to go to the front desk at all!!! What a nice feature! Also, the room was amazing! New everything and a great view! The bed was sooooo comfortable and everything was clean! The beach was beautiful and the hotel was under a little construction but, nothing bothered us at all! No loud noises or workers. The place was pretty empty and no little kids were running around which was nice for our honeymoon! We loved the luau and the beachcomber, we hit it every night to see our favorite bartender mark! I highly suggest going down one hotel to the castaway restaurant, it was cheap and the food, service and view was amazing! If you rent a car, just pay the extra money for the valet service, we did and got 2 free mai tais every night, it was worth it! I suggest getting there before they finish all the renovations and you have to pay alot more! This hotel is truely a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but definitely not Great!”
Reviews.Author: angarg
Reviews.Content: First off, 3 stars is not *bad*, but just indicates that this hotel was average. The Room: We originally booked an Ocean View room (in the tower), and got upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean View room upon arrival (it was a complimentary upgrade for Honeymoons and Anniversaries). I was a little disappointed because the Ocean View and Deluxe Ocean View rooms are what I would call Partial Ocean View. You still get to see the Ocean, but you also have a view of the parking lot, and of the rest of the resort. I was expecting to stay in one of the *front* rooms, that have nothing but beach/ocean to see, but that was not the case. I called the front desk to ask, "If this is an ocean view room, what is a partial ocean view room?" They lady at the front desk told me that the rooms with a total ocean view were in a different price category. Again, the room was not bad, but I was disappointed because of my expectations (If you stay here, don't assume that an Ocean View room is a view of *only* the ocean) -- I'll post pictures to show you what we saw from our "Deluxe Ocean View room). Other than that, the room was nice and the bed was extremely comfortable. (Extremely comfortable is an understatement.; the bed was heavenly). The Beach: This beach is located on the north-side of "Black Rock". The Sheraton and The Whaler are on the south-side. This part is really a comparison of the 2 sides (north & south). The north-side (Royal Lahaina side) was less crowded, but had more pebbles and small rocks on the beach. There was also alot of rocks where the waves came in; You had to go out further to get away from rocks at your feet. The south-side is more crowded, but the sand is much nicer. There weren't any pebbles or rocks on the south-side, which made it much more pleasant to walk from the top of the beach to the water. It also made wading around in the water much more pleasant. Activities/Dining: The Royal Lahaina side of "Black Rock" had very little to do. We spent most of our time on the other side of "Black Rock" (the Sheraton and Whaler side). That place had much more nightlife activity. Many restaurants, and shopping; I usually don't like crowds, but the atmosphere was just better on the south-side (near Whaler Villiage). My Recommendation: This is not a bad hotel. But, next time I go, I would try to stay a little further south on Ka'anapali (perhaps the Whaler). I haven't compared prices between the 2; if this resort is considerably cheaper than some place like "The Whaler", then I would stay again. If it was roughly the same price, I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina still needs some renovation”
Reviews.Author: Kuzzy_P
Reviews.Content: As mentioned the rooms in the tower of this hotel have been renovated in a very appealing and functional style. There is lots of wood and Hawaiian touches and the bed is very comfortable. We were pleased and impressed with the quality of our room. Though disappointed that no robes were provided as other resorts do. This is more a hotel than a resort. Our room views were very nice though I had been told when I called that we would probably be upgraded which didn't occur. The lobby and other parts of the hotel need to be updated. The hotel has two fairly small older styled pools and a nice quiet beach, although a lack of shade on the beach makes it tough to stay for long. Also, no chaise lounges on the beach, nor are any allowed. This is not the case at the Sheraton Maui. The Royal Lahaina beach is north of Black Rock. This means if you wish to be on the main side of Kaanapali beach you need to walk to the Sheraton and cut through their property. My reason for not giving an excellent rating is the very poor service in the dining area and conseige. We had the rudest waitress the first afternoon we arrived wait on us if you can call it that. She complained about being busy (3 tables), gave us the wrong dishes, dropped them off and never asked who ordered what, then when my husband went to check said well they're both tuna so what's the difference. The table next to us was never cleared off so the birds were having a field day. First and last time we ate at the hotel. My husband went to check on when we needed to check in for the luaa which we signed up for the luau at the hotel. My husband was met with check-in is at 5:45 pm. with no willingness to help answer his question. When we arrived at 5:30 pm there was already a huge line who had checked in. So, we ended up way in the back not being able to see the entertainment. Also, there are only 3 small elevators so plan to wait 5 to 10 minutes to get an elevator. As long as you don't plan to spend much time or eat at the resort then this should be a good place to stay. However, if you are looking for an all inclusive resort consider someplace else. Check out Kimos in Lahaina for dinner and drinks. Wonderful views and excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “truly amazing!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SOONER-N-79
Reviews.Content: Wow!!!!!!! I must say that after hearing some of the negative revews I became worried as this was the hotel for our honeymoon... I have a very picky wife and know that she would have had anything short of great....My wife and myself were amazed at how nice the room was...We stayed in the tower and was greeted with a free ocean view upgrade room(FOR HONEYMOONERS).......The room was very clean with very nice furnishings, including a 32 inch HDTV...Although the on-site luah took up a bunch of parking, it was not that big of an issue... I must say that my only issue was that I was unable to get any kind of internet connection while I was here.........We used the expedia kias on property and they were great also......Ask for Josh there as he was very helpful and has good knowledege of the "hot spots." In a nutshell we loved Maui and now wanna live there..........

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but has its problems”
Reviews.Author: AvidVisitor
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the tower of this hotel have been renovated in a very appealing and functional style. There is lots of wood and Hawaiian touches and the bed is very comfortable. I was very pleased and impressed with the quality of our room. The lobby and other parts of the hotel are not as new, although they are also nice and quite pleasant. The hotel has two fairly small pools and a nice beach, although there is a lack of shade on the beach. My reason for not giving an excellent rating is the very poor service in the dining area. Every morning, there were half hour lineups to get to the somewhat expensive ($18) breakfast buffet. This was not due to a lack of tables, but just seemed to be due to the very slow and seemingly unsupervised restaurant staff. After a couple of mornings, we found we could go to the Castaways restaurant at the next complex to the North, with cheap and better breakfasts. The quality of the food for other meals was good, and there were some very nice lunch items for just around $10, such as fish tacos or beef strips with salad. Overall, this is a good hotel and we would go there again, but eat breakfasts elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel from Missouri”
Reviews.Author: LovedMauiPG
Reviews.Content: I cannot say anything bad about this hotel. When we checked in we were told that our room had been upgraded to a full ocean view. How nice. The room was very clean, enjoyed the view and the staff was very friendly. Everyone was so helpful and upbeat all the time. Anytime you asked for directions or help they never hesitated. We parked our own car and did not have any problems finding a parking space. We took the tour "Road to Hana" (got our sandwiches from CJ's and that worked great). The trip was about 12 hours but we stopped a lot and did some hiking. Took a car ride to Haleakala Park another day. We took our two sons, 19 and 15. They went Parasaling and enjoyed that and rented snorkeling equipment at the hotel and had fun. We also attended the Luau at the hotel which we booked from Pleasant Hawaii at the hotel. It was lots of fun. The sunsets were beautiful. We ate at Mixed Plate (not very good) and Bubba Gump Shrimp Co (excellent food). We ate the breakfast buffet at the hotel and it was very good. Lots of food to choose from. It was so nice to walk out the back door and you were on the beach. The guys at the bar were very friendly. We stayed for 3 1/2 days in Maui and then went on to Oahu. I cannot say these good things about our hotel there.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Lahaina was Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: royaloakdmbfan
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the review on here for The Royal Lahaina after booking our long weekend getaway I was quite nervous. Although , from the moment we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. The staff was very accomidating. We actually booked a grden view room and got upgraded to an Ocean View Room on the 4th floor. The rooms were really great. Very clean, modern and updated with nice flat screen tv's. As far as the property is concerned it was also great, after walking down to see all of the other resorts I was always happy to come back to The Royal Lahaina, ll of the other resorts were crowded and loud where TRL was quiet and peacful. The only complaint that I have is that I didnt stay long enough. Make sure to go to Dinner at Son'z at the Hyatt, and The Pineapple Grill in Kapalua.

Reviews.Title: “True Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Pooky-Island
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort. Prior to our stay, there were massive renovations done to the 12-story hotel. We were very impressed with the results. The furnishings and the rooms are absolutely beautiful and provide the comfort of home. We felt like we received the royal treatment due to the aesthetic beauty of the rooms and the quality of service provided. We were treated with the utmost kindness and respect by every staff member there. They go out of their way to help you and try to meet your every need. If you are looking for a place to relax and take in the beauty of the beach, the Royal Lahaina Resort is for you. They have one of the best beaches we've ever been on. We had no complaints about this hotel stay, and it was our best trip to the Hawaiian islands yet. The atmosphere this hotel has strived to create is worth recognition, and we highly recommend this hotel to anyone interested in visiting Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Maui and would return to the Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Jeepn
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort was wonderful. We booked a garden view room through a travel agent. We were on the 4th floor S. side. The view was better than expected and the remodeled rooms are great. We heard absolutely no noise from the rooms above, below or next to us. The TV was nice not that we saw much of it. Shower is fairly new but water pressure and temps were good. We paid for the Valet and resort fee 21/day which includes the safe and Mai Tais. We loved the safe and it was easily accessed by location and codes. There was no microwave but did have small fridge that met our needs. There are very nice quest robes in the closet and plenty of hangers. The sink and vanity are a bit awkward as the sink sits kind of far back on the counter harder for shaving and the lighting my wife tells me is not the best for makeup although she looked great to me! She did also note that for being so new there were a few stains on the carpet that should have been removed. The beds and pillows were very welcome at the end of the days. The balconies on the sides of the building are not very private by way of design (had to wear clothes) but the views were great especially after living in AZ. Ocean front balconies are more private. We could still see some ocean and the other island from the balcony along with the trees and mountain to the East. The staff was great, especially the valet guys. Very quick every time and we did come and go a lot. Jordan was a very big help with all our questions. We both smoke so we had to do so away from the building. There is an area not too far from the front doors and it is fairly nice with a place to sit. At the pool area we just made sure we were not too close to others which is easy to do since it was never really crowded. If you take the road to Hana be sure to get the CD offered at the Shell station on the way. The CD is invaluable if you have never been and includes map. It was $20. We stopped at all the stops and detours mentioned on it and our round trip to the 7 pools and back including dinner was about 11/12 hours. We left at 7 and back before dark. We only ate at the hotel once and had the sunset special which was ok but nothing great. For breakfast we recommend Moose Magilicutyâ€™s (I know I butchered the name spelling it). It is in Lahaina and the portions are big and inexpensive. They have a very wide variety. Wonderful place for breakfast! I still think about it. The one thing I would like to see is a nicer pool area. The pools are clean but very plain. I could see people not choosing this hotel because of it but I feel at this time the hotel and beach views and location make up for it. As far as activities if you are good at managing your time it is well worth it to book ahead of time. Prices can be found for much less when booking on line before you go. We chose to get swimsuits after we got there and glad we did. So much to choose from at Whaler's Village and in Lahaina at the same or less price than back home. We loved Maui and our stay at the Royal Lahaina made it all the more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever Vacation”
Reviews.Author: UNHAPPYOKANOGAN
Reviews.Content: I booked with a tour company and was told what a wonderful time we were going to have..... NOT...well yes if I wanted to clean my own room... make my own bed... take out my own trash...replenish my coffee daily get fresh glasses daily..take out priors days glasses... clean the stain on the carpet (watered down daily by staff) ALL THIS EVEN AFTER TALKING TO A "MNGR" staff was uptight and clearly caitered to those with $$ not just the everday folk.... TOO BAD....EVERYDAY FOLK TIP BETTER!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelbugs97
Reviews.Content: I have been to several resorts and beaches in Hawaii. This one is by far the best yet. It is on Kaanapali Beach which is great for snorkeling. It is a wonderful Resort: great food, drinks, clean rooms, beautiful beach, and great for the kids. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to vacation!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ABANDMOM
Reviews.Content: I was part of a group of 120+ that had the pleasure to stay at the resort from July 6 - July 10, 2007. Every one of us could not stop talking about the newly renovated rooms and services. We had stayed in a hotel in Oahu for 4 days before we came over to Maui and the differences in the rooms were out of this world. The staff was so helpful and the rooms so clean. We were all greatful for the upgrade in hotels. The breakfast buffet was a steal (especially since most of our group was teenagers) we definately got our money's worth. The al a carte menu could be a little pricey for family's though. The pool side assistants were great also. They helped us book a great snorkleing excursion for me and my kids - they will never forget it. The luau was our final night there and was also great - they had food to for ALL ages and tastes! The only thing that we didn't like is the new showers - the water went under the shower door and got all over the bathroom floor but we asked for more towels and let them know about the problem - I am sure they will be addressing this! Like I said from the beginning - THIS IS A GREAT RESORT!!! I also recommend the Bike Ride down MT. HALA AKALA. my 13 & 15 year old were amazed and are still talking about it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: onthegoPittsburgh_Pa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the tower for 4 nights. When we arrived at 3:00 PM our room was not ready, We were told to return in a hour. We had to stand in a long line again only to be told the room was not ready. When we returned for the 3rd time (another long line) we were given complimentary tickets for 2 drinks at the bar. We lost 3 hours just waiting to check in and stood in line 3 times. They should have called on our cell phone when the room was ready. The room was supposed to be ocean view but our room was on the third floor and the roof to a party room next door was shaped like a pyramid and it blocked part of the view. When we questioned this we were told that the higher rooms cost more money. If you rent a car and pay $10 a day to park the guests at the Luau take all of the parking spaces. Don't eat at the Basil Tomato, it is overpriced! On the plus side, the room was brand new and beautiful. The beach & pools were very good. The service people were excellent and the food was was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Tower! Avoid the cottages!”
Reviews.Author: andi75
Reviews.Content: Our room in the Tower was really great. We had a beautiful view, the room was clean and the bed was super comfortable. Originally, we had booked a cottage and ended up staying in there for two nights. I immediately requested a room in the Tower when we arrived at the cottage room because I was so dissappointed with how old everything was. When I unplugged my blowdryer from the socket, the whole electrical box behind it came out with it. The room was clean but everything was so worn out and musty smelling. It reminded me of the smell an abandoned house has. We spent the night of arrival and the next night in the cottage as there was nothing available in the Tower until the third night. I was so relieved when we finally moved to the Tower. What a difference! Of course we gave up the space of a cottage, but it was just my husband and myself so we certainly didn't need it. The difference between the cottage and the room in the Tower was night and day. Needless to say, we had a wonderful time after we were moved. The staff is really friendly and helpful and were very patient regarding our request to change rooms. The moved all our things to the new room for us while we were out sightseeing (and I don't pack lightly). The food in the restaurant was very tasty, but a little pricey. We ate on Front Street a lot anyway. There is a 24 hour Safeway not far away from the resort so we stocked the little fridge in our room with fruit and yogurt, etc, from there for our breakfasts. The resort beach is just wonderful and the 2 pools are nice, too. Parking can be a bit of a pain, so we paid the 16 dollars a day for valet, which was totally worth not having to try to find parking on our own. I would not recommend the "upgrade" on this parking package, though. It costs about another 5 or 6 dollars and you get the use of a safe (which we didn't need) and 2 free drinks in the Beachcomber lounge (we are not big drinkers). The other restaurant on the property is Basil Tomatoes. It has very delicious food..but again, was very pricey. All in all, I would definitely recommend this resort to anyone (unless you are looking for a very swanky experience). The rooms in the Tower are lovely, the staff is friendly and accomadating, and it is really close to a lot of attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina - a good resort”
Reviews.Author: TWS500
Reviews.Content: The Royal is a good resort. Sadly, soon the cottages will be demolished to make way for very expensive condos. Most of the staff try to be service oriented. The tower is very nice after the renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room & great experience!”
Reviews.Author: FreezingInWI
Reviews.Content: After a horrible experience at another hotel that we booked through hotwire, we moved to the Royal Lahaina. I'm not sure if Hotwire asked them to treat us extra nice after our bad experience, but the service and room was exceptional! We moved over to this hotel at 9:30am hoping they would keep our bags until we could check in later that afternoon. To our surprise, they said our room was ready and they were upgrading us from a garden to an ocean view room for no cost. We only paid $205/night with hotwire. THey put us in room 1105 and we had an amazing view of the ocean and mountains. The renovated rooms in the tower are beautiful! Though this hotel was listed as a 3.5 star by hotwire, the rooms were easily 5 star. We didn't want to leave. The bed was very comfortable and the decor made us feel like we were in a spa. The grounds/pools are nice, but don't expect the fancy resort style pools and water features. The two pools are basic. Beach access is great. We swam over to Black Rock to snorkel from the beach in front of the Royal Lahaina, which was a bit too long of a swim, but you can also just walk over to the Sheraton's beach and have easier accesss. We loved this hotel and would definitely go back if we return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina was excellent”
Reviews.Author: edbeef
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 days here for our 10 anniversary. The room we stayed in was fresh, new and was outstandingly put together. There was not an abundance of hotel staff that I noticed, but all needs were perfectly met and therefore we really didn't need any. We stayed in the Tower on the 5th floor. DO NOT stay at a cottage!! I was told they are about to be demolished and a Timeshare resort will be built in their place and adjoined to the building right along the elevator shaft. We had 0 complaints, 0- about this place. The landscaping was probably the most lush of any resort on that side of the island. Parking can be crowded, but we always found a place. I would definitely go back and you will likely enjoy it too. The buffet is about 27dollars for a couple if you ask for a coupon at the front desk. You should ask for a few coupons since they may not voluntarily offer you any. The Royal LaHaina Luau is a 5-7 on a scale of 1 to 10. If you want to go to the premiere luau - Old LaHaina, make reservations before you board your plane or you won't be attending.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: nurse61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Royal Lahaina from 22 to 28th of June in garden cottage room. The location and the grounds are beautiful but the room was dirty, dust all over, i.e. windowsills, bedside tables and lamps,headboard, carpet had stains on it, faucet in the bathroom was liking and I saw little bugs crawling in the room. The hotel has a special form where you can write down your complaints regarding housekeeping, so I did it and gave it to the receptionist, but the next day room was still dirty. I think, that it's good, that towers' rooms were renovated, but it's time to do the same for cottages... And it's also time to get rid of towels and washcloths that at one point were white, but now have grayish color.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our visit at the Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: kop4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from June 20th-26th. We booked a gardenview tower room through our travel agent. We arrived a day late due to airline problems. Upon arrival, the hotel told us that they had placed us into a partial oceanview room. The updated tower is very nicely done. We had to call once for washclothes and once for coffee but they came within a very short amount of time. The front desk assisted us with online checkin and printed our boarding passes on our departure date. The maitai drinks that were part of the parking package were very good. Parking fees are common in all resort areas now, not just on Maui. At least, the hotel included the safe and 2 Mai Tais as part of the package. You will not find that in Washington, D.C. or in Key West. The beach was not crowded nor did we ever lack for beach towels. We spent one day at the beach in front of the Sheraton and to snorkel at Black Rock. The beach and water was so packed with people that it was difficult to walk around the blankets or to swim. We packed our things and returned to the Royal Lahaina. We enjoyed the food at CJ's Deli and Round House Pizza that are in the shopping center near the Royal Lahaina. There is a very nice snorkeling place that is a 6 minute walk from t he Royal Lahaina. One drawback, though, is that there is insufficient room/towel racks on which to hang towels and bathing suits. Overall, we were very happy with our decision to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “FOLLOW UP REVIEW”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this property recently, and have just returned from another brief stay. Any concerns I had previously have been addressed: the staffing seems adequate, the attention to detail has been addressed, we were not bothered by pitchmen at the pool, and the restaurant has enough servers to handle the crowd. Add to this, the already pleasant grounds, and the expansive ocean views from nearly every room in the Tower, and you have an excellent hotel at a quite reasonable price. The General Manager seemed to take very personally the problems we encountered, and assured us that they would be addressed. Not surprisingly, they were. I would NOT hesitate to return to, or recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort - Great Vacation Spot!”
Reviews.Author: WeLuv2Relax
Reviews.Content: We (a group of 6 on a girls trip) stayed here in early June and LOVED it. Our rooms in the Tower were clean and remodeled and the view from our balcony was beautiful. The staff was very friendly and quite accomdating to all of our requests. We ate breakfast at the on-site buffet most mornings and were pleased with the food choices and quality. Being able to walk from the restaurant out to the pools and then to the beach within only a few minutes was great for us. Our vacation was a blast and staying in a great place where we were treated so wonderfully simply added to the great experience we had. We highly recommend this resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mynameis-kathleen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Royal Lahaina on our honeymoon and were pleasantly suprised. We took a gamble and decided to book a cottage room...I was very nervous due to certain reviews on this site, but once we checked in, we were soooooo HAPPY! We stayed in cottage M, and if you decide to stay in the cottages, REQUEST it! While we loved our room, I can see how other reviewers here could be dissapointed. The cottages sprawl from the beach all the way back to the entrance road. Some are very far back, face/back up to main road, etc. Make sure you get cottage M, and you wont be dissapointed! Inside the room, we loved the plantation shutters, the sheets were nice, and our walk to the beach was almost the same as the "ocean front" cottages. By the way...dont bother paying more for the "ocean front" cottages. They are hardly oceanfront. They are pool front. Not as much oceanfront as you would expect. I wouldnt spend the extra money. Only this I have to complain about was the shower. Granted, the bathrooms need a makeover, but every time we took a shower, the water would not drain properly. While the room service lady was very nice in trying to get maintenance to come over and fix the problem, but we didnt want to be bothered. It was not the end of the world. Keep in mind: Hawaii is EXPENSIVE. What you concider to be 5 star on the mainland, does not compare to what you find on the islands. Do I think we payed a lot for what we got? Yeah, probably. But was it a good price in comparison to the other resorts within the same area? Definately. If you would rather spend upwards of 400-500 dollars a night for a little better this and that...then go for it. Kaanapali Alii is down the street. Like I said...I can vouch that cottage M is great. The others...I dont know...some of them looked a little skanky. As for the beach...beautiful. It was a tie for us between this beach and another (on north Maui) for best on the island. You get all the beauty of Kaanapali Beach, but without ALL of the people. Every single day we were out there, it was perfect. Our room was litterally STEPS from the beach, eventhough we got a garden view room (Ask for cottage M!). Very clean!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and refreshing”
Reviews.Author: ndg_g
Reviews.Content: We were only able to stay for 4 days but the stay was increadible. The rooms in the tower were fresh, clean, and user friendly (the view from the lanai was breathtaking). The beds were very comfortable and the shower with the glass door was comfortably large. We enjoyed walking the beach every morning and it was only a short walk to Black Rock (excellent snorkling). We picked up a few things at the shops on site, but shopping and relaxing at Whalers Village and Lahaina were only a shuttle away. Not if, but when we go back, this is where it will be.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: mesker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first week of our Honeymoon. The tower was closed (we had not been told this) and the room the gave us was in the ground floor of an old building. We didn't have a balcony as we had requested, just access to a small lawn which the public had access to. We complained and got moved upstairs which was slightly better. The showers are what you would expect from a roadside Motel and not a honeymoon hotel. I felt my travel agents and the online brochure was very misleading. Also, it is a 15 minute walk to Whalers village which is the main eating and shopping area and the walk back is through a badly lit walkway.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Kenyagirl4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina for 7 nights for our honeymoon, and we loved it! We had a minor problem at check-in, but it was resolved quickly once we contacted our travel agent. Beware: if they try and entice you with free food/valet/luau tickets if you stay in the cottages, don't take it! Thanks to the reviews I had seen on this website, my husband and I stood our ground and demanded the tower room we reserved. I found the people at the check-in counter a bit rude, but otherwise, all of the staff were great! Our room in the tower was gorgeous! There's a mini-fridge which is great for storing snacks and drinks. We enjoyed breakfast in our room on the balcony most days, and went down twice for the breakfast buffet, which was nice. The staff in the restaurant is really friendly. We ate at the restaurant a few times, and I thought the food was good. The beach is GORGEOUS! I couldn't have asked for a better location- the beach seemed private at most times, especially compared to the beachfront on the other side of Black Rock, which is packed. All in all, it was a great stay for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Cashmra
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice within two weeks in two different rooms. The tower rooms are very nice, as they were recently updated. But there is little or no amenities. had to ask for toiletries, washcloths, towels, robe more than once because they didn't leave any, ,and there is no safe in the room. They try to sell this as the equivalent of a 5 star room , but don't expect service or security . (the maid left the door open twice long after she was gone.) The cottages are not cottages at all, and are a dump. It is much less than what you would expect for a "cottage" - top it off with Roaches, ants, dirty carpet, peeling paint...not just dated...nasty. The resort is dated, and three star at best. Don't expect service. Our reservation was wrong, and we had to be very direct to get them to do anything about it. We talked to several other travellers that had the same problem while we were there. They had booked two large groups when we were there and were totally unprepared to handle the volumn, were understaffed, and didn't plan at anything. And lastly don't ask the concierge to do anything because they just say they don't know. Won't stay here again and definately don't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: MNBlueKnight
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip with my wife here for a week. A problem at check-in resulted in a upgraded room in the newly renovated tower. The room was absolutely beautiful. The hallway still smelled like fresh paint. The view from the balcony was very nice. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. Parking was difficult but not impossible. The construction crews worked only during the days and didn't cause much distraction. The beach in front of the hotel was perfect with good snorkeling a 10 minute walk either way. Last but not least, I have to say the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever found in any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina - a true bit of old Hawaii & a tropical paradise!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestFella
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful resort. After spending 5 days in Waikiki, this was a true paradise! Although we loved Honolulu and Waikiki Beach, this place reminds you of a "truer" Hawaii - what it's really meant to be. We had an Ocean View tower room and it was spectacular. Totally clean - beautiful. . . exactly what the pic's on the website show the room to be. Staff was great - although they seemed to work on Hawaii time -- LOL! Would return in a minute. We purchased a breakfast package, but probably wouldn't do that again. The food was only average and the restaurant staff didn't seem to know you even existed. They spent time rearranging cups and silverware on empty tables, rather then tending to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “The Cottages are Dated”
Reviews.Author: sacyyl
Reviews.Content: First time to Maui. The cottage structures were dated, circa 1960? Saw one small baby cockroach in the shower on two of three nights we stayed there. Very expensive to eat there. Breakfast ranged from $9-12 for most breakfast items. Basil Tomato Resturant, located on the grounds, was even more expensive. Three adults and a child came out to $112 dollars for pasta dinner dishes! They also add an 18% gratuity to your tab, although the menu said it would be added for a party of six.Cheaper to go into town and catch a special, like the $1 dollar tacos at " Compadres Grill ". The beach is beautiful but rough @ times. No lifeguard. I think the other side towards the Kaanapali Beach Resorts side would be more sheltered by the cliffs that jut out into the ocean.The grounds are beautiful, straight out of Hawaian Eye episode.The Molokini snorkel dive on the Prince Kuhio Boat was awesome! If there is one must do event in Maui on the Kaanapali side, it would be a snorkel dive on Molokini.

Reviews.Title: “very nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: traveler00000
Reviews.Content: We got an upgrade to an ocean view tower room. The renovated rooms are really nice and sitting on the balcony watching the sunset was great. The front desk was fantastic - very accomodating and helpful. The grounds are nice and we walked to the Whalers Village a few times. The beach in front of the hotel is pleasant though the snorkceing was not good and the waves were a little strong. We had much better snorking on the other side of Black Rock, which is only 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Would Return in a Heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: SeattleSunSeeker
Reviews.Content: Perfect for us (40ish couple), and can't imagine better timing than to go in May. Weather fabulous, beach in front of hotel virtually empty, little to no wait for valet (whose staff were great). No complaints for the price / Paid $199/nt on Orbitz for Garden View and got triple upgrade to Ocean View, then paid $20/nt extra for Deluxe Ocean View which was so worth the extra. The beds in Kai Tower are best I've slept on period. Pleasantly surprised by hotel's restaurant food; not overpriced by Maui standards and the view is actually quite killer from the screened patio overlooking pool and beach beyond. If prices go up might have to reconsider future stays though, until rest of amenities are brought up to level of the rooms themselves. And valet aside, there was a vaguely understaffed feeling for other hotel services, although in fairness we didn't use a lot of them. Definitely a mellow vibe throughout the resort and the island in general, don't go for night life, but loved proximity to spectacular drive on north side of island (past Kapalua) which rivals Hana Highway for dramatic landscapes. Opens up a whole other-worldly variety of terrain. Drove Hana Highway also, which was really quiet at this time of year relatively speaking. Unless you go in peak season, don't let people talk you out of it, the drive is really spectacular. Perfect amount of spots to explore for a week's stay. The Expedia desk really is handy, but the best advice they gave us wasn't about excursions but food: DON'T MISS THE HONOKOWAI OKAZUYA & DELI on Lower Honoapiilani Rd a few miles north of Kaanapali. Their Mahi Mahi w/ Caper Sauce and Ohno w/ Sun Dried Tomato sauce out of this world, and there's a park almost across the street where you can eat and watch sunset while the local kids play in the playground. I'll let the pix say the rest. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal”
Reviews.Author: mrskenny
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in April and had a great time. Newly renovated rooms are very spacious and well done. Views are excellent and with a good size terrace, it was a great place to relax in privacy. Only complaint with the rooms is the lack of a safe and the nasty free coffee. The rest of the resort is still undergoing renovations. Lobby is still old-style and the elevators are from another era. Beware - there is a plan to replace the cottages with Villas, so be sure to double check before you book. Tearing down all those cottages and replacing with modern 2-3 story condos is going to be messy and noisy. There is a sales office, but we never saw any one staffing it. so we could not find out the details. Restaurant was ok. We had dinner there one night and after taking the time to reserve a specific, romantic table for 2, the hostess gave it away. No apology, just - oh - so sorry. Food was ok. Starters better than the entrees. Service was not great. Some servers were obviously more into their jobs than others. Luau was fun. 1/2 the price of the Old Lahaina, and we didn't have to drive afterward. Food was good, and entertainment was enjoyable. Nightcap was a pina-colada on the beach, under the stars. Note to smokers - it is strictly a non-smoking hotel and you can be fined $250 and thrown out if they catch you smoking in the rooms or on the balcony. For us non-smokers, it's a pleasure. As other mentioned, a beautiful,un-crowded beach is at your doorstep. Lahaina is where the action is, and it's just a quick ride away. We would definitely stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Excellent”
Reviews.Author: FernandoBee
Reviews.Content: Why did I go back to the mainland and return to the rat race? The Royal Lahaina went through a massive renovation, and my girlfriend and I enjoyed the new accommodations. The bed was very comfortable and the amenities were nice. The only thing that did not work was the clock radio/MP3 gizmo that was from the Sharper Image. It did not matter; we did not need to use the alarm clock. Flat screen TV worked great. The high speed internet connection is better than many of the 4-diamond hotels in Waikiki. The valet service was efficient and the front desk was responsive and professional. I must say that the housekeeping department did a fine job with the cleanliness of the room. The luau was superb and worth returning. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quiet getaway”
Reviews.Author: danger_bear
Reviews.Content: This seems to be a "love it" or "hate it" property. It really depends on your expectations. For the price, I really can't imagine a better hotel. If you are looking for opulent luxury and to be pampered, this is NOT the hotel for you. Spend the extra money (which is substantial) and stay at the Sheraton, Westin, Grand Wailea, etc. If you have young kids, this is also not the hotel for you. BUT, if you are looking for a relaxing, laid-back getaway on Maui, this is the perfect place. The location is ideal - seems far away from the hoards of people on lower Ka'anapalia Beach. Walked over there on our second night for the Black Rock ceremony, and quickly hurried back, never to return. The beach has maybe a couple dozen people on it most of the time, and it is a mile long. Also, I really loved the fact that there were very few screaming kids. I feel for parents, I do, but when one wants a quiet getaway, nothing is more upsetting than loud kids. I can only turn my iPod up so high. The small pools and few activities clearly lure new parents to the pricier resorts. The rooms in the tower are small but newly refurbished. Brand new linens, flat screen TV, and tons of towels. I heard the cottages will be gradually razed over the next few years to build bigger cottages. The luau wasn't spectacular, but hey, it is right there - how convenient is that? And if you valet your car (highly recommended), you never have to compete with the luau visitors for parking. Restaurant service moves at a glacial, Hawaiian pace. Takes getting used to - it actually annoyed me, but then I'm a city guy, and am used to immediate service. The hotel is also quite understaffed, but the staff that were there were largely friendly and nice. Say hi to the amazing Logan at the front desk! Again, if you want someone to wait on you hand and foot, you have to go elsewhere and pay for it. In short, I wouldn't probably stay here for a honeymoon or a lavish holiday, but if you actually want some relaxation in Maui, this is the place. And if you need a little hustle and bustle, Lahaina is 10 minutes away. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: rozee247
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room and view. Most comfortable bed ever. Great people and great drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: DebOmega
Reviews.Content: I loved the Royal Lahaina Resort. The location is great and the hotel is not too big or crowded. There are very nice pools and the beach is amazing! They recently renovated the rooms and they are probably the best hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. They have large flat screen TV's, Ipod/MP3 ports, refrigerator, balconies (ours was partial ocean view and fabulous!). The hotel had a great buffet breakfast with lots of choices. There is a free shuttle to the Whaler's Village for shopping and dining. And from there you can get a bus for $1 to Lahaina which is very convenient. Unfortunately, if you are a smoker, this isn't the hotel for you since they do not have any smoking rooms. One of the best luaus on the island is at the hotel, which makes it very convenient. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated and wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: stetson3
Reviews.Content: This hotel has gone through renovations and the rooms are just beautiful! The bed was very comfortable, the furnishing are very nice, the bathroom has lots of space and there is even a sound machine in each room. Everything is new and the decor is lovely. The people were very friendly and when the bell hop discovered we had a burnt out light bulb - someone was there in 5 minutes to replace it. The beach is quiet and beautiful. There is a nice gift shop right across from the hotel. We had a great stay there for our 1st anniversary and they even gave us a bottle of champayne to celebrate!

Reviews.Title: “A Fair Review”
Reviews.Author: runjinrun
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina is a great resort for singles or people without partners to visit Maui. It is not for families or couples looking for a romantic vacation. I just returned from a seven night stay. The resort only has one resturant and it is about two star at best. In addition, the resort only has two very small pools which are a likeness to something you'd find in backyards of Southern California. Since I do look rather young I was not treated with alot of respective of hospitalility by any of the hotel staff. The waiting staff in the resturant ignored be so much that I frequently walked into their brekfast buffet & lunch and ate without paying four of my seven nights. Of course I voluntarily paid, but I didn't have too since they didn't pay attention to me. The pool has two stoners giving out beach advice and on several occasions gave me free snorkels and whatnot. Overall, this is not the resort for someone who want's to get a "vacation"...but rather a simple getaway. I'd advise you to spend the extra five hundred or thousand and stay at the Hyatt or Westin which is only a mile away.

Reviews.Title: “We Didn't Want to Leave”
Reviews.Author: JCPB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I picked out Maui to be one of our honeymoon destinations. We were quite excited to lounge on the beach and enjoy the warm weather of the islands. We were both on edge to book for a hotel as this would be both our first time in Maui, and, of course, we wanted it to be a perfect honeymoon experience. I really did luck-out when we discovered Royal Lahaina Resort on our web search. We knew we wanted to be right on the beach, but also close to the town of Lahaina where all the activity is--shops, reataurants, etc. And, RLR was the perfect place for all the things we were looking for in a honeymoon vacation. The RLR Tower is newly renovated as mentioned in their website. We picked out a very reasonable package deal which included a room with a waterfront view, full breakfast every morning, and a rental car. It was a great value--not to mention our trip planning was made convenient for us. RLR is a perfect place for couples for a romantic retreat because the hotel has this traditional Hawaiian feel to it, but with all the modern room amenities. There was not a lot of traffic and kids screaming and roaming about (they're all at the bigger hotels). Thus, this contributed so much to the calm and serenity of the place. The grounds was lovely with lush garden landscaping. Breakfast-dining can be done al-fresco overlooking the beach. Breakfast was abundant and yummy served in buffet fashion. The waitstaff at breakfast were so accommodating and friendly. They made sure that they attended to the guests needs besides breakfast. They offer reliable tips on dining, driving directions and local hot spots in the area. I didn't have to go to the concierge for this; although, every service staff was very helpful and eager to attend to the guests' needs. The views from our hotel room was just fantastic--panoramic view of the beach, the ocean. It was absolutely breathtaking. There were two pools, but you won't need it as the beach is so much better to bathe in. I love the fact that the hotel is so close to the beach and has easy access to it. Also, there is something noteworthy about the location of the hotel itself on the strip of Ka'anapali Beach. A lot of resort hotels are bunched up on this beach, making the beach very crowded. RLR, however, has the best beach on Ka'anapali. You don't see the neighboring hotels as they are quite a distance from the property. RLR's beach also has the best slope while other hotels have beaches that abruptly slope into the water. The only downside to our stay was that there were still some ongoing renovations. One of the elevators was in a really bad shape. Worse, the suite next to us was being worked on. One morning when we were planning for sleeping in, we were woken up at around 7 or 8 am by some loud banging. When this did not cease and after we were fully awake, my husband got frustrated and called up the manager to complain. He told me that the manager was gracious enough to have himself available immediately and was respectful to hear and sympathize with his complaints. Not only did the manager apologize, he also took off a good amount of discount from our total hotel charges. Aside from that (and, oh, I wouldn't recommend the luau at the hotel), we had a lovely stay at RLR. We scouted the other hotels on the beach, and I really think we picked out the best one on Ka'anapali. We'd absolutely stay at RLR again!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest place to sat in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Lisaleopard
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here for two nights and absolutely loved it!!! The tower room was so beautiful-looks like the rooms in the W hotel in New York. Staff was excellent-we were very impressed. We stayed here two nights before heading to the Fairmont in Wailea for a work trip. But for the money, this is a steal!! We had our best lunch in maui at their restaurant by the pool-get the turkey sandwich...it is to die for!! Check out was awesome-we will definitely go back!! Beach was great too-not crowded at all! Upgrade to tower room for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful!!”
Reviews.Author: PurpleZoe21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahinia in late April 2007. Our travel agent in Australia booked it for us. When we arrived, I was greeted by a rude lady at check out. She checked us into a Garden Cottage room. When we arrived at the Garden Cottage room there was two double beds, which would be a tight squeeze for two people to sleep comfortably. I rang check in and asked if we could have a room with a queen size bed. She told me that the hotel was fully booked and they couldn't do anything until the next day. Overall the room was shabby, tired and I didn't feel clean in it. The next day we were offered a Garden Cottage room with a king size bed but choose to upgrade into one of the renovated rooms in the actual hotel. The room in the hotel (7th floor on the west side) was amazing and beautiful. The linen on the bed was fresh and clean and the bathroom was very clean. The views on the balcony were breath taking. Overall, I would recommend that you choose your room carefully (we didn't!). In this hotel, you get what you pay for. Once we were settled into our new room, our stay at the Royal Lahaina was great. By the way, the beach at the Royal Lahaina is great for swimming and sunbaking. Very clean sand and crystal clear water.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: VJWIndy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina for two evenings. The front desk, bell hops, and service staff are very friendly and helpful. Given the convenience factor, I would recommend the valet parking which is only $5 extra/day above and beyond self parking. The rooms are nicely appointed, thanks to the recent renovation. The bed was very comfortable and the linens and towels were nice. The room decor is tastefully done and room service was prompt and tasty. We had a partial ocean view facing the cottages. The common areas aren't anything to write home about. The pool area needs some attention and updating, preferably new lounge chairs and towels. The beach area is very nice and quiet. The free wireless internet is a big bonus!! The resort is a convenient short walk to Whaler's Village of restaurants and shops. With fewer families with children as guests, the Royal Lahaina is a lot less frenetic as the other resorts near it. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: Renee29
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I have to say I was a bit nervous, but our experience was wonderful. We upgraded to a partial ocean view room that had been newly renovated and it was lovely. The people were so friendly and helpful. With parking priced at $10 per day we thought it best to valet park for an extra $5 and it was great. This hotel is located on the best stretch of beach on Maui. We will definitely come back. Awesome vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Keeping it for myself”
Reviews.Author: tomket
Reviews.Content: I would love to tell you that we hated it, but I would be lying if I did. Much like the other review of recent, I was nervous about staying there but as soon as we saw the room and the beautiful view we were sold. We checked out the cottages and they are out dated and a little smelly, but the tower rooms are awesome. Modern and clean with a very comfortable bed. There was very minor construction noises and you could tell that the lobby and elevators hadn't been updated yet... but non of the minor problems could out way the rooms and view. That said, the beach was incredible. Rated #1 in Maui. Sandy beaches out front of the hotel and great snorkeling can be found 1000 ft in either direction. The staff was great. Say "How's it" to Wayne (the bellman) for me. He was super friendly and has a great knowledge of the best places on the island. A couple of suggestions: There is a SafeWay and Long's Drugs in Whalers Village. You can go there and get a case of water and some beer and snacks and keep them in the in room refrigerator. They also have a single serve coffee maker in the room that you can get pods for. We packed a bunch of snacks in some tupperware and brought it along as one of our checked bags. Then when we left we had an empty bag to put our souvenirs in. The best suggestion we can give you is Moose McGillycutty's. It's a restaurant in Downtown Lahaina. They offer a $1.99 breakfast from 7:30-8:30 and even if you don't wake up early enough, it's only $4.95 after that. Say hello to Michelle for me too. Check out the surfing at Honolua Bay. Awesome. Not for beginners. Check out the winery on the way to the volcano. And don't forget about Big Beach. (and little beach if you like it topless) All-in-all, it was great. Maui was great. But don't tell too many people about it because then they will want to come and soon it will be too busy for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Aloha spirit & grand room!”
Reviews.Author: jeannielovesmaui
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful stay at the Royal Lahaina. From the moment we drove our rental car to the hotel entrance until the moment we checked out, EVERY ONE was so friendly, helpful and we felt the Aloha spirit was alive and well at the Royal Lahaina! We were upgraded to a Delux Ocean View room on the 9th floor. Although the hotel is still pouring millions of dollars into renovation, we were never disturbed with dirt or noise. Our room was immaculate with fine linens, beautiful wood cabinetry, and a view of the ocean, mountains and sunset views to die for. The only thing we would have expected in a hotel in this price range would be an in-room safe. It seems as if there is a perfect location in the alcove above the coffee maker for installing a safe so maybe one is planned for the future. The parking lot was a bit hectic in the evening around the time of the very popular luau. They are trying to establish a special parking area for luau guests, but it seems they still need to work on this. The robes, toiletries, plasma screen TV, super hi-tech radio/alarm/ipod features were great. We didn't go to the pool, but it looked clean and inviting, not enough time. The convenience store on-site was expensive, but had all the necessities if you needed a quick snack, sunscreen, etc. The location is wonderful for getting around the island. The beach is beautiful and I could see that a wedding on-site would be gorgeous. I forgot an important business manual when I checked out. All it took was a quick phone call to confirm that housekeeping had found my binder and it was no problem to return to pick it up. Again, I can't stress how beautiful the room was and how wonderful the staff was. Don't hesitate to stay there! I did not check out the villas but once they are renovated, they will probably be great for families.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: vannie23
Reviews.Content: I took a family vacation with my husband and three children ages 15, 11, and 3 during 3/29/07 - 4/05/07. I was very concerned about staying at this resort due to the negative reviews I has read. We had a great time from the moment we arrived. All the staff was very polite and helpful, check in was very quick. We stayed in a cottage suite and it was very clean and was kept that way during our whole stay. The A/C worked great, showers worked great and were very clean. We had a great ocean view and my kids really enjoyed the pool as well as the beach. My only complain would have to be the luau. There is an enormouse line and even the hotel guests have to wait in that line. The seating in very crowded and it's on gravel so all of our shoes got filthy. The food was pretty good. For the price and the great beach I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HaleyR
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina is fantastic. Everything about our stay here was wonderful. The remodeled room was so beautiful, with dark wood furniture, and a great balcony looking over the ocean on one side, and the mountains and garden on the other. The only problem with the remodeling was that they didn't plan enough spots to hang your wet things - bathing suits, towels, etc, so we had to improvise a little. The hotel staff was all very nice and accomodating. The food in the lounge/restaurant was really good. Get the drink in the pineapple - it's served in a cup of dry ice - really impressive. The hotel is right on Kaanapali beach, one of the best in Maui, so I've heard. It was at least a half hour drive to the places we went for snorkeling, and an hour to Haiku for the Haleakala bike tour, but it was fine because we got to see more of the island that way. We ended up going to the luau at the Hyatt because the Royal Lahaina stopped doing the luaus on Saturday nights (I can't image why). The Hyatt looked out of this world luxurious, and probably out of this world expensive. If you can afford it, you could stay at the Hyatt, but for anything less, the RL would be perfect! You will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Lahaina, and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: katandkel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 1124 in the newly renovated tower rooms and had a good ocean view. Rooms were beautifully done. The bed was extremely soft and comfortable. Loved the inside shutter doors, so we could let our sliding glass door open every night. Beautiful view of the ocean and whale watching.The bad reviews of this place are not justified, if you are talking about this tower. Staff was very courteous. The onsite restaurant food was excellent and not overly priced. There were 2 smaller pools, but we used the ocean everyday. Did not like the fact that you could not bring chairs down to the beach or an umbrella. They did have a nice lawn area by the pool to use the chairs but I prefer to be down by the water. There is no shade on this beach. Buy your own chair and umbrella, especially if you want to visit other beaches, everyone charges to rent chairs. Extra charge of 16.00 a day to park your car, includes two Mai-tais a day,which is consistent with other resorts. Expedia desk on-site with excellent trip prices. Overall we were very pleased with this resort ,and I think in the future when they finish renovating with new pools, etc. you won't get the good price they are offering now. We would stay here again, and recommend this place to anyone looking for an Ocean front room at a decent price. The sound of the ocean waves every morning and night were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visitor”
Reviews.Author: LuckyWausau
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort for the 6th time. We had heard of the construction and were concerned, but only affected parking spaces. We stayed in one of the cottages the first two nites, and then transferred to the Hale Bldg for ocean front. We love the ocean front rooms, and enjoy the view. Two downsides - the cost of the breakfast buffet and the cost of parking. Hate to see the resort go the way of business and turn into condos. We like the casual atmosphere, and hope there will still be room for the casual traveler rather than condo owners.

Reviews.Title: “I had the best two weeks of my life at the Royal Lahaina!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hawaiilovers2
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that these people have anything bad to say about The Royal Lahaina. My husband and I got married in Hawaii three years ago. It was before they did any of the remodeling. Everything was perfect. The restaraunt, the service, the room service, the open bar by the pool, the views, the lobby, the location...it was all amazing. The property made us feel like we were in a fantasy. God is was beautiful! We stayed in one of the cottages the first night and then the tower the rest of the trip. The cottage was beautiful. There were tiki lights outside the balcony and we could hear the drums from a luau. The rooms weren't the most updated, but to us it just made it feel more rustic and authentic Hawaiian. All I can say is that the Royal Lahaina resort made our wedding and honeymoon the most fantastic 2 weeks of our lives! When we go back, we wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Arrived 3-6-07”
Reviews.Author: LittleandMale
Reviews.Content: Gave it a chance. Some reviews are bad and some great. The great ones were suspect. We have nothing bad to say so far, In-fact the newly renovated room is just as the photo had shown on Expedia. New everything. Extremely comfortable king bed, neat dressing area. New tile shower (no tub for the fiancÃ©, Blah). Nice art work. I asked about the renovation progress in the tower, they are working on the 3rd floor still. We are in tower 10th floor w/ ocean view. Cool LCD/HD wide screen TV. Comfy carpet. Very cool dark wooded floor to ceiling sliders. Tile on the lanai matches room entry, bathroom floor & shower. Mini fridge. Comfortable hallways. Service, To date the service has been pretty darn good. Seems everyone knows who butters their bread and all have worked hard for their tips. So you pay 15$ a day for parking and Valet, worth it, no wait yet and you're on vacation. Food is OK. We tend to eat at home normally, I'm a pretty good cook and the cooking here is better than mine. 36$ for two buffet breakfasts was pretty high but it was good. Excellent attitude in the restaurant. No Luau planned yet.. WOW. 2 weddings going on this evening just before sunset and a mamma and baby whale were just 100 yards or so off shore. VERY COOL. For others wondering about whales..EVERYWHERE..whales were visible from the shorelines all along the hwy as were drove up to Napili. Tips we got from reviews that paid off. Stop at Costco/Wal-Mart just after you get off the plane in the rental car. Get Coffee pods for the single cup coffee maker, get your beer. Corona is 14$ a six pack at the hotel store.17$ 12 pack at Wal-Mart. We over did the shopping for resort wear at home before leaving, BUY HERE. same price and you donâ€™t have to pack it to leave, bring home for summer at home. I'm not sure about resort provided internet, I brought my Clearw're internet from home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Phish5
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about staying here (on our Honeymoon) as I hadn't heard anything about it and no one I knew who had been to Maui had heard of it. We decided to chance it anyways as we were looking for something a little different from the Hilton hotels we were staying at in Hawaii and Waikiki. The hotel was great! Our room was amazing. We were on the 11th floor of the newly renovated tower and our room was just what I was looking for. The decor was what I thought of a typical Hawaii hotel room to be with the dark wood and shutters, a paddle on the wall and and a great bathroom. The bed was unbelievably comfortable as once my husband and I lied down we couldn't keep our eyes open. We had a great view of the ocean, the golf course, and the mountains. The buffet breakfast each morning was great and pretty reasonably priced considering we had just come from a very expensive hotel on the Big Island. We walked to Whaler's Village everyday along a path that took about 10-15 min. where there are shops, restaurants, more of the big hotels and met our snorkel boat cruise here.
