The parking at the hotel was a little annoying as it was hard to find a spot but there is always the option of doing valet for only a couple of bucks more. The pools were nothing spectacular but we didn't mind them as they weren't too crowded, it was easy to get a lounge chair compared to the other hotels where you have to get up early and hold your spot in a sea of chairs. There's also the option of the beach which is right by the pool and it's beautiful. You can see whales just from sitting at the pool. The sunsets are great as well. It is only a short drive into Lahaina where there are an abundance of restaurants and shops. We also found the staff and guests to be very friendly and it seemed as though a lot of the guests had been coming to the hotel year after year. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definately stay here again. There is also a Royal Kona on the Big Island that if I had known how great the Royal Lahaina was going to be we would have stayed there too.

Reviews.Title: “I would think twice about staying here”
Reviews.Author: CaK9lovers
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay here again !! The pictures looked great & we had been told the hotel had recently been remodeled. When we arrived the paint on the door jams in the hallways was peeling off. Our bed was wet from condensation from the a/c vent above it. The bathroom looked very old & worn. The grout between the ceramic tile in th shower was moldy. We were unable to sleep a few nights because of the howling of the wind thru the sliding glass door. The electricity went out a few times due to problems with the hotels electric panel. We had to walk up 10 flights of stairs to get to & from our room. Not a good experience at all !!!

Reviews.Title: “Spot on remodel on BEST beach location”
Reviews.Author: peasinapod
Reviews.Content: Returned last week for our second stay at this hotel- stayed there one year ago pre-remodel. Sooo nice now ! Beautiful dark wood shutters and woodwork in rooms, fresh eggshell and seafoam paint, sand colored basket-weave patterned berber carpet, nice soft linens and feather pillows and no yicky usual hotel comforter (thank you thank you!)- so nice to know that EVERYTHING on the beds is fresh, beautiful wood canoe-themed artwork and decor, and absolutely the BEST piece of beach that you could ask for ! My husband and I walked this beach for miles and easily came to the conclusion that this property is happily seated on the nicest piece of beach around. Beautiful clean sand, sheltered from the stinging wind that was sandblasting the hotels further north on this same beach, and snorkeling in coral is just a few hundred yards up the beach. We were upgraded from a garden view to a partial ocean view upon checking in at no additional cost- simply asking nicely will get you a long way. While I wouldn't expect this to be available at peak season, it never hurts to ask and it was so worth it! We were on the 9th floor and just left the balcony door open at night to be lulled to sleep by the sound of the waves. Still some remodeling to finish (there was no safe yet in the room and the pocket door to the newly tiled walk in shower and bathroom was really squeaky) but we loved it so much that we might go back next month for a long weekend ! Friendly, prompt, helpful service by everyone, very good restaurant- better than most in town, good luau- you won't go home hungry. Only negative things that I can say is that the elevator was temperamental at times but still pretty fast (I suspect due to the ongoing construction), and our friends staying in another room said their refridgerator was about room-temperature and were unable to get the problem corrected prior to their departure. Unfortunately, parking for our rental car was an additional $15 per day ( I don't know how other resorts handle their parking .) Despite this, the positives so outweigh any negatives that we cannot, cannot, cannot wait to go back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Royal Lahina!”
Reviews.Author: afeldpj
Reviews.Content: We were mislead by the pictures and the descriptions provided of the Royal Lahina on Maui. We were traveling for our honeymoon and did not expect to be so disappointed for what we had paid. Our safe was rusted to the floor of the bathroom. The water was luke warm and had no water pressure. The bed was a taco and the paneling was coming off the walls. It did not feel clean at all!!!!!!! Do NOT stay here!

Reviews.Title: “New rooms very nice- pools still cheesy”
Reviews.Author: kgirls
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feb 2007 and we got a newly remodeled tower room which couldn't be nicer nor with a better view of Maui. The dinner food was good. The breakfast buffet was just OK (I had better in the other 2 Hawaii hotels I stayed at on the other islands). The only negative I have with the RL is that the pools are very small and cheesy. They have 2 pools which are each the size of a backyard pool. The location and beach at the RL are superb. The Loua at the RL is kind of cheesy too and the buffet food at the loua is not too good. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest disappointment of Hawaiian trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: sandielou
Reviews.Content: This was a family trip taken the 1st 10 days of January and included me, my husband, and our 2 young adult daughters. When we drove onto this property, we were very excited. This came to a quick end when were shown to our room. It was totally removed from all the nice surrounding and in an older section of the resort. (We don't mind older, our favorite place was older) The room was drab and SMELLED BAD! We weren't even sure would we would be able to sleep. I wanted to go complain, but my family said no. There were no curtains, just this sliding wood panel that made you feel like you were in a cave when it was closed. About 2 am, we were woke up from a girl below us cussing a blue streak about her bike being stolen -- 'f' this and 'f' that. She said she had it stolen when she was working at a local resturant. In the morning, when I opened the 'wood curtain/wall', I saw construction workers below us leaving for work!! So it cost us about $300 that night to stay with the laborers!!! What a dive! We couldn't get out of there quick enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Be nice when it's finished”
Reviews.Author: GordonToulson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort for three days in January 2007 with a friend for a relaxing break. We were a little perturbed to see that there was construction/refurbishment work on-going when we arrived but this turned out to have a minimal effect on our stay. Our room was not ready when we arrived after check-in time but we were treated to cocktails in the bar while we waited. The room was in the old annex wing and we were pleased as there was work going on only in the main tower block rooms. We had no view from the balcony but the sun shone there in the afternoon. Due to the refurb. there were not many staying at the resort and so the gardens/pools etc. were quiet (as I like it!). When it is complete it will no doubt be fabulous as the location is on the best beach in Maui. A few minutes walk away (or free trolley shuttle bus) is the Whalers centre with bars, shops and restaurants to satisfy all tastes. Lahaina town is a short bus ride away. We felt that if we were to come again for a longer period then a hire car would offer much more freedom to explore this lovely island. Golfers would be in their element, although I did not find out the costs involved. Overall a pleasant and relaxing short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations are making for beautiful rooms. You can't beat the beach here!”
Reviews.Author: djsd
Reviews.Content: This was our 9th time in Hawaii as a family and I think our 8th time staying at the Royal Lahaina. They are currently working hard to renovate the hotel which was really needed and should really improve the property when completed. We were not aware of the renovations at the time of booking, unfortunately, and were not made aware until we received our final travel documents. But, the renovating noise or potential mess did not cause us any problems. Yes, half the parking lot was taken up with construction equipment, but the parking spaces have always been very small and plans are in the works for a future parking ramp. We stayed in newly remodeled rooms that are very nice. (Check out the Royal Lahaina website to see what the new rooms look like with soothing color schemes and dark woodwork.) Our children had an especially nice room with a bar area with bar stools. Because renovations are still in progress some of the amenities they list on the Royal Lahaina website are not yet available. There were no in-room safes and no wi fi -- yet. That was frustrating as we have always used the safe in the past. Although you can always use the front desk safe, I had no desire to stop there several times a day to drop off valuables. One of the things I like about the Royal Lahaina is the size of the hotel's tower. It is not very large so it is easy to run back up to the room if you have forgotten something. And, one of the things I love is the beach. It is just a beautiful stretch of beach that is not very busy. It is getting busier at the far end where Westin is building. Also, the location is wonderful! It is about a 50 minute drive from the airport. Once at the hotel, you are close to Whalers Village and Lahaina for shopping and restaurants. We have never stayed in the cottages and I wasn't really aware of the Royal Hale area. If you go, make sure you stay in the main tower. The biggest downside of the Royal Lahaina -- and this is huge for people like us that are traveling as a larger family -- is that as part of the renovations all the connecting room doors were covered over. There are no adjoining rooms! This was unbelievable to me. Yes, the soundproofing was better, but what are they thinking for families?? And, they assured us before we came that we would have no problems with our reservations yet neglected to tell us that there was no way we could have adjoining rooms. This is enough of a problem for us, even though our four children are a lot older now, that I don't know if we'll go back to this hotel. We may have to investigate condos instead. I say this with sadness because we have stayed there so many times that when we arrive we feel like we've come home and we feel so comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel, Bad Service and Awful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelingRADMD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Kona Resort on the "Big Island" and the Royal Lahaina on Maui. I believe both resorts are operated by the same group. Our other option was to stay at an Embassy Suites for an extra $60 per day. I would rate this hotel 2.5 stars. We stayed for a week. The first room we were booked into had 3 inches of water in the bathroom from a leak in a ceiling pipe. We were then given an "upgraded romantic" Cottage room. We did not like the fact that there were 3 roachs in the bathtub and a few in the room, but were tired and understood this was a tropical place ... . Over the next few days we noticed that there were rat droppings in our room. We were about to ditch the place and pay for a second hotel during our stay. After a lot of complaining we were moved back to the tower into a decent room. Overall the service was not attentive and did not want to acknowlege any problems. I would never stay there again. There are too many other good hotels on Maui. When we go again we will probably stay at Kahana Village, which can be a great deal for a family.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful week at the Royal Lahaina!”
Reviews.Author: mdtraveler1234
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at Christmas at the Royal Lahaina and had a wonderful time. The three generations of our family that stayed there had a wonderful experience. This was our second visit to the Royal Lahaina -- the first being nearly 20 years ago. I was a little leery of staying there this time after reading all of the bad reviews. Our stay was a very pleasant surprise. We found the staff to be remarkable, the grounds to be immaculate, and the rooms (we stayed in the cottages) to be clean and comfortable. For the price, you can't go wrong. It is convenient to Lahaina -- only a short drive or a trolley ride away -- and the ocean views were spectacular. We were able to sit poolside or on the beach or in the lounge most afternoons and have a front row seat to whalewatching. Yes...it is currently under construction, but the construction noise was very tolerable. Yes...there are parts of the hotel that are a bit outdated and will be replaced as the renovation is completed. My biggest complaint would probably have to be that parking spots were too small and too close together. I suspect that is due to the fact that part of the parking has been taken over by construction equipment. Hopefully, once the renovation is complete they will make the spaces a wee bit bigger. I would strongly recommend the Royal Lahaina to most any family traveling. If you are into luxury, this is not your place, but if you are interested in a decent value for the price with a stellar beachfront location, I would recommend the Royal Lahaina in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad....A few hiccups!”
Reviews.Author: Harvsman
Reviews.Content: Way back in mid 2002 a friend and i were travelling through hawaii and we booked into this place for 8 nights. Our reservation stated a standard room and when we checked in we were issued a key and proceeded to our room in a single storey part of the resort. It was disgusting!!!!!! It was dirty, hardly anything worked properly (The tv remote didnt work and neither did the replacement remote they gave us) and when i picked up the phone to order a pizza it went dead even after we'd checked the connections! Furious and feeling we had been ripped off pricewise (we had spent nearly $250 AUD a night), my travel buddy went to see the reception desk and spoke to the manager at the time who happened to be Australian himself! he apologised and upgraded us for free into a room in the beach tower with a full ocean view. The room was much cleaner, spacious and had everything we needed. The facilities were great, and there was a bus just outside reception that would come on the hour and for a $1 would take you into Lahaina Town. (One of the drivers was a hilarious character but his name escapes me) All in all an ok experience but don't book into the Royal Hale wing which was where our original room was!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this placeâ™¥â™¥”
Reviews.Author: Ruskian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the royal Lahaina as part of our honeymoon. We were touring america for a month so money was tight. The Royal was cheap and superbly located so it was ideal. Yes it was a little shabby, and yes there was construction going on but we still had an excellant time. You couldn't hear the construction from our room or the beech/pool. Some parts of the building were slightly shabby, but far less so than some of the dumps that have the nerve to call themselves 4 star that I have stayed at. It was clean, the rooms were large and well equipped, the staff were unbelievably friendly, the location was brilliant, the beech was a minute walk from your hotel room, the cocktails from the onsite bar were the best, the restaurant food deliscious and the views from them both breath-taking, what more do you want? If your minted and into staying in boring, bland, modern marble constructions, then yes this place isn't for you. But if your more economically challenged and are going away for enjoyment, quality time, and the REAL hawaii, then this place is the place to be. Ok, we didn't stay in the Royal Hale wing which apparently is particularly bad, but ensure you don't get booked in there, or worst case, ask to swap. The other rooms are fine and the staff are most accomadating.

Reviews.Title: “New rooms Nice!”
Reviews.Author: jndaudet
Reviews.Content: We booked a little tentatively at the Royal Lahaina after reading some of the reviews but after research we found out that the main hotel one of the oldest in Maui was being renovated and was supposed to be ready for visitors in November. Indeed we received a newly renovated room on the 12th floor the room was beautiful with an ocean view as promised check in was easy although we were late and very tired after a 14 hours flight and they kept us waiting in the lobby for the one bellhop to come to take us up to our rooms we waited a while and then went up ourselves being too tired to wait. The rooms were beautiful the beds are super comfortable- there were renovations going on even on our floor we would see workman but we heard no noise in our room. However when you sit at the pool during the day the serenity is disturbed by quite loud work noise. Check out was a long wait as they had one person working and we waited almost one-half hour to check out -- that being the most annoying aspect of the hotel. Otherwise we enjoyed our stay immensly.

Reviews.Title: “Totally under construction”
Reviews.Author: mauigypsy
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this resort in March of 2003 and were very happy with most everything even though the hotel and cottages are old. When I booked with Pleasant Holidays, this time, they did not tell us that the hotel (tower) and surrounding grounds were under heavy construction. Upon our arrival, I asked for a cottage which they gave us, but the cottage was in bad shape. We encountered roaches in the room which was unnerving. We also found out while checking in that the hotel charges $10.00 per day for parking and/or an optional package for $16.00 per day that includes the daily parking fee, 2 drinks at only one bar, coffee in your room and usage of the safe in your room. You can only order a Mai Tai, so if you like beer, you are out of luck. We paid the $16.00 because they will charge you separately for each thing anyway. We couldn't lay out by either pool because the construction noise was so loud you couldn't stand it. Also, this resort has a Luau every day and we had a difficult time trying to find a place to park; even though they designate hotel guest parking, people park anywhere they can. And, to top that off, the construction crew have huge trucks they park in our guest spots. Go figure! The staff was very accomodating even though they are down to the minimum. They are renovating the tower, plan to tear down all the cottages and are putting up condos and time shares in their place. The grounds are very beautiful and the beach is great. I believe when they get finished it will be a great hotel to stay at, but most likely very, very expensive. I also would suggest not to go on the dinner cruises. The boats are very, very old. We took the boat cruise over to Molokai and that boat needs to be taken out of commission. It is horrible. We saw a tremendous amount of construction while we were in Maui and I assume once they finish all the new hotels, condos and time shares ( alot of time shares), the price of a hotel room will be out of reach for some. We did find a great restaurant in Whalers Village, the Hula Grill. Good food at a good price. Stay away from Basil Tomato, the food is average, very expensive and they add their own tip of 17%. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui99
Reviews.Content: I can't believe all the negative comments about this place. I got married there in 2003 and loved it so much went back for our anniversary the next year. Yes, I agree the hotel is old and it does need updating in some areas but you go there for the location right on the beach (which is FAR from crappy!) where in Spring you can watch and listen to the humpback whales. Yes, you will pay less for a better hotel in Honolulu but that is beacuse Honolulu is a much more touristy/busy place!!!. Don't stay in the Hale tower because that is the oldest and sits above the Luau. Staff are wonderful. Breakfast islovely but expensive so we went to the cafe every morning and got a bagel and a cup of tea and sat on the beach with our breakfast. Dinner's aren't great but a 10 minute walk along the beach and there are plenty of other restuarants to choose from, or Basil Tomatoes is wonderful with an amazing view over the golf course and down to the beach. Lahaina town is a drive away but is well worth it for the restaurants alone. This place is a slice of heaven and if the flights weren't so long (11 hours to LA then another 5.5 to Maui) I would go back there year after year. Even if this place isn't 5 star luxury the location is.....

Reviews.Title: “slow paced and under construction but good staff”
Reviews.Author: elzabeth
Reviews.Content: staff is hands down the olny reason you should go.if you are into listening to construction and paying too much with a crappy beach. then you've got the right place. other wise stay anywhere eles if not, then suffer and enjoy it. parking is absolutely rediculous and so are the fee's. mai tias are crap too. buffet was ok but they raised the price 18.50 per person. tip rememeber all beaches are pulic property and no-hotel is off limits 5.00 dollars will valet your car anywhere and you can enjoy nice beaches at any posh hotel if you so desire i'm sure in 2010 when construction is finised you will love this place. pictures look great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms-Too Expensive”
Reviews.Author: karching
Reviews.Content: After staying in honolulu, we found this place a little too pricey. (Make sure you have transfers otherwise the local taxi driver will take advantage of you as the resort is a fair way away.)They put us into a room right next to the Luau show (free music everynight) plus luau was good. Only ate there once as too pricey, went to Hotel next door more. Drinks were too pricey so stayed in room and drank. Has a service bus that can take you to the golf course or to Royal Lahaina whalers villiage, but staff did not inform us of this, we found out ourselves. The hotel was really nice but lacked atmosphere plus I found some of the staff pretty rude as we got told off for taking a cocktail out to the pool area, the barman ran out after us with a plastic cup instead-which put me off totally. We were misinformed as a staff member told us of happy hour as we first arrived only to be informed after we bought drinks that it was for the Hotel situated next door. Maybe find out what that Hotel that is and stay there as the food was great there too. Would I stay here again- Prob no, as I did not like Maui that much - overpriced etc but I did like my room. If I had to stay in Maui again-maybe, but I doubt it. 0

Reviews.Title: “Nice but shabby.”
Reviews.Author: c8te
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my vacation in Maui and at the Royal Lahaina Resort. Although the staff was very friendly and courteous and the grounds were beautiful the hotel was not. I booked my trip through the Hawaiian Visitors Center on line. A very big mistake. Keep in mind I booked my trip 8 months in advance and was never notified either by the visitors center nor the hotel that the ocean view room, was not available in fact the hotel was under a complete renovation. I was told this at 10:30PM when I arrived at the Royal Lahaina (after a 10 1/2 hr flight from NY to Maui). FYI, I called the hotel at least three times before my trip to ensure that my room and reservation were confirmed!!! No one said anything about a renovation. Although they did give me a cottage suite (this was also the only cottage left) worth more than my hotel room the cottage was in need of renovation itself. It was fairly clean but very old and shabby. The staff only made the bed and changed the towels, no one cleaned. The island of Maui is a must see but I cannot say the same for the Royal Lahaina. One other thing my sister tried sending flowers to my room (for my brthday) and the hotel staff kept giving her the run around and never connected her to the florist. They also, never sent me her phone call. Really, the staff needs upgrading too!!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Resort Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: cgondek111
Reviews.Content: Believe what the negative reports say about this resort! We spent 2 nights there, one on each end of our cruise. We would have cancelled the second night, but the penalty would have been as much as the room cost (great hawaiian vacations will not refund or allow you to change). Nov. 2 we arrived and were given a room in the Hale building that HAD NO AIR CONDITIONING, and was never fixed. In addition, it was on the first floor, with a fence in front of the lanai door, so no air flow for the whole night. We had 2 other couples with us, who also had no air conditioning, but they were on upper floors, so at least could get a breese. Mold in the bathrooms. Most of the rooms in the Hale building seem to be occupied by the construction workers.This facility charges $10/day for parking that is not listed in the pre-reservation information. The grounds are nice and the beachfront lovely. This resort is in the early stages of totally gutting their towers, and we met people who thought they had ocean view rooms in the towers, and were sent to villas in the back of the property with no ocean view. On our return to maui, we checked in early, were given the number of our room, but the key was not ready, so we went out to lunch, until the room was available. On our return, we were told they had overbooked and they had no room for us and we were to go to a different property! This happened to a number of folks, as we met them all at the front desk of our new hotel! Luckily, we were sent to the Maui Kaanapali Villas next door, which was an absolutely great place! The room there was spacious , the facilities superb, and the staff very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “a great honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: LesJB47
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina for 7 nights to honeymoon. We had the honeymoon package which included buffet breakfast each day, complementary champagne on arrival, a sunset dinner sail, and the luau on premise. We arrived after a LONG flight and check in was a breeze. We opted for the 16 dollar fee that included coffee, parking, phone calls, safe, and your 2 mai tais at Don the Beachcomber each day. Well worth it. We stayed in a beach cottage, it was decent sized, clean, and gave you a sense of privacy. DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A RESORT VIBE! The decor is in need of updating, but they are in the process of a multi-million dollar renovation, and from the looks of the plans, it should be pretty amazing when complete. The overall location is great too, as you don't have to deal with a lot of the West Maui traffic from the Kapalua resorts and it is more central to popular tourist destinations (Haleakala, road to Hana, Waleia), you are also walking distance from Whalers Village, a cute shopping area with some good restaurants (we ate at Hula Grill). We ate dinner there the first night and it was well above average. The fish was very fresh and the waitstaff was attentive. In fact, I cannot say enough about the staff. They went out of their way to make sure our needs were met. An upside to the renovations taking place was that the resort was booked at only about 20% occupancy, you felt like you had it to yourself, never had to worry about seats at the pool or bars, and got to know most of the staff. The breakfast buffet was far superior to many of the buffets I have had at carribean all inclusives- the Hawaiian "POG" juice is really really good (try with vodka later in the day for a great cocktail that is a refreshing break from the super sweet mai tais). There were alot of birds flying around if you ate breakfast outside, didn't bother us, but may bother some, so felt it was worth mentioning. Throughout our stay we ate our dinners elsewhere, but had many snacks/lunches on premise, we were never disappointed. Don the Beachcomber is a little dark and musty, but the drinks are good, and the staff friendly, they don't have a food menu though, just pretzels and wasabi peas at the bar. There are two pools, both were kept neat and clean, with no problem getting a seat. The only thing was that there wasn't much shade and the sun is HOT! There is a small bar next to the pool closer to the beach. One thing that was disappointing to me (a true beach bum), is that you couldn't bring the chaise lounges to the beach. If you wanted to lay on the beach directly you either were on a towel or blanket, or brought your own chair. The beach was very secluded though, something that seems to be harder and harder to find on Maui nowadays, so that was nice. The luau was a lot of fun, only one I've been to so I can't compare. Staying at the hotel does mean you get to jump the line. The staff was fabulous, funny, and went out of their way to put on a good show. The buffet food was great as well. The sunset dinner sail was a good time, virtually everyone was a honeymooner, food was tasty as well. The honeymoon package was definitely the way to go. My husband and I also had the pleasure of being on Maui for the earthquake...the Royal Lahaina went out of their way to make guests feel comfortable and reassured. The entire island was out of power till around lunch time, and the staff kept replenishing complimentary juices, coffee, breads, and pastries. The hotel staff barely skipped a beat. Overall, if you are looking for a break from the big resorts and crowds, want an attentive staff, and are low maintenance travelers like myself and my husband, book the Royal Lahaina now, before the renovations are over, and it joins the ranks of the rest of the expensive resorts on Kaanapali Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Royal Lahaina!”
Reviews.Author: SisterAlex
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been building a brand new tower of new rooms for over a year. They are still under construction, and plan on demolishing the old rooms when they are done building. There is a good reason for that...the old rooms are absolutely terrible. We arrived with a small group of friends and relatives for a wedding, and one by one everyone was moved out of the hotel to different properties or "garden cottages" because the old rooms are disgusting. Stained carpet, linens, bedspreads, soiled furniture, rusty water backing up into sinks, broken A/C, bad smells, you name it. Everyone had a problem with their rooms. Some of our relatives laid sheets over the beds in order to sleep on them, because the stains and smell were so bad on the existing linens. While the staff did manage to move everyone out of the old rooms for the week (some went to cottages, which are very small and old themselves), I would avoid this property until the new construction is up and running completely, when there is no chance of being booked into that old broken down hotel. Better yet, if you can afford it, book yourself into the Hyatt just up the beach, which is a wonderful property with a staff that will guarantee you the "royal" treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: N&AYOUNG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina for our wedding and honeymoon from 28th September for 5 nights. Check in was quick and easy and our whole party were upgraded to cottacge rooms. The rooms were very clean and all of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful at all times. The beach in front of the hotel was amazing and the pool areas were great too. There were no guests staying in the main tower due to refurbishment so the hotel was not overly busy, other than that we were not affected by the refurbishment at all. The hotel had a traditional feel which we loved and found it to be far more relaxing and enjoyable than some other hotels we have stayed in. We were married on the beach in front of the hotel and can homestly say it was the best holiday experience of our lives. We were sad to leave and will definitely stay there again. Although I'm sure the hotel will be amazing when the refurbishment is complete, if you are looking for a bland commercial atmosphere go elsewhere. If you are looking for the true spirit of Aloha book the Royal Lahaina now!

Reviews.Title: “The Beach is the only Plus”
Reviews.Author: gabsnrabs
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel! The pictures look much nicer on the website, but the hotel badly needs an extreme makeover! Reading some of the other reviews, I guess the Royal Hale building is the worst place on the property which is where we unfortunately ended up staying. They were refurbishing the main tower, so we could not get an upgrade when we were there. We went on a family trip, so I will admit the kids loved it, they loved the pool, although it was ok. I will also agree with the other reviewers that the beach is excellent. The first two days that we were there, I just wanted to get out of there, but I will admit, that there is no beach quite like this one anywhere on Maui. You don't need to go anywhere else but just a few steps to enjoy the best beach, which is the only reason I would reconsider in staying here again. However, I would definitely look into other resorts on Kaanapali Beach before booking here again. By the way, the luau is ok, again good for kids and it is pretty cheap. If you use the coupon books they give you in town, usually kids are free, so it is worth it, although I've heard that the Old Lahaina Luau is the best in town.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up for the Royal Lahaina!”
Reviews.Author: Dave&JannyBrizius
Reviews.Content: Our most recent stay at the Royal Lahaina was this past May (2006). We always choose the Royal Lahaina if it is available because it is so economical, but with the feel of luxury. This May we stayed in the cottages, which by now may have been torn down to construct the new building. Sad, but that's progress, I guess. We probably have stayed at this resort 10 or more times, and we have always found them to be very willing to fulfill our every desire. Of course the luau is one of the best in the Islands. Even the food is good, which is not always the case at luaus! We really recommend the Royal Lahaina to anyone looking for a quality place that won't break the bank! Dave and Janice Brizius, Bainbridge, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, we loved it”
Reviews.Author: monamecha
Reviews.Content: Of course, we didn't read all the negative reviews until after our travel agent already booked us. DANG, I wish I had never looked online for reviews!! I did a lot of worrying about it because there were so many negative reviews. This was our honeymoon, we stayed in an oceanfront cottage, it was GREAT!! We had a beautiful view, a nice little room that was clean and safe, we had no problems. You should know, they are currently rennovating the MAIN tower, the one directly over the lobby. That whole building was un-occupied so we basically had the whole resort to ourselves. We ate breakfast and lunch out on our lanai. We knew ahead of time about the extra charges (parking, safe, etc.) so that didn't bother us. Parking was not an issue while we were there because of the fact that the main building was out of service. We had a great time, no problems. Everyone was really nice. Our first night there, my husband pressed the "pin out" button (on the inside of the door handle) so we were locked out of our room at 11pm, it took about 20 minutes and 5 employees, but then one guy came over who had the magic touch and let us into our room! We really enjoyed the place, the grounds are beautiful, the pool is beautiful, the beach is FANTASTIC and the restaurant was nice, no more expensive than anywhere else on the island. A gecko fell on my head from the ceiling of the patio, that was hilarious! We had a great time!! Snorkeling in Napili was also nice, just driving around the island was so fun!

Reviews.Title: “We liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: msj57
Reviews.Content: We have been to Maui four times and always have stayed at the Royal Lahaina and found it to be a friendly hotel and had no problems. It is an older hotel and it may have gone down since we were there, however, we loved the location and the beach and we always have a room with an ocean view.. It was not overly priced and we liked that. We are going back next year and since some of you have had bad experiences and it is under renovation, not sure what to do.

Reviews.Title: “We had a few problems in paradise!”
Reviews.Author: HESSEPO
Reviews.Content: We were not given the room we had been promised and even though we were given that room the last 3 days, nevertheless we had to stay at a lesser room for 4 days. there were ants in the room, and other minor annoyances. the people are great with the exception of the night manager at the front lobby..

Reviews.Title: “Great Value; Beach Not Jammed With People Like Major Resorts”
Reviews.Author: Webman
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money. If you are looking for the Westin or Sheraton or other upscale resort, look elsewhere. If you're looking to spend a lot less money for something almost as good, this is a great value. PROS: Beach much less crowded than that by the major resorts just to the south (we were shocked at the mobs at the beach in front of the Sheraton). Good price (especially in the regular rooms; cottages are not worth the upgrade). Excellent oceanfront restaurant. Kids eat free at meals with adult dinner or breakfast. Reasonable prices throughout. Nice, large grounds. Many convenient stores on site, including a large general store stocked with just about everything one might need at reasonable prices. CONS: Construction in the main tower (we stayed in another 3-story tower at the north end, so didn't hear any noise); luau every night at north end (loud at our end until around 10:00, though was pleasant Hawaiian music); $10 per day parking. Rooms somewhat dated but comfortable, no bugs--we are not interested in paying $$$$ for marble or top of the line art. Overall, we were very happy and saved lots of money compared to brand name resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: pixel_93
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so expensive that we expected a lot more because of the price. Wrong! It is old, run down, the decor is tacky and the fixtures are ancient. The beds are uncomfortable and the pillows are a joke - talk about lumps! And the towels and linens - blechk! The pool area was so uninviting that we did not even think about going in. We tried desperately to book a room anywhere else, but every place we called was sold out. Luckily we only had to stay 2 nights before we went on to our next stop. At Royal Lahaina you are getting a 2 star hotel at a 4 star hotel price! Stay somwhere else.

Reviews.Title: “1960's Style Dive Motel”
Reviews.Author: Mets666
Reviews.Content: After coming from the beautiful and posh Princeville in Kuwai, it was quite a disapointment arriving at the Royal Lahaina. We did not expect much as we were staying for 3 nights before heading to The Four Seasons and this was going to be our "cheap" stay. But despite that, we were shocked at how disgusting this place was. Upon entering the lobby, it is like being transformed to 1965 - picture an old episode of Hawaii 5-0. Nothing has been changed since then, the decor is still trapped in this decade. Okay, hopefully the rooms would be better, but upon receiving a key! A real key - I knew we were in trouble. I cant remember the last time I stayed at a hotel where they still used keys and not swipe cards. It didnt even come with a key chain, just a key in an envelope. The room was disgusting! Tiny, and we were upgraded to an ocean view. Small terrace overlooking the ocean on one side and the noisy remodeling construction on the other side. Umm, a little late to remodel no? I mean this was long over due since the Carter administration. Our bed was hard as a rock, the blanket was disgusting and cheap quality, the pillows - all 2 of them, were flat and dirty~! The lovely green carpeting had stains on it. The AC barely worked, but we did have a ceiling fan that was about to fly off its hinges and out the window. The safe, which was an extra $4 a day, looked like an World War II era industrial Nazi piece of machinery that barely worked. Ive seen nicer bathrooms in the YMCA. The shower was disgusting and made for midgets. The towels were like cleaning your self in sand paper. After seeing the room we felt it time to leave the room and explore the grounds. The pools were just boring. One pool was filthy, with garbage floating in it. Lovely. Lucky for me they stop giving towels out at the pool at 5 pm so I couldnt go in anyway. They have the nerve to call thier covered lounge chairs cabanas and make you pay extra for that!! The beach on the property has enough sand to maybe fit a 3 people laying out on it, hardly a beach. We decided to use a free drink coupon and head to the Beachcomber bar. Again, the atmosphere reminded me of something out of a 1960's Hawaii television show and was mobbed with 2 other people. I could not even get my free drink becuase I had left my hotel ID card in the room. That's right, they give everyone an ID card, like being at work or in school. Sounds fun huh? The positives are we were able to book the rest of our stay at the Whalers Village down the road. Only a bit more expensive, but 100x better to stay as we waited to arrive at The Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Love it and plan to return”
Reviews.Author: Terriwa
Reviews.Content: I planned this vacation for my family through the hawaiian resort and hotel website. This was great booked air, hotel, and car, prices were great. The hotel was nice we had a garden view room ( I got lots pictures of sunsets over the ocean for a garden view). The breakfast was fabulous freshly made foods. The staff was extremely helpful. We were only feet from the most beautiful beach and the resort was very family friendly. It was very important to me that I could leave my teenagers on the beach with out being bothered. Families with younger children were in a different area. The Luau was beautiful and full of tradition, I also like how they shared the Christian heritage that is in Hawaii. I have recommended this hotel to many. As to negatives I read I would have to disagree. When you go to this resort you feel so relaxed. It is clean, a little older in decor, but that wasn't really that bad with all the beauty around you. They have a restraunt, and a beachcomber bar, cottages, and different price level buildings. Not a lot of late night parties and the grounds were all clean and kept up well. Yes the ground is a little hot, but the tradewinds were great. This was my first trip here with my children who now hold the same love for Hawaii as I. Thank you to the Royal Lahaina Resort for making it so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Royal Lahaina!”
Reviews.Author: Moonsmilie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I eloped to Maui but with a limited budget, Royal Lahaina was perfect for us. I read some of the reviews on this site that advised to only get a cottage as the rooms were not great. We stayed in the oceanfront cottage to the right of the 'royal suite' cottage, it was literally 10 feet from the beach!! I couldn't imagine anyone writing a bad review of this beautiful place until I went to get a replacement key for our cottage and an unhappy guest was at the front desk, waiting on the manager. She told me that the Hale wing was right next to where the luau is held every night and that it is impossible to hear anything but banging drums and people shouting. She and her family hadn't slept for two nights and was UPSET. A few nights later, we attended the luau and sure enough, the Hale wing is overlooking the dining area of the luau. And it was loud! I can't imagine having a room right next to this event! What poor planning! Luckily, our cottage was on the far end of the property, where it was VERY dark and VERY quiet. But we wouldn't have known any better if we hadn't done a bit of research. Do not stay in the Hale wing!!! The grounds around the cottages are very well kept, the service is friendly, and the breakfast buffet every morning was outstanding!! Our room was cleaned everyday with fresh flowers left on the pillows. The bathroom was spacious with a big closet for luggage and a nice deep tub perfect for soaking. Probably our favorite part of the whole trip was being so close to the beach. The southern part of Kaanapali is packed compared to the north part. We actually got married on the beach about 50 feet from our cottage, at sunset and there was maybe 10 people on the entire beach besides us!! If you like moonlight strolls, the Sheraton at Black Rock is within walking distance (you follow the golf course path) where there are a couple of really excellent restaurants. We never ate at the Royal Lahaina other than for breakfast. Overall, we would definately stay here again and again, as it was close enough to other resorts to enjoy the 'touristy' stuff, but secluded enough to feel like you're truly in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “So So.. Bit Old, too pricy but good location and grounds”
Reviews.Author: Onie13
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here on a honeymoon in November 2002 in the Royal Hale tower section. The room was just ok, partial ocean view room. Room just seemed a bit old and over priced. Pool area, beach and grounds were all nice though. You will need a car to get around though. Would say a 3 star property. Maui though - was awesome! Wouldnt stay there again, think you could get a nicer place for same value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Sunsets”
Reviews.Author: Pineappleboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the 4th holidays and we didn't regret it one time. My wife and I would stay here again in a heart beat. We still have the enlarged photo of one of the most beautiful sunsets we have ever seen the photo was taken from the Royal Lahaina beach front. The food was great and the people were very friendly, the location was great & was close to all of the attractions in Lahaina. ALOHA

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Florida_Traveler16
Reviews.Content: We booked the Royal LaHaina on Maui with the expectations that we would be in a wonderful hotel on the beach and we paid the money to match this expectation. This hotel and their service left much to be desired. The check in and check out is slow and antiquated and during check out I found that the billing was incorrect. This hotels also charges for every "extra" including parking, beach chairs, sports equipment, etc. In addition, major renovation was occuring during the time of our stay and we did not have any advance notice of this. On the one full day we were there, the air conditioning was turned off for the enitre day and that just added to the ambiance of drilling and hammering. The hotel manager did call to inform us of the air conditioning turn off but no attempt was ever made to compensate us for the inconvenience nor the disappointment with this hotel. I am exptremenly disappointed since many other fine hotels are also in this area. On the up side, the food we ate there was very well done.

Reviews.Title: “Magnum P.I.”
Reviews.Author: TahoeFamily4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort over Easter Vacation. We had a hard time finding something affordable due to the holiday. The package with the Royal Lahaina was in our price range and in a good location on the island. We were a bit apprehensive due to the reviews. Also, I work for a resort and travel and stay in Hiltons and Hyatts etc. and can get picky. The Royal Lahaina very pleasantly surprised us. It was very reminiscent of Hawaii Five-O, the Brady Hawian Vacation Episode and Magnum P.I. We stayed in the motel style accommodations. We had a great view of the beach from hour lanai and it was very quiet. We had adjoining rooms and the rooms were large and very clean. We were very happy with the housekeeping. I can see that for some people the layout of the rooms (only a small shower) would be old and the furniture outdated. But the beds were very comfortable and we slept very well. The location to Black Rock was great for snorkeling and crowded (to be expected). The beach in front of the Royal Lahaina was great and we went swimming a lot. The prices for the food were fine with us but we live in a resort town and are used to higher prices. We ate at the restaurant at the hotel a few times. We really liked the Comfort Zone (I think that is the right name) in the strip mall up the street. We tried it towards the end of our vacation and wished we had found it earlier. The only thing were we unhappy with was the day spa. They cancelled our couples massage 1/2 hour before it was scheduled and we stayed at the hotel all morning because of the appointment. I would go somewhere else. Overall we were really happy with the Royal Lahaina. It was clean, large, comfortable and the staff was nice. I would recommend it to my friends. You can not beat the price and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Get there, SOON!”
Reviews.Author: pake
Reviews.Content: Experience a piece of Ka'anpali history before it is GONE! A local friend helped us with the reservations and we were very impressed! Too bad the place is scheduled for demolition, soon. The other less favorable reviews might be correct, but if you want to experience how Maui used to be, then you should rush to make a reservation before it is gone. The place feels real! The tower is already in the midst of a major makeover, but the cottages are charming and spacious. The outdoor lanais feel like you're in your own backyard...if you lived in Maui. The service was friendly and accomodating. Our shower drain backed up, so we called and the engineer was over in ten minutes to fix the problem. The bar "Don the Beachcomber" is definitely a DO NOT MISS! Campy decor with decent cocktails. Buy the services package that includes daily parking, free local telephone calls, in room safe, and TWO "Mai Tai's" (the bartenders might make a substitution) It is a shame that the character is going to be bulldozed, soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach-bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: 50 states before I die
Reviews.Content: I would only come back here for the beach. The beach is within footsteps of your room and I spent every minute there swimming. The room and grounds need a huge makeover. Unless they plan on lowering the price, I can't lower my expectations-this 'resort' cost a lot. My room was dirty and smelly. The shower tiles were falling off the walls and floor. The fridge knob didn't work and 2 mechanics could not fix or replace it. The doorwall had piles of dead and live bugs in the tracks. The pool by the tennis courts was filled with leaves and dirt-it looked like it hadn't been used all year. At check out don't be surprised when they charge you a daily rate for parking and for the in room safe (which I never used-and refused to pay- after talking to the manager I didn't have to) THe shops are nice to look at, but have nothing of interest to actually buy. The free shuttle is great since parking is so limited. The beach rocked!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina Resort, Maui was an excellent choice for the perfect vacation. The hotel is a quiet and relaxing place to stay. My trip was for 13 days and I was treated with exceptional service. The staff was fantastic from housekeeping all the way up to the executives. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The food and drinks were wonderful. Great breakfast buffet. The rooms had an excellent view. I'd say mine was one of the best. The pools could have been larger and more tropical, but with the beach a few steps away, why be in the pool anyway? The sunsets from the "Barefoot Bar" pool area and actually everywhere on site were beautiful. The winds blow in and give it a cool atmosphere daily. The "Ice-Cream Scoop" shop was the place for a cool afternoon treat. Shopping on site for clothing or personal items was very convenient. They have an exciting nightly Luau making it feel and sound very tropical. The ATM and activity desk located in the lobby helped you plan an excursion and have money before you left the hotel. I will stay with the Royal Lahaina on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary also this was the 1st vacation we have been able to take by ourselves in 30 years. We were pleasantly surprised at the property. This was the second choice through our travel agent and she didn't know the property all that well. The room was a bit dated but they are in the process of renovating the entire property. Even though we had a "garden view" when we looked left there was a perfect view of the ocean. Very nice view from our room all around. The property in general was clean and well kept. The staff, especially Dwight the bar tender were great! I would definately go back there. If you are planning on attending the Lua I would recommend paying extra for the premium seating as that gets you closer to the action and first in line for food. It was very easy to get around by using the free trolley and public bus for $1.00 Pool(s) were well kept and clean as was the surrounding areas. The only warning we would give is to watch out for the birds, especially in the mornings as they will grab your food if you let them. We can't wait to go back and are looking at doing so next year.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: MChiddy
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults 2 kids under the age of 10) just returned from a seven night stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort and had a terrific time. Like most of you, I read all of the recent reviews and took a lot of time in deciding on the Royal Lahaina. We figured that the reality was somewhere in the middle of "fantastic" and "awful", plus the location can't be beat. We booked a 1 bedroom garden view cottage, so we were able to avoid the noisy remodeling in the tower rooms. Yes, the property is older (built in the 60's), but the rooms provided everything we needed for our week at the beach. The kitchen was stocked with dishes, glassware, coffee pot, microwave, etc. We picked up a few groceries and were set. Our cottage had 2 bathrooms which needed a bit of updating, but were fully functional and clean considering their age. The maid service was great, we left a lot of sand everywhere and not a grain to be found once we returned in the evenings. There were a few little bugs here and there, but I think that the climate is more to blame than the cleanliness of the rooms. All of the windows can be opened with or with out screens, which makes it easy for critters to fly in and out. Our cottage was located on the outskirts of the property right next to the golf course, which are in the process of being fixed up and landscaped. The first morning we woke to the sounds of a tractor at 7am, but that was the only morning we were disturbed. The property is going through major remodeling, and we were told that eventually all of the cottages would be bulldozered and rebuilt from the ground up. That means that the prices will probably double! So, if you're planning a trip with your family, do it in the next year for the better rates. We thought that $350 per night for the extra space and amenities was a great deal. The kids had half the cottage (full size bed, pull-out sofa bed, separate bathroom , TV and kitchen area) and we had our own room with king size bed , tv, bathroom and sitting area (with folding doors to separate the two rooms). You can't beat the location of this resort, just seconds away from one of Maui's most beautiful beaches. The guys at the activities desk at the main pool were very helpful, only pushy selling us stuff on the first day. Once we said no, they basically left us alone. We did book a 4 hour snorkel boat trip, which was one of the best days we spent on our trip. The kids loved the ride over to Honolua Bay for an afternoon of snorkeling and a light lunch. We sailed the entire way back on the sea winds, which was awesome. They picked us up and dropped us off right on the beach, a few mintues walk from the hotel. We only had the breakfast buffet a few times, but enjoyed the spread of hot food, fruits and sweets. There are so many restaurants in the immediate area that other than the luau, we didn't dine at the hotel restaurants at all. Food is a little more expensive, which is to be expected, but we didn't have a bad meal the entire time. So, I would definitely recommend this hotel as long as you aren't expecting the Ritz-Carlton!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel felt more like old Hawaii than the newer hotels being built. The pool area, lounge and grounds were calm and beautiful. The evening guitarist and Hawaiian dancer(named Wailani) were enchanting, as we watched the sun set, the torch lighting ceremony and felt the breezes right on the waterfront. The rooms were dated, but the location and more reasonable price made up for it. The free shuttle to other resorts, and the nearby path along the beach were useful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient beachfront”
Reviews.Author: DadRob
Reviews.Content: We stayed in June for three nights. We booked an ocean view room, and when we checked in we were informed we were upgraded to ocean front, which it really was. (I think upgrade means that what was booked was not available, but since it did not cost any more, that was fine.) The best bellman we encountered on our trip took us to our room. From our room and patio we had a wonderful view of the ocean and the islands. A path through the hedge led directly to the wonderful sand beach, just steps away from our room. We stayed in the Royal Hale units, a structure apart from the hotel. The room was dated and the carpet worn and not particularly clean, but everything else was clean and worked. The one thing we did not know was that we were right next to the luau, and could hear the whole show from our room. Once the luau was finished, the place was again quiet. We ate breakfast in the dining room, a nice buffet. A cook made omelets or eggs to order. Dinner was very good. Service was excellent. Overall, the staff was very friendly, probably the nicest staff we had in our two weeks on the islands. Everyone from the gardeners to the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The main hotel unit is undergoing renovation as of this writing; I hope they continue with the Hale units as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful time at the Royal Lahaina Hotel. Yes it is under construction, but the staff did everything possible to make our stay comfortable and pleasant. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, so the staff gave us 2 complimentary drinks and upgraded us to one of the tower rooms with a full ocean view. It was spectacular. The beach is right there, the staff is outstanding, the pools are wonderful and we had a treat one night while dining with a lovely hula dancer and a guy singing and playing the guitar. The parking spaces are a bit tight, but that was really our only complaint. Sure the place needs a bit of work, but that is why they are completely renovating it. It's located on one of the most astounding beaches on the island--Kanapalli beach and it was minutes from the town of Lahaina. Overall, we would stay there again. In fact they gave us a tour of one of the cottages and it would suit a family of 5 quite nicely. We were also happy that after we had already checked out and after a long day of snorkeling on a boat ride that took us over to Lanai, the staff allowed us to use one of the hospitality suites to shower and change before heading to the airport. I don't think you will be disappointed if you book with the Royal Lahaina. In fact, you will be pleasantly surprised!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read almost all the reviews before arriving at the hotel. We also had used its luau in the past. Following is our impressions from this hotel: 1- It is quite aging and the value you get is based on how much you manage to pay. The less per room, the better the value! We believe a fair room rate could be around $100/ night. 2- It has been under maintenance that is still ongoing. It is noisy. They even fumigated our room, to kill the bugs, with a short notice. No apologies. You want to ensure your room is not going to be fumigated while there. 3- We decided to get a room in the main tower, as the Royal Hale, a 3-story annex to the hotel, seemed to be noisy each night with the luau activities. It was a good decision, but we had to pay an extra $65/ night to upgrade! We still could hear the drum beats from our main tower room between 8:30 to 9:30 each night. 4-The reception people are generally friendly, but you need to be firm with them, as they provide erroneous information or quote wrong prices unless you notify them. 5-Pools are just pools, nothing fancy. The pool towel attendants are very pushy and aggressive promoting their own scuba diving programs. They dominate the second pool for this purpose. We found this quite annoying & intrusive. Some guests even leave when the pool attendants start their peddling. Their approach is not professional at all. 6- The location is quite convenient to the Whalers' Village- restaurants & shops. 7- Ocean side rooms have fantastic views. 8- Restaurant foods and services are average. You'd find better value elsewhere in Laheina or the Whalers' Village. 9- The luau, claimed to be the best in the islands, is relatively OK, however, expensive. Guests are also annoyed when they see some preferential treatments given to certain groups. Very poor management of the luau event. 10- The room we were in was quite SMALL compared with other hotels in Maui in the same price range. The room had a small old leaky & wet bathroom, sink and shower. We have stayed in many different hotels in the islands and other locations around the world. This hotel is quite average (even below average). We would never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach in the Shower”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina Wed-Sat. The resort is really right on the beach, which was wonderful. You could almost hear the waves from our room. The hotel is currently under renovations but our room had not been renovated yet. The hotel has the potential to be nice, but as of our trip, not so much. We found a cockroach in our shower, none of the sliding doors in the room worked properly and the drains were continuously clogged. There were clean sheets and towels but that was about all the room had to offer. The staff was okay, but I got the impression they catered more to the people attending the luau then to the guest staying at the hotel. The â€œLoungeâ€� had one bar tender and no one else. He was friendly but no food or services other than drinks. It was always empty. The restaurant had good service but the food was over priced for the quality. Overall, not worth the price we paid. Next time we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina...A good find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please...do not believe the poor reviews about this resort! Keep in mind that some people are impossible to please. We stayed from 6/1 to 6/11 for our wedding/honeymoon. We are 23 and 27 and loved the beauty of the Royal Lahaina and service we recieved! This resort is not as high-end as some of the other resorts on Maui, but it is in a great location, has beautiful grounds, 2 great pools, a beautiful oceanfront resturant (with great food and nightly entertainment), and an amazing view of the ocean. This resort also has a wonderful luau...you have to see it to believe it! There was soo much food and unlimited drinks! All of the luau dancers/entertainers were great and had beautiful costumes - a definate picture opportunity! Even though the rooms are in need of an update, they are very clean. The beach is absolutely gorgeous and uncrowded. I would definately suggest this hotel to any future Maui visitors. Sure, we could have stayed in a five-star hotel, but we wouldn't have been able to stay for 10 nights; and really, what's more important...to stay in a more expensive hotel that you only sleep in at night, or stay in a beautiful (but reasonable) hotel that you only sleep in at night? Let's face it, people don't go to Maui to live in their hotel room! Stay at the Royal Lahaina so that you can make your trip last longer because, believe these two newlyweds, you'll never want to leave! There is something majical about this island!

Reviews.Title: “Some Initial Problems, But All Worked Out OK”
Reviews.Author: okairpix
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Royal Lahaina on Friday, May 26 and stayed until Tuesday, May 30. We were originally placed in the Royal Hale on the 2nd floor. The room was a disaster. It had mold growing in the bathroom and smelled like it had not been opened in years. We tried to get the hotel to move us but as it happened to be Memorial Day weekend, they were sold out on Friday night. The young manager intern worked with us to move us the following morning. After a miserable night on a mattress with springs poking you in the back and a smell that would rival any men's room at a stadium, Saturday finally rolled around and we were moved into the tower (rm 4014). It was better but certainly not as nice as most Best Western or Holiday Inns. The mattresses were vintage 1982 with springs poking you in the back and low spots that you would get into and have to roll out of. We found roaches in the bathroom late Saturday afternoon after returning from the beach and phoned the front desk. They did not come or return the call. We went down to the desk and left a message for the manager on duty to call us. Again, no call. Finally, on Sunday afternoon, I found the manager on duty and he actually told me that we were in the tropics and there would be roaches. He said that he had roaches in his home and it was unavoidable. He said that he would send someone up to investigate. Needless to say, I was not really happy with the explanation so I sought out the GM and without telling him what had happened, asked him if there were roaches in his home and then when he said "no, of course not", told him what had happened. He sent housekeeping up to completely scrub the room from stem to stern, spray and disinfect and to put feather pillow tops on the mattress. He also comped the $16 per day parking/safe/etc "resort fee" that was charged for the entire stay as well as breakfast for the last two days. In all fairness, with the pillow tops on the beds, they were comfortable and we did not see anymore bugs during the stay. The ocean view room had a nice view and was high enough to avoid the previously mentioned (by other posters) roof top obstructions that bother the 3rd floor. The hotel is old...very old. It is, however, in the midst of a complete renovation. The plans and the demo rooms are first class. It should be complete by early 2007. The food was very good and prices were certainly fair, especially for Maui. Parking, as has been previously written by many, is very tight and would be suitable for a Mini-Cooper or moped. But the best part, in my opinion, is the beach. It is second to none. Ka'annapali Beach is about as nice a beach as you could find. Even on a holiday weekend, it was uncrowded. Snorkeling was great at Black Rock...saw some turtles and loads of bright tropical fish. The sunsets were as expected. They were breathtaking. For the most part, the hotel staff was polite with the main exception being the front desk folks who were just plain rude. The GM and manager intern were friendly and we had nice visits with them after the problems were worked out. Food and beverage staff were pleasant and professional. The hotel, in it's current form, is a little iffy for me to stay again. However, with the renovations, I would go back in a heartbeat especially with the beach. My advice is to completely avoid the Royal Hale as it is way too much of a crap shoot for a decent room as it is the original hotel built in 1962 and probably not renovated since. The tower is in the process of renovation and construction is going on from 8 am till 4:30 pm. A few days we heard construction as early as 7:00 but such is the price of progress. For the price, it was ok and in all fairness, the management worked, on island time, to remedy the problems that were presented to them. If you stay between now and the end of the year, roll the dice and hopefully you will get lucky.

Reviews.Title: “Why the bad rap? I just don't get it.”
Reviews.Author: Skamusic1975
Reviews.Content: Like others on tripadvisor.com, I had read some not-so good reviews of the Royal Lahaina Resort prior to actually booking my trip, however; I decided I liked the location of the property and the amenities offered, and the rooms were reasonably priced, so I decided to book my Maui vacation here. We stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort from May 25 through 28, 2006 and I can honestly say that I cannot understand what the bad reviews are about. Sure, the Royal Lahaina is not the Ritz Carlton (this is not what I was looking for when booking a hotel), nor is it anywhere near the basic accomodation of the Motel 6. On a scale of 1 - 10, I give the Royal Lahaina Resort a solid 8. I am in no way affiliated with the Royal Lahaina Resort. I am simply an insurance field worker who happened to have a wonderful time at this resort. We arrived at the hotel at 9pm after taking the latest flight to OGG that left Los Angeles. The hotel is about a 40 - 45 minute ride from the Airport. When we arrived on the grounds, we found a good amount of parking quite near the luau grounds, which is in walking distance of the lobby/reception area. You need to understand that everything at this resort is within walking distance so even if we had parked in the farthest space away from the hotel, we still would have only been a leisurely 5 minute walk from the main hotel. There are several different accomodations offered at the Royal Lahaina Resort - some of which are in the main high-rise hotel, and others (such as what we had booked) were in the Hale Kanaapali 3-story buildings. Check in at 9pm was a breeze. We checked in, and were offered 2 parking fee options (yes, there is a fee for parking). The choices were either $10 per day for parking only and ala carte pay-per-use in-room coffee, and in-room safe, and no free drinks OR (what we chose) $16.00 per day for parking, 2 Mai Tai's each day in the bar (check out the statute of the monkey climbing the banana), and inclusive in-room coffee and use of the safe. Since 2 Mai-Tai's are $15.50 at the bar, the $16.00 per day sounded like a deal to us, so we took it. I suggest you take this option if you enjoy having a nice evening cocktail and if you (like me) are a caffeine fiend. We received our two keys, the front desk clerk called the bellman, and our luggage was promptly whisked up to our room (literally a 2 minute walk away from receiption.) The reception are is nicely decorated with fresh flowers and has an island theme. Some prior reviews have said that this hotel is "old" and "warn" however; I had not found that to be the case. The hotel is older, yes, but certainly not "warn" by any means. The front desk staff was very nice and not pushy about the $10 or $16 parking fee. As mentioned before, we were in the Hale Kanaapali rooms which are located in the 3-story tower. There are no elevators here, so you really need to be physically mobile in order to reach the 2nd and 3rd floors, however, the stairs are a very easy climb. The rooms are all reached by an indoor corridor and the balconies/verandas face the outside. Our room was 1604 and was classified as a garden view. At 9:30pm at night, we could see nothing outside of our room except some lights and foliage, but when I opened the sliding glass door, I did hear the sound of the ocean. So nice! The rooms are older, yes, but still they are quite comfortable. No bugs, no leaks, everything worked and was very clean. Coffee maker, safe, small fridge, a wetbar, and a couch was in the room along with 1 king bed and your usual TV. The photos that others have posted are a pretty accurate depiction of the Hale rooms. The bed was comfortable, though some might not enjoy the flatter pillows (I happen to sleep with a flat pillow at home, so this was no problem for me.) This room is in a quiet location. When I awoke the next morning, I brewed some coffee (typical standard 2 cup mini-coffee maker with sort of weakish coffee), and opened the door of the balcony. I could hear lots of birds and the rustling of the foliage. I then looked to my left and saw that we actually had a partial view of the ocean. Though this is a garden room, it should actually be classified as a partial-ocean view because that is what it really is. We went down to the buffet for breakfast and had a pretty good meal. Lots of choices from regular bread and jam to an omelette bar. Fresh juices and milk, nice seats inside and outside with views of the pool and the ocean. Good classic buffet breakfast including stronger coffee!! Waitstaff was pleasant and the omelette bar chef was happy to take omelette orders. After breakfast, we decided to check out the beach. We walked by the pool (which in all fairness we never used) and went to the beach which is literally steps away from the pool. The beach is really clean with soft sand, warm water, and great views up and down Kaanapali. 5 minutes walk to the right is a sweet reef where there is some great snorkleing (we saw lots of surgoenfish and unicornfish as well as colorful triggerfish), and 10 minutes walk to your left is the black rock where there is another sweet snorkeling spot. You can rent snorkeling gear at the hotel poolside or you can rent it in town in Lahaina - your choice. The earlier is more convenient, but the latter is much cheaper. The grounds of the Royal Lahaina Resort was well kept, lots of foliage, easy walks, and really close to everything in Kanaapali. There is a free shuttle which will take you from the hotel to most other hotels and Whalers Village - we used it twice. The shuttle is not run by the hotel, but appears to be run by another entity. In any case, it's free and comes about once every 30 - 60 minutes or so. We went to the Luau at the Royal Lahaina as well and had a great time. You should definately spring for an extra $15.00 to reserve premium seating. We were in the first row, center, thanks to Ford who is the Luau Director, and a generally nice guy. You get free drinks in the bar prior to the luau, and all you can drink during the luau. The kalua pig was fantastic - moist & yummy and the grounds were nicely kept. The band was amazing, and the dancers really "worked it out!" We actually heard one of the dancers go "work it out, work it out, work it out" I thought that was hiilarious! The point is, we were close enough to hear that! The show is well done and goes through Hawaiian, Samoan, Tongan and other south pacific dance styles. The fire throwing at the end is amazing and I'm glad we got some video of it. :) To sum it up, we had a great time. We wanted to spend around $150 per night on a hotel, and I feel we got out money's worth. Great location, comfortable room, VERY friendly staff (Lisa at the Front Desk and the other Lisa in Reservations, along with Ford at the Luau). We could have spent $400 per night at the Sheraton Maui, but that is not what we wanted to do. The Royal Lahaina Resort was perfect for us and we will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a realistic point of view!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For everyone that has read the horrible reviews of this resort, here is an opinion from a 25 year old couple who enjoys having the things money can buy, but also has been camping and knows what it's like to really rough it. We arrived at the Royal Lahaina Resort on May 19th and stayed through May 26th. We were greeted with warm smiles and Aloha's, and had our room upgraded to the Tower (we were booked in the Royal Hale). The room was fine. Nothing bad, nothing great, it was a room. Never did I feel yucky showering or sleeping, and our maid cleaned each day and a couple times we came to the room while she was there so I saw firsthand that she was scrubbing the floor and vacuuming. The food was very good for breakfast and lunch (always had dinners elsewhere). We also very much enjoyed the beach; their pool is a simple rectangle and rather chilly, but we still swam there as well. We did encounter an issue as the renovations are taking place in the tower and our last 3 mornings we definitely heard them. They say the hours are 8:30-4:30, which is no issue but one morning they started at 7AM and we wanted to sleep in. We spoke with a manager about the situation and he offered to move us or do something else to compensate for this issue. It was wonderful! He made the problem seem like a nonissue by making sure we were happy with the solution to the problem. We were very pleased and impressed with the service. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is clean, friendly, and pleasant. The construction may cause a problem for people who like to sleep in late, but if you are in the higher digit rooms, you may be okay (at least from what was happening right now). I don't see where people would feel that they received poor service at this resort, but as the manager brought up when I mentioned Tripadvisor to him, those that don't enjoy their stay are more apt to complain, and often those that are pleased don't say anything. So, we are saying that we enjoyed our stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort and hope that people do not fear the reviews which share the nightmares that only the smallest percentage of people have. Keep in mind, this isn't the Ritz, it is a moderate hotel, worth the value, and utterly enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for first-timers”
Reviews.Author: joy126
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in Royal Lahaina during the second leg of our Hawaiian Spring Break the last week of March. We found the hotel from Pleasant Holidays which offered us a great package deal from SFO to Oahu and Maui. We are both 22 and 23 year-old female college students. This was my 4th time in Hawaii, but first time in the island of Maui. Airport to Hotel: We purchased transfers through Pleasant Holiday because we didnt wanna risk riding a cab for almost 1 hour drive. We arrived in Maui at 6am Sunday morning and the airport was very empty. The drive from the airport was long and boring. We reached Kaanapali Beach Resorts after about an hour. It looked like a subdivision of beachside hotels. We saw Royal Lahaina not too long after. Check-in: We waited in line for about 5 minutes. We felt very relaxed because the lobby was beautiful and relaxing. The bell-boys immidieately took our luggages from the shuttle and watched them as we proceeded to registration. Check-in wasnt till 4pm but we were at the hotel by 8am. They allowed us to go in our room without hesitation. A golf-cart picked us up in the front of the lobby and drove us to our rooms because walking with luggages to teh room would have been a trek.
