The driver carried our luggaes in our room and placed them where we wanted them. Hotel: The hotel is beautiful. It is old and it shows its age. There were cottages and a main building. The beach is easily accessed. You could be tanning in less than 2 minutes from the lobby. There were stairs that leads you to the beach. The pool was ok. It wasn't as pretty as other resorts, but who needs a pool when there's the beach 30 feet away? The lobby is beautiful. It's open air so you could smell teh fresh breeze any time of the day. It was also decorated with native arts and the most beautiful arrangement of tropica flowers. The lobby also has Expedia, Pleasant Holidays, etc offices so one could book activities or inquire about their reservations on-site. Room: Our room was located in teh Royal Hale which is the 3 story building away from the main building. Our room door was a sliding glass door, similar to a patio door. It required an actual metal key which gave it an ancient feel. The room was bigger than expected. Plenty of space for 2 women. I think it could accomdate 4+ persons. The beds were big and comfy. The bathroom had PLENTY of space. The closet was big and the counters were very sufficient. The toilet adn shower were separate from the sink and closet. The TV channel selection was good and the furniture was average. There was an additional counter with a sink and a refrigerator. The sofa was dirty so we used it to put our luggage rack. Outside our room was a cute little garden which put us in an "island" mood. The access to the beach was 20 feet from our doorstep. very convenient for 2 young women that want to laze in the beach all day. =) Staff: Service was very nice. We got everything we wanted and never complained. They were willing to help and always showered us with compliments. We ate at teh hotel restaurant for one dinner and the manager chatted with us several times. He even offered to let us borrow his car so we could do to the bars outside of teh resort. They were very eager to help us. They were not pushy adn didnt make u feel like you are REQUIRED or OBLIGATED to give them tips. We forgot to tip one time and they didnt get mad/upset. Location: This hotel is good if you want to stay very close to the beach. It was 20 seconds outside of our hotel room. =) If you want a nightlife, this hotel is a bit far from it. It is not walking distance from anything. You would need a car if you want to go outside of the hotel. If you dont plan on doing anything outside and just wants to stay in the hotel, then Royal Lahaina will be perfect for you. It is very quiet and peaceful. You get a sense of privacy and true relaxation without feeling so touristy. This resort also has restaurants and a shopping center, so you could do souveneir shopping here. The beach is beautiful and the best in Maui. You could be tanning and see Molokai in your right and Lanai on the left. The sand is golden and teh water is clear. There's a luau in this hotel so you could attend a luau 5 minutes from your room. Why did I choose this hotel?: My friend and I wanted to relax in Maui since we did our partying in Oahu. We wanted a hotel that was a bit secluded becuase we wanted tranquility. We weren't worried about the proximity to shops becuase we didnt want to be in "downtown" area. We just wanted to lay in the sand all day and do nothing. We wanted to enjoy teh resort as opposed to spending our money on activities. I didn't care that the hotel is old because it made us feel like we were home. The fact that it wasnt modern gave it that welcoming feeling becuase it felt more personal. It was as if you were visiting a grandparent. Would I return to this hotel? Most likely, but not anytime soon. This is becuase I want to stay at other areas of Maui as well. I would stay here again when i finish touring the other regions. I would recommend this hotel though because it's a great hotel that would save you money. Pros: value, access to the beach, room size, cleanliness, view, "hang-loose" environment, on-site luau. Cons: location far from airport and downtown, too quiet sometimes, too couple-y, pricey restaurant. This hotel is NOT for: - luxury seekers - singles who want to party and mingle in the hotel bars - teenagers who want hotel activities - penny-savers (there are cheaper hotels in less expensive region of Maui) - honeymooners (better more romantic hotels nearby) This hotel is good for: - first time visitors - elderly people - families with young kids - big group - couples (anniversaries, vacation) - the aveage joe and jane - people willing to pay extra to have tranquility. - people who want the convenience of attending a luau without driving. Final words: I loved my stay in this hotel. My friend and I were satisfied and have no complaints. It would have been nice to have an electronic key since I hated carrying and worrying about the key. The hotel is old, but it doesnt really affect your stay. It has an old Hawaii feel becuase it's not very modern. If you like big-city style hotels, stay at the Hyatt or the Westin. We felt very comfortable here. We had an "upscale" experience without the snootiness. The hotel felt like home and I would love to visit again in the future. This was my first visit in Maui and I would also recommend this hotel to new Maui visitors since It gives you that true Hawaiian spirit without feeling like a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Don't risk staying here.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is undergoing a very slow renovation. Some rooms are very nice but others and downright nasty. My wife and I (we were on our honeymoon) unfortuneatly were in one of the nasty rooms. The first thing we noticed when entering the room (Unit 3017 - 3rd floor) was that it was on the same floor as the roof of the lobby. The roof protruded about 20 feet from the building so our view was of a roof and the very, very tops of palm trees. There was also a huge a/c unit on the roof which was the center of our view and was very loud. We next noticed that there was a lot of water dripping into the shower from the ceiling above the shower. We could see that there was a metal cover on the ceiling above the shower (where the water was dripping from) which allowed acces to pipes. I promptly called the front desk to report the leaking, dirty water and a maintainance person was sent to fix. Once he opened the panel, a huge puddle of water splashed throughout the tiny bathroom leaving the floor wet. There was no way we were going to stay in that room which also had serious mold inside the framed prints on the wall, and after about 2.5 hours of arguing with the staff, we were eventually moved to a villa on the property. Of course the villa had no water view but at least it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina in June of 2005 for our honeymoon. After a year of tireless work and dedication to ensure our big-Italian wedding would go off without a hitch, all we wanted to do is get away somewhere were we could just enjoy each other's company. Our travel agent highly recommended this hotel for us, we were somewhat unsure of Maui when we were told it was for the newlywed- or nearly dead, as my husband and I really enjoy nightlife and staying up late drinking and dancing. We took her word for it and requested 1 week in Maui and 1 week in Waikiki to suit our night-owl needs, thinking by the time we left Maui we would be so bored we would hit every nightclub there. To our extreme suprise....we arrived in Waikiki almost in tears that we had to leave the beautiful Island of Maui and have since dreamed of the oppertunity of returning...even possibly owning property there. The Royal Lahaina resort was perfect for us, and it actually made us learn more about each other, we were asleep every night at 11pm and feel asleep in our oceanfront room listening to the crashing waves and the muffled music from the fantastic Luau. After 2 days of being at the Royal Lahaina and realizing that it had captured our heart, we decided to renew our vows (after 4 days of marriage) and get married on the Royal lahaina beach at sunset. Not only was the food, ambiance and Island amazing, but the wedding coordinating services and the friendly staff were unquestionably one of the most impressionable aspects of our trip, we will not hesitate to stay at this hotel during our next visit. It remains to be in our heart.....and we didn't go to any nightclub, we would wake up at 8:30am, have a romantic amazing breakfast poolside, buy a magazine at the corner store in the resort and lay on the beach until dinner time, Lahaina's Front street is a 5 minute drive away from the resort, and we would explore it every second night, a new restaurant, a new collectibles store, a new Mai-Tai. We also extremely enjoyed the value and experience of the Royal Lahaina Luau, the history lesson behind the roasted pig, the incredible hula dancers, the sunset, the food! and only $50.00 USD. We were somewhat discouraged about this hotel when we looked online and saw some testimonials and we were a little hesitant about our selection, but now returned....HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach, great ambiance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first thought when we arrived was not good, I thought wow, this place is old. We were taken to a 3 story building near the Luau, which worried me even more. We arrived to our room, and all I thought was "can I switch hotels". However, after staying for a night, I realized it was a great place to be. It is not the Westin or Hyatt, but it was very comfortable, clean and had an excellent location on Kaanapali beach. The service was good, meals a lttle pricey, but we enjoyed our stay and would go back again. We took the trolley to the other hotels where we noticed the masses were at the pools. The Hyatt and Westin had great pools, but you can be anywhere and have a nice pool. At the Royal Lahaina it is all about Maui. We found a great deal on Pleasant and for what we paid it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay and we'll be returning”
Reviews.Author: Cookster46
Reviews.Content: Being well seasoned travellers, my wife and I chose to spend our 20th anniversary in Maui. After reading several reviews on this site we chose this hotel for its best value for our money. Granted it was no Marriot or 4 Seasons etc. type of hotel, the Royal Lahaina was one of the "better value" stays I've come across in some time. Their Staff were sincere, helpful, and a pleasure to be around. The proximity to the beach was incredible. This hotel has one of the nicest pieces of beachfront property in the vicinity. Make sure that you get the breakfast buffet included in your room price or you'll be sorely disappointed. Any downside to report was limited to paying for parking, pushy pool attendant trying to book a tour, and their "In-house" Luau which was a bit to commercialized for my liking and lacked that bit of authenticity. When going to Maui make sure to plan in advance for the Royal Lahaina Luau in the City of Lahaina. This is the best Luau around and tough to get into. We plan to return soon with the kids and stay again in this hotel. Aloha, Mr. & Mrs. R. Cook

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very old room, the entire hotel needs up-grading. The room had mold in the bathroom and on the ceiling. You could not adjust the air conditioning, it either went all the time or not at all. We were also put in a room back in a corner, far from the elevator. Parking was expensive and the stalls were extremely small so everyone had problems getting into the space. This was the second time we were in Maui and I think the next time I will try to go back to our previous hotel, the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel, much better location and is kid friendly. The one positive thing is the location, beach front.

Reviews.Title: “There was no picnic in the Garden room or the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: cinnamonbearinn
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a garden view room. We were shown 3, the first two were missing headboards and pictures so we chose the third. As we readied for sleep, we discovered that half of the window coverings were missing, the hot water could not be turned off, and the furniture was broken. For an upgrade fee of $60 we got another room. In this room we got hair on the shower walls and a jack hammer waking us up at 8 am.on Palm Sunday. This place was totally unaccepatable and we won't be back there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised! (and relieved!)”
Reviews.Author: SheriBayBuh
Reviews.Content: I think people who have written bad reviews about this place are people who are impossible to please in ANY situation. We 2 Cali girls (29 and 35) spent our 5 hour plane-ride terrified of what we were about to experience after reading the reviews here (I even brought a fly swatter to defend us from the massive BUGS I heard about on here!)(I never used it, by the way). When we arrived (after praying for it to be half the dump people said it was), we were met with extremely helpful and courteous staff, as well as a cute, roomy, and clean little cottage with TONS of stowe-away space (Cottage L, Room 8213) and a beautiful patio looking out toward the pool. Yes, the shower was very old, but everything was clean, very roomy, & comfortable, and the staff always made sure we were happy before they would leave us. My friend and I had two double-beds, and were very comfortable, especially with the beautiful beach outside, the immaculate grounds, and indeed the price! The only negative I can think of is the walls were VERY thin, and our neighbors were up all night partying like it was the Superbowl. But, anyway, I have stayed in many hotels, and have paid MUCH MORE for yuckier rooms BY FAR (like the gross Hollywood Standard; sorry Cameron Diaz!!). I think people need to pull the stick out of their behinds and see that they are getting WAY more than they're paying for at the Royal Lahaina... How dare you reviewers scare us like that! Sheesh!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really wonderful for the PRICE!! My husband and I stayed for 5 nights at the Royal Lahaina and then 5 nights at the Renaissance Marriot in Wailea. We decided to stay in a less expensive hotel for the first part of our trip and do all of our activities like snorkeling, volcano bike ride, parasailing ect. We then went to Wailea(it has a calmer vibe)to sit by the pool and get massages. The R. Lahaina is located on the Best Beach in Maui, Kaanapali. The beach and grounds are just Amazing. The hotel is on the older quieter side of the beach, but has some of the best beach property in Lahaina. To be right on this beach for less than $200 a night is a steal. Having said that, there is a reason that all of the other hotels on the same beach are double to triple the cost. If you are someone who likes to spend a lot of time in your hotel room, this hotel is not for you. It is not a SPA hotel. Our room was cleaned every day but the rooms are very old and no amount of cleaning will fix that. The showers reminded me of my old dorm. You can't have it all. A Superlow price, be on the best beach in Maui AND have a super modern room! It is a trade off. What is most important to you? With the money we saved we were able to do and see so much, we were busy every day. The hotel rooms were what I kind of expected for the budget price. The rooms at the Marroit in Wailea were super but we paid $475 a night. The R. Lahaina is a wonderful choice for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Chamois
Reviews.Content: Royal Lahaina â€“ March 14 â€“ 21/06 We had a wonderful ocean front room on the 9th floor over looking most of Kaanapali. Incredible views of turtles swimming along the coastline and whales entertained us non-stop. This was the second time we stayed at the Royal Lahaina and it was even better than 7-years ago. The entire staff was polite, friendly, accommodating and efficient! Housekeeping was excellentâ€¦replenishing our towels nightly and turning down the bed leaving beautiful orchids on fresh linen. The Royal Lahaina dÃ©cor is very Hawaiian and they maintain impeccable grounds. The beach activity desk has extremely helpful and knowledgeable staff (thanks Kirk!). The bar restaurant food was surprisingly very goodâ€¦great pizzas. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this resort for excellent location, moderate prices and staff who take very good care of you. We look forward to the many changes over the next five years, especially the gorgeous new hotel room designs. Which we were fortunate enough to view!! Unfortunately the rates will increase, but Iâ€™m sure the Hawaiian atmosphere and excellent service will remain forever. If considering staying here, I would disregard the negative reviews (with the exception of the cottage rooms, as they will be leveled eventually instead of being remodeled). We look forward to returning to the â€œnew & improvedâ€� Royal Lahaina. Mahaloâ€¦ Jodi & Al, Vancouver, BC.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out & Moved to the Westin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After long travel we checked into the Royal Lahaina late on March 31st for our honeymoon. Unfortunately, our introduction to the hotel fell way short of our expectations. We found our ocean view room to be mostly a view of the highway. The wall paper in the room was tearing off the wall. A black substance had stained the ceiling next to the air duct. There was black like mold in the bathroom. We had to do the shower dance as hot and cold water spontaneosly changed back and forth while taking a shower. To make a king size bed, they pushed the two double beds together. When we layed down on the bed we could feel EVERY spring...woke up with sore back and shoulders. We canceled the remainder of our week's stay with them and checked into the MARVELOUS WESTIN. While making a last minute reservation at the Westin almost doubled our cost, we have NO REGRETS. We DO NOT RECOMMEND the Royal Lahaina. They need major renovation. (The one positive is that the breakfast was very good).

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Togtog
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is that after reading the other reviews, there must be some rooms at this hotel that are okay and some that are absolutely horrible. I'm saying this because there is no way that anyone would have called our room wonderful, clean and pleasant. The floors in our room have probably not been cleaned for years, along with the tile and shower in the bathroom. Our room was flithy and the furniture was about to break apart (in fact the armoire was broken) and our toilet ran constantly. The pillows were about an inch thick and the bedding was old and ratty. I will say that the restaurant was good, especially the breakfast buffet. Unfortunately, when we made plans, everything else was booked on Kaanapali so we stayed at this hotel. What a mistake. We would have been better off waiting until something opened up. My advice is that if you stay here, make sure you can get a cottage or upgraded room (we tried and they were all booked).

Reviews.Title: “Really Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: susanCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We were assured that this hotel had been renovated. However, upon check-in, we were told that this was not the case, and that renovation was beginning the next day on the floor above us. We stayed in the tower building. Old tile, small little bathtub, dirty baseboards, roach in closet did not help much in creating the aloha spirit. It took us 45 minutes to check in as they said rooms were not available! It took us 45 minutes to check out as they had only one person at the counter for checking out and for folks checking in. This was on a busy Saturday morning when lots of folks were checking out. Air conditioner dripped on bed. Hot tub was out of order. Pool very old and small. You have to pay $16 extra per day for parking, using the in-room safe, free local phone calls, 800 number access, and to have in-room coffee that you make yourself. If you choose not to pay the $16 per day, then you are charged on a "ala carte basis" for coffee each day, using the safe, local phone calls and 800 # access, and must pay $10 per day for parking. The grounds are nice, but you feel "cut-off" from the rest of the Kannapali beach scene. If they could modernize the hotel, keep it sparkling clean, and get their staff to be more motivated in terms of customer service, this could be a nice resort. This is my 8th trip to Maui, but my first stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything was great.The staff were wonderful,the food was great.One thing did bother us.We asked for a smoking room. Once we arrived we were told that the royal lahaina was a non-smoking property.You should really make it clear in your website that it's non-smoking.Otherwise it was a beautiful time.

Reviews.Title: “Mahalo Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was also were very scared to book here based on the reviews but when we got there it was paradise, by far the best beach front on Kannapali. We were upgraded to an ocean view room and watched the whales from our lanai. You are literally right on the ocean. Everything was perfect. We travel often and the cost of parking is at any hotel in any big city or resort area. We paid 16 bucks and got 2 free mai tais every day, and safe use etc. Cheaper then Florida. The hotel food was great, and you want to book the breakfast buffet with your stay it is worth it. Bar had wonderful music at night with a hula dancer under the stars. We toured some of the other hotels and we would go back to the Royal Lahaina any day. While we were there they were in the middle of upgrading rooms, new furniture etc... everything you need right at the resort. The rooms were very clean and can hear the ocean in your room, and we slept great! You are in Maui and beautiful view of island of Lani. Up the road is Lahaina town, lots of fun, don't miss it. This hotel is not overrun with people, so beautiful and staff were great! Mahalo to everyone at Royal Lahaina, Thanks for the perfect setting to our wonderful vacation. We only heard and saw great things while we stayed at your resort. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Pleaantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from 2 weeks on Maui staying the first 10 days at the Royal Lahaina and we loved it! We stayed in the older building the Royal Hale which yes, is older, but we were 5o paces to the beach, felt safe enough to leave our patio doors open (quite private with a hedge dividing the patio area from the main path which was seldom used by patrons). Every night we could sit out and listen to the waves crashing on the beach enjoying the famous Royal Lahaina Luau from between the palm trees for free!. Got a little like the movie Ground Hog Day after ten days but we weren't home every evening and it was over by 8:30 so never a problem for sleeping. We were supposed to go to Oahu for the last 4 days of our trip but got our Agent to change our ticket so we could stay on Maui. Had to move hotels just two down on the same beach at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel - nice but no where near the cozy quaint feeling of the Royal Lahaini - we were back in a concrete jungle we had fifth floor ocean view but still felt like we were looking at all the other matchbox suites across from us and peering down at the pool and paths and people below us. Each day went back to the Royal Lahaini to hang out. Yes it is "older" but modern concrete flash to me doesn't depict Hawaii - the Royal Lahaini (at least in the Hale building) absolutely does - I would go back in a heart beat. Just remember the "extra charges" for the parking, safe, in room coffee is $16 per day - if you know it - you can budget for it and not be upset when they tell you about it at checkin. We never had a problem with parking - well one night coming back as the Luau was ending was a bit hectic with all the cars trying to leave but other than that - parking was good, maybe we were just lucky. PS if you go - step over to the Castaway restaurant to the right on the "Embassy" property - great food, service, prices got that old Casablanca feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined My Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Twinmom717
Reviews.Content: I planned a wedding in Maui and chose to have all of our guests stay at the Royal Lahaina. BIG mistake!! It was an ABSOLUTE nightmare. The AC went out in the main building for 2 days and they did NOTHING to accomodate all 62 of our guests whom had flown in for the wedding. With all of our guests, we gave this hotel a lot of money and business. They were extremely hard to work with and did not follow through on any of their commitments. The rooms were TERRIBLE and filthy. We made the WORST mistake by planning our Rehearsal Dinner at their Luau. They had our party cramed in to tables. It was an absolute catastrophe. Luckily, our wedding was off site and that saved us. Otherwise, our wedding and the experience of our guests would have been ruined. I would NOT reccommend this hotel to anyone. Not only were grounds and the rooms disgusting, the staff were extremely rude and VERY slow. Spend the extra money and stay at any other hotel except the Royal lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “It was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The negative reviews on this hotel are very disturbing to us. We stayed for a week and we could have not been more pleased. The room was clean, the staff went out of their way to see that everything was perfect. We would not hesitate to stay here again. The parking can be a problem but we never looked for more that 10 minutes to find a place. The grounds and the pool areas are all kept up very well. The beach is very nice and not overcrowded. Hope we can travel to Maui again next year and stay at the same place.

Reviews.Title: “Room Assignment makes All the Difference!”
Reviews.Author: caliwags
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 days at the Royal Lahaina (our third visit to this hotel in the past three years) and again were delighted. While we had initially booked an "Ocean View" I called ahead to see if they would upgrade us to "Ocean Front" since it was our third straight stay. They easily accommodated. However when we checked in we were booked in a fourth floor ocean front room and were disappointed to find two beds and a virtually mini-bathtub which would require curling in a fetus position. Additionally, the noise from the band on the patio was terrible. So we asked to go back to the room type we had in the past. In 2004 and 2005 we stayed in Room 1036 and loved the view, and the king bed room with full bath. That room was not available so they moved us to 7036 (same footprint but 7th floor instead of 10th). It was wonderful. The room, housekeeping, et al was very pleasurable. The poolside sunbathing is fantastic and the breakfast buffet was over-filling and great. Parking is a problem on the nights of the luau at the property, but we always found a spot. For the economics, the Royal Lahaina can't be beat in the Kaanapali area, and as such, we will continue to come back. Maui is the dreamland of the world! Enjoy your stays.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: amydilling1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked rooms at this resort for our honeymoon. When we arrived, we were very dissapointed. It is not as fancy as it looks in the pictures. It looked like it needed a good scrub and a coat of paint. Our room was dingy. The air-conditioner was dripping onto the bed and the ceiling nearby was covered in mildew. We did not end up staying and switched to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I should have expected a letdown after spending 7 nights at the Kona Village Resort on the Big Island, but I didn't expect "the bowels of hell" as another poster so accurately described this trash heap. At check in, I was informed by the woefully trained front desk staff that I had been "upgraded" to a cottage room. The Cottage looked like a low rent apt. It was smelly, dirty, (mold and dirt around light fixtures) dead bugs and broken AC unit. I demanded the front desk give me the ocean view room I payed for, which I eventually got. The rooms in the tower aren't much better. Dirty, outdated and depressing. We wished we had ended our honeymoon after the 7 days on the Big Island. We honestly wished we were back home in Kentucky. (that alone should tell you something!) I blame this hotel for the fact that I may never go back to Maui. OUTDATED, CHEEZY, CLICHE, LOW-RENT IN EVERY WAY POSSIBLE.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina in January 2006 and I must say I have never seen a hotel where no one knows what they are doing. The housekeeping was horrible. Filthy rugs, bathroom door falling off (3 times), food way overpriced and F&B staff is not knowledgeable of the food. One night our waitress?? did not even know what I ordered. For 300.00 plus a night we could of stayed at the Hyatt Regency. Hotel grounds are run down and the place needs to be demo'd. To much emphasis is put on the luau and not the guests staying in the hotel/cottages. Would highly not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “terrific place”
Reviews.Author: cshel718
Reviews.Content: I've seen the couple of negative reviews below, and wonder if we were all staying at the same place -- or maybe the reviewers are just major snobs. This place is terrific - we had a one bedroom garden cottage, just steps across the lawn from the beach, and it was WONDERFUL. Older rooms had been restored and were very "old Hawaii" with lattice/louvered window coverings to let in the ocean breeze at night and little patios off the back. Grounds are lovely and well-kept. Maid service was excellent, the rooms were clean and serviceable, and the staff very nice. If I go back to Maui (hope to see the other islands first) I will stay here without hesitation. Ka'anapali Beach is gorgeous, and there's great snorkeling right off the beach at Black Rock. We even had turtels swimming right by as we swam in the ocean

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: tricia0077
Reviews.Content: My friend and I along with my daughter and her husband shared a one-bedroom cottage and we were pleasantly surprised at how large it was. We had a completely separate section with a bath, bed and sitting area; and on the other side of a large tri-folding door was another bed with sitting area with table and chairs, den with sofa bed and an unexpected bonus was a complete kitchen (with silverware, pots, plates, etc.). The cottages are definitely old and not updated, but they were clean and spacious. However, I would not rate it better than a 3 star hotel. The only unpleasant part was the tub in both bathrooms. They weren't very clean and were very old, so we just showered. But all-in-all it was a pleasant experience - especially since we didn't spend that much time in the cottage itself. Maid service was EXCELLENT - she even washed our dirty dishes each day; we had clean linens and they came in and turned down the beds and placed fresh flowers on each bed every day. We stayed in Cottage V, but I did hear horror stories about other cottages on-site. Some of the ocean-side cottages have been updated so ask for one of those, however they cost more than what we paid for ours which didn't face the ocean. If you are going to Maui just to lay around the hotel -- don't pick this one -- but if you want to see the BEAUTIFUL sites and won't be spending much time inside -- this is the best one for the bucks! You will need to save your other money for all of the sites you need to see.

Reviews.Title: “Three Star No”
Reviews.Author: grite
Reviews.Content: Our first problem was where to park. You simply wait till someone leaves or use the fire lane. The second aside from the extra $16.00 US per day to park , get cofee material in the cottage and acess to the safe was that even though the safe did not work for a week the charge remained unaltered. I should add that the $16.00 included two so so Mai Tais per day but only in the Beachcomber bar which opened at 4:30 PM and closed at around 11 PM.The food was expensive and not particularly good.Tipping was expected which I hate. But is the norm. If tipping is for extra effort it did not apply .The hotel is in part at least, strata owned .Maui I fear is on it's way out as a desirable vacation place charging far more that whatit is worth.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Maui!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: During my week long visit in Maui, my husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort. We were looking for a moderately priced hotel on the beach, and this one got the best reviews for what we were looking for. The hotel is definitely not modern, but the grounds are beautiful. We stayed in a cottage which was worth the extra $ because it was more convenient. The pool was just average, but it served the purpose and the view of the ocean is beautiful. If you don't want to spend a lot of , stay here. Remember, you're in Maui to see Maui, not the hotel! P.S. The parking is a little annoying and there are rarely any spots at night except in the rear of the lot. We didn't mind too much since it allowed us to walk off dinner and some drinks!

Reviews.Title: “What A Joke !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When my husband surprised me with a trip to Hawaii for my birthday - I was unable to control my excitement. We planned our trip with three other couples and made a 10 day trip (5 days Maui and 5 days Oahu). When we arrived, one of the couples had a hotel room the rest of us had cottages. Our cottage had a broken window unit for the cooling system. Complained to front desk after the 2nd night, Maintenance came to "Fix". The unit was removed, brought back , and removed again and brought back - supposedly FIX. At 2:00 am it was very warm for the 3rd night. The 4th night we had a message on our machine that we could be moved. We inquired and were told that since we did not call earlier, that the rooms were now all full and not available for us to move - in other words - Our Problem. We stayed that night on one of our friend's sofa. The next morning my husband finally got the "Manager" - What an absolute joke. This "Manager" could only say " I am sorry " Finally disgusted and glad that we were moving to another island - we through up our hands and said forget it. This is not to mention - The food being over priced, having to pay for parking in a lot where you have to park on the curb, one lounge opened only for 4 - 10, and all eating places close at 10 which means they stop taking orders at 9:30. My husband was also embarrasssed, since we had invited 3 other couples on this great vacation. I would return to maui, but not this "Resort".

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Charm; Great location for exploring; Fantastic beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly decent hotel possessing a uniquely Hawaiian feel in both decor and hospitality. From our 9th floor ocean view room in the main tower we saw lots of frolicking Humpbacks, had an unobstructed view for miles up the coast, and could see all the way to the island of Lanai. Staying at this hotel, we really felt like we were in Hawaii. We spent one night at the Marriot in Wailea (to get married on the beach) and that room, while a bit more spacious, was generically decorated in a style that could have been Anywhere, U.S.A. No view and boring. We were happy to be back at "home base" at The Royal Lahaina. Our hotel provided the perfectly located "hub" for all of our activities...helicopter ride, submarine ride, snorkelling trip, The Maui Ocean Center, The Old Lahaina Luau, beach walks, shopping on charming Front Street, and was close to some awesome fine dining restaurants. Basil Tomatoes (on the premises) has fantastic Northern Italian cuisine in large portions and the Ocean View Terrace (main building) had surprisingly yummy Hawaiian fusion food (also in large portions). The breakfast package is a great deal. All in all, if you are looking to explore this beautiful, serenely sedate island we would highly recommend this as your hub but only if you are renting a car. If you choose not to rent a car and just want to bask by the pool, never leaving the confines of your resort compound, you'd be better off to find a five star resort anywhere (they're all the same) except perhaps Maui (where the prices for any accomodation are particularly high).

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Resort Hotel needs work”
Reviews.Author: XJ-the-DXer-and-YF
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first trip to Maui nine years ago. My wife said it was the best hotel she had ever stayed in - paradise! But, nine years have taken their toll. The place is showing its age. Our first room... dusty, grungy, broken vanes in the lanai door, loose electrical outlet in the bathroom, not appealing. The next morning the cold water in the shower would not turn off. The staff was more than accommodating about addressing the problems and, after the cold water incident, did offer us another room which we took. That was somewhat better. We did learn from a staff member that there are plans for a $333M renovation, including a parking structure, in the works to begin in 2007 or 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hawaiian charm - NOT run down”
Reviews.Author: JelliB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort for 4 nights at the end of a two week holiday throughout Hawaii. Let me say right off, this is not a new hotel, but it is NOT run down. The staff were great and upgraded our room to an ocean view. At night we could actually hear the waves, which was great. The place is clean, the king bed comfy and the bathroom small but good. On arrival our ceiling lights did not work. After calling the front desk and wandering out to the beach and back, they'd been fixed in 10 mins flat! As for the room keys (not electronic pass keys), these are what we used to use to open doors in the 'old days'! I actually enjoyed not being surrounded by marble, glass and high ceilings for a while. The restaurant was a little on the expensive side, but the food was very good. The beach was beautiful, just make sure you get out past the breaking water, as the waves were small but VERY strong. Plenty of whales doing their thing just out from the hotel the whole time we were there. There is a little store in the complex with drinks, icecreams etc as well as a few snack places and poolside bars. The Whalers Village was a great shopping centre, with good eating places and shops. There is a free shuttle from the resort, but the nice walk through the golf course is only 15 mins or so. To get the Lahaina itself is another bus ($2 each) from Whalers, but it's worth it as the walk would be a little hairy down the highway! The last one heads back though at 7pm, but we found a taxi after dinner back to the resort was only USD$15. The shuttles from whalers back to the resort go until around 10 or 11pm, so getting home after having dinner there was no problem. Lahaina is lovely and has some great restaurants. Go Bubba Gump's! We did the crater sunrise/mountain bike ride down the volcano which was fab and definately worth the 2am get-up. The next day we hired a car (USD$65) and drove back to the volcano to do the ATV rides (none of the ATV companies pick up from Lahaina, which is a shame) , also a great 1/2 day.

Reviews.Title: “Just the facts”
Reviews.Author: laza999
Reviews.Content: I am writing this piece based on fact and not on emotion so that readers get a good idea of this resort. Royal Lahina is certainly dated but by no means rundown. The elevators work (fast) and the rooms were clean but small by todays standards. Everything in the room worked. We had a fridge, TV, Safe and Mr Coffee. You will have a choice of either paying ala-carte for the parking ($10) Mr Coffee ($3) Safe ($3) and phone calls ($1/call) or all inclusive of $16/day. Cabanas are $35/day which are a must as there is no shade on the beach or around the pool. Snorkel Fins and Goggles are $15/day and its a 400mtr (500yd) walk to the coral. Best to go to the next resort and hire for $10/day. Avoid the in town stores as they advertise $1.50/day but once you get there you realise they have tricked you into getting the same thing as the resorts for $8.5/day. Not worth the hassel of driving into town. The Royal Lahina will not be for everyone. Its clean is cheap compared to the rest of the resorts. Its close to the supermarket (purchase your breakfast requirements there). Close to the golf and all the other attractions. Best of all is its beautiful scenery.

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Royal Lahaina Resort is very nice. We stayed in 4 oceanfront cottages. They were fabulous. I do not know what the rooms look like in the hotel, however, I would stay in the cottages again. They were very nice. We did not know what to expect with some of these reviews. Some of the reviews were terrible. I really do not know how they could give such bad reviews. We all thought the Royal Lahaina Resort was well worth every penny we spent. We were, however, a little disappointed in the Royal Lahaina Resort Luau. It was quite boring. The grounds at the Royal Lahaina are kept up very well. We ate the breakfast buffet every morning (it was great). Some nights we ate supper in the restaurant (we enjoyed that too). The ocean by the Royal Lahaina was very rough. You can see a lot of whirlpools right where the water was breaking. The kids did not stay in the water too long. The water actually was beating them. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Brazil_Fan1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Royal Lahaina and had a fabulous time. This hotel is what you make of it. If you are expecting perfection and will complain about every chip in the paint or spot on the rug, and want to be waited on like royalty, then this place is not for you. But if you came to Hawaii to enjoy the surrounding beauty and want a place to stay that is close to everything and on the doorstep of one of the nicest beaches in Maui, then this is your place. I travel a lot for business and stay in 4 and 5 star hotels all the time. And the Royal Lahaina is definitely not a 4 or 5 star hotel. This hotel was probably built 25-30 years ago and has not been updated much since then. But it does have the old Hawaii feel that so many of the new resorts lack. And it is clean and functional. Staff is friendly and helpful when we needed it (which wasn't much). The hotel is a bit run-down in some areas of the interior as you would expect from a hotel of this age. But you get what you pay for and the Royal Lahaina is one of the least expensive hotels in Kaanapali. The cheapest rooms with no view at the Hyatt, Sheraton or Westin were twice the price of what I paid here for a beautiful ocean view. We stayed on the 12th floor of the main tower (Kai) and our room was fine. It was dated, and I would guess was at least 20 years old but it was clean and functional and the view was incredible. Its one of the best views you'll get anywhere in Kaanapali and what little time we spent in our room was spent gazing out at the blue ocean, Kaanapali beach and Lanai and Molokai in the distance. It was whale season and we saw whales swimming a few hundred yards off-shore every single day. I can't comment on the rooms in the Hale building or the cottages other than to say that the grounds around the cottages are absolutely beautiful. I have been to Hawaii over a dozen times including Maui, Kauai, Oahu and the Big Island, and I think Kaanapali beach is probably the best beach in Hawaii to stay at if you are looking for perfect weather, a long sandy beach with waves that kids can swim in, and an interesting town nearby (Lahaina). And the Royal Lahaina is positioned right on the best part of this beach away from the crowds you'll find near the Sheraton or Hyatt. The Royal Lahaina has two good-sized pools. Both are right next to the beach as well making for easy access there. Again, these are basic pools, not the huge 2 acre pools with slides and winding pathways that you'll find at the big resorts. But the way I look at it, if you are going to just sit by the pool, go to Vegas or Phoenix instead. Hawaii offers so much more but many people never want to leave their resort. We didn't eat at the hotel and in general I avoid hotel restaurants at all costs because they are universally bad, even at the big resorts. For the money, this is a great place to stay and is in a fantastic location. We had a great time there. But its not perfect and probably not for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: CurlyCris
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay for a discount through expedia, so I assume they gave us their worst room for $150.00 per night when their internet rate was $300+. Other reviewers say their room was nice, ours was HORRIBLE. First of all, we arrived at the hotel and the outside stucco is filthy and chiiping. Not a good first impression. I knew there might be trouble when they actually handed us real keys! Then when we got to the room, 6017 with a partial ocean view, I notice how small and hard the hotel beds are. My husband and I are not large people, but we literally each had to hang a body part off the bed to fit. The beds were so hard parts of my body fell asleep. The furniture is old and the carpets stained. The bathroom shower had paint peeling on the floor. Also, they charge extra if you want coffee or to use the in-room safe. The only thing I liked about the hotel was its proximity to Kaanapali Beach and the ice cream in the shop on the property. If you think you are above sleeping at a Best Western or Motel 6, don't even consider staying here, even if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: LisaF0401
Reviews.Content: We had read some iffy reviews of the Royal Lahaina but got such a deal on priceline that we were willing to throw caution to the wind and try it out. Boy, are we glad that we did. The staff was friendly and upgraded us to a suite which was huge and had a lovely golf course view. The beach is terrific. The pools are okay but not highlight of our trip. We went to the Luau one night which was lovely and reasonably priced. I have been to better luaus but our kids were thrilled and it was about 1/2 the price of the other ones (book in advance online). If you are staying at the Royal Lahaina it is certainly convenient! Our room was clean, clean, clean!

Reviews.Title: “Economical & Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the Royal Lahaina in December, 2005 for a honeymoon vacation. Greeted by smiling and generous bellmen, our bags were ushered up to our oceanfront room (a complimentary upgrade, by the way)without haste. The room can be described as simple. What is noteworthy, is the breathtaking view we celebrated as we stepped onto our balcony. We were even able to catch a glimpse of whales in the bay (since it happened to be that time of year) directly from our position. Exiting the hotel and making our way to the beach offered convenient and serene long walks. This was especially appreciated after realizing this is not possible at many other oceanfront properties on the island. The Resort's luau was excellent, offering delectable entrees and bottomless drinks. Whatever the occassion, family vacation, honeymoon, or a peaceful getaway, the Royal Lahaina makes you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 5th wedding anniversary at the Royal Lahaina Resort. Our room was fine. We didnâ€™t spend much time there anyway. Much to pretty outside to hang in the room. We would have like a little bigger refrigerator, and maybe a little more storage space. (closets). However it was fine. Loved the view from the patio and enjoyed the in room coffee. The beach is great. We only went in the pool once. We spent every day on the beach with a great view. Brought a couple of books that we hardly read. Nice staff, great bartender at the outside bar. He was always smiling, and seemed to enjoy his job. Never ate there however it appears that the restaurants were always busy. Downside; parking getting back late at night and paying for the parking. We choose the package that included a â€œfreeâ€� Mi Tie every day, in room coffee and parking. Over all it was a decent package. $16.00 a day I believe. Parking was $10.00 a day. We will go back there, however next time we will look to book a cottage or duplex. They had great patios to hang on. Overall we will go back and it was a decent hotel. Karl n Sherry Waco, TX

Reviews.Title: “love site hated hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel was not worth the money at all.. the grounds and the staff are great.. the rooms are like a low budget hotel.. we have stayed at some holiday inns for $50.00 that are a lot nicer.. the parkting it also terrible.. you have to pay and from 5-10 when the luau is going on you might as well forget a place to park.. also there is no internet service unless you what to go the the cafe and pay $15.00 a day!!! how is this for a room you are paying $225.00 we will do more reserch next time.

Reviews.Title: “Only the Beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We prepaid a two-night weekend anniversary special last October for this hotel. We received no information about check-in or check-out times. Granted, we could have looked it up on the internet, but the advance information was nil. We arrived at the hotel at 1 p.m. to check in, and were asked if we would like a single king-sized bed or two queen beds. We opted for the two queen beds, and were told we would have an ocean-view room with two queen beds. Check-in time was 3 p.m.. We were told we could leave our luggage and return *any time* after 3 to pick up the room keys, which were then set aside for us. We were also informed that parking was $10.00 per day, but the "package" included a couple of free drinks at the bar on the property. We went to the hotel restaurant for lunch, and paid almost $60 for the one meal - and it was nothing more than simple salads and iced tea. We then went driving around the island and returned shortly before 5. We were taken to a separate building which was a 3-storey walkup, to a room with one king bed and a view of the back yard and some trees. The room was not clean and actually looked extremely run down. When we asked why the room had been changed, there was no response. We were given, in the end, a partial ocean view room with two double beds, but still on the grungy side, and mould growing in the bathroom. It was quite evident that the room we had been given originally (in the anniversary 'package') had been given to someone else. This is, unfortunately, dishonest. Breakfast was by lineup, and was $12.50 per person. By comparison, we were able to get a breakfast in the town of Lahaina for $9 apiece. That same evening we had dinner in Kahului for $32 altogether. We also had an excellent dinner in the town of Lahaina, with a view of the ocean and exceptional service. In the end, we only ate one meal in three days at the hotel. The day we left, we went into Lahaina and bought our own food at the Safeway store. We came away feeling as if the resort was simply out to make money any way possible, and that they really did not care about the guests. Not only that, but in the three days we only once found a parking spot in the hotel guests lot. The rest of the time we had to go to the overflow lot. Ordinarily I wouldn't mind that if it were simply free for all - but when they charge for parking, there should be space available. The only plus to this resort is the wonderful beach, the beautiful sand and incredible water. There is some undertow, and the drop-off is fairly sudden, so it's not always safe at all points of the beach for small children or those who are not strong swimmers. One of the staff told us this hotel is going to be renovated within the next year. It needs it. On its own, the hotel does have a certain old charm, and had we been treated with more respect and honesty, we probably would have overlooked the age and wear. I cannot help but compare with the Beachcomber Hotel where we stay in Waikiki - also one of the oldest resort hotels in Hawaii. We've been there three times now, always get good deals in Canadian dollars, and free parking. They remember us and take care to ensure we enjoy our stay. The food is good and not wildly expensive. I don't intend to go back to this hotel again. We booked through FunSun Vacations in Canada. The resort will be getting a letter from us, with a copy to both FunSun and our travel agent, indicating we don't recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Need to Implode”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Jan 6, 06 to Jan 13,06. Initially we had an oceanfront cottage. No one told us there would be dozens of guests in front of our unit on lounge chairs. This afforded no privacy at all and the unit itself was awful. We changed to a room in the tower on the 6th floor. This was about $70 less per night but no effort was made to reduce our bill. We tried to eat dinner in the hotel one evening and had to use a knife to cut the MahiMahi dinners. Sent both back. They did not charge us so that was a relief.Parking was a joke. The luau guests were to park up the hill in luau parking, yeah right!! Spaces were small and hard to fit into if the next guy overlapped his lines. We're from Las Vegas NV. We implode hotels in this condition and that is our recommendation here. Don't remodel; start over!! Convenience store and other amenities were also a gouge in the pocketbook. The grounds and beach are beautiful, but resort condition and employee attitudes need extreme makeovers. Will not return or recommend. Very sad.

Reviews.Title: “Two Star Hotel with 5 Star Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Expensive Motel 6 with adjacent public beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, not great rooms”
Reviews.Author: april1286
Reviews.Content: I too was worried after reading all of the reviews. You can believe everyone of them. If I only had to base my stay on the room, it would be terrible. But the property is so spacious, and well kept, and out of the way. This made it all worth while. We felt very safe, we have two teenage kids. The pools, the ocean, the lobby were wonderful! The resort charge of $16 per day is a rip-off, parking lot is small, air conditioning does not work. Leave your door open at night with the ceiling fan on, and it will cool off your rooom. Property is great, rooms clean but really old. There is so much to do in Maui, you won't spend it in the room anyway.Skip the Royal Lahaina Luau, go to Old Lahaina Luau. Best thing we did on Maui? Go with trilogy to snorkel on Lanai, best thing we did during the whole 2 weeks. It is a little costly, but extremely well done, saw whales, dolphins,and lots of great views on the way to Lanai. Snorkeling is better than Haunama Bay! About $517 for 2 adults, 1 teen, 1 12 year old. All day excursion and includes sundaes at the end!

Reviews.Title: “No Regrets!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just arrived back last night from Maui and stayed in the Royal Lahaina Resort for 8 x days. We are feeling very bad withdrawl symptons as we had the best trip of our lives and also as a couple(been married 5 years) . We have travelled the world and must say the the RLR is a find. We stayed in the Kai Tower with a deluxe ocean view room 6008 we slept every night to the sound of the waves and woke in the mornings to the same and the also the birds singing. The room was adequate as it had all the extras (king size bed)We slept like logs every night the bed was super comfortable and the room was spotless which included silent air conditioning!. We did unfortunately encounter another guest who was staying at older section of the resort and had terrible things to say but all in all if you want to stay @ RLR I advise the Kai Tower. You will not regret it. The magnificant beach is only steps away and what a view ...its a piece of heaven! I have to stop now as I get emotional thinking about the great time we had on this wonderful island and accomodation..so to all you readers go for it ...incidentally we heard the Hilton bought this resort so book now before the prices go up....

Reviews.Title: “A little shaky at first, but a great experience in the end”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was anxious to finally see this hotel for myself after months of reading very conflicting reviews. After a shaky start in which the safe didn't work, the lamp needed a new bulb, and the air conditioning unit didn't seem to be working, I initially thought that I would never be able to recommend this hotel. However, a lady in the elevator told me that things would get better as our holiday progressed, and she was, indeed, correct. The problems were addressed in a timely manner, the front desk was very courteous, and by the second day, all my concerns seemed to melt away. First of all, this hotel is an older property, as others have said. But "older" doesn't always mean "bad." It does lack the decor/service/ ammenities of the high-end resorts, but it's also not $500+ a night. It is definately not the Ritz or the Four Seasons, but it does have its own kind of charm: lots of old wood, a small, intimate atmosphere, a very close, convenient walk to the gorgeous, spacious beach, a great location in West Maui. I have stayed at four-star resorts and I have stayed at Holiday Inns. If you love the mammoth, cookie-cutter hotel chains (which have their own advantages, of course, but not always a lot of character) this is probably not the place for you. If you are only used to Holiday Inn-like accomodations, this will be an upgrade and you will be happy. If you want a beach hotel with a room that is basic, clean and comfortable, that you really only use to sleep and shower, that is located just a few steps from one of the best beaches in Hawaii, with a staff that is friendly and helpful, then this is the place for you. The beach really is the draw. I'm not kidding: we explored the entire island, including Wailea, and it made me appreciate "our" beach even more: just exquisite! The view from the lanai (8th floor, ocean view) was breathtaking as well: ocean on one side, mountains/golf course/beautifully-manicured grounds on the other. To wrap it all up: this a great hotel for the money. The beach absolutely cannot be beat. The hotel's smaller size makes it very convenient to manuever. The food was good and at prices I thought were very reasonable for Maui. All in all, a wonderful stay and I'd do it again. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heart beat!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had been planning this trip for over 2 years and I must say we were a little worried after readings some of the reviews....The Royal Lahaina is an older resort and it does need some updating, however, for the price and location I wouldn't have wanted to stay anywhere else. Snorkling was great just 100 feet from our cottage, service was awesome, our bed was turned down every night with flowers. We never ran out of fresh towels. The beach is absolutely beautiful and the location is central to everything on Maui. The grounds were well kept and very quiet and relaxing. We spent 7 days here and loved every minute of it! Food was great from the breakfast buffet, to the bar, right straight through to an elegant dinner. We would go back in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Low Expectation, Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had lowered expectation going in, base on reading the other reviews. However, the location of the RLR is pretty good. Located in one of the best area in town, this older resort is convenient to the tourist spots. I would not recommed the regular room on the lower floors. Shoot for a free upgrade at the cottages. I agree with our neighbor that it's the best place to be for the resort. We enjoyed the service of the bell desk and front desk very much. Air conditioning worked great and teh room was very clean. Not fancy though. Too few channels on TV, but I guess you shouldn't stay in the room too much in paradise

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older and does not have a "resort" feel but it was a good value for the price. The room was standard, clean and spacious. The oceanview room and lanai were nice. The ice machine does not work well, but staff will gladly bring you ice. The beach there is amazing. Great snorkeling spot to the righ at Ka'anapli Beach Park. We held a meeting there and the room was a very good size. It has a convenient location, but paying for parking seems odd. There is a luau there 6 nights a week. We did not attend it, but our room offered a prime view to enjoy the entertainment. The resturant has some very good dishes for dinner and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Delightful”
Reviews.Author: kcsu
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, so don't believe all reviews you may have read. We just returned from a week at Royal Lahaina. We had a cottage within a few yards of the pool, beach and main hotel. It is not brand new but it is delightful. Everyone was so nice and helpful.Our king bed unit was clean and had a nice patio.The grounds were kept very clean and the gardens beautiful. Beaches not too busy and the sand clean. With a beautiful golf course next door, it made great morning walking. The restaurant served good food. I especially liked the breakfast buffet. Lots of variety and food very fresh. We ate overlooking the pool and ocean, even saw whales 2 days as we enjoyed breakfast.The luau had a nice variety of food and the entertainment was fun. My only complaint was the parking lot. You are asked to pay a daily fee. The spots are very small and not enough spots, especially when the luau visitors are there too. Visit this place soon because I am sure the cottages will be gone when they remodel the hotel in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star resort with a very good crew.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant surprise when we got here. It is clean, the service people always have good attitudes, the view is tremendous and the room was a 5 star with great ammenities. The bed was King and in great condition. The room constantly smelled of disinfectant and was extremely clean. Hallways were also. We had a view of the pool, ocean, palm trees, people walking along the surf and the grass. The tradewinds were blowing and it was lovely. They have a small, but very nice balcony with 2 chairs. I absolutely loved it there and I highly reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Maui at this hotel was fun. We booked through Pleasant Holidays and is their resort. Our room faced the South West side. It was clean and the bathroom was okay. Shower drainage wasn't working too well though. Buffet was included in our package and was worth it. You can have a wonderful breakfast facing the ocean and see some of the other islands in the horizon. They had two pools and a wonderful beautiful beach. Hotel location was great. Your commute to Lahaina (central area for shopping, restaurants, etc) was less than 15 minutes and walking distance from the Kaanapali shopping center. This part of the island is not too far from all the boating tours/activities. Pleasant Holidays has a breakfast orientation presenting all the activities and some tour companies will pick up from this hotel. Recommend the early rise Volcano tour and then biking down...it was such an amazing experience. We drove to Hana in the clockwise direction with a Ford economy car...great to see the untouched parts of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous beach..good value”
Reviews.Author: scram_toots
Reviews.Content: Some people need to realise that you get what you pay for, and this is definately value for money. It is much nicer than many 3 star resorts all over the world. The staff were very accomodating, but our hairdrier had a melted cord and the bathroom could do with a bit of a better clean,,or a revamp or something. The resturant and bar below were delicious..id recommend the mango smoothie..virgin..its to die for. Kaanipali beach stretch is beautiful and if you can't afford the westin...this may not be as luxurious but its definately very comfortable and accomodating. If might want to go elsewhere for the luau however, it rained and it was kinda gross. Overpiced also. The food was tasty though!!

Reviews.Title: “Spend your nights elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Arleene_s
Reviews.Content: We were not impressed with this place. We booked through a travel agent. The staff was rude. The hotel was very outdated. The beds were extremely small. We stood in several inches of our own shower water as the shower wouldn't drain. The glass sliding door into the bath fell off on the first attempt to close it and was that way the hole five days we stayed. I don't mind paying to park, but it would be nice to be able to find a spot. And the size of the parking spaces when you do was a joke. Be sure to let your passengers out before you pull in. If you want this quality go to a motel 6. If you are looking for a nice place don't go here.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for the price, no frills, just relaxing & quiet”
Reviews.Author: MamaAli
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the garden cottages and loved it. They are not super fancy, but comfortable and the patio area was nice. We liked the feel of being surrounded by trees and it was very peaceful. The breakfast buffet was included with the price of our room and was very tasty with a large variety. Good choice for someone who doesn't need a lot of frills. The property is big enough to have what you need, but small enough so you don't feel overwhelmed with people.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe all these bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Bam86
Reviews.Content: I really can't believe what everyone is saying about this lovely hotel. I went there with my mum and stepdad (they got married in maui) and everything was great. The staff were very friendly, and extremely helpful with anything we asked. We had no problems with our rooms, very clean, bathroom was immaculate with everything in working order. The views were fantastic - and we were only on the first floor!! Nightlife wasn't great but there are bars within walking distance and all people were very friendly. Shopping was good, with a $1 bus that takes you for miles (or you could walk to the nearest) In fact we enjoyed it so much that my mum, step dad, grandma and grandad are all back there right now!! Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Cottages were quaint and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Joan006
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was very nervous because I had made reservations for 2 rooms on Priceline. When checking in I asked for cottage rooms, since I read that the Hale building was a dump. They were not kidding. We were fortunate and got the garden cottages, without additional charge. The cottages needed some updating, but overall very comfortable. The grounds are maintained beautifully and the beach was better than at some of the 4 star resorts. The breakfast buffet was very good. We ate there several times, but the Dine and Deli down the street from the resort was also very good for sandwiches and breakfast. My suggestion check out the room first before checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a break, guys.”
Reviews.Author: jra7750
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Oct. 19 to Oct 30. We rented an oceanfront cottage bedroom, which was the reason we picked this particular property. It is the only hotel complex that still has this type of accommodation. The room was older, true, but it also had high ceilings and a big soaking tub, things you don't see anymore except in the high end properties. It did need repairs, the slider stuck and the screen was a little rusty, but the service was fast, friendly, kept immaculately clean, and you could step outside onto your own large veranda, with your own lounges, chairs and table, and walk a few steps to a pool and the beach! No stairs, no center hallways, just you and a garden. What do you go to Hawaii for, for heaven's sake? I watched nine weddings in our front yard over the weekend. We found out during the stay that they are going to eliminate the cottages which are spread out over many acres, and build more towers in their place - drat! - and that is why they are not replacing sliders etc. In the meantime, if you want a hotel that has a beautiful uncrowded beach out the front door and a lovely golf course out the back, right on the property, a private tennis club on the hill, also right on the property, a remarkable buffet breakfast every morning, and to see the sunset from your own veranda amid wonderfully landscaped grounds and walkways, book the cottages at the Royal Lahaina! They are going away, never to return in all Hawaii. You'll see a Hawaiian hotel the way they all used to be before land became so valuable. Just do it fast. Our well priced package included daily breakfast and car. Definitly recommended. Also, our cottage had coffee and a safe anyway, so don't pay extra for that package.

Reviews.Title: “You Might Be Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Czech_Girl9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahina Resort for 3 nights in October 2005. At first sight, the property and hotel entrance looked like a really nice place to stay. However, that image quickly changes once you are taken into your actual hotel room. My first clue that this "resort" was not what I bargained for was when the front desk handed me two gold keys to grant access to our rooms. Yes, that's right - two KEYS - not a slim electronic card, but actual keys, along with a note that you will be charged $20 if you misplace a key. The room we were given on the 9th floor (deluxe oceanview), was very outdated. We were given two full size beds since they were all out of king beds, which were very uncomfortable. The size of the bathroom was adequate, but the shower was in need of some repair - not to mention a longer shower curtain. The airconditioning unit allows you three settings, low, medium or high - none of them work really well. However, you do get a great breeze from the Lanai. Also, this resort offers a luau that we did not atttened. One of the hotel employees encouraged us to go to the Old Lahaina Luau, which we did and it was wonderful, and several other employees mocked the resort property. As the old saying goes, "you know it's bad when........." Pros: Right on Kaanapali beach and a short drive to Lahaina. The grounds of this resort are beautiful and make up for the unattractive and outdated rooms. Cons: The quality of the rooms and parking. You are charged $10/day for parking in spaces so small that even a compact car has dificulty squeezing into. You are also charged for using the safe and the coffee maker unless your buy their "value package" that is $16/day (includes parking, coffee, use of the safe and 2 mai tai's a day). Bottom line: Stay here if you can get this place for a bargain of a price (we paid $105/night through Priceline). We only slept in our room for 6-7 hours per night - the rest of the time we were out and about so we were able to ignore most of the problems with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: lthines57
Reviews.Content: The rooms were not very clean. The room smelled of mold. The floors were dirty. I had a bungelow & the lighting outside on the patio did not work. The customer service was alright & so was the food. I just felt it should have been much more cleaner, especially for the price. I definately do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We looked at this hotel and it was a dump. We would not stay here for a seond!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the Price, Stay Away from the Hale Building”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on this website, we were a little nervous about staying here. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. We were booked in a Hale Oceanview room. My husband and I travel to the Caribbean alot and compared to other resorts we have stayed at (Sandals, Beaches...), the room would have been considered partial oceanview instead of oceanview. We went back to the front desk and told them we were disappointed with the room. The guy at the front desk was not very helpful so we asked for a manager and he was very cooperative. He wasn't able to move us that night but he moved us to the main tower first thing the next morning. The rooms in the main tower are alot nicer than the Hale building. I was trying to be optimistic about the Hale building but the reviews are right, just pay the extra to stay in the main tower, you'll be much happier. The view from our new room was what we expected, beautful! The rooms were nothing spectacular but they were nice for the price. The beach here was nice too. It was a lot more crowded down the way. I have never been to a Luau before so I don't really have anything to compare it to but for the price, I thought it was good. The food was really good. As far as the parking spaces, yes they are small but all of the parking spaces were small (here, Front Street parking lots, other restaurants, etc.). Most of the complaints seem to be with the Hale building and the cottages. For the price, the main tower was nice. They do charge for parking, coffee and use of the safe but when we arrived they had three signs sitting on the front desk showing you the prices and they also showed it as a value package -- 2 free Mai Tais daily, parking, safe and coffee. For the price ($200 something per night for oceanview), my husband and I would go back to the Royal Lahaina. It is Hawaii, you hardly spend any time in your room anyway!

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this hotel. We went first in May 2005 and were given a room in the main tower facing the water. The view was incredible. The room was nice enough - although the bathroom area could have been more modern. This second time, we booked the same class ''ocean-view' room and were given a room in the Royal Hale - a 3 story building behind the luau area. Although the design of the room was the same - the view and the conditions of the room were very shabby. When I called and asked for a better room saying where I had stayed before the front desk manager was rather short and rude. They made the excuse I had been upgraded before (which I know I had not been). Overall, Hawaii is expensive - so booking this hotel does save you some money and still keeps you right on Kaanaapli Beach - so I guess you have to make a few sacrifices. That said, don't eat anything other than breakfast at the hotel - the prices are WAY too high for lunch and dinner. Find a local spot like Aloha Mixed Plate on Front Street for more authentic Hawaiian food. The luau was fun and not too bad for the cost ($60 each)And brush up on your tagalog since most of the staff we met were from the Philippines!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizzienmick
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned before arrival after reading some reviews. However, we needn't have worried. The Royal Lahaina was an excellent choice for our first trip to Hawaii. We were given a ground floor room in the Royal Hale which was excellent - we just opened our patio doors and with about 20 paces we were on the beach! Everything was clean, there was plenty of drawer and wardrobe space. When we came in at night, the light was on, the bed had been turned down and orchids were placed on the bed. The pool bar/restaurant was a lovely place to sit and have a drink and we had breakfast there most days. The cost for the special deal was $8.50 and it was delicious - especially enhanced by the beautiful view, the birds flying about and the lovely Hawaiian music. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. It cost $16 a day for the car park and the room safe but this included two Mai Tais every night which would have come to almost that anyway. We thoroughly enjoyed it - the location is lovely - a bit out of the way from the other big hotels so we preferred that. The beach is beautiful and never busy. Some people have said they do not like hearing the luau every night. It didn't bother us (we were almost next door to where it is held) after all - that's one of the reasons why we travelled 8,000 miles from England to Hawaii - to hear the beautiful music in a beautiful country!

Reviews.Title: “We give it a 6 of 10.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Walls made of paper, we can hear the neighboors. My wife saw a mouse in the bathroom area. Noisy A/C and Refrigerator freezes everyhing. Try not to stay in the Royal Hale wing. The price in the Royal Hale wing is alot cheaper but you will pay for it in the way above. The beach is only 25 steps away a a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip to the Royal Lahaina through Priceline who rated it a 3-Star, the highest on their list, which purportedly includes the likes of Hyatt, Hilton, Embassy Suites. Upon our arrival, the grounds appeared quite beautiful, but contained scattered "cottages" in addition to the main hotel. We quickly learned the hotel did not offer valet service and that we would be forced to self-park in a lot with the smallest parking stalls I have ever seen (I almost had to climb out the window to exit, I'm only 165 lbs). Our rental car was hit in the lot on the second night of our stay, obviously by a Luau reveler who was leaving and could not navigate the small spaces. Our room was in one of the scattered cottages (5-plex), far from the beach. Due to a lack of privacy, we kept our slider door curtains closed the entire time and were unable to open the wooden tongue and groove shutters because they served as both a window and a shade (opening them let in the hot air). Since the fluorescent type lighting in the room did not work intermittently, the lack of outside light was annoying. The shutters also did not block outside noises (see below).
