The room was very outdated and contained the following amenities: stained carpet, broken tiles in bathroom, black mold in grout, chipped ceiling paint hanging down, dryrot in baseboard in bathroom, portable wall unit A/C (e.g. Motel 6) that was very noisy and did not adequately cool the room, glass closet door sliders that fell off the tracks on first try, etc. Sleeping past 5 am was made impossible, first by sprinklers, then by birds, then by mowers and trimming (all before 7 am). There was only one ice machine for all the cottages, about 400 feet away near the main hotel. The hotel tacked on various petty charges that are not inherent in a quality resort (i.e. $3.50 for use of in-room coffee, $3.75 for use of safe, etc.). We were unable to order pool side food to watch the 6:30 p.m. sunset without going inside and ordering "to go", luckily we asked because the pool waitress advised we couldn't get any food by the pool at that time, and certainly did not offer to obtain it for us. The food was adequate, but nothing more. On our last morning, a very large cockroach ran from under the bed and had to be pursued and terminated. I have pictures but have not had time to download them yet. Certainly, my wife and I did not expect the Ritz Carleton. On the other hand, our room would have been a much better fit at a Motel 6, Economy 8, etc. It was certainly unlike any Hyatt, Hilton or Embassy Suites I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Ocean View room for $220 per night, the pictures looked okay so we thought it was going to be nice. Watch out! The Royal Lahaina is outdated, showers are small and clog up, A/C is not worth using, carpet was stained, bed was hard as a board. Their customer service wasn't too impressive, you get better service at a fast food joint. Watch out for hidden charges, we got billed on our last day for using the safe (3.91 per day) there was no posting they would charge us for it and the bell boy told us it's ours to use and showed us how, they refused to drop the charge for it. Their restaurant has a moldy fruit smell and everything's overpriced (15.50 per person for the breakfast). They charge you $10 per hour to use their chairs on the beach- shouldn't that be included in your stay?? Other than the hotel, Maui was very nice and fun. I wouldn't recommend this hotel, there are many more that are nicer and less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our tenth wedding anniversary at the Royal Lahaina, and we could not be more pleased with everything. The location made it easy to get everywhere with ease, and the staff was very helpful. We went looking for a nice, clean palce to lay our heads after a good day of exploring the island, and we sure found that at the Royal Lahaina Resort! Our tenth floor, ocean view room gave us a great morning and evening view of the beach and water, while letting us listen to the trade winds blowing. We loved it, and hope to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip! Wonderful Hotel! 2nd time here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina from August 11 - 19. This was our 2nd stay at the RL (the first was 1996 and we loved it then). Our room was 1134 (ocean front - 11th floor). When we decided to return to Maui I did not even consider another hotel since we were totally satisfied with our first stay. After I booked is when I started reading reviews of the hotel (the internet was not that big when we went the first time). I must say that I was surprised with what I was reading!? How could people find this VERY Hawaiian Resort to be "kitchy"? I can only say that most of the bad reviews are from "seasoned" travelers that are used to $300 per night rooms that were looking for cheaper digs on Maui or had one bad experience that they let ruin the whole stay. Our room was neat, clean, no mold or bugs. Beautiful view of the ocean. The north side of black rock (where the RL is) is uncrowded and pristine. We did take a jaunt around the south end by Whalers Village and found it to be too much like Waikiki (commercial). The $16 charge per day was worth it for us for the safe and coffee (although I think that no one ever checked the parking pass). It also gets you a free Mai Tai at the Beachcomer every night. Be sure and ask for more Mai than Tai (and drop a few bucks in his jar). Every night you could find good conversation there (trust me - he knows where to stay away from and where to find the good places to eat). If you don't drink coffee or use the safe it may not be worth the money. HINT - ALL the parking spots on Maui are SMALL! Not just at the Royal Lahaina. I parked many times during the Luau and never had to wait for a space to open. The walk is no longer than parking at Walmart when they are busy. Never took us more that 5 minutes from parking to room. We don't spend much time in the room when we travel so I don't put much stock in the carpet and ceiling (we had no complaints). My ONLY complaint was the TV only got 17 stations (they do have many pay for view movies). The grounds are beautiful and kept up. Pools are nothing special but we always paid the $35 to rent a cabana for the day to be by the beach. The staff was attentive to everything we asked for (more pillows, extra coffee, room turn downs, safe fixing for no charge (because I was stupid the first day and forgot the password)). We never met a rude employee during our stay. Free beach towels and friendly pool staff. Great snorkling at black rock. Lots to do and see - WAY TOO much to list here. Feel free to email and ask about my recommendations of Hana, Haleakala, Io Valley, Antiques, Gardens (Enchanted Gardens is a MUST if you like local flora) ... Anyway - we loved it! For $100/night (we booked a package - air/car/hotel) you can't go wrong. Save the money and spend it on horseback riding (thanks Rocky at the Mendes Ranch), winery, castaways cafe (ask the bartender at the Beachcomer). Just enjoy your stay on Maui and don't sweat the small stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at a better place”
Reviews.Author: kinikia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married on Maui and we had some relatives staying at the Royal Lahina Resort. I saw nothing good about this place. Their room was in the Royal Hale wing and it was very dated and the rooms were old and worn and very dark, it felt like they were staying in a closet. They were also right next to the luau which was very noisy for them every night. I didn't get to see any of the other wings of the hotel...i hope they were much better than this. My advice is stay away from the Royal Lahaina. They booked their accomodations as part of a package deal so thankfully they didn't pay much. Thier rack rates are ridiculous. My husband and I stayed at a very nice two bedroom cottage just a few minutes away and the rates were almost identical. Another gripe is that they charge you $10 to park your car and another $5 on top of that if you want to make local calls. Also, if you are not a guest and you go to their luau they charge you $4 to park. It is way too overpriced and so not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, wonderful, fantasitic, unforgettable, stupendous!!”
Reviews.Author: Terrorintheair
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and her friend and I stayed at the Lahania Resort from August 1-August 8th of 2005. I must congradulate all those affilated with the Royal Lahania Resort, contrary to some of the negative reviews I've seen, my family and I found our stay there to be the BEST!!! Not only were the staff courteous and helpful, but Jonny on the Spot when asked to do extra duties!!! You should all be commended and thank you one and all for the most wonderful vacation ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The rooms were always clean and we never had to worry about the toilet clogging or drains overflowing as we have in other more expensive hotels!!!! You ARE THE Best!! Our family hopes one day to see you all again and stay at your gorgeous resort. We were on the 7th floor and the view was exquisite!!! Mahalo--Robert, Beverley and Jessica Richmond friend of family: Alena Regan Bakersfield, California

Reviews.Title: “Hated It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We ended up only staying one night at this hotel. ALthough the location of this hotel is prime, the hotel rooms do not make up for it. It truly is in need of renovation. The rooms are old, the carpet is worn, and the ceiling in our bathroom was peeling. If you are planning a week long vacation here, I would reconsider. Also, we paid $80.00, yes, 80.00 for lunch ( 2 adults, 3 children)....my kids had chicken nuggets and fries, I had chicken wings and my husband had a burger!!!!! Rip-off!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a horrible place!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bad food, a fruit fly infested salad bar, faulty plumbing, inadequate parking, and a rude staff. What more could you want? On the last night of our stay, our shower started burping up garbage. the mainatenace man was rude and insulting and only made the problem worse. We were moved to a room overlooking the parking lot and got no sleep due to traffic noise and car alarms. When we asked for compensation, the manager was rude, sarcastic, insensitve and did his best to characterize us as unreasonable. My two favorite quotes form him are "This is an old hotel, stuff happens" and " I can't control car alarms" He even tried to make us feel like cheapskates for booking through Expedia. I spoke to another guest there who had been charged for phone calls that never connected who recieved the same treatment when he complained. Our vacation was ruined. Avoid this place. It is a horrible waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Gem - great for families. Would go again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from our 8 day stay at the Royal Lahaina. Aug 8 to 15th. We did not want to come home! It was fabulous. After reading other reviews here we were apprehensive but we can not recommend this place enough! It's too bad you didnt experience what we did. We checked out the Sheraton, Marriot and Westin on Kaanapali while we were there. The Royal Lahaina for the price and atmosphere was the BEST! It has the best beach for families and not crowded like south Kaanapali. My 6 yr old and 9 yr old loved to boogie board, build sand castles, snorkel there and then walk over to the front of the Sheraton to snorkel at Black Rock. Whalers Village shopping has a food court for cheaper meals and great shops. Love the ABC stores! Safeway has a great roast chicken and accessories if you are like us and cant eat out for every meal as it gets to be tough on the digestive system and kids want snacks on the room. If you want lots of surf to boogie board, the Ritz Carlton beach - DT Fleming was great, they have a lifeguard but the tides/current can get nasty. Be careful. We stayed in the tower on the top floor, 12th, had no problems...even the room staff gave us extra coffee, towels, cups, etc. We had no problems when we needed the security personnel to come fix the in-room safe after our ds messed with it. Got there within minutes! The room was clean, newer in decor (beds were a dble not queen size) but the view on the lanai and from the room was FANTASTIC! Recommend the extra $ for the parking fee, daily 2 Mai Tais (from Don the Beachcomber bar), fridge and in room safe. All hotels seem to charge for this. We ate 3 dinners, 2 breakfasts and 2 lunches in the dining room. The early bird dinner special and the surf and turf special -recommend! Kids ate for FREE! Wait staff was friendly and fast. The ice cream shop was nice and the laua was just OK. Preferred Germaine's over on Oahu but our kids loved the fire eater/dancer finale. Buy your tickets from Expedia there in the lobby - cheaper and kids are free...give yourself a few days tho. The Royal Lahaina have the lighting of the tiki torches ceremony at dusk around the first pool and live hawaiian musicians in the dining room every night. Fabulous to listen to and watch the sunset from your dinner table over the ocean beach! Parking stalls are tight as too many people cant seem to park their cars properly but we never had a problem finding one close to the hotel every night. If you want a generic concrete hotel that could be at any beach in the world do not stay here. If you want a more traditional Hawaiian experience with thatched roofs on the surrounding buildings, waking to the pounding surf and bird songs, watch sunrises and sunsets over the beach, golf course and hills, beautiful lush tropical grounds and the best beach.....STAY HERE! We've travelled extensively around the world and this was a great trip! Also have to recommend Harmony Airways! Good job...love full service for coach pricing! Would definetly recommend the Royal Lahaina and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Vapor63
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned after a seven-night stay in the tower at the Royal Lahaina Resort. Staff was friendly and the setting was beautiful; however, the facility is old and worn out. Problems: Air conditioning did not work. A technician attempted to repair the air flow into our room and commented that the system had not been cleaned in years. The repair failed. Water pressure in the shower was little more than a dribble. Water temperature in the shower constantly fluctuated from warm to cold. Water out of the tap tasted bad. At least one elevator was constantly on the blink. Restaurant and amenity prices are excessive. $2.25 for a refill of ice-tea! Seems greedy. Our "queen" beds were doubles and the sheets were too short. Housekeeping did not replace towels every day. Don't know about the sheets. Furnishings are old and the entire room setting felt dirty. I recommend against staying at the Royal Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on the Royal Lahaina Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Shame on the Royal Lahaina! I could not wait to come home and write a review for this hotel. My trip was great because I was in Hawaii for a family reunion. However, this hotel was a disappointment. The resort has great grounds, a super beach but it is really dated. I don't think the owners are putting their money back into the hotel. We stayed in one of the cottages, and it was filthy. The couch looked like something from a fraternity house, the walls were so dirty they didn't even wipe clean when I tried. The carpet was worn and dirty. Basically there was old dirt and dust everywhere. The washing machines had mold growing in them. I couldn't imagine being there on my honeymoon in that filth. The front desk acted like they have never run a hotel bill before and got our families all screwed up and even double billed us. Here is another tip, find out how many people are able to attend the luau. We were told there were 500 people there...you could hardly pull your chair out to sit or stand, and I woudn't recommend the dancers either they were very canned and looked bored to death. For the money you can do better. Some one needs to buy the resort and fix it up.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: NJ_J0HNNY
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a most memorable vacation (July 26 - July 31) in beautiful Maui and the wonderful Royal Lahaina Resort. We read these reviews for a month before our trip and we realy didn't know what to expect or who to believe. Well, take it from two fussy travelers, the grounds are breathtaking and well kept, the location is first class and our room (9011) in the Kai Tower was furnished with a King size bed and the bedding looked brand new! The room was extremely clean and the friendly maid service kept it that way. Nothing in the room was in need of repair, there were no "musty odors" or any "insect sightings" as mentioned in some previous reviews. But, I would suggest not getting a room in the Hale Building, as it did look old from the outside. This building looks nothing like the rest of the resort. Maybe staying there was the reason for some bad reviews. If staying in the Kai Tower ask for an odd numbered room because the view of the West Maui mountains, golf course, resort's cottages and of course the ocean, is spectacular! If you get an even numbered room your view will be obstructed unless you're above the 9th floor. The Luau show and food was great! The beach is clean and the beach activity staff was there to help you with whatever water activity you desired-also in supplying you with towels. Yes, you have to pay $10 per day for parking, just like any other resort on the island. But, for $16 you get parking, the use of the in-room safe, coffee and coffee pot, local telephone calls and 2 Mai-Tai's daily (at the bar $7.50 each)! You can't beat it! OK, the parking spaces are a little tight, but I parked my mid-sized car with no problem. The "Breakfast Buffet" was well worth $14.95 if you like fresh fruit, omlets made to order, fresh pastery, juice, coffee, scrambeled eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, waffles, pancackes, and many, many more items. The Basil Tomatoe restaurant is a little pricey, but serves delicious pasta dishes! If you like golf or tenneis, you'll find it at this resort. There are 3 pools. One of which is secluded and is located by the tennis courts. There are many shops on the grounds to care for your various needs, even a laundry. The elevatores and hallways were a little warm but, you weren't in them for long. The staff was pleasant, helpfull and full of "Aloha" spirit. If you're looking for excursions to go on try the Atlantis submarine, the Maui Princess Dinner cruise, and the Ulalena show all out of Lahaina. Go on the "Road to Hana" and go see the view at the summit of Haleakala. It is breathtaking. Although, I wouldn't suggest the bicycle ride down. We would definitely return to this resort again! Mahalo and Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort from June 10 - 13 and could not wait to check out. We were given an upgrade to one of the cotages and it smelled like pee. The scent went away after turning onthe AC but as soon as we left the room someone came inthe room and turned off the AC everytime. I would not recommend staying here and will not be going back to this hotel. I would rather pay 4x the amount to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahina Luau a dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Almaden
Reviews.Content: In general, the Royal Lahaina Luau (Not the Old Lahaina Luau) was a disappointment. We had OK seats but I noticed that people near the end of the very long line to get in got bad seats... either they were far from the stage or with their back to the stage. They are quick to serve drinks but they are Weak with a capital W! The biggest disappointment of all is the food. The pork was way too salty, the turkey was dry, and the fish had all its flavor cooked away. The steak was so chewey and hard to cut that we gave up trying to eat it. The side dishes such as the fried rice and noodles were nothing special but was the only thing we could eat since the featured food was so bad. Normally we are not finicky eaters so this was not a case of us expecting high level food... we knew we were dealing with buffet food and yet it bordered on being uneatable. Well how about the desert? They can't screw that up, can they. Yep, they can! The chocolate cake had a chemical preservative flavor to it... like the prepackaged cakes at a store. The coconut cake was better but nothing special. Then the show begins. The show is OK... we were entertained by it and the firedance at the end was good too. The show won't knock your socks off but it will keep you entertained. Since this was the 1st time for a luau for us, we have nothing to compare the entertainment to so its possible the other luaus are better for this. According to our guide book and people we talked to, the Old Lahainia Luau is much better that this one but its booked weeks in advance. Where as the luau we attended (the Royal Lahina Luau) has lots of empty seats.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Lahaina is not royal.”
Reviews.Author: SB_maui
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels we have ever stayed at. We had reservations for the Marriott Hotel in the Kaanapali area, however, we were able to get an earlier flight one day early and booked one night at the Royal Lahaina. The internet site stated that the hotel had been renovated, which included new carpet, furniture, etc. Unfortunately, the flight was delayed and we ended up arriving at 9pm. They put us in one of the rooms which was apart from the main building. We settled into the room to find mold in the shower, cracked floor tile in the bathroom, the safety lock on the door was missing. the mattress fell off of the frame, some of the dresser drawers broken and the furniture appeared to be old. Our son fell asleep instantly and we were stuck for the night. The next day we complained about the room. The manager stated that the furniture was new to their hotel and was purchased from another hotel which went out of business. The management is not at all accommodating and refused to reimburse us for any of the problems encountered. The manager denied that the website stated the hotel was renovated. They even charged us to park our car outside in the open lot. We found out the hotel was owned by Pleasant Hawaiian and they finally refunded our money.

Reviews.Title: “The cottages were the greatest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had read some bad reviews on the resort. We were pleasantly surprised with our stay at The Royal Lahaina Resort. The beach was the best beach around and we went to many. We (6 of us) had two cottages and were very pleased with them and the grounds, which were so beautiful. It was very clean and comfortable. We would love going back there anytime, but my husband and I only have one 30th aniversary in a life time. The Luau was fabulous too!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon - had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: jenn716
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the Royal Lahaina on our honeymoon for 6 nights. We loved it! I was really skeptical after reading the reviews but I found none of the horrible things people complained about. When we arrived the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful, the bellboy was friendly and gave us all kinds of info. The lobby area was very authentic, which I enjoyed, being in Hawaii. We stayed in the Alii Suite on the 8th floor. It was totally clean, no bugs, the carpet wasn't gross. It was huge, almost as big as our apartment. The bathroom was nice, the walk-in closet huge with lots of space. Yes, the rooms are a little dated, not the furniture or decor, but just like in an older home, there are things that are worn and peely, but it wasn't gross at all. We weren't afraid to be in the shower, although the shower door didn't shut completely, it didn't leak. The tub was really nice. Housekeeping came everyday and made everything clean and fresh. Nightly turn down service with orchids on our bed was beautiful and fun. We got our champagne the second day, as we arrived late the night before. Housekeeping was also very quick to bring up anything extra we needed (like towels). We got our morning paper everyday. The view from the suite is amazing as you have 3 balconies. We could see everything. Parking was never a problem for us, even during the luau. They have areas of the parking lot sectioned off, just for hotel guests that people attending the luau can't park in. No, you may not get front row parking and people do park crooked, but it was never an issue for us, even in a jeep grand cherokee. The food was really good. So many people on here have complained about the breakfast, they must be crazy. We were in breakfast heaven every morning. The food was warm, delicious and the variety was awesome! We made it to breakfast between 6:30-7:30 everyday and it was never crowded. One morning we got there at 8 and it was getting crowded, but the food was still wonderful. We are now really missing breakfast there. Try the waffles with the coconut syrup...mmmmm! The lounge had really good food too, we had the Kahuna salad, which was one of the best salads I've ever had. We ordered room service one night, ribs and a burger, both were really good. The only place we didn't like the food was the Tomatos Basil resterant on the property. It was overpriced and nasty. We'd never seen so much fat on filet mignon. The lady at the concierge was a little ditsy, be sure to get confirmations for anything you book through her. Aunty Lei at the activities desk was pretty helpful, booked us on a great kayaking trip. It was through Kellys Kayaking and it was awesome. The snorkeling trip to molokini and turtle town she booked wasn't very good... so just don't book on anything with more than 40-50 people and don't book on the Prince Kuhio. It was overcrowded with bad service and bad equipment. The beach off this hotel is amazing! It's never crowded, we went at all times of the day. It's warm, no real waves, there is stuff to see snorkeling right off the beach. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful. The sunset dinner sail was so much fun, it pulled right up to the beach and there were dolphins everywhere. The luau was great. The luau food was delicious, especially the pig, but everything was so good. We had a wonderful wonderful time at this hotel and we will definitely come back. I want to come back with kids and extended family in the future. Booking the suite was well worth it, for approx $500 a nite we got the suite with amazing views, a jeep grand cherokee, breakfast every morning, a dinner cruise and tickets to the luau. It was well worth every penny. You can't get a garden view room at one of the big hotels for that. Ignore anything bad anyone says, stay in a decent room and you'll have a great time. We met several people while we were there and everyone loved it, even those that were staying in the cottages. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A great value for the money (if you're on your honeymoon/anniversary)!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 8 nights at the Royal Lahaina to celebrate our anniversary in mid-July 2005 and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The resort is located in Ka'anapali, *the* premiere location on Maui. The grounds of the resort are large and well-manicured, bordered by the beach on one side and a golf course on another. The place boasts a number of restaurants and little shops which we thought enhanced the resort, but only aesthetically. You will probably find the shops and restaurants on the grounds to be overpriced with mediocre fare and borderline service (of course, this is Maui so everything moves a little slower). Some things we discovered during our stay: - This is a particularly good resort if you're on your honeymoon or anniversary. You'll get a free upgrade based on availability - in our case we moved from the older Royal Hale building to the newer, nicer tower. Our first night we were in a smaller corner room with non-functional A/C. In the morning we asked to move and were quickly accomodated. If you're not staying for a honeymoon/anniversary you may find that the hotel is overpriced. This is especially true if you're bringing your family, since some of the rooms run on the small side. - The activities desk in the lobby is actually helpful and offers good prices. The Royal Lahaina luau prices at $77 on the resort's website, but the Expedia desk can get you tickets for $58. - Speaking of the luau, although we really enjoyed the experience, the event happens EVERY NIGHT. If you're coming from the mainland, be prepared for banging drums, clapping, and shouting until 9:30 local time (which will be 3:30 AM for you East Coasters). Also, the wind can be loud on the upper floors of the tower. The rooms with the partial ocean view will get the full brunt of the noise - the garden view rooms will be much quieter. - The hotel is a little older so be prepared for some minor quirks. Whenever our neighbors showered (at 5AM), the pipes squeaked and groaned. The A/C may or may not work. Also, the elevators are notoriously slow and some of the doors in the rooms may stick. We found this to be minor inconveniences, though - this is what made the difference between a four- and five-star review in our minds. - As mentioned above, the hotel's restaurants aren't all that great, but there are some cool places to eat nearby. CJ's Deli is within walking distance and if you have a car be sure to check out the Plantation House in Napili. It's about a 15 minute drive and offers a great view, great food, with a great price. Also, the Honolua Store in Kapalua (right next to the Ritz Carlton) has a really good take-out breakfast for under $5. - When checking out, you'll have access to a hospitality room where you can shower and freshen up before heading out. This was great for us, since we had a few hours between check-out and our flight.

Reviews.Title: “read this review first!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed here for 7 days and have absolutely no complaints! it makes me think that some of the bad reviews are from the hotels competitors! our hotel room was ALWAYS clean. our towels and wash cloths ALWAYS stocked. for those who complained about the breakfast bar, i have no idea what you are talking about! it was full with eggs, bacon, sausage, fresh fruit, you name it, it was there, and it was delicious. breakfast is served from 630 to 10 am. of course if you get up and go eat at 945, the food won't be fresh, but set your alarm if you can't get up, and go eat earlier. DO NOT go eat at LONGHI'S downtown. it is too expensive(35 bucks for a steak), and only a steak. the hotel staff was friendly, especially AUNTY LEI. she works at the desk in the main lobby that arranges the different activities for you! she is kind of a "surrogate mother" to us young couples and wants to take care of us,lol! the beach is wonderful with places to snorkel right off the beach, no need to pay hundreds of dollars to go way off the shoreline, its right there! i will come back and post some photos so everyone can see the view from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina hotel on our honeymoon in June!! We were pleasantly surprised despite the reviews we read leading up to the vacation. We arrived and told the desk that we were on our honeymoon. They upgraded us to a cottage. It was wonderful--ocean view! The room was very clean with a big shower. The staff was excellent!! We bought the parking package which included a 2 drinks a night at the Beachcomber. Let me say it is a little dated, but we made the best of it! Sitting in a dark bar can be very romantic!!! The beach was gorgeous and we snorkeled along the "rock". We did not visit the luau, but if you have been to one you have been to all of them. They seem to be all alike! Anyways, this is great hotel and we really enjoyed our time here.

Reviews.Title: “Part of our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ALOHA!!!! My husband and I (we just got married and it feels so right to call him my husband now but it'll still take some getting used to) stayed at the Royal Lahaina, Maui, Hawaii, as part of our honeymoon (we also stayed on other islands). We booked this hotel through our travel agency and we were a bit suspicious about the prior reviews. I'll tell you that we had a great time. As high as we were flying anyway from just "tying the knot," this place made our trip that more exciting. Upon arrival we were upgraded (for free) to the deluxe honeymoon suite equipped with a beautiful view of the ocean which we had the pleasure of looking out everyday to beautiful rainbows. Sometimes we even saw double rainbows!!! Our room was fresh, clean and, although we were warned from friends and family that have visited Hawaii in the past, we didn't see one bug! The staff was pleasant and jumped at every chance to help us. The bar was tons of fun especially considering we were surrounded by other couples also on their honeymoons. We met alot of nice people and even made great friends. We took a few dips in the pool which was clean and pleasantly warm. The luau was great, fun and enjoyable. It seemed to us to be traditional and island-like. We even got to play a game of tennis and wash our clothes at the hotel's onsite laundray facility. Parking was a little rough but no complaints because on nights we arrived back late to the hotel, a nice young fellow was ready in his golf cart to drive us up the hill and right to the hotel's front doors. OVERALL, WE HAD A GREAT TIME. WE'LL NEVER FORGET IT. MAHALO TO THE STAFF AND ALOHA FOR NOW BECAUSE WE WILL BE BACK. ALOHA!!! PS -- I'll never give an "excellent" unless the hotel was a five star hotel in London, England.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, On the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Victoria08
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. The room was very nice with a ocean view. It is located right on the beach. They have this pina colada drink that they put in a pineapple and put dry ice underneath so it looks like it's smoking. It's worth the $10.00! I wouldn't recommend the Luau here though. We didn't enjoy anything about it. Other than that we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina for 4 nights and really enjoyed our stay. However, I must admit that I was a little skeptical after reading all the bad reviews. Once we arrived we were instantly upgrade from the Hale building to a cottage...HATED IT! We were then moved to the 4th floor in the tower, Rm. 401 ... MUCH BETTER! The room smelled fresh and was very clean (not one bug); we had a GREAT mountain and golf course view. Yes, the hotel is out dated but well keep and the grounds are absolutely BEAUTIFUL! HATS OFF to the cleaning staff; every evening when we returned to our room it was clean! MAHALO Royal Lahaina for helping make our first trip to Maui, Hawaii a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Average but economical given the location”
Reviews.Author: Barbara123456789
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights. The A/C was a problem- we moved to 3 rooms before finding a room with average A/C. The front desk was helpful in that regard to accomodate us. The rooms need upgrading but were livable. The grounds are gorgeous but the pools are average and if your looking for the hot tub? It's so far away from the actual hotel that we never got there. Parking was also a problem - the spots are tight and on the nights that they have the luau- spots are very hard to find. The staff was friendly and helpful. The food was average and pricey- Go into Lahaina for a better deal. Overall the price of this hotel is not bad given the area- we stayed at the westin for the remainder of our trip in Kaanapali and paid almost 100.00 more a night!!! It was a charming, older hotel at best. Would we go back? Maybe...

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay here. The location is perfect, right on Kaanapali Beach, near Black Rock and close to Lahaina, we were on the 9th floor, ocean view, but the West Maui mountains were as enjoyable as the ocean was. The price was reasonable (we went on to the Grand Wailea for a week after our stay here), $5 killer Mai Tais.... only food complaint was the $18 Digiorno frozen pizza for a late snack. The rooms were clean and comfortable, no insects or musty smell as some others have posted, but this isn't the Grand Wailea again, $500 a night difference, this place was a great value.... We enjoyed and recommend

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Royal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina was terrific. Do not pay attention to the bad reviews. The Location is Great. About 200 yards south is a great place to snorkel. My cousins were able to swim with 3 sea turtles and 2 dolphins their. We stayed in the cottages where we had flowers put on our bed every day. The bar was great. The drink served in the pineapple is great. Their is also a great lawn by the pool and the beach that you can lay out in. It is a very quiet resort. very good for relaxing. There is also a great luao to go to at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews before we left. Our travel agent booked our hotel back in January, and it was already paid for when I read the reviews. I was really expecting the worst! Especially since we had a room in the tower with a "partial ocean view". I have to say we were very pleasantly surprised. The hotel was very nice and was just what the ads said. We had a wonderful vacation, the staff was great, the bed was clean and comfortable, it was quiet, and the food was good. (we were opposite the Luau). We would definitely stay at the Royal Lahaina resort again. (Never saw a single bug!)

Reviews.Title: “run run run”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with 10 other family members statyed at this hotel from May 12-17th, this is were we were to spend our honeymoon. The hotel has its good points and its bad points: The front desk was very nice and upgraded us from a Ocean View to Ocean Front (wonderful view) due to the whole honeymoon thing. When we walked into the room, now remember this was our honeymoon suite, we had 2 double beds. Went back down stairs to request a king bed, which was confirmed throught our travel agency, and was told they did not have any rooms available. They informed us that "if" one came available they would call us. Guess what? they nevered called, what a wonderful start to our honemoon. The romance package included a bottle of bubbly for our stay, and granite we did get it......at 9:30am the next morning !!! As far as the room being clean: We found popcorn behind the door, dirt in the bath room, and even found a bottle of suntan lotion setting on the Night Stand. I dont even know if the bathroom was cleaned. Room smelt a little musty, but I guess thats expected as this is an older hotel Nightly the maids would turn down the bed and leave a flower. We would move the flowers and put them on the nightstand. When we checked out there were a total of 10 flowers on the night stand, and that same piece of popcorn was still there. Over all the grounds, the food, the staff and the view were good, and I also brought home a new bride, so I guess that made up for having to slep in different beds on our honeymoon. I would not recommend this hotel and would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Dream Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Royal Lahaina for 12 days on our honeymoon. We upgraded to a seaside cottage room and were so happy that we did! We loved the location of the resort and of our room. It was very secluded with a strip of lawn seperating us from the beach. The pool was a few short steps up from the beach. We had the most relaxing days renting a beach bungalow for two and taking in the beautiful ocean views and air. Whenever it got hot I could wade into the pool, or if I needed a drink or snack I could walk back to my cottage 2 minutes away. The convenience was wonderful. The housekeeping and grounds staff were very friendly and went out of their way to make our stay special. There are coffee machines in the room with Kona (Yum!) coffee for guests. The maid quickly found out I was a coffee drinker and always made sure I had a good supply. The grounds were lovely with plumeria trees all around. I loved being surrounded by flowers. The air smelled thick and sweet. The breakfast buffet was very good and was a nice way to begin the day. The restaurant also served very good dinner selections. I was always impressed with the Chef's Fish of the Evening preparations. There were also (free) cocktail parties once a week with very nice appetizers and drinks served. It was nice to listen to the live music and mingle with some wonderful people. All in all we were very happy with our choice to stay at The Royal Lahaina. We would stay there again. My one recommendation would be to upgrade to a seaside cottage. Waking up to the gorgeous Hawaiian sunrise right outside your sliding glass door is an experience to be savored. The sunset was equally as amazing. My huband and I would take seaside strolls and then just walk back up to our cottage. It was intimate and hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: hsiu
Reviews.Content: We booked thru hotwire which we couldn't control over which hotel. It turned out not that bad. I suggest you called bf to request for a room at the main building, not "Hale". We checked fm their web, found they only have shower no bathtub, so we made special request. we end up stayed at the special-aid room (design for probably person w/ wheelchair or handicap) cos it was the only room in the main tower has bathtub. since we only stayed here for 1 night and Next moring, we went for an early snorkeling tour at Molokini. THe hotel was nice enough to hold our luggage and offer hospitality room at #301 for us to come back after checkout and took shower. Normally the Hospitality booking is every 30 mins per booking, since no one was behind us, so we could take our time for nearly 1 hour. overall, for the price we paid at hotwire, i think it worths what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jerry6004
Reviews.Content: We checked in on May 28th and out on June 4th. We really enjoyed out stay. My wife and I were on the 10th floor room 1028. We were upgraded by the travel company and had a great view. When we checked in the motel had no record that we had booked the reservation. This was not a problem, I showed them a e-mail from the travel company and we were given a room right away. The room was in very good shape and the maid service was good. The staff was not overly friendly but we really did not care we spent most of our time out of the motel anyway. The grounds and the beach were well taken care of. The only downer of the whole trip was the parking at the motel. You are forced to pay $10 per night and you have to fight to get a space. We have stayed at other resorts in Hawaii and they provide valet parking for the same price. Overall I would give the motel a 8 out of 10. When we go back this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Beachside Massage”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca537
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the long holiday weekend enroute to our week-long Timeshare Resort which was further up in the Ka'anapali area. Arrived an hour before check-in and were treated like "royalty". Were given the best Garden Room (#1414)...just across the Beachside Massage Station (request Devon for the most relaxing Lomi Lomi Massage); around the corner from the Luau (an enjoyable and festive event) and steps from the private beach. Since my idea of a relaxing vacation is NOT to rent a car; both the Free Shuttle and $1 Lahaina Bus added to the luxury of the visit. We later found out that they do not run up to most Resorts in the Ka'anapali area. Enjoyed the breakfast buffet daily and their tiny mini-market had great prices for snacks and gifts as well. The Bell Hops were helpful and informative and their Housekeeping Team were quick to clean up each day. Okay the bathroom/vanity area was a little small and did have a stale aroma - so bring the Lysol.

Reviews.Title: “Some good things some bad”
Reviews.Author: newface
Reviews.Content: Hmmmmm...I got my room for 80 dollars a nite on priceline so i guess i cant complain. Second floor, facing the nightly luau, so for 4 straight nights, from sunset to almost midnight, we had to listen to loud scripted show of live music and drums. with over 200 people outside our patio window. Is there roaches in paradise? i killed 3 small and two large in my room. The bathroom door was a sliding plank with no lock. But actually, i enjoyed my stay and might even stay again. The beach was pristine, the water was crysal clear. the hotel store actually had dollar cokes but i have to recommend this hotel anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Big thumbs down!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall the property was nice. The rooms were old, which would have been fine, if every other aspect of the hotel was better. Customer service was HORRIBLE, don't try to contact the hotel, they never answer. I called 8-10 times over a 4-day period (PRIOR to arrival) and received voicemail each time. Even when AT the hotel, couldn't get a hold of anyone. We arrived 3 hours early, room was not ready...which was fine, but the clerk called housekeeping as I was standing there and put a "RUSH" on cleaning our room, she told us to come back in an hour. We came back 3 hours later, room wasn't ready...it was 3:00, the "normal" check-in time, they told us to come back in 20 minutes. We stayed in the garden cottage, which was quaint other than the mildew smell. We were expecting a bag to be delivered after 9pm from the airline...I called at 6:00 AM the NEXT morning (had to leave a voicemail) only to find out they received the bag the night before, but didn't bother letting us know. Had lunch at the hotel, the waiter got very irritated that we asked him what came on the Ahi Steak sandwich...his reply was a flippant "sandwich stuff of course". After waiting 15 minutes for our appetizer salad, we flagged him over and asked how much longer for the salad, he replied "in a minute" and walked off. When he brought out the sandwiches, he got REALLY irritated when we asked for the tartar sauce that was supposed to come with the sandwich. We were obviously idiots who didn't know what "sandwich stuff" was and jerks for asking him to bring us something he forgot to bring out. I won't go into how long it took for him to notice we were finished and bring the bill. The housekeeping staff and the equipment rental staff were really nice and friendly. The beach was nice...a five minute walk down the beach will bring you to some really nice snorkeling and areas with shade (a tip from one of the NICE guys working at the equipment rental place). If you want even the slightest hint of customer service, DO NOT stay at this hotel. For those of you who can appreciate indifference and just plain rudeness, by all means, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Free upgrade to the cottages”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived from LAX, to the Royal Lahaina Resort at about 11pm. Upon check-in, we were informed that there were no more "cheapie" rooms available (that we had booked just to crash) and we would be upgraded for free. The hotel clerk was nice enough to put us in the cottages by the golf course, and also tried to put us in a corner unit (there are about four units in each cottage). They were amazing. You have your own patio area where you can just take off and walk to the beach on their trail, which takes about 2 minutes. Check out the pictures attached for yourself. The maid service was also excellent. We never even saw them. We would leave our room around 8:30am and return by 11am and our room was already made up. The groundskeepers do an excellent job of tending to the lush surroundings. I can not comment on the tower as I did not have a chance to check it out. The hotel is conveniently located by Ka'anapali beach and Black Rock (great for snorkeling), as well as Kihekili beach. I would go back to the resort for the excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina - Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: BeachLassie
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews posted before our trip-I was worried. I feel that this hotel and the staff were great. Our room was on the golf course-oceanview side on the 8th floor. We had a perfect view and it was very peaceful and quiet. We used the pool near the cottages and it was adequate. Don't miss talking to the macaw named Kona that lives in a cage in the garden gazebo near the cottages during the day. He will repeat "Aloha". There were many good places to dine. In Lahaina there is a place called Mixed Grill that looks like a hole in the wall, but their prices are very reasonable and the food and drinks are excellent. We did most of our shopping in Lahaina on Front Street as there were many shoppes. We found the travel agent located in the lobby of the hotel very informative. We took an airplane tour of the volcano's on the Big Island. It was a 3 hour trip and to see the active volcano and lava was just breathtaking. This was one of the most beautiful and relaxing trips we have taken.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Hawaii and what a great experience. We were a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews which we found to be somewhat exagerated after getting there. Our stay at the Royal Lahaina was great! I will say "don't stay in the Hale building"! "It's old"! We were on the 12th floor of the tower...and what view! The view from our room and balcony was spectacular! The staff was very friendly and most kind and helpful. The breakfast buffet was delicious and the atmosphere most relaxing. The grounds were very well maintained and the beach awesome. We are already planning another trip in the future and will stay there again. Thanks to all at the Royal Lahaina for making our trip a wonderful and memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach Heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Must say, Royal Lahaina Hotel is the perfect place for the cockroaches. Our first room had a toilet that couldn't be flushed - had to replace the ancient mechanism -. a shower that dribbled and was tiny, bamboo bedframe that was disintegrating on the floor, filthy carpet, ocean view of hedges and on the dreary side. First morning found 2 live cockroaches and reported to management who could have cared less but promised to spray the room. They did nothing and next morning there were more cockroaches. So we had to pack up and move to the tower, 12th floor. Great improvement except for the never-ending moaning and whistling of the ferocious wind which also made the glass door rattle. Forgetting all that, what we couldn't understand was why there were no facilities to sit on the beach other than either a towel or renting a cabana for $35 per day!!! Staff told us umbrellas could not be used on the beach because of the wind. Simply not true. We went to other hotels in the area and saw chairs, chaisses AND umbrellas. This beach is lovely unless you have to have some shade then you're out of luck. Why would anyone fly for hours to get to Hawaii, rent a car, pay for a resort hotel room and then have to get in your car everyday to find a beach with some shade. Dining room - worst buffet - muffins fall apart in your hand , waffles and pancakes like rubber tires and unpleasant staff who are slow to show up while acting like they"re doing you a favor. Only place we found on our week's vacation where staff failed to make you feel welcome. Lahaina has great restaurants with charming wait staff and great food. Royal Lahaina should send its cooks (they are not chefs) to cooking school and the staff to charm school. We arrived home last night from Maui and I wanted to write this while it is fresh in my mind. There's lots of good things going on in Maui. This hotel isn't one of them.

Reviews.Title: “1am wake up call...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Maui on our honeymoon. We stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort and were overall very pleased with it. The view was incredible and I loved the area. The room was your standard hotel-type room, but it actually pretty nice. The cleaning staff was very nice. The first night we got there on 5/3, we were exhausted as we had been traveling all day and there was a 5 hour time difference, so we went to bed early. Around 1am, we were awoken by the blaring fire alarms. We were on the 7th floor and the entire 12 floor hotel had to evaculate down by the pool. My husband and I found it a bit humerous just b/c it was a story to tell, but there were many older people who did NOT find it funny & were very angry. I still don't know if there was an actual fire or not, but I guess it's better safe than sorry. Otherwise, we enjoyed our trip tremendously. We actually met another couple & drive the Road to Hana with them & made a day of it. The grounds of the Royal Lahaina seemed well kept & well maintianed. Very beautiful. I'd stay there again & recommend it to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “not bad, but few things to know”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hale wing from May 5th till 9th - room was basic, but clean and comfortable. Our room overlooked the Luau - they have it each night except Saturday. Luau ends around 8.30pm and the last 15 minutes are drums, so don't try to fall asleep. But again, if you are out - it won't bother you. Bathroom - small, little bit scary looking, but functional. Main thing nobody tells you - the bathroom fan runs 24x7, and you can't turn it off, so if you are a light sleeper - you'll have problems. It didn't bother me much, but my husband was waking up 3-4 times per night. When we complained, they said there is nothing they can do - all rooms are like that (at least at this building). When we checked in, they have offered "paradise" package for $16 a night: parking, coffee/tea, local and 800 calls, 2 mai tais, safe. Parking w/o this package is $10 per day. Beach is great, if you walk 200 yards north - there is a coral reef and great snorkeling, we have spotted 2 turtles :-). Would we stay at this hotel again? If they fix the bathroom fan - probably yes.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 3rd trip to the islands and had a terrible time at the Royal Lahaina. When I booked the trip originally I was told that they had a food voucher you could purchase upon arrival. It would give you a few dinners at the hotel along with daily breakfast and a few lunches. When we arrived we found out that the voucher service had been discontinued. That was a major reason why we picked this particular hotel. Anyways, after that we were told that we would receive an upgraded room. The room we received was right next to several rooms being renovated. Our room smelled like paint fumes at various times during the day. When you went out on the balcony, you got a view of the torn up area of the hotel and cigarette butts, old beer cans and workers painting. Also our room looked like it was about to fall apart. The carpet looked about 30 years old. The furniture was also fairly distressed. Our closet doors were about to fall apart. When you took a shower the water ran hot and cold. When it came time to park your car at night, we found it hard to find a spot. They have several Luau's and they would take up most of the hotel parking leaving you to find spots very far from the hotel entrance. Also the pools are extremely small and not very inviting. We are not the kind of people to complain and due to the fact that we purchased the accomodations on a package deal we were stuck staying there. If we could have paid more to stay somewhere else at the time of arrival we would have. We will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: StacysOhio
Reviews.Content: Because of plane delays we did not arrive in Maui till about 10:30 pm so the island was already dark. We had expected to arrive long before sunset. After getting our rental car and leaving the airport it was 12:00 so we were a little unsure of getting around and did not have a map with us at the time. It is hard to get lost on Maui though because there are very few roads so shortly we were on our way to the Resort. We did pass the exit for the resort because there are no large signs marking hotel sites. One thing i would suggest is mapquest exact directions from airport to hotel before you leave home. This would have been very helpful to us. We knew we had passed it by so called the front desk and they were very helpful in getting us there. Upon arriving we were upgraded to a cottage. It was nice and very large. We had a refrigerator but no microwave. The luau at the Resort was exceptional. And each night there was also a sunset torch lighting ceremony that was very peaceful to watch. We looked forward to ending our day with this. Maids came in each day to make bed and freshen things up. We enjoyed our stay there very much.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights at this hotel & the rooms were a bit damp but ok. if you're just looking for a place to stay at a good price, this is a good choice

Reviews.Title: “One Bad Night In Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are both from NY and were in Maui on our Honeymoon. We carefully planned our trip and researched hotels and this was in our budget and realistically, we were a little skeptical after reading some of the reviews. However, we didn't read too much into them and decided to book our Honeymoon. When we first arrived at the resort, it was late, we were tired from the all day air travel and just wanted to get our room and hopefully get our free "honeymoon" upgrade (like it says on there website)!! This did not happen. We did receive a cottage room and it was pretty close to the beach, but the man at the front counter was a little clueless and there didn't seem to be much managerial help. We took our cottage room and forgot about the whole situation. AFter all, we DID get the room we requested and it was fairly close to the beach, which is the best beach we've ever been on!! So, we went on with our week. It was the most romantic honeymoon and best experience for us. We traveled into Lahaina frequently at night for dinner and shopping... we ate the breakfast buffet twice and it will definitely fill you up... do be prepared to spend money on food though. Next time we go, we will be staying in a room with a kitchenette. Do not go to Tomato Basils, unless you like paying a lot for avg. Italian food. We are use to very good Italian food, so that may be why we didn't like it. We actually would go back in a heartbeat and stay at this hotel again and are thinking about it for our 10 yr. anniversary trying to get same cottage. It was beautiful and truly is paradise if you can overlook the front desk incompetance, which was easy for us, b/c we were there for us and for the paradise and beach and not for a luxury suite. We would also recommend renting a Jeep and driving up to the north shore and to the waterfalls of maui... beautiful experience. All in all, it was a great time and most memorable honeymoon and we'd do it all over again.... Luau was awesome and activities are great and it is really peaceful and really is paradise!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Go before the Big Renovations”
Reviews.Author: PirateMike
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina is one of the oldest hotels on Maui. Before the big hotels moved in during the eighties, Royal Lahaina was luxury at it's finest, but it shows it's age. It looks like the hotel industry on Maui is moving closer to having a timeshare model of hotels rather than a full service resort like Royal Lahaina. I suppose this will decrease costs for the owners while optimizing occupancy. The Royal is following suit with this trend. We stayed in the L cottage in the middle of what could be considered three rows of buildings. The first is beach/pool front, the last is golf course boundary for the Kaanapali golf course. I thought that the room was not in need of complete repair but could use some TLC. I was thrilled with it's proximity to the beach and restaurant and it's privacy. Having a private patio was awesome. The renovations are scheduled to start in October. They will remove the cottage system at Royal Lahaina and put in timeshare based hotel property. With the destruction of the cottage system, another piece of the island feeling will be lost. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. The trees are mature and healthy. The staff at the front desk and bell service were incredible. I had to watch them deal with customers that would have put me over the edge for such outlandish requests. They did this with professionalism. The guys at the pool were great and very helpful. I did not like the restaurant staff. The hostess was not friendly and the servers were unfriendly too, (except for auntie B). The bartender was on top of it also and he was a local boy. The complaints about the parking lot are valid as it always seemed full. We had to park behind the tennis stadium on most occasions so I was dropping my family off then parking which was a bummer. So hurry up if you want a very reasonably priced vacation spot in a cottage setting. They will be gone soon. A couple of things to note are that the $99 dollar meal deal is discontinued, the parking fees were either 9 or 13 dollars, they have moved to 10 or 16 dollars depending on your plan. The staff will always help you if you ask but they will not read your mind. There were two different traffic fatal accidents while we were there so it seems the speed limits are slow for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at a relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Royal Lahaina Resort and had a great time. As mentioned in other reviews, this hotel is a little old but it is in excellent condition, rooms were clean and comfortable with a great ocean view. We purchased the $159 Oceanview room, car and Breakfast package which was a great value. This was our 6th trip to the Kaanapalii beach area having stayed at the Westin Maui and the Hyatt Regency Maui on three occasions. The Royal Lahaina is a much smaller more intimate hotel and it is much more relaxing and quiet than the Big hotels on the other side of Blackrock. The beach is better (wider and flatter), there are fewer people on the beach and there are some good snorkeling sites along certain sections of the beach where there are coral reefs. The 2 pools are nothing spectacular but we spent most of our time just relaxing on the beach. One tip is to bring our buy your own beach/sand chairs as the hotel does not allow you to take lounge chairs on the beach and the rental cabanas are pricey at $35 per day. The breakfast included in the package was very good with choices of hot and cold items, i.e., scrambled eggs, corned beef hash, bacon, sausage, pancakes, waffles, fruit, etc. This hotel is about one third the price of the Westin or Hyatt and you get a better beach, more peace and quiet, cheaper drinks and the same ocean/sunset/rainbow views. I wish I had discovered this side of Kaanapalii beach years ago.

Reviews.Title: “royal lahaina was well worth it...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: recently got back from staying at the royal lahaina april 8-13th. well, worth the stay! got upgraded to one of the cottages and fell in love...we really did not have any problems in the cottage, we were in heaven...only the mosquitoes at night who would bite us was a bit bothersome...but we didnt mind too much...cuz we were too much into the sightseeing...everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helped out with all of our needs...but a word of caution if you stay at this hotel...dont pay to see the luau here...if you go to a certain area of the hotel, you can watch the luau for FREE...otherwise, very happy with our decision to stay here...beautiful scenery and well worth the money...hopefully, if we ever return to paradise again, will plan to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great views, dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We upgraded for an extra $40 US a night to an ocean front room on the 10th floor. Fantastic views of the beach out to Lanai and Moliki, I think this changed our whole experience being on the water rather than in a room that overlooked the car park. The room interior was still dated (I think the hotel is 30 years old) so if your after something modern and new don't stay here. But the room is clean and neat and has everything you need for a comfortable stay. The staff are not falling over backwards to offer the best service but they're friendly and relaxed. We caught whales breaching in the afternoon, and during our 3 night stay there were always a few whales swimming around a little way off the beach. If your interested in snokelling whiile your in Hawaii I can suggest the following sites in Maui which were absolutely excellant - drive down to Makena and stop off at Ahi Hi Bay, which is at the front of the big Prince hotel. No shortage of green turtles and colourful fish with some pretty good coral. The other spot is at mile marker 14 on route 30 which is on your way to Lahaina from the airport (probably about 20mins from Lahaina along the freeway). This is a very popular spot and you can see plenty of cars parked by the beach. The coral here is amazing, with lots of fish and turtles to be found. Anyway we had a great time in Maui and can't wait to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “a must”
Reviews.Author: relaxing
Reviews.Content: Stay in one of the cottages. E cottage lower level end cottage. Some of the cottages are right by one of the pools. The ones facing the ocean are the best for views. You will do some walking on and off the beach. Which is good for all of us. Parking is the main problem, spaces are small and some do not know how to park. lol But you find that at home also. If you are friendly the staff is friendly and dont be afraid to ask for anything. Eat a breakfast ($15) buffet and royal deal is ($8.50). and lots of other places close by if you do not like the resort. Eat a good breakfast and light lunch if needed and out at night. There are lots of places close to eat that are the same price at home. Best place is to go to the beaches watch the sunsets and cook fish, shrimp or whatever you want. Always a park close by with charcoal pits. Take a helicopter tour, well worth the trip, at least Air Maui tour was of West Maui and Moloki Ocean Cliffs 1 hour long. Take the Teralani 2 Sunset Cruise or Dinner Cruise. Also they have snorkel Sails also. The cottages will be gone in two years and three story condos will be in their place. Remember you are on vacation and do not let anything or anyone ruin it for you. Enjoy. We truly enjoyed the Royal Lahaina Resort Cottages and Maui. Most of all enjoy the Island and it will enjoy you. Lots of different beaches to go to not by the Resorts. Big Beach and Litttle Beach are both wonderful. And lots of beaches on the East Side by he Airport not used by tourists. Good for fun and barbaques. Lots of resonable golf courses, the best is Waiehu Municipal Golf Course. It has more holes by the ocean than any course on Maui. $26, cart $8.50 rent clubs for $25. Buy some balls, tees at Kmart or Costco on Maui. Bring your own glove and save lugging your clubs along. If it is windy, you will not experience any course like it on the mainland. Take your camera or you will feel sorry after you are done. Lorie and Thomas

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Gianna311
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old, but clean. We stayed here with 13 family members for a week in March for my wedding. I picked a cheaper hotel so all my guests could go to Maui without going home broke. It was very nice for the money we paid. We booked the ocean view room and the views were perfect. We had the mountains to our left and the ocean to our right. Food was good and drinks were very strong. It was hard to get service at the bar ( I think they had only one waitress working). All 13 of us got chairs in front of the pool everyday. It was not crowded at all. The beach was excellent too. The whales would come right in front of the hotel about 40 feet from shore. I suggest staying here if you are on a budget. Well worth the price. The luau on the grounds are good too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, loved the helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Marcay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort summer of 2004. Had a great time and a wonderful view of the ocean and grounds. After seeing bad reviews, just had to write a positive review. Yes the resort is older and maybe needs some updating, however I have stayed on other beach hotels on Maui and none offer such wonderful grounds for some privacy in such a busy resort . We were there with a year old child and the staff was very helpful in addressing her needs as well as ours. They arranged side trips and reservations for us when ever needed. The price, view, entainment, and staff were great. I would certainly return and hope to within the next year.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian paradise”
Reviews.Author: miracleneeded
Reviews.Content: I loved the Royal Lahaina. The resort is older, but is decorated in true Hawaiian fashion. The grounds were beautiful and well maintained. Take my advice - pay extra and get an oceanfront room. We did, and were pleasantly suprised. We were able to sit on the lanai, watch the sunset with our cocktails in hand and listen to the music provided by the resort. We were also lucky enough to be there during whale season and were able to watch them playing from the lanai. The buffet breakfast, included with our package was very good also. My only complaints are that the bed was very uncomfortable and parking was not included with our package, (that included a rental car).

Reviews.Title: “A Great Resort in OVERPRICED Kaananpali”
Reviews.Author: patpostro
Reviews.Content: Recently just returned from Maui, March 14-21 2005 and had a great stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort! I stayed here back in 1988 and 1998, true not much has changed, the last reno was in 1996 and that's why I love this place! Not at all stuffy, usually I stay at the FS and Park Hyatt's when traveling to cities like NYC, Melbourne, Sydney and London but in Hawaii, who needs all of that flash really? A beach is a beach and I like to be able to wore a t-shirt and my shorts for breakfast without having to feel underdressed. All of the negative reviews must be from travellers that aren't well travelled because I have stayed at the FS in Waliea and of course that experience is always excellent put your also paying much much more. This Royal Lahaina isn't flashy, but warm and welcoming, laid back and relaxed. Its is a great property located on right on Kaanapali Beach's quieter side away from the big resorts and the crowds. The resort, while not as new and updated as some of the other more expensive resorts in Kaanapali, is much quieter and more relaxed and has a more laid back atmosphere and no crowds, you really feel like your in Hawaii. The rooms are simple and clean and house keeping did a really good job everyday of restocking towels etc. We had an ocean view room on the 9th floor with a great view of the ocean and mountains, but we barely spent time in our room. Try to get a room above the 8th floor, better views!!! The breakfast buffet, $14.95US per person was a good value with lots of choices, my personal favorite was the waffle station! For $8.50US you could get the "Royal Deal" which includes everything on the buffet expect hot items which is good for those days you don't feel that hungry. All of the other meals and drinks that we had were great and were a good valu. Sadly their $99 meal deal is no longer avaliable, it ended the day after we came, but the prices for food and beverage are VERY good considering what you pay at other nearby resorts The best thing was there were no crowds, even in the middle of the day there were lots of lawn chairs and you could always find a place to relax on grass. There were two pools and the Beach Activities desk was great and always had towels when we needed them. We can rent snorkels and boggie boards, I rented one for $35 for the week, otherwise its $15 for one hour, we were there for a week so the $35 weekly rental is a good value. There's a convenience store located on the property which is really handy when you need to grab some sunscreen or a drink and donâ€™t feel like driving to an ABC Store. There is a free shuttle service to Whalers Village that leaves right infront of the hotel and this great if you don't feel like walking over, it's only a 10-15mins walk to the Whalers Village from the resort. Only down side was being charged $9 a day for parking and it was hard to find a spot some nights. The resort has tennis courts and a great luau as well. For those that need to check their email there is an internet cafÃ© located just beside the lobby area $3 for 10mins or if you have your laptop with wireless, it's $15 for the day or $35 for the week, not to bad I think for us that need stay connected with the office while on holidays. The best part of the experience was the staff. They were always friendly and helpful and really made us feel welcome. An example, on St. Patrick's day we were having drinks in the bar and our server brought over some St. Patrick's Day themed cookies, as my name is Patrick, thought this was a nice and geniune touch! This hotel is getting a bit dated, but it's got more Hawaii character then most of the new resorts in Kaanapali and NO nasty RESORT FEE! This resort is sadly going to be turned in a 5 star property, a real shame. I agree they MUST renovate asap, but they should keep the laid back atmosphere, it will be shame to lose this resort to yet more commercialization of the the true Hawaiian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina is home away from home on Maui”
Reviews.Author: jipc
Reviews.Content: I am a Hawaii resident and live on Oahu. Have been staying at the Royal Lahaina Resort for 20+ years. It's the only place we stay when we go outer island. Reasons why: 1. The staff is full of aloha 2. The rooms are "no frills" but clean and have everything you need. 3.You can't beat the beautiful beach- right outside . 4. There is a luau everynight- - free Hawaiian music- just sit on your lanai. 5. Plenty of parking 6. 2 pools for the keiki (kids) 7. Convienient to West Maui Airport- can leave your hotel and be on your flight in less than 30 min. We don't go to Kahului anymore. 8. Close to Lahaina- great fine dining restaurants. 9. Fresh coffee in the mornings promptly delivered by friendly room service staff. 10.Whales right outside your lanai in season- who needs a boat tour. I can't say enough about this place- if you want "frills" and crowds, go down the way to the Hyatt. I'll be at the Royal. Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: samblm
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 1 PM on tues. We waited in line to check in. Lisa at the front desk was nice and helpful. Our cottage wasn't ready so she gave us a coupon for 2 free mai tai's in the lounge while we waited. That was nice. Our room was ready in about a 1/2 hour and we rode the cart to our cottage. The cottage was spacious, huge tub and shower, nice king size bed..great view of the pool and the ocean. Our lanai was ajoined by the next cottage, wasnt too bad the first of the trip, till the prom crowd decided that this was the party area for the evening. Luckily it was only one night and we only had to knock on their door once for them to be quiet, at around 1 in the morning. anyway, We loved our room...the $99 per person breakfast, dinner, drinks deal is good. but if you order dinner in the bar it does not count towards this deal, that is extra....not sure why. The breakfast buffet, skimpy but good. scrambled eggs, sausage, potatoes, fruit, toast, waffles....gets a little old after 6 days....The bar was nice, listening to Eddie and Eddie in the evenings, but get there early, they roll up the sidewalks at 10. We had fair service in the bar....one night we came into the bar from the pool and never did get waited on. So we went around front and then we got waited on...our waiteress walked by us 4 times like we weren't even there. We did see 2 cochroaches, but hey this is hawaii....who the hell cares....If your looking for luxury, go somewhere else. Don't rent a big car !!!!! the parking is ridiculous...We had a PT cruiser and it was tight to get in the spots....The pool was always clean, fresh towels at the beach center....the whales were awesome....the water was warm...and so was the sun, when it came out....rained every other day...but hey it was Maui.....We will come back again.....

Reviews.Title: “Just Book it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed on September 2001, and planning to return this summer, sad to read same complaints.. limited parking spaces, poor service, facilities average, etc. but the beach is excellent, and the location of this hotel is great as well, Maui is a destination where you will be outdoors 90% of the time so don't worry about your hotel room or facilities, just make sure they change your sheets daily, have fun and relax...

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: withifer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina while on our belated honeymoon. It was an average hotel. We had to wait a bit to check in. Our partial ocean view room was ok...along with the partial ocean view, we got to see the roof of the hotel. We attended the luau on the grounds...that was fun. Don't get excited about the unlimited 'adult beverages' at the luau...they are not mixed strong enough to have any effect on you. Parking was a bit crazy. One night we went to the Whalers Village, came back, and due to the luau on site, we had to park in the way back and have staff on a golf cart give us a ride to the hotel lobby! The beach was never busy while we were there. I would recommend staying closer to the Whalers Village personally. Perhaps there is more activity in that area.

Reviews.Title: “was not as bad as a lot of reviewers say”
Reviews.Author: cubankid
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd stage of 3 weeks in Hawaii. 10 days at Waikiki and 10 here. We are used to All Inclusive in Caribean so this was different for us and all Hawaii is much more expensive. What I missed the most at both places was laying at beach in shade in a nice lounge chair. with a cool drink in hand. Not in Hawaii. This resort was on beach but you had to keep chairs on lawn and there was a hedge keeping you from enjoying the view of the ocean. They rented double loungers on the beach for 35 bucks a day. The hotel was for the price good for us. Staff was good. One review said they got there room for 39 bucks a nite. Wow we got about a 1/3 of a day for that All in all it was great Forget the morning Buffet for 15 bucks get the royal deal for 8.50. . Staff, room and hotel were great for us. We had ocean view, not ocean front, but it was great. We could see Black rock, Golf course and lots of the ocean. We saw more whales right from there than on a whale watching dinner cruise. Parking 9 bucks a day is a bit much. We had a car for 10 days and split it with another couple. Good thing.
