Car is almost a necesity but if you can get from airport to hotel someway and dont plan to travel much save yourself $1000 bucks on renting ,gas, and parking.. WE wont do Hawaii again but would not worry about going to Royal Lahania again if we did.

Reviews.Title: “A Bad Experience As Well”
Reviews.Author: Harleyman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina in 1999 and, apparently, not much has changed. Our unit was right on the beach - 1st floor, walk out through sliding doors into sand - practically. However, that was the only positive. Walls were paper thin. Carpet was old, damp, and created a musty smell. The bathroom was, at best, adequate - not what you'd expect from a "Royal" location. Even the staff in the valet area were rude. Avoid this one like the plague; it's not worth $39 a night...

Reviews.Title: “WHILE NOT TERRIBLE, I WOULD NOT RETURN”
Reviews.Author: Vivienne
Reviews.Content: The hotel was rated superior in a book our travel agent used, but I was deeply dissatisfied with our bathroom. The shower was old and worn, and while not dirty, certainly was not inviting. There was no tub, not that I would have used it at that point.I took a shower in my beach thongs and I have not done that since college. I was not a happy camper. The room itself was fine, but also be careful of the "oceanview". While I did have a view of the ocean, I also had a view of a huge tiki hut roof right smack in the middle of our lanai. Be clear about the view. Too, the room deposit upon check-in is $150 and we were not offered the breakfast option. The buffet breakfast was decent, but for $15, I did not feel it was adequate. For example, they had a waffle station and the waffle was sliced 4 ways!!! So what, I'm supposed to just stand there and put 4 waffle wedges on my plate? To me it just seemed too frugal. However, the snack and bar area had good food and there was always a drink special. I recommend the mai tais. If I had to do it over again, I would not stay here . Not because it was a bad hotel per se, but because of the shower. I think that if you are looking for a budget hotel this is a decent bet, although I'd bring shower shoes. Otherwise skip it.

Reviews.Title: “Involuntarily down and out in Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are currently staying at the Royal Lahaina. Saying that it is a horrible hotel is understating the situation. Peeling paint, dirt encrusted carpets, waterstained walls and cracked ceilings are the situation that we will deal with for the next couple of days because all the competitors are booked. The room pictures we saw on the internet were either very old, touched up by a pro, or of rooms in other hotels. The deplorable condition of this hotel is only matched by the surly attitude of the staff. They evidently are so often beseiged by complaints that they have developed a wooden, "yes sir, sorry sir, no there is nothing we can do" response. Actually they don't even say sir, they just refer to you by room number. They allowed us to look at some other rooms and they are all in the same condition. The $450 per night room might have matched the local downtown budget motel, but just barely. The bottom line is that if you have any choice at all, do anything in your power to stay away from this place!

Reviews.Title: “always upgrade”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed 2/22/05 for 4 nights.were booked in tower with partial view.Room was not avail. they wanted to upgrade us for one night and have us move the next day.4 nights in maui I wasnt moving anywhere. I paid 70.00/nt to stay in cottage/top floor. beleive me well worth it. also dont forget they charge for parking which is crazy,$12.00/nt not me. comped. But you may have to make a little noise. other wise resort was really very nice. may go back someday if can find shorter flight from N.Y.

Reviews.Title: “Grounds are beautiful but hotel is not”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed from 2/3 through 2/10/05. I had read the reviews and was quite worried about what to expect. The grounds are beautiful but the room in the hotel was definitely dated. It was always clean and did not smell any mold but needs updating and painting and the linens (bed spread)are very old. It had a shower only with a small bathtub. We had registered with Shiloh Inns who now owns the property and got a member number which entitles you to an upgrade if it is available. So when we were checking in, I asked if there was an available upgrade. The guy checking us in then gave us to another lady who gave us a partial ocean view on the 9th floor, facing the golf course. Neither of these people were welcoming or gave us a smile. The guy getting the luggage out of the jeep was friendlier than them. I had read about the $9 charge for parking but did not realize how many parking places would be left when the luau was in session. We did not go to the luau but every evening when we got back to the hotel, it was a major search to find a parking place, all of the spaces are very small which makes for a lot of fun when you have to park next to a SUV or van. I had read about the Castaway Restaurant at the Maui Villas so we went there for breakfast most mornings. The first morning, we saw about 20 tail slaps from the whales who were not far from the shore. Food was excellent and very reasonable prices. Staff was friendly and knew our drinks before we left the island. Aloha Mixed Plate in Lahaina for the coconut shrimp was also very good. Kimo's in Lahaina - had an excellent fish taco. Pools were adequate. Beach is beautiful and not that busy. Did not hear where the jacuzzi was until the night before we left - out by the highway, past the tennis. Used the laundry facilities and worked well except for some loud noises which eventually went away. The shops were quite nice but again, the people were not that welcoming. The entertainment in the lounge area was not good at all. We had previously stayed at the Kaanapili Beach Hotel and will be going back there in the future when we go back. It is an entirely different feeling from the staff and the hotel. Not to mention the entertainment! KBH has them beat hands down! The extra $20-40 to stay at KBH is money well spent. We went there 2 or 3 nights for the entertainment alone. Overall, the resort needs some money spent on the hotel itself. As I said, the grounds are beautiful and seem to be kept up quite well but for the price, the hotel should be much better. If all you are interested in is a place to sleep and shower without any Hawaiian ambience, then I guess this is the place for you. The "cottages" may be much better (did not see them from the inside) but from the outside, they also looked like they needed some updating. Also, when we were checking in, did not check to use the safe in the room but it was charged on our bill. So be sure to check your bill when checking out. Heard some people checking out when we were checking in who were having problems with what was on their bill so this is evidently a real problem with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “I was scared too!”
Reviews.Author: CindyBennett307
Reviews.Content: You know. After reading A LOT of reviews, I was kind of concerned. However, after we got there and saw the view, all my concerns melted away. Yes, it is just a hotel room. But, the Lanai, was awesome. We spent so much time on the balcony taking in all of what we came to see. You know what else, I heard so many people say they would never stay there again. I have to tell you, on the third night, we were invited to a Manager's cocktail party. Entertainment, bar, food and good people. There were four couples at our table. Two of which had never been to Hawaii (we were one of them), but the other two couples, one had stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort NINE times, the other SEVEN. Now can it possibly be so bad? Well, it was our first time, but the price, the view and the people, YES, we will stay there again! Thank you Royal Lahaina for making my dream trip a possibility.

Reviews.Title: “Great Cottages”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina is a great value as far as the cottages are concerned. We just returned from staying in the garden cottages and found nothing but beautiful grounds and great room service. I have to say I was worried after reading some of the post to this hotel. The tower from what I understand is under renovation, but what we saw downstairs with the restaraunt, bar, pool, lobby, etc. was very nice. The restaraunt was exceptional as far as hotels are concerned, I recommend the Beachcomber Special (steak and shrimp, awsome). We also stayed at the Lodge at Koele in Lana'i for one night. This is rated as one of the finest golf resorts in the world, but you pay for it. The Royal Lahaina is an exceptional value, with a great beach that is not crowded. To me it is what Hawaii is all about. Don't be scared off by the negative posts, this is a place worth staying for the money and rating. If you golf, take the ferry to Lana'i to play the Challenge at Manele and the Experience at Koele, you won't regret it. Book their Play through package and stay a night at either hotel with unlimited golf, best value. Watch the whales on the ferry when in season. Sam Richardson, Abilene, TX

Reviews.Title: “Beuatiful and not a "Roach" in sight”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina October 22 - 26, 2004. This traditional Hawaiin style hotel was a refreshing change from the ultra modern hotels we've stayed at before. The cottage room was clean and the service from the staff was excellent. The food was not too overpriced like many of the other hotels I've stayed at recently in Hawaii. The on-site outdoor Luau was rained out so they performed indoors. It was still very well done. The grounds were beautiful, and of course the beach and access to it was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Maui. The persons responsible for setting up the various tours were excellent and kept us almost too busy, but that was our fault. Every tour or event we partook in was great. We went Whale Watching, Snorkeling, to the hotel's Luau, on a dinner cruise and to a local play. We also played Golf that we set up on our own and went to Haleakala and to the Winery near there and to the Whale Museum. The Hotel staff were very helpful, our room was always clean and I was impressed with the way the bellman's personal worked to get us into our rooms and out. The breakfast buffet was very good and we enjoyed Eddie and Eddie in the lounge area. I would return again if the opportunity ever arose. I had been to Lahaina 30 years ago and could not believe how much things have changed.

Reviews.Title: “No stress holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were there from Dec. 12-Dec19th and it was the best hotel we have found for staff, food and drinks. I had no idea how much stress was with me in daily life, got there no stress for one solid week. It was the best little place we have ever stayed at. And we go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanfront is the only way to go.”
Reviews.Author: Nanyjo
Reviews.Content: Checked in as was really bummed.Our room was ocean view on the side. The Lanni was not at all private. 5 feet from your neighbor OMG. Asked front dest to upgrade was told 85.00 per night. Not willing to pat that much.We kept telling each other were still in Hawaii. After a few drinks in the lounge(more than a few) I went and asked again. New staff was on and it was 10:30pm QUESS WHAT 25.00 this time. The gal asked us if we wanted to see the room first we said no we'll take it. Privite Lanni wonderfull view. OCEANFRONT IS THE ONLY WAY TO GO HERE! Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Great Beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Hawaii and we spent 3 of our nights at this hotel. The beach was beautiful and the view from our oceanview room was also incredible. The bathroom was a bit worn but it was clean and the front desk staff was nice. The elevators were slow and the prices were very high in the restaurant($13.00 for a burger). The location was good except you have to take a trolley to get anywhere but other than that I think its a good hotel. Activities desk personnel was helpful except for one very rude morning person who talked to me like I should know better about helicopter tours!! That was the only rude person I ran into the whole week!!

Reviews.Title: “A Treat in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Vegaztony
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort for 4 days from January 21 to 25 and was very satisfied. Even though the hotel is a bit aged, the front desk staff is very professional. The housekeeping team (Rudy the houseman) was very nice and helpful. Luau staff is the best. I had the opportunity to go to the Feast at Lele and got food poisoning from their luau. At least when it rained on the day of the luau at Royal Lahaina, Sam the manager offered full refunds to those who wanted them. That was a nice touch and very thoughtful. Most hotels and resorts don't put their customers first; the Royal Lahaina does. I will return to the Royal Lahaina! By the way, after I got sick from the Feast at Lele, the front desk staff at Royal Lahaina was kind enough to extend my stay way after the check-out time of 12 noon so I can get better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Horrible Resort and front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stay in Maui 2-3 times a year, We have never had a bad room until we stayed at the Royal Lahaina.The check in personnel were miserable and condescending.The first room we stayed in was horrible, it was dirty, had decor from the seventies, a leakey faucet, paint falling from the bath room ceiling, mold on the shower ceiling, rust, broken furniture, a loud ticking noise coming from within the wall where the headboard rests, and the balcony was small with zero privacy.We went to the front desk to complain, the manager was a lot nicer than her staff, she gave us another room which was almost as bad as the first one and explained that this is a very old hotel as if that was a valid excuse. The elevators were extremely slow which was further compounded because there was no ice on all but two floors and the snack machines were broken.The few good things about the place were the great beach with snorkeling, the location-close enough to walk to Whalers, restaurants and shops and the trolley that runs often.

Reviews.Title: “great beach & location but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: bonnerus
Reviews.Content: our first trip to Maui from Calgary, Canada, Jan 8th to 15th 2005. I was a little leary because of the wide range of reviews on this hotel. definitely not what I would have picked had I seen it in person prior to booking but it was clean & suited our purposes which was a place to hang our hat at night . our main goal was to sightsee & lay on the beach. I was disappointed with the quality of the room for the price paid. The room & especially bathroom are worn & dated & much in need of an update . As well everything had an extra charge, - coffee maker provided but charged for every pouch of coffee or tea bag used - in-room safe provided but charged if used. - parking was $9 per day & it was hard to find an available spot most evenings . all of these things should be included with the price of the room . the restaurant was okay if you like buffets . the lounge had a limited menu & was not open past 10 pm so if you wanted to have a few drinks at the end of the day you had to go elsewhere. overalll I was satisfied because of the location ( easy to get around to most sights from here) and beach ( large & not too busy) as well as room cleanliness . however I would not likely stay there again or recommend it. if you are looking for luxury or modern decor then this is not the place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Dogswood
Reviews.Content: Since we were arriving in Maui at midnight for a week's vacation, we decided to use Priceline for the first night of our stay. We were booked into the Royal Lahaina. After reading some of the terrible reviews, we were leary of even spending one night there. We checked in at 1 am and were very satisfied with the reception. While we did not appreciate the $9/day parking charge, we were impressed with the desk clerk's suggestion that we leave the car in the hotel driveway until the morning since it was very late to go hunting for a parking space in the vast grounds. It's those little things that keep you coming back. We were even more surprised when we were upgraded to an ocean view tower room. While the room could have done with upgrading, it was very clean with a comfortable bed. No bugs, no mould, no unusual noises, etc. Best of all, the grounds are beautiful and the beach is best on the island (if not in the US). A very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “lord help us.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: oh no. we checked into the royal lahaina resort, and were blown away by the disgustingness of it all. the staff was friendly and helpful, but the room was foul. foul. foul. the photograph that appears online looks nothing like the room we had. we were given a "garden view" room, which actually translated in hawaiian to "mediocre parking lot view," and the room was absolutely gross. we arrived there and thankfully brought our own sheets (we had read reviews ahead of time). the putred smell of mildew permeated the entire guest room floor. the carpet was gross. the bedspread was from 1960, and we were told that we could only get ice from two floors of the tower (our floor wasnt one of them). we arrived late at night, so we had no other alternative but to stay the night, and even after a long, long flight, we couldnt bring ourselves to take a shower or sleep comfortably in the beds. the saving grace was the sheets we brought from home and the comfort of my boyfriend in the bed with me. needless to say, at about 2 am, i made some calls and booked a room for the rest of the week at the westin. if you are coming to maui and dont want to spend any money for a hotel, you are much better off flying to santa monica or san diego, or booking something in cancun. be warned. if you have allergies to dust, dander, cockroaches, mold, mildew or otherwise, stay far, far away from the royal lahaina. start saving your money months in advance to get a better hotel. if you are just looking for a simple place to rest your head at night, this would work.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to the Royal Lahaina on our honeymoon on 11/25. When we arrived I told the receptionist at the front desk that it was our honeymoon and requested an upgrade and we were immediately upgraded to an ocean front cottage for the entire week. We also got a free bottle of champagne with our room which was modern and very clean. The beach access at this hotel is fantastic. There are very few people using the beach at any given time so it is almost like your own private beach. Also we rented some snorkel equipment from a place in Lahaina and walked a little ways up the beach to a small but pretty reef for snorkeling. Also within walking distance from the Royal Lahaina is Black Rock which is one of the world's foremost snorkeling spots. The food at the resort restaurant was pretty good and not too expensive for Hawaiian standards. We bought a package which offered free breakfast buffet each morning which I would recommend because the buffet costs $12.50. There is a daily parking fee at the resort and an extra fee for using the room safe, but this is well advertised by the resort if you do ANY research at all so this was not a surprise and I had no issues paying the fees. I have stayed at some of the busier south Ka'anapali resorts (Whaler and Ali'i) and I much prefer the slower pace and smaller crowds of the Royal Lahaina Resort. If you like hustle and bustle and fancy hotels with many frills, stay somewhere else, but if you like to get away from most of the crowds on vacation and have a nice play to stay, go to the Royal Lahaina. One more thing, make sure to splurge a little for a cottage....it's vacation for goodness sake. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Lori04
Reviews.Content: The Royal La Haina has very beautiful grounds and the one of the nicest beaches in the area. The hotel room, and we were in the old section was pretty bad. We too had a large roach or two but worse than that was the bathroom. There was quite a bit of mold on the ceiling and all around the shower area, which smelled pretty bad. We were only there for two days otherwise I would of asked to be moved. It was expensive for breakfast and lunch, so we only ate there twice. A small cheese burger was approx. $12.00. But what do you expect, you are in Maui. Overall, it was ok. and since we weren't paying that much for the room we just dealt with it. I hear the towers are much nicer to stay in, so ask for them instead. One more thing, there were no elevators in the section were stayed in, so we had to drag our suitcases up 2 flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina & Maui - Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: AnthUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina Hotel December 2002 for our honeymoon we arrived on New Years Eve. The hotel was great and the buffett breakfast was the best we'd ever had. Our room overlooked the ocean and we could see the whales jumping far out at sea - what a picture that was, something we'll never forget. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful and it was easy to get around via the buses that were like old fashioned trams. The beach was gorgeous, although the sea's current could be quite strong at times. Maui as an Island had loads to keep us busy for the 11 days we were there. We cycled down Halaekala after watching the sunrise (early start though!), went deep sea kayaking and snorkeling. We also went to the Luau at the hotel - not our sort of food really but the entertainment was magnificent. We also went on the Sugar Train which was very reasonable. We booked our tours with Tom Bigfoot in Lahaina (a very pretty town) and they were extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: gregkeith57
Reviews.Content: 12/19/2004, We went to the north shore of Oahu and stayed at Turtle Bay Resort. It was the best. We decided to check out Maui and stayed at the Royal Royal Lahaina Resort. When we arrived at 1:30 PM we had to wait for an hour before getting a room. The room was an out dated, run down and pretty much a dump. I have stayed at Motel 6's that were in much better shape. There was no bath tub, only a shower. Our veiw was the side of a building. The house cleaning staff were friendly but the rest were snobby. I noticed there were not allot of local's working. I went to the travel / activities desk and asked for directions to dive boat and I was told since I did not purchase the dive through them, all they could do was give me a map. Everthing was old and dirty. This was the worst resort I have ever stayed at. I am pretty open minded about where I stay at and usually not to hard to please but this place was terrible. I would also suggest staying on the south or east side of Maui. We were always at least a 30 minute drive anywhere we went. The north shore on Oahu is my pick. You still can find the Hawaiian spirit there and the prices for food is reasonable when compared to Maui. In few words the Royal Lahaina Resort was unfriendly, dirty and in an expensive area. Mahalo and Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time - Adequate for Budget and Explorers”
Reviews.Author: molecule
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Maui. Royal Lahaina is perfectly adequate for what we needed. The hotel isn't exactly top knotch, but if you're on a budget, and you like to explore and spend more time visiting your vacation destination then your hotel - this is a good place to be. The rooms were clean and simple in the Royal Hale section, nothing fancy. The staff was very friendly, we even received a free room upgrade upon arrival which was a great surprise. The staff responds to friendliness, so if you are rude, don't expect a room upgrade or pleasantness in return. We were pleasant and were treated wonderfully. The luau is every night, and quite loud, if you're going to be in a Royal Hale hotel room around dinnertime you may wish you request another room on the opposite side of the luau, where you still hear it but not nearly as loud. Personally I wasn't bothered by it, although it is basically the same thing everynight so be prepared for some repetative listening. Be aware of the $12/day resort fee, which should just be included in the price. It covers parking, safe, coffee, phone calls. You can opt out, and pay for things individually, its $9/day for parking, $1 for each local call, $1.50 + $0.50 a minute for 800 numbers - silly stuff. The beach is wonderfully beautiful but crowded, about a mile long heading to the north, and a short walk to the south side of Kaanapali beach and blackrock, which is even more crowded but about 2 miles long. Unfortunately there's an awful amount of cigarette butts and litter of pop and beer cans from people who trash the beach. We explored much of the coastline and just about everywhere we saw cigarette butts. If you smoke have some respect, the beach is not an ashtray. Don't throw your garbage around in paradise. Snorkeling is pretty good in front of the new Westin building which is maybe a quarter mile walk north of the Royal Lahaina along the beach. Black rock is also good but on a very crowded stretch of Kaanapali Beach in front of the Sheraton, a short walk south. The waters are a bit cloudy now, and the coral is being smothered from dust and dirt being blown into the ocean from the construction at the Westin, so enjoy it while it lasts. The best snorkeling visibility tends to be in the morning. We saw local police patrol the beach, and police are frequently seen in downtown Lahaina. You may view this as good or bad. High crime, or just extra protective? Who knows, but theft is relatively common, so don't leave valuables in your car when on hiking or exploring trips around the island. I would stay here again. I think the people who are complaining are used to staying in costly resorts, such as Hyatts, Hiltons, Four Seasons, etc. If you want to spend a bunch and get spoiled, go to the south side of the island - Grand Wailea and Four Seasons are extreme luxury. You get what you pay for. If you're on a budget and don't spent every minute at your hotel grounds, this is a good place. Don't expect red carpet treatment, and be prepared for finding cigarette butts as you comb the sand to build sand castles in some areas. The hotel itself was quite busy throughout our stay, many europeans and australians stay here which I see no problem with. You're on vacation, enjoy yourself. Don't let the little things ruin your time. A note if you're on a budget: If you're shopping, try to bargain - many people are quite flexible with prices that otherwise seem outrageous. Food is very expensive at the resorts and hotels, so prepare for that.

Reviews.Title: “ok- average”
Reviews.Author: kepola
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina From Dec. 11 - 18th. This is our first trip to Hawaii! If you are looking for a fancy, 5 star hotel, then go to Vegas. Otherwise, if you are there to see and experience Maui, stay here. We had a wonderful time here. Must admit to park you car ($9 per day) and the breakfast buffet ($13) are pricy, everything else is ok. This resort has a free Shuttle Trolley that takes you to Whaler's Village once every hour. Whaler's Village is a shopping district and eating area close by. We even walked a couple times (takes about 20 minutes one way). Very nice walk, you walk right beside beautiful gold course and other hotels on way. They also have a bus that goes to town of Lahaina every hour, this costs $1 per person each way so not too bad. Hotel staff were excellent, very helpful. Laua is on 5 nights a week so a little noisy for us as we were staying right beside it. But we just went out for the evening and enjoyed the other amenities so noise didn't bother us...........shopping, entertainment etc. Pools are very cold, ocean is warmer to swim in. Eddie and brother played at little pub at hotel. They were absolutely hilarious and made you feel welcome. Hotel room was ok , Just had a shower, no tub, had a fridge, hair blower, tv and most importantly air conditioner. All worked , no problems. We stayed at Royal Hale part. Shower leaked but we told front desk and someone came down within hour to fix it. Aloho night we were invited to with free drinks, food and entertainment, this was very nice of managers to do this. We had a woenderful night, met people, entertained etc. Grounds are beautiful, see mountain in a distance, beach is right there, stores right on grounds for late night convenience (sundries, postcards, drinks, sandwiches). Ice cream store had outragious prices, something like $5 for one ice cream cone. Hung out at beach alot, saw a whale in distance. Towels are provided free of charge from the pool guy. Always found a chair to use while at beach/pool area. Lots of birds there not afraid of humans at all. Then rent snorkling stuff and blow up rafts on grounds if interested. (pricy though). One day, someone was snorkling and found a 20 dollar bill in water. They said they saw a hundred dollar bill float by but could not catch it, so nonetheless, a few people went out then and tried to find it, no luck though. Drinks by pool and beach expensive but to be expected. Thet do have machines with bottled water and other beverages for $1 by rooms so that was pretty cheap. Luau was ok, not many drink selections, only 2 kinds of drinks. Food was ok , tables were close together. Attraction desk had an amazing knowledgeable lady there working who helped us book our fun activities. Overall, we had a great time! so much to do and see. But caution, food is very expensive there, especially the fish meals. But you are there to enjoy and indulge after all you are on holidays! Don't spend too much time in rooms so the appearance does not matter. Hope to go back to another island of Hawaii. Was so nice to get away from the snow and cold weather back home even if only for a week! Mele Kalikimaka!! (Merry christmas in Hawaiian)!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny insect infested room with a bed in need of a new mattress”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds are gorgeous, the room although upgraded to an oceanview...not to be confused with an oceanfront was tiny. The mattress flat and uncomfortable, the carpet stained, and we were visited by a roach the size of a Buick. In fact, the hotel had areas blocked that were being fumigated. The staff was unfriendly and attempted to charge us an extra $3.91 per day for the room safe that we never used. Please look elsewhere and don't ruin your vacation as we did. This was December 3 to Dec 7 2004

Reviews.Title: “This place is the worst”
Reviews.Author: josephine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this place for part of our honeymoon, the Maui part. As soon as we got there, I was terribly disappointed, but when we went to our room, I could have cried. It was like staying in a cheesy sleezy motel. This place is old and would need a complete overhaul. Needless to say, I called my travel agent, paid an upgrade and the folllowing day, moved to the Sheraton which I absolutely LOVED!!!!!!!! Believe me, this place is cheap for a reason. I heard that a lot of Europeans stay here because they don't care about the quality of accomodations the way Americans do and go with the cheapest. So, I would say that unless you're used to sub-standard hotels and really just want a place to crash, do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: MauiBound
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina over Thanksgiving this year. After reading some of the reviews (of course after I booked the room) I was a bit apprehensive. Everything turned out great though. 10th floor with an ocean view. We could see whales in the distance from our balacony in the morning. These aren't luxury accommodations but quite nice for the money. Yes, the hotel is a bit dated but we found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. Our housekeeper knew us by name and would always ask if everything was OK or if we needed more pillows?! I've stayed in many 5star hotels that didn't even do that! We stayed at the resort for 5 days. I have also stayed at the Westin, just down the beach from the Royal Lahaina. While it's definitely NOT the Westin, I would recommend this place to anyone on a budget. Affordable and the best beach on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all folks, relax”
Reviews.Author: TheAtomicJeff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned just this morning from our stay at the Royal Lahaina for our first trip to Maui. We also traveled to Italy for 10 days in October so budget was a consideration for us for Maui accomodations. I have to admit that previous reviews that I read before our departure last week had me very concerned but once we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. We stayed in room 8001 (on the very corner), located on the southeast corner of the building with a partial ocean view. It was more than what I expected. From our balcony the view overlooked the golf course. Looking to the left we could see the awesome mountains. Looking to the right we could see the beach and Molokai. It was beautiful and we found ourselves often sitting on the balcony looking at the view from all hours of the day and night. The stars at night are so fabulous. No complaints at all about the view. Here's the good and the bad, starting with the bad to keep the reader's suspense down to a minimum (smile). 1) The sliding door separating the shower/toilet from the rest of the bathroom didn't slide. We constantly had to pickup the door (it wasn't heavy at all) and slide it ourselves when privacy was needed. It was an annoyance but we didn't let it ruin our trip. We figured that we got a pretty good room considering some of those described in other reviews so we lived with the situation vs. gambling on a room change and perhaps getting something not as good. 2) Parking spaces are definately small but we could ALWAYS find a place to park, regardless of whether the luau was going on or not. The walk from the parking lot to the hotel isn't as remotely as bad as people are saying. The Royal Lahaina situation was considerable better than some of the parking facilities of the other premium hotels located along Kaanapali. Some of those arrangements required waaay longer walks than RL. Besides, judging by the looks of some of you fatties vacationing in Maui, you can definitely benefit by walking the extra few yards. Guys, that's really it for the bad. The rooms are certainly older compared to modern standards but our's was perfectly comfortable and clean. No smelly elevators, etc. The good? 1) Staff was excellent! We arrived at the resort at about 6 PM. No problems with check-in; it was fast and smooth. Bellman took our luggage from our car and loaded it onto the cart and carried it to our room. All staff treated us very well at all times so I don't understand what all the fuss is about. Here's a fine example: Our Monday return flight didn't leave until 6 PM. The resort's checkout time was at noon. We didn't want to drive around or sit at the airport for several hours waiting for our return flight. What did we do? We called the front desk, explained our situation and asked for a check out time extension. Without hesitation the staff said no problem and granted an extension until 3 PM without any questions asked or additional fees. What would otherwise have been an early check out and long day at the airport ended up being several extra hours on the beach on our final morning. How's that for customer service? 2) The beach was excellent, as were the grounds. 3) Breakfast was very good. Yes, two people for the buffet cost $26 but it's convenient if you're spending a day at the resort's beach. I don't understand what previous reviewer's complaints have been about the breakfast. Eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns, pancakes or waffles, toast, cereal, oatmeal, loads of fruit, juices and more. If you can't find something to eat among that tremendous variety then you are one picky S.O.B. Hey, I saw a whole lot of you fatties there and it wouldn't hurt you one bit to not have a perfect breakfast every morning. I only ate lunch once at the poolside restaurant and it was overpriced (which hotel poolside restaurant isn't?) and it wasn't that great but it was edible. For dinner, the only onsite restaurant we ate at was at the Tomato Basil, which was very good. An experienced traveler should have some idea of what vacation's actually cost. If the price seems a little low then you should know you're not getting Marriott-styled accomodations. Some of these people complaining about low ceiling fans, long walks from tight parking spaces, no bathtubs, not getting an extra suitcase stand, etc., should get off their high horses and fork out the extra cash for such amenities. Extra suitcase stands? Shesh - ---? Put your suitcase on the floor! You want premium rooms and swimming pools? Fork out the extra cash and go to the Sheraton or Westin. In return for your investment you'll get superb accomodations. You'll also get hoards of screaming children surrounding you at every turn since those type of resorts especially cater to the family-oriented, activity-filled vacation. After a week of sitting at the pool, at night your ears will be echoing the horrible, reverberating sounds of "Mommy/Daddy, look!" or "Wahhh" since you've heard it all week. There were very few children at LR. I've never understood why so many people travel thousands of miles to be on a fantastic island only to spend the week sitting at the pool instead of on a beautiful beach but to each, his own. If ultra chic swimming pools and fabulously premium rooms are a high priority for your vacation experience then you could save yourself a heck of a lot of money by going to Las Vegas. The rooms and pools there are second to none and are cheap, by island vacation standards. My wife and I never vacation at the same place because there's a great big world out there and so little time to see it. But if we did and for the same price, I would definitely return to Royal Lahaina. The money we saved allowed us to eat excellent dinners in town in Lahaina and buy lots of the crap we always buy on vacations - that's half the fun. I'd rather have money in my pocket and a decent place to rest my head at night then stay at a palace with a fine pool. Anyway, thanks for letting me rant, LOL. Hey, bottom line is that Royal Lahaina isn't that bad at all and is an excellent bargain if budget is an issue. I feel sorry for some of you people with high maintenence spouses who gripe and moan about every little inconvenience. Relax and have a good time and don't let the little things in life get to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Oceanview Maui”
Reviews.Author: travelerjoyce
Reviews.Content: I read all 200 reviews for this hotel before I booked, so we were not expecting anything fancy or glorious. Maui is expensive; I wanted a spacious ocean view room on Kaanapali Beach with a king bed for under $175 including parking, taxes, and EVERYTHING and I got it. We booked a Tower room, gardenview with guaranteed upgrade to oceanview. (We called the hotel directly the morning of arrival to request King bed.) The employees were all efficient and courteous, the breakfast buffet was good though a little overpriced at $13. The gardens were gorgeous. The parking was a little tight in the evening hours, the bathroom a little faded, however, we had read about all these drawbacks and we thought they were minor, far outweighed by the old hawaiian ambiance and the fabuluous view of the beach. We had a great stay in early November and would return in a heartbeat. We spent the money we saved not staying in a fancier place on the top-of the line Helicopter tour to Molokai (Sunshine Helicopters) and it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Spend Much Time In Your Room”
Reviews.Author: Sumntodd
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Royal Lahaina twice (Nov. 2003 and Nov. 2004). The first time we were in the newest tower (where the main lobby is) and that wasn't too bad. For what the hotel charges per night (beware that they charge $9 a day for parking), it was fine. The room was a little shabby (old furniture, not-so-clean shower), but for the price what can you say. However, during our second stay, we were put in the off-site tower and it was totally disgusting. Since we live in Hawaii, we did not want to upgrade to an ocean view room and decided on a garden view room. When I walked in (Room 1500), I immediately went back to the lobby and complained. Not only was the room disgusting (old bedspread, old carpet, paint peeling off the wall, beat up door, etc.) we had a view of the noisy parking lot. We were promptly given a room down the hall (Room 1510) which was much better, but I still wore my flip flops around the room (afraid to put my bare feet on the floor) and closed my eyes every time I was in the shower (mold, unidentified hairs and a shower curtain that would make you cringe). My husband kept telling me to stop complaining, which made me realize I did get what we paid for. For what little time you spend in your hotel room, it's not a bad hotel. However, if you can afford to splurge a little, I highly encourage it. The good thing about the Royal Lahaina is: it is right on a beautiful beach, it has a free shuttle to Lahaina Town (5 miles down the road), and it makes it affordable to see the beautiful island of Maui for people on a budget. Just beward of the shower (ick).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice View - OK room/decor/amenities”
Reviews.Author: laurlee
Reviews.Content: First time visitors to Maui and RL 11/25/04-12/2/04. The RL has a great location right on the beach but it's not a three star hotel. Good choice for budget conscience who don't plan on spending much time in the room and utilizing resort amenities. Don't expect luxury. We were much more interested in having a "home base" and venturing out and exploring the island. The rooms were clean with outdated dÃ©cor. No full bath in our room. Thankfully, the king size bed was quite comfy. Front desk service was OK. We wished there was a Jacuzzi on site near the pools. The drink specials are great and the bartenders friendly. The luau show was all right, the food was good. The location of the luau, great. Overall, not too bad. We were almost scared away by other reviews and would have been disappointed if we had not read them. We didnâ€™t expect much. Would we return to the RL? That depends on our budget next time. :) Booked our activities through Boss Frog's. We went to Molokini twice and snorkeled on the Quicksilver (great boat & crew), did the bike down Haleakala (Maui Downhill) and drove the whole way through Hana to the south side (with a Saturn rental - no problem). That was amazing. We had a book called Maui revealed which was a tremendous help. Get it before you go! The seafood buffet at Kapalua Bay hotel (Friday only) was out of this world. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: zatrams1
Reviews.Content: we just got back from maui today - the RL is a great place to stay (we were in the 7th floor-kai tower). beautiful resort by the ocean, convenient location, nice luau. this was our first time in maui. we were there for 5 days: 1st day(half-day): drove north of lahaina, explored the beaches- kaanapali and niapli 2nd day: drove south to beaches of kihei and makena (big beach), attended luau in the evening 3rd day: haleakala 4th day: road to hana started from RL at 7AM, got back at 7:30 PM 5th day: snorkeling at corral gardens, swimming in "little beach" at makena (clothing optional), sunset at makena landing among the beaches, we liked these the best: black sands beach and the red sand beach(hana), big beach and little beach(makena). for swimming, little beach in makena has the best waves in our opinion. if you are on a time crunch, maybe skip the north beaches of niapli and kaanapali, and the south ones of kihei. they are pretty, but the waves were relatively small. we bought the book "maui revealed "- very handy . also, for events you like to attend such as the luau, maybe try and get your tickets in advance before the travel - that way you save money and also avoid hassles of booked-out events.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the chronic complainers!”
Reviews.Author: ukcivil
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 12 nights in October 2004. After reading the reviews from this site, we were somewhat apprehensive. After our arrival, we were very pleasantly surprised. The accomadations were fine considering the price paid ($100 and night for the 12th floor tower). After parking, room fee, and taxes, it was about $125 a night. The room was clean, maid service was good, and the staff was friendly. We especially enjoyed the complimentary managers cocktail hour on Wednesday night. This hotel is also on a prime beach location, just a quarter mile north of the Sheraton where the price is double. The hotel is older, and the bathroom is a little small, but, hey you are in Hawaii, does it really matter? We will return to the Royal Lahaina on our next trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Don't always believe what you read...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We almost didn't stay here due to the reviews we read. However, we are very glad we decided to keep our reservation. We stayed in the Beach Front Cottage and it was wonderful. Our cottage was very nice, clean, roomy and right outside was the pool and the beach. It was a beautiful view from our lanai. We spent 7 nights here and it was very relaxing. The room was very clean, the hotel staff was very friendly, and it was in a very convenient area with a beautiful beach and grounds. Everything was kept up very nice. The breakfast buffet left a little to be desired, but is that really so important? We mostly ate outside of the resort, except a few breakfasts. I loved the convenience of walking right out of your cottage to the pool and beach. It was one of the best vacations we have had. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to get away and relax and enjoy beautiful scenery. Trust me, if it wasn't clean, I wouldn't have stayed there! Once again, you can't believe everything you read and I'm very surprised at the poor ratings this hotel has received. I don't feel they are deserved!

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again. They lied.”
Reviews.Author: goldenboy
Reviews.Content: An extremely noisy stay with buses and trucks backup- beeping. We booked and paid for an ocean view room with a tub. Due to construction noises on the west side where they had swinging scaffold where grinding, sawing and hammering occurred. The main pool was covered with tarps. The tub was a 30" x 30" stall with a seat in the corner(japanese furo). At the desk, they tried to assure me that this was their tub and the sun set in the north. They do have a jacuzzi up near the freeway and tennis courts. There was a micro fridge which I had to defrost with a hair dryer before we could use it. There is a $126 charge on my bill for parking. They charge$2 to get a baked potato instead of mashed with the prime rib dinner. I forgot to tell them to cook the mixed vegetables. The coffee was luke warm. I will now be getting a new travel agent for putting us in that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We're Coming Back TOO”
Reviews.Author: emmit
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the 25th Anniversary Story! We came for our Honeymoon in 1984 and are coming 1st of the year!!!! No, its not the Ritz; but who wants all those people around! We have fond memories of the Garden Cottage and after 20 years of marriage; we want to return!!!! Yes, you can get more posh accommodations but your can't beat the atmosphere and staff from what my memories serve me! Can't Wait..... Michele and John Dallas TX

Reviews.Title: “darn ceiling fan”
Reviews.Author: pepprgrl
Reviews.Content: When I read the review : "R.L. Does Not Care About Customer Safety!!!!!!!," A TripAdvisor User, Foster City, CA, October 26, 2004 I smiled. I'm 5'10 and had the same ceiling fan experience. Luckily, I had no blood loss or major pain like the previous reviewer. As someone in the legal world I am suprised by how the hotel handled the situation and the position they took. Somewhat outrageous. I believe they were quite responsible and legally owe this guest. Ps - if you plan to do any business on your computer via internet make sure to bring your our extension cords - our standard room had two open plugs - in the bathroom. So charging batteries for the camera, cell phones, ipod, and anythign else was such a hassle. If you wanted to connect to the internet using the phone you have to pull out the bed an unplug either the alarm clock or lamp to power your computer. Ive been to countless hotels and this was very strange. When I asked the front desk if there was anything they could do, such as provide an extension cord - the response was that the hotel doesnt have extension cords.

Reviews.Title: “As honeymooners this place met our needs..........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband posted earlier but, I just wanted to add a few things he forgot to mention. We didn't do the Luau at hotel after reading all the bad reviews. I found a nice one via the web located on Front Street. It's call the OLD LAHAINA LUAU. What a great time we had. The food was excellent, free drinks (top shelf stuff) during and before dinner, real flower lei's, excellent service and a great show. It cost a little more than some of the other Luau's but, I thought it was worth it. The Royal Lahaina served our needs perfectly. We had a wonderful wedding. The maid didn't clean our room one day but, when I went to the front desk the next evening they sent someone to clean it right away. There were no other problems after that. We enjoyed our stay. If you love seafood make sure to dine at Mama's Fish House. Pricy but, the food is to die for. You only live once so enjoy it. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Twenty Fifth Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: canadianABfan
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary at the same hotel we met in, the Royal Lahaina Resort. When we met in 1978 ,the hotel had a thriving disco called the Foxey Lady. Times have moved on and the disco is long gone but the friendliness of staff still remains. In particular the Maitre D' for the dining room, Ford Ushiami did a wonderful job looking after us whenever we ate in the dining room. In a previous review, I noted the comment of a three star hotel in a 5 star setting. The truth is that the Royal Lahaina does not compare to the larger resort hotels such the Sheraton, Westin etc. It is in a class of its own offering staff who have been at the hotel for many years. Some even remember the Foxey Lady Disco. The hotel has a real island feel with its bamboo papered walls of its dining room. While we were there, renovations were taking place to continue to improve on the hotel. The facilties are excellent with two pools and a beach that is perfect. The popular Whaler's Village is a 10 minute walk away. This allows the resort to remain a peaceful place away slightly from the crowds. We took advantage on a $99.00 meal plan per person. This offered 7 full buffet breakfasts, 2 dinners and a $50.00 bar tab, excellent value, excellent food and excellent service. The wine list was satisfactory with an excellent house reisling at $15.00 a bottle. The rooms were comfortable. We had been given an uprade to the 12th floor(top floor) with a balcony that overlooked the Ocean. I enjoyed my morning Kona coffee in the room on the balcony before breakfast each morning. As you can tell, we enjoyed ourselves and look forward to returning in the future. With two daughters entering their 20's, I would consider going back for a wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Let's get real!!! This isn't a bad place What do you want!!!???”
Reviews.Author: kevinmba
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got married there on Oct. 17. It was just the two of us. We got married at 10:00 in the morning right on the beach. Everything went perfect without a hitch. The photographer did an excellent job with our wedding pictures. She put EVERY shot on a CD and created a slide show. We burned CD's and sent them to our family and friends and they love it. They feel like they were actually there. We spent most of our time away from the hotel. Parking is not the problem people claim it is. Some of the spaces at the resort are small, but that's because the cars on the island are bigger now. It's about the same size at the Whaler Village. Parking on Front St. is easy because there's either free parking or validated parking available. The resort is beautifully landscaped, it's just an older structure. We read all these scary reviews before we came out, but we weren't too worried. We had an Oceanview room, and there was no mold, no mildew, the room was clean. We were given a bottle of champaign for being newlyweds. There was some work being done on the Oceanfront rooms and you could hear the drilling for a couple of days, BUT, that was only from about 9:30 til 4:30 and we weren't in the room that much during the day anyway. Did we eat there...no, we went out on the town. If you want a good breakfast, reasonably priced, go to the Castaway, which is literally next door (really, you just walk there) at the Maui Villas. There's so many good and affordable places to eat on Front St., why would you want to eat at the hotel anyway?? It's always more expensive and not necessarily that good. They're in the hotel business not the food business!!! I kind of wonder how much time some people are spending in their hotel room, and we were on our honeymoon! When you go to Maui, you want to see Maui! Overall it's an adequate hotel for people who want a decent place to put their stuff while they're out having fun and don't want to spend a fortune. It's a 3 star hotel. I wouldn't feel bad telling someone to stay here. If you want 5 star service, stay at a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spend 5 nights at RL. Got upgraded to a cottage. Nice staff. Room was average. Beach was great. You definitely get what you paid for. You can spend much more on the Sherton or the Hyatt for a better place if you plan to spend the vacation in the resort. I prefer to see the wanders of Maui and just have a place to sleep and relax. The cottage was average. I didn't stay in the tower so I can't comment on it. The Luau was also average. The whole place is just average. Don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Older Resort, Good Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the older Royal Hale section of the resort from October 9-16, 2004. The ocean front rooms are the ones to get if you're staying in the Royal Hale. Yes, the decor is dated, but everything worked, and the housekeeping staff did an excellent job of keeping everything clean and neat. We had two minor problems which were repaired within 2 hours of reporting them. Our room was ground level, faced the ocean, the view could not be beat. 50 feet to the best beach in Maui! (that's why you come here anyway) The drawbacks, it deems like the RLR charges for somethings that are taken for granted at other resorts, coffee, safe use, etc... This is an extra $12.00 per day charge. Also since we were next to the LUAU, we would have heard it every night from 5:00 - 8:00. But for us this was not a problem... we were out at dinner for all but one of the nights we stayed there. The night we were in, we sat outsideand watched the show for FREE! I believe thet even the rooms in the big tower could hear the LUAU. Overall we had a great time, the staff was friendly, and helpful. The grounds were clean, and neat. The room was clean, but needed updating. The beach was FANTASTIC! If you're looking for a high dollar, pamper you resort go elsewhere. If you want a nice facility, with a good staff, decent prices, and great location stay at the RLR. We would go back again. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina noisy but great beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RLR from 09/16 - 09/22 Room was Ocean Front on 4th floor, right above the bar!!! When we checked in we asked the desk clerk if this might be a problem. He assured us it wouldn't be but did try to find something else. No luck??? The entertainment (??) in the bar must of had their speakers turn up because we could hear the music and the poor humor as if they were in our room and this is with the sliding door and shutter door closed. Thank goodness they quit at !0 pm!! At about 5 am they would start to rearrange the furniture in the bar area, dragging chairs across the tile floor etc. Awake, to close the doors (end of hearing the surf)! When our travel agent made our reservation we had requested a king or queen size bed. When we asked about that at the front desk we were told that none we available but we could be put on a list to move. Next day we asked again and a differant clerk told us that most of their Ocean front rooms have 2 double beds as we had, this makes for tight quarters in the small rooms. Other than the above problems, we felt the RLR was O.K. We stayed in the room we were given, and by the end of the week we got accustomed to the noise, like living next to a freeway. We might go back,if we can be assured that we would have a room above the 8th floor, the beach was GREAT, enjoyed the snorkeling by BLack Rock and it's location is private. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Okay...so its definitely not the Ritz....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: but what can you expect from a 2.5 star hotel that was built when my parents were still in college! My husband and I just recently returned from our honeymoon to Maui where we stayed at the Royal Lahina for 9 days/8 nights. I give this hotel an above average rating for two reasons: #1 they have a management team that is willing to please and to go the extra mile. Upon checking-in to the RLR we found ourselves, less than impressed with the accomodations in the Tower (this is the tower that IS NOT ABOVE THE LUAU (I'm probably spelling that wrong since I didn't attend but heard enought of it from my room from the tower). But, the management team promptly upgraded us to an Ocean View and then ultimately to an Ocean Front Cottage-which if you decide to stay here-you should DEFINITELY book in one of the ocean front cottages-your vacation will feel much different being just steps from the beach and opening your shades every morning to see a breathtaking view. They also have a wonderful FREE happy hour on Wednesdays hosted by the friendly management staff...they definitely treat you like guests and the food and beverages are served unlimited for 2 hours--its a great deal to get anything FREE these days (and even if its built into the room cost somehow) -it still feels nice not to have to pay for your drinks and PuPus at HH. #2 they definitely are in a prime location. Most of the other high end resorts-such as the Ritz-Grand Wailea-are not directly on the beach-the RLR is just steps (vs. a long stroll on a foot-path) to beautiful Kaanapali beach. You are also a footpath a way from Whalers Village, which has higher-end shopping for West Maui (Tiffany, Coach etc.) and some great restaurants and bars that stay open past 10 pm (beware, if you like staying up at past 10 pm at your hotel bar...you'll be by yourself as this place pretty much shuts down at 10 pm) If you are expecting to get a great deal on a hotel-which their rates at the RLR are- and hope to find yourself surprised with a beautiful room like the Ritz, this isn't your place. You pretty much get what you pay for here where the room accomdoations are concerned. If you are, however, looking for some value (in an otherwise, pretty much very expensive area for resorts) and a great location with a management team that genuinely cares -this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanfront cottage is awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Maui to get married and stayed at the Royal Lahaina. Teresa at RLR was our wedding coordinator and did a fantasic job - everything about our wedding was perfect and I didn't have to worry about a single detail. I think the major difference between those who love the RLR and those who hate it is the room you stay in. I would only stay here if it was in one of the awesome oceanfront cottages or cottage suites. You can get lucky and get upgraded for free to an oceanfront cottage once you get there (like my parents had the good fortune of - and they had paid the lowest price imaginable). But we weren't willing to take the chance. If you want luxury, this is not the place for you as many have already stated. But it is a great location on a beautiful beach at a good price for hotels in Maui. I do not recommend the restaurant on property though for dinner, the food was mediocre at best and very overpriced with a not so knowledgeable wait staff. Head to Whaler's Village instead to eat. I found absolutely no problems with water pressure, bugs, cleanliness, etc as some others had. Again, could be the difference from cottages and regular rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Went Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled to Maui many times but we have never been treated as well as we were this past summer at the Royal Lahaina Resort. The staff treated us like we were family; from the Front Office folks to the Bell Hops, they always had time for us. Besides staying in and enjoying a beautiful Oceanfront Cottage we were invited to and attended the Wednesday evening Mai Tai party. The drinks never stopped coming, the food was great, and the staff hung out with us like we had known them all our life; we didn't want to leave at the end of the night as we were having so much fun! We had the pleasure of eating at the Royal Lahaina Resort Restaurant on another night and we enjoyed great Prime Rib and Fresh Fish but what made the night special was our waiter; he took care of all the little things and really made the night special by his friendly demeanor; we felt like we were his only customers! I highly recommend the Royal Lahaina Resort; not only does it sit on beautiful Kaanapali Beach but it has a wonderful group of people working there who definitely spread the Aloha Spirit!

Reviews.Title: “So the hotel is older.....but the beach is awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent my honeymoon here last year and we had such a great time at RLR that we came back for our one year anniversary. We loved the very homey feeling of this hotel. The beach is awesome and very kid friendly. The waves are not rough like the Ritz or Sheraton. Somehow my husband and I got upgraded to the best suite in the hotel and it was awesome. My husband and I will continue to come to the RLR in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: nokaoi
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 9/20-9/30 and we would like to compliment everyone we came in contact with, the service was outstanding from check-in to check-out. Thankyou very much for making our time there so relaxing and enjoyable at the Royal Lahaina. Warren Webb

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RLR for the past week. If you are used to staying in modern luxury resorts such as the Hyatt Regency or the Grand Wailea, you may be unhappy here. The RLR was built around 1970 and was among the original Kaanapali resort properties. As a result, it does not have a fancy kids pool, game room, DVD player in the room, jacuzi tub, swim-up bar, etc., but it does have the best view location in West Maui. Just watch the sun set between Lanai and Molokai one night and you will understand. The rooms in the main building have received new tile flooring and carpet, plus new furnishings. Like many hotels this age, the bathrooms are small. Water pressure could be improved. Exterior concrete repairs on the building are underway. There is a shuttered restaurant (Don the Beachcomber) now used for storage,and in general the place needs a makeover. The hotel restaurant is overpriced given the mediocre food; I agree that meals should be eaten elsewhere -- Maui is full of great restaurants. The bar closes at 10:00 -- what's that about?? The pools are plain old rectangles, with no caves, waterfalls or slides. I found the staff helpful and friendly, and the room was clean. There's not much for kids here, but for those who love Hawaii's natural beauty it is a peaceful and quiet spot with low room rates. Unlike the mega-resorts, you don't have to fight for chairs by the pool or stand in lines for restaurants. The hotel sits on a great beach. Bottom line -- if you have money to burn, you'll be better off at the Hyatt Regency or similar property, but if you are not able to or don't care to pay the rates charged by the mega-resorts, the RLR is a good compromise. This place looks dated, but it grows on you with each passing day. The RLR may be Maui's best kept secret Note on parking - the parking lot has been striped to create many spaces tood ld get some door dings here!

Reviews.Title: “This is Paradise”
Reviews.Author: cocotiger
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I visited Maui in April of this year. This was our first visit to Maui and we were more than happy with the Hotel. The rooms were clean, comfortable and very reasonably priced. We had a wonderful time and couldn't fault anything with our stay. We are planning another trip to Hawaii next April and Maui & the Royal Lahania Resort are top of our list on where we want to go. Next year I will be taking a group of approximately 20 Netballers (teenagers) and my daughter has assured them that this is THE place to stay. We certainly found the staff very friendly. The tour desk couldn't have been more helpful, they went out of their way to ensure our stay was memorable. Can't wait till next April.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Maui was the last stop on our honeymoon and we were very much looking forward to out private cottage on the beach. And while the property was beautiful, the customer service was absolutely awful! Upon arrival I waited for over a half hour to check in, while watching many of the service people chat amongst themselves. I was treated with disrespect. Both the waiting the rudeness were consitent themes everytime we had to speak with someone at the front desk. When we asked the tourism desk what they suggested we do, their response was (in a rude tone) was to look at the brochures. They were extrondinarily unhelpful. Our private cottage had a private beach which we were excited to use. However, we were disapointed to find the chairs covered in bird poop. After asking the hotel to clean it 3 times, we gave up. Perhaps most disappointing, is that I spent time filling out the feedback card (with both positive and negative feedback) and almost a year later received no response. That tells me that the Royal Lahaina Resort is not interested in changing.

Reviews.Title: “The honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent one week there 8/29-9/6. Our bathroom shower had sand upon arrival but after contacted the desk it was taken care of within a 1/2 hour. Housekeeping was constantly eager to clean our room. It definitely needs a update but not a horrible place to stay when on a budget. Don't eat at the RL, the bar lounge is slow on service and prices are high for drinks. Breakfast buffet is overpriced. Great Beach and Luau was good. The hotel is close to Lahania and there are lots of great places to eat. I also recommend a trip to wailea to the four seasons, Spago is there and is by far the best food and service you will ever have. We recommend aTrilogy trip(they are on Lahainaluna St) for a day trip to Lanai (breakfast and lunch included)snorkeling and van trip, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “5 star location, 2 star accommodation”
Reviews.Author: velogiant
Reviews.Content: Top location but please update your rooms. I don't know when this hotel was built but frankly, stop spending money on the landscaping and fix the facilities now. There are so many new hotels going up in the area, as we speak and this place looks like a 1950's country club. I think the room fitting are coming back into fashion! Yes we paid for a standard room but this often tells you what the hotel really thinks of it clients. The bathroom was the worst aspect of the room but to the credit of the hotel, as soon as I advised them of the maintenance needs of the room, they fixed ASAP ie, ligh bulbs needed replacing, the door lock was almost off it's hinge, the sink was blocking up and the safe stopped working on our last night at the hotel. The beach is wonderful and the location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Lynn60
Reviews.Content: Was very worried about staying at the Royal Lahaina after reading these trip reports. Although it is an older property, we found it clean and comfortable. The staff was courteous & helpful. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were welcomed by the most accomodating staff, complete with smiles and great hospitality. We loved our oceanfront room and the view was spectacular. We enjoyed and relished the moments of our stay at this establishment. This was our first anniversary together and we couldn't have picked a more suitable place to stay. The only negative was "running out" of food during dinner. We had dinner at the Terrace Lounge and and came to find out that all the fresh fish was gone.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: J_Lee
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in September 2004, in a delux partial ocean view room in the tower, floor 9. We got a special rate through expedia for $112 a night. The view was fabulous, and you could hear the waves crashing in. The hotel could use a little upgrading, maybe new furniture. The room was decent, but I noticed the bathroom had some mildew in the tiles, and I didn't care for the shower curtain odor. The bathroom doors are the kind that slide, and it was hard to slide back and forth. The carpet and chairs in the room were a bit worn too. If you are not a neat freak than you will probably be less bothered by it. Also if you are a light sleeper that needs absolute, complete silence, the air conditioning makes an annoying humming sound. We tried turning off the air and opening the balcony window, and the waves were very loud too. It seems to be amplified when you are on the ninth floor. The best part about the hotel is the location. The beach is beautiful, and sandy and does not have rocks. Because of the lack of coral and rocks, there are not too many fish swimming around. We took walks along the beach at sunset and in the morning. It was absolutely beautiful and romantic. The service was very responsive and courteous. Every time we requested something to be brought to our room, it took no more than five minutes. The activity counter was very helpful and reliable. I purchased surf lessons at Maui Waveriders through the hotel. I had the best time. If you want to learn to surf, I highly recommend them. The food was not too good at the hotel. We had the breakfast buffet for $13 each, and was not worth it. My husband compared it to camp food. We ate dinner at the restaurant downstairs once and it was only so so. Maybe we should have tried Basil Tomatoes. The hotel provides a free shuttle to Whalers Village. You can also take the bus to Lahaina for $1 each way. It was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money”
Reviews.Author: ferdy7
Reviews.Content: Our prior trip to Maui was to the Grand Wailea for our Honeymoon so I was curious to find out what lay in store for us at this Hotel. Needless to say we were very pleasantly surprised. This Hotel represents great value for money. We took the breakfast and rental car package and it turned out to be a really good deal. Following a prior traveller's advice we asked for rooms on the higher floors. Ours was an ocean view room on the 11th floor which might as well have been ocean front for the view that we had. The room was spacious and clean. This is simply an older hotel that has been well used but maintained well. No frills though they do have two pools and a decent restaurant. Note that they have a Luau every evening at 5:30 so if you plan on sleeping at that time don't count on it. We were rarely in the hotel for the duration of the Luau so the sound did not bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Best beach at Royal Lahaina Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the negative reviews, we were scared of the condition of the hotel. Since we were expecting the worst, we were pleasantly surprised with many aspects of the hotel. The location and beach cannot be beat. There is a great reef for snorkeling less than a block away. The infamous "Black Rock" is another short walk in the other direction. The beaches were clean and uncrowded. The rooms were tidy, but there was a very strong, musty smell. Fortunately, we spent little time in the room so it was not a big issue. We simply opened the sliding doors to air it out each time we came in. The shower was gross and it took a while for us to convince the kids that it was safe to use. It was clean but old and in disrepair. We had a partial ocean view and the view was fabulous. It did not feel "partial" at all. We appreciated the casual, beachy feel of the lobby and the rest of the hotel. After all, we went to Hawaii to relax and all we needed was a good beach. The staff was quite friendly, but since we were not there to visit with the staff, we didn't care either way. The restaurant was not very good and the drinks in the lounge were weak at best. We wandered down to see the Sheraton and Hyatt to see if they would be worth the splurge. The Sheraton was a mob scene at the beach and the pool. The Hyatt was beautiful, but filled with folks on their computers and cell-phones. If you are on vacation to work, that would be a great place to stay. I would put the atmosphere and lack of crowds at the Royal Lahaina as an A+. We would probably come back but make sure that we were in an updated room (the hotel is in renovation). Two more tips....best Mai Tai's on Maui were at Aloha Mixed Plate, just 10 minutes from the hotel on front street. There was also a great breakfast/lunch dinner place called Soup Nut'z and Java Jazz. Only five minutes from the hotel and the food was out of this world. They serve a lot to locals and the atmosphere was just as good as the food!!! I highly recommend the lobster.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to a Cottage if you can”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading hundreds of less than average reviews about the Royal Lahaina hotel rooms my husband I were a little leary of our first stay. We immediately called our travel agent to upgrade to an oceanfront cottage. The grounds were beautiful and nicely maintained, and the staff was very friendly. We felt right at home with an older (but charming) beach cottage. It was clean and functional. No problems with hot/cold water temps. A few ants and geckos but what's a beach cottage without a few buddies? Anyway, geckos are good luck! The free and $1.00 shuttles were an added plus for shopping and lunch trips (check out the Hula Grill for dinner sunsets). The snorkeling was amazing, and lucky us we caught a glimpse of sea turtles! The road to Hana is a definite must! It rained part of the way making it a memorable and beautiful experience. Overall, the cottage was great but highly recommend eating out. I would stay here again if in a cottage by the sea! P.S. The hotel charges a $50.00 a day (upfront) pending transaction to your credit card that you may not be informed about.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel, Beautiful Beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, let me say this, its an old property with beautiful surroundings. We stayed here two times before, back in 71 and 78, a long time ago. What has changed? Not much. This is the problem, with resorts in Hawaii. They do not want to up-date, especially with the rooms. This is not the 70s. Its not right, that you pay top dollar to stay in these hotels, but have to endure hard beds, crummy old tvs, small old style bathrooms besides the rooms being small already, out-dated furniture thats been used for years and years. The beach is wonderful, the location is superb, but the hotel? Motel6 quality, even in the tower rooms. Its not just the Royal Hawaiian, its all the other major resorts as well. They want to give you the bare minimum, however, pay top dollar for out-dated old rooms. Not our style, back in the 70s, yeah it was great, but Hawaii needs to catch up to 2004. We don't mind paying top dollars for resort hotels, however, we do mind, when we are not getting our moneys worth. As for maid service, forget it. They don't even care. How about taking a windex bottle and washing the mirrors and the sliding door out to the balcony. You are paying for the view, right? You just have to do it yourself. Its so sad, that people do not like their jobs. Even though you are only in the room for a short period of time each day, it would be nice to have modern amenities, not a 25 yr old tv. How about a little paint and some modern furnishings? I think we are finished with Hawaii for awhile. Next trip, Asia, where hotels are modern and high tech.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina OK”
Reviews.Author: ATLAS313
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the cottages and it was OK. There is a ton of trees and vegetation on the grounds and the birds go wild in the morning making it hard to sleep. Air conditioning is the wall units which work but are quite noisy. Overall, I got what I paid for and the facilties/food/drinks etc. was adequate. The bar band was not very good and the biggest applause came from an audience member who performed Karaoke. The resort was not walking distance to anything. Positives: Room was clean and decent sized. Location is centrally located andthe grounds are very nice and the beach was also quite nice. If you are going to do Hana and the crater, I would recommend staying on Southern coast rather than the west coast.

Reviews.Title: “Three weeks of paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: FiveOs
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Royal Lahaina three times in the past four years and have loved every minute of it. I can honestly say we never had a bad time.
