We stayed three weeks last Ocober/November (2003) and had a great time. We have always opted to stay in the three story Royal Hale building which is on the north side of the property next to the luau grounds. We stayed for five days one time in the tower and didn't care for the trek to the beach. The Royal Hale is three stories high and I would recommend the second or third floor AWAY from the luau, but being close isn't too bad since we were usually out during most of the luau festivities. The ocean view from this building's front rooms is awesome and just a stone's throw from the water. After a night or two the sound of the waves are welcome white noise. The view from the first floor of this building is blocked by vegetation. We had wonderful views of Molokai and Lanai. This building is a bit out of the main stream and usaually very quiet. The luau customers surround the place though in the afternoon waiting to get in and they take pictures right in front of the building. Can be amusing to watch. We always stay in October, which is the off season. Halloween in Lahaina is one BIG party!!! They call it the Mardi Gras of the Pacific. Thousands of people along Front Street in Lahaina in costume. We bring our own costumes from home now and always have fun. Great place to people watch. The room in the resort itself was neat and clean but a little tired. The toilet/shower room is small and that sliding door could use updating, but it's acceptable. Some very small red ants running around the bath and on the porch, but nothing to fret about. The room has a very small dorm fridge in it which could be bigger. The grounds of the hotel are wonderful and well kept. Not perfect, but nice. The beach is the best part. Isn't this what you come for? Very quiet and not too many people. There is great snorkeling just to the north about 200 yards starting in front of the public beach and going north. All sorts of fish, some eels, an octopus or two, an occasional turtle and even a small white tipped shark (with a hook in his mouth!). I did the scuba dive off Black Rock twice with the resort instructor, but it wasn't really too much better than just snorkeling. We never had a problem with the staff. They were always helpful when needed. We're easy to please and really had very few, if any, reasons to call them. The food in the restaurant was good. Breakfast buffet was typical with nothing really outstanding. After eating there, you really don't need lunch. Aloha Mixed Plate, next to the Old Lahaina Luau is one of our favorite places for supper. It's a very casual place and you eat at patio furniture on a deck out of take-out foam trays with plastic cups for drinks, but the food is always the best (two scoops rice, one scoop mac salad). Just love the Shoyu Chicken! Inexpensive too. Mama's Fish House was very good and very pricey. Staying for three weeks, my wife and I are looking for a bargain, and the Royal Lahaina is about as inexpensive as you can get for a resort on Kaanapali. We could probably only stay for a week or so at the other resorts for the same price. You REALLY don't spend that much time in the rooms to make it worth the difference (the Mrs. and I aren't newlyweds ;). The road to Hana is much improved in the last 5 years with the roadway being wider. It's not the white knuckle drive it used to be. Go ahead and drive all the way around. It's better than seeing the same sights on the way back. The unpaved portions past the Seven Pools were well packed gravel/dirt. Very desolate back there and little traffic. Don't go this way if heavy rains in the mountains as the road goes through a BIG wash valley on the north side. I imagine this would be a river to the ocean in the rainy season. We'll be back in the fall of 2005 for another two or three weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina Resort was the perfect place for us. We had our almost 4 year old daughter with us and I am do to give birth to our son in less than 7 weeks. We stayed in a garden view cottage which sat right behind the ocean view (would have preferred) cottages. The pool was maybe 50 feet away and the beach another 30 maybe. The beach was so beautiful and clean. Very secluded, not busy at all. Incredible grounds. The staff couldn't have been nicer. We avoided a rental car, so had no parking trouble. There is a shuttle that will take you into Lahiana for a dollar, making several stops. The burgers at the grill were excellent, the Tomato Basil at the top of the hill was excellent. The breakfast buffet was okay, it was a buffet. The Luau was excellent. Would recommend this to all our family and friends. We can't wait to go back next year!! Hope you take the chance and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “It is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time. The grounds are beautiful and clean. The beach is excellent. The snorkeling is also excellent in this area. This was our first time in Maui and when we go back we will stay here again. Everything you need is right there or close by.

Reviews.Title: “WE HAD A VERY ENJOYABLE TIME”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 40th Wedding Anniversary at the Royal Lahaina Resort from July 12-17th. We had a very enjoyable stay. Yes, they do need to do some updating in the rooms but ours was comfortable and clean. We stayed in the main tower and had an Ocean Front Room on the 8th floor. The room was not perfect but the view from our room was so spectacular that it made up for anything else. We did not let the little things spoil our time. The Royal Lahaina is an older hotel and you pay older hotel prices. You want to stay at the Westin or the Sheraton where the decor is perfect than you pay for the newer decor and the higher prices. Most of the staff at the hotel was courteous and friendly. We ate the buffet breakfast every morning we were there and found it to be wonderful. It had a nice variety of food and enough to satisfy us. We also had the early bird dinners and they too were very nice and the price reasonable. We would stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort again. ALOHA!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Royal Lahina in Maui. The location is incredible! We had room 1227 on the 12th floor and what an Ocean View! Granted it was not Ocean Front we still had an outstanding view of Black Rock and the surrounding islands. The hotel staff is very courteous. The room had a queen bed, balcony and a refrigerator! This is a great hotel. We went through Carefree Vacations and they set us up with a great room. We also went through the hotel wedding service and renewed our vows on the beach! Least expensive I found around the region. The beach is quiet, flat and has beautiful clear water! Just south past Black Rock are all of the big chain hotels like Marriott ect.....This area was teaming with people and numerous kids steep beaches and loud Seadoos. If you want a great vacation, clean room, awesome beach! Check out the Royal Lahina. -------------

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL IF CLEANLINESS IS IMPORTANT TO YOU”
Reviews.Author: donegalone
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Hawaii, spent 4 nights at Royal Lahaina and would not recommend this hotel to anyone that is interested in clean surrondings - for example, there are rattan chairs in room, chairs had dust and dirt ingrained in wicker, I complained to manager, sent housekeeping to clean but this was years of dirt so a superficial clean was not going to do it. Simiarly, bathroom had sliding louved door. Slats contained years of dust and grease, disgusting. If we had booked longer I would definitely have moved hotels. As others have stated the positives of this hotel do not make up for negatives. I have travelled extensively and stayed in budget and ultra budget accomadations and this is the worst. there is no excuse for this, a hotel being old is fine but lack of cleanliness is just not acceptable to me.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahania is a wonderful Hawaiian hotel. Everything in Maui is expensive. If you understand that, you will realize it is a good deal for the money. If you want an upscale suite for the price of a room in most hotels, reserve the Alii suite. We did, and it was beautiful. It is a two room suite with a hottub in one of the two bathrooms. The suite is very modern and spacious. We had a spectacular view of the ocean from three sliding glass doors. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. My husband and I were married on the grounds and Theresa, our wedding coordinator, took care of everything. Our wedding was everything we wanted it to be. We are going back for our fifth anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible, but not great either”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort from July 12-19 on our honeymoon. We know that it wasn't one of the top resorts in the area, but with the exchange, our budget was a factor since we wanted to spend two weeks in Hawaii. We booked our trip months ahead of time and requested a quiet room on a floor higher up. When we checked in, we were in a room in the building that was directly over the luau and very loud. I have to tell you, that I am not a princess by any means, but my heart sank when we entered this room. It was dark, smelled awful, the carpet was discusting and there were numerous stains on the couch in the room. I requested that we be moved, which we were, to a room in the same building but on the back side on the ground floor. It was marginally better. The following morning when we headed out, we decided to ask the manager what our options were as far as changing rooms. He was very accomodating, and admitted that the area of the resort that we were in was tired. We were offered a room in the tower or a room in one of the cottages for no extra charge. We snapped up the cottage room and were very happy with the upgrade. We were on the golf course behind Basil Tomatos Restaurant. While the walls were thin, this room was much larger, very bright, quiet and seemed cleaner. We did not opt for the coffee/safe/parking/phone call package. We brought our own coffee and only ended up making two calls so we saved money there. When they say there's a fridge in the room, that was all there was. We had to buy cutlery, cups and coffee filters to be able to have our own coffee and snacks in our room. A mouse, lizard and weird bug (cochroach?) were found in our room but in a tropical climate on the ground floor it wasn't totally unexpected. We were disappointed there was no bathtub in our room though. The maid service starting banging on our door at 8:15 am, which is way too early in my opinion. We did have a privacy tag which we used most mornings. The bar/lounge had decent drinks and we ate lunch or a light dinner there a few times and were satisfied. The beach was spectacular and the pools were decent. We didn't attend the luau so we can't provide any information regarding that. Overall, I'd recommend it to others on a budget but we wouldn't stay here again. As for Maui, we snorkeled at Kapalua Bay, Black Rock and Molokini. You see the same fish at the first two places that you see at Molokini so we wouldn't pay to go to Molokini again. We also went on a dinner cruise with the Pacific Whale Foundation which was nice, and we drove to Hana and up Haleakala. We didn't go to the aquarium but we've heard it's world class. We loved Maui and will definately return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!! Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina for 4 nights and 5 days in June. I would not return! When you check in they unload your bags into the lobby and just leave them sitting around out where anybody could take anything that they want. I had my son stand with the bags while I checked in. When I checked in the girl went over with me the length of stay number of people in my room and so forth. They give you the option to pay for a package which includes parking, in-room coffee and tea for a little discounted price so I said ok to that. She then informed me that we had been upgraded to an ocean view room. When we were taken to our room it only had 1 bed and there were 3 of us (which she knew because she confirmed that on check in). So we had to go back downstairs to get another room. No other rooms were ready so we had to wait. We decided to have lunch while we waited so we put our luggage in the room of my sisterâ€™s family who was traveling with us, otherwise they would have just left it sitting out in the lobby. When we did get our room it was not ocean view but partial ocean view which was ok but it smelled like urine! Very strong! My husband complained and they said that they had no other rooms available and we would have to wait until tomorrow to change. They said that while we went to dinner they would send up housekeeping to re-clean the bathrooms but they didnâ€™t. What a horrible night. The beds were tiny and had flat-as-pancake pillows. We signed a form giving them permission to move our luggage the next day to a different room because we had plans and could not hang out at the hotel til sometime between 1:00-3:00 which is when they said that they could move us. When we returned they had moved us two doors down. The new room did not smell, had bigger beds, fluffier pillows and a brand new comforter. I wonder if they just see what youâ€™ll put up with before they give you a decent room? Anyway, I have been in better motels than this resort! The bathrooms are awful. There is a sliding door to shut off the toilet and shower area of the bathroom. Ours closed all the way at the top but there was about a 2â€� gap as you got to the bottom. The showers are disgusting! There is some kind of panel above them that the paint is chipping off and cold water drips out constantly. The bottom of the shower had a lot of chips of porcelain missing. Both the rooms and my sisters where the same way. Oh, in the first room the toilet seat did not match the toilet. It was a different color and did not fit properly. It was just an old cheap plastic one. The lighting in the bathroom was horrible to get yourself ready. Part of the wall was missing in the toilet area at the door jam. Come on, how can they not repair these things in a resort! The knobs on the closet door were disgustingly dirty as was the telephone. Yuk! My sisterâ€™s room had a iron burn mark in the rug. The entire room is not carpeted, just around the beds. Can they not afford to replace this? As others said, the elevators did smell like fish. The bar lounge smelled funny too. I might expect a bathroom like this if I picked a slum area motel that rents by the month to homeless but not from a resort. I was supposed to be on vacation for heavenâ€™s sake! The resort fee package I paid was a waste because of the dirtiness of the room I could not bring myself to use the coffee maker. Maid service never brought new glasses when they would clean, they just left the used ones on the sink. They leave water on the sink but that is not included in the fee you pay. They charge extra if you drink those. There was an area where they had cut out a big square in the wallpaper and then tried to glue it back on but it was coming unglued around the edges. While at the hotel we did over hear a number of other guests complaining to the front desk about numerous problems. Now Iâ€™ll tell you what was good just incase for some insane reason you still want to stay here. The resort is very pretty. Lovely tropical plants, golf course and beach. The lobby was very nice. You can tell when this place was first built it was really nice. The decorating in the hallways and elevator were really neat and Hawaiian. There is an excellent place to snorkel in front of the Sheraton next door. The staff was nice enough. Views out the balcony were great! It is just a shame that they have let other things run down so badly. When in the sleeping part of the room away from the bathroom, it was nice as long as you donâ€™t notice how grimey the phone is. We had no complaints about the pool or beach. Breakfast buffet was just ok. It is not bad for one day or maybe two but I would not want you to commit to eating it everyday of your stay. The dinning room was nice. I read the mixed reviews before I went and wish I would have listened to the warnings! We are used to staying in Howard Johnsons and Best Western types so I am not a Hotel Snob. But the rest of it did not make up for the filthy, gross, bathrooms. Stay somewhere else! Be sure to do the road to Hana. Get some kind of a guide when you do. We had the Hawaii for Dummies book and it told you exactly where to stop to get out of your car and walk a very short ways to see waterfalls. You can swim in them and it is neat experience. There is also a black sand beach at a park that starts with a "W" I don't remember the name at about 32 miles in that was really beautiful! Kobe's in lahaina was great for dinner. Better to make reservations though. Snorkeling at Molikini is Great! It is expensive though so if you want to save money the snorkeling infront of the Sheraton at Kaanapali beach is really really good too (free). If you do go to Hawaii, have a fantastic trip!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time on Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow. Just returned from a three day stay at Royal Lahaina Resort in Maui (7/15 - 7/18). First of all - when most hotels say "partial ocean view" you generally have to crane your neck to see a slice of water. Our room (1002) at Royal Lahaina featured what I'd consider to be almost a full ocean view with gorgeous Molokai and Lanai. Excellent pool and beach area, a very nice breakfast/lunch service restaurant (Didn't do dinner there, so can't evaluate) . Yes, the rooms weren't "super deluxe" - and needed a touch of paint and perhaps no charge for coffee - but for the location, and amenities, it was worth it all. Nice job to the staff for clean rooms and courtesy. The luau was a lot of fun as well. Look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Resort”
Reviews.Author: rltga
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our trip to Maui and enjoyed our stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort. I have no complaints on the resort... contrary to some other postings, and we found the staff to be courteous and friendly and resort to be great. While not a Sheraton, it had its own charm and the location was excellent. The beach was clean and right by the resort. The restaurants were great, and even accomodated us after normal closing on the day we arrived. Parking was tight due to the luau's held there every day, so you sometimes had to walk a ways to get to the hotel lobby. The luau was good but I recommend you go to one of the others off site. The tour operators had booths in the lobby and were always eager to support your needs. Plenty of tours to take if you want to, and prices were reasonable. Took the road trip to Hana and found it to be fantastic. You need to start early though and watch the road if you are driving. Several good spots to get off to take pictures and to get snacks. The banana bread at some of the stops was GREAT! Ate lunch at Hana, found it reasonable. Get a good map to find key locations and mark it ahead of time. Try to be out by sunset as the driving after dark is rough and the roads narrow. As they advertise, lots of one lane bridges, hills and some drivers were going too fast for conditions... Went to Molokai on a day trip and had a great time. Also went snorkeling... the waters were great. The airport was busy... need to get their ~2 hours before your flight. We had a minor problem with our connecting flight and were not told the airline was not in the main terminal. Aloha Island Airlines is about a 10 minute walk... Make sure you have the right airline if you are going on to Oahu. Our travel agent messed this up on us. Rental cars were no problem, but gas is high. Paid ~ $2.70 gal. Lots of great restaurants... enjoyed Mama's Fish House the best. Also liked several in Lahaina. Our room was neat and clean, and on the 6th floor. Recommend at least the 4th floor or higher to get a good view of the ocean. I opted not to go all inclusive and found was best since we were out on the island during the day. Would have no problem going back... and in fact my wife and I miss it already. It was so peaceful and quiet there. Took the sunrise trip to Haleaka... 2 AM is just too early but my wife wanted to see it. It was cold ~ 40 degrees, so bring a jacket and gloves. Once the sun came up, it warmed up fast. Took over 500 pictures while I was there with my digital camera... didn't realize it was so many until I got home. Take a close look at helicopter tours before you decide. We went with Sunshine and were a little disappointed we did not get to see a lot of spots shown in their ad. I thought it was too expensive for what we saw and the pilot was not much for narrating the trip. Also, the video they made for us was not free as advertised on TV there, it was $20 and not worth it. Hope this helps you in your planning and hope you enjoy your trip to Maui. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Lousy place for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a dissappointment! We have traveled the USA, Mexico, Europe, Middle East and have never been so unpleasantly surprised on a trip touted to be so great. The staff at the Royal Lahaina actually argued with us about various requests. Like the extra suitecase stand. It took us a whole day to get that. They argued about breakfast and dinner seating. It took us a day to get a "privacy" sign for outside our door. It was gone that afternoon and not replaced. Another surprise was the parking fees for our rental car. It was $9 a day basic, or $12 a day including in room coffee every day and the use of a safe. The bar didn't open up until 1130 am. There were no pool side waitresses or waiters, and no waitressess oceanside. There is no air conditioning used in the hallways upstairs outside your room. It smells musty and damp. The creaky, slow and hot (no a/c) elevators smelled like old dead fish. The highly touted breakfest buffet was just terrible. The limited choices of a pan of scrambled, gooey eggs, hash browns and bacon were mostly served cold. The dinners were not bad. The service was ok, and the food, mostly fish dishes were well prepared. This was somewhat tempered with the incident that one of the waitresses was observed by me to be wiping each knife, fork and spoon with her bare hands before wrapping the setting up into a cloth napkin for the day's use. Royal Lahaina's hotel staff's service reminds me of hotels behind the Iron Curtain before the fall of the Soviet Union - how retro!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came back from vacation about three weeks ago from Maui, Hawaii. We stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort. All of the people we dealt with were very courteous and helped us any way they could. Even though this is an older hotel, we found the rooms had a cozy touch with the way the rooms were decorated. The food we ate was very good and the luai put on by the hotel was very entertaining. We would have no problems coming back to this hotel to stay another time.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at the Royal Lahaina Resort on June 17th and 18th before moving to a home we rented in Haiku and then on to the Kea Lani for my honeymoon. My family was greeted by two bellman before we even exited our cars. They took our baggage out of the car and it was delivered to our room before we were finished checking in. Check in was quick and we were offered an upgrade to a room with an oceanview. The view was breathtaking and we were impressed, especially since there are so many negative reviews on this site. The staff was always friendly and very helpful. I have traveled all over Maui and the beach at the resort is by far the most serene and beautiful I have been to. We enjoyed the pool directly in front of the rest. and loved the tropical drink bar near the pool. We had breakfast on the terrace on the first morning and were treated to an excellant breakfast along with great service. I have no doubt that people have experienced bad situations at this resort, but that can be said for any resort or hotel, regardless of the hotel class. Maui is an amazing place to visit, go with a positive mind and don't worry so much about the small details.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Royal Lahaina!”
Reviews.Author: HighCNote
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina from June 23rd - 25th. We were just looking for an inexpensive way to stay in the Kaanapali beach area. I told my husband that from the reviews I had read - we were probably staying in a "dump". I can't tell you how relieved we were to drive up to a very attractive resort. The lobby area is very open and relaxing. The ocean view from the Sunset Terrace is beautiful. You can grab a Mai Tai at the bar and head straight for one of the pools or beach area. Snorkel and scuba gear can be rented right by the pool within walking distance of a coral reef that has many beautiful fish. Our room was fresh and clean with a balcony overlooking palm trees and the beach. The staff was wonderful. Our maid Cora even took extra care to get us some king size, foam pillows after we mentioned that the one's we used the previous night were small. The only drawbacks - check in was slow - there was quite a line. Also - the bathrooms could use some renovation. However - for the price and location - you can't beat this place!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkJetsetta
Reviews.Content: royal lahaina is a nice comfortable and affordable place to stay in maui. I was there in september 2002 and I am going back this sept 2004. It is great for a inexpensive hotel choice with good amenities. I would not stay there on my honeymoon but for traveling with a friend or boyfriend its not bad. The parking system needs to be worked around sometimes you have to park far up the hill late at night and walk down a bit but after drinking and eating thats my exercise for the week! All and all the hotel isnt a dump and i would stay there again and again just for the great price to be on kannapali beach. Service is good only ate breakfast there and maybe a few drinks! I like to go out and explore maui but for sleeping there and going to the beach and pool its great! Dont be scared! the price is right and being a new yorker I know how expensive things can be! go ahead book the royal lahaina you'll be satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst experiences in my life. Horrible service staff, outdated rooms and bad food. This hotel needs a major overhaul. Don't stay here..unless you think staying at a Motel 6 is a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: DanHerndon
Reviews.Content: We vacationed at the Royal Lahaina June 17th - 24th, We stayed in Cottage "L" which was just behind the ocean front cottages we were about 50 yards from the beach, each cottage has a patio with a table and chairs and a couple of lounge chairs. I would highly recommend trying for one of the cottage rooms if you stay at this hotel. The only thing that was a bit annoying is that the sprinklers that came on at 4 am and the birds outside that wake you up at 6am, but after the first night we got used to it and didn't really bother us too much. The beach is EXCELLENT... if you're into snorkeling go to the southern end by the rocks, Black Rock is around the corner, there are many fish here try to get up early around 6 am this is the best time, this is a good spot for kids to snorkel but be careful if you go past the point there are some strong currents. Oh and there are some small Barracuda that hang out there... don't worry they're friendly. I enjoyed snorkeling here more than I did at Molokini. The poolside lounge had good burgers, but the TAP beer was a bit warm for my taste... go for the bottled much colder. There is a free shuttle that goes to Whalers Village. We went to the Luau one night it was a bit crowded but the food was good! Overall we had a great time, the hotel grounds are beautiful, and the lobby has a great old Hawaii feel to it, everyone was friendly and helpful. We would stay here again! Just as a recommendation try the sunset cocktail cruise on the Kapalua Kai it leaves from the beach in front of Lelani's at Whalers Village.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last two days of our Maui trip in early June. We ended up getting a cottage, which we loved. The bathroom was huge and room comfortable. The pool is rt. in front of the ocean. Sure, things are a little older, but it adds character to the place. We love the show and food at the Luau! Parking can be far, but a good walk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina for 5 nights in June 2004. We found the hotel and room to be very comfortable. Our partial ocean view room in the Tower bldg was incredible. I was somewhat anxious about the hotel after reading some of the reviews, but was very pleasantly surprised. We found the staff to be friendly, shops on the premises were nice, breakfast buffet was great, location on the beach was perfect. I've stayed at The Whaler before which was beautiful, but for the amount of money we saved staying at the RL, my family of 4 was perfectly pleased. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved athe Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: petlover86322
Reviews.Content: We loved the Royal Lahaina. We stayed there from June 3 to June 15th. The grounds are really beautiful, and we stayed in one of the cottages. We thought all the people working there were very helpful and friendly. We even had our air conditioner worked on at 10pm, and it was fixed very fast. The person who serviced our room was named Lilian, and she did a great job and was a very sweet woman. I read all the reviews before I left, and was a bit reluctant about going there, but I am sure glad we gave the place a chance because it it great, and we would certainly stay there again. Also, we did not have any trouble parking, there was always a place to park. We also attended the Luau, and it was the best food we ever had at a Luau. You can also walk to Black Rock beach to snorkel, which is one of the best places to snorkel, it is only abaout a 10 minute walk. I can not say enough good things about the Royal Lahaina, I don't understand why people have given it bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews 2 days before departing and like many readers panicked and called my travel agent to switch hotels. He advised to give it 1 night and I'm glad we did. We stayed for the full 7 nights in early June. The RL was not bad at all, we did not find many of the complaints of the other guests (the only valid one was the thin walls, one night our neighbors must have been doing sunrise at haleakala because they were up at 3am and so were we - had a connecting room and we complained the next morning, got a bottle of champagne the next day from management). We stayed in the main tower rm 6024 and had a beautiful ocean view and the room was very adequate. I would say for the price this hotel is a great value and I'd advise anyone to give it a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Hotel”
Reviews.Author: I~Love~J~C~2
Reviews.Content: Don't Panic People! This is not as bad a place as so many people have made it out to be~...Our stay was from May 31st until June 8, 2004... and we had a wonderully relaxing vacation for my 50th birthday... I am a travel agent for the State of Washington and my husband wanted to plan one for a change! HE DID and I was worried about the property at first...I couldn't change the reservations or he would have been cruched...So, I prayed and the Good Lord Blessed Us with a great room....As an agent I must tell you that location and the staff are the most important thing when chosing a hotel on the beach...This hotel has the most beautiful beach in this area of Maui and YES the hotel is aging but it was an upper scale place in it's time. They are working on reconstructing it, and you can not hear them working as they have closed this section off...As soon as you arrive you are greeted by friendly staff...Don't be offended that they ask you to unload you bags and go park before you check-in. It is how they keep the traffic down infront of the lobby and it is for security measures, as well. NO ONE will mess with your bags. Have your wife and/or kid stay there with them if you don't trust them at first. NONE of our things were molested while staying for 8 days. The maids were always attentive (leave them a few bucks a day, spread the wealth~!)...We were on the 8th floor and had a partial view, we could see the ocean and the luau from our balcony. Nice balcony with furniture for the early mornings or late night drink. Coffee maker is provided. Bring your own coffee if you don't want to pay the extra charge for theirs. Parking was full most of the time but never a problem. You need a little walk after eating the gourmet foods of Maui....The Basil and Tomato Restraunt is a great place to walk to on the property if you don't feel like driving. My husband can't sleep laying down because of an accident. The hotel arranged for him to rent a Lazy Boy Chair Much cheaper this way compared to spending another $100.00 per day by having to rent a room with a living room set up. RAC was the company and they were very helpful by sending the brand new chair on time and picking it up when we left. The plumbing is a little slow but remember when you have thousands of people washing sand off their bodies, you are going to have plumbing problems! The pool was nice and right on the beach. Breakfast was good and good price. It isn't the cleanest place in the world but who needs a micro-managed place anyway? If you do then you may want to go to the stuffy hotels that surround the R.L. There are plenty of them but only this one has the laid back feel of Maui! You gotta love that! Aloha and Mahalo for taking the time to read mine! Trust Me!!! SAVE MONEY , Stay here and spend the extra Cash on yourself! MIXED PLATE ALOHA is a great place to eat Coconut fried shrimp...It don't get much better than this...Also, go snorkeling next to the black rock right near the hotel's beach...There are lots of ways to save money if you have a family. Bring a suitcase full of your snack foods, cold cereal, drink boxes, paper products, etc. You can easily save $50.00 per day by doing this and skip eating out once a day. Also, bring your own snorkel gear, bring a guide book so you know the good beach access places and the sites along the road to Hana. Don't forget your jacket for the Top of the Volcano .....Haleakula...I don't know if that is how to spell it....OH WELL> HAVE FUN~!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a major Face-Lift to earn a 3-star rating”
Reviews.Author: EZ2Travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina June 9-12, 2004. NEVER AGAIN! We were excited when we arrived in Maui, but was somewhat apprehensive about the Royal Lahaina Resort. Upon arrival we were told we were upgraded to a full ocean view room, but as it turned out, it was the partial ocean view we booked. Last time I checked, a full ocean view means, "your room faces the ocean and does not overlook other roof-tops". Anyway, we got to our room and turned the AC up full blast, but the room never cooled down. The water pressure was very low, but the toilet worked and so did the faucet, but there was a mildew odor in the room. I must say, for a hotel that was built in 1962, it doesn't deserve the 3-star rating. It DOES NOT compare in any way to a 3-star hotel like Holiday Inn/Express, Hampton Inn, AmeriSuites, DoubleTree, and even the Embassy Suites (those are all 3-star rated hotels). The Royal Lahaina is more like a 2-star hotel, since it has not been properly renovated and does not deserve any higher rating. On a positive note, it has some possibilities, but only if the owners invest some $$$$ and gut the bathrooms first. Get rid of that crappy tile that collects mildew and bacteria. We also went to the Luau for a pre-wedding dinner. The food could have been a lot better for the price. I was so dissapointed in the fish and the teriyaki steak was tough as leather. However, the pork and cake were delicious and so were the drinks. We would NOT stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Where there's smoke....”
Reviews.Author: Angie010
Reviews.Content: BELIEVE the rotten reviews!!! All of these people who have taken the time to write them are really trying to spread the word. I stayed at the Royal Lahaina June 1-8 and I wish that I had heeded the warnings. This place is just a waste of beautiful space! I expected old and run down, which it was, but I didn't expect (nor appreciate!) the extremely rude and disinterested staff. Whenever I had to make an inquiry, or ask a question they either a) ignored me, b) pretended not to speak English, or c) asked "what do you expect me to do" (yes, someone really said that) The beach is beautiful and not crowded, but the complaints about the rooms are all true. It was dingy, old, musty, air conditioner worked half-time, shower was mildewed with no water pressure, and on and on. Yes, we just slept here, but I really like to sleep with BOTH eyes closed, not with one open to make sure that rotting ceiling tile doesn't cave in! Again, the staff is my biggest complaint. They are horrendous. In addition to all of the "charges" for staying here (that are really ludicrous as others have mentioned) they did not honor their advertisment of "kids eat free with adult". Every time that we ate at one of their restaurants I was charged for my child. Every time, it took numerous requests and finally manager assistance (who actually ROLLED his eyes at me for even asking) to correct the mistake. The buffet breakfast was just so-so, watery eggs, bacon and some muffins. Oh, and pineapple and watered down juice. I recommend not taking the $99 breakfast deal they offer. For one thing, the deal is supposed to include 2 dinners and $50 drink credit "anywhere on the property". At checkout I was informed none of my beverages counted for the drink credit because it was only during the dinner hour at the hotel restaurant! (Even though we asked before using our beverage/meal plan card at each place we bought drinks!! And the people took the card without telling us it wasn't valid there!!!) As for the 2 "dinners" I ate with a companion one night, used my "meal card" when the check came, BUT at check out guess what? I ended up having to pay full price for one of my dinners (a $21.95 pasta dish, yeah right!!) because they used one of my free dinners as my companion's that night!! He had the $9.95 chicken, did not have a meal plan AT ALL at that hotel and no amount of explaining to the staff at the desk or in the restaurant helped. They would not take his dinner off my meal plan. If you want a similar-priced hotel, we checked out the Kaanapali Beach Hotel briefly and it looked somewhat better, and the Maui Kaanapali Villas next door to the Royal Lahaina actually was quite nice. We ate at their restaurant once and it had good food, priced fair, and the staff were great also!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fortier2024
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina from May 31 to June 6th and are whole party was upgraded to the cottages. We were a big group there for a wedding and found that the cottages were charming. Yes the hotel is dated and older but it's comfortable, quiet and close to the beach. The rooms are clean but somewhat older, there were some small bugs that come from outdoors but it's Hawaii a tropical climate and in the cottages you are closer to nature. It's not a big deal. It was humid so there was a mustiness to the room but it went away after awhile once the air conditioning was on. Others that had certain problems with their rooms were immediately responded to, the hotel will change anything that doesn't work well. Everything in Hawaii is expensive so paying for parking shouldn't be a surprise, just make sure to inform yourself about the little charges like for coffee in your room. Just go to the Emporium, a store right beside the lobby and buy your own coffee to brew in your room which is what alot of us did. Some in our group found the parking lot too small, the Luau that takes place there takes up alot of the spots so just don't arrive too late or you'll be parking very far. You are close to Whaler's village and Lahaina, they were fun places to visit and have great restaurants. The Mixed Plate was a good inexpensive place to eat and the Lahaina Fish Co. was fabulous, it's right on the water. At the hotel, the breakfast buffet is extensive and the "Happy Hour" is fun with live muscians playing. The beach is beautiful and not crowded, bring your snorkeling gear and go early it's fantastic. I would definitely stay here again, it was a restful and relaxing place. Stay in the cottages, it's definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “adorable hales!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Personally, I thought the RL was great. the hale we stayed in was pretty and comfortable. the staff were nice, they even put fresh cut flowers in our room. the beach was awesome and the hotel was just a short drive from everything. the food was good too. the views were spectacular. beautiful beach, sky, and water. I thought the atmosphere was relaxing, clean, and welcoming. the little shops were a bit overpriced, as is everything on the island, but they had a good selection of cool items. our baggage was taken right from our car as we pulled up and even though our room was not available at the time of check-in, the staff cleared up the discrepency in a reasonable time frame. my husband and I traveled over 5,000 miles to get there and would do it again in a heart-beat.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We also read the negative reviews and were a bit apprehensive about staying @ the Royal Lahaina on Maui. We stayed on the 12th floor and had a great view of the beach. We weren't facing diectly west so we didn't have to deal with the afternoon sun. Now, we did hear some negative comments about the "cottages" while we were there, but our room was neat and clean and maid service was terrific. I brought along some coffee "bags", (single serving) so didn't have to pay the $3.00 per day coffee fee... The food @ the restaurant was very good, snorkeling 900 yards up the beach was great. We had reservations to go the the Old Lahiana Luau, then an accident and traffic tie up caused it to be canceled. We were able to go to the Royal Lahiana Luau the next evening and had the best time. Both the food and entertainment was very good and it was about $60.00 less for both of us.. All in all, the people were friendly, we always found a parking spot and the only recommendation I would have for the hotel is to fix up the Tennis Club area. That does need some work.

Reviews.Title: “a great visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three island visit and wanted to comment on the Royal Lahaina. Having read the reviews before our visit, we were very concerned before we arrived, but were pleasantly surprised. Our room was bright, spacious and clean and the hotel staff were helpful and most friendly. The beach and surrounding grounds were beautiful and made for a great holiday. We would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about staying at the RL due to the negative reviews. Upon arriving we found that the grounds were well kept and the staff was very welcoming. The rooms are old but very comfortable. It is a decent room for a great price. The location is perfect, it is right on Kaanapali beach (aka the best beach in Maui), a ten minute walk to whaler's village and a five minute drive to Lahaina. The beach is unpopulated with great snorkeling spots including black rock. We always found parking regardless of time. I loved the location, the hawaiian decor and the genereous staff. Most importantly, I loved the price, it was such a deal to stay in kaanapali at such a great rate. If you're going to Maui don't let anything bring you down especially trivial things like an old room, worn carpets etc... You're in Maui! Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyergold52
Reviews.Content: stayed for three days in April 2004 Got a screaming deal through travelzoo which included a car and breakfast buffet. The hotel is older. Room and furniture is dated, but very pleasant nonetheless. The beach is awesome. Had a partial ocean view which was wonderful. My friend had the same deal and could barely see the ocean at all from his balcony. Complained and was moved to a better location immediately. The breakfast buffet is wonderful. Georgeous setting looking out on the grounds and ocean with nice decore--wide food selection. Get there early, the lines build. I really enjoyed my stay. As others have mentioned--parking is rediculous. After about 8 pm it took a long time to find a place to park. Visit the whaler's museum down the road at whaler village if you have a chance--free and extremely interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reaction”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK Hotel, older but still has character and class. Some things need major updating. Parking was a chore - too many tourist rental cars and not enough spots. Food was great, staff was pleasant, it has a beautiful beach and it's convenient to a lot of the local activites. Reasonable rates, ours included buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Second class”
Reviews.Author: bavon
Reviews.Content: First room was dirty; a/c didn't work and fan made a racket. At our insistence, we were moved to a waterfront cottage at an additional cost/day. Location was wonderful; room was worn and carpet stained. Everything about this place was mediocre. The staff was reactive and disinterested. Basically, it's a money machine that is run down, dirty and second class. Spend the money and book better accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Resort - Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from another trip to Maui and this review is long overdue. I felt an urgency to write and share with all the wonderful experience my husband and I have had while staying at the Royal Lahaina Resort. In the past 20 years, we have taken many trips to Maui and have stayed at several different establishments. None surpass the standards, courtesy and warm Aloha of the Royal Lahaina Resort. They have a great variety of rooms that would accommodate anyone, including suites and cottages. The wide range of services cover everything (in-room meal service, massage by the ocean, scuba-diving, sunset cruises). It's a guarantee that their knowledgable staff will steer you in the right direction towards a "vacation of a lifetime". Most important to us, is the professional, personal, friendly service delivered by every one of the staff. Because there is such low turnover with the employees, the staff remembers and welcomes you, by name, year after year. There really isn't a better start to a great vacation. We won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing! We will never stay here again and we will warn everyone else to stay away too. The hotel is very run down, the staff are rude and unhelpful, they charge for EVERYTHING (even the bad in-room coffee packet) and the food is awful and over-priced. My shoes were stolen from outside our room and I could not get any staff to return my calls or talk to me in person (I was told to call lost and found even though they were stolen). The only positive thing about the hotel is the beach it sits on - beautiful and not crowded.

Reviews.Title: “We loved everything about this resort =)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 8 days for our honeymoon before we got married and it was excellent. The service was great. We didn't want to leave ever, but we did just to shop at all the nearby stores. We didn't have any problems even though it was both our first time in Maui. It was nicer than the hotels in our hometown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Awesome Beach!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Maui, so everything was new to us!! We were very pleased with everything!! The rooms are older, but give me a break, your not their to stay in the room. The service was perfect. We saved alot of money by staying there and got to do alot more things. The beach outside our balcony was a view to die for!!! I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Royal Lahaina yesterday. We stayed for a week and never had any problems. It was clean, comfortable, and everyone was friendly. The view from our room was beautiful...the beach, the ocean, the palm trees... We stayed in the "Tower" and couldn't hear the Luau, only the ocean. Yes, the decor is a little dated, but for the money you save, well worth the price. There is an extra charge for parking, but factor that in to the price and your still paying less than you would at the other major resorts in the area. One of the on-site restaurants, "Basil Tomatoes" serves excellent italian food! If money is no object to you, I'm sure you could find a nicer place to stay. If you're on a budget, the Royal Lahaina is a nice resort in a great location with a beautiful beach just a few feet away.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were upgraded to a cabin with no extra charge and no imput on our part. Very large and roomy. Cleaning service was good and prompt. Cockroaches are normal if you live in the south and not a hazard just funky. Ocassional sighting is all that was seen. Lack of recreational and exercise type rooms needed. Beach adequate along with pool.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, fantastic location, but not the highest quality.”
Reviews.Author: DrHickenlocher
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina seems like it was one of the best resorts in all of Kaanapali... about 15 years ago. And they really haven't done anything about it since then. They've kept up maintenance so that things mostly don't go wrong. No problems with water pressure or other maintenance issues. Most of the bad reviews I've read have all been about the Hale building anyways. I was 11th Floor Ocean Front Tower, and the view was amazing!!! I read that hotels nowadays aren't even allowed to build above 10 floors anymore, so we really had a class-AAA view. Everything else about the hotel was... okay. Not bad. Not great. But then you could say that about the price I was paying, just in the middle. I mean, it's quite obvious to tell that it's an old hotel. But the room was clean, no bugs or mildew. The bed wasn't new, but it wasn't a hard rock either. Everything about it screams middle-level hotel. And it does have that "authentic" Maui charm. =)

Reviews.Title: “Lighten Up People... You're In Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our 4 day adventure to Maui. When we arrived it was raining and we realized that it was Maui, so "No Worries". We had read a lot of the reviews of the RL and I guess the only thing I can say is "Lighten UP" people. Our stay was very enjoyable and we loved all that the RL had to offer. Yes, the Luau was a little loud at times, but it's Maui, relax, at least it wasn't sirens. We have a condo in Kihei, and frequent Maui often, and we will recommend to those who can to try RL. What a great place to get away, relax and let the sun shine in!! I just think people need to lighten up and quit being so icky about the little things and find the blessings in each experience. Pay more, get more. Pay less and have more to spend on the other groovie things Maui has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “NOT at all what I expected ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a six night stay at the RL. I read ALL the reviews before I left and was SCARED TO DEATH! RL is NOT NOT NOT near as bad as the reviews make it seem. First of all ... you are in MAUI ... so relax. No, RL is not the Ritz Carlton, it does not claim to be the Ritz Carlton and you are NOT paying Ritz Carlton prices ... so, do NOT expect the Ritz or you will be let down. We stayed in an oceanfront cottage room and really enjoyed our stay. Yes, it is older and yes, it could use some renovations. However, the service was great, the view was amazing, the beach is really nice (all the surrounding resort beaches are just as narrow). We also had some bugs in our room BUT we were right on the beach ... so, I would expect a bug or two (we called the front desk and within 5 minutes someone came and sprayed and the issue was resolved). We cannot speak for the tour rooms ... but, if you hve the extra money ... the oceanfront cottage views are amazing! Please do not get nervous when you read all the negative reviews ... it is Maui ... enjoy yourselves and do not let a room's decor deter you from having fun in the most beautiful place on earth!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: dustin747
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 9034. Cost was 1947.00 which inclued buffet breakfest which was fantastic. Buffet is 12.50 a person other wise. Room was very clean beautiful view, it was an ocean front room Kai tower. Hotel is very well kept up. beautiful beach comfortable lawn chairs. Beach lit up at night. Pools clean. Towels free get at small pool. Employees were very very friendly. Parking no problem. You pay at any hotel you stay at. Very nice grounds, very well kept up. Beautiful sunsets. Drinks 5.00 at happy hour. Water pressure great, nice shower, no tub worked great. Plenty of storage for clothes, big closet, 6 dresser drawers. Good tv. 2 big comfortable chairs to sit in. Bed small because we are use to king bed had a queen. Pools were nice and clean. They clean every morning. Waves splashing all night, we left door open a little with screen shut. Air conditioning works good. Saw lots of whales from balcony. Burgers served pollside with chips or fruit 8.75. No big sign for the hotel on hwy 30 turn left on kekka drive just past big kanopoli sign. Staff was great very freindly. You can set up any tour from hotel. We were at other hotels and we had the best beach and view. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You knew you were doing Maui on the cheap...”
Reviews.Author: CCarkeek
Reviews.Content: I think that the bad reviews are unfair....you should have known not to expect luxury at this price! A lot of the comments are in fact true, it's not the newest or the squeaky cleanest hotel around, and it's definitely a long haul from the parking lot to the room, but again....I was on a budget! I didn't complain! They drive you in a golf cart to unload and reload your luggage, and I imagine if you call for a ride any other time they'd be right over. Everyone is super nice. Maybe we just got lucky with our particular room, but I very much enjoyed it! We stayed in a cottage that was so close to the beach we easily ran back and forth from beach to room. Itâ€™s right on the golf course too so it was nice to get up in the morning for a jog on the paved trail along the beach and through the golf course. It was our first trip to Maui and we arrived 2 days too early to check into the time share where we were staying for free with friends. Of course the nights in the time share were immeasurably nicer, but I could never have afforded that type of place on my own. We all get to enjoy the same beautiful beach whether we pay $100 or $300+ for a room. We didn't go to the luau or eat in the restaurant so I can't comment on that, I just want to say that if you are like me and just looking for a place to wash off the sand and sleep, this place is for you. We have the same situation next year and will be staying our first 2 nights at Royal Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews the day before we flew to Maui. I was scared to say the least. I tried my best to get another hotel - but at the last moment it was not really feasible. So there we went. We had the garden View room. they immediately upgraded us to a Ocean View room. The view from the room balcony was awesome - a really nice view of the sea- and that of the mountains. The room was clean and the bathroom decent. We stayed on the 9th floor and got to see neither ants nor cockroaches as some other reviewers did. But keep in mind we have lived in the tropics before and know that food left open outside spoils and/or attracts ants/roaches. We did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment about the food there. the pools were decent as was the beach. All in all i would say it was a good value for money. However I can see how folks put up at the Royal Hale might be upset about stuff- we were in the main tower. Would I stay there again - well yes if I got the same/similar room.

Reviews.Title: “An opinion from the UK”
Reviews.Author: ceramica
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before we went to the Royal Lahaina Resort and was slightly concerned about the accommodation there. However we were pleasantly surprised. Our booking agent had requested a sea view high floor room and we found it comfortable with lovely views over the sea, mountains and gardens. We were also pleased to be able to watch the whales passing from our balcony. We did not find the 12 dollar charge a night outrageous and thought the in room safe was the best we had ever used. Yes, the decor was a bit outdated but everything worked well and we were pleased with our room amenities. Maybe because we are British we do not expect quite as much as Americans do. For example We would have been quite happy without a television - who needs a television on holiday. We didn't have any trouble parking our car. We might have had to walk a little way to the hotel but there were always spaces. We thought the buffet was excellent - it was much better than the one at a better hotel in Hawaii (our next port of call). The staff were very helpful and everything was reasonably priced. The pool was clean and the beach was very pleasant and the gardens well tended. I think because the hotel was older it had more character and wasn't as boxy as some of the other hotels we saw. We went to Whaler's Shopping Centre one night. It was a terrible place, packed with people and full of awful hotels and terrible restaurants. Lahaina had much more atmosphere and we thoroughly enjoyed our evening meal at the Cool Cat Club. If you drive down Prison Road there is free parking for 3 hours. We found we didn't need to eat any lunch as the breakfast buffet was so vast. We did find it slightly odd having cakes for breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “We are pretty sure that Elvis stayed here at some point”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We, Please pay attention to all the other write up's We didn't and payed for it. Everything everybody has said is true. BUT If you don't care where you sleep, just a bed. This is the place for you. We checked in, opened the door and grabbed the phone book to find another place. All full They did offer to put us in a condo for another $168 per night. NOT. stay elsewhere if you can afford it

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for me”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our honeymoon. This is a great old hotel. Very affordable for your first time in Hawaii. The pool was nothing special. but the beach was great and the gardens were nice and the room was just as pictured. It is a great place for the money. And the rates were even better. And it is not that far from the restaurants. Actually we walked there almost every night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't honeymoon here”
Reviews.Author: Bobbbb
Reviews.Content: I don't know what was worse, the clogged sink, the burned out bathroom light or the vent that dripped water right onto my wife in bed at night. I never got the feeling the staff much cared about our concerns either, right from the moment we stepped in. We told them we were honeymooners when we checked in, and they said they'd upgrade our room from partial ocean view to ocean view. But when we got to the room, there was no ocean in sight. Plus the sheets were unmade and the towels dirty. When I phoned to say we had no ocean view, the woman on the line decided to argue with me rather than acquiesce. (It seems "ocean view" in their eyes means only that it is possible, if you try real hard, to see the ocean from the room. You are not "ocean front" which most people would be expecting.) We had to go back down to the desk with our bags, and the patient bell man, to get a new room. This one had a better view (if you stepped outside on the balcony and craned you could see the ocean) and clean sheets, but the sink, we soon discovered was clogged. And very soon the bathroom light died. That night my wife couldn't sleep after the air conditioner vent above our bed began dripping water on her. Breakfast was served in a very hot, muggy dining room. The meal featured sloppy, runny scrambled eggs. OK, so we knew we weren't booking luxury, but I've stayed in cheap motels with better facilities and service. So don't expect much from the Royal Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Royal La-Heinous, Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you can afford the extra $$ at all, and are dead set on staying in Ka'anapali beach, book a stay at a resort other than the Royal Lahaina. Before my trip, I tried to do as much research as possible about the hotels in the area. The first sign that the hotel may not be "up to par" was that it did not have a website. I thought... "how could a 'resort' on one of the nicest beaches in Hawaii not have a website of its own to boast its amenities???". The second sign of negativity was the many reviews on this website indicating that the hotel was in need of renovation, the service was mediocre, the parking was bad... yadda, yadda, yadda. All are true. From my experience, this hotel was terrible. I travel quite often for work and pleasure and stay at hotels ranging from the Hampton Inn and Courtyard Marriot all the way to Sheraton Grand or Westin types. Let's just say that the Royal Lahaina will have trouble competing with most Courtyard Marriots and many Hampton Inns if they were sitting on Ka'anapaali Beach. If you're not dead set on that area and would like to save $$, I would highly suggest, as an alternative to the Royal Lahaina, looking down towards Kihei, where some of the hotels are less expensive and the beach area are quite nice also. Plus you would be near (within 10 min. drive from Kihei) of other nice beaches such as Wailea and Makena.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina fine with us.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter ( 15 years old ) were at the Royal Lahaina from March 21 thru March 25. After reading many negative reviews I was somewhat uneasy about the choice my travel agent had made for us. But upon arrival I was pleasantly relieved. Don't get me wrong, the Royal Lahaina does show it's age. We were booked into a oceanview room on the 10th floor with a fine view of the ocean, mountains and golf course. The room was comfortable, but the bathroom could have used a little paint. Obviously due to the age of the resort you won't find all the bells and whistles of the nearby hotels and resorts, but who cares. You get what you pay for and believe me everything you need is at hand. I didn't pay thousands of dollars to spend five days in my hotel. Is that your plan while on Maui? I recommend you give the Royal Lahaina a try. You'll save a few bucks and not miss out on much at all.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 10 days during our honeymoon. Its not a terrible place, but the owners need to invest some cash to upgrade the place. First impessions were ok, we had a bit of trouble finding it because there is no actual sign in front stating "Royal Lahaina Resort", so we spent a few minutes figuring out where to pull up. The lobby was open and spacious, check in was easy, and a bellboy graciously helped us get to our room in the 'royal hale' building (not the tower). Our room was on the 2nd out of 3 floors. I was worried about the fact that the door had a regular key lock and not a key card - not very secure. The room was slightly larger that we were expecting - about 300 sf or so with a bathroom sink area separated by a semi wall, commode/shower niche (no bath tub) separated by an old sliding door which did not provide much privacy and a patio with enough room for a couple chairs and a small table. There was also another sink in the room and a small refrigerator. Other decor was basic with a dresser, table, 19 inch tv(with about 8 channels) and 2 full size beds and a love seat couch. I would consider a microwave to be essential for any one staying in Maui for any legnth of time given the expense of food, we didn't have one. The room was fairly clean with the exception of clearly visible foot prints on the wall where some one layed on the bed with their feet on the wall. The rest of the hotel includes a resaurant/ bar overlooking a basic rectangular pool, several small stores in an outside area, and an outside luau area which we didn't go to. We also didn't eat at the restaurant as we thought it was very expensive ($16 for chicken for instance, more for anything else). There is also tennis courts and a laundry room to wash your clothes for $5 a load including soap. Royal Lahaina also has cottages reviewed by others. The beach is right off the hotel. It is sort of narrow, but not too bad, and there is a wider beach a 10 minute walk away. The beach drops off steeply so the waves can break kinda hard - not suitable for small children to play near the water. Its nothing like Cresant or Daytona beaches. Back to the room, my biggest of 2 complaints is that the walls are VERY thin. Also, if some one sits or moves on the bed in the next room, it shakes the thin wall - the beds are attached to the wall. So if some one's rugrat is jumping on the bed in the next room, its more than annoying. Also, as mentioned by a previous reviewer, there are alot of charges at this hotel. A 2 cup packet of coffee is $3 a day, the safe was $3.75 or so, and parking is like $7 or 8, so you can get a package deal for $14 or something. We thought that was very chintzy - never paid for daily coffee at any other hotel. It certainly adds up. To make outside calls is also expensive - bring your cellphone, our Sprint phones worked fine with no roaming. Also, room service forgot to leave us the coffee (we had already payed for via the package deal) and wash cloths 2 days in a row, we mentioned it to the manager and it was promptly taken care of. Another thing which should be mentioned is that the hotel places a $50 charge per day as a deposit on your credit card as a pending transaction. This was not told to us by the hotel before hand. Additionally, the parking lot can get jammed up and you might have to park quite a ways from your room. To wrap it up, I'd say this hotel was OK - nothing fancy. Next time I'd try to find different accomidations. My last piece of advice is not to book daily excursions through the hotel, grab the flyers and call directly, you can probably do things cheaper that way. Need more? go ahead and email me.

Reviews.Title: “Dont let the BAD news scare you”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had read good and bad about the Royal. So needless to say we were hesitant when we pulled up to check in on a rainy Sat nite. We are glad we chose the Lahaina. If you are looking for a "new" hotel with all the glitz and glitter..go somewhere else but if you want the seclusion and good service(and affordable) stay here! Nice staff. It is older..but the rooms were clean and the noise wasnt bad. Food was eatable (lots of other places clsoe by if you dont want to eat there) Great beach and the luau was good for the price and convenience. We got the 12.00 a day resort fee wich covered parking and local calls and the coffee each morning. If it hadnt rained 3 of the 4 days we were there Id have to say we had an excellent stay! But I cant blame the hotel for the weather.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Resort, pleasant stay, small, affordable...beautiful views!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel808
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina Resort was a nice getaway for us. We stayed there for 5 days, 4 nights. Although it was raining for the most part of our stay, we enjoyed it, the view from our room was beautiful! Aside from 'Oahu, Maui is our most favorite island. Friendly people, great scenery, and delicious food. Don't let the poor reviews scare you out of staying here. Yes, the parking costs $9.00 per day, the water pressure comes and goes and the water temperature is anything but constant, however, the hotel does grow on you. Rosario at the front desk and June the manager were very friendly. Let's not forget the excellent job done by our room cleaner Yolanda! If you're the type of people who don't mind going to Foodland or Long's Drugs to pick up your snacks and beverages, you'll love this hotel. If you're the type to stay in and use the amenities provided by the hotel at a nominal fee, it will cost you! The food at the resort is acceptable, nothing to brag about. If you have a car (as most island travelers do) I suggest driving over to Wailea, Kihei, Makawao or Lahaina for your meals. If in Kihei, try eating at Stella Blues for dinner, around there for lunch, eat at the Sports Page (great burgers!). In Wailea, I highly recommend the Maui Prince Hotel's Prince Court restaurant (not open on Tuesdays) and Joe's Restaurant...great service and food! In Makawao, eat at Casanova's...great Italian food! We eat there everytime we go to Maui! In Lahaina, try true fire greats like, Hard Rock Cafe, Longhi's, Bubba Gumps's, Roy's Restaurant, and Hecock's. When we travel, we love to see the places we go to. We hop in the car and go site seeing and hardly stay in the room. We love to rent SUVs and go off roading, great for Maui's unpaved roads. But when we do go back to rest, relax and sleep, it was nice to know that our room would be clean, ready and waiting for us. Our sheets and towels were changed daily, our room vacuumed and cups washed. We left our room cleaner a daily tip...we reward excellent service! Yes, this is not the best resort on the island, it's not the posh Grand Wailea Resort and Spa or Four Seasons but it is quite nice. The staff is friendly, the clientele nice and rates reasonable. What more could you ask for? Not many of us stay in our hotel rooms anyway, we go out, we site see and shop. If you are the type to stay in and enjoy the amenities that the resort has to offer...the Royal Lahaina Resort offers that too! There are shops and restaurants on premises, beach within walking distance, a luau (food is pretty good at the luau), a small pool, a golf course etc... Book an ocean view room, relax and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Narrow beach, and tower is in serious need of renovation.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms are old and have serious maintenance issues, housekeeping is not the best, and staff at the front desk were not the least bit friendly. This hotel is not a good value and is not a convenient location. See my recommendations for other hotels at the bottom of my review. We arrived at the hotel on March 22, 2004 in pouring rain and checked in around 3:45 pm. We waited in line for at least 20 minutes and we were only the third couple in line. When I checked in, I was not offered a parking pass for our rental car so I had to come back for it. Parking is $9/day, with phone calls $1 for the first 20 minutes, including 800 numbers, and use of the in-room safe is $3.75 per day. You can purchase a $12/day package that includes all of these fees, but I still think the charges are a little steep. There is no Weather Channel on hotel's cable, and they do not give free newspapers like some of the other hotels, so if you want to check the weather you have to make a phone call (for $1!) Also, if you put the bottled water in your mini-refrigerator, housekeeping will assume that you drank them and charge you $1.50 per bottle. (Bottles were on the bathroom counter when we checked in.) Some friends of ours did not know this until they checked out and were charged $6 for water they didn't drink. Our first room was on the 12th (top) floor and when we stepped off the elevator there were wastebaskets in the hall in front of our room collecting water. There were two more baskets inside our room. Water was leaking EVERYWHERE! Management was obviously aware of the problem but they gave us the room anyway. When I called the desk to change rooms, the girl who answered was less than polite and never called us back. I tried calling the desk 3 more times but nobody picked it up. Finally the desk manager called to see if we needed something, and we were moved to another room on the 7th floor that was a little larger than the first room, but upon our first use of the bathroom we discovered another leak coming from the room above. At that point, the manager told us that there were several leaking rooms in the hotel and he wasn't sure if he had anything else available. I was so disgusted that we were ready to move to another hotel but were having a hard time finding vacancies. More than 3 hours after we checked in, the manager finally knocked on our door and gave us a dry room on the 9th floor. Dry, but still not worth the price. Paint was peeling in the bathroom, back of the main door was chipped, balcony had cracks running through it, our mattress had seen much better days - I could hardly sleep on it. I slept much better in the plane on the way home than I did on that ancient mattress. Could they at least invest in a pad to put over it so we couldn't feel the springs??? We had a partial ocean view, which was beautiful, but don't plan on going to bed early because the hotel has a luau on the grounds that gets pretty loud. Don't plan on taking a bubble bath! Our tub was only about 3 x 3. I did not have any problems with the water pressure or temperature until our last day, when I could only get lukewarm water out of the shower. I would recommend staying at any of the hotels on the South side of Black Rock rather than the Royal Lahaina. Kaanapali Beach Hotel, Sheraton, Westin Maui, The Whaler - all great beaches. The Royal Lahaina has a narrow beach and there are warning signs about strong current, Man-o-War, and steep dropoffs. The only kids we saw swimming in this area were wearing lifejackets, and even some of the adults were having trouble getting out of the water because of the dropoff and the undertow. The hotels at the other side of Black Rock have much wider sandy beaches, good snorkeling and swimming, and are all walking distance from the shops and hotels at Whalers Village. Most of the rooms at Kaanapali Beach Hotel are recently renovated and are similarly priced to Royal Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Older, but great view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is definitely an older facility: had room keys instead of cards. Small bathrooms, but workable. The only problem was hot water. During your shower you had times where the water would get scalding hot. The room was pretty small, but clean. Resort package was $12.00/day and included parking, coffee-in-room, local calls). They still charged $1.50/bottle if you drank the bottles of water they left in the room. Ala carte you paid $9.00 for parking, $3.75 for coffee and $1.00 each for local calls. We had the package including the option of a menu breakfast or breakfast buffet. Took the breakfast buffet everyday which was great! The pool was ok, but the beach was great and very close. The lounge was hoping every night, although our room just above it so glad they didn't play too late (very noisy even with the patio door closed). The staff was very helpful. Our room was overdue in getting ready for check in so they gave us 2 free Mai Tai's in the lounge. Careful of the Pleasant Holidays Activity Center desk in the lobby. They were very nice and helpful, but we found activities priced much lower going through the "This Week in Maui" books that are available in the airport and many locations. Recommend Boss Frogs for snorkeling/whale watching cruises.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service. Terrible Rooms. $7 Parking!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were old. The bathroom did not work. The TV was broken. We were moved to another room. It was identical. The showers were awful. Everything is old. Everyday we would drive to Kihei or Waleia to get out of that hell hole! On top of everything, they charge you $7 for parking. Not recommended at all!

Reviews.Title: “It grows on you”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful. The room, at first glance, made me want to cry. It is obviously was an old resort, but it grew on us. We had a partial ocean view. We could see all the ocean, mountains, and plenty of the resort. A/C had a neat function. It went off automatically when the balcony door was opened. We had it open alot, the breeze and the sound of the ocean was great. The staff was friendly. The beach and pools were great. We only stayed for 2 nights, but I would have loved to stay longer. Even though the resort is an older one, I would definately stay there again. A little hint: Rent a jeep and drive to Hana, at least once. Stop at a little area where they have a famers market. A little stand outside of it has the friendliest woman that makes the best banana bread ever. Take shoes for hiking, to see the waterfalls, and dramamine if you get motion sickness. The road is very very curvy. It was a great short vacation.

Reviews.Title: “You want Hawaii, then ROYAL LAHAINA RESORT is the place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is our sixth time here, and we always enjoy are stay here. The hotel is one of the older one's in that area, but it has Hawaii written all over it.
