The ocean front rooms have a great view for seeing the whales. and some beautiful sun sets. My daughter had her wedding on the beach at the ROYAL LAHAINA RESORT. They did an excellent job with arranging everything for the wedding. The rooms are nice and comfortable ,checking in and out was no bother. The buffet breakfast was good, the dinner was so so. The beach is great . The service was a little slow, but so what it's Maui lay back and relax(YOU'RE ON VACATION).The people are real friendly(guests and workers). For the price you pay you will not beat it. Mahalo and Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Did not know what to expect in advance of my arrival and was pleasantly surprised. The staff were all very friendly and the rate was good too. Would not hesitate to recommend or return to Royal Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “More plusses than minuses”
Reviews.Author: archiebunk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 2nd stay at the RLR. If you're looking for a glitzy American hotel with lots of stainless steel and neon (and high prices), this is not for you. And if you expect to stay on the on-site motel-style Hale House for $100/night and get resort-style accommodations, this is not for you. This is an older (well-maintained) Hawaiian-style resort. The staff is friendly; some of the restaurant service is slow, but some is quite good. We had a RLR package, which included an ocean-view room, an all-you-can-eat buffet breakfast (quite good actually), and a compact car for about $240/night. The location of this resort is great. It is on the north side of Kaanapali Beach, uncrowded, even in February. You can watch whales swimming in the channel between Maui and Molokai from your deck, while you're having breakfast, or from the beach. You're close to many restaurants and shops in Lahaina and the south part of Kaanapali Beach. We will return (for our 3rd visit to Maui) and we will stay at this resort again. I'll be happy to answer any questions you wish to email me

Reviews.Title: “It's like home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Been going to the Royal Lahaina for get aways for over 20 years now. There is no other place that we stay- it is like going home. Lots of aloha, great beach, clean rooms and friendly staff. Can't beat the price. Here is a tip- fly into the West Maui airport- only 10 min. from the hotel and you don't have to deal with the Kahului airport and the long drive up to West Maui.

Reviews.Title: “A Royal Enjoyment to Stay at The Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina Resort was fabulous. My husband and I were pleased with everything except the Luau, don't waist your time or money. I am very picky about clean places and this places was pleasing. I never felt uncomfortable about my room. It was spotless everyday. We stayed in a partial ocean view room and boy did we get a view. We got the mountains on oneside, ocean on the other and a golf course straight ahead. Talk about beautiful. We also included breakfast in our room. The buffet was very nice and got us full for our days activities. This resort is set on a beautiful stretch of beach. I have never been so happy with a hotel. I would refer it to anyone! We will definately return to The Royal Lahaina for our Maui needs. I highly recommend staying at the Royal Lahaina Resort.

Reviews.Title: “It had problems, but overall I would recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: Keven919
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip to the Royal Lahaina Resort for my fiance and me for Valentines Day as a surprise. I had never been to Maui before, so I used this website to judge the resort. After reading some of the reviews, I must admit, I was scared that I made the wrong chose. Happily, everything on the trip was great. I can see what some of the reviewers were saying with the resort being old; my ceiling fan was noisy, the toilet seat was loose, and the water pressure was week. I don't think anyone will tell you that this is a 5 star resort.Those were easy things to look pass, especially since the price was so reasonable. I also found everyone to be very friendly and the beach was outstanding. I suggest that you take a stroll to Black Rock (south end of the beach) for great snorkeling. The location of the resort was good also; you must try a restaurant a few blocks away (31 & Front St) called Canoe. Overall I would recommend this resort for anyone that is just looking for a nice place to stay in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding at the Royal Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding at the Royal Lahaina in July 2001. Overall, it was a wonderful experience. We stayed in one of the cottages and had our wedding in the Gazebo and we were very happy with these choices. We especially liked that the Royal Lahaina engraves a stone with your names and the date of your wedding, which is placed in the pathway to the wedding gazebo. We loved the location, being on the quiet end of Ka'anapali Beach was great. The grounds were well tended and picturesque, and we enjoyed our meals at the resort's restaurants- although with all the excitement on the wedding day, I could hardly taste my food anyway. (For fine cuisine we read the guidebooks and chose other places.) We only a few problems, which were related to services: On the morning of the wedding I had scheduled a manicure at the resort salon. I went to the appointment, which was for 10:00 am I believe, but the person who was supposed to do it was not there, and I was told "I guess she's on break, or something-". I waited for about 45 minutes, and she never showed up! At that point, I was scheduled for a massage down by the ocean- another mistake- I should have scheduled it for after the wedding, since pushing my face into the massage table pillow during the massage left me with puffy eyes- and they were still a little puffy many hours later when it was time for the ceremony. The other problem was the wedding cooridator, appointed by the Royal Lahaina, who caused us a couple of days of panic when we told her that we had hired our own photographer and videographer (we hadn't been impressed with the options she'd given us, because no sample work was available for us to see) she said we were only allowed to use people she had recommended- and we had already put down deposits with these people, which she did eventually approved for her list. Anyway, our wedding was beautiful and we would definately recommend Maui for a wonderful wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Decent--agree with others”
Reviews.Author: PasadenaCAMom
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate on Pricline. We were 'upgraded' to a cottage...not sure if it's an upgrade or not. Room was spacious and grounds were nice. Shower took forever to get hot water and it was really tough to regulate the water temperature. We were on the bottom floor and it sounded like the people above us were training for the Olympics. Resort fee was $12/night not including the bottled water! Beach was very nice. Overall location was very nice. LOVED MAUI!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad- but that mild anxiety you're feeling...well...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ...it may be warranted. My girlfriend and I spent a week at the royal lahaina in early january. You know all those other reviews which left you with the impression that the place is "decent" or "adequate"- well, those are right on the money. The hotel is located on an absolutely beautiful beach with a living reef stretching up onto the shore about 250 yards from the hotel. This guarantees fun, accessible snorkeling for everyone. In addition, we stayed in the tower and found our room clean and well-tended. I highly recommend a whale watching excursion if you're there during the season. On the other hand, the on-site restaurant is not very good. The urge to just stay in the hotel and relax completely can be pretty strong...kind of defeating your motivation to seek out better restaurants. We wasted far too much money on only tolerable food- you're better off taking the shuttle to town. The grounds are dated and the pool area is somewhat small. The hotel on the whole feels pretty neglected. Bottom line: if you're feeling nervous about choosing the royal lahaina for a dream vacation or romantic adventure, I'd say listen to your gut and pick a nicer hotel. If you feel like spending the money, I spent a week at the westin a few years ago and highly recommend it. If your primary goal is just to get to the beach and to hell with the fancy service- the royal lahaina ain't bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: lakesbrkr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RL from the 2nd to the 9th and had a great time. Don't listen to the bad reviews about this property. It is by far the least expensive of the hotels on any beach in the area. The grounds are great, the parking isn't as bad as people say. We got in at all times of the day/night and always found a place to park. Big deal if you have to walk an extra 200 feet. If you have trouble walking, park in handicapt parking. Excellent beach, friendly service throughout, although the bartenders could have more of a personality. We were signed up for the royal hale, the least expensive room we could find (gv/$125 a night) and were automatically upgraded to a garden view cottage which we didn't even ask for. It was great. To sum it up, I believe that compared to the other resorts on maui, here you get MORE than you pay for. If I go back to Maui, I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon and first trip to Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Maui on January 20th and were due for a 5 night stay at the Royal Lahaina resort. I had read some bad reviews but in my opinion I think they were disgruntled people for other reasons and were too cheap to pay more money and wanted something they couldn't have. In simple words the Resort was "perfect". We got there at night and couldn't really see much but we were upgraded most likely because of the honeymoon status. When morning came we stepped out onto the lanai and watched whales jumping in the water toward Molokai. This started a perfect stay!! The people there are more than friendly, from the poolside drink runners to the front desk personnel that helped us get a hospitality room before getting on the plane the last day there. Parking was ok if the Luau wasn't full. The beach is completely the best. The atmosphere is very quiet and peaceful, no screaming children or obnoxious drunks at the bar. Our maid service was perfect, clean towels, folded sheets, and most of all she appreciated our cleanliness with a very sweet comment in the hall. My point is, the resort did everything we needed it to do, which was providing us a place to rest our worn out feet. Maui is full of wonderful adventures, get out of the hotel and see it. You aren't there to stay in the resort all day, you can do that at the neighborhood Motel 6. I personally wrote the hotel manager thanking him for a wonderful stay at his wonderful resort. Will we go back? I would have to say, definitely YES!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely loved the royal lahaina”
Reviews.Author: kaatok
Reviews.Content: my family and I had a very splendid time at this resort. We stayed in the cottages which were very clean.Our maid,thestaff at the desk,the service was excellant.I would reccomend staying at this property.Very beautiful grounds. Right on the beach. Hawaii feel is definitely here. Our maid was our favorite, very sweet person. Last time I was in Maui my wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency. Hyatt is flashy and beautiful. Royal Lahaina is charming and a great place to stay. I will return to this property again. We loved the setting in the morning outside our patio.Breakfast in the morning it is very quiet,very intimate,birds,papaya fruit,mangoes.My family and I would reccomend this property to our friends

Reviews.Title: “A Trip Advisor User, Ontario, CA.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay at the Royal Lahaina Resort except for one annoying situation. It was the parking, or the lack of it, situation. We had over-looked the fact that we had to pay for parking over and above the hotel price. At the time it seemed very chinsey. The annoying part was that we couldn't go anywhere after 5:00 p.m. for fear of not finding a decent place to park. Most evenings there was a luau going on outside our room and it attracted many cars to the limited parking spaces available. What a waste of valuable vacation time being secluded in one place. Space and time is limited to go into detail the argument we had with management on this. On the last day the manager said we were upgraded to the oceon front because of the parking, or the lack of it, that we were experiencing. That's baloney. We didn't complain until after we were already in our oceon front room and had returned from LaHaina the first eveining to discover no parking available near our place. When we returned our rented car eight days later, it was the first time we had put any gas in the tank. The lack of decent evening parking resulted in a waiste of money on a rented car. No remorse or understanding was shown to us at any time by the resort.I must be fair to say that we lucked out to get an oceon front suite. I haven't yet checked with our travel advisor to see if we in fact paid for such a location.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth P
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin! My husband and I have just returned from Maui and we had 2 nights booked at the Royal Lahaina, and we only ended up staying one We were in the Royal Hale building, which should be torn down. It was a ground floor room with the entrance from the outside. The curtains had mildew on them, as did the chairs. The closet door was off the runners, and the sink stopper was broken. The room was dingy and just plain depressing! After speaking to the manager on call we were moved to a room on the third floor, which was the top floor. It was in better condition,but we could hear the people in the next room, and one of the lights didn't even have a light bulb in it. The worst was yet to come. When my husband got into bed he was horrified to find a big wet patch at the end of the bed. We are not sure what it was,luckily there was another bed in the room. It was then we decided to go elsewhere. When we checked out they told my husband we would have our money refunded.As we had prepaid for the 2 nights before we arrived, it will be interesting to see if this happens. I can not recommend this place to anyone. I have stayed in better backpackers.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Royal Lahina on our honeymoon and a few times before that too. We love the atmosphere day and night. During the day it is open and breezy, quiet pool side area, and easy access to beautiful, clean sandy beaches to snorkel, read a book, or lounge. Every evening there is a luau, dinners, and these two hawaiian guys play soft music, it is so romantic, you can dance, stroll the grounds, or just sit and listen. Not once have I heard kids playing, not once did I see a kid! Love 'em, but not on vacation. The customer service is excellent, they really work to please. We will definately be returning again this year!

Reviews.Title: “The location is about all it offers!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at the end of Dec 03. Positives: The location of this hotel is fabulous! The beach in this area is just beautiful with no riptide, so great for kids and adults alike. The view is awesome. Within walking distance to several other resorts with better restaurants and beachside lounges. The fruit from room service was better than we had in most restaurants we went to. Negatives: The services available. The Concierge works from 7:00 am - 4:00 pm. Went to look for dining assistance at 4:30, sorry too late. Wanted room service after the long bike ride down Haleakala, sorry, room service is only available from 7:00-10:00 am or 6:00-9:00 pm. The in-room coffee is horrible, for $3.00 it needs improvement. The shower is small and water temp unpredictable. The bed is hard and uncomfortable. The interactions with the staff was very courteous with few exceptions, the lounge attendents were difficult to track down to get service. We had to get up and go to the bar to get drinks most of the time because our waitress had taken a break or something. Bottom Line: If you are looking for a place to only catch a few winks before your next activity, it's a good deal for the price and I would recommend. If you are looking to be pampered and need service go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for here...I WOULD NEVER GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Maui, and we stayed at the RLR. Let's start by saying with the exception of the the bellmen, the staff is rude, slow and not good at all. Gardenview rooms don't mean you see a garden...it is what they call their lower level rooms. The Room we stayed in was dirty, very outdated and bathroom door kept falling off the tracks. There was no data port on phone for Internet access. They also charge an extra $12 a day for parking, phone and safe access. You also have to demand a copy of every reciept you charge to the room. they will not give you them without request. Hard to check your bill when leaving. The pools are very small and they don't offer waiters or waitresses by the pool. I would say that they are very understaffed. Lastly, I have stayed at 3 separate Hotels on Maui, and the worst one of those three would be 3 stars. I would rate this resort a 1/2 star..just because it's cheap in cost.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Value....but needs TLC on the grounds.........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay---I spent WEEKS reading good reviews, bad reviews, okay reviews, and here is my opinion. We booked late for a Christmas week stay, so to get ANY hotel, we were lucky. We truly expected the worse. Actually, it wasn't bad....I'm a CLEAN freak, and wanted CLEAN. We rented 2 rooms for kids & us, and the rooms, beds, sheets were very clean. The bathrooms were clean, but in our room the overhead ceiling part in the shower had a metal cover with peeling paint. Definitely did not add to ambience. Yes, it was cheaper than other places, but a can of rusoleum and a pint of paint, we felt they could have afforded. The public areas and bathrooms all had fresh flowers and poinsettias that were allowed to wilt, and be unattractive late in the day. Yes, it's not a big deal, but again, a touch of TLC and the resort would be magnificent. The Beach Guys that worked at that desk were phenomenally helpful about surf, snorkeling, scuba, anything you wanted to know about water activities, they were MOST helpful and MOST on the mark. The restaurant was mediocre, but we didn't care about it. The beach, I think is the best around. It's not crowded---especially Christmas week---and it's close to the activities, but you could stay away if you wanted a more restful environment. We stayed in ocean view rooms on the front of the tower and our biggest complaint was the bus drivers loading buses at 2 am and BANGING luggage into their buses. Also, delivery people screaming at each other. We liked having the door open to hear the ocean, and ultimately opted for a/c and a closed door. All in all we thought the staff to be courteous and helpful, and truthfully, if they would put a little more TLC in maintenance, it would be a GREAT place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitely older, but it still provided everything that we needed. The staff was not always as friendly as one would like when you are spending $200 a night, though. There is a Luau on the property, which was wonderful. I would recommend this hotel for a person that is not looking to spend their entire day at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rates, old furnishings, clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Royal Lahaina, Maui. It was an o.k. experience. We only paid $105 per night and were upgraded to ocean-view for free. (Ocean view is any floor above the 6th). We could hear our neighbors partying all night and their cigarette smoke lingered in through the connector-door. (we had a non-smoking room, they obviously did not). I would recommend getting one of the rooms that do not have a connecting room-door otherwise you will hear your neighbors and smell their smoke. They tell you that they do not have any rooms like that but all of the rooms that end in 36 are not connectors. Very expensive food and drinks, like everywhere in Maui. Luau was the best deal there. Women at the front desk were rude, men were nice, go figure...Order one of the specialty drinks in the pineapple, they are $10 but a good value. Nice waitrons. Terrible weather, down poured everyday. All in all, ok property, wouldn't go back. Couldn't swim in ocean b/c waves too strong. ok pools. NOTE: Hot-tub and 3rd pool are across the street at the tennis-club, no one tells you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort & AWAY from Hotel Row Just Around Black Rock Point!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow! After reading quite a few negative responses I was extremely pleased with our experience. We stayed here from November 27th-December 2nd 2003. This resort really has an Old Hawaii feel. The rooms were clean. We first stayed in a Tower Room with a Partial Oceanview which was a bit noisy in the morning as we were directly over the hotel dropoff point so, as we had our kids along, we opted for an Oceanfront Cottage (at a minimal upgrade fee!) and it was terrific! Up every morning and in the ocean just steps away. Note about the bugs...we left a pizza out in the room and indeed there was bugs on it in the am...but you are in the tropics. The buffet breakfast was wonderful with an excellent selection w/ everything from fresh papaya & pineapple, to miso and rice, to hash :-) and egss, to good old fashioned oatmeal. You can't go wrong especially if you take one of their all inclusive deals. The pools were small but with the ocean at bathtub temperature in front of you...who cares! Plenty of places to lounge. The snorkeling at Black Rock was incredible for beginners and again a big plus is that this hotel is AWAY from the string of resorts right around the point which crowds the beach on that side considerably. We were going to stay at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel first and were most glad we did not as it was MUCH bigger than Royal Lahaina and there were no rooms there that were as close to the ocean as we were. These are the two oldest properties on Kaanapali Beach and, although this was evident, the Royal Lahaina was very well kept and the staff friendly. Staying at the Royal Lahaina was truly like staying at a secluded beach resort and it was awesome. If you like crowds....go around the corner. If not, stay at the Royal Lahaina, you won't be disappointed! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Not great but not horrible.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good points about the hotel: Relatively small, great beach access, good bar. Bad points: The rooms are far from plush and can be very loud. Make sure you do not stay in any rooms near the elevator. The elevators make a loud screeching noise which can be heard in the room. Once I got moved to another room, I had a bad experience. The alarm in the room next to mine had been left on, and it went off at 4:45 AM. It took three calls to the front desk to get it turned off. Very unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but choose your room carefully.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only reason that I am rating this hotel "Above Average" is because we were upgraded to a bungalow room on our second night. My wife and I have been to Maui five times and we have stayed at the Ritz, Sheraton and Marriott hotels. The Royal Lahaina is definitely not on the same level as any of these hotels however it does have some redeeming values. First of all it costs much less to stay at the Royal Lahaina than the other three hotels. Over all you can stay a week at the Royal Lahaina for half the cost of the other hotels. The room charges are much less and the food was pretty good and priced less than you would pay at the more expensive hotels. Secondly if you like a low key out of the way atmosphere with allot of room to stretch out then you have come to the right place. The hotel seems to be one of the older hotels in the area and does not offer the large pools and overly impressive landscaping that the newer hotels offer and is in need of some remodeling. However you are not crowed and packed in like you are at the fancier hotels. The Royal Lahaina grounds are lush and spacious and the beach is very nice. Most of the staff is courteous and helpful with the exception of a few of the male waiters in the restaurant and bar and one or two of the front desk staff. I can't say much for the main tower rooms but our bungalow was great. It was spacious and clean and had a nice covered patio that faced towards the ocean. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Royal Lahaina. We recommend the hotel on the basis of its lower cost and its low-key atmosphere. If you want to save money and do not require all of the flash and hype of the fancier hotels on the island then The Royal Lahaina is the place to stay. However, take care when booking your stay and choose your rooms carefully. Some lodging areas of the hotel are much less desirable than others. We would definitely return to this hotel but only if we could stay in one of the Bungalow rooms. RR

Reviews.Title: “STAY IN THE NEWEST TOWER”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort in mid-November 2003 and thought it was a pleasant place to stay. It's not a 5-star resort, but then again, it was good deal for the money ($105/night for us, double occupancy). Considering that we had an oceanview from our room terrace, we got a good deal. Had no problems with the hotel staff or the room itself. either. Just be sure to stay at the newest building on the resort grounds, which is where we stayed. The newer building doesn't have the "problems" of the older one. The newer building is the tall one. I hear the "older" building is the one that is not as nice and seems to be generating the most complaints from reviewers. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel in Paradise - You have to stay here!! its wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina Resort is the most beautiful hotel I have ever seen.There are the most stunning murals on the walls in the reception area. The dining room looks out onto the gardens on one side & the swimming pool on another. There are trees & flowers of all descriptions in the grounds which are excellently maintained. Even the laundry room, which is in a building on its own has scented trees & bushes around it. The pools are exceptionally clean & the beach is about 30 seconds walk from the Royal Ocean Terrace bar.Even in the toilets there are fresh flowers every day.Without exception, the staff are all really friendly & helpful, especially Elena & Aunty Lei on the Hawaii Activities desk. All the rooms are spotlessly clean & the cleaning ladies are very friendly.There is a breakfast buffet every morning, but you can also order seperately if you don't want the buffet.There is always a very wide selection for the evening buffets, but again, you can order seperately from the menu if you wish.The food is unbelievably good. The shops at the hotel are very reasonably priced.There is a free shuttle to take you to the local shopping centre and back every hour.There are local people selling souvenirs they have made in the foyer every moring, but there is no pressure to buy anything.We got married in Hawaii, and the management sent a bottle of champagne to our room, and also on the morning of the wedding, the staff sent up leis for myself & my daughter to wear.Very unexpected & very much appreciated. If I was to go back to Hawaii, I would choose the Royal Lahaina Resort every time.K Tiller

Reviews.Title: “Not Great...But Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 8 nights in May '03. Choosing to stay here depends on the vacation you want. We spent most of our time exploring Maui or at one of the various beaches, so the price and quality of this hotel worked well for us. The more lavish (and much more expensive) hotels to the south would have been wasted on us. We chose to save money on the hotel so we could spend it elsewhere. The room was fine and the view outstanding, but the bathtub was a joke and the bathroom doors needed replacing. The beach in front of the hotel is nicer than much of the area further south, which we took full advantage of. Did not eat at the Hotel other than breakfast, which tasted fine and was part of our package. The Mariott Luau was better. We would consider staying here again, but would probably look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “4th stay in 10 years and planning to return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 nights 5-14 November and had a great time. This was our 4th stay in 10 years and we cannot fault the Royal Lahaina on value for money and the best location possible. We saw whales from our breakfast table on the 15th and you can't do better than that. The beach is a perfect tropical setting with no facilities and it should be like that. The hotel facilities are better than the 3 star standard in Europe. However it is not the sort of hotel for residents who require spoon feeding for every activity. So what if there are ice machines on only 3 of 12 floors and that the parking lot spaces are narrow. All the criticisms about the breakfast buffet astound me. What do you want burrittos and waffles? There is more than enough to choose from and I paid more than the $12 price each day when in San Francisco. (There is a $4.99 alternative advertised in the lobby too.) The staff were polite, helpful and quick, but overworked at times. The two criticsms I have are that the lobby desk nearly always had a line and the main hotel block is in need of cosmetic maintenance - not just paint but making good all previous repairs which now show! A good stay and I would recommend the Royal Lahaina to everyone who needs a good comfortable base to explore the delights of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great HAWAIIAN style hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from maui 10/31-11/6. I stayed at the Royal Lahina hotel for my last two days in Maui. This hotel is an older hotel but has a lot of charm. The staff at this hotel is excellent. Especially the Luau make sure you go see this. Also non-stop drinks and they bring them to you!! My room was on the 12th floor I had a beautiful view of the ocean. This hotel is not a luxury spa type hotel but is very comfortable and laid back. I also stayed at a four star hotel hotel there in lahina and had better service at the Royal Lahina. So if you are looking for a good hotel with great customer service and an awesome beach I would really suggest this one.

Reviews.Title: “Would return to the Royal Lahina in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent 10 nights at the Royal Lahina Resort and I honestly can't say anything bad about it. Like so many of you I had misgivings after reading so many negative reviews but from the time we arrived until we left it was truly a wonderful experience. Our room was on the 9th floor of the hotel. It was clean, quiet and had great views of the ocean and golf course. The grounds were beautiful, great luau, and the customer service was excellent. We found that we didn't need to rent a car because of the shuttles back and forth to Whalers Village and Lahina town. So if you want to experience a true Hawaiian atmoshpere at reasonable rates please give the Royal Lahina a try.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Lahaina Resort”
Reviews.Author: dentr
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina Resorts continues to be our favorite place to stay on Maui. We have been coming to this property for over twenty years. It continues to offer value to it's customers. The property continues to deliver the best in an original quaint Hawaiian atomsphere! During our stay, it was good see that the property was being renovated. They were accomplishing this without disruption or annoyance to the guests. The staff continues to be the best on on island. They are freindly and responsive to your needs or requests. The room was adequate but showing some wear. However, the furnishing were confortable and adequate. We recommend this resort to all our freinds heading to Maui and will continue to return, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Lahaina Resort Review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lahaina Resort offers genuine Hawaiian atmosphere. The staff is friendly and attentive. The rooms are very clean. The food, as well as the drinks, taste great and are reasonably priced. The resort is situated on a nice stretch of beach, too. Some higher priced resorts either have no immediate beach access or they are too rocky to swim in. We have stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort several times. We will do so again!

Reviews.Title: “Romatic and quiet”
Reviews.Author: happy1953
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 25th anniversary at the Royal Lahaina and we were not dissapointed at all! No, it's not the hot spot, jet setter, gold foiled walls of the upper class joints...GOOD! Very few screaming kids, low prices and a beautiful deserted beach. Of course, we got the best beach front cottage, so that may be a factor over the cheaper rooms. We sat on our lanai under the gently swaying palm trees and watched the sun set between the islands of Molaki and Lanai every evening over a couple of the "lava flows" from the bar while sailboats cut back and forth across the sparkling trail of the setting sun. It was paradise! We found the staff very friendly and treated us like family and the included meals were very good. We are making it our regular romatic getaway for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Room in Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We also read the reveiws of this hotel before leaving. We must have been given the worst room in the hotel. There was mold around the A/C vent and in the bathtub. The paint was peeling in the bathroom. the sink was cracked, and the bedspread was stain. Too top it off, on several occassions we came back to the hotel to find our room was not cleaned well at all (bathroom was untoched). Maui was great, but there are other hotels to choose from (even budget hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not as bad as some say...”
Reviews.Author: Grant_CA
Reviews.Content: The RL was exactly as advertised a great value right on a great beach. Some of the rooms looked a little old but ours was great. The older low rise building is right by the Luau and I would not recommend that unless you are on a tight budget I would pay up a little and get a garden view cottage. The cottages are prefect, close to the ocean, quite and seem to have been redecorated recently. As for the staff and customer serice, the line at the front desk was slow but almost everyone is on some type of package tour and has coupons to be sorted out. Most people are asking for an upgrade or trying to scam a free breakfast or something so it takes a while and I can see why the staff gets bad reviews. I would get tired of dealing with cheap cheap tourists every day. The wait staff in the resturant was always very nce but we did run into a few staff members that were surrly often. all in all I would recomemnd it as a great 3 star hotel with a 5 star location, It is very familiy freindly too.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected after reading previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: drinkhummingbirds
Reviews.Content: I and my husband stayed here from September 27 until October 3. After reading reviews before going I was expecting something bad. The resort is old but that was not a problem. Everyone was very curtious and friendly. We had a room in the Hale building - don't know why people think this is out of the way. Can't they walk? It keeps it quieter except on the luau nights but whats the big deal? The bar and pool area was great - spent a lot of time chatting with the bar tenders and other guests. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone. Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “How bad could it be when you are in MAUI?!?!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You know, the hotel is old. It leaves a lot to be desired if you are used to a higher quality place. But truth be, you are in MAUI- who cares?!?! The beds were clean, the shower worked- and really that is all you need while in MAUI- who stays in their room anyways?? We stayed 7 nights in the Hilo tower, 3rd floor, (if you don't mind stairs- this is worth it) had an ocean view that was breath taking! It was more than worth the price if you aren't expecting too much.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, HOWEVER Needs Customer Service Classes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WE just returned from the Royal Lahaina Resort ( Sept 2003)and I feel you should take a second look at booking reservations at this hotel. Four of us reserved two rooms, garden view...when we got there after traveling 21 hours, we had to wait and talk to the manager to have rooms in the main hotel, instead of the older three story building behind the tall hotel you see on the website. The front desk "customer service" representative was rude and wanted to argue with us, dispite our calm conservation and display of the reservation confirmation. After our situation was discussed with the manager, we received a room that faced a very noisy hotel entrance, which included the garbage truck picking up the trash and cars coming and going, as well as the terrific view of the roof top...oh yea...a little ocean view between the buildings. We could hear running water through the walls when others in the next room took showers & also, heard conversations of anyone walking down the hall. Needless to say this influenced our entire stay. We paid $12.00 a day for parking, safe use & daily coffee, and the abilty to make local phone calls, We asked for an extended checked out time due to a late flight leaving the island and received- a very rude- no. The parking spots are extremely narrow & on the nights there is a Luau at the hotel- parking spots are hard to find. We did not receive very good service at the breakfast buffet, as the waitress was grumpy, didn't smile and acted as if we were a hindrance to her to show us to our table. HOWEVER, we did enjoy a late evening pizza from the restaurant, it was good. The person manning the outside pool shack that gives you your towels, was friendly & did offer tips for were the best spots to snorkel & dive were. The spa staff was excellent & quite customer service orientated. The building is an older building, quite quaint; really, if the personnel had better "person skills"- it would not have been a bad place to stay. Lahaina Resort needs Customer Service training. Beware, if this is important to you, have them give you exact descriptions & details when making a reservation- or what you think is clear turns out to be something eles you may be unhappy with.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for wedding ceremony & honeymoon !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On August 29, 2003 I married the love of my life in Maui at the Royal Lahaina Resort on Kaanapali Beach. Not only was it the perfect destination wedding for myself and my new husband, but for all 40 guests who traveled to celebrate our special day. My accomodations were excellent ! I had the most beautiful suite called The Alii Room and the service of all the hotel personal was amazing. My wedding coordinator Debbie Mauga and wedding photographer Battina Antle, were the 2 people responsible for my incredible and flawless wedding ceremony and reception. Every guest was impressed with the resort, food and service of the staff at The Royal Lahaina Resort. Robyn Freeman

Reviews.Title: “Would go back there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my honeymoon on Sep 19. We booked our stay at the Royal Lahaina after reading all the bad reviews. So of course I was very worried. We loved a lot about the resort. The beach was beautiful and the luau was great. It was very clean and there was no cockroaches like I had read about. You get what you pay for here. It is no Sheraton. I loved the tranquility of the hotel and the beach. I also loved how it was a couple of minutes from great restaurants and shops and about five minutes from Lahaina. The food was pretty good too. My only complaint is that most of the restaurant service were not too friendly. We dealt with a lot of grumpy people. That was very disappointing. I would go back again for the great location, the beautiful beach, and the peaceful,relaxing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “not that bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_fr_LA
Reviews.Content: This place is good enough for the price. You can easily walk through the golf course to get to the beach at the sheraton and snorkel black rock (but seeing Sheraton's pools will make you wish you could afford to stay there). The rooms were clean, lobby very nice. I was on the 7th floor and the luau below didn't bother me and I got a good view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal Lahaina Resort Both Visits”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I just stayed (for a second time) at the Royal Lahaina Resort for one week. It was, once again, a terrific experience. The Bell staff were helpful, efficient, and friendly. The restraunt personnel were always, without fail, pleasant, accommodating, and very efficient. The consignere was extremely helpful, sweet, and made us feel very welcome. The luau was great. Sam was a gracious and accommodating host. We intend to revisit as soon as we can. I highly recommend this resort for a very relaxing, rejuvinating stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it! GREAT hotel for great price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at the Royal Lahaina and am sad to see it getting such terrible reviews here. My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon; we spent 6 nights at the Hilton Hawaiian Village on Oahu and 2 nights at the Royal Lahaina on Maui. I can honestly say that I enjoyed the Royal Lahaina almost as much as the Hilton. I frequently travel to Hawaii, and I know just how expensive it is. Once I stayed one night in the Hyatt Regency on Maui, and it wound up costing close to $1000. However, at the Lahaina, my husband and I got an oceanfront cottage room with compact car rental, champagne, two tickets to the wonderful Royal Lahaina Luau, and a sunset sail all for only $650. You'd be hard-pressed to find a better deal on Maui, especially for what we considered to be a wonderful hotel. Our room was very comfortable, large, and clean. There was no mold or mildew and no cockroaches. The luau was wonderful--crowded, but well-organized, and one of the best I've ever been to in Hawaii. As for the service...well, I personally don't see how people can complain. We had wonderful service; all of the staff that we came in contact with was incredibly friendly and helpful. We were initially scheduled to stay for 3 nights but had to leave early; this was taken care of in about 3 minutes, and our bill was amended with no problems whatsoever. I can see how, during the busy tourist season, service might not be as good--probably because the staff is run ragged!--but that's the case for any hotel during Hawaii's busy season. Believe me. The towers did look run-down, and I imagine that those rooms are not as nice as the cottage room we had. But then, they're much less expensive. I'm sorry, but if you go to Hawaii and expect to get a great room for a very cheap price, you're in for an unpleasant surprise. It's just not going to happen. So don't complain and moan about it. If you want to vacation in Hawaii on the cheap, forego the hotel scene and camp at the many state parks. It's a fun alternative. All in all, I had a great time at the Royal Lahaina and would definitely recommend it to anyone traveling to the Lahaina/Kaanapali area. I'm sorry to see that it's been getting such terrible reviews. I feel that these bad reviews are undeserved. Great hotel, great price...Thanks, Royal Lahaina, for helping make my husband's and my honeymoon a wonderful experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Resort”
Reviews.Author: Randykhatami
Reviews.Content: Maui was awesome and more importantly the Royal Lahaina Resort was excellent. My friend and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina for nine days and had the time of our lives. The hotel offered all of the activities Maui has to offer and is very friendly and helpful. In addition, the locals in Maui seemed to be very responsive to main landers and helped us find the best surf spots on the island. The Resort also had some great beaches to explore. Another thing I liked about the resort was the transportation. It was very easy to catch a bus into town to do a little partying at night. All and all the Royal Lahaina is the place to stay in Maui. Thank you Alhoa, Randy

Reviews.Title: “Age with Character”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Royal Lahaina Resort - this hotel was recommended to us by a family that travels often to Maui. we booked a garden view cottage for six nights during August 2003 and to our surprise on arrival had been upgraded to an ocean front cottage. Compared to other vacations in the Bahamas (two visits) and Florida (ten plus visits), this hotel offered a lot of value. If you like having a covered porch to stay during the heat of the day and look at the ocean, I would highly suggest booking a cottage - did not see the rooms in the high rise so don't have any information. The landscaping is wonderful - pools, public areas and grounds were clean. Housekeeping for our cottage was above average. A small refrig is included in the room and is handy for snack items. I would mention that the Royal Lahaina is one of the older hotels on the island and the age (maintenance needs) is showing - so if you don't like character, lots of great landscaping and have to have the new cookiecutter hotel - you might want to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the Royal Hale building!”
Reviews.Author: poppy89
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Royal Lahaina. Our room was in the Royal Hale building, a 5-min walk from the main building. Don't stay there! The room wasn't that bad (fairly clean, nice bathroom) but it overlooked the luau. So, every night, from 6-10pm, we had to listen to really loud hawaiian music. It was okay for the first night, then got really, really annoying. There was nothing we could do as the staff told us the hotel was full. The breakfast buffet is pricey but not that good - go for the breakfast special, which is $4.99 and very filling. The main restaurants are also expensive. If I were you, walk past the Hale building, into the Aston Maui Kaanapali Villas next door. Eat at the Castaway Cafe there by the pool - great food and very reasonable prices. Also, the Royal Lahaina is in the middle of nowhere - you're miles from Lahaina. Taxis are $15 to the town - get the shuttle ($1) or you're in for a pricey holiday. On our last 2 nights, a couple of idiotic lads moved into the room next door. The walls are so thin, we could here every noise they made - and they made A LOT of noise! The staff were pretty surly and couldn't really give a s**t about our complaint. Oh well, if we ever go back to Maui, we'll know not to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont order the Pizza!”
Reviews.Author: cathy01013
Reviews.Content: This hotels beach was beautiful. You can really do some nice snorkeling here. There are two pool areas with a nice lawned area. We were able to bring our coolers down and lounge under palm trees on the lawn for our last day. NICE! There PINA COLADAS, outstanding... They do have drink specials at Happy Hour and a small band. The hotel itself however, Oh my God. It really was pretty but the service was BAD! Front desk upon entering, rude. They will try and charge you for parking and coffee. They will tell you, not ask you, to pay for this. Parking by the way is hard. It fills up because of the $72.00 per person Luau they put on. The porter didn't look happy with his tip either. When I was in Waikiki Beachside, they were ecstatic! Beachside was also a lot friendlier and pleasant. The rooms were pretty and airy. Nice sliding shutters and view. Carpet clean. The restaurant and staff need help. Breakfast buffet, not great. What ever one does, DON'T order their pizza. For $13.00 you get a personal size pizza with cheese and pepperoni. A frozen one is better. The beds were clean but I had softer mattresses! I think I would find another place just because of service alone. What ever you do, go to the Road to Hanna and buy Pineapple Wine! Have fun

Reviews.Title: “I Guess We Got Lucky”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Lahaina for 2 weeks, some 5 years ago. Knowing that Kaanapali Beach was fantasic, the RL seemed to offer a great location at a good price.When we arrived, I was told that the room deal we had booked was sold out; without fuss we we transferred to an ocean cottage. It was fab - wonderful view of the ocean with garden grounds to the rear. We really couldn't have asked for more, considering that we had paid something like $95 per night.We found all the staff very friendly and helpful and I don't remember the cottage or the hotel being dirty at all.But I would agree that it is not a 5* property. The hotel was in need of an overhaul when we visited, , but it was an acceptable standard. And you cannot beat the RL's location on Kaanapali Beach.The trip was great, but I'm not sure if we would have enjoyed our stay as much had we not had the ocean cottage

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: jacksnme
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Lahaina from August 9 through August 16. We were in the tower. The room wasn't that bad. True, the hotel is old, but so is the Embassy Suites. The room was clean and the maid service was great. The pools weren't that great, so if you're bringing your kids, you should stay somewhere else. But the beach is wonderful. It's more private and quieter than the stretch of Kaanapli Beach starting from the Sheraton going south. The food is terrible. You definitely have to eat out every day after breakfast. If you want a clean hotel, with great beach access for a good price, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as everyone said”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui after staying a week at the Royal Lahaina Resort on Kaanapali Beach. I had read many reviews of this hotel before we left and had tried to change my reservations prior to leaving, but was unable to. We went there with dread in our hearts about the "dump" we would be staying in. However, the Royal Lahaina wasn't that bad. Sure the Brad's and Jen's of the world could never have stayed in a place like this, but it was adequate for all us normal, middle-income people. Yes, it is in need of updating - the place is old and deteriorating, but our room was clean and roomy and the maid service was very good. We stayed in the Kia Towers because we had heard too many awful things about the Hale building. While we did not get a chance to check that building out, it did not look very inviting from the outside. Our problem with the Royal Lahaina was unfriendly service people. I think they must not like working under the management of this hotel because not many of them were very cordial. The housekeeping people were friendly and kind as was the parking attendants but everyone else gave us the impression they were tired of tourists. The woman in the Emporium absolutely ignored me even though I tried speaking with her several times. The other thing that bothered us was they charged $5 per hour for snorkel equipment but you can go anywhere on the island and get them for $1.50 per day! The equipment as well as parking should have been free to guests staying here. They also charge you $3.75 for a 4-cup pot of coffee in your room. Save your money and bring your own from home along with some filters. We paid the extra $13 per day fee for the parking, coffee and room safe but we felt all of this should have been included with the price of the room. The food in the Ocean Terrace Room was generally pretty good and the price was fair. There are so many places to eat on this island that you don't have to eat a single meal at the hotel if you don't want to. We had an excellent meal at the Italian restaurant adjacent to the hotel although it was very expensive. There are many, many hotels on this island that were newer and had nicer amenities but if you've never been there you don't find out until you're there. This hotel had 3 pools but they were just small square boxes in the ground - good only for cooling off from the heat. My kids were very disappointed after seeing all the really cool pools at the other hotels. The beach couldn't have been better though. I think they have one of the best beaches on the island and the grounds at the Royal Lahaina were beautiful as well. All in all, we had a good stay but I would not go back there nor would I recommend this resort to any of my friends. There are so many better hotels to choose from that offer clean, friendly service for the same price. The Royal Lahaina needs an entire building and staff facelift if they want to get any repeat visitors because they do not go out of their way to make you feel wanted! Most of the hawaiian staff made us feel that we were bothering them. The friendliest staff were asian or american. If you get a good deal on your room, go ahead and stay here but be ready to give up courtesy and friendliness from everyone but a few. Also, they have a Luau every night so if you face the Luau you have to hear it every night in your room and you have to deal with the lack of parking space until it's over. The owners of this resort should take a look at what reviewers are saying because if they don't make some changes soon, they will be filing for bankruptcy in the near future. There are too many other hotels in Maui that are willing to show vacationers the courtesy and friendliness that Hawaii is known for.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & myself arrived at The Royal Lahaina,on Monday,July 21, 2003,we were updated to a cabin for free. We stayed there until July 31, 2003. We were very satisfied,we had a great time. There are 2-swimming pools.There's a meal plan that you may purchase there. Is really up to you to make your stay any where you go on vacation as good as you want it to be. We had a ball.

Reviews.Title: “It was Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently went on a trip to Maui with my high school band. 250 people attended the trip and I would say about 45% of them hated it. I wouldn't recommend the Royal Hale building to anyone unless you loved to look at mold or loved to live with roaches. Upon the arrival of my room mates and myself we found spaghetti stuck to the chairs, mold on the air conditioning vents and mold in the shower. This was only the beginning of our problems. We couldn't stay in our room, it was disgusting. After 2 days we finally got our room changed from 1410 to 1616. That was up 2 floors and off the ground so you'd think it would be better... It wasn't. The only thing better was we were closer to our friends. Just to give you an idea of how bad our first room smelt, Listen to this, We had asked a few of our friends to come down to our room to order some pizza. They said yeah so they came down and told us that they couldn't eat in here because they began to feel nauseus. This place was gross. The only nice thing was Kaanapali beach and Whaler's Beach. DON'T EVER STAY IN THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “3-1/2 starts is a strech”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews prior to booking in hopes it was just an average hotel, when I arrived my hopes quickly dimenished. The rooms were in desprate need of an update, the carpet was actually torn, the wall paper was cracked, the walls had exposed screws and the furniture was very old. The bathroom was tiny the tub was 4 feet long and the balcony had cracks in it. The pool was a simple square but the beach was great. The location of the hotel is good and the shuttle was convient, but I could'nt overlook how rough the room was, we checked out and moved to the Renassance, it was worth the extra $40 and it saved my vaction.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: JessInNY
Reviews.Content: I found a deal on the internet for the Royal Lahaina and was very pleased with the hotel. It's not a terribly upscale hotel and doesn't pretend to be. If you're looking for 400-thread count sheets and 5-star restaurants, stay at the Four Seasons. If you want a clean, comfortable, affordable hotel that is close to everything, stay here. It's not beautiful, but the rooms are clean, the staff is courteous, and it's a stone's throw from the beach. We were upgraded to a cottage from our economy room and we had more than enough space. The bathroom was spacious and we had a patio outside of our room. If you're on a budget, this is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: treyboy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous trip to Maui and stayed at the Royal Lahaina because the price was right. You definitely get what you pay for. We were a little weary of the hotel because of what we had read on this site. But, it's not as bad as people have written here. Yes, the hotel is old. There are bugs, but you're in Hawaii. The beach that the hotel is located on is breathtaking. By far, the best beach in Lahaina! There is a shuttle ($1) that will take you to all of the major Maui resorts and shopping areas -- even to Wailea. There is also a free shuttle that will take you to all the major shopping areas in Kaanapali for free. Both, shuttles stop at the front of the hotel. The luau at the hotel is okay. Don't pay the $72 dollars that the hotel charges. Look in all of the activity books for a discount price. The hotel breakfast buffet just okay and there really isn't much to choose from. They don't tell you this, but you don't have to eat the breakfast buffet for $12 dollars. You can order from the menu for much less. This all being said....the hotel is fine for a week stay. No, it's not the Sheraton beauty, nor close to the happenings, but it's fine for the money you pay. The room is dated, the bathrooms are old, the pool is small, but the view that this hotel provides is unmatched in Maui. No it wouldn't spend my honeymoon there, but I would be willing to pay average prices for a 5 day vacation with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a two-week Maui vacation. We first stayed at the Royal Lahaina. We had an ocean front cottage. Great view of the pool house. While it was private & relaxing, we could not see the ocean. Another problem was the the pools weren't heated. Plus, the last day we were there, my husband went for an early-morning swim & found hundreds of dead mosquitoes in the water. Yeech. If you want bugs, this is the place. Ants everywhere. Thankfully, we didn't see any roaches until the last morning. Found a dead one being consumed by ants & a live roach in the nightstand drawer. Another drawback is that this resort is so far from everything. We didn't rent a car, so we had to taxi it everywhere. Add to that the exhorbitant prices in Lahaina & you have an expensive stay. We did walk along the beachwalk to the Sheraton. Big mistake. The Royal Lahaina looks even more shabby next to that place. Positives? The beach is just a few steps away. The restaurants are kind of sad. The poolside bar/restaurant was okay. The Italian restaurant up the road was good, but very spendy. We had the breakfast buffet once--that was enough. Nearly $15 for a sad excuse for a buffet. While the $285 a night was a fair price, we had to spend nearly that in cab rides for a decent dinner! Here's a hint!! Call Hilo Hattie's for a van pickup, buy a couple of shirts there (you know you will anyway). When you're done exploring Lahaina, go back to Hilo's, show your receipt, and they take you home!! We could have saved a ton of money on cab fares had we known this. In Lahaina, you have to find creative ways to save some money! If the Royal Lahaina would just invest some money in upgrading the facility, it could be a great resort. We won't be back, however.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have travelled fairly extensively staying in a wide range of hotels from the luxurious to the economical. I pick the type of hotel depending on my itinerary- going romantic-go for the deluxe accomodations,need a place to shower and sleep-go for the economy. My wife and I picked the royal lahaina for the location. We were there from 6/20-6/28 and were pleased with our choice. The hotel is on one of the prettiest beaches I've ever been on with 2 great places to snorkel. The pool was rather plain, but we didn't spend much time there. The ocean view room had a beautiful view of the beach-gorgeous in the morning and evening. The hotel has a walking path that connects to the long beach trail that goes all the way to the Hyatt(approx 1.5 mi long). Around the midpoint of this trail is Whaler's village which has some nice shops and restaurants. We loved walking on the path everyday-checking out the different hotels and people watching. We were planning a very active vacation-seeing all the sights in a week. The hotel is close to many attractions making travel convenient. Also the hotel had a car package with a convertible sebring costing about 35/day. The bar and the restaurant were simple but had a nice view of either the garden or the ocean,and the food was surprisingly above average and cheap(steak dinner for under 20 dollars). The service througout the hotel was pleasant and helpful. Overall, although we were hesitant to initially stay there because some of the negative comments we had heard, we had a wonderful time. Of course not everything was perfect. For one , the rooms look dated-with both the ceiling and tub having cracks. Although we didn't see any mildew, the shower had a fairly noticeable "mildewy" odor. The carpets appeared old and faded with several stains. In conclusion, wanting to be on the beach,close to the "action",and needing a hotel just for sleeping and showering, my wife and I were very pleased with our choice. But, the hotel is rather plain and dated and could use some refurbishing in many areas. So, we would not recommend this place for honeymooners or any others who may be seeking a luxurious oasis. Miles

Reviews.Title: “Not as Bad as Everyone Said”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of the resort two days before we left on our vacation I was in a panic about the resort. It turned out we loved it. Yes it was old, but it wasn't filthy dirty. My boyfirend who is a neat freak agreed that it was cleaned to his standards. The breakfasts were very good. And the view from our balcony was incredible. We had a garden view room, but we could still see the ocean, plus we had a view of the mountains and the golf course. (room 9029). There was not much to do on the resort but with so much to do on the Island who wants to stay around the Hotel. The beach in front of the hotel was much less crouded than the public beach in front of the Sheraton or the other hotels down the way. Overall we agreed that if we ever get back to Maui we would stay there and we would recomend it to anyone who is looking do things on the island and not blow all their money on a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bed bugs bite!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: How do you like your bugs? How about in the milk at the buffet? In your bed? Cockroaches running out of the shower? This place is creeping with bugs. We stayed in the bungalows...nice and spacious but bugs under the sofabed and in the showers. The beach is great for snorkeling, which is what saved us from checking out after checking in. The service is terrible, though. The website said free food for the kids---we had to fight with the manager at the hotel to get them to honor this. And even then they wouldn't give the kids free lunches (oh, well, it's true what they say about no such thing as a free lunch!) If you're going all the way to Maui, dind somewhere nicer to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Hotel / Great Beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about the hotel I was not expecting much. It is old, small, and run down. I did get what I expected from the beach. It is fantastic. Views of Molokai and Lanai make the beach unforgettable. Just a few minutes up the beach is a reef that is great for snorkleing. Food is OK in the hotel, but not a large selection. They are currently in the process of remodeling a few of the rooms so be prepared for noise. The beds are small and old so be prepared for some uncomfortable sleep- Alcohol will help this though. Parking is pretty bad, but you can find it easily if you are patient or do not mind walking a bit- just don't park under a tree- you may wind up with a bunch of roaches in your car! Overall, not bad for the price! I do not know about you but when I am in Maui I don't spend too much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my other half stayed here in Feb., 2003 and I was a little hesitant because of some of the reviews I had read, But when we got there my fears where gone. The grounds where beautiful and very well kept. The beach is great, nice and sandy the water is clear and warm and great for swimming. If you want to snorkel just take a 5 min walk and there is a great reef with lots of fish and I saw several turtles. The hotel is located in a great area to go to the Kaanapali strip, where there are plenty of places to eat and shop. The Luau was nice, but pay the extra for the VIP seats. But if you've seen one Luau you've seen them all. We only ate at the hotel once, at the grill by the pool, food was good. The room was nothing special, very dated but clean, the bathroom counter and closet space is plentiful, the room where the shower and toilet are is very small and needed some updating. We stayed in the Hale building and I would not recommend the garden view. I would most upgrade to an ocean view or at least away from the sides facing the Luau section. The walls are very thin and you can hear everything from the hallways and the next rooms. The bungalows looked very nice and great for families. We only dealt with the hotel staff twice, once checking in and the bell boy was great and the second time checking out, they where okay. I found this side of Maui, the side to stay on for the beaches, and the touristy places to eat and shop. I would most defiently come back and stay here again you just cant beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for (more or less)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Royal Lahaina Resort. The service was terrible & the (Hale) rooms are little better than freeway motel rooms. That having been said - you get the pretty much the cheapest hotel on Ka'arnapali beach - 2003 USA best beach (according to Dr. Beach).So if you want to stay here, get a timetable for the (free) shuttle to Whalers Village the ($1?) shuttle to Lahaina & don't plan on dinning at the resort much (I was first into the dining room one night & took 42 minutes for my meal (steak) - 35 minutes of that was sitting (alone) waiting.On the upside - this is a gorgeous beach - I loved it. It was about 100 feet from my room, and has decent snorkelling a couple of hundred yards up the beach, or (for the more competent snorkeller) cool snorkelling (including sea turtles) around Black Rock.If you are active & will be out of the hotel alot, this can be a good deal. If you want pampering - maybe you should think about paying extra & stay somewhere else - there's lots of choice in the area.P.S. Next time I go to Maui, I'll go back to the Royal Lahaina Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent trip....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Maui last week. The weather was perfect, the sunsets beautiful. We stayed at the Royal Lahaina Resort, a wonderful place, it seemed like a central place to stay in order to get around the island. The road to Hana was an experience that we won't forget, my husband said that he is now a skilled driver and believes he is ready for the race track. You must plan where you want to stop or really go slow in order not to miss any of the sites along the road, unfortunately we missed some of the sites because we didn't want to slow everyone else behind us and we didn't have a clue as to what we were going to see. Maybe next year we will return and take the road to Hana now that we know what we missed.

Reviews.Title: “Old Charm May 16 2003”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is what our expectations were of this classic hotel. Clean and comfortable with all the necessary amenities..Excellent location away from the sprawl of hotel row. Beautiful beach, nice pool facilities, tennis courts and hot tub....not to mention the golf course and the beach access to "Black Rock"one of the best scuba diving spots in Hawaii. Yes the extra fee for coffee in the room and parking fee were a little annoying but add that $10 to the daily rate and what's the big deal. The non-users get a break.. If I wanted "Ritz and Glitz" I can get it in down town San Francisco....I like "comfortable" when doing Hawaii .

HotelInfo.Name: Royal Lahaina Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 2780 Kekaa Drive, Kaanapali Beach, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761
